histogram.name: Accessibility.Android.AnimationsEnabled
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 because a need was discovered for a non-boolean value. Superseded by Accessibility.Android.AnimationsEnabled2.
histogram.summary: Tracks whether animations are enabled on Android (e.g. if the animator duration scale is non-zero.) The purpose is to inform the design of the prefers-reduced-motion media feature; see http://crbug.com/722548. This is logged once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosAutoclickDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: If the user has enabled Autoclick, this is the delay set by the user for autoclicks to occur, in milliseconds, at startup and when changed.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosChromeVoxAfterSwitchAccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed M85 when no longer needed, as there is no longer a restriction on having both features enabled.
histogram.summary: When ChromeVox is enabled, true if Switch Access was previously enabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.SpeechPitch
histogram.obsolete: Removed 7/2018 in Issue 866550 in favor of using global Text-to-Speech settings for speech pitch.
histogram.summary: The speech pitch setting when Select-to-Speak was activated. It is stored as a sparse histogram with values (100 * speech_pitch). For example, a speech pitch of 1.0 (default) will be seen as 100.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.SpeechRate
histogram.obsolete: Removed 7/2018 in Issue 866550 in favor of using global Text-to-Speech settings for speech rate.
histogram.summary: The speech rate setting when Select-to-Speak was activated. It is stored as a sparse histogram with values (100 * speech_rate). For example, a speech rate of 1.0 (default) will be seen as 100.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSelectToSpeak.WordHighlighting
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Whether Select-to-Speak had per-word highlighting enabled when activated.

histogram.name: Accessibility.CrosSwitchAccessAfterChromeVox
histogram.obsolete: Removed M85 when no longer needed, as there is no longer a restriction on having both features enabled.
histogram.summary: When Switch Access is enabled, true if ChromeVox was previously enabled.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.ContextMenuOption
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 because we don't need to keep tracking this.
histogram.summary: When a user selects the Chrome accessibility image labels option in the context menu, whether they are trying to enable or disable the feature, or enable it for a single use. Recorded when the user selects the option from the context menu. The feature may not have been enabled if they do not confirm on the modal dialog that appears after.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ImageLabels.FromSettings.ToggleSetting
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 because we don't need to keep tracking this.
histogram.summary: When a user selects the Chrome accessibility image labels option in chrome://settings, whether they are trying to enable or disable the feature. Recorded when the user activates the toggle from the settings page. The feature may not have been enabled if they do not confirm on the modal dialog that appears after.

histogram.name: Accessibility.InvertedColors
histogram.summary: Whether Windows system settings show that high-contrast mode is enabled and the user has selected a light-on-dark color scheme (logged once 45 secs after startup). This causes Chrome to prompt the user with a bubble to optionally install a High Contrast extension and theme.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaptions
histogram.summary: Whether the Live Caption feature is enabled. This is logged once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaptions.Session
histogram.summary: Logged when there's a change in the lifetime of a Live Caption audio stream: When a session started and captions began arriving from the service, when a session ended because the audio stream finished, or when the session ended because a user clicked the close button on the caption bubble.

histogram.name: Accessibility.LiveCaptions.ToggleEnabled
histogram.summary: Records when a user enables or disables the Live Caption feature from chrome://settings.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Mac.DifferentiateWithoutColor
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09: Data no longer needed or gathered.
histogram.summary: Whether the "differentiate without color" Mac system setting is enabled. This is logged once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Mac.FullKeyboardAccessEnabled
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09: Data no longer needed or gathered.
histogram.summary: Whether the "full keyboard access" Mac system setting is enabled. This is logged once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.Mac.IncreaseContrast
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09: Data no longer needed or gathered.
histogram.summary: Whether the "increase contrast" Mac system setting is enabled. This is logged once, 45 seconds after startup.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ScreenReader.Image.MinSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 as this is stable and doesn't need to be tracked closely.
histogram.summary: For every image on a page with screen reader accessibility mode enabled, this histogram will be used to understand minimum dimension of the image, i.e. either the width or height in px.

histogram.name: Accessibility.ScreenReader.Image.SizeRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 as this is stable and doesn't need to be tracked closely.
histogram.summary: For every image on a page with screen reader accessibility mode enabled, this histogram will be used to understand the size ratio of the image. This is the smaller dimension divided by the larger dimension.

histogram.name: Accessibility.State
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2016 in Issue 672205 with the addition of Accessibility.ModeFlag.
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome has enabled accessibility support because it detects supported assistive technology running, or due to being manually enabled via a command-line flag (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: Accessibility.WinSAToGo
histogram.obsolete: System Access To Go is a discontinued product.
histogram.summary: Whether the third-party System Access To Go screen reader is running (logged once 45 secs after startup).

histogram.name: AccountManager.LegacySetPrimaryAccountAndUpdateAccountInfo
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84 as part of https://crrev.com/c/2131912 The legacy code path and API being checked by this UMA stat no longer exist.
histogram.summary: Tracks the usage of the legacy Primary Account setting flow vs the new flow through Account Manager. This is recorded only once per session, at login time.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.UncleanShutdownCount
histogram.summary: Number of unclean shutdowns, as derived from the stability instrumentation. Logged each time stability file collection is performed.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Collect.UncleanSystemCount
histogram.summary: Number of unclean shutdowns that can potentially be attributed to system instability. This should be smaller or equal to UncleanShutdownCount. Logged each time stability file collection is performed.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.CollectCrash.OpenForDeleteSuccess
histogram.summary: Success of the attempt to open the debug file for deletion. Logged each time a debug file is opened for deletion during collection from the crash handler.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Record.InitStatus
histogram.summary: Status of internal activity tracking initialization. Logged once, during the activity tracking initialization.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.Record.SetupTime
histogram.summary: Time spent setting up the stability debugging instrumentation. Logged once, during setup of the stability debugging instrumentation.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.ThreadTrackers.Count
histogram.summary: The number of threads being tracked for activities such as waiting for a lock/event, a thread to join, or a task to run. Analysis of this data can reveal why a thread will not exit. This value is updated every time a new thread gets an activity tracked for the first time so will show one count for every permanent thread but multiple counts for a thread than exits and is replaced.

histogram.name: ActivityTracker.ThreadTrackers.MemLimitTrackerCount
histogram.summary: The limit on the number of thread trackers that could be allocated from the persistent memory segment. Trackers beyond this number were allocated from the heap and thus were not available for analysis. This value is updated on every "memory full" failure.

histogram.name: Ads.Features.AdResourceIsIsolated
histogram.summary: For a given ad request, logs information related to whether it is isolated from the top-level context. Logged per ad subresource request.

histogram.name: Ads.Features.ResourceIsSecure
histogram.summary: For a given request, logs information related to whether it is marked as an ad, and whether it is secure (e.g. https). Logged per subresource request.

histogram.name: Ads.Media.BytesReceived
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 in issue 1000058; no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Total number of bytes buffered over the lifetime of a WebMediaPlayer inside of an adframe. Suffixed by type of playback.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Cache
histogram.summary: For a given resource fetched from the disk cache, logs the encoded body length of the resource, even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete. Recorded when the resource request is complete, or when the page is destroyed/navigated for incomplete resources.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Mainframe.AdResource
histogram.summary: For a given ad resource in the main frame, logs the network bytes received for the resource, even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Mainframe.VanillaResource
histogram.summary: For a given non-ad resource in the main frame, logs the network bytes received for the resource, even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Mime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. Replaced with Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Cache.Mime and Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Network.Mime.
histogram.summary: Size of resources tagged as ads, identified by the response header mime type. This includes resources that did not complete loading. Recorded when the resource request is completed. For incomplete requests, recorded when the page is destroyed/navigated.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Subframe.AdResource
histogram.summary: For a given ad resource in a subframe, logs the network bytes received for the resource, even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete.

histogram.name: Ads.ResourceUsage.Size.Subframe.VanillaResource
histogram.summary: For a given non-ad resource in a subframe, logs the network bytes received for the resource, even if the resource request was canceled or incomplete.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.AreaRank
histogram.summary: The rank of the clicked anchor element in terms of area. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.ClickIntervals
histogram.summary: The interval between consecutive clicks of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when an anchor element is clicked except the first click in the current document.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.DurationLoadToFirstClick
histogram.summary: The duration between page load and the first click of an anchor element. If the first click happens before page load, then the sample is recorded in bucket 0. This histogram is recorded when an anchor element is clicked for the first time in the current document.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.HrefEngagementScore
histogram.summary: The target link (href) engagement score of an anchor element. The score is retrieved from the site engagement service. Currently all scores reported are set to 0. This will soon change. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.HrefEngagementScorePositive
histogram.summary: The site engagement score of the target link (href) of an anchor element. The score is retrieved from the site engagement service. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked, and the score is larger than 0.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.NavigationScore
histogram.summary: The calculated navigation score of the target link (href) of an anchor element. The score is retrieved from the site engagement service. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and the score has already been calculated when the document is loaded.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.NavigationScoreRank
histogram.summary: The rank of the navigation score of the target link (href) of an anchor element. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and the score has already been calculated when the document is loaded.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioContainsImage_ContainsImage
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the number of anchor elements that contains images and the total number of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and it contains images.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioContainsImage_NoImage
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the number of anchor elements that contains images and the total number of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and it does not contain images.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioInIframe_InIframe
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the number of anchor elements that is inside an iframe and the total number of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and it is inside an iframe.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioInIframe_NotInIframe
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the number of anchor elements that is inside an iframe and the total number of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and it is not inside an iframe.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioRootHeight
histogram.summary: The ratio between the height of the root document and the height of the viewport times 100. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioSameHost_DiffHost
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the number of anchor elements whose href have the same host as the document and the total number of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and href of the anchor element has a different host than the document.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioSameHost_SameHost
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the number of anchor elements whose href have the same host as the document and the total number of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and href of the anchor element has the same host as the document.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioUrlIncremented_NotIncremented
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the number of anchor elements whose href is incremented by one from the url of the document and the total number of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and its href is not incremented by one from the url of the document.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Clicked.RatioUrlIncremented_UrlIncremented
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the number of anchor elements whose href is incremented by one from the url of the document and the total number of anchor elements. This histogram is recorded when the anchor element is clicked and its href is incremented by one from the url of the document.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.ContainsImage
histogram.summary: True if the anchor element contains an image element, false if it is not.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.DocumentEngagementScore
histogram.summary: The site engagement score of the document URL. The score is retrieved from the site engagement service.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.HrefEngagementScore2
histogram.summary: The site engagement score of the target link (href) of an anchor element. The score is retrieved from the site engagement service.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.HrefEngagementScoreExternal
histogram.summary: The site engagement score of the target link (href) of an anchor element. The score is retrieved from the site engagement service. This histogram is recorded when href is an external link.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.IsAdFrameElement
histogram.summary: True if the anchor element was inside an iframe tagged as an ad iframe.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.IsInIFrame
histogram.summary: True if the anchor element is within an iframe, false if it is not.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.IsUrlIncrementedByOne
histogram.summary: True if the target URL of the anchor element and the URL of the root document only differ by one number, and the number in the target URL equals the number in the the URL of the root document plus one.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.RatioArea
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the clickable region area of an anchor element, and the viewport area.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.RatioDistanceCenterToVisibleTop
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the distance from the center of the clickable region of an anchor element to the top edge of the visible region, and the viewport height.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.RatioDistanceRootBottom
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the distance from the bottom of the clickable region of an anchor element to the bottom edge of the root frame, and the viewport height.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.RatioDistanceRootTop
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the distance from the top of the clickable region of an anchor element to the top edge of the root frame, and the viewport height.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.RatioDistanceTopToVisibleTop
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the distance from the top of the clickable region of an anchor element to the top edge of the visible region, and the viewport height.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.RatioVisibleArea
histogram.summary: The ratio times 100 between the visible clickable region area of an anchor element, and the viewport area.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Visible.HighestNavigationScore
histogram.summary: The highest navigation score of the anchor elements sent to the browser process on a page load. This histogram is recorded when the webpage is loaded. Normalized to a value between 0.0 and 100.0.

histogram.name: AnchorElementMetrics.Visible.NumberOfAnchorElements
histogram.summary: The number of anchor element metrics sent to the browser process on a page load. This histogram is recorded when the webpage is loaded.

histogram.name: Android.Activity.ChromeTabbedActivity.StopReason
histogram.summary: What caused ChromeTabbedActivity#onStop() to be called, which indicates that Chrome is sent to the background.

histogram.name: Android.Activity.ChromeTabbedActivity.SystemBackAction
histogram.summary: What happened when the user hit the system back button in ChromeTabbedActivity.

histogram.name: Android.ArmFpu
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-01: New releases of Chrome+Android+ARM rely on NEON support.
histogram.summary: Reports the FPU capabilities of the Android ARM device. This is recorded once per browser session during startup.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessLauncher.OnServiceConnectedTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2017. Made decision in issue 736066 with already acquired data. So this is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Measure time from bindService call to onServiceConnected. This is part of launching child services on Android that's under Android's control. Recorded in the first onServiceConnected of a connection.

histogram.name: Android.ChildProcessLauncher.OnServiceConnectedTimedOut
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2017. Made decision in issue 736066 with already acquired data. So this is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram that records whether bindServiced timed out. Timeout is recorded in a delayed task, and success is recorded in onServiceConnected callback.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.DurationOpen
histogram.summary: The duration the Chrome Home bottom sheet was open.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.OpenReason
histogram.summary: The reason the bottom sheet was opened.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.OpenSheetVelocity.Fail
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2018. Chrome Home is being deprecated.
histogram.summary: Records the reciprocal of the velocity of a swipe that did not result in the bottom sheet opening. This value is recorded in microseconds per dp traveled and is only recorded if the "chrome-home-swipe-logic" experiment is set to "velocity".

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.OpenSheetVelocity.Navigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2018. Chrome Home is being deprecated.
histogram.summary: Records the reciprocal of the velocity of a swipe that resulted in the bottom sheet opening and the user navigating to a URL or a different sheet content. This value is recorded in microseconds per dp traveled.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.OpenSheetVelocity.NoNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2018. Chrome Home is being deprecated.
histogram.summary: Records the reciprocal of the velocity of a swipe that resulted in the bottom sheet opening but the user taking no action (i.e. the next action is the sheet closing). This value is recorded in microseconds per dp traveled.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.OpenSheetVelocity.Success
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2018. Chrome Home is being deprecated.
histogram.summary: Records the reciprocal velocity of a swipe that resulted in the bottom sheet opening. This value is recorded in microseconds per dp traveled and is only recorded if the "chrome-home-swipe-logic" experiment is set to "velocity".

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.Promo.Result.Menu
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2018 with the removal of the first version of Chrome Home.
histogram.summary: The result of showing the Chrome Home promo when launched from the overflow menu. This action can only be performed if Chrome Home is enabled.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.Promo.Result.NTP
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2018 with the removal of the first version of Chrome Home.
histogram.summary: The result of showing the Chrome Home promo when launched from the NTP. This action can only be performed if Chrome Home is disabled.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.Promo.Result.Startup
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2018 with the removal of the first version of Chrome Home.
histogram.summary: The result of showing the Chrome Home promo when launched from startup. This action can only be performed if Chrome Home is disabled.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.Promo.ShowReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2018 with the removal of the first version of Chrome Home.
histogram.summary: The reason the Chrome Home promo was shown.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.Survey.DownloadResponseCode
histogram.summary: The response code of the completed survey download request.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.Survey.InfoBarClosingState
histogram.summary: If the infobar was visible when it was closed and if it was closed directly or not.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.Survey.ShowSurvey
histogram.summary: Whether or not the survey was successfully shown after its download.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.Survey.SurveyFilteringResults
histogram.summary: The result of the survey filtering process. Each enum represents a different filter that caught the user. This is recorded on cold starts when we check if a user qualifies for a survey.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.TimeBetweenCloseAndNextOpen
histogram.summary: The time between the last time the Chrome Home bottom sheet was closed and the next time it was opened.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.TimeToFirstOpen
histogram.summary: The time between app creation and the first open of the Chrome Home bottom sheet for this run of Chrome.

histogram.name: Android.ChromeHome.UserPreference.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the user preference for Chrome Home is set to enabled. This is recorded whenever the browser is restarted and the state of Chrome Home is first checked. This metric is only recorded if the user's preference is set.

histogram.name: Android.CustomFeedback.Category
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2018. CustomFeedback never shipped to 100% and is no longer planned for launch.
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user selects a category button when in the Custom Feedback UI.

histogram.name: Android.CustomFeedback.CategoryDetails
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2018. CustomFeedback never shipped to 100% and is no longer planned for launch.
histogram.summary: Recorded when a user selects an option related to their problem within the Custom Feedback UI.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.Chips.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records the number of chips being shown on download home. Recorded during initialization and also during any list change.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.List.Section.Menu.Images.Action
histogram.obsolete: Removed October 2019. The feature was dropped during implementation review.
histogram.summary: Recorded when a menu action is taken on the images section.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.NotificationLaunch
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2019. The relaunch rarely happens.
histogram.summary: Records instances when a notification is being launched for the first time or relaunched due to the need to dissociate the notification from the foreground (only on API less than 24).

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.NotificationsCount.ForegroundDisabled
histogram.summary: Records the number of notifications that are already existing (presumably displayed) when a new notification is being launched to help understand the frequency of multiple downloads with downloads as a foreground service disabled.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.NotificationsCount.ForegroundEnabled
histogram.summary: Records the number of notifications that are already existing (presumably displayed) when a new notification is being launched to help understand the frequency of multiple downloads with downloads as a foreground service enabled.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OtherExtensions.InitialCount
histogram.summary: The extension type for non-incognito download items that match the "other" filter type. Recorded when the download UI is initialized.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OtherExtensions.OpenFailed
histogram.summary: The extension type for downloads that match the "other" filter type. Recorded when a download fails to open.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OtherExtensions.OpenSucceeded
histogram.summary: The extension type for downloads that match the "other" filter type. Recorded when a download is opened.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.OtherExtensions.Share
histogram.summary: The extension type for downloads that match the "other" filter type. Recorded when downloads are shared through the download manager.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.ShowStorageInfo
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2016 with code removal of download home V1 to follow.
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user clicks the info button on download home to toggle the storage info. The state recorded is after the visibility is toggled.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.ViewRetentionTime.Audio
histogram.summary: The duration between when an audio file is downloaded and when the file is opened, only recorded when the user opens the file in download home UI.

histogram.name: Android.DownloadManager.ViewRetentionTime.Video
histogram.summary: The duration between when a video file is downloaded and when the file is opened, only recorded when the user opens the file in download home UI.

histogram.name: Android.FeatureModules.CachedInstallDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of successful installs for each dynamic feature module. Only contains install durations for modules first requested *before* Chrome started last and may therefore be installed from cache.

histogram.name: Android.FeatureModules.UncachedInstallDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of successful installs for each dynamic feature module. Only contains install durations of modules first requested *after* Chrome started last and are therefore unlikely to be installed from cache.

histogram.name: Android.HistoryPage.OpenSelected
histogram.summary: The number of selected items the user opened in new tabs from the native Android history page.

histogram.name: Android.HistoryPage.RemoveSelected
histogram.summary: The number of selected items the user removed from the native Android history page.

histogram.name: Android.InstantApps.ApiCallDuration2
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time spent in the getInstantAppIntent() API call.

histogram.name: Android.IntentHeaders
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M86. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Records the usage of the Browser.EXTRA_HEADERS field for Intents that Chrome receives, breaking down by type of header and by whether the launching app was first or third party.

histogram.name: Android.IntentNonSafelistedHeaderNames
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M86. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Records hashes of header names used in the Browser.EXTRA_HEADERS fields for Intents that Chrome receives that aren't on the CORS header safelist. This can be used to match against known types of headers to measure their frequencies.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstanceMigration.FailedToRenameMetadataFile
histogram.summary: Renaming the old tab metadata file failed during multi-instance migration. Only true is recorded.

histogram.name: Android.MultiInstanceMigration.NewMetadataFileExists
histogram.summary: The new tab metadata file already existed when multi-instance migration was attempted. Only true is recorded.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.IsTabletScreenWidthBelow600
histogram.summary: Records whether the screen width is below 600dp when the activity is in Android N multi-window mode. True if the screen width is less than 600dp and false if is greater than or equal to 600dp.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.ScreenHeight
histogram.summary: Records the screen height in dp when the activity is in Android N multi-window mode. Clamped at 200dp to 1200dp.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.ScreenWidth
histogram.summary: Records the screen width in dp when the activity is in Android N multi-window mode. Clamped at 200dp to 1200dp.

histogram.name: Android.MultiWindowMode.TabletScreenWidth
histogram.summary: Records the screen width in dp when the activity is in Android N multi-window mode and the width is below 600dp.

histogram.name: Android.NativeLibraryPreloader.Result.Browser
histogram.summary: The return value of NativeLibraryPreloader.loadLibrary() in browser process, is recorded once per browser process start.

histogram.name: Android.NativeLibraryPreloader.Result.Renderer
histogram.summary: The return value of NativeLibraryPreloader.loadLibrary() in renderer process, is recorded once per renderer process start.

histogram.name: Android.Permissions.ReadStorage
histogram.obsolete: Removed from the code in July 2019. See https://crbug.com/975701.
histogram.summary: At startup, records whether the Chrome application has been granted the read storage permission on Android.

histogram.name: Android.RecentTabsManager.OtherDevices
histogram.summary: Records the number of other devices listed in recent tabs page when recent tabs page is loaded.

histogram.name: Android.RecentTabsManager.RecentlyClosedTabs
histogram.summary: Records the number of recently-closed tabs shown in recent tabs page when recent tabs page is loaded.

histogram.name: Android.RecentTabsManager.TotalTabs
histogram.summary: Records the total number of tabs listed in recent tabs page (sum of all tab from other devices plus recently-closed tabs) when recent tabs page is loaded.

histogram.name: Android.SeccompStatus.Prctl
histogram.obsolete: Removed from the code in July 2019. See https://crbug.com/975749.
histogram.summary: Reports the level of kernel support for the seccomp-bpf sandbox using prctl(PR_SET_SECCOMP).

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.CheckGooglePlayServicesTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2019. See https://crbug.com/577190 for context.
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from checking for whether play services is available.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.CheckGoogleSignedTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from checking for whether a package is Google signed.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.DocumentModeSharedPrefs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2016 in Issue 582539 with the removal of document mode.
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching the DocumentMode shared preferences file.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.DocumentTabStateLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2016 in Issue 582539 with the removal of document mode.
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from document mode loading its prioritized tab's state.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.DownloadsDir
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2019. See https://crbug.com/508615 for context.
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching and possibly creating the downloads directory.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.NotificationUIBuildTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from custom notification builder through date formatting.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.SnippetUIBuildTime
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from snippet UI through date formatting.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.WebappAuthenticatorMac
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from looking up a webapp's MAC on startup.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.WebappDir
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching for creating the webapp directory.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.WebappSaveState
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from reading and saving webapp state.

histogram.name: Android.StrictMode.WebappSharedPrefs
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time due to a StrictMode violation from fetching the Webapp shared preferences file.

histogram.name: Android.TabNavigationInterceptResult
histogram.summary: The distribution of results when running ExternalNavigationHandler, this shows how often we send intents to be handled by other applications.

histogram.name: Android.TabPersistentStore.MergeStateMetadataFileSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes read for the other tab state's metadata file when merging tab states in Android N+.

histogram.name: Android.TabPersistentStore.MergeStateTabCount
histogram.summary: The number of normal and incognito tabs merged (for Android N+ multi-instance). This will be logged for both cold-start and non-cold-start merging assuming that the native library is loaded.

histogram.name: Android.TabPersistentStore.MergeStateTimePerTab
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of time it takes to restore state for each merged tab (for Android N+ multi-instance). This will only be logged for non-cold-start merging, because restoring merged tabs is not distingushed from restoring regular tabs on cold start.

histogram.name: Android.WebView.DevUi.SessionDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed May 2020 because this only captures sessions up to 10 seconds long. Use Android.WebView.DevUi.SessionDuration2 instead, which captures sessions up to an hour.
histogram.summary: Records the time spent using a specific tool, from creation to destruction.

histogram.name: Android.WebView.ExtraHeaders
histogram.summary: Record when extra headers are added to requests by AwURLLoaderThrottle and whether they were kept or removed during redirects.

histogram.name: Android.WebView.Gfx.FunctorStencilEnabled
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M79. Obtained required data from M78.
histogram.summary: Record in a functor draw whether stencil test is enabled by Android HWUI. This is recorded every frame. Note some OS versions never use stencil so worth checking result split by OS version.

histogram.name: Android.WebView.LoadUrl.DataUriHasOctothorpe
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/10/11. This histogram was never well understood and the underlying feature has been shipped for some time anyway.
histogram.summary: Records if a data url passed to loadUrl had a '#' character. This is to be used in the effort to deprecate the incorrect treatment of '#' characters in data URIs; see http://crbug.com/823666#c30.

histogram.name: Android.WebView.Metrics.BackfillInstallDate
histogram.obsolete: Removed in April 2020. The backfill logic is deemed no longer necessary to keep around.
histogram.summary: Records whether WebView needed to backfill the install date pref with Android frameworks APIs. Recorded once during startup (metrics service initializtion).

histogram.name: Android.WebView.Mimetype.AppProvided
histogram.obsolete: Removed in April 2020. Network Service has launched, and we don't intend to follow up on this metric.
histogram.summary: Records information about the specified MIME types for app-provided content loaded in Android WebView. At the moment, this focuses on shouldInterceptRequest, ContentProvider-supplied content, and app assets/resources (where we expect the app to use proper file extensions to indicate MIME type), and is recorded as part of the process of loading each resource. This may apply to any type of resource (frame HTML, subresource, etc.).

histogram.name: Android.WebView.onReceivedSslError.ErrorCode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020. These are no longer being tracked.
histogram.summary: The WebViewClient SSL error code as received by onReceivedSslError.

histogram.name: Android.WebView.onSafeBrowsingHit.ThreatType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2020. These metrics are tracked generally for SafeBrowsing, and WebView no longer needs specializations.
histogram.summary: Records the WebViewClient safe browsing threat type as returned by onSafeBrowsingHit callback.

histogram.name: Android.WebView.SplitApkWorkaroundResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M73. Bundles have shipped.
histogram.summary: Result of applying a workaround to fix a crash on Android O if the WebView provider is a split APK (see crbug.com/889954 for more details).

histogram.name: Android.WebView.VariationsEnableState
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code July 2018. Variations in WebView has launched.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether variations is enabled. We want to know how enabling variations affects metrics, but we can't enable variations as a variations study, since variations can't enable/disable itself. Instead, WebView hard-codes a random variable for enabling variations, and reports the result in this histogram.

histogram.name: AndroidTabCloseUndo.Toast
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 06/2020. Mostly tracked with Snackbar.Shown.
histogram.summary: When a user closes a tab an undo toast will popup on certain devices giving the user the chance to undo closing that tab. This stat tracks how the user interacts with that UI and what actions they take. A cold start means that the undo bar wasn't showing when it was triggered to show again. A warm start means that it was. Warm starts can happen when the user closes multiple tabs close together. When the undo bar is dismissed, all closes that were queued up to be undone are committed. This can happen either by a timeout or by an action by the user to move to another part of the UI.

histogram.name: Animation.AnimationWorklet.GlobalScope.MutateDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for AnimationWorkletGlobalScope to produce a mutation update. This includes all V8 script execution cost.

histogram.name: appcache.CheckResponseResult
histogram.summary: AppCache check response result code.

histogram.name: appcache.CompletionQueueTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between a completion task being queued and run.

histogram.name: appcache.CompletionRunTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to run a completion task on the IO thread.

histogram.name: appcache.CorruptionDetected
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times corruption is detected in the sql database.

histogram.name: appcache.InitResult
histogram.summary: AppCache initialization result code.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.AppCache
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests to be retrieved from the appcache are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.Error
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests that result in a synthesized error are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.JobStartDelay.Network
histogram.summary: How long URLRequests to be retrieved over the network are delayed.

histogram.name: appcache.MainPageLoad
histogram.summary: Counts the number of appcached page loads for secure vs insecure origins.

histogram.name: appcache.MainResourceResponseRetrieval
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of retrieving a main resource from the appcache.

histogram.name: appcache.Manifest.FallbackPattern
histogram.summary: The proportion of manifests that use patterns in valid FALLBACK: entries. Only tracks manifests that were successfully parsed.

histogram.name: appcache.Manifest.NetworkPattern
histogram.summary: The proportion of manifests that use patterns in valid NETWORK: entries. Only tracks manifests that were successfully parsed.

histogram.name: appcache.Manifest.Pattern
histogram.summary: The proportion of manifests that use patterns in any valid entries. Only tracks manifests that were successfully parsed.

histogram.name: appcache.Manifest.ValidManifestURL
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: The proportion of ParseManifest calls that are triggered using a valid vs an invalid manifest URL.

histogram.name: appcache.MissingManifestDetectedAtCallsite
histogram.summary: Identifies where a missing manifest was detected occured.

histogram.name: appcache.MissingManifestEntry
histogram.summary: Logged on each occurrence of there being no record for the manifest file in the entries table.

histogram.name: appcache.SubResourceResponseRetrieval
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate of retrieving a sub resource from the appcache.

histogram.name: appcache.TaskQueueTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between a background task being queued and run.

histogram.name: appcache.TaskRunTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to run a background task.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJob.ExistingVaryDuring304
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of times while handling a 304 response a cached response has a Vary header while the incoming 304 response doesn't.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateJobResult
histogram.summary: AppCache update job result code.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateProgressAtPointOfFaliure
histogram.summary: Percent completion at point of failure of an update job.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateWasOffOriginAtPointOfFailure
histogram.summary: Whether the resource causing the failure was from a different origin.

histogram.name: appcache.UpdateWasStalledAtPointOfFailure
histogram.summary: Whether any progresss had been made in the 5 minutes preceeding failure.

histogram.name: Apps.AppLauncherPromo
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017 in issue 600915 with the removal of app list on platforms other than Chrome OS.
histogram.summary: Interactions with the App Launcher promo dialog.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.LaunchedItemPosition
histogram.obsolete: Removed October 2019, replaced by Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.LaunchedItemPositionV2, which uses different bucketing.
histogram.summary: The position index of an item launched from zero state search results.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.NumImpressionTypes
histogram.obsolete: Removed October 2019, replaced by Apps.AppList.ZeroStateResultsList.NumImpressionTypesV2, which uses different bucketing.
histogram.summary: The number of item types included in each zero state impression set.

histogram.name: Apps.AppList.ZeroStateSearchResutRemovalDecision
histogram.summary: The decision of the user whether to remove a zero state search result. This is gathered per click of a remove or cancel button of a search result removal confirmation dialog.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListAppLaunched
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2019 in favor Apps.AppListAppLaunchedV2.
histogram.summary: The number of apps launched from the launcher. This is logged each time an app is launched. The bucket denotes whether the app is suggested.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListAppLaunchedFullscreen
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2019 in favor Apps.AppListAppLaunchedV2.
histogram.summary: The number of apps launched from the fullscreen launcher. This is logged each time an app is launched. The bucket denotes whether the app is suggested.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListDoodleAction
histogram.obsolete: App list doesn't support doodles anymore.
histogram.summary: The number of user interactions with the app list doodle. This is logged once per action.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListDriveQuickAccessProvider.ResultPresence
histogram.obsolete: Removed January 2020, this was a debugging metric that was too expensive to keep in the code.
histogram.summary: Emitted when the launcher updates the displayed zero-state search results. Records whether a) a Drive QuickAccess result was displayed, b) a DQA result was present in the candidate results list but wasn't one of the top 5 so was not displayed, or c) no DQA results were in the results list.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListHowEnabled
histogram.summary: The trigger that caused the app list to be enabled. Recorded when the user first shows the app list. If not shown after one hour, will be recorded then. If Chrome was not running at the one-hour mark, will be recorded during the next Chrome startup.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListLaunchRecorderError
histogram.obsolete: Removed January 2020, the app list launch recorded has been removed.
histogram.summary: Reports error states of the app list launch recorder system.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultDistanceFromOrigin
histogram.summary: The minimum number of arrow keys a user would need to press to navigate to the opened search result. This is gathered per click of a search result.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListSearchResultOpenType
histogram.summary: The type of app list search result that was opened by the user. This is gathered per SearchResult opened. Only recorded for search results shown in the search result page of the launcher, except for M-62 where suggestion chips were recorded as search results (https://crbug.com/919550). M-62 should be filtered out when viewing this histogram to ignore the metrics caused by the above mentioned bug.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListTileLaunchIndexAndQueryLength
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2020. The related app ranking experiments have finished.
histogram.summary: The index of a clicked result in the search result app tiles and the length of the search query. The index is relative to the SearchTileItemListView, not the overall position in the suggestion window.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListTimeToDiscover
histogram.summary: Time between enabling the app list, and a user explicitly choosing to show it. If the app list is not shown after one hour, an entry in the last bucket is recorded. If the user installs a second packaged app within one hour, or if the app list was not enabled by installing a packaged app from the Web Store, no time value is recorded - only Apps.AppListHowEnabled.

histogram.name: Apps.AppListWarmupDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2016 in Issue 600915 with the removal of the app list on Windows.
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in warmup (in WarmupForProfile call). This will tell us how long warmup blocks the UI.

histogram.name: Apps.FileHandler.Registration.Mac.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2020. File handler registration is done through shortcuts creation, replaced by WebApp.Shortcuts.Creation.Result.
histogram.summary: Records the result of file handler registration for PWA on MacOS

histogram.name: Apps.LockScreen.NoteTakingApp.UnlockUIAction
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete - tracks actions in UI that did not launch.
histogram.summary: The action the user took on the lock screen UI shown when lock screen app window is in background, shown under the lock screen.

histogram.name: Apps.Window.Type
histogram.obsolete: There was only one valid value starting in M69 and code to record the values was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: The type of app window opened (through the chrome.app.window API).

histogram.name: Arc.CustomTabs.SessionLifetime.All
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019. Replaced by Arc.CustomTabs.SessionLifetime2.All to extend the max value.
histogram.summary: Lifetime of each session. Recorded when a session ends.

histogram.name: Arc.CustomTabs.SessionLifetime.Closed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019. Replaced by Arc.CustomTabs.SessionLifetime2.Closed to extend the max value.
histogram.summary: Lifetime of each session. Recorded when a session is closed.

histogram.name: Arc.CustomTabs.SessionLifetime.ForwardedToNormalTab
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019. Replaced by Arc.CustomTabs.SessionLifetime2.ForwardedToNormalTab to extend the max value.
histogram.summary: Lifetime of each session. Recorded when a session ends because the tab was forwarded to a normal tab.

histogram.name: Arc.IntentHandlerAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed April 2018 and replaced by ChromeOS.Apps.IntentPickerAction.
histogram.summary: ARC intent handler action taken by user.

histogram.name: Arc.IntentHandlerDestinationPlatform
histogram.summary: ARC intent handler destination platform. The destination may be specified due to the user explicit selection or a previously stored preference.

histogram.name: Arc.OOMKills.Score
histogram.summary: The oom_badness score of a OOM killed process as reported by kernel.

histogram.name: Arc.OOMKills.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: The elapsed time since last OOM kill event.

histogram.name: ArcRuntime.LowMemoryKiller.FreedSize
histogram.summary: The memory size freed by each low memory kill event.

histogram.name: ArcRuntime.LowMemoryKiller.TimeDelta
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to last low memory kill event.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.LockScreen
histogram.summary: The lock screen action has two accelerators: - Ctrl+Shift+L which is deprecated. - Search+L which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.Accelerators.Deprecated.NextIME
histogram.summary: The switch to the next IME action has two accelerators: - Shift+Alt which is deprecated. - Ctrl+Shift+Space which is new. This histogram shows the number of times each accelerator (deprecated and new) is used.

histogram.name: Ash.ActiveTouchPoints
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: Number of active touch-points when a new touch-point is added.

histogram.name: Ash.AppList.TimeBetweenTaskSwitches
histogram.summary: The amount of time between selecting an item from the Ash app list. Not recorded on the first time an item is selected from the app list after startup.

histogram.name: Ash.ContextualNudge
histogram.summary: Tracks usage of the contextual nudge for the user gesture education.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.DesksCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2020, and replaced by Ash.Desks.DesksCount2. This was broken as it did report desks count during the creation of the first-ever created desk after boot.
histogram.summary: Emitted when there's a change in the virtual desks count whether due to desk creation or removal. Specifies the number of available desks.

histogram.name: Ash.Desks.NewDesk
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2020, and replaced by Ash.Desks.NewDesk2. This was broken as it did report the creation of the first-ever created default desk after boot as being created by the new-desk button.
histogram.summary: Emitted when a virtual desk is created to specify the source of this action, i.e. whether from the new-desk button, keyboard shortcut.

histogram.name: Ash.DisplayColorManager.IccFileFound
histogram.summary: This boolean keeps track if a request for an ICC for a specific product id has been successful or not.

histogram.name: Ash.GestureCreated
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2014 in Issue 352654, and replaced by Event.GestureCreated.
histogram.summary: The gesture-events recognized and dispatched by the browser gesture recognizer.

histogram.name: Ash.GestureTarget
histogram.summary: The gesture-events recognized and dispatched for UI components owned by Ash. For browser gestures, see Event.Touch.GestureType.

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.NumPasswordAttempts.UntilFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed 27/05/2020, the histogram has been revised as we do not count pod switching anymore and the metric was not recorded on shutdown. New histogram: Ash.Login.Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.UntilFailure
histogram.summary: The number of incorrect password entered in ChromeOS login/lock screen until the user gives up (switch pods or user sign out the current session or shutdown the device).

histogram.name: Ash.Login.Lock.NumPasswordAttempts.UntilSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed 27/05/2020, the histogram has been revised as we did not count successful authentification on login screen and successful authentification on lock screen wasn't recorded due to a bug. New histogram: Ash.Login.Lock.NbPasswordAttempts.UntilSuccess
histogram.summary: The number of incorrect password entered in ChromeOS login/lock screen until a successful attempt.

histogram.name: Ash.ProcessCreationToFirstPresent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2019; no longer need to track this.
histogram.summary: The delta between when chrome main starts to when the Chrome OS system UI (ash) is visible to the user (specifically the first time pixels are lit up on the primary display showing the Chrome OS system UI).

histogram.name: Ash.StationaryTouchDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The duration of mostly stationary long-duration touches.

histogram.name: Ash.Tab.TimeBetweenSwitchToExistingTabUserActions
histogram.summary: The number of seconds between tab switches triggered by a user gesture (e.g. Ctrl+T, Ctrl+1, tapping or clicking the tab strip, etc).

histogram.name: Ash.TouchDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2013 in r239809, and replaced by Ash.TouchDuration2.
histogram.summary: The duration of a touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchDuration2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2014 in Issue 352654, and replaced by Event.TouchDuration.
histogram.summary: The duration of a touch-sequence.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMaxDistance
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2014 in Issue 352654, and replaced by Event.TouchMaxDistance.
histogram.summary: The maximum euclidean distance in dips which a touch point has travelled away from its starting point. Only measured for single finger gestures.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchMoveInterval
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The interval between touch-move events.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchPositionX
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The position of the touch-events along the X axis.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchPositionY
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The position of the touch-events along the Y axis.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchRadius
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The radius of a touch event.

histogram.name: Ash.TouchStartBurst
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The number of rapid touch-starts that happened within a short interval. Logged once for each such burst group.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.Apps
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2/2018. Currently there is only one type of Wallpaper App.
histogram.summary: The Wallpaper App that the user is using right now on Chrome OS. It's the app that is used when the user right clicks on desktop and selects "Set wallpaper" or when the user selects "Set wallpaper" from chrome://settings page. This is recorded at user login.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.Durations
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract colors from wallpapers. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes. It may contain multiple colors extracted.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.UserDelay
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract colors from 'expensive' wallpapers. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes and the color extraction is expected to be expensive, e.g. image size > 100 pixels. This includes time spent switching threads. It may contain multiple colors extracted.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtractionResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the success rate for wallpaper color extraction. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.DefaultIndex
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2012. Use of indices has been removed.
histogram.summary: The wallpaper index if one of the default wallpapers has been selected. Recorded at user login. Currently only for the old wallpaper picker UI.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.TimeSpentExtractingColors
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2017 in favor of Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.Durations and Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.UserDelay.
histogram.summary: The time taken to extract colors from wallpapers. Recorded each time the wallpaper image changes. NOTE, this measure also included the time spent jumping between threads, thus it was deprecated in favor of Ash.Wallpaper.ColorExtraction.Durations.

histogram.name: Ash.Wallpaper.TimeSpentResizing
histogram.summary: The time taken to resize wallpapers. Recorded once each time the wallpaper changes (e.g. initial wallpaper loading at boot, switching user avatar at login screen, switching between logged in users, user selects new wallpaper, etc).

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.CycleTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time the Alt key is held after pressing Alt+Tab to begin cycling through windows.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleController.SelectionDepth
histogram.summary: When a window is selected after pressing Alt+Tab, records that window's position in the global MRU ordering. 1 represents the most-recently used window, 2 represents the next most-recently used window, and so on. Recorded when Alt+Tab cycling stops, i.e., when Alt key is released.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowCycleView.AnimationSmoothness.HighLight
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 in Issue 989794 since we are now using focus rings instead of a highlight. The focus rings have no animations.
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of showing window animation when the highlight moves to the next window in the window cycle view when alt + tab is pressed. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.AnimationSmoothness.Close
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when closing a window in overview mode. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.AnimationSmoothness.Enter
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when entering overview mode. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.AnimationSmoothness.Exit
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations when exiting overview mode. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second.

histogram.name: Ash.WindowSelector.CycleTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 06/2014. No longer relevant since alt-tab switching was separated from WindowSelector.
histogram.summary: The amount of time the Alt key is held after pressing Alt+Tab to begin cycling through windows.

histogram.name: Assistant.ContainerView.Resize.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative animation smoothness of resizing assistant container window. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents when only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded when the container window resizing is finished.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.CardClick
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records a click on a proactive suggestions card by the user. This histogram is recorded for every click event while derivative metrics are recorded for splicing by category, index, and veId only when those respective attributes are known.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.CardClick.ByCategory
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records a content category for a proactive suggestions card that was clicked by the user.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.CardClick.ByIndex
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records the index for a proactive suggestions card within its list that was clicked by the user.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.CardClick.ByVeId
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records the VE ID for a proactive suggestions card that was clicked by the user.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.FirstShowAttempt
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 because a need was discovered for a non-boolean value. Superseded by Accessibility.Android.AnimationsEnabled2.
histogram.summary: Records an attempt to show a proactive suggestion to the user for the first time.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.FirstShowAttempt.ByCategory
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records a content category for an attempt to show a proactive suggestion to the user for the first time.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.FirstShowResult
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records a result of having shown a proactive suggestion to the user for the first time.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.FirstShowResult.ByCategory
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records a content category for having shown a proactive suggestion to the user for the first time.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.RequestResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 because a need was discovered for a non-boolean value. Superseded by Accessibility.Android.AnimationsEnabled2.
histogram.summary: Records a result for a proactive suggestions server request.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.RequestResult.Error
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records a content category for a proactive suggestions server request that resulted in error.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.RequestResult.SuccessWithContent
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records a content category for a proactive suggestions server request that resulted in a successful response containing content.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.RequestResult.SuccessWithoutContent
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records a content category for a proactive suggestions server request that resulted in a successful response that did not contain content.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.ReshowAttempt
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.
histogram.summary: Records an attempt to reshow a proactive suggestion to the user that has already been seen.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.ReshowAttempt.ByCategory
histogram.obsolete: Associated with an experimental feature which was removed in M85.

Note that this histogram is primarily used with Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.CardClick to give an idea of CTR.

histogram.name: Assistant.ProactiveSuggestions.ViewImpression.ByVeId

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.AttemptCountFail
histogram.summary: Count of DnsAttempts before DnsTransaction completes with failure.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.AttemptCountSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of DnsAttempts before DnsTransaction completes successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ConfigParseResult
histogram.summary: Whether DnsConfig was parsed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DNSChangerDetected
histogram.summary: Whether the first valid DnsConfig included a rogue nameserver.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DnsClientDisabledReason
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent ProcTask succeeded, at the end of a streak of failures after which the DnsClient was disabled.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.DnsClientEnabled
histogram.summary: TRUE counts the events when a valid DnsConfig is received and used to enable DnsClient, while FALSE counts the events when DnsClient is disabled after a series of successful fallbacks from DnsTask to ProcTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.FallbackFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent by ProcTask in failing fallback resolutions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.FallbackSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time spent by ProcTask in successful fallback resolutions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HaveDnsConfig
histogram.summary: Whether there was a valid DNS configuration at the start of a job which eventually completed successfully.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.HostsSize
histogram.summary: The size of the HOSTS file observed before each attempt to parse it.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_HIGHEST
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_IDLE
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority IDLE when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_LOW
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOW when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_LOWEST
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority LOWEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTime_MEDIUM
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.JobQueueTime.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the time the HostResolverImpl::Job was created and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority MEDIUM when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_HIGHEST
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the last time the priority of a HostResolverImpl::Job changed (when a Request was attached or detached) and the time the Job was started (using DnsClient). Includes only Jobs which had priority HIGHEST when started.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.JobQueueTimeAfterChange_IDLE

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.NameServersType
histogram.summary: Type of nameservers in the DNS config, recorded each time the config is read by the DNSConfigService.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ParseToAddressList
histogram.summary: Counts of results of parsing addresses out of DNS responses in successful DnsTransactions.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.PrefDefaultSource
histogram.summary: The source of the async DNS preference's default. Logged at startup, when the IO thread is created.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.PrefSource
histogram.summary: The source of the async DNS preference's value. Logged at startup, when the IO thread is created.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.Rcode
histogram.summary:
The DNS response rcode (https://www.iana.org/assignments/dns-parameters/dns-parameters.xhtml#dns-parameters-6). Logged when a DnsTransaction finishes an attempt at a DNS record lookup. It may make multiple attempts - the rcode of each attempt will be logged. No logging will occur for attempts that do not obtain a response from a DNS server.
Only DNS record lookups performed by the internal DNS resolver ("AsyncDNS") will have their rcode logged. Lookups performed by the system resolver will not have their rcode logged.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveError
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.DnsTaskError.
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned by DnsTask if a subsequent ProcTask succeeded.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveFail
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.DnsTaskFail.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask in resolutions that failed. Excludes time spent in the subsequent fallback.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveStatus
histogram.summary: Counts of the overall results of using asynchronous DNS in HostResolverImpl. This only includes jobs started with valid DNS configuration and excludes synchronous resolutions (as IP literals, from cache, and from HOSTS).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.DnsTaskSuccess.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTask in resolutions that succeeded.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV4
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.DnsTaskSuccess.
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv4 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_IPV6
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.DnsTaskSuccess.
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to pure IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess_FAMILY_UNSPEC
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.DnsTaskSuccess.
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.ResolveSuccess, but limited to IPv4/IPv6 lookups.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailureIndex
histogram.summary: Index in DnsConfig of the failing server, recorded at the time of failure.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresAfterNetworkChange
histogram.summary: Count of server failures after network change before first success in the DnsSession. Recorded at the time of first success.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresAfterSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures after success until the end of the session. Server has reported success at some point during the session. Recorded at the end of the DnsSession.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures before success. This is NOT the first success in the DnsSession. Recorded at the time of success.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerFailuresWithoutSuccess
histogram.summary: Count of server failures without success until the end of the session. Server has never reported success during the DnsSession. Recorded at the end of the DnsSession.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.ServerIsGood
histogram.summary: The current server is "good" and does not have to be skipped.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SortFailure
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in failing calls to AddressSorter in dual-stack resolutions using DnsTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SortSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in successful calls to AddressSorter in dual-stack resolutions using DnsTask.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchDone
histogram.summary: The number of names from the search name list consumed during a successful transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchRemain
histogram.summary: The number of names left on the search name list at the end of a successful transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.SuffixSearchStart
histogram.summary: The number of names on the search name list at the start of a transaction (QTYPE A only).

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TCPAttemptFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTCPAttempt in failed attempts. Excludes timeouts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TCPAttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsTCPAttempt in successful attempts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorHistogram
histogram.summary: Difference between RTT and timeout calculated using Histogram algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorHistogramUnder
histogram.summary: Difference between timeout calculated using Histogram algorithm and RTT.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorJacobson
histogram.summary: Difference between RTT and timeout calculated using Jacobson algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutErrorJacobsonUnder
histogram.summary: Difference between timeout calculated using Jacobson algorithm and RTT.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutSpentHistogram
histogram.summary: Duration of time that would be spent waiting for lost request using Histogram algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TimeoutSpentJacobson
histogram.summary: Duration of time that would be spent waiting for lost request using Jacobson algorithm.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TotalTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.TotalTime.
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Excludes speculative requests.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TotalTime_speculative
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2017. Replaced by Net.DNS.TotalTime_speculative.
histogram.summary: Duration of time since a HostResolverImpl::Resolve request to the time a result is posted. Excludes canceled, evicted, and aborted requests. Includes cache hits (recorded as 0). Speculative requests only.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionFailure
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in failing DnsTransactions. This includes server failures, timeouts and NXDOMAIN results.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken in successful DnsTransactions. This includes all NOERROR answers, even if they indicate the name has no addresses or they cannot be parsed.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess_A
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess but limited to A query type.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess_AAAA
histogram.summary: Same as AsyncDNS.TransactionSuccess but limited to AAAA query type.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.TTL
histogram.summary: TTL of the resolved addresses, as in the response received from the server. For results served from local cache, the TTL is from the original response.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UDPAttemptFail
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsUDPAttempt in failed attempts. Excludes timeouts.

histogram.name: AsyncDNS.UDPAttemptSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken by DnsUDPAttempt in successful attempts. Includes responses arriving after timeout, if multiple attempts are allowed.
