histogram.name: AutodetectEncoding.Attempted
histogram.summary:
Whether the text encoding auto detection logic was attempted for a web page. The logic is triggered when the parser fails to find the encoding method from other signals such as http header, meta tag, BOM, etc.
If the logic successfully detects a new encoding method which is different from the default one, the result is reported through AutodetectEncoding.Detected with the encoding method (see below). Otherwise - i.e. detection logic somehow fails to work for the page or the detected one is same as the default - no result is reported.

histogram.name: AutodetectEncoding.Detected
histogram.summary: The number of web pages whose encoding method is found by the auto detection logic. Grouped by the encoding methods defined in EncodingMethod.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBook.AccessSkipped
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to access the Mac AddressBook was skipped because doing so would incorrectly cause the appearance of the permissions dialog. This happens when Chrome auto-update changes the binary on disk before the first AddressBook access attempt.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBookAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Mac AddressBook was available on an attempt to read data from it.

histogram.name: Autofill.AddressBookAvailableOnFirstAttempt
histogram.summary: Whether the Mac AddressBook was available on the *first* attempt to read data from it. This is only recorded once per Chrome profile.

histogram.name: Autofill.AutomaticProfileCreation
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Autofill.ProfileActionOnFormSubmitted.
histogram.summary: Whether a new Autofill profile was created automatically. In the "false" case, an existing profile was used (and possibly updated).

histogram.name: Autofill.CanLogUKM
histogram.summary: Tracks whether UKM logging is enabled for the page in the Autofill.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadDecision
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2/2016, replaced by Autofill.CardUploadDecisionMetric.
histogram.summary: Whether upload was offered upon detecting a form submission with credit card data and a reason if it wasn't.

histogram.name: Autofill.CardUploadDecisionExpanded
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2017, replaced by Autofill.CardUploadDecisionMetric.
histogram.summary: Whether upload was offered upon detecting a form submission with credit card data and a detailed reason if it wasn't.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarAccepted
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was accepted.

histogram.name: AutoFill.CCInfoBarDenied
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 3/2011, replaced by Autofill.CreditCardInfoBar.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The Autofill credit card info bar was denied.

histogram.name: Autofill.CreditCardUploadDisallowedForNetwork
histogram.obsolete: Was replaced by the AutofillDoNotUploadSaveUnsupportedCards feature in M75. Removed 2019/07.
histogram.summary: When a credit card is not allowed to be offered upload save due to its network, logs what the card network was.

histogram.name: Autofill.DaysSincePreviousUseAtSubmission.Profile
histogram.summary: Logs the number of days between most recent use without modification and the penultimate use of the profile when submitting a credit card form.

histogram.name: Autofill.FormDynamicity
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 after sufficient data was collected, to cleanup the code base.
histogram.summary:
Records how forms change dynamically: whether the form signature changed, a field's signature changed, or a field was newly created. The reference period starts when Autofill parses the form for the first time, and ends when a navigation is committed or the frame is destructed.
Every form is observed for dynamic changes from the time it was first parsed by Autofill until either a navigation has been committed or the frame is destructed or the form's observation had to be flushed prematurely (the form observations are managed in an LRU cache of maximum size 32, with least recently parsed forms being discarded first). At the end of the lifetime, a three-bit number is sent: the lowest bit is 1 iff a field was changed during the form's lifetime (its signature changed); the second bit is 1 iff a field was added (its renderer ID is new to the form); the highest bit is 1 iff the form was changed (its signature changed).

histogram.name: Autofill.FormEvents.CreditCard.BankNameDisplayed
histogram.summary:
Autofill form events for credit card forms. These are recorded when the user interacts with a form requesting a credit card, a dropdown of suggestions is shown and at least one of the suggestions has a bank name. Form events are logged at most once per page load.
These metrics are used to measure the impact of the bank name experiment. They are used to calculate the CTR of the autofill UI with bank names available. Not all credit cards will have bank names even if we launch the experiment. With these metrics we can run the experiment on 2 groups. For one group, we will show bank names if available. For the other, we won't shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.HasModifiedProfile.CreditCardFormSubmission
histogram.summary: Whether user modified an address profile shortly before submitting a credit card form.

histogram.name: Autofill.IcuCollatorCreationSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill was able to create the ICU collator successfully.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyboardAccessoryButtonsIOS_ScreenReaderOff
histogram.summary: [iOS] Measures the frequency of button presses on the iOS Autofill keyboard accessory view when VoiceOver is off.

histogram.name: Autofill.KeyboardAccessoryButtonsIOS_ScreenReaderOn
histogram.summary: [iOS] Measures the frequency of button presses on the iOS Autofill keyboard accessory view when VoiceOver is on.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook
histogram.summary: When Chrome tries to access the user's Address Book, OSX presents a blocking dialog which disrupts the user experience. A new Chrome feature has been introduced wherein Chrome only shows this blocking dialog if the user explicitly asked Chrome to access the user's Address Book. If a form's field looks like it might support Autofill suggestions from the user's Address Book and there are no other suggestions, Chrome shows an Autofill entry that prompts the user to give Chrome access to the user's Address Book. This histogram tracks the frequency that this Autofill entry is presented, and the frequency that this Autofill entry is selected.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.AcceptedSuggestionIsFromAddressBook
histogram.summary: This metric is emitted each time the user accepts an Autofill suggestion. It records whether the result is from the Address Book.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.AccessTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent accessing the OSX Address Book the first time after Chrome was launched. If this time is larger than ~100ms, this it is likely that the user was shown a blocking, modal dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.ContainedMeCard
histogram.summary: After a Chrome is given access to the Mac Address Book, whether the Address Book contained a Me card.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.MeCard.HadAddress
histogram.summary: When Chrome is given access to the Me Card of the Address Book, whether the card has an address that contained a street number and either a city or zip code.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.MeCard.HadEmail
histogram.summary: When Chrome is given access to the Me Card of the Address Book, whether the card has an email.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.MeCard.HadName
histogram.summary: When Chrome is given access to the Me Card of the Address Book, whether the card has a name.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.MeCard.HadPhoneNumber
histogram.summary: When Chrome is given access to the Me Card of the Address Book, whether the card has a phone number.

histogram.name: Autofill.MacAddressBook.NumShowsBeforeSelected
histogram.summary: The number of times that the access Address Book prompt has been shown when the user selects the prompt.

histogram.name: Autofill.MaskedCardComparisonNetworksMatch
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when two credit cards are compared using CreditCard::HasSameNumberAs and one of the cards in the comparison is masked. The metric measures whether there is a match between a masked card's network and the network of the card with which the masked card is being compared.

histogram.name: Autofill.PasswordFormQueryVolume
histogram.summary: Tracks the increased load on the Autofill server if the restriction on querying for password forms with fewer than 3 fields were omitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.PayloadCompressionRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 1/2016, autofill payload compression was removed.
histogram.summary: Compression ratio of the query and upload payload that are sent to the Autofill server. The payload is compressed using gzip.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentsCustomerDataBillingIdIsValid

histogram.name: Autofill.WalletAddresses
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 12/2018, replaced by Autofill.WalletAddresses2.
histogram.summary: The number of Wallet addresses that were added to Chrome or removed from Chrome via Sync. Recorded when receiving an AUTOFILL_WALLET_DATA update from the Sync server. Recorded only if both the user had previously non-empty data set locally and the new data set is also non-empty (to rule out initial sync and wiping out data). This metric has a flaw that the Directory implementation (unlike the USS implementation) records the metric also on every startup and the resulting histograms are hard to compare.

histogram.name: AutoScreenBrightness.UserAdjustment
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2018. It has been replaced by DailyUserAdjustment.
histogram.summary: Type of user manual screen brightness adjustment.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.TimeUntilFailure
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent working on a single probe attempt to get to a failed state. Recorded every time a probe fails.

histogram.name: Availability.Prober.TimeUntilSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time spent working on a single probe attempt to get to a successful state. Recorded every time a probe succeeds.

histogram.name: BackForwardCache.SameSite.ActionAfterPagehide
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 09/2020 in favor of ActionAfterPagehide2 which excludes actions taken when the unload event is in progress.
histogram.summary: Records occurences of certain actions triggered by script running on a page after the pagehide event gets dispatched in the page, which might be possible if we dispatch the pagehide event without unloading/freezing the page (only happens when we're doing a same-site navigation and we did a proactive BrowsingInstance swap but we're reusing the old page's process). Note: we will only track actions that might affect the user after we've navigated away from the old page, such as modifications to storage, navigations, or sending/receiving postMessage.

histogram.name: Badging.AppBadgeUpdate.Win.Result

histogram.obsolete: The blacklist is deprecated in favor of third-party DLL blocking.

histogram.name: Blacklist.RetryAttempts.Success
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by ChromeElf.Beacon.RetryAttemptsBeforeSuccess after the old blacklist was deprecated.

histogram.name: Blacklist.Setup
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by ChromeElf.Beacon.SetupStatus after the old blacklist was deprecated.
histogram.summary: Records the successes and failures when running the browser blacklist setup code. Used to determine if the blacklist is working as intended during startup (since the blacklist runs before crash reporting is set up). This only occurs on Windows.

histogram.name: Blink.BudgetAPI.QueryBudget
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 08/2018 (M70) with the removal of the Budget API.
histogram.summary: Whenever the Budget API framework receives a query for the current budget, this records the total budget available to the origin, which is an internal Chrome value for the amount of background processing an origin can do without visibly alerting the user. Scale for the budget is 0 to 100. Care should be taken when drawing conclusions from this metric, as budget is based on both engagement and usage, so could vary significantly based on user behaviour and origin.

histogram.name: Blink.BudgetAPI.Reserve
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 08/2018 (M70) with the removal of the Budget API.
histogram.summary: Whenever the Budget API framework receives a request to reserve budget for a future background operation, this records whether the reserve request succeeded or not.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.2DLayerBridgeIsDeferred
histogram.obsolete: Removed as the deferral path is always used now - 11/2019.
histogram.summary: Records if a 2D Layer Bridge is using deferred rendering when it is destroyed. Emitted in Canvas2DLayerBridge::~Canvas2DLayerBridge.

histogram.summary:
Time spent on 2D canvas drawImage API call.

Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

Time spent on 2D canvas getImageData API call.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.GPUAccelerated2DCanvasDisableDeferralReason
histogram.obsolete: Canvas doesn't disable deferral anymore since July 2019.
histogram.summary: The reasons why a GPU accelerated canvas stopped deferring its rendering operations.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.OffscreenCommitTimer
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 10/2018. Offscreen Canvas no longer needs commits.
histogram.summary:
Wall clock durations of OffscreenCanvas.commit() calls.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.PutImageData
histogram.summary:
Time spent on 2D canvas putImageData API call.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlob.IdleEncodeDuration
histogram.summary: This metric measures the total time spent on encoding all the rows of an image (jpeg or png), excluding the waiting time of next idle periods. This is part of a canvas.toBlob API call. Encoding occurs during one or more idle periods on the main thread.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToBlobDuration
histogram.summary:
Time spent on 2D canvas toBlob API call.
In addition, metric values from OffscreenCanvas.convertToBlob API call are also gathered into this histogram, because the logic flow is exactly the same as canvas.toBlob. It's worth to note that the values can come from idle tasks on either main or worker thread.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Blink.Canvas.ToDataURL
histogram.summary:
Time spent on 2D canvas toDataURL API call.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Blink.CheckerableImageCount
histogram.summary: The number of images which could have been checkered (async decoded) for a performance gain, split by the DOM element type on which they were used. This is recorded each time an image for an element created by the page is loaded, either from the network or the local cache. The browser heuristics define an image to be checkerable if it is expected to have a long decode duration. Since these images may be on the rendering critical path, decoding them asychronously from painting other content can provide better performance be reducing overall content checkerboarding.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorGamut.Source
histogram.summary: Gamut properties of image color space.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.ExtractedRawData
histogram.summary: Whether or not the output color space ICC profile was able to produce raw transfer function tables.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.ICCResult
histogram.summary: The result of analyzing the destiation color space's ICC profile.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.LinearFitError
histogram.obsolete: Linear fit found to be always inaccurate on 2017-02-28.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.Matrix
histogram.summary: Whether or not to-XYZD50 matrix was extracted from the output color space ICC profile.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.NonlinearFitConverged
histogram.obsolete: Nonlinear fit code moved to skcms on 2018-04-25.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.NonlinearFitError
histogram.obsolete: Nonlinear fit code moved to skcms on 2018-04-25.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.Numerical

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.OneMinusTMax
histogram.obsolete: TMax found to almost always be 1 on 2017-02-28.
histogram.summary: One minus the maximum value of table-based ICC profile transfer functions as an 8-bit fixed-point value. This histogram is temporary, to see if we can bake in the assumption that it will almost always be 255.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Destination.TMin
histogram.obsolete: TMin found to almost always be 0 on 2017-02-28.
histogram.summary: The minimum value of table-based ICC profile transfer functions as an 8-bit fixed-point value. This histogram is temporary, to see if we can bake in the assumption that it will almost always be 0.

histogram.name: Blink.ColorSpace.Source
histogram.summary: Gamma properties of image color space.

histogram.name: Blink.Compositing.UpdateTime
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of http://crrev.com/794384 and M86.
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating compositing in the Blink document lifecycle. This is the legacy compositing approach. BlinkGenPropertyTrees launches part of the new compositing approach and will use both this and Blink.CompositingCommit.UpdateTime.
Note: As of M70, this histogram has stopped recording metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.
TODO(crbug.com/1100711): This is being replaced soon by CompositingInputs + CompositingAssignments (== Compositing).

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.CanvasExpanded
histogram.summary: The original canvas dimensions were sufficient to determine image size. This is logged once per image header decode, which happens typically twice per image on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.EffectiveDimensionsLocation
histogram.summary: How many bytes of the file were read before an image width and height were determined. This is logged once per image header decode, which happens typically twice per image on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 08/23/2018. Replaced by Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity.*
histogram.summary: The compressed image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for JPEGs with at least 100 pixels on each dimension.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity.1000px
histogram.summary: The compressed image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for JPEGs with at least 1000 pixels on the smallest dimension (width or height).

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity.100px
histogram.summary: The compressed image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for JPEGs with at least 100 pixels on the smallest dimension (width or height) but less than 400 pixels on the smallest dimension.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.JpegDensity.400px
histogram.summary: The compressed image density measured in 0.01 bits per pixel. This is logged once per image load after the whole image is loaded and only for JPEGs with at least 400 pixels on the smallest dimension (width or height) but less than 1000 pixels on the smallest dimension.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.XCanvasExpansion
histogram.summary: How much the canvas width needed to be expanded as a result of the first frame's width and x-offset being larger than the initial canvas width. This is logged once per image header decode, which happens typically twice per image on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.DecodedImage.YCanvasExpansion
histogram.summary: How much the canvas height needed to be expanded as a result of the first frame's height and y-offset being larger than the initial canvas height. This is logged once per image header decode, which happens typically twice per image on the page.

histogram.name: Blink.EventListenerDuration.Resize
histogram.summary: Time it takes to execute all the `resize` event listeners on a page when a resize event is fired. Tracked only for the main frame.

histogram.name: Blink.Fonts.HarfBuzzFaceZeroCopyAccess
histogram.summary: Counts success or failure of attempting to access font tables using the zero copy instantiation method in the HarfBuzz integration layer. This value is only recorded on non-Mac platforms. Reported each time a HarfBuzz face object is created.

histogram.name: Blink.Gesture.Merged
histogram.obsolete: UserActivationV2 made UserGestureTokens obselete, so the merge stats is now irrelevant.
histogram.summary: How many times two user gesture tokens were merged by UserGestureIndicator, and whether each token had an active gesture. One of the new token's gestures, if any, is moved to the old token.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.ProxyCommitRatio
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with separate ImplCompositorCommit and WaitForCommit metrics and removed in M84.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for committing the layer tree to the impl thread.

histogram.name: Blink.MainFrame.StyleAndLayoutRatio
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with separate Style and Layout metrics and removed in M81.
histogram.summary: The percentage of time between a BeginMainFrame and paint results commit in Blink that is used for computing Style and Layout.

histogram.name: Blink.MediaDocument.DownloadButton
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2017 as it is integrated into media controller.
histogram.summary: Records how the download button on the MediaDocument is used.

histogram.name: Blink.MediaElement.Autoplay
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016 in Issue 666370 with the deprecation of Autoplay experiment.
histogram.summary: Records user observation and interaction with Media HTML elements that feature autoplay, either script-controlled or through the attribute.

histogram.name: Blink.Paint.IndexedItemPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Not very useful for identifying performance issues.
histogram.summary: Percentage of display items that are put into the index because of out-of-order display item matching. Higher value means lower performance beause of the cost of out-of-order matching and indexing. Recorded when we finish updating paint in the Blink document lifecycle.

histogram.name: Blink.Paint.NumDisplayItems
histogram.obsolete: Not very useful for identifying performance issues.
histogram.summary: Total number of display items (including cached and repainted) in the painted result. Recorded when we finish updating paint in the Blink document lifecycle.

histogram.name: Blink.Paint.NumPaintChunks
histogram.obsolete: Not very useful for identifying performance issues.
histogram.summary: Total number of paint chunks in the painted result. Recorded when we finish updating paint in the Blink document lifecycle.

histogram.name: Blink.Paint.NumSubsequences
histogram.obsolete: Not very useful for identifying performance issues.
histogram.summary: Total number of subsequences (including cached and repainted) in the painted result. Recorded when we finish updating paint in the Blink document lifecycle.

histogram.name: Blink.PaintInvalidation.UpdateTime
histogram.obsolete: SlimmingPaintInvalidation is enabled by default, so this histogram is no longer being logged. Was removed in 02-2018.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating paint invalidation in the Blink document lifecycle. Not available when SlimmingPaintInvalidation or SlimmingPaintV2 is enabled.

histogram.name: Blink.ProxyCommit.UpdateTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with separate ImplCompositorCommit and WaitForCommit metrics and removed in M84.
histogram.summary:
Time spent commiting the layer tree to the impl thread in a main frame update.
Note: This histogram does not record metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceFetcher.StaleWhileRevalidate
histogram.summary: Count of resources attempted Stale Revalidation.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.DecodedBytes
histogram.summary: Count received data size in bytes for each resource.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.DecodedBytes.KBPerFrameStatus
histogram.summary:
Total decoded size of resources associated with frames of a particular type. Recorded when a fetch has been completed.
Each bucket of the histogram cointains the total size of all requests associated with frames with a particular frame status in kilobytes.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.PeakRequests
histogram.summary: The largest number of outstanding resource requests issued by a frame until the network 2-quiet (no more than 2 active network requests for 1 seconds).

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.RequestCount
histogram.summary: Count resource request circumstance, e.g. from the main frame vs sub-frames, or in throttled state vs in not-throttled state, on each resource load completion.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.ThrottlingStateChangeCount
histogram.summary: Count how many times the scheduler has changed throttling status from the frame creation until network activity quiets.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.TotalDecodedBytes
histogram.summary: Total received data size in bytes to load resources from the frame creation until network activity quiets.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.TotalRequestCount
histogram.summary: Total number of resource requests completed from the frame creation until network activity quiets.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.TotalTrafficBytes
histogram.summary: Total traffic data in bytes transferred over networks to load resources from the frame creation until network activity quiets.

histogram.name: Blink.ResourceLoadScheduler.TrafficBytes
histogram.summary: Count traffic data size in bytes transferred over networks to load each resource.

histogram.name: Blink.RestoredCachedStyleSheet
histogram.summary: On each link stylesheet tag resolve, record whether a Blink MemoryCached StyleSheetContents was reused.

histogram.name: Blink.RestoredCachedStyleSheet2
histogram.summary: On each link stylesheet tag resolve, record which cache Blink hit.

histogram.name: Blink.ScriptValueSerializer.DOMWrapperCount
histogram.obsolete: Used to justify distribution of serialized data in the wild, but unlikely to be useful to track long-term.
histogram.summary: Number of DOM wrappers serialized as part of an object passed to postMessage, IndexedDB, or another API that serializes script values.

histogram.name: Blink.ScriptValueSerializer.JSObjectCount
histogram.obsolete: Used to justify distribution of serialized data in the wild, but unlikely to be useful to track long-term.
histogram.summary: Number of JavaScript objects (other than DOM wrappers) serialized as part of an object passed to postMessage, IndexedDB, or another API that serializes script values.

histogram.name: Blink.ScriptValueSerializer.PrimitiveCount
histogram.obsolete: Used to justify distribution of serialized data in the wild, but unlikely to be useful to track long-term.
histogram.summary: Number of primitive values (numbers, strings, etc.) serialized as part of an object passed to postMessage, IndexedDB, or another API that serializes script values.

histogram.name: Blink.SharedBuffer.FailedLock
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 since SharedBuffer::unlock() was successfully removed.
histogram.summary: Number of failed SharedBuffer::lock() calls for each resource type. https://crbug.com/603791

histogram.name: Blink.SharedBuffer.SuccessfulLock
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 since SharedBuffer::unlock() was successfully removed.
histogram.summary: Number of successful SharedBuffer::lock() calls for each resource type. https://crbug.com/603791

histogram.name: Blink.SharedBuffer.Unlock
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 since SharedBuffer::unlock() was successfully removed.
histogram.summary: Number of SharedBuffer::unlock() calls for each resource type. https://crbug.com/603791

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.RequestedTimeout
histogram.obsolete: Removed 9/2019 since the concept of timeouts have been removed. https://crbug.com/1000376
histogram.summary: Records the timeout value specified when the API is called regardless of whether or not the call actually timed out. The value of 0 indicates that no value was specified.

histogram.name: Blink.Sms.Receive.TimeTimeoutExceeded
histogram.obsolete: Removed 9/2019 since the concept of timeouts have been removed. https://crbug.com/1000376
histogram.summary: Records the duration from when the API is called to when the user gets timed out of the SMS verification flow because no SMS was received within the specified timeout window.

histogram.name: Blink.StyleAndLayout.UpdateTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with separate Style and Layout metrics and removed in M81.
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating style and layout in the Blink document lifecycle.
Note: As of M70, this histogram has stopped recording metrics on machines with low-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.AnimatedCSSProperties_TestBrowserProcessLogging
histogram.obsolete: Renamed to Blink.UseCounter.AnimatedCSSProperties in 03/2018, M69. The old blink UseCounter is flawed in OOPIF, so moved to the browser side instead.
histogram.summary: Records usage of animated CSS properties used across all frames in a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page view except kTotalPagesMeasuredCSSSampleId which represents a page load (enum value of 1) and is counted exactly once per page view.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties_TestBrowserProcessLogging
histogram.obsolete: Renamed to Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties in 03/2018, M69. The old blink UseCounter is flawed in OOPIF, so moved to the browser side instead.
histogram.summary: Records usage of CSS properties used across all frames in a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view except kTotalPagesMeasuredCSSSampleId which represents a page load (enum value of 1) and is counted exactly once per page view.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.ImageDownscalingRatio
histogram.obsolete: Feature moved from feature policy to document policy in M82. Histogram and recording code removed for feature policy. Histogram and recording code will be added for document policy.
histogram.summary: Logs downscaling ratio in percentage for images enforced by feature policy oversized-images policy going into origin trials in M75. If an image's downscaling ratio is 1, it will be represented as 10 percent, if an image's downscaling ratio is 5, it will be represented as 50 percents. Recorded when oversized-images policy is enforced and the image is about to be painted.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.ImageFormats
histogram.obsolete: Feature moved from feature policy to document policy in M82. Histogram and recording code removed for feature policy. Histogram and recording code will be added for document policy.
histogram.summary: Counts ImageFileFormats (lossy, lossless, webp animation, others) of images enforced by feature policy unoptimized-images policy going into origin trials in M75. Recorded when images finish decoding the mime type.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.LosslessImageCompression
histogram.obsolete: Feature moved from feature policy to document policy in M82. Histogram and recording code removed for feature policy. Histogram and recording code will be added for document policy.
histogram.summary: Logs compression ratio in percentage with 1KB overhead for lossless type images enforced by feature policy unoptimized-lossless-images policy going into origin trials in M75. If an image's compression ratio is 0.1, it will be represented as 1 percent, if an image's compression ratio is 5, it will be represented as 50 percents. Recorded when unoptimized-lossless-images policy is enforced and the image finishes decoding its mime type.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.LossyImageCompression
histogram.obsolete: Feature moved from feature policy to document policy in M82. Histogram and recording code removed for feature policy. Histogram and recording code will be added for document policy.
histogram.summary: Logs compression ratio with 1KB overhead for lossy type images enforced by feature policy unoptimized-lossy-images policy going into origin trials in M75. If an image's compression ratio is 0.1, it will be represented as 1 percent, if an image's compression ratio is 5, it will be represented as 50 percents. Recorded when unoptimized-lossy-images policy is enforced and the image finishes decoding its mime type.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.FeaturePolicy.StrictLosslessImageCompression
histogram.obsolete: Feature moved from feature policy to document policy in M82. Histogram and recording code removed for feature policy. Histogram and recording code will be added for document policy.
histogram.summary: Logs compression ratio with 10KB overhead for lossless type images enforced by feature policy unoptimized-lossless-images-strict policy going into origin trials in M75. If an image's compression ratio is 0.1, it will be represented as 1 percent, if an image's compression ratio is 5, it will be represented as 50 percents. Recorded when unoptimized-lossless-images-strict policy is enforced and the image finishes decoding its mime type.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.Features_Legacy
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Blink.UseCounter.Features in M67. See crbug.com/849695.
histogram.summary:
Count of how many page loads use various features. The PageVisits bucket is incremented for each page load, and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via the blink::UseCounter class.
This histogram recorded values in the renderer process. With the addition of OOPIF, the counts could be inaccurate due to multiple renderer processes for a page. It was replaced by an implementation that records values in the browser process.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.Features_TestBrowserProcessLogging
histogram.obsolete: Renamed to Blink.UseCounter.Features in 03/2018, M67. The old blink UseCounter is flawed in OOPIF, so moved to the browser side (this) instead.
histogram.summary: Count of how many page loads use various features across all frames in a page. The PageVisits bucket is incremented for each page load, and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via the WebCore::UseCounter class. This counter lives in browser process.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.AnimatedCSSProperties
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2018, M69 since the histogram is not really useful. See https://crbug.com/804645.
histogram.summary:
Like Blink.UseCounter.AnimatedCSSProperties but specifically for the case of CSS properties used inside of an SVG image.
Warning: This histogram represents pre-renderer metrics and so is flawed under OOPIF.
This histogram counts usage of animated CSS properties only. Refer to Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.CSSProperties for details.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.CSSProperties
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2018, M69 since the histogram is not really useful. See https://crbug.com/804645.
histogram.summary:
Like Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties but specifically for the case of CSS properties used inside of an SVG image.
Warning: This histogram represents pre-renderer metrics and so is flawed under OOPIF.
The 'Total pages measured' bucket is incremented each time a new SVG image is created. Note that the same SVG image can be used across multiple tabs in a single renderer but this counts as a single usage. See http://crbug.com/236262.

histogram.name: Blink.UseCounter.SVGImage.Features
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 05/2019, M76. Every SVGImage has it's own Page instance and multiple web pages can share the usage of a single SVGImage. Previously Blink.UseCounter.Features was recorded on the Blink side per Page; metrics from SVGImage needed to be recorded in a separate histogram. Now that metrics are recorded on the browser side, feature usage from SVGImage is measured via page load metrics, on Blink.UseCounter.Features, once per page load. This histogram is no longer needed.
histogram.summary:
Like Blink.UseCounter.Features except specifically for the case of SVG Images.
Warning: This histogram represents pre-renderer metrics and so is flawed under OOPIF.
Count of how many SVG images use various features. The PageVisits bucket is incremented each time a new SVG image is created. Note that the same SVG image can be used across multiple tabs in a single renderer but this counts as a single usage. See http://crbug.com/236262.

histogram.name: Blink.XHR.setRequestHeader.HeaderValueCategoryInRFC7230
histogram.summary: The count of XMLHttpRequest.setRequestHeader() calls where header values are invalid/valid but affected by normalization/valid in RFC 7230. https://crbug.com/455099.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.AtomicPhaseMarking
histogram.summary: Duration of finishing marking the transitive closure of objects during the final Blink garbage collection pause. Recorded at the end of each garbage collection.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CollectGarbage
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2018. The sample taken here was a mix of marking, sweeping and compaction. Replaced by BlinkGC.AtomicPhaseMarking for the marking phase and BlinkGC.TimeForTotalCollectGarbage for the overal time.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run Heap::collectGarbage(). Recorded at the end of each garbage collection.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CommittedSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2019. Use Memory.Renderer.* and Memory.Experimental.Renderer2.* instead.
histogram.summary: The committed memory size in Blink GC. The value is reported when we see the highest memory usage we've ever seen in the renderer process.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.CompleteSweep
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run ThreadState::completeSweep().

histogram.name: BlinkGC.PerformPendingSweep
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run ThreadState::performPendingSweep().

histogram.name: BlinkGC.SlowIncrementalMarkingFinalize.AtomicPhaseMarking
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Data gathering finished with the result that slow marking finalization was mostly caused by visiting DOM wrappers or premature finalization.
histogram.summary: Duration of finishing marking the transitive closure of objects during the final Blink garbage collection pause. Only recorded when incremental marking finalization took at least 40ms.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.SlowIncrementalMarkingFinalize.EagerSweep
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Data gathering finished with the result that slow marking finalization was mostly caused by visiting DOM wrappers or premature finalization.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run eager sweep finalizers finalizers. Only recorded when incremental marking finalization took at least 40ms.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.SlowIncrementalMarkingFinalize.IncrementalMarkingFinalize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Data gathering finished with the result that slow marking finalization was mostly caused by visiting DOM wrappers or premature finalization.
histogram.summary: Duration of time for incremental marking finalization. Only recorded when incremental marking finalization took at least 40ms.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.SlowIncrementalMarkingFinalize.InvokePreFinalizers
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Data gathering finished with the result that slow marking finalization was mostly caused by visiting DOM wrappers or premature finalization.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to invoke pre finalizers. Only recorded when incremental marking finalization took at least 40ms.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.SlowIncrementalMarkingFinalize.MarkWeakProcessing
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Data gathering finished with the result that slow marking finalization was mostly caused by visiting DOM wrappers or premature finalization.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken for weak processing. Only recorded when incremental marking finalization took at least 40ms.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.SlowIncrementalMarkingFinalize.VisitCrossThreadPersistents
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Data gathering finished with the result that slow marking finalization was mostly caused by visiting DOM wrappers or premature finalization.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to visit cross thread persistents. Only recorded when incremental marking finalization took at least 40ms.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.SlowIncrementalMarkingFinalize.VisitDOMWrappers
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Data gathering finished with the result that slow marking finalization was mostly caused by visiting DOM wrappers or premature finalization.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to visit DOM wrappers. Only recorded when incremental marking finalization took at least 40ms.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForCoalesce
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Coalescing is not used anymore.
histogram.summary: Duration of memory coalesce operation in the Blink GC. Reported once per coalesce operation.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForStoppingThreads
histogram.obsolete: As of 02/2017, the code to stop Blink threads was removed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to stop all Blink threads before starting a GC.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForSweepingAllObjects
histogram.obsolete: As of 07/2019, this metric is replaced by BlinkGC.TimeForSweepingSum.
histogram.summary: Accumulated time taken to sweep all objects.

histogram.name: BlinkGC.TimeForThreadLocalWeakProcessing
histogram.obsolete: As of 02/2017, the code for thread-local weak processing was removed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to run thread-local weak processing.

histogram.name: BloatedRenderer.HandlingInBrowser
histogram.summary: Records how a bloated renderer was handled in the browser process.

histogram.name: BloatedRenderer.HandlingInResourceCoordinator
histogram.summary: Records how a bloated renderer was handled in the resource coordinator service.

histogram.name: BloatedRenderer.V8.NearV8HeapLimitHandling
histogram.summary: Records how a bloated V8 heap was handled in the renderer process. It is emitted the first time V8 heap reaches the heap limit and invokes the NearHeapLimitCallback. Subsequent invocations of the callback are ignored. Thus it is emitted once per renderer process run.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Availability
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2019, and replaced by Bluetooth.Availability.v2. This metric was double-reporting on an error condition.
histogram.summary: Determines the availability and capabilities of the Bluetooth driver. This metric is logged on startup.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.GATTErrors
histogram.obsolete: As of 08/2015 this has been replaced by Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.ReadValue and Bluetooth.Web.Characteristic.WriteValue.
histogram.summary: Records how many times each GATT Error has occured. The results will be used to determine how common this errors are and if we need to provide better error messages to the users.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.RequestDevice.Outcome
histogram.summary: Records the result of a navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice() call. Used to understand what errors developers are getting so we can target efforts toward the most common ones. Multiple outcomes may result for a given RequestDevice, such as rescan multiple times and then select a device.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.Blacklist.ParsedNonEmptyString
histogram.summary:
Records the result of BluetoothBlacklist::Add parsing a non-empty string. These strings will be updated dynamically by a server, and this histogram provides feedback that parsing is functioning correctly on clients.
False values are BAD, a blacklist is failing to be applied correctly.

histogram.name: Bluetooth.Web.FunctionCall.Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 3/2017. Replaced by using blink IDL annotation MeasureAs which appear in Blink.UseCounter.Features.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each call to a WebBluetooth function is done.

histogram.name: BlueZ.ChipLost
histogram.obsolete: Replaced 08/2018 by BlueZ.ChipLost2 for more suspend/resume filtering even when the Bluetooth adapter is turned off.
histogram.summary: This is specific to Chrome OS. Records a duration of a Bluetooth adapter being lost caused by hardware disconnection. This helps us better understand the Bluetooth controller drop issue in the field.

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.CommandExecutedFromKeyboard
histogram.summary:
Logs when a keyboard shortcut triggers a command in the bookmark manager.
Revised in M-76 when the "Open (double click/enter)" bucket was split into two separate buckets, one for bookmarks and one for folders.

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.NumDraggedInSession
histogram.summary: Logs the number of drag actions that are performed in one session (defined as the time between a user's opening a folder and closing said folder).

histogram.name: BookmarkManager.NumReorderButtonInSession
histogram.summary: Logs the number of uses of the Move Up / Down buttons in one session (defined as the time between a user's opening a folder and closing said folder).

histogram.name: Bookmarks.Count.OnProfileLoad.EmptyTitle
histogram.summary: The number of bookmarks a user has saved with an empty title (strictly speaking, i.e. does not count whitespace-only titles), including folders and excluding the root. Recorded when bookmarks are loaded into storage from disk if there is at least one node with an empty title.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.FileSize
histogram.summary: The size of the file used to persist bookmarks. It's recorded every time the file is loaded in memory.

histogram.name: Bookmarks.LaunchDepth
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2019. This histogram is no longer necessary.
histogram.summary: Logs the depth of the bookmark in the bookmark tree hierarchy every time a bookmark is launched. Depth indicates how many levels below a permanent bookmark folder the bookmark was found in (e.g. a bookmark immediately in the bookmark bar has depth 1).

histogram.name: Bookmarks.OpenAction
histogram.summary: Logs how user is opening a bookmark on Android. For example, user can long press and select "Open in a new tab" or "Open in incognito tab".

histogram.name: BootTime.Total
histogram.obsolete: Replaced 08/2016 by BootTime.Total2 with larger range and more buckets.
histogram.summary: Time from power on to login panel ready (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: BrotliFilter.GzipHeaderDetected
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the gzip-like header was detected.

histogram.name: Browser.Metal.TestShaderCompileTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2020. Was not substantially different from results in the GPU process.
histogram.summary: Compiling a MTLLibrary will sometimes hang forever. When initializing the browser process, a test shader is compiled to see if the MTLCompilerService is responding or not. This records the time that it took for the compile to succeeded, up to 1 minute. After 1 minute, a timeout sentinel value of 3 minutes is reported.

histogram.name: Browser.Metal.TestShaderMethodTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2020. Did not reveal interesting results.
histogram.summary: Compiling a MTLLibrary will sometimes hang forever. When initializing the browser process, a test shader is compiled to see if the MTLCompilerService is responding or not. This records the time that it took for the compile method to finish (not including the time for the compile itself to finish), up to 1 minute. After 1 minute, a timeout sentinel value of 3 minutes is reported.

histogram.name: BrowserActions.NumTabCreatedInBackground
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 with the removal of Browser Actions.
histogram.summary: The number of tabs currently opened when users tap "Open in new Chrome tab" from Browser Actions context menu. This includes the new tab created from the tap.

histogram.name: BrowserActions.SelectedOption
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 with the removal of Browser Actions.
histogram.summary: The option that the user selected from a Browser Actions context menu.

histogram.name: BrowserDialogs.ExternalProtocol.RememberCheckbox
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2017. This histogram has been replaced with ExternalProtocol.HandleState.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the user checked the option in the external protocol dialog to remember their choice of opening or not opening the specified app. Recorded each time the user interacts with the External Protocol Dialog (either accepting or cancelling/dismissing).

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.KeepAliveDuration
histogram.summary: How long a render process is kept alive by additional customers such as shared workers and service workers.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.KeepAliveDuration.Fetch
histogram.summary: How long fetch is alive which in turn keeps the render process alive. TODO(panicker): Remove after investigation of crbug/823482, likely in M68.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.KeepAliveDuration.ServiceWorker
histogram.summary: How long service worker is alive which in turn keeps the render process alive. TODO(panicker): Remove after investigation of crbug/823482, likely in M68.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.KeepAliveDuration.SharedWorker
histogram.summary: How long shared worker is alive which in turn keeps the render process alive. TODO(panicker): Remove after investigation of crbug/823482, likely in M68.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.KeepAliveDuration.Unload
histogram.summary: How long the renderer process is kept alive by a subframe unload handler. TODO(panicker): Remove after investigation of crbug/823482.

histogram.name: BrowserRenderProcessHost.OnChannelError
histogram.summary: Number of times BrowserRenderProcessHost::OnChannelError was called.

histogram.name: BrowserServices.TwaOpenTime
histogram.obsolete: Retired in M77 in favour of BrowserServices.TwaOpenTime.V2 which uses a more appropriate timescale.
histogram.summary: Triggered when a TrustedWebActivity is paused, recording the time since it had been resumed.

histogram.name: BrowserWindow.Resize.Duration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete since 01/2020: mus+ash project was canceled, and these metrics are no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Duration of an interactive resize from start to end. Measured only on Windows.

histogram.name: BrowserWindow.Resize.StepBoundsChange
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete since 01/2020: mus+ash project was canceled, and these metrics are no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Size changed between two consecutive steps during browser-window resize. Measured only on Windows.

histogram.name: BrowserWindow.Resize.StepCount
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete since 01/2020: mus+ash project was canceled, and these metrics are no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Number of intermediate resize-steps taken to complete the resize from start to end. Measured only on Windows.

histogram.name: BrowserWindow.Resize.StepInterval
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete since 01/2020: mus+ash project was canceled, and these metrics are no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Time-interval between two consecutive steps during browser-window resize. An interactive resize can have many number of small steps. This measures the interval between two steps. 'Duration' measures the interval between the first and last steps. Measured only on Windows.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.Accepted

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.FocusLost

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.FullscreenToggled

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.Navigated

histogram.summary: An open bubble was dismissed because the page was navigated.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.TabDetached
histogram.obsolete: No longer used; generating code removed in M81.
histogram.summary: An open bubble was closed because a tab was detached.

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.TabSwitched

histogram.name: Bubbles.Close.UserDismissed
histogram.obsolete: No longer used; generating code removed in M81.
histogram.summary: An open bubble was dismissed by the user without making a decission.

histogram.name: Bubbles.DisplayTime.All
histogram.obsolete: No longer used; generating code removed in M81.
histogram.summary: Log the amount of time any bubble was visible. Only bubbles that are shown will have a visible time.

histogram.name: Bubbles.NeverShown
histogram.obsolete: No longer used; generating code removed in M81.

histogram.name: CachedImageFetcher.Events
histogram.summary: Events that track the lifecycle and performance of the cached_image_fetcher. The events reported include: success/failure conditions, various recoverable errors and a couple of dead-end errors.

histogram.name: CachedImageFetcher.ImageLoadFromCacheTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes for cached_image_fetcher to load an image from the cache in native.

histogram.name: CachedImageFetcher.ImageLoadFromCacheTimeJava
histogram.summary: The time it takes for cached_image_fetcher to load an image from the cache in Java.

histogram.name: CachedImageFetcher.ImageLoadFromNativeTimeJava
histogram.summary: The time it takes for cached_image_fetcher to load an image from native code. Only recorded on successful loads.

histogram.name: CachedImageFetcher.ImageLoadFromNetworkAfterCacheHit
histogram.summary: The time it takes for cached_image_fetcher to load an image from the network after a cache hit.

histogram.name: CachedImageFetcher.ImageLoadFromNetworkTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes for cached_image_fetcher to load an image from the network.

histogram.name: CachedImageFetcher.LoadImageMetadata
histogram.summary: The time it takes to load an image's metadata from the metadata store.

histogram.name: CachedImageFetcher.TimeSinceLastCacheLRUEviction
histogram.summary: The time since the last LRU eviction from the image cache. Recorded when two LRU evictions occur within closure proximity to one another. Will be used to determine if LRU eviction is happening too frequently.

histogram.name: Canvas.ContextType
histogram.summary: Records the context type names used to create canvas rendering contexts.

histogram.name: Canvas.CreateImageBitmapSource
histogram.summary: The source from which an ImageBitmap is created by a createImageBitmap call.

histogram.name: Canvas.DisplayListFallbackReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017 with removal of Display List Canvas 2D mode.
histogram.summary: The reasons why a canvas initially set to display list mode had to fall back to direct rasterization mode.

histogram.name: Canvas.GPUAccelerated2DCanvasDisableDeferralReason
histogram.summary: The reasons why a GPU accelerated canvas stopped deferring its rendering operations.

histogram.name: Canvas.HibernationEvents
histogram.summary: Records the occurrence of events related to 2D canvas GPU resource hibernation.

histogram.name: Canvas.Offscreen.CommitType
histogram.summary: The type of code path that OffscreenCanvas's commit API goes through.

histogram.name: Canvas.Repaint.Bounds.Percentage
histogram.obsolete: The experiment finishes and removed in 03/2020
histogram.summary: measure the percentage of Canvas is dirty before each repaint by using cc::Rect. Note that we record this metrics for all canvas that has an area of more than 65k pixel^2 (256x256).

histogram.name: Canvas.Repaint.Region.Percentage
histogram.obsolete: The experiment finishes and removed in 03/2020
histogram.summary: measure the percentage of Canvas is dirty before each repaint by using cc::Region. Note that we record this metrics for all canvas that has an area of more than 65k pixel^2 (256x256).

histogram.name: Canvas.RequestedImageMimeTypes
histogram.summary: Records the occurence of image file formats passed into toDataURL and toBlob functions in canvas.

histogram.name: Canvas.TextMetrics.MeasureText
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/08, this metrics doesn't reflect the measurement speed because it is dependent on the length of text.
histogram.summary:
Time spent in microseconds to perform calls to measure TextMetrics for Canvas2d. It's measured each time TextMetrics is called.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CAPSUpdater.Step
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 with removal of Chrome Crash Service component.
histogram.summary: Tracks the component updater steps for the Chrome Crash Service.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Notification.Status
histogram.summary: Count of displayed and not displayed due to errors notifications about captive portal.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Notification.UserAction
histogram.summary: Count of clicked, closed and ignored captive portal notifications.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DetectionDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the captive portal detection process for a particular network at OOBE. Detection duration is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DetectionResult
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts performed at OOBE. Detection result is recorded when portal detection is completed for an active network and when it differs from the previous result for the same network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.DiscrepancyWithShill
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts at OOBE if it diverges from network manager results. Detection result is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.OOBE.PortalToOnlineTransition
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between consecutive reports for the same network about portal and online states.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.RedirectTime
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds between start of request to gstatic.com/generate_204 and receipt of response with redirect to captive portal login page.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DetectionDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the captive portal detection process for a particular network in user session. Detection duration is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DetectionResult
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts performed in user session. Detection result is recorded when portal detection is completed for an active network and when it differs from the previous result for the same network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.DiscrepancyWithShill
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts in session if it diverges from network manager results. Detection result is recorded each time portal detection is completed for an active network.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.PortalToOnlineTransition
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between consecutive reports for the same network about portal and online states.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.SecureConnectionFailed
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts performed in user session. Detection result is recorded when portal detection is completed for a failed secure connection.

histogram.name: CaptivePortal.Session.TimeoutDetectionResult
histogram.summary: The result of captive portal detection attempts performed in user session. Detection result is recorded when portal detection is completed for a request which timed out or hadn't yet replied within eight seconds.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastButtonShown
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the cast button was shown to the user. The value will be true if the button is enabled, and false if the button is disabled. Note that depending on the current UX, it's possible that we hide the button entirely if it's disabled, so it's possible for the false values to be 0.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastButtonShownInitialFullscreen
histogram.summary: Records the number of times the cast button was shown to the user when the video is fullscreened. The value will only be recorded on entering fullscreen. The value will be true if the button is enabled, and false if the button is disabled. Note that depending on the current UX,it's possible that we hide the button entirely if it's disabled, so it's possible for the false values to be 0.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.CastPlaySuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result of a request to play remotely. The value will be true if the playback succeeded, and false if there was an error.

histogram.name: Cast.Sender.Overlay
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2017 in favor of Media.Controls.CTR.CastOverlayButton.
histogram.summary: Records events and user interactions related to the Cast overlay shown on video elements.

histogram.name: CertificateType
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2013. This histogram only considered the leaf certificate expiry date as a proxy for whether a certificate was in-scope for the BRs, but did not consider the issuance date. As some CAs have issued long-lived certs prior to the BRs, this disproportionately reported those certs as being subject to the BRs, but non-compliant, when in reality they're not subject.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Information about the certificate algorithms and sizes in use on the web, to examine compliance with the CA/Browser Forum requirements and security best practice.
