histogram.summary: The amount of time used to collect printer capabilities.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityDisconnectTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time the utility process runs before disconnect.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityMetafileFailTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to fail to generate metafile.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilityMetafileTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to generate metafile.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilitySemanticCapsFailTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to fail to collect printer capabilities.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.ServiceUtilitySemanticCapsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time used to collect printer capabilities.

histogram.name: CloudPrint.XmppTimeout
histogram.summary: Xmpp timeout option value provided by server.

histogram.name: CompositeDocToPdf.Status
histogram.summary: Tracks the status of PDF document composition and generation conducted in PDF compositor service.

histogram.name: CompositePageToPdf.Status
histogram.summary: Tracks the status of PDF page composition and generation conducted in PDF compositor service.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.CachedImagesCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2019 because it no longer reports. To be superseded by a measurement related to percentage of cache/discardable memory used by image caching.
histogram.summary: The maximum number of images that were cached in the browser over the lifetime of the image decode cache. This is recorded at the image cache destruction. It is further split up by Software and Gpu rasterization.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.CompositorFrame.Quads
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019 because the research it was used for is complete.
histogram.summary: The total number of quads in all render passes in a CompositorFrame. This is logged as the CompositorFrame is submitted to its surface.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2016. See Blink.Paint.UpdateTime as a related alternate metric.
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when display list recording source is updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2016. See Blink.Paint.UpdateTime as a related alternate metric.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a display list, in microseconds. Recorded when display list is updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.DrawResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. This metric didn't end up being useful.
histogram.summary: How often the layer compositor successfully submitted content to the display compositor, or what caused an abort. This is reported fairly late in the pipeline, during the final stages of submitting content.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.PictureMemoryUsageKb
histogram.obsolete: Has not produced data for over a year prior to removal in 03/2020.
histogram.summary: Total estimated memory used by SkPictures in the layer tree, in kilobytes. Recorded once per frame, before the frame is drawn (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.PicturePile.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.PicturePile.UpdateUs
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a picture pile, in microseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated (in a browser process).
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016. Increased the max tracking range to accomendate GPU raster, and will require new baskets.
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs2
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes (in a browser process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RasterTask.RasterUs
histogram.summary:
Time spent completing a compositor rasterization task, in microseconds. Recorded after the task finishes (in a browser process).
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTilesNoImageContent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2016. We'd learned as much as we could from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of missing tiles that had some image content in the browser process.

histogram.name: Compositing.Browser.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTilesSomeImageContent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2016. We'd learned as much as we could from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of missing tiles that did not have any image content in the browser process.

histogram.name: Compositing.CompositorFrameSinkSupport.SubmitResult
histogram.summary: The result of submitting a CompositorFrame to a CompositorFrameSink. ACCEPTED means the frame was accepted by the CompositorFrameSink. COPY_OUTPUT_REQUESTS_NOT_ALLOWED means an unprivileged client attempted to readback a texture. SURFACE_INVARIANTS_VIOLATION means size or device scale factor changed but a new viz::LocalSurfaceId was not allocated.

histogram.name: Compositing.CopyFromSurfaceTimeSynchronous
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time taken for the sync readback of pixels is measured here.

histogram.name: Compositing.Display.Draw.Occlusion.Drawing.Area.Saved
histogram.summary: It records the total drawing area skipped to show on screen as a result of applying draw occlusion. This is logged once per frame, when the frame is drawn.

histogram.name: Compositing.Display.Draw.Quads
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019 because the research it was used for is complete.
histogram.summary: This is logged once per frame, when the frame is drawn. The total number of quads in all render passes in the CompositorFrame that is produced by surface aggregation.

histogram.name: Compositing.Display.Draw.Quads.With.Complex.Transform.Area
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2018. We'd learned enough from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: This is logged once per frame, when the frame is drawn. Captures area of all draw quads that need to go through no scale and no translation transforms.

histogram.name: Compositing.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when display list recording source is updated.

histogram.name: Compositing.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a display list, in microseconds. Recorded when display list is updated.

histogram.name: Compositing.LayerTreeImpl.FindClosestMatchingLayerUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2017 in Issue 710306. Histogram was used temporarily for tracking a potential performance regression.
histogram.summary: Time spent finding the closest matching layer to a given point, in microseconds. Recorded each time we do hit testing on LayerTreeImpl.

histogram.name: Compositing.MainFrameSynchronization.Duration
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took for a main frame with unresolved dependencies to activate. Note that some activations may be triggered due to a deadline hitting.

histogram.name: Compositing.NumActiveLayers
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: The number of layers in the active tree for each compositor frame. This is logged once per frame, before the frame is drawn.

histogram.name: Compositing.PictureMemoryUsageKb
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Total estimated memory used by SkPictures in the layer tree, in kilobytes. Recorded once per frame, before the frame is drawn.

histogram.name: Compositing.PicturePile.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated.

histogram.name: Compositing.PicturePile.UpdateUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a picture pile, in microseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated.

histogram.name: Compositing.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes.

histogram.name: Compositing.RasterTask.RasterUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2015, replaced by similar metrics under Compositing.Renderer and Compositing.Browser, depending on which process it occurs in.
histogram.summary: Time spent completing a compositor rasterization task, in microseconds. Recorded after the task finishes.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.CachedImagesCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2019 because it no longer reports. To be superseded by a measurement related to percentage of cache/discardable memory used by image caching.
histogram.summary: The maximum number of images that were cached in the renderer over the lifetime of the image decode cache. This is recorded at the image cache destruction. It is further split up by Software and Gpu rasterization.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.CheckerImagingDecision
histogram.summary: The outcome for whether an image could be sucessfully deferred for asynchronous decode in the renderer compositor. If not, the reason for using a synchronous decode. An image which is decoded asynchronously will be checkerboarded on the rasterized tiles until the decode is finished, as opposed to synchronous decodes where the tile rasterization is blocked on the image decode completing.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.CompositorFrame.Quads
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019 because the research it was used for is complete.
histogram.summary: The total number of quads in all render passes in a CompositorFrame. This is logged as the CompositorFrame is submitted to its surface.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DirectlyCompositedImage.AvoidRasterAdjustmentWithTransformTrigger
histogram.obsolete: Removed September 2020 because the research it was used for is complete.
histogram.summary: Records instances of directly composited images that did not need to recalculate raster scale in response to scale changes. The boolean value indicates whether will-change:transform is set or a scale transforms is animating. This metric will be used to determine the impact on raster CPU usage if we were to scope the directly composited images feature.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DirectlyCompositedImage.RasterScaleDirectlyComposited
histogram.obsolete: Removed September 2020 because the research it was used for is complete.
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a PictureLayerImpl that has a single drawImage paint operation is able to apply directly composited image optimization. See PictureLayerImpl::ShouldDirectlyCompositeImage for more details.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DirectlyCompositedImage.TileAreaAdded
histogram.obsolete: Removed September 2020 because the research it was used for is complete.
histogram.summary: Records the number of tile pixels added when directly composited image is applied to a layer. If the raster scale is greater than it otherwise would be, the difference in pixels used for tiling the layer is logged in this histogram.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DirectlyCompositedImage.TileAreaMatches
histogram.obsolete: Removed September 2020 because the research it was used for is complete.
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the chosen raster scale for a directly composited image matches the ideal raster scale. In cases where the scale does not match (i.e. false values for this histogram), either TileAreaAdded or TileAreaSaved will be logged to provide an indication on the effects on memory usage.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DirectlyCompositedImage.TileAreaSaved
histogram.obsolete: Removed September 2020 because the research it was used for is complete.
histogram.summary: Records the number of tile pixels saved when directly composited image is applied to a layer. If the raster scale is lower than it otherwise would be, the difference in pixels used for tiling the layer is logged in this histogram.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2016. See Blink.Paint.UpdateTime as a related alternate metric.
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when display list recording source is updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DisplayListRecordingSource.UpdateUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2016. See Blink.Paint.UpdateTime as a related alternate metric.
histogram.summary: Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a display list, in microseconds. Recorded when display list is updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.DrawResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. This metric didn't end up being useful.
histogram.summary: How often the layer compositor successfully submitted content to the display compositor, or what caused an abort. This is reported fairly late in the pipeline, during the final stages of submitting content.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.LCDTextEligiblePixelPercentage
histogram.summary: Records the percentage of approximate number of pixels covered by text drawing operations that are LCD-text eligible, in that of all text drawing operations. This is recorded when the renderer is idle, at minimum interval of the longer of 1 minute and 500 begin frames for each local frame tree. Note that LCD-text eligible text may rasterize in non-LCD-text mode when e.g. LCD-text is not supported by the font or LCD-text doesn't appreciably improve quality.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.PercentPictureLayersWithTextButLCDTextDisabled
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 03/2020 because changes in the data are difficult to reason about as the number of layers also tends to change at the same time.
histogram.summary: The number of PictureLayers in the active tree for each compositor frame that have both text drawing operations and do not permit lcd text. This is logged once per frame, before the frame is drawn (in a renderer process). Suffixed with the count of number of picture layers with text.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.PictureMemoryUsageKb
histogram.obsolete: Removal in 03/2020 because it is not very useful.
histogram.summary: Total estimated memory used by SkPictures in the layer tree, in kilobytes. Recorded once per frame, before the frame is drawn (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.PicturePile.UpdateInvalidatedAreaPerMs
histogram.summary: Area of invalidated content, in pixels, divided by update (i.e. record), in milliseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.PicturePile.UpdateUs
histogram.summary:
Time spent updating (i.e. recording) a picture pile, in microseconds. Recorded when picture pile is updated (in a renderer process).
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016. Increased the max tracking range to accomendate GPU raster, and will require new baskets.
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RasterTask.RasterPixelsPerMs2
histogram.summary: Rasterized area, in pixels, divided by rasterization time, in milliseconds, of a compositor rasterization task. Recorded after the task finishes (in a renderer process).

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RasterTask.RasterUs
histogram.summary:
Time spent completing a compositor rasterization task, in microseconds. Recorded after the task finishes (in a renderer process).
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTilesNoImageContent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2016. We'd learned as much as we could from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of missing tiles that had some image content in the renderer process.

histogram.name: Compositing.Renderer.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.NumMissingTilesSomeImageContent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2016. We'd learned as much as we could from this metric and it made no sense to keep it around.
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of missing tiles that did not have any image content in the renderer process.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.MaskLayerPercent
histogram.obsolete: Removed as being no longer useful to track.
histogram.summary: Percent of layers drawn that frame that are mask layers. A sample is recorded on the first draw per commit.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.RCMaskArea
histogram.obsolete: Removed as being no longer useful to track.
histogram.summary: Total visible area of layers drawn that frame that are mask layers and also are simple rounded corner masks. A sample is recorded on the first draw per commit.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.RCMaskAreaPercent
histogram.obsolete: Removed as being no longer useful to track.
histogram.summary: Percent of visible area of layers drawn that frame that are mask layers and also are simple rounded corner masks. A sample is recorded on the first draw per commit.

histogram.name: Compositing.RenderPass.AppendQuadData.RCMaskLayerPercent
histogram.obsolete: Removed as being no longer useful to track.
histogram.summary: Percent of layers drawn that frame that are mask layers and also are simple rounded corner masks. A sample is recorded on the first draw per commit.

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.LatestInFlightSurface.ManhattanDistanceToPrimary
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. This metric didn't end up being useful.
histogram.summary: The distance between the latest inflight surface and the primary surface. This is logged for each call to HandleSurfaceQuad().

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.SurfaceDrawQuad.MissingSurface
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2018 in issue 865597 in order to avoid spurious error messages on Viz process crash.
histogram.summary: The number of SurfaceDrawQuads where the surface doesn't exist. This is logged for each call to Aggregate().

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.SurfaceDrawQuad.NoActiveFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2018 in issue 865597 in order to avoid spurious error messages on Viz process crash.
histogram.summary: The number of SurfaceDrawQuads where the surface exists but doesn't have an active CompositorFrame. This is logged for each call to Aggregate().

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.SurfaceDrawQuad.UsingFallbackSurface
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. This metric didn't end up being useful.
histogram.summary: The number of SurfaceDrawQuads where the primary SurfaceId does not have a corresponding active CompositorFrame and so the fallback surface is used instead. This is logged for each call to Aggregate().

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceAggregator.SurfaceDrawQuad.ValidSurface
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. This metric didn't end up being useful.
histogram.summary: The number of SurfaceDrawQuads where the surface exists and has an active CompositorFrame. This is logged for each call to Aggregate().

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceDependencyDeadline.DeadlineHit
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2018. This metric didn't end up being useful.
histogram.summary: Tracks whether an activation of a surface was due to due to a deadline or the resolution of dependencies.

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceInvariantsViolations
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2018/09/10 in favor of Compositing.CompositorFrameSinkSupport.SubmitResult.
histogram.summary: The number of times a renderer in this browser session has violated a surface synchronization invariant. This manifests as a skipped frame. Ideally this metric should always report 0, but realistically there are races in the system and this tracks the frequency that we hit these races.

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceManager.NumOldTemporaryReferences
histogram.summary: The number of temporary references that have existed for at least 10 seconds and are most likely orphaned. This is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceManager.RemovedTemporaryReference
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason for removing a temporary reference.

histogram.name: Compositing.SurfaceManager.TemporaryReferences
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of temporary references after each garbage collection operation.

histogram.name: CompositorImplAndroid.TearDownDisplayTime
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete after 03/2019. For temporary debugging of CompositorImpl hangs.
histogram.summary: Tracks the amount of time it takes to synchronously tear down the display when the CompositorImpl becomes invisible or is destroyed. Recorded after display teardown completes in CompositorImpl:: TearDownDisplayAndUnregisterRootFrameSink.

histogram.name: CompositorLatency.MissedFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 01/2020. MissedFrame changed to DroppedFrame for more clarity.
histogram.summary:
Tracks the duration of various stages in the pipeline as a single frame goes through the various stages in the compositor. This is reported for frames that the user did not see: this includes frames that are dropped in various stages inside chromium, or even frames that went through all stages in chromium, but ultimately was not presented to the user.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: CompositorLatency.MissedFrameLatencyIncrease
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 9/2019. Did not provide enough information about latency.
histogram.summary:
The latency increase of an abnormally long activation stage on the multithread thread compositor pipeline when the frame is missed.
These latency increases are determined by comparing the stage duration to the times from past non-missed frames. These times are also reported to "CompositorLatency.MissedFrame.<StageName>"

histogram.name: ConnectivityDetector.FromSystem
histogram.summary: Whether or not the network connectivity info, i.e. validated, is provided by the system. We will use it if it is available from the system. Otherwise, we will do our own http probes to find it out. This UMA will not be recorded if a flag in about:flags is set to bypass this logic to always favor the check by http probes.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDetector.Probe.HttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The HTTP response code returned from a HTTP probe for the purpose of checking network connectivity.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDetector.Probe.Result
histogram.summary: The result from a HTTP probe for the purpose of checking network connectivity.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDetector.Probe.ValidationTime
histogram.summary: The total duration measuring all the HTTP probes and backoff time taken when the network connectivity is successfully validated.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDetector.Probe.ValidationUrl
histogram.summary: Records type of url, default or fallback URL, resulting in successful connectivity validation.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.HTTP_LATENCY
histogram.summary:
HTTP latency seen by the Connectivity Diagnostics.
HTTP latency is computed using the chrome.socket API to make an HTTP GET request to the /generate_204 page of three randomly generated Google hostnames (*-ccd-testing-v4.metric.gstatic.com). The time taken from issuing the HTTP request to receiving a response is clocked in JavaScript and the arithmetic mean of the three times is used as the HTTP latency.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.TestVerdict
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: Outcome of the connectivity tests.

histogram.name: ConnectivityDiagnostics.TimeTaken
histogram.summary: Connectivity Diagnostics App: Amount of time taken to run each of the connectivity tests.

histogram.name: ContentCapture.CaptureOneContentTime
histogram.summary: The estimated time taken to capture one on-screen content.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultHandlersSetting
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2014 since it is not referenced anywhere in the code.
histogram.summary: The default handler setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultKeygenSetting
histogram.summary: The default setting for using key generation in forms at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultMediaStreamSetting
histogram.obsolete: This setting was deprecated in r322364 and replaced with separate settings for camera and microphone. See ContentSettings.DefaultMediaStreamCameraSetting and ContentSettings.DefaultMediaStreamMicSetting.
histogram.summary: The default MediaStream setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultMouseCursorSetting
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-07-07. This histogram is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: The default mouse cursor setting at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.DefaultPushMessagingSetting
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-07-07. This histogram is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: The default permission setting for push messages at profile open.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.LastSettingParsed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-10-05 in Issue 433475. Histogram was used temorarily for diagnosing crash causes.
histogram.summary: Numer of results of parsing WebsiteSettingsHandler::last_setting_ success or failure in WebsiteSettingsHandler methods.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.MixedScript
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-01-06. Histogram had already expired and metrics are no longer required after the mixed content shield removal.
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the mixed content shield was shown, and how the user interacted with it.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.NumberOfAllowCookiesExceptions
histogram.obsolete: Removed Oct 2018 in favor of ContentSettings.Exceptions.cookies.Allow
histogram.summary: The number of user defined cookies setting exceptions for allowing cookies at browser start.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.NumberOfBlockCookiesExceptions
histogram.obsolete: Removed Oct 2018 in favor of ContentSettings.Exceptions.cookies.Block
histogram.summary: The number of user defined cookies setting exceptions for blocking cookies at browser start.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.NumberOfSessionOnlyCookiesExceptions
histogram.summary: The number of user defined cookies setting exceptions for 'clearing cookies on browser exit' at browser start.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionActions
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionActionsInsecureOrigin
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc on an insecure origin. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.PermissionActionsSecureOrigin
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc on a secure origin. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.Popups.FirstDocumentEngagementTime
histogram.summary: Measures the total duration a popup WebContents is visible / foregrounded for the duration of its first document load. This time is measured from the first navigation commit to the time either the WebContents is destroyed or when a new navigation commits.

histogram.name: ContentSettings.Popups.StrongBlockerActivationPosition
histogram.summary: For pages that trigger Safe Browsing triggered popup blocker (in warn or enforce modes), records the position in the redirect chain for the page the activation was triggered by. If SubresourceFilterConsiderRedirects is disabled, then always returns "Only navigation".

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.AppLifecycleEvents
histogram.summary: Android: count of app lifecycle events reported to the Feed library. Recorded as these events occur; e.g. when Chrome is foregrounded, backgrounded, or the user clears cached browsing data.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.Image.FetchResult
histogram.summary: Android: Represents success/failure of Feed image loading. Recorded upon each individual image retrieved from the feed_image_cache. Feed v1 only.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.Image.LoadFromCacheTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes for Feed to load an image from the cache.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.Image.LoadFromNetworkTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes for Feed to load an image from the network.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.InitialSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks the Feed storage success rate during initial storage.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.LoadKeysSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks the Feed storage success rate during load keys.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.LoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks the Feed storage success rate during load entries.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.ManageInterestsOpened
histogram.obsolete: This implementation is incorrect and we are now using NewTabPage.ActionAndroid2 instead. Marked obsolete in 01-2020
histogram.summary: The position of a card in the feed from which the user has opened the Manage Interests page. Recorded when the Manage Interest item is clicked in the card menu.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.NetworkRequestStatusCode
histogram.summary: Android: The integer status code of network requests made by the feed library's networking host. This code includes both protocol(1xx-5xx) and non-protocol(-xxx) errors. Recorded when a request completes.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.OperationCommitSuccess
histogram.summary: Tracks the Feed storage success rate during commit operations.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.RequestSizeKB.Compressed
histogram.summary: Android: the size in kb of gzip-compressed requests sent by the Feed's networking host. Recorded when a request is sent.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.ResponseSizeKB
histogram.summary: Android: the uncompressed size in KB of responses received by the Feed's networking host. Recorded when a successful response is received.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.TokenCompleted.ContentCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of ContentSuggestions.Feed.TokenCompleted.ContentCount2. Removed 03/2019. http://crbug.com/943838
histogram.summary: How many top level features were in the continuation response, typically clusters. Recorded when the fetch completes successfully.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.Feed.TokenFetchStatus
histogram.summary: Android: failure reason when attempting to fetch an OAuth token for the feed. Recorded when an artcile fetch completes.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.FetchPendingPlaceholder.VisibleDuration
histogram.summary: Android: How long the content suggestion placeholder is shown. This is tracked based on when the placeholder is enabled in the UI, not how long it is actually visible on screen. Depending on the screen size, the used value could be bigger.

histogram.name: ContentSuggestions.FetchPendingSpinner.VisibleDuration
histogram.summary: Android: How long the content suggestion loading spinner is shown. This is tracked based on when the spinner is enabled in the UI, not how long it is actually visible on screen. Depending on the screen size, the used value could be bigger.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.DOMElementFetchDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019. iFrame Context Menu feature shipped.
histogram.summary: How long it takes to fetch the details of the DOM element the user is selecting for the context menu. On iOS, JavaScript must be run in order to get the details of the DOM element. If the element is not inside the main frame, latency could be added due to the communication between frames. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.SelectedOption
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code as of 5/2019. WARNING: The code emitting this histogram was broken on desktop, and logged many items that should not have been logged at all into bucket 0. The values for bucket 0 are wrong and should not be relied upon. The replacements are ContextMenu.SelectedOptionDesktop, ContextMenu.SelectedOptionAndroid, and ContextMenu.SelectedOptionIOS.
histogram.summary: The option that the user selected from a context menu. This mis-logged and thus was removed.

histogram.name: ContextMenu.UnexpectedFindElementResultHandlerMessage
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019. iFrame Context Menu feature shipped.
histogram.summary: Logged when an unexpected FindElementResultHandler message was received by the application. An unexpected message may be sent by a malicious frame. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.EnabledState
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: Whether contextual suggestions are enabled. Recorded when the enabled state changes. Note that this may be recorded multiple times per session.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.Events
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Records each event handled by the Contextual Suggestions backend. Recorded when the event is sent to the backend, typically when a UI or network action is registered. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.FetchErrorCode
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: The net::Error status code of contextual suggestion fetches. Recorded when a fetch completes.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.FetchLatencyMilliseconds
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: the amount of time taken elapsed between a contextual suggestion fetch starting and ending. Recorded when a fetch is completed.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.FetchRequestProtoSizeKB
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: The size of the serialized and base64-encoded proto sent to the server when fetching contextual suggestions. Recorded when a fetch is

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.FetchResponseCode
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: The http status code of contextual suggestion fetches. Recorded when a fetch completes.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.FetchResponseNetworkBytes
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M75
histogram.summary: Android: The number of bytes in the response received when a contextual suggestions fetch completes. Recorded when the response is received.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.FetchResponseSizeKB
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: The size of the response body received when a contextual suggestions fetch completes. Recorded when the response is received.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.PageViewClickLength
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: The length of a visit on a page. Reported for HTTP and HTTPS pages provided there was something visible printed to the screen. Selecting a tab or loading a new URL in current tab starts timing a visit. Switching to a different tab, closing the tab or loading a new URL finishes timing and reports the time if the page did a visually non-empty paint or finished loading. Bucketed by short/medium/long.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.PageViewTime
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: The length of a visit on a page. Reported for HTTP and HTTPS pages provided there was something visible printed to the screen. Selecting a tab or loading a new URL in current tab starts timing a visit. Switching to a different tab, closing the tab or loading a new URL finishes timing and reports the time if the page did a visually non-empty paint or finished loading.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.Preference.State
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: Whether the user preference for contextual suggestions is enabled. Recorded on cold start and when the user has changed the preference state. Note that this may be recorded multiple times per session.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.ResultsReturnedInOverviewMode
histogram.summary: Android: Whether the contextual suggestions results are returned to the UI-layer while the user is in overview mode.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.SuggestionClickPosition.Cluster
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the clicked contextual suggestion card within its cluster.

histogram.name: ContextualSuggestions.SuggestionClickPosition.Global
histogram.obsolete: This feature was deprecated in M74
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the clicked contextual suggestion card within the entire list of suggestions.

histogram.name: Cookie.BetweenAccessIntervalMinutes
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Intervals between access time updates for each cookie.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookieDeleteEquivalent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-10-23 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/993120).
histogram.summary: Record when at attempt is made to delete an equivalent cookie on a set cookie operation and when such a cookie is found and deleted. Also measure when strict secure cookie rules affect this outcome and prevent a cookie from being deleted.

histogram.name: Cookie.CookieLineCookieValueValidity
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-07-14 as it demonstrated that making cookie parsing rules stricter was not feasible. See https://crbug.com/638117.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie initialised from a Set-Cookie header value was valid or not. This is only logged after cookies containing control characters have already been rejected, so "Invalid" here means that the cookie contains quotes, commas, backslashes or top-bit-set characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.DBSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size, on disk, of the cookie database as it is being loaded.

histogram.name: Cookie.DeletionCause
histogram.obsolete: Removed Jul 2017 for lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each cookie removed from the store, the reason it was removed.

histogram.name: Cookie.DomainCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each domain, number of cookies in that domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: Cookie.DomainPerEtldp1Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For every top level domain, number of subdomains in that top level domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: Cookie.Etldp1Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For every top level domain, number of cookies in that domain (recorded every 10 minutes of active browsing time).

histogram.name: Cookie.EvictedLastAccessMinutes
histogram.obsolete: Removed Jul 2017 for lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each evicted (not expired) cookie, the amount of time since it was last used

histogram.name: Cookie.GetCookieListCompletionTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed Feb 2019 as further data collection is no longer necessary.
histogram.summary: The length of time between when the network stack receives a request for a cookie list and when it actually responds to the request or abandons it (for e.g. a closed renderer).

histogram.name: Cookie.LaxAllowUnsafeCookieIncludedAge
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2020. No longer needed because results are expected to be stable.
histogram.summary: The age in milliseconds of a cookie that activates the Lax-allow-unsafe intervention. Emitted whenever a cookie is included in a request with an unsafe HTTP method, where the cookie has an unspecified SameSite attribute and is only included because it is new enough to fall under the age threshold for allowing Lax-allow-unsafe.

histogram.name: Cookie.NetworkSecurity
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-10-31 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/993120).
histogram.summary: Degree of protection against cookie theft. Recorded for each cookie when setting the `Cookie` header for a request.

histogram.name: Cookie.NumberOfLoadedCookies
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-07-03. Cookie.Count measures similar things with different timing.
histogram.summary: This histogram records the total number of cookies loaded from disk, including any cookies that are discarded during loading (for whatever reason).

histogram.name: Cookie.ParsedCookieStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When parsing a cookie, indicates if control characters were present in any of the cookie values and if any of the cookie values were invalid. Specifically, checks that all of the parsed values are valid according to the valid token definition in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.ReinstatedCookies
histogram.summary: The duration in seconds between a cookie getting evicted (due to the number of cookies exceeding a domain limit), and subsequently reinstated.

histogram.name: Cookie.SameSiteDifferentSchemeRequest
histogram.obsolete: Removed Apr 2020 as this metric doesn't capture the correct information. https://crbug.com/1066231
histogram.summary: The value of the SameSiteCookieContext if a Lax or Strict cookie is being sent http-to-https or https-to-http for the site-for-cookies to the request. Logged once per cookie sent with the above conditions.

histogram.name: Cookie.SameSiteDifferentSchemeResponse
histogram.obsolete: Removed Apr 2020 as this metric doesn't capture the correct information. https://crbug.com/1066231
histogram.summary: The value of the SameSiteCookieContext if a Lax or Strict cookie is being set http-to-https or https-to-http for the site-for-cookies from the response. Logged once per cookie sent with the above conditions.

histogram.name: Cookie.SameSiteUnspecifiedTooOldToAllowUnsafe
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2020. No longer needed because results are expected to be stable.
histogram.summary: The age in milliseconds of a cookie that would have activated the Lax-allow-unsafe intervention except for the fact that it is too old. Emitted whenever a cookie is excluded from being sent on a request with an unsafe method, where the cookie has an unspecified SameSite attribute and is too old to fall under the age threshold to allow Lax-allow-unsafe.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetAttributePairCharsValidity
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie attribute pair was set with both a valid key and a valid attribute value or not. For the key, this implies that it was a valid token as defined in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters. For the value, this implies that it contained no control characters and no semicolon.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetNameValidity
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie name was set with a valid token. A valid token is defined in Section 2.2 of RFC2616 which specifies a token must have no separators (i.e. no characters from the following string, ignoring the starting and ending single quote: '()<>@,;:\"/[]?={} \t') and no control characters.

histogram.name: Cookie.SetValueCookieValueValidity
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2013. Experiment to measure control characters in cookies is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether a cookie value was valid or invalid when there was an attempt to set it, where a valid value is defined in RFC 6265 as ASCII characters excluding controls, whitspace, comma, semicolon, and backslash.

histogram.name: Cookie.Shutdown.NumberOfCookiesDeleted
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2015. The associated experiment was flawed.
histogram.summary: The number of session cookies deleted on shutdown. This metric is emitted even if no cookies are deleted.

histogram.name: Cookie.Shutdown.TimeSpentDeletingCookies
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2015. The associated experiment was flawed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time required to delete session cookies on shutdown. This metric is emitted even if no cookies are deleted.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV5
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2015. The migration has finished for most users.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v4 database to v5.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV6
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2015. The migration has finished for most users.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v5 database to v6.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV7
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2015. The migration has finished for most users.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v6 database to v7.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeDatabaseMigrationToV8
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2015. The migration has finished for most users.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to migrate a v7 database to v8.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeGet
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to get cookies for each URL request.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeInitializeDomainMap
histogram.obsolete: Removed as part of histogram expiry. See discussion in crbug.com/975202.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to read and parse the domain map from the cookies database.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeLoadDomains
histogram.obsolete: Removed as part of histogram expiry. See discussion in crbug.com/975202.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to read the domain map from the cookies database.

histogram.name: Cookie.TimeParseDomains
histogram.obsolete: Removed as part of histogram expiry. See discussion in crbug.com/975202.
histogram.summary: The amount of time (ms) to parse the domains already loaded from the cookies database and put them in the domain map.

histogram.name: Cookie{Age}{CookieConnectionType}{CookieSiteAffinity}
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-10-31 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/993120).

histogram.name: CrashReport.BreakpadCrashDumpOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2016 as CrashPad does not implement this.
histogram.summary: Reports the result of an attempt to report a crash dump via Breakpad. Success indicates only that the out-of-process crash reporter succesfully generated a dump. The success or failure of the eventual upload is not measured. This stability metric is logged from the first Chrome launch post-dump.

histogram.name: CrashReport.BreakpadDumpWithoutCrashOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2016 as CrashPad does not implement this.
histogram.summary: Reports the result of an attempt to report a dump via Breakpad without crashing. Success indicates only that the out-of-process crash reporter succesfully generated a dump. The success or failure of the eventual upload is not measured. This stability metric is logged from the first Chrome launch post-dump.

histogram.name: CrashReport.CrashBackgroundUploadDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 03/2018 when Chrome for iOS stopped uploading crash dumps in the background.
histogram.summary: Time delta between when the crash took place and when the crash was uploaded by the app as a background task. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: CrashReport.DumpWithoutCrashingHandler.FromInitSharedMemoryIfNeeded
histogram.summary: Which crash handler (Breakpad or Crashpad) is handling ProducerClient::InitSharedMemoryIfNeeded()'s attempt to do a DumpWithoutCrashing. Investigating why Breakpad never seems to generate InitSharedMemoryIfNeeded reports on some ChromeOS devices.

histogram.name: CrashReport.DumpWithoutCrashingResult.FromInitSharedMemoryIfNeeded
histogram.summary: Did the attempt to dump without crashing in ProducerClient::InitSharedMemoryIfNeeded() succeed or fail? Investigating why Breakpad never seems to generate InitSharedMemoryIfNeeded reports on some ChromeOS devices.

histogram.name: CrashReport.DumpWithoutCrashingResult.FromInitSharedMemoryIfNeeded2
histogram.summary: Did the attempt to dump without crashing in ProducerClient::InitSharedMemoryIfNeeded() succeed or fail? Investigating why Breakpad never seems to generate InitSharedMemoryIfNeeded reports on some ChromeOS devices.

histogram.name: CrashReport.PendingReportsOnBackgroundWakeUp
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 03/2018 when Chrome for iOS stopped uploading crash dumps in the background.
histogram.summary: The number of crash reports present when the app wakes up as a background task to upload crash reports. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: CrashReport.PermanentUploadFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2017 in Issue 680162 with the removal of Kasko.
histogram.summary: Counts crash reports that the Kasko crash reporter fails to upload and hands off to Chrome. Kasko stores the failed reports in a location specified by Chrome. Chrome records this metric when it detects new minidump files in that location. Currently the reports are discarded, but they could eventually be uploaded via the Chrome network stack.

histogram.name: Cros.ClickOnShelf
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 12/2013. Default pinned apps trial is finished.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS shelf clicks.

histogram.name: Crostini.DiskImageSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 because it was never used.
histogram.summary: The maximum space allowed for a VM disk image, as set at install time. This is recorded each time a disk image is successfully created.

histogram.summary: Records the result of the async ClientAppMetadata retrieval needed for the device activity getter. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.summary: Records the result of the async ClientAppMetadata retrieval during the CryptAuth v2 DeviceSync flow. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.name: CryptAuth.DeviceSyncV2.DeviceNotifier.AsyncTaskResult.ClientAppMetadataFetch

histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-01-02 because metric was never used.
histogram.summary: Records the execution time of the async ShareGroupPrivateKey API call during the CryptAuth v2 DeviceSync flow. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.name: CryptAuth.DeviceSyncV2.FeatureStatusSetter.AsyncTaskResult.ClientAppMetadataFetch
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-07-29. ClientAppMetadata now fetched in DeviceSync service.
histogram.summary: Records the result of the async ClientAppMetadata retrieval for the CryptAuth feature status setter. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.name: CryptAuth.DeviceSyncV2.FeatureStatusSetter.ExecutionTime.ClientAppMetadataFetch
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-07-29. ClientAppMetadata now fetched in DeviceSync service.
histogram.summary: Records the execution time of the async ClientAppMetadata retrieval for the CryptAuth feature status setter. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.name: CryptAuth.EnrollmentV2.AsyncTaskResult.ClientAppMetadataFetch
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-07-29. ClientAppMetadata now fetched in DeviceSync service.
histogram.summary: Records the result of the async ClientAppMetadata retrieval during the CryptAuth v2 Enrollment flow. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-12-11 in favor of CryptAuth.EnrollmentV2.GcmRegistration.Success because the timeout was removed.
histogram.summary: Records the result of the async GCM registration call during the CryptAuth v2 Enrollment flow. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09-12 in favor of CryptAuth.EnrollmentV2.ExecutionTime.ClientAppMetadataFetch2 because too many results were reaching the max time limit.
histogram.summary: Records the execution time of the async ClientAppMetadata retrieval during the CryptAuth v2 Enrollment flow. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.name: CryptAuth.EnrollmentV2.ExecutionTime.ClientAppMetadataFetch2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-07-29. ClientAppMetadata now fetched in DeviceSync service.
histogram.summary: Records the execution time of the async ClientAppMetadata retrieval during the CryptAuth v2 Enrollment flow. Recorded when the async callback is invoked or when the call times out.

histogram.name: CryptAuth.EnrollmentV2.ExecutionTime.GcmRegistration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-12-11 in favor of CryptAuth.EnrollmentV2.GcmRegistration.AttemptTime because too many results were reaching the max time limit.
