histogram.name: Event.Latency.X11EventSource.UpdateServerTime
histogram.summary: Time to request a timestamp from the X server.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.CoalescedCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Number of continuous events (touchmove, mousemove, mousewheel) coalesced inside the main thread event queue per event. This field is recorded just before the event is processed on the main thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.Continuous.FreshnessTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Time between when a continuous event (touchmove, mousemove, mousewheel) was placed into the queue (or coalesced with another event) and when it was processed on the main thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.Continuous.QueueingTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Time between when a continuous event (touchmove, mousemove, mousewheel) was placed into the queue and when it was processed on the main thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.FlushQueueNoBeginMainFrame
histogram.summary:
Whether the Begin Main Frame was not received and the queue generated a flush queue after a given timeout.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.MainThreadEventQueue.NonContinuous.QueueingTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Time between when a non-continuous event (not touchmove, mousemove, mousewheel) was placed into the queue and when it was processed on the main thread.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveForcedEventDispatchCancelled
histogram.summary:
Counts the number of event listener invocations that were forced to be passive due to interventions and whether the invocation of the listener called prevent default or not.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatencyDueToFling.
histogram.summary: Time between when a forced non-blocking event was generated and the event processed. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing non-blocking events listeners.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatencyDueToFling
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touchstart or first touchmove event per scroll was generated and the event processed, for events which were forced non-blocking since they occurred during fling. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing events non-blocking during fling.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatencyDueToUnresponsiveMainThread
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2018 due to cancellation of experiment.
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touchstart or first touchmove event per scroll was generated and the event processed, for events which were forced non-blocking since they occurred while the main thread was unresponsive. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing events non-blocking when the main thread is unresponsive.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.PassiveListeners.Latency
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of M80 due to the lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Time between when a cancelable event was generated and the event processed yet no action was executed for the event. This histogram tracks the potential benefit of using passive events listeners.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Event.Pen.InputEventTimeStamp.DeltaBetweenTimeNowAndPerformanceCount.Negative
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 due to the completion of the experiment.
histogram.summary: On Windows, reports negative time delta between pointer input timestamps based on TimeNow and the timestamp reported via PointerInfo.PerformanceCount. This negative time delta is w.r.t to PerformanceCount. See also Pen.InputEventTimeStamp.DeltaBetweenTimeNowAndPerformanceCount.Positive.

histogram.name: Event.Pen.InputEventTimeStamp.DeltaBetweenTimeNowAndPerformanceCount.Positive
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 due to the completion of the experiment.
histogram.summary: On Windows, reports positive time delta between pointer input timestamps based on TimeNow and the timestamp reported via PointerInfo.PerformanceCount. This positive time delta is w.r.t to PerformanceCount. See also Pen.InputEventTimeStamp.DeltaBetweenTimeNowAndPerformanceCount.Negative.

histogram.name: Event.RenderView.DiscardInput
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Whether the input IPC messages were discarded before being fully processed in RenderView's IPC message handler.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Scroll.ScrollerSize.OnLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2017 due to the completion of the experiment.
histogram.summary:
Record the area of a scroller upon page load. This is intended to help us measure the distribution of scrollers with different sizes. Combined with the other two metrics which measure the size of scrollers on scroll, we may have a better idea of not compositing small scrollers.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org, animations-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Scroll.ScrollerSize.OnScroll
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2017 due to the completion of the experiment.
histogram.summary:
Record the area of a scroller upon ScrollBegin. This is intended to help us measure the frequencies of different sizes of scrollers getting scrolled. For those small scrollers that users may rarely scroll, there is no need to composite them even if we are able to do so.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org, animations-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Scroll.TouchGestureLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2019 due to no further need of data.
histogram.summary:
Time (ms) between the pointer down event and when a subsequent pointer move is recognized as a scroll.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org

histogram.name: Event.TimestampHasValidTimebase
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 1/2018 in issue 650338 (http://crbug.com/650338). Using a DCHECK instead.
histogram.summary:
Whether the timestamps on input events produced by the windowing system appear to be sharing the same time base as TimeTicks, modulo possible roll-over.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.InputEventTimeStamp.DeltaBetweenTimeNowAndPerformanceCount.Negative
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 due to the completion of the experiment.
histogram.summary: On Windows, reports negative time delta between pointer input timestamps based on TimeNow and the timestamp reported via PointerInfo.PerformanceCount. This negative time delta is w.r.t to PerformanceCount. See also Touch.InputEventTimeStamp.DeltaBetweenTimeNowAndPerformanceCount.Positive.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.InputEventTimeStamp.DeltaBetweenTimeNowAndPerformanceCount.Positive
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 due to the completion of the experiment.
histogram.summary: On Windows, reports positive time delta between pointer input timestamps based on TimeNow and the timestamp reported via PointerInfo.PerformanceCount. This positive time delta is w.r.t to PerformanceCount. See also Touch.InputEventTimeStamp.DeltaBetweenTimeNowAndPerformanceCount.Negative.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TargetAndDispatchResult
histogram.summary: An enumeration identifying 3 properties: 1) a classification of the event target whether it is a root scroll listener (window, document, body) or not; 2) the result of the dispatch; 3) whether the document was scrollable or not.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TargetAndDispatchResult2
histogram.summary:
An enumeration identifying 4 properties: 1) a classification of the current target whether it is a root scroll listener (window, document, body) or not; 2) the result of the dispatch or whether it was previously canceled 3) whether the document was scrollable or not 4) what phase the listener was encountered at. This metric is logged during the dispatch of the touch events. It will only be reported for main frame events that block scrolling, have only one touch point and current targets that fired an event listener at that phase.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchAdjustment.AdjustDistance
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019 due to no longer needed.
histogram.summary:
Records the euclidean distance in dips from a gesture event's original tap center to its adjusted touch point. 0 if not adjusted. This only records GestureTap events and GestureLongPress events.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchAdjustment.AdjustedNode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2018 due to no longer needed.
histogram.summary:
Records if doing touch adjustment on touchstart have same hit test node as doing touch adjustment on GestureTap. If not, record if one is descendant of the other. Others means neither of the nodes are descendant of the other. This only records GestureTap events.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchAdjustment.AdjustToSameNode
histogram.summary:
Records if doing touch adjustment on touchstart have same hit test node as doing touch adjustment on GestureTap. True for same node, false for different node. This only records GestureTap events.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsAfterPageLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll. Only recorded after the page is fully loaded.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsBeforePageLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll. Only recorded before the page is fully loaded.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsDuringFling
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsDuringFling2.
histogram.summary: Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart events. Only recorded while there is an active fling animation.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsDuringFling2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart and first touchmove events per scroll. Only recorded while there is an active fling animation.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsOutsideFling
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsOutsideFling2.
histogram.summary: Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart events. Only recorded while there is no active fling animation.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchDispositionsOutsideFling2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Records the disposition (handled or not handled) of touchstart and first touchmove events per scroll events. Only recorded while there is no active fling animation.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchLatencyAfterPageLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touch event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only for touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll that occur after the page is fully loaded.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchLatencyBeforePageLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touch event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only for touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll that occur before the page is fully loaded. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing passive event listeners before the page is fully loaded.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchLatencyOutsideFling
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
Time between when a touch event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only for touchstart events and the first touchmove events per scroll when there was no active fling animation.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchStartLatencyDuringFling
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.PassiveListeners.ForcedNonBlockingLatencyDueToFling.
histogram.summary: Time between when a touchstart event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only when there was an active fling animation. This histogram tracks the benefit of forcing passive event listeners during fling.

histogram.name: Event.Touch.TouchStartLatencyOutsideFling
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 in Issue 595327, and replaced by Event.Touch.TouchLatencyOutsideFling.
histogram.summary: Time between when a touchstart event was generated and the event was processed. Recorded only when there was no active fling animation.

histogram.name: Event.VizHitTest.AggregateTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2018. Replaced with Event.VizHitTest.AggregateTimeUs.
histogram.summary: Tracks how long it takes for HitTestAggregator to aggregate hit-test data received from all clients.

histogram.name: Event.VizHitTest.AggregateTimeUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2020. The feature has been launched.
histogram.summary: Tracks how long it takes for HitTestAggregator to aggregate hit-test data received from all clients, in microseconds.

histogram.name: Event.VizHitTest.HitTestRegions
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2020. The feature has been launched.
histogram.summary: Total number of hit-test regions Viz received from all clients.

histogram.name: Event.VizHitTest.TargetTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2018. Replaced with Event.VizHitTest.TargetTimeUs.
histogram.summary: Tracks how long it takes for HitTestQuery to find a target on a given location.

histogram.name: Event.VizHitTest.TargetTimeUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2020. The feature has been launched.
histogram.summary: Tracks how long it takes for HitTestQuery to find a target on a given location, in microseconds.

histogram.name: Event.VizHitTest.TransformTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2018. Replaced with Event.VizHitTest.TransformTimeUs.
histogram.summary: Tracks how long it takes for HitTestQuery to transform a location to a given target's coordinate space.

histogram.name: Event.VizHitTest.TransformTimeUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2020. The feature has been launched.
histogram.summary: Tracks how long it takes for HitTestQuery to transform a location to a given target's coordinate space, in microseconds.

histogram.name: Event.VizHitTestSurfaceLayer.ResultsMatch
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2019. The verification path is removed.
histogram.summary:
This tracks how often the cc layer based hit testing fast path result matches or doesn't match the asynchronous blink hit test result.
Team: event-targeting@chromium.org.

histogram.name: ExploreSites.SiteTilesClickIndex
histogram.obsolete: Removed with M77 and replaced by ExploreSites.SiteTilesClickIndex2.
histogram.summary: The total index of the selected tile on the ExploreSites page. This measures how far down from the top it is, counting all the other tiles in cards above it. This assumes 8 tiles per category, and might skip some valid indices if fewer tiles are displayed in a category.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdInjected

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdLikelyInjected

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdLikelyReplaced

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.AdReplaced
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that replace at least one ad.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.ContentScript
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that inject a content script.

histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create divs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedEmbed
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create 'embed' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedIframe
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create iframes to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedInput
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create inputs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedLink
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create links to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedObject
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create 'object' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.CreatedScript
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that create script tags to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.DocumentWrite
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that use document.write.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ContentScript
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that inject a content script.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedDiv
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create divs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedEmbed
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create 'embed' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedInput
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create inputs to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedLink
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create links to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedObject
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that create 'object' elements to add to the page.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.CreatedScript

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.DocumentWrite
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that use document.write.

histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that set innerHTML.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.InvokedDomMethod
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that invoke DOM methods.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ModifiedDom
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that set the value of DOM properties via assignments.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.Google.ReadDom
histogram.summary: For each www.google.com pageload, the number of extensions that read from the DOM.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.InnerHtml
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that set innerHTML.

histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that invoke DOM methods.

histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that set the value of DOM properties via assignments.

histogram.name: ExtensionActivity.ReadDom
histogram.summary: For each pageload, the number of extensions that read from the DOM.

histogram.name: ExtensionBubble.WipeoutUserSelection
histogram.obsolete: Stopped recording in 2019-07. Data was no longer required.
histogram.summary: The action taken by the user when seeing the bubble, logged right after the action is taken.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstalledLoader.ForceDisabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts whether we force-disabled an installed extension at startup because a policy provider indicated it must remain disabled.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstalledLoader.ForceDisabled2
histogram.summary: Counts whether we force-disabled an installed extension at startup because it failed ManagementPolicy::MustRemainDisabled check. This checks both UserMayLoad and MustRemainDisabled methods on a policy provider.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.FetchSuccess
histogram.summary: N/A. Never properly tracked.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.GetResponseSuccess
histogram.summary: N/A. Never properly tracked.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.InvalidCount
histogram.summary: This is a count of the number of ids that we asked to be signed which the server response indicated were not in the webstore.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.ParseFieldsSuccess
histogram.summary: N/A. Never properly tracked.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.ParseJsonSuccess
histogram.summary: N/A. Never properly tracked.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.RequestCount
histogram.summary: A count of the number of server requests since Chrome started running, recorded each time we do a request. NOTE: when interpreting these values, keep in mind that a user who did 5 server requests during one run of Chrome will log this histogram 5 times with values 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.ResultWasValid
histogram.summary: Whether the server result received by the extensions install signer was valid or invalid.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.SecondsSinceLastRequest
histogram.summary: This records the number of seconds since the last time we've done a request to the server (only during this run of the browser).

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallSigner.UptimeAtTimeOfRequest
histogram.summary: Records how many seconds the browser has been running at the time a request to the server is made to get a new install signature.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.ActualStatus
histogram.summary: Logged during InstallVerifier::Init, to indicate the actual enforcement status used (usually determined by the ExtensionInstallVerifier field trial experiment, but possibly modified by command line flags).

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.ExperimentStatus
histogram.summary: Logged during InstallVerifier::Init to indicate the enforcement status as determined by the ExtensionInstallVerifier field trial experiment.

histogram.name: ExtensionInstallVerifier.MustRemainDisabled
histogram.summary: The outcome for each call to InstallVerifier::MustRemainDisabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.PreventableAdInjectors
histogram.summary: The number of extensions per page that injected an ad and could have been stopped if the user had declined script injection. This is related to the ActivityLog metrics, ExtensionActivity.Ad*. Recorded upon page close or navigation. Only recorded if there was at least one ad injection detected.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.ShownActiveScriptsOnPage
histogram.summary: The number of extensions which would display an Active Script Running indiciation to the user. Recorded at page close.

histogram.name: Extensions.ActiveScriptController.UnpreventableAdInjectors
histogram.summary: The number of extensions per page that injected an ad and that could not have been stopped through script injection permission. This is related to the ActivityLog metrics, ExtensionActivity.Ad*. Recorded upon page close or navigation. Only recorded if there was at least one ad injection detected.

histogram.name: Extensions.AdInjection.AdType
histogram.summary: The type of ad that was injected.

histogram.name: Extensions.AdInjection.InstallLocation
histogram.summary: The install location of an ad-injecting extension. Recorded upon page close for any extension that injected ads on that page.

histogram.name: Extensions.ApiUrlNavigationDevtools
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Reports whether a URL navigated to by an extension through the extensions API has the devtools scheme. Reported once per call to tabs.update(), tabs.create() or browser.openTab(). Also reported from windows.create() and will be reported once for each url passed to that function.

histogram.name: Extensions.APIUse_RelativeURL
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Captures the results of URL resolution when relative urls are used in the tabs/windows api.

histogram.name: Extensions.AppLaunchContainer
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 12/2014, replaced by Apps.HostedAppLaunchContainer.
histogram.summary: The number of times apps are launched grouped by extensions::LaunchContainer.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundContentsServiceStartupTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load BackgroundContents for apps at startup when the extension system notifies that it is ready.

histogram.name: Extensions.BackgroundPageLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for an extension's background page to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.BluetoothSocket.Connect.Service
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M73 after collecting the data necessary.
histogram.summary: Records the UUID of the service to which a Chrome App opens a socket connection. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Extensions.BluetoothSocket.ListenL2CAP.Service
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M73 after collecting the data necessary.
histogram.summary: Records the UUID of a service created by a Chrome App listening for L2CAP connections. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Extensions.BluetoothSocket.ListenRFCOMM.Service
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M73 after collecting the data necessary.
histogram.summary: Records the UUID of a service created by a Chrome App listening for RFCOMM connections. The recorded value is a 31-bit hash of the UUID. These results will help us better understand the uses of the API and make changes according to developers' behavior.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkApp.GetAppForCurrentURLDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/05 as PWA link capturing has been removed.
histogram.summary: Time it takes to retrieve the app for the current URL during a navigation.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkApp.GetAppForWindowDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/05 as PWA link capturing has been removed.
histogram.summary: Time it takes to retrieve the app associated with the window during a navigation.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkApp.GetTargetAppDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/05 as PWA link capturing has been removed.
histogram.summary: Time it takes to retrieve the app for the target url during a navigation.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnCreate
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code class returned for each icon loaded during a BookmarkApp's creation.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkApp.Icon.HttpStatusCodeClassOnSync
histogram.summary: The HTTP status code class returned for each icon loaded when syncing a BookmarkApp.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkApp.NavigationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/05 as PWA link capturing has been removed.
histogram.summary: Number of times navigations into and out of Bookmark Apps are processed, grouped by their result.

histogram.name: Extensions.BookmarkApp.TimeBetweenOpenAppAndLastNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/05 as PWA link capturing has been removed.
histogram.summary: The time between the last navigation in the context and us opening a new app window in response to a new navigation. If it is very small, the context probably redirected immediately, which is a bad user experience.

histogram.name: Extensions.BrowsingInstanceViolation.ExtensionType
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77. Some historical data may be found at (Google-internal, sorry) https://docs.google.com/document/d/11O-73Hs0avk1xkkULn5HoxtY0gvzz3Ff5I3GFvMI_cY
histogram.summary:
When an extension violates browsing instance boundaries, this metric records the extension type.
This is a temporary metric - probably okay to remove it in M66, after we've gathered sufficient UMA data in M65. See also https://crbug.com/786411.

histogram.name: Extensions.BrowsingInstanceViolation.IsBackgroundSourceOrTarget
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77. Some historical data may be found at (Google-internal, sorry) https://docs.google.com/document/d/11O-73Hs0avk1xkkULn5HoxtY0gvzz3Ff5I3GFvMI_cY
histogram.summary:
When an extension violates browsing instance boundaries, this metric records whether either the source or the target frame was of the extension view type of VIEW_TYPE_BACKGROUND_CONTENTS.
This is a temporary metric - probably okay to remove it in M66, after we've gathered sufficient UMA data in M65. See also https://crbug.com/786411.

histogram.name: Extensions.BrowsingInstanceViolation.SourceExtensionViewType
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77. Some historical data may be found at (Google-internal, sorry) https://docs.google.com/document/d/11O-73Hs0avk1xkkULn5HoxtY0gvzz3Ff5I3GFvMI_cY
histogram.summary:
When an extension violates browsing instance boundaries, this metric records the extension view type of the source frame.
This is a temporary metric - probably okay to remove it in M66, after we've gathered sufficient UMA data in M65. See also https://crbug.com/786411.

histogram.name: Extensions.BrowsingInstanceViolation.TargetExtensionViewType
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77. Some historical data may be found at (Google-internal, sorry) https://docs.google.com/document/d/11O-73Hs0avk1xkkULn5HoxtY0gvzz3Ff5I3GFvMI_cY
histogram.summary:
When an extension violates browsing instance boundaries, this metric records the extension view type of the found frame.
This metric should help confirm or deny the theory that violating browsing instance boundaries is only needed for looking up background contents / pages (of VIEW_TYPE_BACKGROUND_CONTENTS type).
This is a temporary metric - probably okay to remove it in M66, after we've gathered sufficient UMA data in M65. See also https://crbug.com/786411.

histogram.name: Extensions.ChromeExtensionsClientInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of elapsed time taken to initialize the ChromeExtensionsClient. Recorded once per client initialization, which happens once per instance of Chrome.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptPolicyExtensionDetected
histogram.summary: Fires when we detect corruption in an enterprise policy forced install extension and begin the process of reinstalling it. Compare to CorruptPolicyExtensionResolved to judge success rate.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptPolicyExtensionDetected2
histogram.summary: Fires when we detect corruption in an enterprise policy forced install extension and begin the process of reinstalling it. Compare to CorruptPolicyExtensionResolved to judge success rate.

histogram.name: Extensions.CorruptPolicyExtensionWouldBeDisabled
histogram.summary: Fires when we detect corruption in an enterprise policy forced install extension. See http://crbug.com/447040 for more background on why we don't yet disable these. A useful comparison can be made between this value and the number of policy forced extensions loaded at startup, which is logged in the EXTERNAL_POLICY_DOWNLOAD bucket of the Extensions.ExtensionLocation histogram.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchError
histogram.summary: Net error results from URLFetcher.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchFailureRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchFailureRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually giving up.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchSuccessRetryCountGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxFetchSuccessRetryCountOtherUrl
histogram.summary: Number of times chrome retried to download an extension with a url on a non google.com domain, before eventually succeeding.

histogram.name: Extensions.CrxInstallDirPathLength
histogram.summary: Length of the path to the directory under which an extension is installed. This directory is in the user's profile.

histogram.name: Extensions.Database.Restore
histogram.obsolete: Shipped only in M48. Superceded by Extensions.Database.Database.Restore and Extensions.Database.Value.Restore.
histogram.summary: The result of an attempt to recover from an attempt to open a database that failed as a result of corruption.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.EvaluateBeforeRequestTime.SingleExtension
histogram.obsolete: Removed Jan 2020 to increase resolution to microseconds. Replaced with Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.EvaluateBeforeRequestTime.SingleExtension2.
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate the before-request action for a network request for a single extension ruleset. Emitted for each network request that is visible to the extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.EvaluateRequestTime.AllExtensions
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate whether a network request should be blocked or redirected as per the Declarative Net Request API. This includes the time taken to evaluate all the extension rulesets. Emitted for non-sensitive network requests seen by the Extension System.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.EvaluateRequestTime.AllExtensions2
histogram.obsolete: Removed Jan 2020 to increase resolution to microseconds. Replaced with Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.EvaluateRequestTime.AllExtensions3.
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate whether a network request should be blocked or redirected as per the Declarative Net Request API. This includes the time taken to evaluate all the extension rulesets. Emitted for non-sensitive network requests seen by the Extension System when there is at least one active extension ruleset.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.IndexRulesTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to index the deserialized json rules provided by an extension manifest for the Declarative Net Request API. This is emitted whenever an extension's json ruleset is successfully indexed. This may happen when a packed extension is installed, an unpacked extension is loaded, an extension's ruleset is re-indexed due to corruption, etc.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ManifestRulesCount
histogram.summary: The number of indexed declarative rules provided by an extension manifest for the Declarative Net Request API. This is emitted whenever a packaged extension with a declarative ruleset is installed or updated.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.PageWhitelistingInitiatorCheck
histogram.obsolete: Removed Jan 2020. The addAllowedPages API was removed.
histogram.summary: Describes the different cases pertaining to initiator checks used by the Declarative Net Request Page Whitelisting API. Emitted whenever an extension ruleset is evaluated for a main frame sub-resource request.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ShouldBlockRequestTime.AllExtensions
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate whether a network request should be blocked as per the Declarative Net Request API. This includes the time taken to evaluate all the extension rulesets. Emitted whenever a non-sensitive network request is seen by the Extension System.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ShouldBlockRequestTime.SingleExtension
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate whether a network request should be blocked for a single extension ruleset. Emitted for each network request that is visible to the extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ShouldRedirecRequestTime.SingleExtension
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate whether a network request should be redirected for a single extension ruleset. Emitted for network requests visible to the extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeNetRequest.ShouldRedirectRequestTime.AllExtensions
histogram.summary: Time taken to evaluate whether a network request should be redirected as per the Declarative Net Request API. This includes the time taken to evaluate all the extension rulesets. Emitted for non-sensitive network requests seen by the Extension System.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeWebRequest.ConditionAttributeType
histogram.summary: The type of each WebRequestConditionAttribute created as part of the declarativeWebRequest API.

histogram.name: Extensions.DeclarativeWebRequest.WebViewRequestDeclarativeRules
histogram.summary: Whether a network request from a guest webview has any declarative web request rules that need to be evaluated. Emitted whenever a network request from a guest webview is received at the network layer.

histogram.name: Extensions.DepricatedExternalJsonCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of extensions referenced in the depricated external extensions source at path chrome::DIR_DEPRICATED_EXTERNAL_EXTENSIONS.

histogram.name: Extensions.DialogLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: There is no such thing as an extension dialog.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time for a dialog-hosted extension to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.DidSuppressJavaScriptException
histogram.summary: Records the Chrome channel when JavaScript exceptions are not gracefully dealt with, and suppressed by C++ instead. These are exceptions generated (or simply not caught and gracefully recovered) in our own internal JavaScript, not from JavaScript code written by developers (that which is typically hosted in CRX files). This should be 0 for unstable channels like canary and dev, because we try *not* to suppress errors and instead kill the renderer and generate a crash report. However, at times we need to suppress even those. Note that this histogram is intended to be tracked over time, per channel, to observe crash rates. Comparisons between stable/beta/dev/canary are unlikely to be meaningful.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponse
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2017 because miscounting IGNORE histogram entry. This error is fixed with DisabledUIUserResponse2.
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to an update requiring more permissions.

histogram.name: Extensions.DisabledUIUserResponseRemoteInstall
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2017 because miscounting IGNORE histogram entry. This error is fixed with DisabledUIUserResponseRemoteInstall2.
histogram.summary: User response to the dialog shown when an extension is disabled due to it having been installed remotely.

histogram.name: Extensions.DocsOfflineIconState
histogram.summary: The state of the toolbar icon for the docs offline extension (visible in the toolbar, overflowed in the menu, or the extension is disabled). Recorded once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: Extensions.EnhancedBookmarksManagerNumEventListeners
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete since the enhanced bookmarks manager is no longer using an event page.
histogram.summary: The number of event listeners the Enhanced Bookmarks Manager has, measured at profile startup. A value of 0 implies that Chrome has a general bug with event page management, since the bookmarks manager should always have at least one event listener - but a bug with event page management that affects the bookmarks manager is particularly dire.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageActiveTime
histogram.summary: The time an extension's event page has spent loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.EventPageLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for an extension's event page to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.Events.DispatchToComponentWithSuspendedEventPage
histogram.summary: Recorded every time an event is dispatched to a *component* extension with a suspended event page. Otherwise identical to Extensions.Events.DispatchWithSuspendedEventPage.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionCreationTime
histogram.summary:
The amount of time taken to create a single extension object. This includes parsing all the different extension manifest keys and initializating the associated manifest data.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionFrameMapCacheHit
histogram.summary: True if the cache of the extension frame map was hit during access on the IO thread.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionFrameMapLookupSuccessful
histogram.summary: True if the lookup for a frame in the extension frame map succeeded after a cache miss.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionHostMonitoring.MaxActiveLoading
histogram.summary: The maximum number of ExtensionHosts (primarily background/event pages) that were actively loading at any one time, within the first minute of Chrome startup. Emitted exactly one minute after startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionHostMonitoring.MaxInQueue
histogram.summary: The maximum number of ExtensionHosts (primarily background/event pages) in the queue awaiting being loaded (via an ExtensionHostQueue), within the first minute of Chrome startup. Emitted exactly one minute after startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionHostMonitoring.NumLoaded
histogram.summary: The total number of ExtensionHosts that completed loading in the first minute of Chrome startup. Emitted exactly one minute after startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionHostMonitoring.NumQueued
histogram.summary: The total number of ExtensionHosts (primarily background/event pages) that were added to a queue to start loading, within the first minute of Chrome startup. These may or may not end up starting, let alone finishing, depending on the queue behavior. Emitted exactly one minute after startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionManagement_RefreshTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ExtensionManagement::Refresh.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionRendererStateCacheHit
histogram.obsolete: Removed 4/2016. ExtensionRendererState was replaced with ExtensionFrameMap.
histogram.summary: True if the cache for the ExtensionRendererState was hit during a lookup.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUpdaterFirstUpdateCheckErrorsGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Records the error codes of the extension updater update check errors. These events are triggered only when the extension updater gets an error for the first time (before any retry) in the update check phase for a google.com domain.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUpdaterFirstUpdateCheckErrorsNonGoogleUrl
histogram.summary: Records the error codes of the extension updater update check errors. These events are triggered only when the extension updater gets an error for the first time (before any retry) in the update check phase for a non google.com domain.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUpdaterRawUpdateCalls
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are checked for update. This number is emitted right before the extensions are split between the current extension updater and the unified extension updater (if used).

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUpdaterUpdateCalls
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are passed over to the extension updater for update check. Triggered when the extension updater starts doing update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUpdaterUpdateFoundCount
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that have updates in an update check session. Triggered when the extension updater found an update for an extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExtensionUpdaterUpdateResults
histogram.summary: Records the update results of extensions in an extension updater session, grouped by ExtensionUpdaterUpdateResult.

histogram.name: Extensions.ExternalWarningUninstallationResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not the uninstallation of an external extension succeeded. Triggered when the external install warning is shown to the user and the user selects to remove the extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.FileInstallation
histogram.summary: Record the time taken to physically move the extention files from temporary location to the final installation directory. It includes the time to flush the file system if ExtensionUseSafeInstallation field trial is enabled. This is recorded once per extension install/update.

histogram.name: Extensions.FontSettingsEventRouterCtorTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the FontSettingsEventRouter construction.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureManifestInvalidErrorDetail
histogram.summary: The detailed reason why enterprise policy forced extensions had failed to install because fetched update manifest was invalid. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason2 equal to MANIFEST_INVALID.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason
histogram.summary: The reason why enterprise policy forced extensions were not installed. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram, but for every extension not installed at the moment.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason2
histogram.summary:
The reason why enterprise policy forced extensions were not installed. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram, but for every extension not installed at the moment.
Replaced Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureReason because of splitting CRX_FETCH_FAILED options into three dirrerent failures.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledFailureUpdateCheckStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-08-28 because it is verified from the collected statistics that we always receive "no update" status in case of CRX_FETCH_URL_EMPTY.
histogram.summary: The update check status details for enterprise policy forced extensions when update manifest is fetched from server. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledHttpErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP error code for the last retry attempt when CRX fetch failed for enterprise policy forced extensions. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.{OffStore,WebStore}_ForceInstalledFailureReason3 equal to CRX_FETCH_FAILED and a HTTP response code was received. HTTP response code is received only if there was no network error.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledManifestFetchFailedHttpErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP error code for the last retry attempt when Manifest fetch failed for enterprise policy forced extensions. Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes with Extensions.{OffStore,WebStore}_ForceInstalledFailureReason3 equal to MANIFEST_FETCH_FAILED and a HTTP response code was received. HTTP response code is received only if there was no network error.

histogram.name: Extensions.ForceInstalledStage
histogram.summary: The last known stage of extension installation process if failure reason was not recorded (installation of an extension was neither yet finished nor failed). Recorded for each forced extension that failed to install after 5 minutes. Recorded together with "Extensions.ForceInstalledTimedOutCount" histogram, but for every extension not installed at the moment.

histogram.name: Extensions.FunctionCalls
histogram.summary: Number of calls to extension functions.

histogram.name: Extensions.GetUserDataTempDir
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: What happens when the extensions system tries to get a temp dir to unpack in?

histogram.name: Extensions.HasPermissions_WebStoreInstallAbort3
histogram.summary: Whether there were any permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted (e.g. because the parent window of the confirmation dialog went away), not including installation errors and user cancels. To find places where this histogram may be emitted, look for calls to ExtensionService::RecordPermissionMessagesHistogram with the argument WebStoreInstallAbort.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostedAppUnlimitedStoragePersistentStorageUsage
histogram.summary: The usage (in kilobytes) of persistent storage in a hosted app with the unlimitedStorage permission. This is logged each time the storage is used*, so this also serves as a cap of the number of calls that would fail if the app did not have the unlimited storage permission. *Capped at once per 30 seconds so as to not impact performance.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostedAppUnlimitedStorageTemporaryStorageUsage
histogram.summary: The percentage of "normal" (that is, not unlimited) quota that a hosted app with unlimited storage is currently using. This is logged each time the storage is used*, so the number of times the app would use greater than 100% of the default storage can serve as a cap for the number of calls that would fail if the app did not have the unlimitedStorage permission. *Capped at once per 30 seconds so as to not impact performance.

histogram.name: Extensions.HostedAppUnlimitedStorageUsage
histogram.summary: The usage (in kilobytes) of a hosted app with the unlimitedStorage api permission, recorded once per run per app the first time we load storage for the hosted app. This is separate from the other metrics on hosted app unlimited storage usage because it is logged once per extension per run.

histogram.name: Extensions.InitExtensionControlledPrefsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ExtensionPrefs::InitExtensionControlledPrefs.

histogram.name: Extensions.InitPrefStoreTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ExtensionPrefs::InitPrefStore.

histogram.name: Extensions.InjectScriptTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to inject all scripts by extensions.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPrompt.Accepted
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 2019-05 as it can be derived by comparing the aggregate counts of Extensions.InstallPrompt.TimeToInstall and Extensions.InstallPrompt.TimeToInstall.
histogram.summary: Whether the user accepted or aborted an extension installation.

histogram.name: Extensions.InstallPrompt.Type
histogram.obsolete: Stopped recording 2019-07. The previous enum was garbled.
histogram.summary: Type of the extension install prompt displayed when an extension installation is triggered.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadAllTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2019-11. Replaced by Extensions.LoadAllTime2.
histogram.summary: Time taken to load all non-component extensions at profile open. This happens as part of the total initialization time of ExtensionService, measured in Extensions.ExtensionServiceInitTime.

histogram.name: Extensions.LoadContentPack
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 4/2015. Replaced by ManagedUsers.Whitelist.Count.
histogram.summary: The number of content-pack extensions loaded at profile open.

histogram.name: Extensions.LongInjectionTaskTime
histogram.summary:
The amount of time taken to inject content scripts. If multiple scripts are injected within a single task, this records the time taken to execute all the scripts.
This metric only logs tasks longer than 50 milliseconds. This threshold aligns with the definition of "long task" in Long Tasks API (https://w3c.github.io/longtasks/).
Note that this histogram itself doesn't tell you what percentage of content scripts are greater than 50 ms. See Extensions.Inject{Start,End,Idle}_Time and Extensions.InjectedScriptExecutionTime.* for the overall distribution.

histogram.name: Extensions.Messaging.IncludeChannelIdBehavior
histogram.summary: The behavior for including the TLS channel ID in the information sent with extension messaging. Recorded once per opened channel.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelayRegistryLoad
histogram.summary: Time that network requests were blocked due to relevant rule registries loading.

histogram.name: Extensions.NetworkDelayStartup
histogram.obsolete: Never used. Added to source 06/2012. Removed from source and added here 09/2016.
histogram.summary: Delay of network requests due to waiting for extension declarativeWebRequest rules to be loaded from disk at startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade).

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_AutoDisable3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it is automatically disabled due to a permission increase (e.g., after an extension upgrade).

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Install
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Install2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Install2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Install3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_InstallAbort3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_InstallCancel3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Load
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Load2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Load2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Load3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was loaded.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnable3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was re-enabled from a confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted, not including installation errors and manual user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableAbort3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable prompt was aborted, not including installation errors and manual user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_ReEnableCancel3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when the re-enable was canceled from the confirmation prompt.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_Uninstall3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was uninstalled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2014, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall2.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2015, replaced by Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstall3.
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when it was installed through the web store.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallAbort
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallAbort2
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was aborted, not including installation errors and user cancels.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallCancel
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.Permissions_WebStoreInstallCancel2
histogram.summary: The permissions present in an extension when installation from the web store was canceled.

histogram.name: Extensions.PopupLoadTime
histogram.summary: The time for an Extension's popup to load.

histogram.name: Extensions.ProcessManagerStartupHostsTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to start up persistent background pages for extensions in ExtensionProcessManager when the extension system notifies that it is ready.

histogram.name: Extensions.ResourceDirectoryTimestampQueryLatency
histogram.obsolete: Stopped recording 2019-07. Data no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The initialization latency (in milliseconds) introduced to each extension resource request by querying the directory timestamp.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackFailure
histogram.summary: Count the number of times a sandboxed extension unpack fails.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackFailureTime
histogram.obsolete: Code removed 2020-04. No longer being monitored.
histogram.summary: Time taken to unpack an extension, when the unpack fails.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackInitialCrxPathLength
histogram.obsolete: Code removed 2020-04. No longer being monitored.
histogram.summary: Length of the initial path to the CRX to be unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackLinkFreeCrxPathLength
histogram.obsolete: Code removed 2020-04. No longer being monitored.
histogram.summary: Length of the normalized (link/junction free) path to the temporary copy of a CRX made during unpacking.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate
histogram.summary: Rate at which a CRX file is unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate1To2mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 1MB to 2MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate2To5mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 2MB to 5MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate50kBTo1mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 50kB to 1MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRate5To10mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files 5MB to 10 MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRateOver10mB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files larger than 10MB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackRateUnder50kB
histogram.summary: Rate at which CRX files under 50 KB are unpacked in Kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccessCantGetCrxSize
histogram.obsolete: Code removed 2020-04. No longer being monitored.
histogram.summary: Count the number of times a sandboxed CRX unpack succeeds, but we can't get the file size.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccessCrxSize
histogram.summary: Size of the .crx file, in KB, when the unpack succeeds.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackSuccessTime
histogram.obsolete: Code removed 2020-04. No longer being monitored.
histogram.summary: Time taken to unpack an extension, when the unpack succeeds.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackTempCrxPathLength
histogram.obsolete: Code removed 2020-04. No longer being monitored.
histogram.summary: Length of the path of the temporary copy of a CRX made during unpacking.

histogram.name: Extensions.SandboxUnpackUnpackedCrxPathLength
histogram.obsolete: Code removed 2020-04. No longer being monitored.
histogram.summary: Length of the path under which a CRX is unpacked.

histogram.name: Extensions.SettingsQuotaExceeded.BytesPerSetting
histogram.summary: Emitted when QuotaExceededError was called due to an extension using too many bytes for a given setting. The number has no natural numerator (normalizing factor) and thus is not particularly useful.

histogram.name: Extensions.SettingsQuotaExceeded.KeyCount
histogram.summary: Emitted when QuotaExceededError was called due to an extension using too many keys. The number has no natural numerator (normalizing factor) and thus is not particularly useful.

histogram.name: Extensions.SettingsQuotaExceeded.TotalBytes
histogram.summary: Emitted when QuotaExceededError was called due to an extension using too many bytes. The number has no natural numerator (normalizing factor) and thus is not particularly useful.

histogram.name: Extensions.ShouldAllowOpenURL.Failure
histogram.summary: When the web-accessible resource check in ChromeContentBrowserClientExtensionsPart::ShouldAllowOpenURL fails, this records the reason for the failure. This check is performed on navigations that utilize the OpenURL path as well as on transfers.

histogram.name: Extensions.ShouldAllowOpenURL.Failure.Scheme
histogram.summary: When the web-accessible resource check in ChromeContentBrowserClientExtensionsPart::ShouldAllowOpenURL fails, this records the scheme of the SiteInstance that initiated the blocked load. This check is performed on navigations that utilize the OpenURL path as well as on transfers.

histogram.name: Extensions.StartupDelay
histogram.obsolete: This has not been recorded since at least mid-2013.
histogram.summary: The time one extension delays network requests at startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.StartupDelay_Total
histogram.obsolete: This has not been recorded since at least mid-2013.
histogram.summary: The total time extensions delay network requests at startup.

histogram.name: Extensions.StorageFrontendInitTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during StorageFrontend::Init.

histogram.name: Extensions.ThrottledNetworkRequests
histogram.summary: The total number of network requests that were delayed by extension user script load. Recorded once each time network requests may have been delayed by user script load (i.e., once at the end of each batch of script loads).

histogram.name: Extensions.TimeYieldedBetweenContentScriptRuns
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between two asynchronously-injected content script runs.

histogram.name: Extensions.Toolbar.PinnedExtensionCount
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that the user has pinned on the toolbar. Recorded once per profile during initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.Toolbar.PinnedExtensionPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of extensions that the user has pinned to the toolbar (i.e., this will be 100 if the user has every extension pinned). Recorded once per profile during initialization.

histogram.name: Extensions.Toolbar.PinnedExtensionPercentage2
histogram.summary: The percentage of extensions that the user has pinned to the toolbar (i.e., this will be 100 if the user has every extension pinned). Recorded once per profile during initialization if the user has at least one extension with an action in the toolbar.

histogram.name: Extensions.ToolstripLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time taken to load a toolstrip.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnifiedExtensionUpdaterDownloadErrors
histogram.summary: Records the error codes of the unified extension updater download errors. These events are triggered when the extension updater fails to download the extension update package of an extension, which can happen only after the updater has successfuly determined that there is an update for the extension.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnifiedExtensionUpdaterUpdateCalls
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that are passed over to the unified extension updater for update check. Triggered when the new extension updater starts doing update check.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnifiedExtensionUpdaterUpdateCheckErrors
histogram.summary: Records the error codes of the unified extension updater update check errors. These events are triggered only when the new extension updater gets an error in the update check phase.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnifiedExtensionUpdaterUpdateResults
histogram.summary: Records the update results of extensions in an unified extension updater session, grouped by ExtensionUpdaterUpdateResult.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnifiedExtensionUpdaterUpdateServiceErrors
histogram.summary: The update service errors that the update service encouters during an update check session using update client.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackFailureInstallCause
histogram.summary: Count failing CRX installs, grouped by the way an extension can be installed.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackFailureInstallSource
histogram.summary: The install source of an extension that failed to unpack correctly. Emitted each time an extension fails to unpack from the CrxInstaller.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackSuccessInstallCause
histogram.summary: Count successful CRX installs, grouped by the cause of the install.

histogram.name: Extensions.UnpackSuccessInstallSource
histogram.summary: The install source of an extension that succeeded in unpacking correctly. Emitted each time an extension successfully unpacks from the CrxInstaller.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateCheckGap
histogram.summary: Time in minutes between update checks.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateFrequencyCommandLineFlagIsUsed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 3/2018 in https://crbug.com/357781 with the removal of the extensions-update-frequency command line flag.
histogram.summary: Logs whether or not the extensions-update-frequency command line flag is used. Recorded at profile creation if extensions autoupdate is enabled.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateManifestDuplicateEntryCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of entries with the same extension ID found in the update manifest of an update check request. When the update manifest does not contain any update entry for an extension ID in the update check request, the count will be 0.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdateManifestHasProdVersionMinCounts
histogram.summary: The number of prodversionmin attributes appearing in an update manifest of an update check request.

histogram.name: Extensions.UpdaterWriteCrx
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: What happened when the extension updater tried to write a file?

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.InitiatorAccess
histogram.summary: Describes the different cases pertaining to host permissions check for the initiator URL of a network request. This is emitted whenever an extension is found to have access to a request url, when checked by the WebRequest API.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.InitiatorAccess2
histogram.summary: Describes the different cases pertaining to host permissions check for the initiator URL of a network request. This is emitted whenever an extension is found to have access to a request url for the WebRequest or Declarative Net Request API.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.ModifiedResponseHeaders
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 as this is no longer needed.
histogram.summary:
Tracks whether any interesting response header modifications were made for each request seen by the Web Request API. Logged for every network request as long as one or more enabled extensions is using a declarative or blocking filter to process onHeadersReceived events.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582. It can probably be removed by M69.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.SetCookieResponseHeaderChanged
histogram.summary:
Whether the set-cookie response header was changed by an extension using the Web Request API. Logged for every network request as long as one or more enabled extensions is using a declarative or blocking filter to process onHeadersReceived events.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582. It can probably be removed by M73.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.SetCookieResponseHeaderRemoved
histogram.summary:
Whether the set-cookie response header was removed by an extension using the Web Request API. Logged for every network request as long as one or more enabled extensions is using a declarative or blocking filter to process onHeadersReceived events.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582. It can probably be removed by M73.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.SpecialHeadersRemoved
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 as this is no longer needed.
histogram.summary:
Whether either or both of the special Accept-Language or User-Agent request headers were removed by an extension using the Web Request API. Logged for every network request as long as one or more enabled extensions is using a declarative or blocking filter to process onBeforeSendHeaders events.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582. It can probably be removed by M69.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.SpecialRequestHeadersChanged
histogram.summary:
Whether Accept-Language, Accept-Encoding, User-Agent, Cookie, Referer, or mulitple of these request headers were changed by an extension using the Web Request API. Logged for every network request as long as one or more enabled extensions is using a declarative or blocking filter to process onBeforeSendHeaders events.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582. It can probably be removed by M73.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.SpecialRequestHeadersRemoved
histogram.summary:
Whether Accept-Language, Accept-Encoding, User-Agent, Cookie, Referer, or mulitple of these request headers were removed by an extension using the Web Request API. Logged for every network request as long as one or more enabled extensions is using a declarative or blocking filter to process onBeforeSendHeaders events.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582. It can probably be removed by M73.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.WS_CookiesAreModifiedOnBeforeSendHeaders
histogram.summary:
Whether cookies on a websocket connection are modified in OnBeforeSendHeaders.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.WS_CookiesAreModifiedOnHeadersReceived
histogram.summary:
Whether cookies on a websocket connection are modified in OnHeadersReceived.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.WS_RequestHeaders
histogram.summary: Whether certain headers are modified in OnBeforeSendHeaders.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.WS_RequestHeadersModification
histogram.summary:
Tracks request headers modifications on a websocket connection in OnBeforeSendHeaders.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequest.WS_ResponseHeadersAreModified
histogram.summary:
Whether response headers on a websocket connection are modified in OnHeadersReceived.
This histogram is temporary, for investigating https://crbug.com/827582.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebRequestEventFoundFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2017. No longer relevant after refactoring.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the render frame lookup for a given webRequest event succeeded.

histogram.name: Extensions.WebstoreDownload.FileDownload
histogram.summary: The time spent to download the crx file from the webstore to local disk. This is recorded once per successful download.

histogram.name: ExtensionService.ZipUnpackerDisabledReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 09/2018, with the removal of the "Zip Unpacker" component extension.
histogram.summary: Records the reason why the ZIP unpacker extension was disabled when the service attempted to re-enable the extension upon startup. Each entry indicates that the extension was disabled unintentionally and a fix was attempted.

histogram.name: ExtensionToolbarModel.BrowserActionsPermanentlyHidden
histogram.summary: The number of Browser Action icons the user has elected to permanently hide (as opposed to putting them in the overflow bucket). Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteError
histogram.obsolete: Removed at 07/2019 because refactored DataPipeProducer does not provide the net::Error code any more, and it reaches the planned expiry milestone.
histogram.summary: The error code for failures of incremental reads of a file stream for a chrome-extension:// URL. (See also ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteResult for the success case).

histogram.name: ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed at 07/2019 because refactored DataPipeProducer does not provide the reported value, and this metric was already broken, reporting always 0.
histogram.summary: The result of an incremental read of a file stream for a chrome-extension:// URL, representing a byte count. Logged in success cases (see also ExtensionUrlRequest.OnReadCompleteError).

histogram.name: Favicons.CandidatesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of favicon link tags on a page once the page has finished loading. The count includes the automatically added favicon.ico entry.

histogram.name: Favicons.CandidatesWithDefinedSizesCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of favicon link tags with a non empty sizes attribute once the page has finished loading.

histogram.name: Favicons.CandidatesWithTouchIconsCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of apple-touch-icon and apple-touch-icon-precomposed link tags once the page has finished loading.

histogram.name: Favicons.DownloadAttempts
histogram.summary: Records the number of icons requested until the best-fitting candidate was found or there were no candidates left to check. More than 15 attempts are unlikely and will be stored in overflow bucket 16. Less than 1 attempt means an error happened; these cases are in bucket 0.

histogram.name: Favicons.DownloadOutcome
histogram.summary: Records whether a download succeeded, failed or was skipped because it has failed previously.

histogram.name: FCMInvalidations.FCMMessagesDeleted
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the GCM client announces that some FCM messages were deleted. Note that this does not record the number of deleted messages.

histogram.name: FCMInvalidations.TokenStateOnRegistrationRequest
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in 2019-12 by FCMInvalidations.TokenStateOnRegistrationRequest2. This first version did not record the "Token was cleared" bucket.
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of instance ID token requests (i.e. whether the token changed). Such requests are made when invalidations are first enabled (e.g. on sign-in), and then periodically every 24 hours.

histogram.name: Feed.Offline.GetStatusCount
histogram.summary: The number of urls that have offline status requested per call.

histogram.name: Feed.Offline.GetStatusDuration
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds to round trip offline status for a set of URLs from Offline Pages component.

histogram.name: Feed.Scheduler.RefreshTrigger
histogram.summary: The scheduler watches for various triggers, which cause it to decide if a refresh is currently warranted or not. This histogram is emitted when a trigger causes a refresh.

histogram.name: Feed.Scheduler.RequestBehavior
histogram.summary: When NTP is opened, the scheduler host tells the Feed library how to act, if the existing content should be shown, immediately or with timeout, and if a refresh request should be started.

histogram.name: Feedback.HappinessTrackingSurvey.DesktopResponse
histogram.summary: Reports on the responses to showing Happiness Tracking Surveys (HaTS) to a subset of users. Records each time HaTS is shown.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.CloudImport.UserAction
histogram.obsolete: Was removed from the code at an unknown time.
