histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser - Specific actions taken by user such initiating cloud import, canceling import, selecting a directory, or opting-in to Drive>Photos sync.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.CrostiniShareDialog
histogram.summary: Dialog shown when using crostini app to open a file.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.CrostiniSharedPaths.Depth
histogram.summary: The depth from volume root of the path being shared. This is equivalent to how many '/' are in the path. E.g. 'Downloads' or 'My Drive' has depth 0. 'Downloads/foo/bar' has depth 2.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.HardUnpluggedAroundSuspend.TimeSinceResume
histogram.obsolete: The bug which the UMA was investigating got fixed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time from the SuspendDone event to the DiskRemoved event. The UMA is added temporarily for crbug.com/433734.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.HardUnpluggedAroundSuspend.TimeUntilSuspend
histogram.obsolete: The bug which the UMA was investigating got fixed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time from the DiskRemoved event to the Suspend event. The UMA is added temporarily for crbug.com/433734.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.MountCrostiniContainer
histogram.summary: Chrome OS File Browser: time to start and mount the crostini container in order to show Linux Files.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.OpeningFileType
histogram.summary: File types that were tried to be opened through browser.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Action
histogram.obsolete: Code seems to have been removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: action chosen in the Action Choice dialog for the external device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportCount
histogram.obsolete: Code seems to have been removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the number of photos imported. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.ImportPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Code seems to have been removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: the percent of photos imported among all the photos on the device. Measured on every successfull import operation.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Load
histogram.obsolete: Code seems to have been removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to load the action dialog. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment user see all available actions for the device.

histogram.name: FileBrowser.PhotoImport.Scan
histogram.obsolete: Code seems to have been removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS Photo Import flow: time to scan the external device.

histogram.name: FileSystem.OriginFailedCanCommitURL
histogram.summary: Logged when we fail the permission validation of the filesystem URL origin, from ChildProcessSecurityPolicy::HasPermissionsForFileSystemFile. This is not expected to happen in normal operation.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.EmailInterstitialInteraction
histogram.summary: Records when a user interacted with the email interstitial of the onboarding process. We record that the page was seen and what action the user took.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.EmailProvidersInteraction
histogram.summary: Records when a user interacted with the Email Providers new user experience. We record the number of times the page is seen, how they interacted with the page (i.e. interacting with presented options and button clicks), and through what method they leave the page (i.e. confirm, cancel, neither). The new user experience should only be shown once to new profiles. Hence, the leaving method should be recorded at most once.

histogram.name: FirstRun.NewUserExperience.EmailProvidersSelection
histogram.summary: Records what email provider was selected as part of the Email Providers New User Experience. Histogram is only recorded when a user confirms adding an email provider.

histogram.name: FirstUserAction.BackgroundTime.MainIntent
histogram.summary: The amount of time (in minutes) that the app was in the background before the user started it (via an ACTION_MAIN intent) and performed a user action that describes the intent of resuming the app. Only recorded if the action took place within the first 10 seconds of starting Chrome. The actions are further described in the FirstUserActionTypes suffix.

histogram.name: Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.NetErrorCodes.Retry
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. Enough data has been collected for investigation of https://crbug.com/876306
histogram.summary: Reports the network error code for requests to the ListAccounts Gaia endpoint. There are suffixes for individual tries (0 is the initial request, and 1-8 are retries).

histogram.name: Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.ProcessUptime.Error
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. Enough data has been collected for investigation of https://crbug.com/876306
histogram.summary: Reported when a request to the ListAccounts Gaia endpoint fails to complete for network reasons (i.e. when the error is not OK). This histogram can be used in conjunction with "Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.ProcessUptime.Success" in order to compute the failure rate of ListAccounts depending on the process uptime (measured as a base::TimeDelta between the start of the process and the start of the request).

histogram.name: Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.ProcessUptime.Success
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. Enough data has been collected for investigation of https://crbug.com/876306
histogram.summary: Reported when a request to the ListAccounts Gaia endpoint completes without network error (i.e. when the network error is OK). This histogram can be used in conjunction with "Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.ProcessUptime.Error" in order to compute the failure rate of ListAccounts depending on the process uptime (measured as a base::TimeDelta between the start of the process and the start of the request).

histogram.name: Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.SystemUptime.Error
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. Enough data has been collected for investigation of https://crbug.com/876306
histogram.summary: Reported when a request to the ListAccounts Gaia endpoint fails to complete for network reasons (i.e. when the network error is not OK). This histogram can be used in conjunction with "Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.SystemUptime.Success" in order to compute the failure rate of ListAccounts depending on the system uptime (measured as a base::TimeDelta between the start of the system and the start of the request).

histogram.name: Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.SystemUptime.Success
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. Enough data has been collected for investigation of https://crbug.com/876306
histogram.summary: Reported when a request to the ListAccounts Gaia endpoint completes without network error (i.e. when the network error is OK). This histogram can be used in conjunction with "Gaia.AuthFetcher.ListAccounts.SystemUptime.Error" in order to compute the failure rate of ListAccounts depending on the system uptime (measured as a base::TimeDelta between the start of the system and the start of the request).

histogram.name: Gaia.SuccessCountBeforeBadRequestForOAuth2AccessToken
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of M86.
histogram.summary: Number of successful requests preceding a bad request for an OAuth2 refresh token.

histogram.name: Gamepad.KnownGamepadConnected
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2018. Use Gamepad.KnownGamepadConnectedWithId instead.
histogram.summary: Records an enumeration value that can be used to identify the connected device from a list of known gamepads. Reported when a device with a vendor and product ID matching a known gaming input device is detected during Gamepad API enumeration.

histogram.name: GCM.AndroidGcmReceiverError
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2016. The error has been fixed by GCM. (crbug/580367)
histogram.summary: Result of a message received by the GcmReceiver on Android.

histogram.name: GCM.APICallUnregister
histogram.summary: Number of times when gcm.unregister API is called.

histogram.name: GCM.CheckinCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM checkin request successfully. If the checkin is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.CheckinRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM checkin succeeds.

histogram.name: GCM.ConnectedViaProxy
histogram.summary: Whether the GCM connection was made via a proxy or not.

histogram.name: GCM.DataMessageBurstReceivedInterval
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2020 as the data was no longer being used.
histogram.summary: Interval between two successive received data message bursts.

histogram.name: GCM.DataMessageReceivedHasRegisteredApp
histogram.obsolete: No longer used starting with Chrome 61 as the check was removed.
histogram.summary: Records whether a matching registration was found for each received DATA_MESSAGE message from Google Cloud Messaging. Recorded while processing the received message. Prior to M56 this also counted received DELETED_MESSAGES messages.

histogram.name: GCM.FirstReceivedDataMessageLatencyAfterConnection
histogram.summary: The time between the successful completion of the connection and the arrival of the first data message.

histogram.name: GCM.GetInstanceIDData.ClientStarted
histogram.summary: Reports the client-started state when the GCM driver requested a read of the instance id although the client was not ready. If != Success, the client is likely leaking a registration.

histogram.name: GCM.IgnoredWriteResult
histogram.summary: Result of the outcome of persisting a change in the GCMStore. This histogram is to meausure the frequency of such events and assess their severity. For example, failing to write when calling AddInstanceIDData() likely results in leaked FCM registrations.

histogram.name: GCM.LoadSucceeded
histogram.summary: Success indicates successfully loading an initialized persistent GCM store at startup time. Failure indicates a failure loading the store.

histogram.name: GCM.NumUsers
histogram.summary: Number of GCM users associated with this client at startup time.

histogram.name: GCM.OutgoingMessageTTL
histogram.summary: Category of TTL specified in the outgoing message: 0, less than or equal to 1 minute, less than or equal to 1 hour and etc.

histogram.name: GCM.ReceivedDataMessageBurstSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2020 as the data was no longer being used.
histogram.summary: Number of messages in a received GCM data message burst.

histogram.name: GCM.ReceivedDataMessageIntervalWithinBurst
histogram.summary: Interval between messages within a received GCM data message burst.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM registration request successfully. If the registration is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.RegistrationRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM registration succeeds.

histogram.name: GCM.ResetStore
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M56 in favor of GCM.ResetStoreError
histogram.summary: Reports the problem encountered when resetting the GCM store.

histogram.name: GCM.SendWebPushMessageForbiddenBody
histogram.summary: Categorized response body when 403: Forbidden is received from sending web push messages. Recorded when received response after message has been sent. All platforms.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationCompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete a GCM unregistration request successfully. If the unregistration is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationRequest
histogram.summary: Number of unregistration requests sent to Google Cloud Messaging. Recorded immediately after the request has started.

histogram.name: GCM.UnregistrationRetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before a GCM unregistration succeeds.

histogram.name: GCMInvalidations.IncomingMessageStatus
histogram.summary: Status of parsing incoming invalidations message from GCM channel.

histogram.name: GCMInvalidations.OutgoingMessageStatus
histogram.summary: Status of sending outgoing invalidations message through GCM.

histogram.name: GData.EntireFeedLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the entire file system information from the server

histogram.name: GData.EntryKind
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Provides breakdown of specific formats for hosted documents. Recorded when feed is loaded from the server.

histogram.name: GData.InitialFeedLoadTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load the initial part of the file system information from the server

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfHostedDocuments
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of hosted documents (spreadsheets etc.) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfRegularFiles
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of regualr files on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: GData.NumberOfTotalFiles
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of total files (regualr files + hosted documents) on Drive. Logged when Drive is first accessed.

histogram.name: Geolocation.GeolocationDispatcherHostImpl.EnableHighAccuracy
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 because the metric is not needed anymore. See https://crbug.com/1036861 for discussion on this metric.
histogram.summary: Whether high accuracy geolocation information was requested.

histogram.name: Geolocation.InfoBarDelegate.Event
histogram.summary: Events in GeolocationInfoBarDelegate.

histogram.name: Geolocation.InfoBarDelegateAndroid.Event
histogram.summary: Events in GeolocationInfoBarDelegateAndroid.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PostDisclosureContentSetting
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation content setting for the default search engine's origin after the search geolocation disclosure has been shown and won't be shown again. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PostDisclosurePermission
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation permission for the default search engine's origin after the search geolocation disclosure has been shown and won't be shown again. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PreDisclosureContentSetting
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation content setting for the default search engine's origin immediately before the search geolocation disclosure has been shown. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GeolocationDisclosure.PreDisclosurePermission
histogram.summary: Records the geolocation permission for the default search engine's origin immediately before the search geolocation disclosure has been shown. This metric is only recorded once per client.

histogram.name: GestureNavigation.Abandoned
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures that were abandoned before they were completed. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: GestureNavigation.SwipedOverThreshold
histogram.summary: Overscroll gesture was made beyond a threshold that, upon release, would trigger navigation. Users can swipe back below the threshold but this event will still be logged. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: GestureNavigation.Triggered
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures initiated by the user. Note that not all overscroll gestures triggered are completed (e.g. the overscroll gesture is aborted if user swipes back to the edge before releasing the finger). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Button.Clicked0
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received an index 0 button click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Button.Clicked1
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received an index 1 button click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Card.Clicked
histogram.summary: Types of cards which received a notification click.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.Event
histogram.summary: Events in Google Now component extension.

histogram.name: GoogleNow.MessageCenter.Displayed.NotificationsVisible
histogram.summary: Count of the number of Google Now notifications visible when the message center/notification center is shown.

histogram.name: GooglePlayServices.ConnectionResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2019. See https://crbug.com/490710 for context.
histogram.summary: ConnectionResult error codes resulting from attempts to check whether or not Google Play Services is available. Most of these checks are done lazily, when a user accesses a feature that uses Google Play Services. Added for http://crbug.com/490710.

histogram.name: GooglePlayServices.ErrorHandlerAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2019. See https://crbug.com/490710 for context.
histogram.summary: Types of action taken in response to Google Play Services user-recoverable errors. Added for http://crbug.com/490710.

histogram.name: GoogleSearch.AccessPoint
histogram.summary: Counts number of Google searches from various access points in the browser. WARNING: Do not use this histogram as it currently fails to classify a large percentage of Omnibox searches correctly - http://crbug.com/421631.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.EffectivePolicy
histogram.summary: The effective update policy for Chrome on Windows. Recorded once per startup (following a 45 seconds delay).

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.InfoBar.ActionTaken
histogram.summary: (Android-only) Records what action the user took (if any) on the InfoBar indicating that a new version of Chrome is available.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.InfoBar.InternalStorageSizeAvailable
histogram.summary: (Android-only) The amount of internal memory storage available on the user's device when the InfoBar or update menu item is shown. Deprecating soon in M64.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.InfoBar.TimeShown
histogram.summary: (Android-only) The amount of time which the InfoBar indicating a new version is available is visible.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.Notification.LaunchEvent
histogram.summary: (Android-only) Records events when try to launch the update work flow via an update notification.

histogram.name: GoogleUpdate.UpdatePolicyIsOverridden
histogram.summary: True if the effective update policy for Chrome on Windows is the result of an app-specific override; false if it is the default for all apps. Recorded once per startup (following a 45 seconds delay).

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.D3D11CreateDeviceMS
histogram.summary: The time that elapses for the initial call to D3D11CreateDevice on D3D11 ANGLE. A pure system call, with no ANGLE or Chromium code, called once every GPU process startup.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.Renderer11InitializeDeviceMS
histogram.summary: Time ANGLE spends initializing various shaders and internal classes. This is time that isn't purely loading system DLLs and calling OS methods. It might be work we can optimize or defer until later.

histogram.name: GPU.ANGLE.Renderer11InitializeDLLsMS
histogram.summary: Time ANGLE spends loading system DLLs, such as the D3D compiler DLL, and the D3D11 and DXGI DLLs. Probably unavoidable startup costs, though very useful to keep track of.

histogram.name: GPU.AtExitMBytesAllocated
histogram.summary: The amount of GPU memory that was currently allocated as of just before the GPU process' exit.

histogram.name: GPU.AtExitMBytesAllocatedMax
histogram.summary: The maximum amount of GPU memory that had ever been allocated during the GPU process' lifetime, as of just before the GPU process' exit.

histogram.name: GPU.AtExitMBytesLimit
histogram.summary: The GPU memory manager's limit on the amount of GPU memory that can be allocated as of just before the GPU process' exit.

histogram.name: GPU.AtExitWindowCount
histogram.summary: The number of windows that the GPU memory manager believed to exist as of just before the GPU process' exit.

histogram.name: GPU.BlacklistFeatureTestResultsWindows
histogram.summary: Counts number of browser invocations for which a GPU feature is allowed/blacklisted/disabled in various Windows sub-versions.

histogram.name: GPU.BlockStatusForClient3DAPIs
histogram.summary: Indicates whether WebGL / Pepper3D were blocked, and if so, for all domains, or only a single one. This statistic is gathered every time an attempt is made to create a 3D context.

histogram.name: GPU.CheckFramebufferValidDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in GLES2DecoderImpl::CheckFramebufferValid.

histogram.name: GPU.CreateBrowserCompositor
histogram.summary:
The time that the browser process takes to create the compositor from its point of view. One of these is created for each top-level window (browser frame, menus, etc.).
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: GPU.D3D11_FeatureLevel
histogram.obsolete: As of 02/26/2020 this has been superceded by GPU.D3D11FeatureLevel.
histogram.summary: The highest D3D11 feature level available.

histogram.name: GPU.DestroyProgramManagerPrograms.Elapsed
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent destroying programs during ProgramManager::Destroy.

histogram.name: GPU.DestroyProgramManagerPrograms.Programs
histogram.summary: The number of progams destroyed during ProgramManager::Destroy.

histogram.name: GPU.DestroyProgramManagerPrograms.ProgramsPerMs
histogram.summary: The number of programs destroyed per millisecond during ProgramManager::Destroy. Only logged if both the number of programs and the elapsed time are greater than zero.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayerResult
histogram.summary: Recorded for each quad (on overlay processing) the reason it was or wasn't put in an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DCLayerResult2
histogram.summary: Recorded for each quad (on overlay processing) with protected video type the reason it was or wasn't put in an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DecodeSwapChainPresentResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 3/2019. This either succeeds or fails with DXGI_STATUS_OCCLUDED infrequently which we also handle.
histogram.summary: Result of calling Present on decode swap chain. Recorded on each present.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DecodeSwapChainSurfaceCreationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 3/2019. Creating the surface never fails.
histogram.summary: Result of calling CreateSurfaceFromHandle. Recorded when decode swap chain is created.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DecodeSwapChainUsed
histogram.summary: Whether zero copy decode swap chain was used to present video frame instead of video processor blit with flip swap chain. Recorded on each present.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.DisableLargerThanScreenOverlaysWorkaround
histogram.obsolete: No longer needed. Data has been collected.
histogram.summary: Recorded for each overlay frame during the video playback whether the workaround that reduces the swap chain size to fit the screen is active.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.FullScreenOverlay
histogram.summary: Recorded for each overlay/underlay quad during the video playback whether the video is played in full screen mode

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlayFormatUsed
histogram.summary: Which overlay format was chosen for YUV overlays.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlayFormatUsed2
histogram.summary: Which overlay format was chosen for YUV overlays. Recorded once per GPU process launch only if hardware overlays are supported.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlayFullScreenTypes
histogram.summary: The overlay size types in comparison to the full screen size. Recorded for each overlay quad during the video playback.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlayNV12Rec709Supported
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2019. Rec 709 is almost always supported.
histogram.summary: Whether or not Rec709 color space is supported on NV12 supported machines. Recorded during the GPU process initialization.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlaySupportFlags
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by format specific histograms under OverlaySupportFlags2.
histogram.summary: These are the flags explaining how well overlays are supported on the current display. The is recorded for every connected display when creating a DirectComposition view context.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.OverlaySupportFlags2
histogram.summary: Flags that indicate if overlays are supported, and if additional features such as scaling are supported for some common pixel formats.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapBuffersFailed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2018. Replaced by SwapBuffersResult which is emitted on both success and failure.
histogram.summary: Emitted on direct composition surface swap buffers failure.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapBuffersLastError
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2018. GetLastError returns error for last successful or failed win32 call so this doesn't work as expected.
histogram.summary: Last error when presentation using DirectComposition fails.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapBuffersResult
histogram.summary: Whether or not swap buffers succeeded.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainCreationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2019 because of using histogram macros instead of functions. Replaced by SwapChainCreationResult2.
histogram.summary: Whether creating swap chain for overlay format succeeded. Recorded once per swap chain creation.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapchainFormat
histogram.summary: What type of swapchain was actually created for an overlay.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainFormat2
histogram.summary: What format was used for each overlay swap chain on each swap buffers.

histogram.name: GPU.DirectComposition.SwapChainResizeResult
histogram.summary: Result of ResizeBuffers call. Recorded once per swap chain resize.

histogram.name: GPU.DisplayCompositorLifetimeEvents
histogram.summary: Counts of the number of gpu process crashes when it only has display compositor (no hardware acceleration and software compositing).

histogram.name: GPU.DisplayLinkInstallationStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2/2017. The values hadn't been updated since it was created, and the code gathering the installation status has been removed in Chrome CL 2679773002.
histogram.summary: Whether a version of DisplayLink is installed that crashes the GPU process. This information is collected at statup. It applies only to Windows. See http://crbug.com/177611.

histogram.name: GPU.EstablishGpuChannelDuration
histogram.summary: The duration from when a request to establish a GPU channel arrives in viz::GpuClient and to when the response for the request is sent.

histogram.name: GPU.GpuBlockedBetweenSwapsUs
histogram.summary: This is logged once per frame if the output surface provides timing information. It measures the time Gpu Main thread was blocked (difference between wall time and cpu time) during tasks execution for currect frame. Only reported when there is single surface swap in the same vsync interval. Only reported for platforms supporting high resolution clocks.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUChannelHostWaitTime
histogram.summary: The wait time between the IPC message sent from the GPU channel host and the event sync from the GPU process. If the wait time takes longer than 60 seconds, 60 seconds will be recoreded.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUChannelHostWaitTime.MicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Records how long the browser UI thread spent blocked for a sync IPC sent using GpuChannelHost to see if it's contributing to jank.

histogram.name: GPU.GpuGeneration
histogram.summary: Records user device's GPU generation. Only recorded on Windows platform at GPU process launch time. Currently only meaningful with Intel GPUs.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUInitializationTime
histogram.summary: The time between the GPU process starts and the GPU Info is collected in Viz GPU service. If GPU initilization takes longer than 60 seconds, 60 seconds will be recoreded.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessLaunchCause
histogram.summary: Counts enumerating the initial cause for the GPU Process to be launched.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessLifetimeEvents
histogram.summary: Counts of the number of process launches and crashes (when running on h/w).

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessSoftwareRendering
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer recorded. Use GPU.GLImplementation == kGLImplementationSwiftShaderGL to check if the gpu process is launched with software rendering.
histogram.summary: A boolean indicating whether the gpu process that was launched uses software or hardware 3d rendering.

histogram.name: GPU.GPUProcessTerminationStatus
histogram.summary: Counts for each time the GPU Process Host detects the process dies.

histogram.name: GPU.GrContextMemoryKb
histogram.summary: Kilobytes of memory used by Skia in the gpu process. This is recorded after every block of commands in the raster decoder.

histogram.name: GPU.InForceCompositingModeFieldTrial
histogram.summary: Records whether a client was selected for the force compositing mode field trial or not.

histogram.name: GPU.InitializeOneOffTime
histogram.summary: The time that the GPU process spends in initializing the GL surface, and collecting graphics information.

histogram.name: Gpu.Metal.TestShaderCompileSucceeded
histogram.obsolete: It is not planned to use this approach to determine if Metal is to be used.
histogram.summary: Compiling a MTLLibrary will sometimes hang forever. When initializing Metal, a test shader is compiled to see if the MTLCompilerService is responding or not. This records the success or failure of this test compile, once at initialization.

histogram.name: Gpu.Metal.TestShaderMethodTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2020. Did not reveal interesting results.
histogram.summary: Compiling a MTLLibrary will sometimes hang forever. When initializing the gpu process, a test shader is compiled to see if the MTLCompilerService is is responding or not. This records the time that it took for the compile method to finish (not including the time for the compile itself to finish), up to 1 minute. After 1 minute, a timeout sentinel value of 3 minutes is reported.

histogram.name: Gpu.MetalProxy.NewLibraryAttempt
histogram.obsolete: This did not substantially improve the situation and was removed.
histogram.summary: Creating a new MTLLibrary will automatically retry if its callback is not invoked within a short timeframe. This records the attempt number whose callback was executed first. Recorded after every call to -[MTLDeviceProxy newLibraryWithSource:] completes.

histogram.name: Gpu.MetalProxy.NewRenderPipelineStateAttempt
histogram.obsolete: This did not substantially improve the situation and was removed.
histogram.summary: Creating a new MTLRenderPipelineState will automatically retry if its callback is not invoked within a short timeframe. This records the attempt number whose callback was executed first. Recorded after every call to -[MTLDeviceProxy newRenderPipelineStateWithDescriptor:] completes.

histogram.name: GPU.OopRaster.PaintOpSerializationSize
histogram.summary: This records the number of bytes required to serialize a paint op for OOP rasterization. The metric is recorded each time an op is serialized with a size > 512k bytes.

histogram.name: GPU.Output.MaxLuminance
histogram.summary: Records the display maximum lumens as reported by Windows. Recorded once for each monitor when the gpu process starts. If monitor enumeration fails, this metric will not be provided.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.CompressDataSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary: Whether we succeeded in compressing program data. Expected to always be true.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.CompressDataTime
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary:
The time to compress a program's binary data during insertion into the program cache.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.CompressionPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary: The percentage of raw size that a program binary takes after compression.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.DecompressDataSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary: Whether we succeeded in decompressing program data. Failure indicates disk or memory corruption.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.DecompressDataTime
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary:
The time to decompress a program's binary data during retrieval from the program cache.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.LoadBinarySuccess
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary: Records if the call to glProgramBinary was successful. This can legitimately fail if the driver wants chrome to re-link and re-cache the gpu program.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.MemoryReleasedOnPressure
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary: Amount of memory released from the program cache on memory pressure.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.MemorySizeAfterKb
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary: Records the total in-memory cache size, before a program is cached. Can be used with GPU.ProgramCache.MemorySizeBeforeKb to find the maximum cache size distribution.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.MemorySizeBeforeKb
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary: Records the total in-memory cache size, after a program is cached. Can be used with GPU.ProgramCache.MemorySizeAfterKb to find the maximum cache size distribution.

histogram.name: GPU.ProgramCache.ProgramBinarySizeBytes
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. ProgramCache not actively being tuned.
histogram.summary: The size of program binaries loaded into the gpu program cache.

histogram.name: GPU.SoftwareRendererLifetimeEvents
histogram.summary: Counts of the number of gpu process crashes when the software rasterizer is enabled.

histogram.name: GPU.SupportsVulkan
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. Data has been collected on Windows.
histogram.summary: This metric shows whether the GPU supports Vulkan. It is recorded 15 seconds after the browser launch.

histogram.name: GPU.SurfaceCountAtExit
histogram.summary: The number of surfaces that the GPU process was rendering to right before exiting. This should be equal to the number of tabs (both visible and hidden) rendering via the compositor.

histogram.name: GPU.SwiftShaderLifetimeEvents
histogram.summary: Counts of the number of process launches and crashes (when running on s/w).

histogram.name: GPU.TextureR16Ext_LuminanceF16
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. Both LUMINANCE_F16 and R16_EXT must be supported for now.
histogram.summary: Whether LUMINANCE_F16 and/or R16_EXT texture support is available. Recorded each time a new context group is initialized and extensions are detected.

histogram.name: GPU.ThreeDAPIInfoBarDismissal
histogram.summary: Counts user actions when a 3D API info bar is raised.

histogram.name: GPU.VulkanExtSupport.VK_KHR_external_memory_win32
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. Data has been collected on Windows.
histogram.summary: Whether the Vulkan extension VK_KHR_external_memory_win32 is supported in the GPU drivers. It is recorded 15 seconds after the browser launch.

histogram.name: GPU.VulkanExtSupport.VK_KHR_external_semaphore_win32
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. Data has been collected on Windows.
histogram.summary: Whether the Vulkan extension VK_KHR_external_semaphore_win32 is supported in the GPU drivers. It is recorded 15 seconds after the browser launch.

histogram.name: GPU.VulkanExtSupport.VK_KHR_win32_keyed_mutex
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. Data has been collected on Windows.
histogram.summary: Whether the Vulkan extension VK_KHR_win32_keyed_mutex is supported in the GPU drivers. It is recorded 15 seconds after the browser launch.

histogram.name: GPU.VulkanVersion
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. Data has been collected on Windows.
histogram.summary: The maximum Vulkan API version supported in the gpu drivers. It is recorded 15 seconds after the browser launch.

histogram.name: GPU.WatchdogThread.Event.V2
histogram.obsolete: No longer used after GPU watchdog V2 is enabled by default in M82. It's the same as the default histogram GPU.WatchdogThread.Event.
histogram.summary: Recorded for each time the GPU watchdog V2 thread starts, crashes and ends.

histogram.name: GPU.WatchdogThread.V1.ExtraThreadTime
histogram.obsolete: GPU watchdog V1 is disabled in M82. Please see GPU.WatchdogThread.ExtraThreadTime for the result of V2.
histogram.summary: The time the GPU main thread needs to make any progress after the first watchdog timeout.

histogram.name: GPU.WatchdogThread.V1.Timeout
histogram.obsolete: GPU watchdog V1 is disabled in M82. Please see GPU.WatchdogThread.Timeout for the result of V2.
histogram.summary: Recorded timeout events when the GPU watchdog V2 enters OnWatchdogTimeout.

histogram.name: GPU.WatchdogThread.V1.WaitTime
histogram.obsolete: GPU watchdog V1 is disabled in M82. Please see GPU.WatchdogThread.WaitTime for the result of V2.
histogram.summary: Record the wait time in OnWatchdogTimeout() for the GPU main thread to make any progress.

histogram.name: Graphics.Smoothness.Throughput
histogram.obsolete: As of 2020-02-12, this is deprecated in favor of Graphics.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames.

histogram.name: Graphics.Smoothness.Throughput.AllAnimations
histogram.obsolete: As of 2020-02-12, this is deprecated in favor of Graphics.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames.AllAnimations.

histogram.name: Graphics.Smoothness.Throughput.AllInteractions
histogram.obsolete: As of 2020-02-12, this is deprecated in favor of Graphics.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames.AllInteractions.
histogram.summary: As of 2020-02-12, this is deprecated in favor of Graphics.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames.AllInteractions.

histogram.name: Graphics.Smoothness.Throughput.AllSequences
histogram.obsolete: As of 2020-02-12, this is deprecated in favor of Graphics.Smoothness.PercentDroppedFrames.AllSequence.

histogram.name: GwpAsan.AllocatorOom.Malloc
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2020; currently unowned, and histogram gathering was causing crashes.
histogram.summary: Reports how many allocations it took for malloc GWP-ASan to OOM. Reported the first time the allocator fails to consecutively allocate GuardedPageAllocator::kOutOfMemoryCount allocations in a row.

histogram.name: GwpAsan.AllocatorOom.PartitionAlloc
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2020; currently unowned, and histogram gathering was causing crashes.
histogram.summary: Reports how many allocations it took for PartitionAlloc GWP-ASan to OOM. Reported the first time the allocator fails to consecutively allocate GuardedPageAllocator::kOutOfMemoryCount allocations in a row.

histogram.name: Hardware.Drive.HasSeekPenalty
histogram.obsolete: Removed 1/2020 - but the data exists in system_profile under hardware.app_drive and hardware.user_data_app_drive
histogram.summary: Whether a drive has a seek penalty (i.e. is a spinning disk). Emitted 0-2 times shortly after startup when constructing the initial UMA log.

histogram.name: Hardware.Drive.HasSeekPenalty_Success
histogram.obsolete: Removed 1/2020 - but the data exists in system_profile under hardware.app_drive and hardware.user_data_app_drive
histogram.summary:
Whether it was possible to determine if a drive has a seek penalty. This can fail for various reasons (device drivers don't offer this information, the drive is still mounting, lack of access, etc.). Emitted twice shortly after startup when constructing the initial UMA log.
Seek penalty detection is disabled on XP/Vista as of 9/24/2015 because it crashes too much. http://crbug.com/514822

histogram.name: Hardware.Drive.HasSeekPenalty_Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed 1/2020 - but the data exists in system_profile under hardware.app_drive and hardware.user_data_app_drive
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to determine whether a drive has a seek penalty. Emitted twice shortly after startup when constructing the initial UMA log.

histogram.name: Hardware.Serial.NewMinusOldDeviceListSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M83 after all code for the old enumeration method had been removed.
histogram.summary: On Windows and Mac, we're implementing new methods to enumerate serial devices that provide us more information about the actual devices. This metric measures the difference between the number of devices that the new and old enumeration methods find. Once this metric gives us confidence that the new and old methods are at parity, we can cut out the old method altogether.

histogram.name: HeavyPageCapping.BlacklistReason
histogram.summary: Records that the capping heavy pages InfoBar was allowed or the specific reason that the feature was blacklisted from heavy page capping. Recorded when the triggering threshold is met for users with capping heavy pages enabled. Reasons are ordered in the same order they are checked.

histogram.name: HeavyPageCapping.InfoBarInteraction
histogram.summary: Records the details of user interaction with the heavy page capping InfoBar.

histogram.name: HeavyPageCapping.RecordedDataSavings
histogram.summary: Records the data savings due to heavy page capping. This is recorded when the page is being terminated. This is not recorded when the tab is backgrounded, so android fast shutdown may result in this metric not being recorded. This is only recorded for page loads that were still paused when the page was terminated.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesBrowser
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a browser for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency MAY appear time and again as the same corrupt histogram is examined for each potenital UMA upload.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesBrowserUnique
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a browser for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency will only appear at most one time for each histogram in a single process (i.e., duplicate corruption in a single histogram is not noted in this chart.)

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesChildProcess
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a child process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency MAY appear time and again as the same corrupt histogram is examined for each potenital UMA upload.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesChildProcessUnique
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a child process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency will only appear at most one time for each histogram in a single process (i.e., duplicate corruption in a single histogram is not noted in this chart.)

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesRenderer
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a renderer for transmission to the browser. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted to the browser. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency MAY appear time and again as the same corrupt histogram is examined for each potenital UMA upload.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistenciesRendererUnique
histogram.summary: The number of inconsistency events found when examining a single histogram's data in a renderer for transmission to the browser. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted to the browser. Each type of inconsistency is a bit, and all bits found in one histogram examination are added together to summarize the inconsistent event. Note that the same inconsistency will only appear at most one time for each histogram in a single renderer process (i.e., duplicate corruption in a single histogram is not noted in this chart.)

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentCountHigh
histogram.summary: The number of extra samples counted in the redundant_count in a histogram that were not found by summing the samples in the buckets.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentCountLow
histogram.summary: The number of missing samples in the redundant_count in a histogram that were found by summing the samples in the buckets.

histogram.name: Histogram.InconsistentSnapshotRenderer
histogram.summary: The amount of discrepancy found when examining a single histogram's data in a renderer process for transmission via UMA. Inconsistent data is NOT transmitted via UMA.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.Duration.PartialDeletion
histogram.obsolete: Removed May 2020, replaced with more detailed histograms: History.ClearBrowsingData.Duration.TimeRangeDeletion, History.ClearBrowsingData.Duration.OriginDeletion, History.ClearBrowsingData.Duration.FilteredDeletion.
histogram.summary: The time that passed while performing a browsing data deletion for a restricted amount of time (e.g. "Last hour") or with an origin filter.

histogram.name: History.ClearBrowsingData.SpannableStringAppliedCorrectly
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2020 since the histogram indicators were stable.
histogram.summary: Track whether the SpannableString is applied correctly in ClearBrowsingDataCheckbox.java. (crbug.com/783866)

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredPercentage
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Size of the recovered Favicons database relative to the original corrupt database. Recovery is VACUUM-like, so the resulting database should always be smaller. Substantial 100% results would indicate empty databases being recovered, substantial low% results would indicate very little data being recovered.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsFaviconBitmaps
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [favicon_bitmaps] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsFavicons
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [favicons] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecoveredRowsIconMapping
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Rows recovered from [icon_mapping] table in Favicons recovery.

histogram.name: History.FaviconsRecovery
histogram.obsolete: No longer tracked as of March 2017.
histogram.summary: Track results of SQLite database recovery code in thumbnail_database.cc.

histogram.name: History.HistoryServiceInitTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2020. The vast majority of the time this is under 50ms.
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during HistoryService::Init.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryDBKeywordTermsPopulate
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2020 as not deemed necessary.
histogram.summary: Time to load in-memory keyword_search_terms table from disk. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryDBKeywordURLPopulate
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2020 as not deemed necessary.
histogram.summary: Time to load in-memory urls table from disk urls table. Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryTypedUrlVisitCount
histogram.obsolete: No longer needed. Removed Aug 2019 as part of crbug.com/969934 cleanup.
histogram.summary: The sum of the visit_count fields for all URLs in the "in memory" history database. This corresponds to the number of times the user has visited the typed URLs in the last 30 days (excluding page reloads, since the history database does not increment the visit_count in that case). Recorded on profile open.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLCacheSize
histogram.summary: Size of on-disk cache for in-memory url index. Recorded on profile open when restoring from a cache file.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLChars
histogram.summary: Number of items in the in-memory url index char_word_map_. Recorded on profile open when restoring from a cache file and again shortly after profile open when rebuilding the in-memory url index from history.

histogram.name: History.InMemoryURLWords
histogram.summary: Number of items in in-memory url index word_map_. Recorded on profile open when restoring from a cache file and again shortly after profile open when rebuilding the in-memory url index from history.

histogram.name: History.TopHostsVisitsByRank
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2018, not used in production since 2/2018.
histogram.summary: Page visits to each of a user's top 50 hosts. The bucket is the 1-based rank of the host. Visits to all other hosts go into the 51st bucket. Android-only. Only counts the last URL in a redirect chain and does not include reloads. The list of top hosts is computed approximately nightly. This means that a given day will likely include a recalculation of top hosts, and therefore a given bucket may represent two different hosts at different times of day.

histogram.name: History.TopSitesVisitsByRank
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Page visits to each of a user's top 50 sites. Visits to all other sites go into the 51st bucket. Only count the page visit if it came from user browsing and only count it once when cycling through a redirect chain.

histogram.name: History.UpdateTopSitesOnDBThreadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed because only the execution time at startup is of interest. See histogram History.UpdateTopSitesOnDBThread_Startup_Time.
histogram.summary: The amount of time for function history::TopSitesBackend::UpdateTopSitesOnDBThread to execute. Excludes the case where local TopSitesDatabase db_ is unavailable, i.e. where the update doesn't really happen.

histogram.name: Hotword.AudioLoggingEnabled
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: The state of the hotword audio logging preference. This value is emitted each time the hotword availability is requested by the extension if the user is also opted in to hotword voice search. This check typically happens each time a hotword search is initiated.

histogram.name: Hotword.Enabled
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: The state of the hotword preference. This value is emitted during HotwordService initialization which happens during Profile initialization.

histogram.name: Hotword.ExtensionAvailability
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: Whether the external component hotword extension exists (i.e., not pending download, disabled, etc.). This value is emitted each time the hotword availability is requested by the extension which typically happens each time a hotword search is initiated.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordError
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: Errors reported by the hotword service when determining if hotwording is available. Non-errors are also reported so that errors can be seen as a percentage of total requests.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordMediaStreamResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: Success or error when attempting to open a MediaStream for the microphone. At most one success or error will be logged for an attempt to open a stream.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordNaClMessageTimeout
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: Timeout occured while waiting for a message from the NaCl hotword detector plugin. This value is the message that was expected to be received from the plugin.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordNaClPluginLoadResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: Success or error when attempting to load the NaCl hotword detector plugin.

histogram.name: Hotword.HotwordTriggerSource
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: Location of hotword trigger. Emitted every time the hotword is triggered by the user saying 'Ok Google'.

histogram.name: Hotword.SharedModuleReinstallLanguage
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2017. Feature removed with crbug/761426.
histogram.summary: Language, switched to by the user, that triggered a hotword shared module reinstall.

histogram.name: HTMLImport.UnexpectedRequest
histogram.summary: Logs the type of requests made by HTML imports with wrong fetcher.

histogram.name: HttpCache.AsyncValidationDuration
histogram.summary: The time spent performing an asynchronous revalidation that was triggered by a Cache-Control: stale-while-revalidate directive. This is recorded when the asynchronous revalidation completes, either after the response was completely read or an error occurred. One entry is recorded for each asynchronous revalidation that is performed.

histogram.name: HttpCache.ExternallyConditionalized
histogram.obsolete: stale-while-revalidate implementation removed for now, see https://crbug.com/700568.
histogram.summary: Count of the number of external (ie. from Blink) conditionalized requests, and whether or not those requests could have been served from the browser cache.

histogram.name: HttpCache.NetworkIsolationKeyPresent
histogram.summary: Records whether a cache request has a network isolation key set or not, which is used for double-keying.

histogram.name: HttpCache.OfflineStatus
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Result of a main page HttpCacheTransaction if offline mode had been enabled.

histogram.name: HttpCache.PercentBeforeSend
histogram.summary: For http cache transactions in which a network request was sent, the percentage of total request time that elapsed before sending the request over the network; this is the time spent accessing the disk cache.

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.FreshnessPeriodsSinceLastUsed
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a cache entry exists but it cannot be used because the entry's age is beyond its freshness: counts how many freshness periods have elapsed since the entry was last used (x1000).

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.Updated.Age
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a validation attempt is made due to a stale entry and is updated (e.g., 200), records the age of the entry in seconds.

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.Updated.AgeInFreshnessPeriods
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a validation attempt is made due to a stale entry and is updated (e.g., 200), records the age of the entry as percentage of freshness period.

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.Validated.Age
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a validation attempt is made due to a stale entry and is validated (304), records the age of the entry in seconds.

histogram.name: HttpCache.StaleEntry.Validated.AgeInFreshnessPeriods
histogram.summary: For each http cache transaction for which a validation attempt is made due to a stale entry and is validated (304), records the age of the entry as percentage of freshness period.

histogram.name: HttpCache.TopFrameOriginPresent
histogram.summary: Records whether a cache request has a top frame origin set or not, which is used for double-keying.

histogram.name: HttpCache.Vary
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The type of Vary header for a given GET response.

histogram.name: Import.IncludesPasswords.Firefox
histogram.summary: Whether or not the password checkbox is checked when importing a profile of Firefox. Note that canceled imports could be counted also.

histogram.name: Import.NumberOfImportedPasswords.Firefox
histogram.summary: The number of passwords that are imported from Firefox. This is recorded when importing a profile of Firefox with the password checkbox checked. Note that the reported number of password could be slightly bigger than the actual number of imported passwords because some incomplete or blacklisted passwords that are dropped while importing might be included in the reported value.

histogram.name: Import.ShowDialog.FromBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import.ShowDialog.FromFloatingBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from NTP floating BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import_ShowDlg.FromBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: Import_ShowDlg.FromFloatingBookmarkBarView
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time from install time to time that user opens import dialog from NTP floating BookmarkBarView.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileDeleteError
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by ImportantFile.FileDeleteNoRetryError, ImportantFile.FileDeleteRetryExceededError, and ImportantFile.FileDeleteRetrySuccessCount in M84.
histogram.summary: File error happened upon temporary file deletion at ImportantFileWriter.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.FileOpenError
histogram.summary: File error happened upon opening temporary file at ImportantFileWriter.

histogram.name: ImportantFile.TimeToWrite
histogram.summary: Time used to atomically write string into a file using ImportantFileWriter.

histogram.name: InertialSensor.RotationVectorAndroidAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the Sensor.TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR was available at the start of Device Orientation.

histogram.name: InputMethod.Commit.Type
histogram.summary: The suggestion accuracy type which the user chooses to commit.

histogram.name: InputMethod.ID
histogram.obsolete: This is deprecated since M46, InputMethod.ID2 is used since then.
histogram.summary: The breakdown of input method usage by input method IDs. Recorded when the user presses keys on physical or on-screen keyboard.

histogram.name: InputMethod.RegisterProxyView
histogram.summary: The result of registering proxy view to InputMethodManager.

histogram.name: Installer.Recovery.Count
histogram.summary:
The number of times the device has been recovered.
This is reported on reboot after a successful recovery. Cleared only when switching to dev mode or on factory reset.
This metric is specific to Chrome OS.

histogram.name: InstallSigner.InvalidCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 4/2015. It appears the code at some point changed to use the histogram name 'ExtensionInstallSigner.InvalidCount' and we forgot to update this histogram name.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This is a count of the number of ids that we asked to be signed which the server response indicated were not in the webstore.

histogram.name: InstallSigner.InvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extensions install signer got a well-formed result from the server but the signature check on it failed.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackInvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier tried to get a new signature and received a response but it wasn't properly signed.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackNoSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier tried to get a new signature but was unable to (network error contacting the server, response from server was malformed, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.CallbackValidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier got a new signature from the server that was valid.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitGoodSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a valid signature at startup, and this is a count of the number of signed ids it contained.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitInvalidSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a signature in the prefs at startup, and it parsed properly, but it was invalid (some ids may have been added/removed, could not verify it was signed with the correct private key, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitNoSignature
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier did not find any signature in the prefs at startup.

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.InitUnparseablePref
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier found a signature in the prefs at startup, but it wasn't parseable (missing/wrong format of required keys, etc.).

histogram.name: InstallVerifier.SignatureFailedButNotEnforcing
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The extension install verifier would have disabled an extension but is not in enforcement mode.

histogram.name: InstanceID.DeleteToken.CompleteTime
histogram.summary: Length of time taken to complete the DeleteToken request successfully. If the request is retried multiple times, the length of time is counted for the last successful retry.

histogram.name: InstanceID.DeleteToken.RetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before DeleteToken succeeds.

histogram.name: InstanceID.Enabled
histogram.summary: Whether the Instance ID API is enabled. Checked when a chrome.instanceID function is called.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GeneratedNewID
histogram.summary: Counts the events when the GCM integration generates and registers a new instance ID with FCM. This histogram acts as a pure counter and only emits 'true' values. The goal of the histogram is to detect potential instance ID leaks. It's best interpreted in relation to the reported number of syncing/sync-transport users.

histogram.name: InstanceID.GetToken.RetryCount
histogram.summary: Number of retries before GetToken succeeds.

histogram.name: Instant.InstantControllerEvent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records various events of interest in the InstantController. E.g. When URLs are blacklisted.

histogram.name: Instant.SessionsStorageNamespace
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often an Instant preview is committed onto a different tab than it was created from.

histogram.name: Instant.TimeToFirstShow
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time between the first Omnibox interaction and when the Instant preview shows. If the instant preview was already showing when the user interacted with the omnibox, this histogram is not recorded.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.CacheableNTPLoad
histogram.summary: Records a histogram for how often the Cacheable NTP fails to load.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.FallbackToLocalOverlay
histogram.obsolete: Depcreated as of 10/2013. No longer relevant since the HTML overlay was abandoned.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the cause for falling back to a local overlay at the time of fallback.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.InstantNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2013. This histogram is no longer relevant since the HTML overlay went away.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records a histogram for instant extended (Local NTP and Online NTP) and non-extended navigations.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.NewOptInState
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, whether the user has chosen to opt-in to or opt-out of InstantExtended via chrome://flags.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.OptInState
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2013-06. As of m30 use InstantExtended.NewOptInState.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, whether the user has chosen to opt-in to or opt-out of InstantExtended via chrome://flags.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchQuerytoQuery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to another search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchQuerytoURL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to a url. Example: Accidental search for google.con, then navigation to google.com.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchURLtoQuery
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to a search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchURLtoURL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to another url.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_QuerytoQuery
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2016 with the removal of query in the omnibox code.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to another search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_QuerytoURL
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2016 with the removal of query in the omnibox code.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a search query to a url. Example: Accidental search for google.con, then navigation to google.com.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_URLtoQuery
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2016 because (i) this measurement was somewhat wrong, (ii) it's difficult to understand the data, and (iii) there are better ways to answer the same question. The measurement is somewhat wrong because reloads, link drops, and pasting URLs and pressing enter are all incorrectly logged to the URLtoQuery histogram, not the URLtoURL histogram. Futhermore, this histogram is difficult to analyze because it's not broken up by input length. Short URLs can by random chance have a sizable percentage match with a query. Finally, there are better source for data like this; ask mpearson for details.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to a search query.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PercentageMatchV2_URLtoURL
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2016 because (i) this measurement was somewhat wrong, and (ii) there are better ways to answer the same question. The measurement is somewhat wrong because reloads, link drops, and pasting URLs and pressing enter are all incorrectly logged to the URLtoQuery histogram, not the URLtoURL histogram. Furthermore, there are better source for data like this; ask mpearson for details.
histogram.summary: Records the number of matching characters at the start of the user's text as a percentage of average length between the old and new text when the user navigates from a url to another url.

histogram.name: InstantExtended.PrefValue
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2013-06. This preference has not been exposed or used for months, and we do not plan to use it in the future.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Records, on startup, the value of the "Allow your search engine to provide Instant result" preference setting for the first profile loaded.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.PreviewScrollState
histogram.summary: Records the scroll state on the preview page when instant search clicks feature is triggered.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.ReasonForSwap
histogram.summary: Records the reason that triggered the page swap when instant search clicks feature is triggered.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.TimeInPreview
histogram.summary: The time spent by the user in preview page before swapping to original or navigating out of preview page.

histogram.name: InstantSearchClicks.TimeToSwap
histogram.summary: The time it took for swap to trigger for all swaps. The is the time between preview page load start to preview page swap with the original page.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.ConnectionToHostResult.SuccessRate
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
Captures the count of successful and failed connection attempts.
This metric counts the top-level user action from beginning to connect, all the way through success or failure of the connection (excluding any programmatic retries within the connection attempt).
This metric provides an immediate understanding of the Instant Tethering connection success rate. The counts of failure are broken down in InstantTethering.ConnectionToHostResult.Failure.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.GattConnectionAttempt.EffectiveSuccessRateWithRetries
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
Captures the effective count of successful and failed GATT connection attempts, including retries. This means that if a GATT connection attempt fails but then succeeds on a future retry, this is counted as a single success. In the context of this metric, a failure represents a GATT failure in all retry attempts.
An individual attempt is considered successful if a GATT connection was created and authenticated successfully (i.e., the connection was ready for Instant Tethering to exchange protocol messages).

histogram.name: InstantTethering.GattConnectionAttempt.EffectiveSuccessRateWithRetries.Background
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
Captures the effective count of successful and failed GATT connection attempts, including retries. This means that if a GATT connection attempt fails but then succeeds on a future retry, this is counted as a single success. In the context of this metric, a failure represents a GATT failure in all retry attempts.
An individual attempt is considered successful if a GATT connection was created and authenticated successfully (i.e., the connection was ready for Instant Tethering to exchange protocol messages).
This metric is the background advertisement analog of InstantTethering.GattConnectionAttempt.EffectiveSuccessRateWithRetries.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.GattConnectionAttempt.SuccessRate
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
Captures the count of successful and failed GATT connection attempts.
An attempt is considered successful if a GATT connection was created and authenticated successfully (i.e., the connection was ready for Instant Tethering to exchange protocol messages).

histogram.name: InstantTethering.GattConnectionAttempt.SuccessRate.Background
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
Captures the count of successful and failed GATT connection attempts.
An attempt is considered successful if a GATT connection was created and authenticated successfully (i.e., the connection was ready for Instant Tethering to exchange protocol messages).
This metric is the background advertisement analog of InstantTethering.GattConnectionAttempt.SuccessRate.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.AdvertisementToConnectionDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
The duration of time between when a client begins to scan and advertise, and connects to a host (before authentication).
This histogram only considers the time from when the client *sends* an advertisement, and not when the client *receives* an advertisement. See InstantTethering.Performance.StartScanToReceiveAdvertisementDuration and InstantTethering.Performance.ReceiveAdvertisementToConnectionDuration for histograms that consider when the client receives an advertisement.
This histogram is the foreground advertisement analog of InstantTethering.Performance.StartScanToConnectionDuration.Background.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.ConnectionToAuthenticationDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary: The duration of time between when a client connects to a host, and authenticates with that host.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.ConnectionToAuthenticationDuration.Background
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
The duration of time between when a client connects to a host, and authenticates with that host.
This histogram is the background advertisement analog of InstantTethering.Performance.ConnectionToAuthenticationDuration.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.ConnectToHostDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary: The duration of time it takes for the client to connect to the host, from the moment the user taps 'Connect', until the client connects to the host's hotspot. This does not include timeouts.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.ReceiveAdvertisementToConnectionDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary: The duration of time between when a client received a foreground advertisement from a host, and connected to that host (before authentication).

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.ReceiveAdvertisementToConnectionDuration.Background
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
The duration of time between when a client received a background advertisement from a host, and connected to that host (before authentication).
This histogram is the background advertisement analog of InstantTethering.Performance.ReceiveAdvertisementToConnectionDuration.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.StartScanToConnectionDuration.Background
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
The duration of time between when a client begins to scan, and connects to a host (before authentication).
This histogram is the background advertisement analog of InstantTethering.Performance.AdvertisementToConnectionDuration.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.StartScanToReceiveAdvertisementDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary: The duration of time between when a client begins to scan and advertise, and receives a foreground advertisement from a host.

histogram.name: InstantTethering.Performance.StartScanToReceiveAdvertisementDuration.Background
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02 in favor of MultiDevice.* equivalent.
histogram.summary:
The duration of time between when a client begins to scan, and receives a background advertisement from a host.
This histogram is the background advertisement analog of InstantTethering.Performance.AdvertisementToConnectionDuration.
