histogram.name: interstitial.authority_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_AUTHORITY_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.common_name_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.date_invalid_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, which may be either accept or deny. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings with a CERT_DATE_INVALID warning. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by interstitial.ssl_overridable.* and interstitial.ssl_nonoverridable.* in Jan 2015 (M42).
histogram.summary: User action when the user is shown a SSL interstitial. SHOW_ALL and MORE refer to the total number of SSL errors; all of the other numbers pertain to the number of actions related to SSL errors that are overridable. The counts do not sum to 100%; SHOW_ALL is a superset of SHOW_OVERRIDABLE, which in turn will be a supserset of the PROCEED/DONT_PROCEED variables. SHOW_UNDERSTAND is only being used by an experimental field trial. The interstitials due to captive portals are now recorded in the "SSLCaptivePortal".

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network
histogram.obsolete: Removed August 2016. Replaced with interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network2, which records reasons why network time might be unavailable.
histogram.summary: State of the system clock, relative to network time, when an SSL CERT_INVALID_DATE error is seen.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network2
histogram.obsolete: Removed October 2016. Due to a bug, data in this histogram is mislabelled and should be disregarded. Replaced with interstitial.ssl.clockstate.network3.
histogram.summary: State of the system clock, relative to network time, when an SSL CERT_INVALID_DATE error is seen.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.did_user_revoke_decisions
histogram.summary: Specifies when a user enters the page info menu whether or not the user pressed the SSL decisions revoke button. This can only by done if the user is in the "Remember Certificate Error Decisions" experiment. This is logged when the page info UI is closed. Replaced by .did_user_revoke_decisions2 to keep data separate after changing functionality to only log when button was visible.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.expiration_and_decision.nonoverridable
histogram.summary: Records when a user has made a decision to proceed on a nonoverridable SSL interstitial. Also records whether a prior decision had been made but the decision expired.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.expiration_and_decision.overridable
histogram.summary: Records when a user has made a decision to proceed on an overridable SSL interstitial. Also records whether a prior decision had been made but the decision expired.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.good_cert_seen
histogram.summary: Emitted when a good certificate is seen, specifying whether the user already gave an exception for a bad certificate for the same host.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.good_cert_seen_type_is_frame
histogram.summary: Whether the resource type for a request that succeeded with a good cert and revoked a certificate exception is for a frame (as opposed to subresource).

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.severity_score.authority_invalid
histogram.summary: The likelihood of a |CERT_AUTHORITY_INVALID| error being an attack.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.severity_score.common_name_invalid
histogram.summary: The likelihood of a |CERT_COMMON_NAME_INVALID| error being an attack.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl.severity_score.date_invalid
histogram.summary: The likelihood of a |CERT_DATE_INVALID| error being an attack.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_accept_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, when the user accepts the SSL warning. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_error_handler.superfish
histogram.summary: When encountering a certificate error, Chrome looks for the well-known Superfish certificate in the certificate chain and records this histogram as true if the Superfish certificate is present and false otherwise. The Superfish certificate is an indication that the user is vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks because of software installed on their computer.

histogram.name: interstitial.ssl_reject_time
histogram.summary: The time between the SSL interstitial display and the user decision, when the user rejects the SSL warning. This is only recorded for overridable SSL warnings. Timing begins when user first focuses on the page.

histogram.name: Invalidations.NetworkChannel
histogram.summary: Network channel used for invalidations.

histogram.name: IOS.CanonicalURLResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-01. As of M65 use Mobile.CanonicalURLResult.
histogram.summary: The result of the operation to retrieve the page's canonical URL.

histogram.name: IOS.Inspect.Console
histogram.summary: Recorded when the iOS JavaScript Console logging is manually enabled or manually disabled.

histogram.name: IOS.MailtoURLRewritten
histogram.summary: Counts the times when a mailto: URL is tapped by user and whether the URL has been rewritten for an available native Mail client app or not.

histogram.name: IOS.PageLoadCountMigration.Counts
histogram.summary: Counts different types of navigation and loading events that are relevant to counting page loads.

histogram.name: IOS.ProviderIsValidOnShutdown
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user quits the app. True if ChromeBrowserProvider is a non-null pointer. Chrome for iOS has frequent crashes during shutdown caused by dereferencing null or dangling ChromeBrowserProvider pointer (crbug.com/983504). ChromeBrowserProvider can only be null if iOS did not call application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions: callback. This metric should help to understand if ChromeBrowserProvider can even be null after app is launched.

histogram.name: IOS.ShowTabSwitcherSnapshotResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of snapshotting when the user enters the tab switcher. Recorded whenever the user enters the tab switcher.

histogram.name: IOS.TabGridMediator.DidDetachNilWebStateList
histogram.summary: WebStateList should be guaranteed to be non-nil during a WebStateListObserver callback. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant holding when webStateList:DidDetachWebState: is invoked in TabGridMediator. Violations of this invariant is the cause of real-world crashes (https://crbug.com/877792), which were not currently reproducible in testing. This histogram is used to retain visibility of the severity of this issue, while preventing the crashes with a no-op.

histogram.name: IOS.TabGridMediator.GetActiveTabIDNilWebStateList
histogram.summary: WebStateList should be guaranteed to be non-nil during a WebStateListObserver callback. This histogram counts the frequency of this invariant holding when GetActiveTabID() is invoked in TabGridMediator. Violations of this invariant is the cause of real-world crashes (https://crbug.com/877792), which were not currently reproducible in testing. This histogram is used to retain visibility of the severity of this issue, while preventing the crashes with a no-op.

histogram.name: IOS.WKWebViewStartProvisionalNavigationWithEmptyURL
histogram.summary: On iOS9, didStartProvisionalNavigation may be called with empty URL. However in didCommitNavigation the URL will be about:blank. This historgram checks if this still happens in later iOS versions, and records it when it happens.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CharacterCount
histogram.summary: The count of the number of characters in JavaScript dialog messages.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CharacterCountUserSuppressed
histogram.summary: The count of the number of characters in JavaScript dialog messages that were suppressed by the user. Compare with JSDialogs.CountOfJSDialogMessageCharacters.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CountOfJSDialogMessageCharacters
histogram.summary: The count of the number of characters in JavaScript dialog messages.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CountOfJSDialogMessageNewlines
histogram.summary: The count of the number of newlines in JavaScript dialog messages. (This does not count breaks inserted by the UI toolkit in wrapping the messages.)

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CountOfOnBeforeUnloadMessageCharacters
histogram.summary: The count of the number of characters in onbeforeunload messages.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.CountOfOnBeforeUnloadMessageNewlines
histogram.summary: The count of the number of newlines in onbeforeunload messages. (This does not count breaks inserted by the UI toolkit in wrapping the messages.)

histogram.name: JSDialogs.DismissalCause
histogram.summary: The cause of dismissal of JavaScript dialogs.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenDialogClosedAndNextDialogCreated
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between closing a Javascript dialog and opening another, to track very frequent dialogs.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenDialogCreatedAndNextDialogCreated
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between opening a Javascript dialog and opening another, to track very frequent dialogs.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenDialogCreatedAndSameDialogClosed
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between opening a Javascript dialog and closing it, to track very short-lived dialogs.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.IsForemost
histogram.summary: For dialogs, whether or not they were spawned by a tab that was foremost.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.SiteEngagementOfBeforeUnload
histogram.summary: The site engagement values of sites showing onbeforeunload dialogs. Logged once per dialog, whether shown or suppressed.

histogram.name: JSDialogs.SiteEngagementOfDialogs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-10. Site engagement needed to be measured in small buckets anyway so it was never high-resolution enough for use.
histogram.summary: The site engagement values of sites showing dialogs. Logged once per dialog, whether shown or suppressed.

histogram.name: Keyboard.KeystrokeDeltas
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2016 in crbug.com/631204 with KeyboardUmaEventFilter removal.
histogram.summary: The time between keystrokes in Aura text fields. The only keystrokes that are measured are ones that produce a printable character and are not over 5 seconds apart.

histogram.name: Keyboard.Shortcuts.CrosSearchKeyDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-07. Search key shortcut analysis is done.
histogram.summary: The time between a user pressing the Chrome OS "Search" key and the second key being pressed down to active a shortcut. e.g. Search + L would record the time between Search key down and L key down. If the user pressed multiple keys after Search, we only record the first key down.

histogram.name: Keyboard.ShortcutViewer.SearchUpdateTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-06. Shortcut viewer has been in production for many milestones and its performance is adequate.
histogram.summary: Time delay to make the visual update in response to a search-query. Note that this does *not* include the initial delay to trigger the update after the initial keystroke to change the search-query string.

histogram.name: Keyboard.ShortcutViewer.SearchUpdateTimeVisual
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-06. Shortcut viewer has been in production for many milestones and its performance is adequate.
histogram.summary: Time delay for the visual update to be visible on screen in response to a search-query. Note that this does *not* include the initial delay to trigger the update after the initial keystroke to change the search-query string.

histogram.name: KeyboardAccessory.GeneratedPasswordDialog
histogram.summary: Android only. Records the interaction with the password generation dialog.

histogram.name: KioskNextHome.Bridge.Action
histogram.summary: Records usage of methods in KioskNextHome Mojo bridge. Recorded on every method invocation.

histogram.name: KioskNextHome.Bridge.GetAndroidIdSuccess
histogram.summary: Records the result (success or failure) of every call from KioskNextHome bridge to get the Android id.

histogram.name: KioskNextHome.Bridge.LaunchIntentResult
histogram.summary: Records the result (success or error reason) of every call from KioskNextHome bridge to launch an intent.

histogram.name: KioskNextHome.StateTransition.AnimationSmoothness
histogram.summary: Relative smoothness of animations of KioskNext Home state transitions. 100% represents ideally smooth 60 frames per second. 50% represents only 30 frames per second is achieved during the animations. 0% should not happen. This metric is recorded exactly once when the user switches states of the KioskNext Home.

histogram.name: KioskNextShell.EnabledState
histogram.summary: Records when KioskNextShell becomes enabled or disabled.

histogram.name: KioskNextShell.Launched
histogram.summary: Records launches of KioskNextShell. Only true is recorded.

histogram.name: Launch.InvalidIntent
histogram.summary: Records whether or not an invalid Android Intent was fired to launch Chrome. (http://crbug.com/445136)

histogram.name: Launch.MashService
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-05 -- removed as part of removing mash code
histogram.summary: Records when a mojo ash UI service is started, for example the mojo app version of the keyboard shortcut viewer.

histogram.name: Layout.ScrollRestoration.PrecededByJsScroll
histogram.summary: We are considering allowing JS scrolling to prevent browser scroll position restoration. This histogram measures the impact of that change, in terms of how often restoration would be prevented by JS Scroll. Recorded after each successful scroll restoration attempt.

histogram.name: LevelDB.ApproximateMemoryUse
histogram.summary: The approximate memory use of a LevelDB in bytes. Recorded right after initializing an on-disk database.

histogram.name: LevelDB.Open
histogram.summary: The result of an open attempt of a leveldb.

histogram.name: LevelDB.SharedCache.BytesUsed
histogram.summary: The estimated size (in bytes) of the leveldb shared cache. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: LevelDB.SharedCache.DBCount
histogram.summary: The number of databases currently using the shared block cache. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: LevelDB.SharedCache.KBUsed
histogram.obsolete: No longer used. Removed in April, 2020.
histogram.summary: The estimated size (in kilobytes) of the leveldb shared cache. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.All.SafeThreadAccess
histogram.summary: Linux and CrOS use unlocked_stdio(3). If it is used unsafely, record it here. If there is no record of unsafety after chrome 29 has been in the stable channel for a few weeks then revert this change.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single leveldb method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE
histogram.summary: Errors (base::File::Error) encountered by a single leveldb method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewLogger
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE.NewLogger.
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewLogger.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewSequentialFile
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE.NewSequentialFile.
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in NewSequentialFile.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.RandomAccessFile
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.NewRandomAccessFile.
histogram.summary: File errors in leveldb ChromiumEnv's NewRandomAccessFile method.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.WritableFileAppend
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileAppend.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.IOError.WritableFileFlush
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use LevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE.WritableFileFlush.
histogram.summary: Errno of errors encountered in WritableFileFlush.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.LockFileAncestorsNotFound
histogram.summary: Number of directories missing when Non-IDB LevelDBEnv tries to create a Lock file.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.MaxFDs
histogram.summary: File descriptor limit recorded every time LevelDB calls NewRandomAccessFile for clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.RetryRecoveredFromErrorIn
histogram.summary: When Non-IDB LevelDBEnv successfully retries an operation that had failed, record the error from the most recent failed attempt.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.Table
histogram.obsolete: As of M54 no longer creating or using table backup files.
histogram.summary: Success indicates a successful backup or restore operation for .ldb table files when used by LevelDB clients other than IndexedDB.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.TimeTo
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2013-04. As of m28 use LevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor.
histogram.summary: Time Non-IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try.

histogram.name: LevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor
histogram.summary: Time Non-IDB LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try, as LevelDBEnv only sleeps when retries are needed.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.NativeLibraryHack
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2014, removed from code.
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates whether the workaround of a Sony framework bug was used. The metric is Android-specific, and is logged when the browser starts. See more details at http://crbug.com/311644.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.PrefetchDetailedStatus
histogram.summary: Detailed status of the library prefetch final status. This is an expanded version of LibraryLoader.PrefetchStatus. Android only, recorded at most once per browser startup.

histogram.name: LibraryLoader.PrefetchStatus
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the forking of a child process to prefetch the native library succeeded. Android only, recorded at most once per browser startup.

histogram.name: Linux.Distro
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 2020-04 in favor of Linux.Distro2 because distro-specific version metrics were added.
histogram.summary: The Linux distro used. Logged on each start up.

histogram.name: Linux.X11.ServerRTT
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/20 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary:
RTT between Chrome and the X11 server. Tracked in X11EventSource by measuring the latency to receive a property event after changing a property.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: LoadingPredictor.SubresourceConnectDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the time measured before starting DNS lookup until after the connection is complete for main frame subresources observed by the LoadingPredictor. Only resources that required network connection and happened before the first contentful paint are recorded.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.ClientRestartAttempts
histogram.summary: Records number of attempts to start local discovery.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.DetectorRestartTime
histogram.summary: Time between detector restarts.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.DetectorTriggerTime
histogram.summary: Time before detector trigger notifications.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.DevicesPage
histogram.summary: Records events related to devices page.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.FirewallAccessTime
histogram.summary: Windows only histogram that reports request time spend accessing firewall rules. It's logged once per browser process lifetime, when local discovery is used first time.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.IsFirewallReady
histogram.summary: Windows only histogram that reports, whether a firewall is set, so we can bind inbound sockets. It's logged once per browser process lifetime, when local discovery is used first time.

histogram.name: LocalDiscovery.PrivetNotificationsEvent
histogram.summary: Records events related to local discovery notifications.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.BrowserLocalStorageSizeInKB
histogram.obsolete: No longer emitted after onion soup refactor.
histogram.summary: Size of the HTML5 LocalStorage DB in KB in the browser-side cache.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.BrowserTimeToPrimeLocalStorage{LocalStorageSizes}
histogram.obsolete: No longer emitted after onion soup refactor.
histogram.summary: Time to load HTML5 LocalStorage into the browser-side cache. {LocalStorageSizes}

histogram.name: LocalStorage.CommitDelay
histogram.obsolete: No longer emitted after onion soup refactor. Replaced with LevelDBWrapper.CommitDelay.
histogram.summary: Delay between a page making changes and those changes being written to the DB.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.RendererTimeToPrimeLocalStorage{LocalStorageSizes}
histogram.obsolete: No longer omitted after onion soup refactor. Replaced by LocalStorage.MojoTimeToPrime. {LocalStorageSizes}
histogram.summary: Time to load HTML5 LocalStorage into the renderer-side cache.

histogram.name: LocalStorage.TimeToPrimeLocalStorage
histogram.obsolete: No longer omitted after onion soup refactor. Replaced by LocalStorage.MojoTimeToPrime.
histogram.summary: Time to load HTML5 LocalStorage into the renderer-side cache. Note that the name is not 'Renderer' prefixed for continuity with the old naming.

histogram.name: Login.DefaultPageZoom
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020. It was added to decide if the SplitSettings project could safely decouple browser page zoom from ARC++/OS zoom. We decided it was safe and did the decoupling in M78.
histogram.summary: The user's default page zoom setting, recorded on login.

histogram.name: Login.ReauthReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85. Splitted in two: Login.PasswordChanged.ReauthReason and Login.PasswordNotChanged.ReauthReason.
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason why a user was sent through the GAIA re-auth flow.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.ElapsedTimeMicrosec
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-02-01 because elapsed time should be measured by clients, if they need it.
histogram.summary: Elapsed time of one Chrome OS ML Service request.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.PeakPrivateMemoryKb
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 because we change to record total (shared+unshared) memory rather than only private memory. Replaced by MachineLearningService.PeakTotalMemoryKb.
histogram.summary: Peak private (non-shared) memory used by Chrome OS ML Service over the last 24 hours. Sampled every 5 minutes, so may miss short-lived spikes.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.PrivateMemoryDeltaKb
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 because we change to record total (shared+unshared) memory rather than only private memory. Replaced by MachineLearningService.TotalMemoryDeltaKb.
histogram.summary: Memory usage increase caused by one Chrome OS ML Service request.

histogram.name: MachineLearningService.PrivateMemoryKb
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 because we change to record total (shared+unshared) memory rather than only private memory. Replaced by MachineLearningService.TotalMemoryKb.
histogram.summary: Private (non-shared) memory used by Chrome OS ML Service, sampled every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.BlockedFrameDepth
histogram.summary: The depth of blocked frame in the frame tree. The value is recorded when the renderer frame hosting the blocking page finishes loading.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.ChromeOS.PasswordChange
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2020 as it is no longer used.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS histogram that keeps track of supervised user password change result.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.Whitelist.JsonParseDuration
histogram.summary: The total amount of time taken to parse the JSON contents of a whitelist out of process.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.Whitelist.ReadDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to read a whitelist file from disk.

histogram.name: ManagedUsers.Whitelist.TotalLoadDuration
histogram.summary: The total amount of time taken to load a whitelist from disk and parse it, including jumps to the blocking thread.

histogram.name: Manifest.IsEmpty
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the parsed Manifest is the empty Manifest.

histogram.name: Media.AcceleratedCompositingActive
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether accelerated compositing was used for HTML5 media rendering.

histogram.name: Media.Android.IsHttpLiveStreamingMedia
histogram.summary: Android: Records whether a regular media URL is HLS (HTTP Live Streaming) media or not.

histogram.name: Media.Android.IsHttpLiveStreamingMediaPredictionResult
histogram.summary: Android: Records which HLS prediction based on the original URL was best.

histogram.name: Media.Android.NumMediaServerCrashes
histogram.summary: Android: Number of consecutive media server crashes monitored before it is reset to 0. Reset happens if there are no crashes in a minute, or if user hits the "try again" button on the media throttle info bar.

histogram.name: Media.Android.ThrottleInfobarResponse
histogram.summary: Android: The distribution of responses to the media throttle infobar prompt.

histogram.name: Media.ArcGpuVideoDecodeAccelerator.InitializeResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of June 12, 2017. Replaced by Media.ChromeArcVideoDecodeAccelerator.InitializeResult.
histogram.summary: Counts of status values returned from calls to ArcGpuVideoDecodeAccelerator::Initialize().

histogram.name: Media.Audio.AutomaticGainControlMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if the Automatic Gain Control (AGC) is enabled or not. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Autoplay.Attribute.WaitTime
histogram.summary: Records time from load starts until audio starts based on autoplay attribute.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Autoplay.PlayMethod.WaitTime
histogram.summary: Records time from load starts until audio starts based on play method.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Bitstream
histogram.summary: Records whether the given bitstream audio output format is supported. Recorded when the browser or audio process AudioManager is constructed.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.CallbackError
histogram.summary: A boolean that reflects whether or not an error was reported during audio capture.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.DeviceLatency
histogram.summary: The audio input device latency. The time from when a frame was captured until it reaches Chrome's platform audio implementation. Sampled for every buffer received from the device, and reports the latency for the first frame in the buffer.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.StreamBrokerDisconnectReason
histogram.summary: Error codes from AudioInputStreamBroker::ObserverBindingLost. They describe why an audio input stream ended.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.StreamCallbackError
histogram.summary: When AudioInputDevice is stopped, this stat is recorded with whether an error callback was ever received over IPC.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Win.ConcurrentGlitchAndDiscontinuities
histogram.summary: The number of times a glitch was detected by detecting skipped frames (as with Media.Audio.Capture.Glitches) and disconinuity was flagged by the OS at the same time (as with Media.Audio.Capture.Win.Discontinuities). Sometimes these indications are not consistent with each other so this metric helps understanding how often they aren't. This value is logged when an audio input stream is closed.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Win.DevicePeriod
histogram.summary: The audio engine's period between processing passes. See IAudioClient::GetDevicePeriod. This value is logged when an audio input stream is opened.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Win.DevicePositionLessThanExpected
histogram.summary: The number of times the device position was less than expected during the lifetime of an audio stream. This value is logged when an audio input stream is closed.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Win.Discontinuities
histogram.summary: The number of glitches that were detected at the OS level on Windows while an audio stream was active, as reported by the OS via the discontinuity flag (see IAudioCaptureClient::GetBuffer). This value is logged when an audio input stream is closed.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Win.EndpointBufferSize
histogram.summary: The endpoint buffer size for input audio. This value is logged when an audio input stream is opened.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Capture.Win.StreamLatency
histogram.summary: The maximum stream latency as reported by the OS. See IAudioClient::GetStreamLatency. This value is logged when an audio input stream is opened.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputBufferSizeWasChangedAudioWorkedMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if the size of the audio unit's IO buffer was changed when starting an input audio stream. Sampled each time an AUAudioInputStream instance is closed, i.e., we know that input audio has started as it should when this value is stored. Can be compared with Media.Audio.InputBufferSizeWasChangedMac which is only added when input audio fails to start.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputDevicePropertyChangedMac
histogram.obsolete: Removed Feb 2018. Was put in place to debug missing callback issues that have since been resolved.
histogram.summary: Lists device properties that have been changed during an audio input stream session. We update a map of different property changes during a session and all these values are recorded when an AUAudioInputStream object is closed, hence multiple enum values can be emitted when the histogram is stored.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputDevicePropertyChangedStartupFailedMac
histogram.obsolete: Removed Feb 2018. Was put in place to debug missing callback issues that have since been resolved.
histogram.summary: Lists device properties that have been changed during an audio input stream session. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure' and multiple enum values can be emitted each time that happens.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputRestartAttemptsMac
histogram.obsolete: Removed May 2017. Restart mechanism is removed.
histogram.summary: Counts the total number of times an attempt to restart input audio has been done. The value is stored once when a stream is closed and updated when it has been detected that input audio callbacks are not generated as expected.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputStartWasDeferredAudioWorkedMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if audio capturing started with a small delay or not. Sampled each time an AUAudioInputStream instance is closed, i.e., we know that input audio has started as it should when this value is stored. Can be compared with Media.Audio.InputStartWasDeferredMac which is only added when input audio fails to start.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.InputStartWasDeferredMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if audio capturing started with a small delay or not. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.IsOnBatteryPowerMac
histogram.summary: Indicates if the Mac OSX device is on battery power or not. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.NumberOfBasicInputStreamsMac
histogram.summary: Number of created default input audio streams. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.NumberOfLowLatencyInputStreamsMac
histogram.summary: Number of created low-latency input audio streams. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.NumberOfOutputStreamsMac
histogram.summary: Number of created output audio streams. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.OutputStreamsCanceledByBrowser
histogram.summary: When a mojo audio stream factory is destructed, the streams it created are also destructed. This is a potential source of stat differences between the new mojo code and the old Chrome IPC code, where streams could potentially stick around until the destruction of the owning RenderProcessHost. This histogram measures how many output streams are destructed each time a mojo output stream factory is destructed.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioInputsPerMixer.LatencyExact
histogram.summary: Number of simultaneous inputs coming to the AudioRendererMixer which renders audio with user specified latency. The value is logged each time it reaches a new maximum for the mixer. It is useful for evaluating how mixing audio in renderer reduces the number of output audio streams going from the renderer to the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioInputsPerMixer.LatencyInteractive
histogram.summary: Number of simultaneous inputs coming to the AudioRendererMixer which renders audio with interactive latency. The value is logged each time it reaches a new maximum for the mixer. It is useful for evaluating how mixing audio in renderer reduces the number of output audio streams going from the renderer to the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioInputsPerMixer.LatencyPlayback
histogram.summary: Number of simultaneous inputs coming to the AudioRendererMixer which renders audio with playback latency. The value is logged each time it reaches a new maximum for the mixer. It is useful for evaluating how mixing audio in renderer reduces the number of output audio streams going from the renderer to the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioInputsPerMixer.LatencyRtc
histogram.summary: Number of simultaneous inputs coming to the AudioRendererMixer which renders audio with real time latency. The value is logged each time it reaches a new maximum for the mixer. It is useful for evaluating how mixing audio in renderer reduces the number of output audio streams going from the renderer to the browser.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.AudioMixing.LatencyMap
histogram.summary: Subset of audio output latencies encountered by the renderer so far. Logged each time an audio output with a new latency starts playing. The values are bitsets where each bit represents corresponding latency according to AudioLatency::LatencyType. Useful for understanding usecases for audio output mixing in renderer.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.BrowserCallbackRegularity
histogram.summary: Reflects how regularly browser issues audio requests to renderer. Depends on how well the system buffer size the browser side renders audio at and the buffer size it requests from renderer are aligned. When zero, it means renderer buffer size is a multiple of system buffer size, and render calls from browser to renderer are issued evenly. When -1, it means the renderer buffer size is larger than system buffer size, but is not an exact multiple of it; in this case browser periodically skips a call to renderer. When positive, floor(value/2) reflects the number of extra consecutive render requests issued by browser to renderer each time to fulfill the system audio render request; if (value/2) is not integer, then plus one more extra call is issued periodically. The metric is recorded on the edge between browser and renderer. On Mac the system buffer size may vary dynamically, the metric does not capture that: only the buffer size mismatch introduced by audio output device configuration is captured.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.InputDeviceStartTime
histogram.summary: The time delta from an AudioInputDevice sending a RecordStream message to it getting its first data callback.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.InputDeviceStreamCreationTime
histogram.summary: The time delta between the moment a MojoAudioInputIPC instance on the renderer process requests a new stream from the browser to the moment it receives a response.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.OutputDeviceStartTime
histogram.summary: The time delta from an AudioOutputDevice sending its first PlayStream message to it getting its first data callback.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.OutputDeviceStreamCreationTime
histogram.summary: The time delta between the moment a MojoAudioOutputIPC instance on the renderer process requests a new stream from the browser to the moment it receives a response.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.StreamBrokerDisconnectReason
histogram.summary: Error codes from AudioOutputStreamBroker::ObserverBindingLost. They describe why an audio output stream ended.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.StreamBrokerDisconnectReason2
histogram.summary: Describes why and in which state an audio output stream ended.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.StreamBrokerDocumentDestroyedAwaitingCreatedTime
histogram.summary: If the document was destroyed after the broker requested the output stream from the audio service, but before it received the reply: how long ago the stream was requested.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.StreamBrokerStreamCreationTime
histogram.summary: Time interval between the moment the broker requested the output stream from the audio service, and the moment it received the reply.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.Render.StreamCallbackError
histogram.summary: When AudioOutputDevice is stopped, this stat is recorded with whether an error callback was ever received over IPC.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.ResumeEventsMac
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the system has resumed from power suspension. Counting is reset each time Chrome restarts. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.Audio.UptimeMac
histogram.summary: Reports the system uptime in hours for Mac OS X devices. Only sampled when Media.Audio.InputStartupSuccessMac reports 'Failure'.

histogram.name: Media.AudioCapturerRepetition
histogram.summary: Captures bit-exact audio repetitions with pre-defined look back time. As soon as a repetition is detected, its look back time is reported. Ideally, no reports should be generated.

histogram.name: Media.AudioChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Audio channel layout in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputControllerCaptureStartupSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether capture started successfully after an input stream startup was requested.

histogram.name: Media.AudioInputDeviceManager
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for AudioInputDeviceManager::

histogram.name: Media.AudioOutputController
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken for AudioOutputController::

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererEvents
histogram.obsolete: Removed Mar 2016 in favor of a new PipelineStatus code.
histogram.summary: Captures statistics for various AudioRendererImpl events.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererIpcStreams
histogram.summary: The maximum number of simultaneous audio render streams over IPC created in AudioRendererHost for a render process. Logged at render process shutdown.

histogram.name: Media.AudioRendererIpcStreamsTotal
histogram.summary: The maximum number of simultaneous audio render streams over IPC created in AudioRendererHost for all render processes. Logged at render process shutdown.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSampleFormat
histogram.summary: Audio sample format in HTML5 media. Logged when Audio Decoder initializes.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSamplesPerSecond
histogram.summary: Audio samples per second in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.AudioSamplesPerSecondUnexpected
histogram.summary: Audio samples per second in HTML5 media (atypical values, in Hz).

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.ObservedDowntime
histogram.summary: The audio service downtime, observed from the browser process. The downtime interval is measured either from when the audio service listener is initialized to the first audio service start, or from the audio service shutdown to the next startup.

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.ObservedDowntime2
histogram.summary: The audio service downtime, observed from the browser process. The downtime interval is measured from the audio service shutdown to the next startup.

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.ObservedInitialDowntime
histogram.summary: The audio service downtime, observed from the browser process. The downtime interval is measured from when the audio service listener is initialized to the first audio service start.

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.ObservedProcessTerminationStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. Covered by the more generic stats ChildProcess.Crashed.UtilityProcessHash and ChildProcess.Launched.UtilityProcessHash.
histogram.summary: The termination status of the audio service process, observed from the browser process.

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.ObservedStartStatus
histogram.summary: The start result of the audio service, observed from the browser process.

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.ObservedStartupTime
histogram.summary: The startup time of the audio service, observed from the browser process. The startup time interval is measured from when a connect request results in the audio service being created to the moment when the audio service is started.

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.ObservedUptime
histogram.summary: The uptime of the audio service, observed from the browser process. The uptime interval is measured from when the audio service starts to when it is shut down (either normally or through kill/crash). This metric includes Media.AudioService.Uptime measurements, logged by the audio service on normal shutdown. A difference between Media.AudioService.ObservedUptime and Media.AudioService.Uptime indicates buggy audio service behavior.

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.SystemInfoClient
histogram.summary: The time interval between the moment when a client issues a system information request to the audio service, and the moment it receives the responce. Logged individually for each request type.

histogram.name: Media.AudioService.Uptime
histogram.summary: The uptime of the audio service, observed from the audio service. The uptime interval is measured from the audio service start to the audio service stop.

histogram.name: Media.AudioTrackProcessingStates
histogram.summary: State of the media stream audio track processing, sampled once during the life time of a MediaStreamAudioProcessor.

histogram.name: Media.Autoplay.CrossOrigin.Result
histogram.summary: The result of autoplaying video elements in cross-origin iframes.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.InputQueueTime
histogram.summary: The time that a bitstream buffer spends in AVDA's pending bitstream buffer queue before it is fed to MediaCodec.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.MissingFormatChanged
histogram.summary: Number of times that AVDA stopped decoding because MediaCodec failed to provide a FORMAT_CHANGED message before sending decoded frames back. True counts indicate instances where FORMAT_CHANGE was missed, while false instances indicate any MediaCodec initialization by AVDA.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.NumAVDAInstances
histogram.summary: The number of concurrently running AndroidVideoDecodeAccelerators. Logged during each AVDA initialization.

histogram.name: Media.AVDA.VirtualContext
histogram.summary: Number of times that AVDA's deferred rendering encountered a virtual GL context. True counts indicate virtual, false counts indicate not.

histogram.name: Media.AvdaCodecImage.WaitTimeForFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2018. This has been renamed to Media.CodecImage.SurfaceTextureGLOwner.WaitTimeForFrame and Media.CodecImage.ImageReaderGLOwner.WaitTimeForFrame.
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting for a frame to become available in a Non Overlay after requesting that MediaCodec renders it.

histogram.name: Media.BytesReadFromCache
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 in issue 1000058; no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Kb read by media demuxer from MultiBuffer cache.

histogram.name: Media.BytesReadFromNetwork
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 in issue 1000058; no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Kb read by from network into MultiBuffer cache.

histogram.name: Media.BytesReceived
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019 in issue 1000058; no longer needed.

histogram.name: Media.Controls.Overflow.TimeToAction
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the overflow menu is displayed until the user clicked on a menu item. The overflow menu is shown by clicking the three dots on the media controls and is used to show more controls when there is not enough space. This histogram will record up to 100 seconds with accuracy to the second.

histogram.name: Media.Controls.Overflow.TimeToDismiss
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the overflow menu is displayed until the user dismissed the menu without clicking on a menu item. The overflow menu is shown by clicking the three dots on the media controls and is used to show more controls when there is not enough space. This histogram will record up to 100 seconds with accuracy to the second.

histogram.summary: Records the reason why the Media Engagement data was cleared. Partial changes and full wipeout will both be recorded as one event.

histogram.name: Media.Engagement.PreloadedList.LoadTime
histogram.summary: Time taken to load the Media Engagement Preloaded List. It should be recorded once per load of the list which will be once per start up with additional loads when the list is updated while running.

histogram.summary: Time taken to lookup an entry in the Media Engagement Preloaded List. This is recorded for every lookup, regardless of its success.

histogram.name: Media.Engagement.ScoreAtStartup
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 in Issue 900679 as we are no longer using this.
histogram.summary: Media engagement scores for each origin, recorded at Chrome startup. It is converted to a percentage so should be divided by 100 to get the actual score.

histogram.name: Media.Engagement.Session
histogram.summary: Records creation and playback status of a Media Engagement Session. This is recorded at the same time as the data is commited into the content settings database.

histogram.name: Media.Engagement.Session.Restored
histogram.summary: Records creation and playback status of a restored Media Engagement Session. This is recorded at the same time as the data is commited into the content settings database. Restored information are recorded in addition of regular ones (Media.Engagement.Session).

histogram.name: Media.Engagement.URLsDeletedScoreReduction
histogram.summary: Recorded when the history is cleared and the media engagement data are similarly cleared. It records the reduction in score for each affected origin. The algorithm is made to reduce the score by 0.0 as much as possible and if it fails, the score will actually become 0.0 so every reduction also represent the value of the previous score.

histogram.name: Media.IsStreaming
histogram.summary: Whether the WMPI data source is streaming (does not support range requests).

histogram.name: Media.Learning.MediaCapabilities.DroppedFrameRatioTask
histogram.summary:
Confusion matrix for MediaCapabilities local learning experiment, using a lookup table and the base MediaCapabilities features (resolution, frame rate, video format). A positive outcome is smooth playback, while a negative outcome is not smooth. For example, a False Negative indicates that we predicted a negative result (not smooth playback), but we later observed that the result was positive (smooth playback).
For those observations for which we could not make a prediction due to data sparsity, the "no-prediction" buckets indicate whether the observation was positive or negative.
This is very similar to the existing MediaCapabilities implementation, but uses the same training set as other learners.
The "BaseTable" variant uses a lookup table as the model, and uses the original MediaCapabilities features (resolution, frame rate, video format).
The "BaseTree" variant uses ExtraTrees model and the same features as the BaseTable variant.
The "EnhancedTree" variant uses ExtraTrees, plus additional features such as NetworkType. The exact set of features is still in flux, so be sure to restrict reporting to a particular Chromium version.

histogram.name: Media.MediaElement.PlaybackPositionIsInfinity
histogram.obsolete: Removed and removed from code as of January 2019.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the MediaElement is at a playback position of infinity when checking if playback has ended.

histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2018. Histogram Eraser marked this histogram as unnecessary. See https://crbug.com/871467 for details.
histogram.summary: Level of the microphone volume measured in percent. This value can be larger than 100% on Linux. Measured approximately four times per minute.

histogram.summary: Connected input port numbers on the initialization.

histogram.name: Media.Midi.OutputPorts
histogram.summary: Connected output port numbers on the initialization.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.AudioSpliceDurationType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2018. Splicing no longer performed on buffers with estimated duration. See https://crbug.com/396634.
histogram.summary: Categorizes MSE audio splicing by the type of duration used in the overlapped buffer.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.DetectedTrackCount.Audio
histogram.summary: Number of detected audio tracks in Media Source Extensions playback. Not all may be usable by the player.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.DetectedTrackCount.Text
histogram.summary: Number of detected text tracks in Media Source Extensions playback. Not all may be usable by the player. This count includes only explicitly signalled tracks in MSE initialization segments parsed from WebM or ISO BMFF bytestreams.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.DetectedTrackCount.Video
histogram.summary: Number of detected video tracks in Media Source Extensions playback. Not all may be usable by the player.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.LateAudioFrames
histogram.obsolete: Deleted along with browser side MSE implementation.
histogram.summary: Relative number of late audio frames wrt total number of audio frames in MSE playback, multiplied by one million. The audio frame is considered late if it might cause an underrun, i.e. comes from decoder when audio buffer is already depleted.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.LateVideoFrames
histogram.obsolete: Deleted along with browser side MSE implementation.
histogram.summary: Relative number of late video frames wrt total number of video frames in MSE playback, multiplied by one million. The video frame is late if it missed its presentation time as determined by PTS when it comes from decoder. The rendering policy (i.e. render or skip) does not affect it.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.NumberOfTracks
histogram.summary: Number of tracks specified to AddId() for Media Source Extensions playback. May be called multiple times per element if playback is dynamically altered.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.Playback
histogram.summary: Whether Media Source Extensions is specified for playback of Media elements. Sampled when media pipeline starts.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.PlaybackDuration
histogram.obsolete: Deleted along with browser side MSE implementation.
histogram.summary: Duration of an uninterrupted MSE playback. This is the time interval between the playback starts or resumes and the moment when user stops the playback by pressing pause, initiating a seek etc. Measured in media time in milliseconds.

histogram.name: Media.MSE.Starvations
histogram.obsolete: Deleted along with browser side MSE implementation.
histogram.summary: Relative number of starvations wrt total number of frames in MSE playback, multiplied by one million. Starvation happens when the player interrupts the regular playback and asks for more data, conditions are player-specific.

histogram.obsolete: Removed 8/2019 in Issue 995521 due to expiry and not needed anymore.
histogram.summary: The number of times a media session abandon audio focus and where the abandon audio focus call originated from. This is recorded every time a media session abandons audio focus because it has stopped playing.

histogram.name: Media.Session.AudioFocus.Request
histogram.obsolete: Removed 8/2019 in Issue 995521 due to expiry and not needed anymore.
histogram.summary: The number of times a media session requested audio focus and where that focus request originated from. This is recorded every time a media session requests audio focus because it wants to start playing.

histogram.name: Media.Session.AudioFocus.Type
histogram.obsolete: Removed 8/2019 in Issue 995521 due to expiry and not needed anymore.
histogram.summary: The number of times a media session requested audio focus for a specific audio focus type. This is recorded every time a media session requests a new audio focus type. This may be because the session has started playing or the type of media being played has changed.

histogram.name: Media.SRC.PreloadAutoHasPoster
histogram.summary: Whether a SRC= playback had a poster set at load() when the effective preload type is "auto". Note that this includes audio playbacks, since we do not have track metadata at load(); audio elements never have posters.

histogram.name: Media.SRC.PreloadMetaDataHasPoster
histogram.summary: Whether a SRC= playback had a poster set at load() when the effective preload type is "metadata". Note that this includes audio playbacks, since we do not have track metadata at load(); audio elements never have posters.

histogram.name: Media.Timeline.Width
histogram.summary: The width of the media timeline track in CSS pixels, recorded the first time a media element with controls starts playing (strictly speaking, it's the width in CSS pixels ignoring CSS transforms, multiplied by pageZoomFactor, but deliberately ignoring pinch zoom's pageScaleFactor).

histogram.name: Media.TimeToFirstFrame.SRC.ManyVideos
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from when WebMediaPlayerImpl starts loading until the first video frame has been shown IFF six or more videos are loading in parallel.

histogram.name: Media.TimeToPipelineStarted
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from HTML5 media pipeline creation to playing event.

histogram.name: Media.UncacheableReason
histogram.summary: Reasons a media response won't be used to satisfy a future request.

histogram.name: Media.UnderflowCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed Feb 2017. Media.UnderflowDuration provides more useful counts.
histogram.summary: The number of times a src= playback has underflowed; i.e. ran out of data.

histogram.name: Media.UnderflowDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed Aug 2017. Media.UnderflowDuration2.SRC removes zero-weighting so that we only report actual underflows.
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to leave the underflow state (i.e. resume playback) for src= playbacks.

histogram.name: Media.UnderflowDuration.EME
histogram.obsolete: Removed Aug 2017. Media.UnderflowDuration2.EME removes zero-weighting so that we only report actual underflows.

histogram.name: Media.UnderflowDuration.MSE
histogram.obsolete: Removed Aug 2017. Media.UnderflowDuration2.MSE removes zero-weighting so that we only report actual underflows.
histogram.summary: The amount of time taken to leave the underflow state (i.e. resume playback) for Media Source Extensions (MSE) based playbacks.

histogram.name: Media.Video.FullscreenOrientationLock.AutoRotateEnabled
histogram.summary: Whether auto rotation of screen orientation is enabled by the user (if so the user has not locked the screen orientation at the OS level, though the orientation may still be locked by apps). Recorded each time MediaControlsOrientationLockDelegate locks the screen orientation in response to a video going fullscreen (or loading metadata whilst fullscreen).

histogram.name: Media.Video.FullscreenOrientationLock.MetadataAvailability

histogram.name: Media.Video.KeyFrameDistance
