histogram.name: Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/18/2017 in issue 670150. Replaced by Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame.DisableTrack and Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame.Paused.
histogram.summary: Records the time between the moment when the video element is brought to the foreground and when the video frame compositor outputs the next frame.

histogram.name: Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame.DisableTrack
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 06/2019 -- no longer used after background track disable has launched.
histogram.summary: Records the time between the moment when the video element that had video track disabled in the background is brought to the foreground and when the video frame compositor outputs the next frame. Recorded even if disabling video track in the background is turned off to collect data for the control group.

histogram.name: Media.Video.TimeFromForegroundToFirstFrame.Paused
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 06/2019 -- no longer used after background track disable has launched.
histogram.summary: Records the time between the moment when the video element that was paused in the background is brought to the foreground and when the video frame compositor outputs the next frame. Recorded even if disabling pausing video in the background is turned off to collect data for the control group.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.FramesReceived
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2014 in issue 422822. Replaced by Media.VideoCaptureManager.Event and the two new values 3 and 4 in the enum VideoCaptureEvent.
histogram.summary: Whether any frames were received during a video capture session. This metric is recorded when a video source is stopped.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCapture.PixelFormat
histogram.summary: Pixel format provided by a Video Capture Device. The collection is made in the VideoCaptureController upon reception of the first frame.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCaptureApi.Mac
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 30th. This is no longer used.
histogram.summary: Video Capture and device enumeration/monitoring API used for Mac OS Lion or later. Collection is made only once when the flags are parsed and the appropriate library selected and/or loaded, successfully or not.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCaptureService.DurationFromLastConnectToClosingConnection
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2017 in favor of the more differentiated durations.
histogram.summary: Measures the duration from the time the Browser connected to the video capture service to the time it closed the connection.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCaptureService.DurationUntilReconnect
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2017 in favor of the more differentiated durations.
histogram.summary: Measures the duration from the time the Browser last closed or lost connection to the video capture service to the time it reconnects.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCodecProfile
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2020 in https://crbug.com/1053030. We have this in UKM.
histogram.summary: Video codec profile used in HTML5 media.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCodedAspectRatio
histogram.summary: Coded aspect ratio of HTML5 video.

histogram.name: Media.VideoCodedWidth
histogram.summary: Coded width of HTML5 video.

histogram.name: Media.VideoColorRange
histogram.summary: Pixel format color range of HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoFormat
histogram.summary: Pixel format used in HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoFrame.ColorSpace
histogram.summary: Video frame color space. Emitted for each video frame.

histogram.name: Media.VideoFramePixelFormat
histogram.summary: Pixel format used in HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoPixelFormat
histogram.summary: Pixel format used in HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoPixelFormatUnion
histogram.obsolete: Pixel format has been removed from demuxers. 06/2019
histogram.summary: Pixel format used in capture and HTML5 video. Emitted on video load.

histogram.name: Media.VideoTrackAdapter.FramesReceived
histogram.summary: If any frames were received during a video capture session. It's recorded when a video source is stopped.

histogram.name: Media.VideoVisibleAspectRatio
histogram.summary: Visible aspect ratio of HTML5 video.

histogram.name: Media.VideoVisibleWidth
histogram.summary: Visible width of HTML5 video.

histogram.name: Media.Vpx.VideoDecoderBuffersInUseByDecoder
histogram.summary: Number of frame buffers used by Vpx decoder.

histogram.name: Media.Vpx.VideoDecoderBuffersInUseByDecoderAndVideoFrame
histogram.summary: Number of frame buffers currently in use by both Vpx decoder and a VideoFrame.

histogram.name: Media.VpxVideoDecoder.Vp9DecodeTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 -- shows nothing interesting; it's been static for years.
histogram.summary: Amount of time taken to decode one VP9 frame.

histogram.name: Media.WebAudioSourceProvider.SinkStatus
histogram.summary: Status of audio sink provided to WebMediaPlayer. If not OK, null sink will be used for audio output instead.

histogram.name: Media.WebMediaPlayerImpl.HLS.WouldTaintOrigin
histogram.obsolete: Removed because an overwhelming majority of pages do not set the crossorigin attribute and as a result most HLS content is counted. Superseded by Media.WebMediaPlayerImpl.HLS.HasAccessControl.
histogram.summary: When an HLS manifest is found during loading (on Android only), records whether the request was CORS cross-origin or redirected between origins. These are cases that may or may not be able to be implemented using fetch(), depending on details of the redirection and the setting of the crossorigin attribute. Note: subresources referenced by the manifest are not considered; they may have different origins or CORS configurations.

histogram.name: Media.WebMediaPlayerImpl.Memory
histogram.summary: Amount of memory used by the WebMediaPlayerImpl and its components.

histogram.name: Media.WebView.UnsupportedContainer
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2018 since support for these containers has been deprecated.
histogram.summary: Media container extensions seen by WebView that are not supported by the standard HTML5 playback path. This value is recorded every time a WebMediaPlayer is created with one of the unsupported containers.

histogram.name: Media.WindowsCoreAudioInput
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2017 as Windows Core Audio is now the only audio input implementation on Windows.
histogram.summary: Whether Chrome is using Windows Core Audio for audio input or not. Updated on Windows only when a low-latency audio input stream is created.

histogram.name: Media.YouTube.DelayedAndDroppedFramesPer5Sec
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average number of delayed and dropped frames for the YouTube application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.YouTube.DisplayedFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The average number of displayed frames for the YouTube application. Reported every 5 seconds.

histogram.name: Media.YouTube.TimeToBufferAvAfterAbort
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time needed to buffer A/V data after an abort for the YouTube application.

histogram.name: MediaRouter.Provider.RouteControllerCreationOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Route controller is specific to the old WebUI Cast dialog, and the new Views dialog does not have it.
histogram.summary: Records whether the Media Route Provider succeeded or failed to create a controller for a media route.

histogram.name: MediaRouter.Sink.SearchOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Sink search is specific to the old WebUI Cast dialog, and the new Views dialog does not have it.
histogram.summary: The outcome of querying Media Route Providers for a sink by ID. "Success" indicates that a sink was found. This is recorded when the user attempts to cast to a sink with a manually entered ID.

histogram.name: MediaRouter.Ui.Dialog.LoadedWebUiRouteController
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Route controller is specific to the old WebUI Cast dialog, and the new Views dialog does not have it.
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds it takes the WebUI route controls in the route details view to be populated after the view is opened.

histogram.name: MediaRouter.Ui.InitialState
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. This histogram was for tracking whether the old WebUI Cast dialog opened in sink list view or route details view.
histogram.summary: The view that was shown when the Media Router dialog is initially opened.

histogram.name: MemCache.WriteResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::WriteData in the memory cache.

histogram.name: Memory.Browser
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping. Note the existence of Memory.Browser.Large, which doesn't have overflow issues. TODO(rkaplow): This should be replaced with Memory.Browser.Large2 in M54.

histogram.name: Memory.Browser.Committed
histogram.summary: The total committed memory used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Browser.Large
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2016 as it reports wrong numbers. crbug.com/629354. Replaced with Memory.Browser.Large2
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Browser.Large2
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Chrome
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. No direct replacement, but Memory.Renderer.PrivateMemoryFootprint is similar.
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each chrome:// renderer process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ChromeProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active chrome:// renderer processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.CompressibleStringCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Aug 2016. CompressibleString has been reverted once at https://crrev.com/2227933002.
histogram.summary: This records the frequency with which JavaScript source strings are compressed and decompressed in foreground and background tabs. Compressing runs 10 seconds after the tab goes background and decompressing runs when JavaScript source string is required (e.g. V8 starts to compile). This measurement is a preparation to introduce CompressibleString class for JavaScript source strings to reduce Blink memory usage.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.FreeMemoryUntilCritical
histogram.summary: Available free memory until the system will be in a critical state. Critical is as defined by the OS (swapping will occur, or physical memory will run out, etc).

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.StateDuration
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the global state changes.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.StateOnCriticalNotificationReceived
histogram.summary: The global state of memory coordinator when a critical pressure notification is received.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.StateOnModerateNotificationReceived
histogram.summary: The global state of memory coordinator when a moderate pressure notification is received.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.TotalPrivate
histogram.summary: The total private working set memory used by the browser and renderer processes when the memory coordinator changes the global memory state.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.TrimMemoryLevel.Normal
histogram.summary: Android: Records trim memory level when the global state is NORMAL.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.TrimMemoryLevel.Suspended
histogram.summary: Android: Records trim memory level when the global state is SUSPENDED.

histogram.name: Memory.Coordinator.TrimMemoryLevel.Throttled
histogram.summary: Android: Records trim memory level when the global state is THROTTLED.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Browser.PrivateMemoryFootprint.MacOS
histogram.summary: A rough estimate of the private memory footprint of the browser process.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Browser.PurgedMemory
histogram.summary: Amount of reclaimed memory (in terms of the private working set size) after a purge request on the browser process. Recorded 2 seconds after the purge request.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.CompressedPagesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of pages compressed per second. Recorded every 60 seconds. Only recorded on macOS.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.DecompressedPagesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of pages decompressed per second. Recorded every 60 seconds. Only recorded on macOS.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Extension.PrivateMemoryFootprint.MacOS
histogram.summary: A rough estimate of the private memory footprint of an extension process.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Gpu.PrivateMemoryFootprint.MacOS
histogram.summary: A rough estimate of the private memory footprint of the GPU process.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.NewMemoryPressureMonitor.SessionDurations.CriticalPressure
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in the critical memory pressure state. Recorded every time the level changes and at shutdown.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.NewMemoryPressureMonitor.SessionDurations.NoPressure
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent in the no memory pressure state. Recorded every time the level changes and at shutdown.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.BrowserMonitorStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2018. Made a decision in issue 871507 that we no longer need this data.
histogram.summary: Records the status of OOM intervention if the feature is turned on, with various reasons for failure, in the browser process. Recorded once at browser startup.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.InterventionStateOnCrash
histogram.summary: Records state of the intervention (accepted or declined) when the foreground renderer is crashed after near-OOM intervention is triggered.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.NavigationAfterDetectionTime
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed between a near-OOM detection and when a navigation is started.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.NearOomDetectionEndReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason for stopping near-OOM detection. This isn't recorded when a near-OOM situation was detected.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.OomProtectedCrashAfterDetectionTime
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed between a near-OOM detection and when an OOM protected renderer was crashed.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.ReducedBlinkUsageAfter10secs
histogram.summary: Reduced amount of blink usage after 10 seconds of intervention. This reports negative numbers when reduced.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.ReducedBlinkUsageAfter20secs
histogram.summary: Reduced amount of blink usage after 20 seconds of intervention. This reports negative numbers when reduced.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.ReducedBlinkUsageAfter30secs
histogram.summary: Reduced amount of blink usage after 30 seconds of intervention. This reports negative numbers when reduced.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.ReducedRendererPMFAfter10secs
histogram.summary: Reduced amount of renderer pmf after 10 seconds of intervention. This reports negative numbers when reduced.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.ReducedRendererPMFAfter20secs
histogram.summary: Reduced amount of renderer pmf after 20 seconds of intervention. This reports negative numbers when reduced.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.ReducedRendererPMFAfter30secs
histogram.summary: Reduced amount of renderer pmf after 30 seconds of intervention. This reports negative numbers when reduced.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.RendererEnabledStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2018. Made a decision in issue 871507 that we no longer need this data.
histogram.summary: Records the status of OOM intervention in renderer process if the feature is turned on, with various reasons for failure. Recorded at each navigation or reload.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.RendererGoneAfterDetectionTime
histogram.summary: Records the time elapsed between a near-OOM detection and when a foreground renderer process was gone. This histogram does not contain OOM protected crashes.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.RendererTimeSinceLastNavigationAtIntervention
histogram.obsolete: Removed 1/2019 because RendererTimeSinceLastNavigationAtDetection replaced this metric by expanding coverage to include detection-only mode.
histogram.summary: Records the time since last main frame navigation start on the renderer process when intervention is triggered. Record only when navigation happened at least once.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.RendererVmSizeAtOOM
histogram.summary: The renderer process' virtual memory usage, when a foreground OOM occurs. This was last recorded metric by renderer a few seconds before getting killed.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.OomIntervention.UserDecision
histogram.summary: Records user decisions on near-OOM intervention.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Renderer.LocalFrameRootPurgeSignal
histogram.summary:
Recorded after every memory purge signal received by a foreground local frame root with accelerated compositing enabled. Records whether or not the signal was the first received by the local frame root.
This metric has changed over time and it is important to consider these changes when analyzing historical data.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Renderer.PrivateMemoryFootprint.MacOS
histogram.summary: A rough estimate of the private memory footprint of a renderer process.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.Renderer.PurgedMemory
histogram.summary: Amount of reclaimed memory (in terms of Memory.Experimental.Renderer.TotalAllocated) after a purge request on a renderer process. Recorded 2 seconds after the purge request.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.SwapInPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of swap-ins per second. Recorded every 60 seconds.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.SwapOutPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of swap-outs per second. Recorded every 60 seconds.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.SwapThrashingLevel
histogram.summary: The swap thrashing level, which is recorded periodically. This shows the cumulative number of seconds that systems spend in each of the swap thrashing states. Only available on Windows.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.SwapThrashingLevelChanges
histogram.summary: The number of swap-thrashing level state changes for each possible pairwise state change. Only available on Windows.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.Init.AddEnumDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the call to |AddEnum| to complete during the initialization of the WMI Refresher.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.Init.AddEnumDuration2
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the call to |AddEnum| to complete during the initialization of the WMI Refresher.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.Init.CoCreateInstanceDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the call to |CoCreateInstance| to complete during the initialization of the WMI Refresher.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.Init.CreateLocalWmiConnectionDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the call to |CreateLocalWmiConnection| to complete during the initialization of the WMI Refresher.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.InitDiskIdleTimeConfigStatus
histogram.summary: The result of configuring the WMIRefresher to read the disk idle time values.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.InitializeDiskIdleTimeConfigDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes to initialize the disk idle config in the WMI Refresher.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.InitializeDiskIdleTimeConfigDuration2
histogram.summary: The time it takes to initialize the disk idle config in the WMI Refresher.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.RefreshDiskIdleTimeDuration
histogram.summary: The time it takes to do a refresh of the disk idle time value in the WMI Refresher.

histogram.name: Memory.Experimental.WMIRefresher.RefreshDiskIdleTimeStatus
histogram.summary: The result of refreshing the disk idle time value in the WMIRefresher.

histogram.name: Memory.Extension
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each extension process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ExtensionProcessCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. No direct replacement. For similar histograms see Memory.RenderProcessHost.Count.*, Memory.RendererProcessCount and Memory.ProcessCount. Old data has been preserved at (Google-internal) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QleZ5KhAbFZkv0In61sw7e2rWCaJ05dUCdV9DncJZ2E
histogram.summary: The count of active extension processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Gpu
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the GPU process. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.IPCChannelReader.ReceivedMessageSize
histogram.summary: Size of messages received by IPC::ChannelReader.

histogram.name: Memory.MovableStringParkingAction
histogram.summary: Recorded each time a Movable String is (un)parked, with the context: foreground/background.

histogram.name: Memory.MovableStringsCount
histogram.summary: This records the number of movable Javascript source string resources in a given renderer, at the time page is backgrounded. Recorded alongside Memory.MovableStringsTotalSizeKb.

histogram.name: Memory.MovableStringsTotalSizeKb
histogram.summary: This records the total size of movable Javascript source string resources in a given renderer, at the time page is backgrounded. Recorded alongside Memory.MovableStringsCount.

histogram.name: Memory.NativeClient
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Native Client loader process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.NativeClientBroker
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Native Client broker process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.NativeLibrary.MappedAndResidentMemoryFootprint
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2019. Replaced by Memory.NativeLibrary.MappedAndResidentMemoryFootprint2 to add more precision to buckets.
histogram.summary: The size of the resident memory for the native library code across all processes. This metric is computed by parsing proc/self/pagemap and counting native library pages that are mapped and present in RAM for at least one Chrome process. Recorded once per UMA ping. Available only on Android.

histogram.name: Memory.NativeLibrary.MappedAndResidentMemoryFootprint2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020. Replaced by Memory.NativeLibrary.MappedAndResidentMemoryFootprint3 to increase device coverage.
histogram.summary:
The size of the resident memory for the native library code across all processes. This metric is computed by parsing proc/self/pagemap and counting native library pages that are mapped and present in RAM for at least one Chrome process.
Recorded at Poisson sampled time intervals with a mean of 5 minutes on Android and 30 minutes on other platforms.

histogram.name: Memory.OtherProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of other various utility processes (nacl, gpu, sandbox, zygote, utility). Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ParkableString.CompressionRatio
histogram.summary: Average compression ratio, 100 * compressed_size / initial_size, for all compressed ParkableStrings. Recorded at the same time as "Memory.ParkableString.TotalSizeKb".

histogram.name: Memory.ParkableString.TotalSizeKb
histogram.summary: Total size of ParkableStrings assuming no compression, in KB. Recorded 30s after compression was triggered, provided that the renderer stayed backgrounded.

histogram.name: Memory.PartitionAlloc.MainThreadTime.5min
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from the code 06/2020.
histogram.summary: Total main thread time used by PartitionAlloc's decommit logic over the first 5 minutes of a renderer lifetime. Starting time is renderer initialization.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperFlashPlugin
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Pepper Flash plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperPlugin
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Pepper plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperPluginBroker
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each Pepper plugin broker process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperPluginBrokerProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of Pepper plugin broker processes, recorded once per metrics services (UMA) update. See MetricsReportingScheduler for details.

histogram.name: Memory.PepperPluginProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active Pepper plugin processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Plugin
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.PluginProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active plugin processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.ProcessLimit
histogram.summary: The current process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Renderer
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA ping. TODO(rkaplow): This should be replaced with Memory.Renderer.Large2 in M54.

histogram.name: Memory.Renderer.Committed
histogram.summary: The total committed memory used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Renderer.Large2
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererAll
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. No direct replacement, although Memory.Total.PrivateMemoryFootprint is similar.
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each renderer process, including all renderer types, i.e. this includes Chrome renderer, extensions renderer, as well as regular renderer processes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererAll.Committed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2018. No direct replacement, although Memory.Total.PrivateMemoryFootprint is similar.
histogram.summary: The total committed memory used by each renderer process, including all renderer types, i.e. this includes Chrome renderer, extensions renderer, as well as regular renderer processes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererGrowthIn30Min
histogram.summary: Growth speed of the private working set used by each renderer process per 30 minutes. The usage and growth speed is recorded at most every 30 minutes, not every exact 30 minutes. If the interval is longer than 30 minutes, it is normalized to a speed KB per 30 minutes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA log unless this is the first time the UMA log is recorded after startup of the renderer, 30 minutes have not passed from the last recording of the renderer or the usage goes down. If the usage goes down, the amount of the shrink will be recorded in the Memory.RendererShrinkIn30Min histogram.

histogram.name: Memory.RendererShrinkIn30Min
histogram.summary: Shrink speed of the private working set used by each renderer process per 30 minutes. The usage and shrink speed is recorded at most every 30 minutes, not every exact 30 minutes. If the interval is longer than 30 minutes, it is normalized to a speed KB per 30 minutes. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per UMA log unless this is the first time the UMA log is recorded after startup of the renderer, 30 minutes have not passed from the last recording of the renderer or the usage goes up. If the usage goes up, the amount of the growth will be recorded in the Memory.RendererGrowthIn30Min histogram.

histogram.name: Memory.SandboxHelper
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each sandbox helper process. Each sandbox helper process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPageFile
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPageFile2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the maximum amount of memory the current process can commit. This value is equal to or smaller than the system-wide available commit value.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPageFile2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the maximum amount of memory the current process can commit. This value is equal to or smaller than the system-wide available commit value.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPhys
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPhys2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of physical memory currently available. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first. It is the sum of the size of the standby, free, and zero lists.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailPhys2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of physical memory currently available. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first. It is the sum of the size of the standby, free, and zero lists.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailVirtual
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.AvailVirtual2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of unreserved and uncommitted memory currently in the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.AvailVirtual2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of unreserved and uncommitted memory currently in the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.MemoryLoad
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the approximate percentage of physical memory that was in use (0 indicates no memory use and 100 indicates full memory use).

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPageFile
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPageFile2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the current committed memory limit for the system or the current process, whichever is smaller.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPageFile2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the current committed memory limit for the system or the current process, whichever is smaller.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPhys
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPhys2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of actual physical memory.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalPhys2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the amount of actual physical memory.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalVirtual
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 595320 and replaced with Memory.Stats.Win.TotalVirtual2.
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system. For example, this value is approximately 2 GB for most 32-bit processes on an x86 processor and approximately 3 GB for 32-bit processes that are large address aware running on a system with 4-gigabyte tuning enabled.

histogram.name: Memory.Stats.Win.TotalVirtual2
histogram.summary: Windows-only metric that represents the size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system. For example, this value is approximately 2 GB for most 32-bit processes on an x86 processor and approximately 3 GB for 32-bit processes that are large address aware running on a system with 4-gigabyte tuning enabled.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Browser
histogram.summary: The swap used by the browser process. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Chrome
histogram.summary: The swap used by each chrome:// renderer process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.CompressedDataSize
histogram.summary: The amount of memory that swap was compressed into. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.CompressionRatio
histogram.summary: The ratio of swapped data original size to compressed size. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Extension
histogram.summary: The swap used by each extension process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Gpu
histogram.summary: The swap used by the GPU process. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.HaveSwapped
histogram.summary: Indicates that the system has swapped memory out at least once since boot. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.MemUsedTotal
histogram.summary: The amount of memory that is used by swap, including bookkeeping. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.NativeClient
histogram.summary: The swap used by each Native Client loader process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.NativeClientBroker
histogram.summary: The swap used by each Native Client broker process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.NumReads
histogram.summary: The number of reads from swap. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.NumWrites
histogram.summary: The number of writes to swap. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.OriginalDataSize
histogram.summary: The amount of memory that was swapped out. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.PepperPlugin
histogram.summary: The swap used by each Pepper plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.PepperPluginBroker
histogram.summary: The swap used by each Pepper plugin broker process. Each process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Plugin
histogram.summary: The swap used by each plugin process. Each plugin process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Renderer
histogram.summary: The swap used by each renderer process. Each renderer process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.SandboxHelper
histogram.summary: The swap used by each sandbox helper process. Each sandbox helper process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Total
histogram.summary: The sum of all processes' swap. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped. See Memory.Swap.Total2 for the same metric with higher precision bucketing.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Total2
histogram.summary: The sum of all processes' swap. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Utility
histogram.summary: The swap used by each utility process. Each utility process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Swap.Zygote
histogram.summary: The swap used by the zygote process. Recorded once per UMA ping if the system has swapped.

histogram.name: Memory.Total
histogram.summary: The sum of all processes. This is not aware of shared memory so it is just a rough estimate. Recorded once per UMA ping. See Memory.Total2 for the same metric with higher precision bucketing.

histogram.name: Memory.Total2
histogram.summary: The sum of all processes. This is not aware of shared memory so it is just a rough estimate. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Utility
histogram.summary: The private working set used by each utility process. Each utility process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.WorkerProcessCount
histogram.summary: The count of active worker processes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: Memory.Zygote
histogram.summary: The private working set used by the zygote process. Each zygote process provides one sample. Recorded once per process per UMA ping.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.LowMemoryTimeBetween
histogram.summary: Time between two consecutive LowMemory notification in one foreground session.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.NotificationBackground
histogram.summary: Memory notifications delivered through system callbacks to Chrome while in the background.

histogram.name: MemoryAndroid.NotificationForeground
histogram.summary: Memory notifications delivered through system callbacks to Chrome while in the foreground - we count LowMemory notification vs particular levels of TrimMemory foreground notification.

histogram.name: MemoryPurgeController.ReclaimedPartitionAllocInactiveTab
histogram.summary: The amount of reclaimed memory after a tab became inactive.

histogram.name: MemoryWarning.EvictedTabTimeSinceActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When the OS sends a memory warning and the app evicts a tab, this histogram records the time since the evicted tab was active.

histogram.name: MemoryWarning.ProtectedTabTimeSinceActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When the OS sends a memory warning and the app protects a tab, this histogram records the time since the protected tab was active.

histogram.name: MessageLoop.DelayedTaskQueue.PendingTasksCountOnIdle
histogram.summary: The size of the delayed task queue when the loop becomes idle. Diagnosis metric for https://crbug.com/850450#c4.

histogram.name: MessageLoop.DelayedTaskQueue.PostedDelay
histogram.summary: Reports the delay of a delayed task posted to a MessageLoop. Reported once per delayed task. Diagnosis metric for https://crbug.com/850450#c4.

histogram.name: MessageLoop.DelayedTaskQueueForUI.PendingTasksCountOnIdle
histogram.summary: The size of the delayed task queue when the loop becomes idle on a UI thread. Diagnosis metric for https://crbug.com/850450#c4. Note: this metric is a bit broken on Mac OSX as CFRunLoop doesn't deterministically invoke MessageLoop::DoIdleWork().

histogram.name: MessageLoop.ScheduledSleep.Completed
histogram.summary: Reports the delay for which the MessageLoop successfully slept until an upcoming delayed task. Reported each time a MessageLoop successfully sleeps until the next delayed task.

histogram.name: MessageLoop.ScheduledSleep.Interrupted
histogram.summary: Reports the delay for which the MessageLoop had planned to sleep (next delayed task) before it was woken up early. Reported each time a MessageLoop is woken up early.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.Navigation.OptedOut
histogram.summary: Whether a navigation opted out or not of Mixed Content autoupgrades. Recorded every navigation.

histogram.name: MixedAutoupgrade.Websocket.Status
histogram.summary: The status of a mixed content websocket that was autoupgraded to WSS.

histogram.name: Mobile.Splash.HideSplashWhenFinishing
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2020 because it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Records the cases when the splash screen is hidden when the activity is finishing. Only "true" is recorded. The purpose is to help determine cause of http://crbug.com/1096171

histogram.name: Mobile.Splash.TranslucencyRemovalFailed
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2020 because it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Records the cases when removing a Trusted Web Activity's or WebAPK's translucency via a reflective call fails. Only "true" is recorded.

histogram.name: Mobile.SystemNotification.CreationFailure
histogram.summary: Android: Represents the number of system notifications failed to be created by the Android API.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.BytesDownloaded
histogram.summary: Android: Records the total data downloaded by completion status.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.BytesWasted.ChromeNetworkStack
histogram.summary: Android: Records the total data wasted during download due to resumptions.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.CancelledDownloadRemovedFromHistory
histogram.summary: Android: Records the number of cancelled download that are cleaned up from the history, after loading all the downloads from the history DB on startup.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.CancelReason
histogram.summary: Android: Records the reason that a download is canceled.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.DownloadResumption
histogram.summary: Android: Records user interaction on the download resumption button.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.DownloadTime
histogram.summary: Android: Records the total time for a download by completion status.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.DuplicateInfobar
histogram.summary: Android: Records various counts related to the duplicate download infobar.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.FirstBackground.InterruptionCount
histogram.summary: Android: Records the number of interruptions for the first download started in background after it reaches a terminal state.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.FirstBackground.Reason
histogram.summary: Android: Records all the interrupt reasons for the first download started in background after every browser process launch. We only record the first download so that we can compare the difference between service manager only mode and full browser process mode.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.FirstBackground.StartedReason
histogram.summary: Android: After every browser process launch, records the interrupt reason of the first background download when it is started. This interrupt reason allows us to know whether download was interrupted due to browser process crash in an earlier attempt.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.InterceptFailureReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2016 in Issue 647755 with all downloads going through Chrome.
histogram.summary: Android: Records the reason that Chrome fails to intercept a download and pass it to the Android DownloadManager.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.InterruptedDownloadsRemovedFromHistory
histogram.summary: Android: Records the number of interrupted download that are cleaned up from the history, after loading all the downloads from the history DB on startup.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.InterruptionsCount
histogram.summary: Android: Records the total interruptions for a download by completion status.

histogram.name: MobileDownload.Notification.FixingSummaryLeak
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2017 in Issue 722320 with the removal of DownloadNotificationService.hideDanglingSummaryNotification.
histogram.summary: Android: Records the situation where we try to fix a standalone downloads summary notification, which shouldn't be visible to the user. True if the notification was a foreground notification, in which case we can't dismiss it and need to attempt a more drastic workaround. False if it was a normal notification and we can dismiss it easily (this is okay and expected behavior in some scenarios).

histogram.name: MobileFre.PrivacyLinkTappedStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2020 because the Privacy Notice is removed from FRE. (See crbug.com/1065912)
histogram.summary: iOS: Records the status of the privacy page after user taps on the privacy link on the first run welcome view. This metric is only recorded if and after the TOS are accepted. This metric is specific to iOS.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ColdStartupIntent
histogram.summary: For cold starts of Chrome (native not initialized at the time of intent), record in ChromeTabbedActivity whether the intent had the effect of opening a new page or was a restore of last session.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.LoadedHomepageOnColdStart
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated and removed from the code 02/2020
histogram.summary: Android: Tracks whether a homepage was loaded on startup of ChromeTabbedActivity. Launching a homepage is conditional on a homepage being configured on the device and the absence of any existing tabs, so it will only happen on a subsets of cold starts. The metric splits out whether the homepage was the NTP or some other URL.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.MainIntentAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed and removed from the code 05/2018
histogram.summary: Android: Records the first action the user does within 10s of starting Chrome. Recorded in DocumentActivity and ChromeTabbedActivity only when the starting intent is of type MAIN.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.MobileMultiWindowInstances
histogram.summary:
Android: Number of instances of Chrome currently open during a MultiWindow session. Emitted every time Chrome is paused. Only emitted on Android MultiWindow devices.
A MultiWindow session is any period of time that Chrome was not used in a full screen mode but together with another Activity that is visible at the same time. This is only supported in a few Android models.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.MobileMultiWindowSession
histogram.summary:
Android: percent of the screen available for Chrome during a multi-window session. Emitted every time chrome is paused. Only emitted on Android MultiWindow devices.
A multiwindow session is any period of time that Chrome was not used in full screen mode but together with some other application that is visible at the same time. This is only supported in a few Android models.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.NonMainIntentAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed and removed from the code 05/2018
histogram.summary: Android: Records the first action the user does within 10s of starting Chrome. Recorded in DocumentActivity and ChromeTabbedActivity only when the starting intent is not of type MAIN, e.g. VIEW, etc.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.TimeSinceLastUse
histogram.obsolete: Removed and removed from the code 05/2018
histogram.summary:
Android: The time since last use until Chrome is launched from the home screen. This is measured from the time the last tab is closed until a Main intent is received. Has a minute level precision for first 10 minutes increasing exponentially till 30 days.
Note: this metric is broken in M63 and below and only reliable in M64+.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstDrawTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed and renamed to MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstDrawTime2 due to double reporting bug (see https://crbug.com/857508).
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes from launch to the completion of first draw for Toolbar. This excludes activity creation time spent in framework.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstDrawTime2
histogram.obsolete: No longer useful, deprecated in M82.
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes from launch to the completion of first draw for Toolbar. This excludes activity creation time spent in framework.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstFocusStartupState
histogram.obsolete: No longer useful, deprecated in M82 (see https://crbug.com/1053190).
histogram.summary: Android: The state of chrome startup at the first time the user focuses the omnibox, if the user does so within the first 30s of the launch (excluding activity creation time spent in the framework).

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstFocusTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed and renamed to MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstFocusTime2 due to double reporting bug (see https://crbug.com/857508).
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes from launch to the first time the user focuses the omnibox if the user does so within first 30s of the launch. This excludes activity creation time spent in framework.

histogram.name: MobileStartup.ToolbarFirstFocusTime2
histogram.obsolete: No longer useful, deprecated in M82.
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes from launch to the first time the user focuses the omnibox if the user does so within first 30s of the launch. This excludes activity creation time spent in framework.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.Difference
histogram.obsolete: Removed and removed from code as of 05/2015.
histogram.summary: Represents the difference in bytes deemed modified by the two ModuleIntegrityVerifier code paths. The suffix indicates which path had a higher value. Logged when the ModuleIntegrityVerifier determines that a module is different on disk and in memory after being triggered by an incident and the reported byte count for both methods is different.

histogram.name: ModuleIntegrityVerification.RelocationsUnorderedModuleIndex
histogram.summary: Logged when the relocations in a module are not ordered causing the module verification to abort. The value is the index of the affected module.

histogram.name: Mojo.MachPortRelay.BrokerError
histogram.obsolete: The MachPortRelay was deleted in July 2019.
histogram.summary: Errors that the broker process encounters while trying to send or receive Mach ports from a child process.

histogram.name: Mojo.MachPortRelay.ChildError
histogram.obsolete: The MachPortRelay was deleted in July 2019.
histogram.summary: Errors that a child process encounters while trying to receive Mach ports from the broker process.

histogram.name: Mojo.Shell.ChildConnectionTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2/2018. Has not actually been collected for some time.
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes for a new child process to receive an initialization request from the Mojo shell. This is precisely the duration of the MojoShellConnectionImpl::BindToMessagePipe() call in ChildThreadImpl.

histogram.name: Mojo.System.GetParentPlatformHandleSyncTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time it takes for a child to receive its parent platform handle synchronously from the broker on startup. This only applies to the subset of platforms on which the sync broker is used.

histogram.name: Mojo.System.MessagesAcceptedPerEvent
histogram.summary: Number of internal Mojo system messages processed synchronously during a single execution of NodeController::AcceptIncomingMessages(). This is called any time an event requires internal Mojo system messages to be pumped. Values below 4 are no longer logged.

histogram.name: Mojo.System.Node.ConnectedPeers
histogram.summary: Number of connected peer nodes tracked by a node. This is emitted any time a peer is added to or dropped from a node.

histogram.name: Mojo.System.Node.PendingChildren
histogram.summary: Number of connected pending child node connections tracked by a node. This is emitted any time a parent-child node connection is initiated or dropped.

histogram.name: MojoLevelDBEnv.IOError.BFE
histogram.summary: Errors (base::File::Error) encountered by a single leveldb method in leveldb's Mojo environment.

histogram.name: MojoLevelDBEnv.RetryRecoveredFromErrorIn
histogram.summary: When Mojo LevelDBEnv successfully retries an operation that had failed, record the error from the most recent failed attempt.

histogram.name: MojoLevelDBEnv.TimeUntilSuccessFor
histogram.summary: Time Mojo LevelDBEnv slept before successfully completing this operation. 0 means success on the first try, as LevelDBEnv only sleeps when retries are needed.

histogram.name: Mouse.Sensitivity.Changed
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2013, replaced by Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Changed.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting.

histogram.name: Mouse.Sensitivity.Started
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2013, replaced by Mouse.PointerSensitivity.Started.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks mouse sensitivity setting on startup.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseDownDuration_Click
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user mousedown-ed a link and when the user clicked a link.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseDownFollowedByClick
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For each click handled by an HTML anchor tag link, whether Blink saw a mousedown event preceding it. This is only measured for clicks handled by the anchor tag's default click event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseDowns
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of mousedown events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseOverDuration_Click
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user mouseover-ed a link and when the user clicked a link.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseOverDuration_NoClick
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user mouseover-ed a link and when the user mouseout-ed a link without click.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.MouseOvers
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of mouseover events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.PreTapEventsFollowedByClick
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The tap gesture events detected before click at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.TapDownDuration_Click
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed between when the user tapdown-ed a link and when the user clicked a link.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.TapDowns
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of gesturetapdown events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MouseEventPrefetch.TapUnconfirmeds
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of gesturetapunconfirmed events detected at HTML anchor-tag links' default event handler.

histogram.name: MPArch.IIR_InputEventDelta
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 due to lack of use (Histogram Eraser).
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for the renderer to acknowledge an input event.

histogram.name: MPArch.RendererLaunchFirst
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn the first renderer subprocess (including sandbox init).

histogram.name: MPArch.RendererLaunchSubsequent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time it takes to spawn renderer sub processes not counting the first one.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_HangMonitorUnresponsive
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2017 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The length of time the renderer is unresponsive according to the hang monitor. Recorded when the renderer regains responsiveness.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_InputEventDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for the renderer to acknowledge an input event.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_OnMsgPaintRect
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent inside RenderWidgetHost::OnMsgPaintRect.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_OnMsgResizeOrRepaintACK
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2018 as message no longer exists.
histogram.summary: The time delta for processing a paint message. On platforms that don't support asynchronous painting, this is equivalent to MPArch.RWH_TotalPaintTime.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_OnMsgScrollRect
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent inside RenderWidgetHost::OnMsgScrollRect.

histogram.name: MPArch.RWH_OnMsgUpdateRect
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: MPArch.RWHH_WhiteoutDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that the user sees a blank white page after switching to a different tab, while the RenderWidgetHost receives data to paint from the renderer process.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.DiscardedTabsPerUser
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. Analysis confirms that the number of discards increases with the number of logged in users. No action will be taken based on this information.
histogram.summary: The relation of discarded tabs vs. the amount of simultaneous users. The counts are the number of discards and the buckets are the number of users. Since the count values are absolute numbers, they need to be normalized before use - so divide the counts by the percentage of users per session found under 'MultiProfile.UsersPerSessionIncremental'.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SessionMode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2017 when side-by-side multi-profile mode was removed. There is now only one multi-profile mode (separate desktop). See the metric 'MultiProfile.UsersPerSessionIncremental' for overall usage of the multi-profile feature on Chrome OS.
histogram.summary: The session counter for different multi profile modes which gets stored once per session at the beginning of the session.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.SigninUserUIPath
histogram.summary: Count the number of times each UI path is taken for signing into a new account in a Chrome OS multiprofile session. UI paths include the system tray and the user account switcher on the browser frame.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.TeleportWindow
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2018. Was not being maintained - some cases leading to teleport were not captured. See counts of 'MultiProfile.TeleportWindowType' to assess the usage of the teleport window feature.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of window teleportations when using separated desktop mode.

histogram.name: MultiProfile.UsersPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of users simultaneously signed into a multiprofile session on Chrome OS. This is recorded upon session end.

histogram.name: NaCl.ManifestDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the manifset file for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to download the main .nexe for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeSize
histogram.summary: The size of the main .nexe file downloaded for a Native Client module.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeStartupTime
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.NexeStartupTimePerMB
histogram.summary: The time it took between the Native Client plugin initialization and when proxied execution of the NaCl module begins. This is the general startup overhead of running as a NaCl module vs a trusted PPAPI plugin.

histogram.name: NaCl.OSArch
histogram.summary: The OS/Architecture of a nexe that was loaded.

histogram.name: NaCl.Startups
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2011, data is duplicated by NaCl.NexeStartupTime, and normalizing to 'tab opens' is unusual.
histogram.summary: The number of times that Native Client has been started by loading a .nexe compared to the number of times that a tab has been opened.

histogram.name: NativeAppLauncher.InstallationDetected
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. This metric is not sufficiently used.
histogram.summary: The number of times that Chrome detected that a request to download and install another Google iOS app completed successfully.

histogram.name: Navigation.BackForward.IsSameProcess
histogram.summary: Whether the back-forward navigation lead to a change of process or not.

histogram.name: Navigation.BackForward.ReadyToCommitUntilCommit
histogram.summary: The time needed to commit a back forward-navigation once it is ready to commit. This is the time between ReadyToCommit and DidFinishNavigation (for a navigation that commits).

histogram.name: Navigation.BackForward.TimeToReadyToCommit
histogram.summary: The time delta between the start of a back-forward navigation and the time it was ready to commit.

histogram.name: Navigation.ClientRedirectCycle.RedirectToReferrer
histogram.summary: Records when a client redirect cycle that is directly back to the referrer is detected.

histogram.name: Navigation.DeferredDocumentLoading.StatesV1
histogram.summary: Why and if cross-origin documents would be loaded in a world where we defer loading until they are visible.

histogram.name: Navigation.DeferredDocumentLoading.StatesV2
histogram.summary: Why and if cross-origin documents would be loaded if we were to defer loading as long as possible.

histogram.name: Navigation.DeferredDocumentLoading.StatesV3
histogram.summary: Why and if cross-origin documents would be loaded if we were to defer loading as long as possible. Difference from V2: frames positioned both above and to the left of the page have their own bucket and are no longer counted in the "above" bucket.

histogram.name: Navigation.DeferredDocumentLoading.StatesV4
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 because LazyLoading has real stats now.
histogram.summary: Why and if cross-origin documents would be loaded if we were to defer loading as long as possible. Changes from V3: replace detailed reasons with summaries for four strategies. E.g. any document that would load under a strategy of loading when a frame is two screens away is logged to the WouldLoad2Screens AND WouldLoad3Screens bucket. We only record documents below the current viewport, not to the right of it.

histogram.name: Navigation.DownloadPolicy
histogram.summary: When a navigation results in a download, logs the download policy applied to that navigation.

histogram.name: Navigation.FrameHasEmbeddedCredentials
histogram.summary: Whether the navigation was to a URL that had embedded credentials.

histogram.name: Navigation.Intercept.Ignored
histogram.summary: Records whether the InterceptNavigationThrottle ignored the navigation. This is recorded at the end of every navigation the throttle observes.

histogram.name: Navigation.Intercept.WillStart
histogram.summary:
The microseconds it takes for the InterceptNavigationThrottle to determine if the navigation should be ignored, at WillStartRequest time.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Navigation.IOSWKWebViewSlowFastBackForward
histogram.summary: Counts slow/fast back/forward WKWebView navigations on iOS. Fast navigation is a back/forward navigation done with WKBackForwardList.

histogram.name: Navigation.IsMobileOptimized
histogram.summary: Signifies whether a succesfully finished page load for the main frame content width fits within the device width and/or has a fixed page scale.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameHasEmbeddedCredentials
histogram.summary: Whether the main-frame navigation was to a URL that had embedded credentials.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameHasRTLDomain
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2020. Replaced with Navigation.MainFrameHasRTLDomain2. Navigation.MainFrameHasRTLDomain was logged differently for iOS and Navigation.MainFrameHasRTLDomain2 does not have this discrepancy.
histogram.summary: Whether the main-frame navigation was to a URL with an RTL domain name. This is only recorded for finished navigations and not attempts.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameHasRTLDomainDifferentPage
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2020. Replaced with Navigation.MainFrameHasRTLDomainDifferentPage2. Navigation.MainFrameHasRTLDomainDifferentPage was logged differently for iOS and Navigation.MainFrameHasRTLDomainDifferentPage2 does not have this discrepancy.
histogram.summary: Whether the main-frame navigation was to a URL with an RTL domain name, recorded for each main-frame avigation that replaces a document object. This is not reported for reference fragment navigations, pushState/replaceState or same page history navigation. This is only recorded for finished navigations and not attempts.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameProfileType
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2020. Replaced with Navigation.MainFrameProfileType2. Navigation.MainFrameProfileType was logged differently for iOS and Navigation.MainFrameProfileType2 does not have this discrepancy.
histogram.summary: The browser profile type for each main-frame navigation, recorded after navigation completion, including NTP.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameScheme
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2020. Replaced with Navigation.MainFrameScheme2. Navigation.MainFrameScheme was logged differently for iOS and Navigation.MainFrameScheme2 does not have this discrepancy.
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation. This is only recorded for finished navigations and not attempts.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameScheme.DataUrl.MimeType
histogram.summary: The mime type of the data: URL for each main-frame navigation. This only contains mime types that can run scripts. This is only recorded for finished navigations and not attempts.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPage
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2020. Replaced with Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPage2. Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPage was logged differently for iOS and Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPage2 does not have this discrepancy.
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation that replaces a document object. This is not reported for reference fragment navigations, pushState/replaceState or same page history navigation. This is only recorded for finished navigations and not attempts.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPageOTR
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2020. Replaced with Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPageOTR2. Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPageOTR was logged differently for iOS and Navigation.MainFrameSchemeDifferentPageOTR2 does not have this discrepancy.
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation that replaces a document object while in incognito. This is not reported for reference fragment navigations, pushState/replaceState or same page history navigation. This is only recorded for finished navigations and not attempts.

histogram.name: Navigation.MainFrameSchemeOTR
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code June 2020. Replaced with Navigation.MainFrameSchemeOTR2. Navigation.MainFrameSchemeOTR was logged differently for iOS and Navigation.MainFrameSchemeOTR2 does not have this discrepancy.
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for each main-frame navigation while in incognito. This is only recorded for finished navigations and not attempts.

histogram.name: Navigation.ReadyToCommitUntilCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-01 (M73), replaced by Navigation.ReadyToCommitUntilCommit2 (same histogram, different bucketing).
histogram.summary: The time needed to commit a navigation once it is ready to commit. This is the time between ReadyToCommit and DidFinishNavigation (for a navigation that commits).

histogram.name: Navigation.RedirectChainSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed January 2019 because it wasn't used.
histogram.summary: Total length of the redirect URL strings in navigation entry. Logged when entry is committed.

histogram.name: Navigation.Reload.ReloadMainResourceToReloadDuration
histogram.summary: Reported when a user triggers reload without any other navigations after the previous reload in the same page, and the previous reload variant was RELOAD_MAIN_RESOURCE. Duration time between two reloads is reported.

histogram.name: Navigation.Reload.ReloadToReloadDuration
histogram.summary: Reported when a user triggers reload without any other navigations after the previous reload in the same page. Duration time between two reloads is reported.

histogram.name: Navigation.Renderer.ReadyToCommitUntilCommit
histogram.summary: The time needed in the renderer process between receiving the message to commit the navigation until the navigation has committed.

histogram.name: Navigation.ResourceHandler.ProceedWithResponseUntilFirstReadCompleted
histogram.summary: The time delta between when the ResourceHandler is allowed to read the response's body and when it has completed its first read.

histogram.name: Navigation.ResourceHandler.ResponseStartedUntilProceedWithResponse
histogram.summary: The time delta between when the ResourceHandler started receiving the response and when it is allowed to read the response's body.

histogram.name: Navigation.SandboxFrameBackForwardStaysWithinSubtree
histogram.summary: Counts session history navigations in sandboxed iframes that disallow top level navigation, for cases that only stay within the iframe's subtree vs those that affect other frames instead or as well.

histogram.name: Navigation.Scheduled.MaybeCausedAbort
histogram.summary: window.location and other scheduled navigation changes can cause the current provisional load to be aborted. Many times these are initiated without user gesture. This histogram logs counts of the various aborters.

histogram.name: Navigation.Scheduled.MaybeCausedAbort.Time
histogram.summary: window.location and other scheduled navigation changes can cause the current provisional load to be aborted. Many times these are initiated without user gesture. This histogram logs the time between the aborted navigation start and the scheduled navigation start, if the aborted navigation has a non-zero navigationStart value.

histogram.name: Navigation.SchemePerUniqueOrigin
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for the first main-frame navigation per origin per non-OffTheRecord session.

histogram.name: Navigation.SchemePerUniqueOriginOTR
histogram.summary: The scheme of the URL for the first main-frame navigation per origin per OffTheRecord session.

histogram.name: Navigation.Start.RendererBrowserDifference.Negative
histogram.obsolete: Data collected and posted on issue 675833.
histogram.summary: The difference between Now() in the renderer and browser_navigation_start for browser-initiated navigations if the difference is negative. This value should ideally only reflect the IPC time between the browser process and renderer process, but in practice could be skewed by inter-process timing errors. If the clocks used for TimeTicks are monotonic across processes, all samples should fall into the Positive bucket.

histogram.name: Navigation.Start.RendererBrowserDifference.Positive
histogram.obsolete: Data collected and posted on issue 675833.
histogram.summary: The difference between Now() in the renderer and browser_navigation_start for browser-initiated navigations if the difference is positive. This value should ideally only reflect the IPC time between the browser process and renderer process, but in practice could be skewed by inter-process timing errors. If the clocks used for TimeTicks are monotonic across processes, all samples should fall into the Positive bucket.

histogram.name: Navigation.TimeToCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed March 2018 in favor of Navigation.StartToCommit variants. Removed from code in November 2020 (M89).
histogram.summary: Time between the start of a browser-started navigation request in and its commit.

histogram.name: Navigation.TimeToReadyToCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-01 (M73), replaced by Navigation.TimeToReadyToCommit2 (same histogram, different bucketing).
histogram.summary: The time delta between the start of a navigation and the time it is ready to commit.

histogram.name: Navigation.UI_OnCommitProvisionalLoad.Intent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2018 in favor of PageLoad metrics.
histogram.summary: Obsolete. Time between receiving an Android Intent and the navigation commit.

histogram.name: Navigation.UI_OnCommitProvisionalLoad.Link
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2018 in favor of PageLoad metrics.
histogram.summary: Obsolete. Time between clicking on a link and the navigation commit.

histogram.name: Navigation.UI_OnLoadComplete.Intent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2018 in favor of PageLoad metrics.
histogram.summary: Obsolete. Time between receiving an Android intent and the document load complete event for a navigation in the main frame.

histogram.name: Navigation.UI_OnLoadComplete.Link
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2018 in favor of PageLoad metrics.
histogram.summary: Obsolete. Time between clicking on a link and the document load complete event for a navigation in the main frame.

histogram.name: NavigationPredictor.AccuracyActionTaken
histogram.summary: Tracks the accuracy of the action taken by navigation predictor. Recorded at the time of page click.

histogram.name: NCN.CM.FastestRTTOn2G
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on a 2G connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
This metric is recorded when the NetworkChangeNotifier detects a connectivity change. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time seen on a 3G connection, before the NetworkChangeNotifier detected a connectivity change.
