Any value other than 0 indicates that we have received errors in a range outside of the one in which we recorded the specific errors in Net.FileError_Write. The code is OS dependent, so when looking at the histogram don't mix OSes.

histogram.name: Net.FileSVGZLoadCount
histogram.summary: A compressed SVG file was loaded from the file scheme. This is a temporary counter to determine how often (if at all) this feature is used. Recorded during creation of file-request for .svgz resource. See http://crbug.com/857117 for more information.

histogram.name: Net.ForceAlternativeService
histogram.obsolete: Data collection ended, corresponding feature removed.
histogram.summary: Track usage of alternative services forced by the force-alt-protocols command line flag. Triggered each time alternative services are queried for a given origin and the command line flag would make a difference (that is, there is no advertised alternative service for that origin).

histogram.name: Net.FoundSystemTrustRootsAndroid
histogram.obsolete: Underlying implementation changed to no longer depend on OS. Removed in Chrome 77.
histogram.summary: Whether or not system installed trust anchors could be distinguished from user installed trust anchors. Recorded on first certificate verification on Android 4.2 and later.

histogram.name: Net.FtpDataConnectionErrorCount
histogram.summary: The number of times each FTP Error was observed.

histogram.name: Net.FtpDataConnectionErrorHappened
histogram.summary: The number of Chrome sessions which encountered the indicates FTP Error. This prevents allowing a user that retried a connection many times (getting an error each time) from biasing the tallies.

histogram.name: Net.FtpServerTypeCount
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of times the FTP server type was encountered.

histogram.name: Net.FtpServerTypeCount2
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of times the FTP server type was encountered.

histogram.name: Net.GetProxyForUrl_FAIL
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for WinHttpGetProxyForUrl to return with error.

histogram.name: Net.GetProxyForUrl_OK
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time spent waiting for WinHttpGetProxyForUrl to return with success.

histogram.name: Net.GoogleConnectionInappropriateFallback
histogram.summary: Records a sample for each HTTPS request to a Google server that either succeeded or received an inappropriate_fallback alert. This is used to estimate how frequently the fallback is used to recover from a spurious network failure.

histogram.name: Net.GoogleConnectionUsedSSLVersionFallback
histogram.summary: Nonzero if the HTTP request was to a Google server which required SSL version fallback. The value indicates the SSL version the request fell back on. Since Google servers support TLS 1.2, any fallback is an indication of network middleware problems.

histogram.name: Net.GoogleConnectionUsedSSLVersionFallback2
histogram.summary: For each successful HTTPS request to a Google server, whether it used the SSL version fallback. The value indicates the SSL version the request fell back on. Since Google servers support TLS 1.2 and FALLBACK_SCSV, any fallback is an indication of a broken local SSL MITM proxy.

histogram.name: Net.GzipEncodingFixupResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed around 2015/03/18. The code which implemented Gzip encoding fixup was removed.
histogram.summary: Resources are sometimes transferred with an incorrect encoding type of gzip. net::Filter::FixupEncodingTypes() attempts to correct for these situations by applying a set of heuristics. This histogram counts the frequency of usage of these heuristics in the wild.

histogram.name: Net.HadConnectionType
histogram.obsolete: The count was inaccurate (it counted transactions rather than connections).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Each bucket is a boolean (0 or 1) indicating whether the user has had a connection of that type during the session.

histogram.name: Net.HadConnectionType2
histogram.obsolete: This statistic measures successful and failed connections, the new one only measures successful ones.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Each bucket is a boolean (0 or 1) indicating whether the user has had a connection of that type during the session.

histogram.name: Net.HadConnectionType3
histogram.summary: Each bucket is a boolean (0 or 1) indicating whether the user has had a successful connection of that type during the session.

histogram.name: Net.HadFtpServerType
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of sessions that encountered a given FTP server type. Each session reports a given server type at most once.

histogram.name: Net.HadFtpServerType2
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of sessions that encountered a given FTP server type. Each session reports a given server type at most once.

histogram.name: Net.HstsInfo
histogram.summary: Recorded for each host where we query the HSTS state, details on whether the implementation matched the specification. See https://crbug.com/821811.

histogram.name: Net.Http2ResponseStatusHeader
histogram.summary: Format of :status header value in HTTP/2 response.

histogram.name: Net.Http2SSLCipherSuite
histogram.summary: The SSL/TLS cipher suite that was negotiated, recorded for each successful HTTP/2 connection.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCacheAddEvicted
histogram.summary: Whether adding an entry to the HTTP auth cache evicted another entry.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCacheAddEvictedCreation
histogram.summary: When an HTTP auth cache entry is evicted, the time since it was created.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCacheAddEvictedLastUse
histogram.summary: When an HTTP auth cache entry is evicted, the time since it was last used.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCacheAddPathEvicted
histogram.summary: Whether adding a path to an entry in the HTTP auth cache evicted another path.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCacheEntriesExaminedWhenNoMatch
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018 when changing the cache implementation such that the number of entries examined no longer applies.
histogram.summary: The number of entries examined (equal to the cache size) when attempting to look up an HTTP auth cache entry (either by path or realm) and finding no matching entries. This is recorded whenever the lookup fails (i.e., value 0 in Net.HttpAuthCacheLookupPosition and Net.HttpAuthCacheLookupByPathPosition).

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCacheLookupByPathPosition
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018 when changing the cache implementation such that the lookup position no longer applies.
histogram.summary: When looking up an HTTP auth cache entry by path, the position (1-indexed) of the entry on a hit, or 0 on a miss.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthCacheLookupPosition
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018 when changing the cache implementation such that the lookup position no longer applies.
histogram.summary: When looking up an HTTP auth cache entry by realm, the position (1-indexed) of the entry on a hit, or 0 on a miss.

histogram.name: Net.HttpAuthResource
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Count of authentication requests for top level pages vs. sub-resources, such as images or iframes.

histogram.name: Net.HttpConnectionLatency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time between the HttpNetworkTransaction requesting a connection and the time it connected.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLength
histogram.summary: Size of the response body. This is the actual number of bytes received, which usually agrees with but is not necessarily the same as the size specified by the Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthCacheable
histogram.summary: Size of the response body if it is cacheable. This is the actual number of bytes received, which usually agrees with but is not necessarily the same as the size specified by the Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthCacheable24Hours
histogram.summary: Size of the response body if it is cacheable for at least 24 hours. This is the actual number of bytes received, which usually agrees with but is not necessarily the same as the size specified by the Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthCacheable4Hours
histogram.summary: Size of the response body if it is cacheable for at least 4 hours. This is the actual number of bytes received, which usually agrees with but is not necessarily the same as the size specified by the Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthDifference
histogram.summary: The difference between the size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header and the size of the response body. This is zero if the X-Original-Content-Length header is not present in the response.

histogram.name: Net.HttpContentLengthWithValidOCL
histogram.summary: Size of the response body. Only includes resources that have the X-Original-Content-Length header.

histogram.name: Net.HttpHeaderParserEvent
histogram.summary: Records the frequency with which a number of hacky HTTP header parsing rules are invoked. This histogram should be removed after we have enough data to know if we can remove the hacks.

histogram.name: Net.HttpOriginalContentLength
histogram.summary: Size specified in the X-Original-Content-Length header. If this header is not present in the response, the size of the response body is used.

histogram.name: Net.HttpProxySocketRequestTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes to request a new (unused) HTTP proxy socket.

histogram.name: Net.HttpRequest.ContainsInvalidHeaderValuesInRFC7230
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2016 because this is not continuously tracked.
histogram.summary: Whether a request contains invalid request header values in RFC 7230. This is counted once for every redirect leg. https://crbug.com/455099.

histogram.name: Net.HttpRequestCompletionErrorCodes
histogram.summary: The network error code that the HTTP request completes with, including OK and ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.HttpRequestCompletionErrorCodes.MainFrame
histogram.summary: The network error code that the HTTP main frame resource request completes with, including OK and ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.HttpResponse.ContainsInvalidHeaderValuesInRFC7230
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2016 because this is not continuously tracked.
histogram.summary: Whether a response contains invalid response header values in RFC 7230. This is counted once for every redirect leg. https://crbug.com/455099.

histogram.name: Net.HttpResponseCode_Nxx_MainFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 06/2019. Net.HttpResponseCode has similar information, but for all resources, not just the main frame, and includes the full response code.
histogram.summary: The count of HTTP Response codes encountered, in response to MAIN_FRAME requests only; saving only the hundreds digit, e.g. 100->1, 300->3.

histogram.name: Net.HttpResponseInfo.ConnectionInfo
histogram.summary: Application protocol used in HTTP response. Recorded every time a URLRequest completes.

histogram.name: Net.HttpResponseInfo.ConnectionInfo.MainFrame
histogram.summary: Application protocol used in HTTP responses to requests for main frames. Only includes requests that went over the network.

histogram.name: Net.HttpResponseInfo.ConnectionInfo.SubResource
histogram.summary: Application protocol used in HTTP responses to requests for resources other than main frames. Does not include internal Chrome requests. Only includes requests that went over the network.

histogram.name: Net.HttpServerProperties.UpdatePrefs
histogram.summary: The location in http_server_properties_manager.cc where UpdatePrefs was called.

histogram.name: Net.HttpSocketType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets (all HTTP sockets, regardless of any proxy used) used for HTTP[s].

histogram.name: Net.HttpStatusLineStatus
histogram.summary: Records how often violations of RFC 7230's header parsing rules are observed.

histogram.name: Net.HttpStreamFactoryJob.Alt.NextState
histogram.summary: Reports the next state that the Alternative Job is in.

histogram.name: Net.HttpStreamFactoryJob.Alt.State
histogram.summary: Reports the state that the Alternative Job is in.

histogram.name: Net.HttpStreamFactoryJob.Main.NextState
histogram.summary: Reports the next state that the Main Job is in.

histogram.name: Net.HttpStreamFactoryJob.Main.State
histogram.summary: Reports the state that the Main Job is in.

histogram.name: Net.HttpStreamFactoryJob.StreamReadyCallbackTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes for OnStreamReadyCallback to be called.

histogram.name: Net.HttpTimeToFirstByte.LargeUpload
histogram.summary: Time from when an HTTP request is issued to when the first byte is processed, for requests with an upload that is > 1 MiB. Excludes chunked uploads.

histogram.name: Net.IOError_SocketReuseType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of handleable socket errors (connection abort/close/reset) per socket reuse type.

histogram.name: Net.IOError_SocketReuseType_disable_late_binding
histogram.obsolete: Late bindings are on by default now.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.IOError_SocketReuseType_enable_late_binding
histogram.obsolete: Late bindings are on by default now.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of handleable socket errors (connection abort/close/reset) per socket reuse type. Socket late binding is enabled.

histogram.name: Net.IOThreadCreationToHttpRequestStart
histogram.summary: Time from when the IOThread is created to when the first URL request is started. Only requests that are created for a profile while Chrome is starting up are considered.

histogram.name: Net.IPv6ConnectDuration
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.IPv6ConnectFailureMatch
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.

histogram.name: Net.IPv6ConnectSuccessMatch
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether the interface-enumeration IPv6 probe method was successful given that the UDP-connect IPV6 probe was successful.

histogram.name: Net.IPv6Status
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The probe results when a test for IPv6 support is done.

histogram.name: Net.IPv6Status_retest
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The probe results when a test for IPv6 support is done, after a network change event.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfJobController
histogram.summary: This counts number of all the job controllers that are still alive if the count is a multiple of 100: 100, 200, 300, etc.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfJobController.NonPreconnect.PendingRequest
histogram.summary: This counts number of JobControllers that are still alive, not created for preconnect, and still have a HttpStreamFactoryImpl::Request pending.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfJobController.NonPreconnect.RequestGone
histogram.summary: This counts number of job controllers that are still alive, not created for preconnect but HttpStreamFactoryImpl::Request has completed.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfJobController.Preconnect
histogram.summary: This counts number of job controllers which are used for preconnect and are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfJobControllerAtShutDown
histogram.summary: This counts number of all the job controllers that are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfNonPreconnectAltJob
histogram.summary: This counts number of alternative jobs which are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfNonPreconnectMainJob
histogram.summary: This counts number of main jobs which are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfPendingRequest
histogram.summary: This counts number of HttpStreamFactoryImpl::Request which are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.JobControllerSet.CountOfPreconnect
histogram.summary: This counts number of job controllers which are used for preconnect and are still alive.

histogram.name: Net.KeepaliveStatisticsRecorder.PeakInflightRequests
histogram.summary: The peak number of concurrent outstanding requests with keepalive specified.

histogram.name: Net.LoadPrefetch.Pattern
histogram.summary:
The completion status of prefetches that have finished loading.
Measurement occurs at ResourceLoader::ResponseCompleted so requests canceled before that point are not registered.
This applies to requests with net::LOAD_PREFETCH, used by various prefetching features such as no-state prefetch and RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.
Note that "success from cache" means that the UrlRequest::was_cached() was true and unused_since_prefetch was false. "success from network" means that was_cached() was false. "success already prefetched" means that both was_cached() and unused_since_prefetch were true. Validated results are considered cached, even though a conditional network request is made.

histogram.name: Net.MTPR_GetProxyForUrl_Thread_Wait_Time
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time that a (non-cancelled) proxy resolution request was stalled waiting for an execution thread, for MultiThreadedProxyResolver.

histogram.name: Net.MTPR_GetProxyForUrl_Time
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that it took for a (non-cancelled) proxy resolution request to complete, for MultiThreadedProxyResolver.

histogram.name: Net.NetInternalsUi.Feature
histogram.summary: Counts the number of browser launches where chrome://net-internals and chrome://net-internals/#tests are used.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorLogging.HeaderOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 for cleanup. https://crbug.com/1089011. Not actively used, large size, and information is not actionable.
histogram.summary: When Network Error Logging receives a "NEL:" header, what happens to it.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorLogging.RequestOutcome
histogram.summary: When Network Error Logging observes a completed request that might generate a report, what happens to it. NEL observes all requests, both successful and unsuccessful. It sends reports for successful and unsuccessful requests at specified sampling rates so that error rates can be calculated. Insecure requests are discarded for having an insecure origin regardless of existence of a policy for the origin.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsRecovered.MainFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download the main frame of a page in response to specific HTTP network errors succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsRecovered.Subresource
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download a subresource in response to specific HTTP network errors succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsUnrecovered.MainFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download the main frame of a page in response to specific HTTP network errors returns another network error. Histogram includes only the error code that triggered the retry.

histogram.name: Net.NetworkErrorsUnrecovered.Subresource
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: How often automatically retrying to download a subresource in response to specific HTTP network errors returns another network error. Histogram includes only the error code that triggered the retry.

histogram.name: Net.NumDuplicateCookiesInDb
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-08-17 as part of cookie histogram cleanup (https://crbug.com/521135).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of duplicate cookies that were present in the cookie store during startup.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestFailedTimeMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-04-21 as it was Linux/CrOS only.
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This measures the amount of time that failures to get OCSP information take.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-04-21 as it was Linux/CrOS only.
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This records the fraction of successful requests.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPRequestTimeMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-04-21 as it was Linux/CrOS only.
histogram.summary: When validating an HTTPS certificate we may have to make one or more HTTP fetches to OCSP responders in order to get revocation information. This measures the amount of time that each of those requests takes.

histogram.name: Net.OCSPResponseStapled
histogram.summary: When connecting over HTTPS, a server may include an OCSP response as part of the TLS handshake so that clients do not have to fetch it, provided the client requested the server do so. This measures whether or not a server included an OCSP response when it was requested.

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()". This error code is platform specific, so when there is a Windows/Linux conflict, both decodings are shown.

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Linux
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Mac
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.OSErrorsForGetAddrinfo_Win
histogram.summary: Positive error code that was returned by the system library "getaddrinfo()".

histogram.name: Net.PacResultForStrippedUrl
histogram.summary:
Proxy Auto Config (PAC) allows specifying an arbitrary javascript program to pick network proxies on a per-request basis (based on the URL). This works by calling the script's FindProxyForURL() function with the target URL as its first argument.
Traditionally, the URL parameter passed into the script contains the exact URL being loaded, except maybe for having stripped the fragment and embedded identity portions of the URL.
This histogram records what happens when the URL passed into FindProxyForURL() additionally has had its path component stripped. Does it return the same proxy list as when calling FindProxyForURL() with the original (unmodified) URL?
This comparison is done only when the URL scheme implies a secure channel (i.e. https:// and wss://), in order to gather data for crbug.com/593759.

histogram.name: Net.Ping_ResponseStartedTime
histogram.summary: How long it took for an <a ping> request to receive a response. Only recorded if a response was received.

histogram.name: Net.Ping_Result
histogram.summary: The result of an <a ping> request, whether it received a response or timed out or failed for some other reason.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectedLinkNavigations
histogram.summary: Indicate whether a link navigation was preceded by a recent pre-connect trigger (within 10 seconds). There is a high chance that loading the page used a preconnected TCP session.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectedNavigation
histogram.summary: Indicate whether a URLRequest was preceded by a recent pre-connect trigger (within 10 seconds). There is a high chance that loading the resource used a preconnected TCP session.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectMotivation
histogram.summary:
When a preconnection is made, indicate what the motivation was.
Currently, the most common (only?) motivations are SELF_REFERAL, LEARNED_REFERAL and OMNIBOX. The SELF_REFERAL indicates that we made sure a second connection was available for a resource that either was never before seen, or has historically had no subresources. The LEARNED_REFERAL indicates that we "learned" that a subresource was commonly needed, and that motivated the TCP/IP preconnect. The OMNIBOX motivation happens when a search is being suggested, and we preconnect to the search provider. (WARNING: Prior to version 7.517.*, enums 7, 8, and 9 may be confused, as EARLY_LOAD_MOTIVATED was inserted new 6 value.)

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectProxyStatus
histogram.summary: Indicate whether there was a proxy to preclude preconnection.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectSkippedToProxyServers
histogram.summary: Indicates number of times a preconnect to proxy server was skipped due to an existing pending preconnection request.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectSubresourceEval
histogram.summary:
What did we decide to do about a predicted resource, based on the historical expected number of connection that this subresource will require.
This is basically the current thresholding of the SubresourceExpectation, relative to current static thresholds, and taking into account whether preconnection is enabled (i.e., if preconnection is disabled, we'll never decide to preconnect).

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectSubresourceExpectation
histogram.summary:
The expected number of connections, times 100, that we'll make to a given subresource, based on learned history.
By comparing this to thresholds, we decide if we will preconnect, preresolve, or do nothing. This histogram can be used to select those static thresholds.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectTriggerUsed
histogram.summary: Indicate whether if a preconnect trigger is followed by a resource request (from link navigations) to the host or not. This is to measure precision of link-based preconnect triggers.

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectUtilization
histogram.obsolete: Sourced data corrected, and replaced by NetPreconnectUtilization2
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Indicate final utilization for each attempted socket connection.
We also include stats for non-speculative sockets. Some socket connections may never connect, and others may never be used (as the user may abort before then).

histogram.name: Net.PreconnectUtilization2
histogram.summary:
Indicate final utilization for each attempted socket connection.
We also include stats for non-speculative sockets. Some socket connections may never connect, and others may never be used (as the user may abort before then).

histogram.name: Net.Predictor.MRUIndex
histogram.obsolete: Dev data was collected which was good enough to make a decision on the size of the predictor database.
histogram.summary: The index into the predictor's MRU on navigation. This is the size the MRU had to be in order to effectively predict subresources for this navigation.

histogram.name: Net.Predictor.Startup.DBSize
histogram.summary: The approximate size in bytes of the predictor's database on startup.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.Pattern
histogram.summary:
The completion status of prefetches that have finished loading.
Measurement occurs at ResourceLoader::ResponseCompleted so requests canceled before that point are not registered.
This applies to requests with RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.
Note that "success from cache" means that the UrlRequest::was_cached() was true and unused_since_prefetch was false. "success from network" means that was_cached() was false. "success already prefetched" means that both was_cached() and unused_since_prefetch were true. Validated results are considered cached, even though a conditional network request is made.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.TimeBeforeCancel
histogram.summary:
Time spent on prefetch requests before the request was canceled.
This applies to requests with RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.TimeSpentOnPrefetchHit
histogram.summary: Time spent on requests that were served from a cache entry whose unused_since_prefetch bit is true.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.TimeSpentPrefetchingFromCache
histogram.summary:
Time spent on prefetch requests when fetched from cache.
This applies to requests with RESOURCE_TYPE_PREFETCH.

histogram.name: Net.Prefetch.TimeSpentPrefetchingFromNetwork
histogram.summary: Time spent on prefetch requests when fetched from the network, including validation time.

histogram.name: Net.PrefProxyConfig.GooglezipProxyRemovalCount
histogram.summary: Records how many *.googlezip.net Data Reduction Proxies were removed from the effective proxy configuration when a proxy reconfiguration occurs.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_High_Latency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for high priority (currently frame and subframe) requests. Only times under 10 minutes are recorded.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_High_Latency_b
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for high priority (currently frame and subframe) requests.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_Low_Latency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for low priority (non-frame/subframe) requests. Only times under 10 minutes are recorded.

histogram.name: Net.Priority_Low_Latency_b
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the start of the http transaction until the first byte of the response for low priority (non-frame/subframe) requests.

histogram.name: Net.Proxy.RedirectDuringConnect
histogram.summary:
Counts how often a 302 (redirect) response is observed during CONNECT (proxy tunnel establishment). The counts are bucketed by proxy settings source (auto-detect vs explicit) and load type (subresource vs main frame).
To interpret this histogram, the most interesting property will be the number of users in each of the buckets, which can be used to approximate what fraction of users would be affected by a policy change that blocked redirects on subresources/non-autodetected proxies.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyAuthRequested.HasConnection
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/02/28, in a proxy auth refactor.
histogram.summary: When a PROXY_AUTH_REQUESTED error code is handled in net::HttpStreamFactoryImpl::Job::RunLoop, this is true if connection_ has an associated value.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyPollConfigurationTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time in milliseconds spent fetch the system proxy configuration, when polling it for changes.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolutionService.PacUrlScheme
histogram.summary: The breakdown of URL schemes seen for explicitly configured ProxyAutoConfig (PAC). This metric is emitted once each time the proxy settings change (including initial value). Note that this does not count implicitly inferred PAC URLs (from WPAD).

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.AbandonedExecutionTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent executing the proxy script during "tracing" runs (executions of the script which discovered a new DNS dependency and were subsequently abandoned).

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.AbandonedExecutionTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent executing the proxy script during "tracing" runs (executions of the script which discovered a new DNS dependency and were subsequently abandoned).

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.DnsWaitTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent in the non-blocking DNS bindings while executing PAC scripts. This includes the times for abandoned executions.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.ExecutionTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time inside of V8 that the proxy script spent executing for the final pass. This includes the time spent in the javascript bindings. This does not include the time spent in abandoned execution passes.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.NumAlerts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that alert() was called in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.NumErrors
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of errors that were seen in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.NumRestarts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that the PAC script execution was restarted.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.TotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.TotalTimeDNS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that proxy resolution spent waiting for DNS. This also includes any queuing delays on the origin thread waiting for the DNS result to be processed.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.BlockingDNSMode.UniqueDNS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of unique DNS hostnames that the PAC script tried to resolve. The *Ex() versions of the bindings count separately.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.DnsWaitTotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total amount of time that was spent in the non-blocking DNS bindings while executing PAC scripts. This includes the times for abandoned executions.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.ExecutionTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time inside of V8 that the proxy script spent executing for the final pass. This includes the time spent in the javascript bindings (which is probably dominated by Net.ProxyResolver.DnsWaitTotalTime). This does not include the time spent in abandoned execution passes.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumAlerts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that alert() was called in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumErrors
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of errors that were seen in the final execution of the script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.NumRestarts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that the PAC script execution was restarted.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.OriginThreadLatency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took upon completion to run the final task posted back to the IO thread.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTimeDNS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that proxy resolution spent waiting for DNS. This also includes any queuing delays on the origin thread waiting for the DNS result to be processed.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.TotalTimeWorkerThread
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The total time that the proxy resolution took, not including the post back to the origin thread. This includes all the time spent waiting for DNS, PAC script execution, and restarts.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.UniqueDNS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of unique DNS hostnames that the PAC script tried to resolve. The *Ex() versions of the bindings count separately.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyResolver.URLSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The length of the URL that was passed into the PAC script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.GetProxyUsingScriptResult
histogram.summary: The network error code of resolving a URL by forwarding the request to the proxy resolver and executing the PAC script.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.GetProxyUsingScriptTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to resolve a URL by forwarding the request to the proxy resolver and executing the PAC script. This includes PAC script execution, DNS queries, and internal retries. This does not include retries initiated by the user, such as by calling ProxyService::ReconsiderProxyAfterError().

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.ResolvedUsingScript
histogram.summary: Whether proxy resolution occured by forwarding the request to the proxy resolver and executing the PAC script. This histogram records all URLs, regardless of whether a proxy configuration is set. Note that in some cases, the system proxy resolver is used. If so, this histogram indicates whether the request was forwarded to the system resolver. However, on desktop platforms, the number of users using the system resolver should be small since the default is to use V8. Hence, the count of emissions to the 'True' bucket on desktop caused by users of the system resolver should be small.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.ResolveProxyTime
histogram.summary: The total time taken to resolve a URL. This includes PAC script execution, DNS queries, and internal retries. This does not include retries initiated by the user, such as by calling ProxyService::ReconsiderProxyAfterError().

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.ScriptTerminated
histogram.summary: Whether a proxy resolution resulted in the PAC script terminating unexpectedly. This does not include terminations that occured during initialization of a new proxy resolver. This only happens when the resolver process crashes when using out-of-process PAC.

histogram.name: Net.ProxyService.ScriptTerminatedOnInit
histogram.summary: Whether the creation of a new proxy resolver resulted in the PAC script terminating unexpectedly. This only happens when the resolver process crashes when using out-of-process PAC.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinFailureDomain
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of November 2016 because of disuse. Historical data is likely inaccurate due to changes in the data structure that calculated domain IDs for this histogram.
histogram.summary: Second-level domains for which we have observed public key pinning failures.

histogram.name: Net.PublicKeyPinReportSendingFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2016. Replaced with Net.PublicKeyPinReportSendingFailure2.
histogram.summary: A validated certificate chain may be subject to additional pinning requirements on a per-domain basis. When pinning requirements are violated, Chrome attempts to send a report about the incident. This records the net error code when sending a pinning violation report fails.

histogram.name: Net.PushedStreamAlreadyHasResponseHeaders
histogram.summary: Records whether HTTP/2 response headers have already arrived on a pushed stream at the time the stream is matched up with a request. See https://crbug.com/554220.

histogram.name: Net.QuicAlternativeProxy.Usage
histogram.summary: Breakdown of how requests which could potentially make use of an alternative QUIC proxy server use or don't use the QUIC server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicChromiumPacketReader.ShouldStopReadingInLoop
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2019, associated bug is root-caused and fixed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that QuicChromiumPacketReader should stop reading in the loop at StartReading. This data will be compared against crashes and help investigate https://crbug.com/1014092.

histogram.name: Net.QuicChromiumPacketReader.ShouldStopReadingOnReadComplete
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2019, associated bug is root-caused and fixed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that QuicChromiumPacketReader should stop reading after finishing the previous read. This data will be compared against crashes and help investigate https://crbug.com/1014092.

histogram.name: Net.QuicClientHelloServerConfig.HowExpired
histogram.summary: How expired server config is for sending inchoate ClientHello to the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicClientHelloServerConfig.InvalidDuration
histogram.summary: The time since expiration of server config when we sent inchoate ClientHello to the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicClientHelloServerConfigState
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2014. Replaced by Net.QuicInchoateClientHelloReason.
histogram.summary: The reason (the state of the server config) for sending inchoate ClientHello to the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicCloseConnection.NullVisitor
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2018. No data for this histogram for more than 30 days.
histogram.summary: The number of times Connection's visitor is a nullptr when CloseConnection is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicCryptoClientConfig.PopulatedFromCanonicalConfig
histogram.summary: The number of times CryptoClientConfig's CachedState is populated from canonical config whenever we create a new CryptoClientConfig::CachedState.

histogram.name: Net.QuicDiskCache.APICall
histogram.summary: Tracks number of times data read/parse/write API calls of QuicServerInfo to and from disk cache is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicDiskCache.EntryState
histogram.summary: Tracks the opening and closing of disk cache entries. Recorded each time a disk cache entry is either opened or closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicEphemeralPortsSuggested
histogram.summary: The number of ports suggested per server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicHttpStream::DoStreamRequest.IsNullSession
histogram.summary: The number of times QuicHttpStream's session_ is a nullptr before StartRequest() is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicInchoateClientHelloReason
histogram.summary: The reason (the state of the server config) for sending inchoate ClientHello to the server.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumSentClientHellosCryptoHandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: The number of client hello messages sent when the crypto handshake was confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumStreamFramesInPacket
histogram.summary: The number of stream frames bundled within a received packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicNumStreamFramesPerStreamInPacket
histogram.summary: The number of stream frames per stream ID within a received packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicReadAvailableData.NullStream
histogram.summary: The number of times QuicHttpStream's stream_ is a nullptr before IsDoneReading() is called.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.DiskCacheLoadTime
histogram.summary: Time spent to load QUIC server information from disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.DiskCacheReadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2014. Replaced by DiskCacheWaitForDataReadyTime.
histogram.summary: Time spent to load QUIC server information from disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.DiskCacheWaitForDataReadyTime
histogram.summary: Time spent waiting to load QUIC server information from disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.ExpectConfigMissingFromDiskCache
histogram.summary: The number of times AlternateProtocolMap supports QUIC, but there is no QUIC server information in the disk cache. This is recorded whenever QUIC server information is loaded from the disk cache.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.WaitForDataReady.HandshakeConfirmedTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time between waiting for reading of QUIC server information from disk cache, and receiving crypto handshake confirmation from the server. Will measure the impact of cancelling the WaitForDataReady callback. Logged after crypto handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicServerInfo.WaitForDataReadyToRtt
histogram.summary: The ratio of the time spent waiting to load QUIC server information from disk cache to the min rtt. Logged when session is closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.21CumulativePacketsReceived
histogram.summary: This histogram summarizes information about a 21 packet sequence, indicating for each of the 21 possible prefixes of this pattern, how many packets were received in that prefix. The first range uses buckets 0 and 1, and it describes the 1st packet in the sequence. It indicates if the first packet was missing (bucket 0), or the first packet was present (bucket 1). The second range uses buckets 2 through 4, and describes the first 2 packets in the prefix of this sequence. It indicates if there were no packets received in the first two packets (bucket 2), or there was one out of two packets received (bucket 3), or if there was two out of tow received (bucket 4). etc. etc. Reading this histogram may require post-processing in a spread sheet, but can indicate the potential value of using FEC packets to convey data.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.6PacketsPatternsReceived
histogram.summary: Each of the 64 buckets represents a different binary pattern of 6 consecutive packets that were received by the client. The LSB of the bucket number corresponds to the reception of the oldest packet. A bit in the bucket-number being 1 indicates the packet was received, and a 0 means the packet was never received (by the client).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ConnectionCloseErrorCode
histogram.summary: The QUIC error code which resulted in the Google QUIC connection being closed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.CookieSentToAccountsOverChannelId
histogram.summary: Logs whether channel ID was used when a cookie is sent over QUIC to https://accounts.google.com.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.FailToSerializePacketLocation
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated 10/2020 because it's no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Record where exactly packet serialization fails for investigation.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HandshakeRoundTrips
histogram.summary: Samples of the number of round-trips needed by a QUIC connection before a request could be sent by the client.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HeadersHOLBlockedTime
histogram.obsolete: The experiments with head of line blocking have been completed, and the code tracking head of line blocking was removed.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time that headers are head of line blocked on others, presumably due to lost headers stream packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HeadersStream.EarlyFramesReceived
histogram.summary: The frames received on the headers stream which arrived early.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.HostResolutionTime
histogram.summary: Time spent resolving the DNS name of the server for a QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.InternalErrorLocation
histogram.summary: The location where a QUIC internal error was generated, recorded any time an internal error is generated, which should be once per connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.LocallyTimedOutWithOpenStreams.TimeSinceLastReceived{UnackedPackets}
histogram.summary: If a QUIC connection timed out locally with open streams, this contains the time since any data was read from the network until the connection was closed. The suffix specifies whether there were any unacked packets pending when the connection timed out. {UnackedPackets}

variant.name: .NoUnackedPackets
variant.summary: The session had no outstanding unacked packets.

variant.name: .UnackedPackets
variant.summary: The session had outstanding unacked packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumQueuedPacketsAtOutOfOrder
histogram.summary: The number of queued packets when a connection is closed due to writing an out of order packet.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.NumQueuedPacketsBeforeWrite
histogram.summary: The number of queued packets when a connection starts to write queued packets.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PacketReceived
histogram.summary: Each bucket corresponds to a specific packet sequence number that was sent by a server to Chrome at the start of a QUIC connection. This histogram is compared, bucket by bucket, with a second histogram to compute the ratio for each bucket (each packet sequence number).

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.PublicResetAddressMismatch
histogram.summary: When a public reset packet is received, whether the client IP address and port number in it differ from the client IP address and port number in the ServerHello handshake message. In the comparison, the first address is the one in ServerHello and the second address is the one in public reset. Note: this histogram is obsolete because it failed to treat IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses as IPv4 addresses.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReceivedSettings.MaxHeaderListSize
histogram.summary: The value of the SETTINGS_MAX_HEADER_LIST_SIZE parameter received on an HTTP/3 connection, if any.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.ReceivedSettings.MaxTableCapacity
histogram.summary: The value of the SETTINGS_QPACK_MAX_TABLE_CAPACITY parameter received on an HTTP/3 connection, if any.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.RetryAfterWriteErrorCount
histogram.summary: The number of consecutive times a packet was retried after a write error.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.SentConnectivityProbe
histogram.summary: The number of times the connection sends connectivity probe to the peer.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.SessionAvailableWhenValidatingDNS
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 9/19 because this metric was added to inspect a crash and the crash had been fixed.
histogram.summary: True if at the time of Dns comparison between fresh resolution and stale resolution, session_ is valid.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.StaleHostResolveFailed
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 9/19 because this metric was added to inspect a crash and the crash had been fixed.
histogram.summary: Logs places in code where stale host resolution doesn't have valid results. For control purpose, it also logs when a valid stale result is used.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TooManyOpenStream
histogram.summary: True if more than 100 streams are open when a new stream is activated.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TruncatedAcksReceived
histogram.summary: The number of truncated ACK frames received.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.TruncatedAcksSent
histogram.summary: The number of truncated ACK frames sent.

histogram.name: Net.QuicSession.WriteOutOfOrderQueuedPacketAfterClose
histogram.summary: Temporary histogram being used to investigate https://crbug.com/818040. Records whether a connection is closed when an out of order queued packet is about to be written.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.MigrationBeforeHandshake
histogram.summary: Status of the connection which is created for migration before handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.NumDegradingSessions
histogram.summary: The number of sessions that are degrading on network change. The suffix specifies the network change.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.NumQuicSessionsAtNetworkChange
histogram.summary: The number of QUIC sessions when a network change is detected.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.PercentageDegradingSessions
histogram.summary: Of all the exisiting sessions, the percentage of sessions that detects degrading on network change. The suffix specifies the network change.

histogram.name: Net.QuicStreamFactory.TSVIPCliIsLoaded
histogram.summary: Whether TSVIPCli DLL is loaded or not on windows when the socket is configured.

histogram.name: Net.QuicTimeBetweenTwoPacketSent
histogram.summary: Time duration from last packet sent to a new packet sent in QUIC connection.

histogram.name: Net.QuicVerifyProofFailed.HandshakeConfirmed
histogram.summary: Logged whenever proof verification fails and if the failure occurred before or after the crypto handshake is confirmed.

histogram.name: Net.RenegotiationExtensionSupported
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if the HTTP request was sent to a server which supports the TLS renegotiation extension.

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.HeaderEndpointGroupOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to process a single endpoint group in a Report-To header once the header itself has been parsed.

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.HeaderEndpointOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to process a single endpoint in a Report-To header once the header itself has been parsed.

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.HeaderOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to process a Report-To header. Once it is parsed, Reporting.HeaderEndpointOutcome records the outcome of the endpoints within it.

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.ReportDeliveredAttempts
histogram.summary: When Reporting successfully delivers a report, the number of unsuccessful delivery attempts that preceded the successful one.

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.ReportDeliveredLatency
histogram.summary: The delivery latency of reports successfully delivered by Reporting. Starts when the report is queued and finishes when the delivery attempt returns successfully.

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.UploadError
histogram.summary: The error (net or HTTP) encountered by Reporting trying to upload one or more reports to a single endpoint in a single request, recorded when the upload attempt completes, if and only if the attempt failed with a net error or an HTTP error other than 410 (which is specified to mean "remove endpoint").

histogram.name: Net.Reporting.UploadOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to upload one or more reports to a single endpoint in a single request, recorded when the upload attempt completes.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Net.RequestTime2 due to bug in original implementation.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for success and various different errors.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2
histogram.obsolete: Unused, so removed from Chromium as of 2017/8/31.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for success and various different errors.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.HttpScheme
histogram.obsolete: Unused, so removed from Chromium as of 2017/8/31.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the request's scheme is http/s.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.NetworkContent
histogram.obsolete: Unused, so removed from Chromium as of 2017/8/31.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the requests TotalReceivedBytes() > 0.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.NoBytesRead
histogram.obsolete: Unused, so removed from Chromium as of 2017/8/31.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the requests TotalReceivedBytes() = 0 and received_response_content_length() = 0.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.NoNetworkContent.CachedContent
histogram.obsolete: Unused, so removed from Chromium as of 2017/8/31.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the requests TotalReceivedBytes() = 0 and received_response_content_length() > 0.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2.ErrAborted.NonHttpScheme
histogram.obsolete: Unused, so removed from Chromium as of 2017/8/31.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for ERR_ABORTED when the request's scheme is not http/s.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2Success.MainFrame
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for success for main frame resources.

histogram.name: Net.RequestTime2Success.Subresource
histogram.summary: The amount of time between request initiation and request completion for success for non-main frame resources.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceDispatcherHost.OutstandingRequests.PerProcess
histogram.summary: The largest number of outstanding requests that are handled by the resource dispatcher host for a single process.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceDispatcherHost.OutstandingRequests.Total
histogram.summary: The largest number of outstanding requests that are handled by the resource dispatcher host across all processes.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceDispatcherHost.PeakOutstandingRequests
histogram.summary: The largest number of outstanding requests handled by the resource dispatcher host, during the last sample interval (60 seconds). Not logged if there are no outstanding requests in the interval. This metric is temporary for the Loading Dispatcher v0 (crbug.com/723233), and will be removed soon.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceDispatcherHost.RequestMode.Get
histogram.summary: Records request mode (https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-request-mode) for HTTP "GET" requests.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceDispatcherHost.RequestMode.Post
histogram.summary: Records request mode (https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-request-mode) for HTTP "POST" requests.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceDispatcherHost.RequestMode.Post.WithPort
histogram.summary: Records request mode (https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-request-mode) for HTTP "POST" requests whose url contains a port.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.ExpectedContentSizeResult
histogram.summary: Records how many times expected content size equals/less/more than size of read body/buffer or content size is unkown. Recorded for each resource load.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.InliningStatus
histogram.obsolete: This experiment was turned down, see https://crbug.com/703188.
histogram.summary: Counts whether the chunk inlining is applicable or not to a resource loading. Counts the reason if inapplicable.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.ResponseStartToEnd
histogram.summary:
Time from the start to the end of receiving a response body. Recorded for each resource load.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Net.ResourceLoader.TimeToURLRequestStart
histogram.summary: The time elapsed from URLRequest creation to when a ResourceLoader actually calls Start on it.

histogram.name: Net.ResponseSizeByProcess.Browser
histogram.obsolete: The code to record this histogram was removed November 2017.
histogram.summary: Count of (post-SSL/proxy, pre-filter) kilobytes received per request made by the browser process.

histogram.name: Net.ResponseSizeByProcess.Renderer
histogram.obsolete: The code to record this histogram was removed November 2017.
histogram.summary: Count of (post-SSL/proxy, pre-filter) kilobytes received per request made by a renderer process.

histogram.name: Net.ResponseSizeByProcess.Unknown
histogram.obsolete: The code to record this histogram was removed November 2017.
histogram.summary: Count of (post-SSL/proxy, pre-filter) kilobytes received per request made by a process not covered by one of the other ResponseSizeByProcess histograms.

histogram.name: Net.RestrictedCookieManager.SetCanonicalCookieDomainMatch
histogram.obsolete: Removed Aug 2020. This was added to evaluate safety of proposed code changes, and is no longer necessary as the necessary results were obtained.
histogram.summary: Logged whenever the RestrictedCookieManager sets a CanonicalCookie. True if the domain of the cookie matches the domain of the URL, false otherwise.

histogram.name: Net.Socket.IdleSocketFate
histogram.summary: Whether an idle socket is reused, timed out, or closed to make room for new sockets.

histogram.name: Net.Socket.IdleSocketReuseTime
histogram.summary: Seconds a socket was idle before it was reused. Emitted upon reuse. Does not record the times sockets were idle before first use.

histogram.name: Net.Socket.IdleSocketTimeSaving
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds an idle socket saved in connection establishment because it is reused.

histogram.name: Net.Socket.NumIdleSockets
histogram.summary: Number of idle sockets when one of them was reused.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an already used socket sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused socket (all HTTP sockets, regardless of any proxy used) sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeOnIOError2_ReusedSocket
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time a previously used socket sat idle before encountering a recoverable socket IO error (connection abort/reset/close).

histogram.name: Net.SocketIdleTimeOnIOError2_UnusedSocket
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused socket sat idle before encountering a recoverable socket IO error (connection abort/reset/close).

histogram.name: Net.SocketInitErrorCodes
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Net error codes that socket initializations end with, including net::OK and net::ERR_ABORTED.

histogram.name: Net.SocketReceiveBufferUnchangeable
histogram.summary: The size of a socket's receive buffer when the attempt to change it via setsockopt failed.

histogram.name: Net.SocketRequestTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from initial RequestSocket() call until successfully acquiring a connected socket.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionEstablish
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: The time from the connection start to connection establish.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: The time waiting to be ready to start connecting.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ConnectionType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of connection type of socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.Duration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. Replaced by Net.WebSocket.Duration.
histogram.summary: The time a socket stream was open.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ProtocolType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: Each bucket is the number of protocol type on socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ReceivedBytes
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: Number of bytes on a socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.ReceivedCounts
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: Number of reads on a socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.SentBytes
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: Number of bytes on a socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketStream.SentCounts
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10-28. No longer generated. No direct replacement.
histogram.summary: Number of Write on a socket stream.

histogram.name: Net.SocketType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets returned by the socket pools.

histogram.name: Net.SOCKSSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an already used SOCKS socket sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SOCKSSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused SOCKS socket sat idle before being used.

histogram.name: Net.SOCKSSocketRequestTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from initial SOCKSClientSocketPool::RequestSocket() call until successfully acquiring a connected SOCKS socket.

histogram.name: Net.SocksSocketRequestTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time it takes to request a new (unused) SOCKS proxy socket.

histogram.name: Net.SOCKSSocketType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets returned by the SOCKS pool.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyConnectionLatency
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyConnectionLatency_2
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyFrameStreamFlowControlState
histogram.obsolete: The last protocol which would trigger this was deprecated in 2014 November. This histogram is deprecated in 2016 January.
histogram.summary: The counts of the flow control state of each frame (with stream flow control on).

histogram.name: Net.SpdyHighestQueuedCappedFramesCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 2020-03 once we confirmed the numbers looked as expected.
histogram.summary: The highest number of capped frames queued in the SPDY write queue.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyHpackEncodedCharacterFrequency
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as HTTP/2 standard is finalized.
histogram.summary: Frequencies of characters observed in request and response headers. Temporarily being collected to inform the construction of an optimized Huffman code for the HTTP/2 specification. Buckets are ASCII codes offset by 1.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyPing.RTT
histogram.summary: The RTT for SPDY's PING.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyPriorityCount
histogram.summary: The count of streams at each priority over Spdy sessions.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyRecvBytes
histogram.obsolete: Removed because it took up too much space and nobody used it.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes recevied per stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySendBytes
histogram.obsolete: Removed because it took up too much space and nobody used it.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes sent per stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.BytesRead.EOF
histogram.summary: Total number of bytes recevied per session before closing session due to EOF.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySession.BytesRead.OtherErrors
histogram.summary: Total number of bytes recevied per session before closing session due to an error during read.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionErrorDetails
histogram.summary:
WARNING: r181910 added an enum value in the middle, so don't trust the counts for values 9 and above for Chrome builds after that revision.
The type of SPDY Protocol error encountered.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionErrorDetails_Google
histogram.summary: The type of SPDY Protocol error encountered when talking to a google.com server.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessions_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: The count of SPDY sessions using the data reduction proxy and the count of other SPDY sessions.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionSocketNotConnectedGetLocalAddress
histogram.summary: SpdySession::GetLocalAddress returned ERR_SOCKET_NOT_CONNECTED.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionSocketNotConnectedGetPeerAddress
histogram.summary: SpdySession::GetPeerAddress returned ERR_SOCKET_NOT_CONNECTED.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySessionsWithStalls
histogram.summary: The count of SPDY Sessions with or without stalls.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsCwnd
histogram.summary: The congestion window (in pkts) received at the end of a SpdySession.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsCwndSent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016 July with removal of SPDY/3.1.
histogram.summary: The congestion window (in pkts) sent at the beginning of a SpdySession.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsReceived
histogram.summary: Percentage of sessions which received settings from the server.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsRetransRate
histogram.summary: The Download Retransmission Rate (%) received at the end of a SpdySession.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsRTT
histogram.summary: The RTT received at the end of a SpdySession.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySettingsSent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sessions which sent settings to the server.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamDownloadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed because it took up too much space and nobody used it.
histogram.summary: The time between receiving the first chunk and the last chunk of data on a Spdy stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamStallsPerSession
histogram.summary: The number of stream stalls per session.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed because it took up too much space and nobody used it.
histogram.summary: The time of a Spdy stream. Measured from sending the first chunk to receiving the last chunk of data.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyStreamTimeToFirstByte
histogram.obsolete: Removed because it took up too much space and nobody used it.
histogram.summary: The time between sending the request and receiving the first chunk of data on a Spdy stream.

histogram.name: Net.SpdySynStreamCompressionPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2016-11-28, because SPDY/3 and, accordingly, SYN_STREAM frames are no longer used. Compression values are now calculated slightly differently. Replaced by Net.SpdyHeadersCompressionPercentage.
histogram.summary: The percent compression achieved when compression SYN_STREAM frames.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyVersion
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2014-09-11, because the uploaded values were changing as protocols were removed, therefore statistics couldn't be combined across different builds. Replaced by Net.SpdyVersion2.
histogram.summary: The SPDY protocol version that is used to talk to SPDY servers.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyVersion2
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2016-02-01, because the incorrect bucket count caused data corruption. Replaced by Net.SpdyVersion3.
histogram.summary: The SPDY protocol version that is used to talk to SPDY servers. Logged every time a SPDY session is initialized.

histogram.name: Net.SpdyVersion3
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016 July with removal of SPDY/3.1.
histogram.summary: The SPDY protocol version that is used to talk to SPDY servers. Logged every time a SPDY session is initialized.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_AuthRootConsistency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-01 with the transition to a unified root list with OS fallback.
histogram.summary: The results of comparing the built-in list of known Windows roots against the CERT_AUTH_ROOT_SHA256_HASH_PROP_ID certificate property. Recorded for each certificate verification on Windows.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Error_FastRadioPadding
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned when opening an SSL connection for an endpoint which is eligible for fastradio padding.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Error_Google
histogram.summary: Counts of specific error codes returned when opening an SSL connection for google.com and any subdomain of it.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes when using the data reduction proxy. This includes certificate retrieval and verification.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Full_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for full handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google2
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google_Full_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it for full handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google_No_Revocation_Checking
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it. This only includes users in a 50% field trial that disables revocation checking for certificate pinned sites.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google_Resume_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it for resumption handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Google_Revocation_Checking
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for google.com and any subdomain of it. This only includes users not in a 50% field trail that disables revocation for certificate pinned sites.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_PostQuantum
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes, but only for servers that are part of the post-quantum experiment.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_PostQuantumSupported_Full_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes (full handshakes only), for a set of domains that we expect to always offer the experimental post-quantum (CECPQ1) ciphersuites.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_PQPadding
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for any server that echos a dummy post-quantum padding extension.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_Latency_Resume_Handshake
histogram.summary: Time from when the Connect() starts until it completes for resumption handshakes.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_Connection_PostQuantum_Negotiated
histogram.summary: For only browsers in the post-quantum (CECPQ1) ciphersuite experiment, counts the full TLS handshakes where CECPQ1 was, or was not, negotiated on hosts where we expect it to be negotiated.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_EVCertificateCTCompliance
histogram.summary: The state of compliance with Certificate Transparency presence requirements for each EV certificate. An EV certificate could be non-compliant (in which case it loses the EV status), comply through inclusion in the EV whitelist or have the required number of Signed Certificate Timestamps. This metric will gauge adoption rate of Certificate Transparency and will help identify when the EV whitelist is no longer needed. Emitted during every SSL connection establishment, but only if the client is checking compliance with Certificate Transparency requirements (currently guarded by a Finch experiment).

histogram.name: Net.SSL_EVCertificateInWhitelist
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 with the deprecation of the EV certificate whitelist after all certificates expired.
histogram.summary: Whether an EV certificate is present in the Certificate Transparency whitelist. Emitted once for every EV certificate encountered (during SSL connection establishment), but only if the client has a valid whitelist.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_EVCTCompliance
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 with the deprecation of distinct EV and !EV CT policies.
histogram.summary: The state of compliance with Certificate Transparency presence requirements for each EV certificate. An EV certificate could be non-compliant (in which case it loses the EV status), comply through inclusion in the EV whitelist or comply with the CT certificate policy. This metric will gauge adoption rate of Certificate Transparency and will help identify when the EV whitelist is no longer needed. Emitted during every SSL connection establishment.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_EVWhitelistValidityForNonCompliantCert
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2017 with the deprecation of the EV certificate whitelist after all certificates expired.
histogram.summary: Whether the client holds a valid EV Certificates whitelist or not. Only emitted when an EV cert that is not compliant with the Certificate Transparency requirement is encountered. This histogram is intended to be short-lived and help determine if EV certificates are considered non-compliant because they are not whitelisted or if the client does not hold a valid instance of the whitelist.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_KeyExchange.DHE
histogram.summary: Bit strength of the key exchange for DHE. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds.

histogram.name: Net.SSL_KeyExchange.RSA
