histogram.summary: Bit strength of the key exchange for RSA. Recorded for each SSL/TLS connection in the socket pool where Connect() succeeds. See |SSL_SESSION|'s key_exchange_info for more information.

histogram.name: Net.SSLCertBlacklisted
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 01/2016. Only ever measured blacklisted Comodo serials, not any of the other blacklisted certificates and keys.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times that users have hit blacklisted certificates. The indexes match up to the indexes in net/base/x509_certificate.cc:IsBlacklisted. The details of the certificates in question is confidential.

histogram.name: Net.SSLDraftDowngradeTLS13Experiment
histogram.summary: For each HTTPS connection to the TLS 1.3 experiment server set, whether the TLS 1.3 anti-downgrade mechanism would have fired. This is to measure the effects of non-compliant middleboxes on this otherwise safe security feature. The numbers are only valid while the TLS 1.3 experiment set deploys a TLS 1.3 draft version compatible with the corresponding Chrome version and implement the our draft anti-downgrade signal. See https://crbug.com/boringssl/226.

histogram.name: Net.SSLFallbackErrorCode
histogram.summary: For each successful HTTPS request which used the TLS version fallback, the error code of the last failed attempt.

histogram.name: Net.SSLFallbackFailureState
histogram.summary: For each successful HTTPS request which used the TLS version fallback, the type of handshake failure of the last failed attempt.

histogram.name: Net.SSLHostInfoDNSLookup
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time to complete a DNS lookup for a DNS CAA record.

histogram.name: Net.SSLHostInfoDNSLookupDelayMs
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time that we would have wasted had we waited for a CAA lookup in order to validate a certificate.

histogram.name: Net.SSLHostInfoVerificationTimeMs
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time to complete a speculative certificate verification.

histogram.name: Net.SSLProtocolErrorCipher
histogram.summary: The cipher suite used when the corresponding operation on an SSLClientSocket fails with ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR. This histogram will be removed when https://crbug.com/593963 is resolved.

histogram.name: Net.SSLProtocolErrorReason
histogram.summary: The internal, version-specific BoringSSL error reason reported when the corresponding operation on an SSLClientSocket fails with ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR. This histogram will be removed when https://crbug.com/593963 is resolved.

histogram.name: Net.SSLProtocolNegotiation
histogram.summary: TLS extension used to negotiate protocol (ALPN or NPN); in case of NPN, whether the protocol is indeed supported by both the client and the server or is a fallback because of no overlap; and the negotiated protocol itself.

histogram.name: Net.SSLRecordSizeRead
histogram.summary: The number of bytes, excluding the record header, of each TLS record read.

histogram.name: Net.SSLRSAKeyUsage.KnownRoot
histogram.summary: For each TLS connection which uses a known root, an RSA key, and TLS 1.2 or below, what the result of checking the RSA key usage would have been.

histogram.name: Net.SSLSecureRenegotiation
histogram.summary: For each attempted SSL renegotiation (non-initial handshake), whether the server supported the renegotiation_info extension (RFC 5746).

histogram.name: Net.SSLServerKeyExchangeHash
histogram.summary: For each SSL connection with a full handshake using a DHE- or ECDHE-based key exchange, the hash function used in the ServerKeyExchange signature.

histogram.name: Net.SSLSessionConcurrentLookupCount
histogram.summary: For each SSL connection where we resume a session and negotiate HTTP/2, the simulated minimum number of sessions retained per host it would have required with TLS 1.3 single-use sessions. See https://crbug.com/631988.

histogram.name: Net.SSLSessionVersionMatch
histogram.summary: For each SSL connection that resumed a session, whether the session was resumed at the same version it was established at. This is only recorded in BoringSSL ports.

histogram.name: Net.SSLTLS13Downgrade
histogram.summary: For each HTTPS connection, whether the TLS 1.3 anti-downgrade mechanism would have fired. This is only recorded if enforcement has been disabled and includes samples from non-1.3 servers. See https://crbug.com/boringssl/226.

histogram.name: Net.SSLTLS13DowngradeTLS13Experiment
histogram.summary: For each HTTPS connection to the TLS 1.3 experiment server set, whether the TLS 1.3 anti-downgrade mechanism would have fired. This is only recorded if enforcement has been disabled and is only valid while the TLS 1.3 experiment set deploys the final TLS 1.3 version. See https://crbug.com/boringssl/226.

histogram.name: Net.SSLTLS13DowngradeType
histogram.summary: For each HTTPS connection that triggered the TLS 1.3 anti-downgrade mechanism, the key exchange and whether the root was known.

histogram.name: Net.SSLTLS13DowngradeTypeTLS13Experiment
histogram.summary: For each HTTPS connection to the TLS 1.3 experiment server set that triggered the TLS 1.3 anti-downgrade mechanism, the key exchange and whether the root was known.

histogram.name: Net.SSLTLS13SessionLifetime
histogram.summary: For each session added to TLS session cache that uses TLS 1.3 or later, the lifetime of the session. Note that this incorporates both the server-supplied timeout and any local restrictions imposed by the client itself.

histogram.name: Net.SSLTLS13SessionTimeToUse
histogram.summary: For each TLS 1.3 session successfully retrieved from the session cache, the time between the session was added and the time it was retrieved.

histogram.name: Net.SSLv3FallbackToRenegoPatchedServer
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times that we have performed SSLv3 fallback and found a TLS renegotiation patched server.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVerificationMerged
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Was a speculative certificate verification used?

histogram.name: Net.SSLVerificationMergedMsSaved
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time saved by a speculative certificate vertification.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVersionInterferenceDetails_TLS13Experiment
histogram.summary: For each detected SSL version interference against a server in the initial TLS 1.3 deployment, details on how the initial connection failed.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVersionInterferenceError
histogram.summary: For each detected SSL version interference, what network error the original failed connection reported.

histogram.name: Net.SSLVersionInterferenceProbeTrigger
histogram.summary: For each SSL version interference probe, what network error triggered it. Probes are only triggered for a small set of network errors.

histogram.name: Net.SuccessfulResolutionWithValidDNSName
histogram.summary: True if a DNS name contains only characters for which |net::IsValidLabelCharacter| returns true. Used to see if we can deprecate and remove support for arbitrary bytes in DNS names. This histogram is recorded after DNS resolution has completed successfully.

histogram.name: Net.TCP_Connection_Idle_Sockets
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Number of idle sockets when the Connect() succeeded.

histogram.name: Net.TcpFastOpenSocketConnection
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2019, as fast open support has been removed.
histogram.summary: For sockets for which a TCP Fast Open protocol might be used, the result of trying to use it.

histogram.name: Net.TCPForSOCKSSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an already used TCP socket sat idle before being used for a SOCKS request.

histogram.name: Net.TCPForSOCKSSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused TCP socket sat idle before being used for a SOCKS request.

histogram.name: Net.TCPForSOCKSSocketRequestTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from initial SOCKSClientSocketPool::RequestSocket() call until successfully acquiring a connected TCP socket.

histogram.name: Net.TCPForSOCKSSocketType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets returned by the TCP pool used by the SOCKS pool.

histogram.name: Net.TCPSocketType
histogram.obsolete: Was only used for HTTP[S] connections, renamed to Net.HTTPSocketType.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of TCP socket returned.

histogram.name: Net.ThreadHopResourceThrottleTime
histogram.summary: The time it took to do an IO to UI round-trip in the ThreadHopResourceThrottle. This is part of an experiment to determine the feasibility to moving some high-level resource loading checks to the UI thread.

histogram.name: Net.TokenBinding.HeaderCreationTime
histogram.obsolete: Token Binding was removed in Q4 2018 and this histogram was removed in 3/2019.
histogram.summary: Time spent creating a Token-Binding header.

histogram.name: Net.TokenBinding.KeyMatch
histogram.obsolete: Token Binding was removed in Q4 2018 and this histogram was removed in 3/2019.
histogram.summary: Logs on each request that is sent on a connection where Channel ID was sent whether the key that would be used for Token Binding matches the key used for Channel ID.

histogram.name: Net.TokenBinding.StoreEphemerality
histogram.obsolete: Token Binding was removed in Q4 2018 and this histogram was removed in 3/2019.
histogram.summary: For each request to accounts.google.com on a connection where Channel ID was sent, this logs whether the Cookie store and the Channel ID store were ephemeral or persistent.

histogram.name: Net.TokenBinding.Support
histogram.obsolete: Token Binding was removed in Q4 2018 and this histogram was removed in 3/2019.
histogram.summary: The number of secure HTTP requests broken down by support for Token Binding, indicating if Token Binding was negotiated and supported by both client and server, or why it wasn't if not.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Bandwidth
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Effective bandwidth in KByte/Second of transactions logged to Transaction_Latency histogram. Note that only samples durations greater than zero ms, and less than 1 hour are tallied into this ratio.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Connected
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the when the network transaction is requested, until the first byte of the header is received.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Connected_New
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When a new connection is established, the time from the when the network transaction is requested, until the first byte of the header is received. Only items under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Connected_New_b
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When a new connection is established, the time from the when the network transaction is requested, until the first byte of the header is received.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Connected_Under_10
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from the when the network transaction is requested, until the first byte of the header is received. Only items under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from first byte sent until last byte received by the new network stack. Only items under 1 hour are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_b
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from first byte sent until last byte received by the new network stack.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Total
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from when a network transaction is requested until last byte received by the new network stack.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Total_New_Connection
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When an existing TCP/IP connection is NOT reused, the time from when a network transaction is requested until last byte received by the new network stack.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Total_New_Connection_Under_10
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When an existing TCP/IP connection is NOT reused, the time from when a network transaction is requested until last byte received by the new network stack. Only items under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Total_Under_10
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from when a network transaction is requested until last byte received by the new network stack. Only items under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_Under_10
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from first byte sent until last byte received by the new network stack. Only items under 10 minutes are logged.

histogram.name: Net.Transaction_Latency_WinHTTP
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from first byte sent until last byte received with old WinHTTP network stack. Only items under 1 hour are logged.

histogram.name: Net.TransportSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_ReusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an already used TCP socket sat idle before being used (either for direct or non-socks use).

histogram.name: Net.TransportSocketIdleTimeBeforeNextUse_UnusedSocket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time an unused TCP socket sat idle before being used (either for direct or non-socks use).

histogram.name: Net.TransportSocketRequestTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from initial ClientSocketPool::RequestSocket() call until successfully acquiring a connected socket (either for direct or non-socks use).

histogram.name: Net.TransportSocketType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The counts of the type of sockets returned by the TCP pool (either for direct or non-socks use).

histogram.name: Net.UdpSocketBindErrorFromPosix
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Posix error code from call to bind() UDP socket.

histogram.name: Net.UdpSocketBindErrorFromWinOS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Windows error code from call to bind() UDP socket.

histogram.name: Net.URLRequest_SetReferrer_IsEmptyOrValid
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if a URLRequest's referrer is empty or valid when set.

histogram.name: Net.URLRequestContext.OutstandingRequests
histogram.summary: Indicates the number of URLRequests that are handed out by a URLRequestContext and are not yet destroyed.

histogram.name: Net.URLRequestContext.OutstandingRequests.Type
histogram.summary: Records the annotation type of the URLRequest that is handed out by a URLRequestContext when Net.URLRequestContext.OutstandingRequests is recorded.

histogram.name: Net.ValidDNSName
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2017, not necessary to determine deprecation for invalid DNS names.
histogram.summary: True if a DNS name contains only characters for which |net::IsValidLabelCharacter| returns true. Used to see if we can deprecate and remove support for arbitrary bytes in DNS names. This histogram is recorded when converting dotted DNS names into DNS query form, in preparation for issuing a DNS request.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.DataUse.Downstream
histogram.summary: Records the downstream data use of WebSockets. Logged on every read operation in the WebSocket.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.DataUse.Upstream
histogram.summary: Records the upstream data use of WebSockets. Logged on every write operation in the WebSocket.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.DeflateMode
histogram.summary: Count the number of WebSockets that accepted permessage-deflate extension for each context take over mode. Used by the new Chromium-based WebSocket implementation.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.Duration
histogram.summary: The time from a WebSocket is successfully opened until it's closed. Used to study how WebSockets are used.

histogram.name: Net.WebSocket.HandshakeResult
histogram.summary: Results of WebSocket handshakes. Use this histogram as a baseline for investigating feature usage counters.

histogram.name: Net.Wifi.InterfaceCount
histogram.summary: The number of Wi-fi adapters on the computer. Because the histogram is logged each time Chrome performs a Wi-fi scan, it's better to see results in the "user count" view.

histogram.name: Net.Wifi.LbsLatency
histogram.summary: The time that a request to Location Based Services takes.

histogram.name: Net.Wifi.ScanLatency
histogram.summary: The time that a Wi-fi scan takes.

histogram.name: Net.WpadQuickCheckFailure
histogram.summary: Duration of time that a failing WPAD QuickCheck takes. WPAD QuickCheck does a name lookup for "wpad" and times out quickly to fail fast when there's no WPAD server on the network.

histogram.name: Net.WpadQuickCheckSuccess
histogram.summary: Duration of time that a successful WPAD QuickCheck takes. WPAD QuickCheck does a name lookup for "wpad" and times out quickly to fail fast when there's no WPAD server on the network.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Pipeline.0.NetworkError
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2014, related field trial already long expired.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The network error, if any, of the first pipeline connectivity request.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Pipeline.0.ResponseCode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2014, related field trial already long expired.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Sent21
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: In this experiment, 21 packets were sent to Google via UDP at port 6121 as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked, and no data is recorded in this histogram. If the port is not blocked, then this histogram shows the number of echo responses received from the first

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Sent21.AckReceivedForNthPacket
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: In this experiment, 21 packets were sent to Google via UDP at port 6121 as rapidly as possible, just after successfully sending an UMA upload. Each packet was numbered, as was its ACK sent back by Google. This histogram records, for each packet number, how often we received an ACK for that packet.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.Sent21.GotAnAck

If no packets (of the 21) were ever ACKed, then the port is assumed to be blocked. The histogram shows if we ever got an ACK for a packet in our series of 21.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.UDP.PacketLoss
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome sends 4 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if packets 1 and 3 are received, but packets 2 and 4 are lost, then we'd record a sample of binary 0101B, or 5.

histogram.name: NetConnectivity.UDP.PacketLoss6
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome sends 6 UDP packets in a row to test to see if there is a probabalistic dependency in packet loss for consecutive packets. We record a bit vector of packets received, where the least significant bit is a 1 if the first packet was received, etc. For example, if all packets other than packet 2 and 4 are responded to, then we'd have a sample (in binary) of 110101B, or 53.

histogram.name: Network.MigrationNssToPem
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric counting the number of network configurations that contained a NSS nickname identifying a CA certificate, which triggered the migration to PEM encoding. This metric doesn't consider whether the migration was successful but once a migration was successful the nickname is removed.

histogram.name: Network.ServiceErrors
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS connection manager service errors seen.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Cellular.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds
histogram.obsolete: Removed since Chrome OS build 10010.0.0 and superceded by Network.Shill.Cellular.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds2 due to change in number of buckets (crosreview.com/557297, crosreview.com/703679).
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a cellular network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.DarkResumeActionTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes dark resume actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Ethernet.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds
histogram.obsolete: Removed since Chrome OS build 10010.0.0 and superceded by Network.Shill.Ethernet.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds2 due to change in number of buckets (crosreview.com/557297, crosreview.com/703679).
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for an Ethernet network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.SandboxingEnabled
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric signifying whether a system is running shill in a sandbox or not. This is controlled through a VariationsService flag, but requires 1-2 reboots to take affect. This metric will help us ensure that shill is being run with sandboxing enabled/disabled at the proportion that we expect.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.SuspendActionsTimeTaken
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes suspend actions to complete when shill suspends. Note that this was a misspelling of the metric that is really in use by Shill. No histogram should ever have included this entry.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.SuspendActionTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes suspend actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionResult.OnSuspend
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of termination actions that successfully complete or fail when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionResult.OnTerminate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the number of termination actions that successfully complete or fail when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionTime
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionTime.OnSuspend
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill suspends.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.TerminationActionTime.OnTerminate
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network diagnostic metric sampling the time in milliseconds it takes termination actions to complete when shill terminates.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.ApMode
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network usage metric. The AP mode setting for each successful WiFi connection.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wifi.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds
histogram.obsolete: Removed since Chrome OS build 10010.0.0 and superceded by Network.Shill.Wifi.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds2 due to change in number of buckets (crosreview.com/557297, crosreview.com/703679).
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a WiFi network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.WiFi.FrequenciesConnectedEver
histogram.summary: Chrome OS metric sampling the number of different frequencies (i.e. channels) on which a device has connected to a WiFi network. This value is recorded every time a WiFi connection is established (WPASupplicant::kInterfaceStateCompleted). Note that the word "Ever" in the metric name is misleading. Chrome OS actually ages out historical information, currently after 3 weeks.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.DevicePresenceStatus
histogram.obsolete: Wimax support has been dropped from shill since M76.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the presence of a WiMax device in the system. A sample is emitted once every 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.DHCPOptionFailureDetected
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric that tracks the number of DHCP option failures encountered by Shill. This indicates that Shill is using minimal DHCP options due to suspected MTU issues on the return path from the DHCP server back to the client.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds
histogram.obsolete: Removed since Chrome OS build 10010.0.0 and superceded by Network.Shill.Wimax.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds2 due to change in number of buckets (crosreview.com/557297, crosreview.com/703679).
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a WiMax network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.ExpiredLeaseLengthSeconds2
histogram.obsolete: Wimax support has been dropped from shill since M76.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric that tracks the length of a lease for a WiMax network at the time it expired without the DHCP client being able to renew it.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.TimeToConfig
histogram.obsolete: Wimax support has been dropped from shill since M76.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on a WiMax network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.TimeToInitialize
histogram.obsolete: Wimax support has been dropped from shill since M76.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to initialize a WiMax device.

histogram.name: Network.Shill.Wimax.TimeToOnline
histogram.obsolete: Wimax support has been dropped from shill since M76.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that a WiMax network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Cellular
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a 3G/Cellular network and configure Layer 3 state. Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Cellular.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Ethernet
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join a wired Ethernet network and configure Layer 3 state (typically acquire a DHCP lease). Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Ethernet.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToConfig.Wifi
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease). Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Wifi.TimeToConfig.

histogram.name: Network.TimeToDrop
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network stability metric sampling the time in seconds between the networking going online to going offline. Offline events due to device shutdown or suspend are ignored (along with the online time before that offline event).

histogram.name: Network.TimeToJoin.Wifi
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join (associate plus authenticate) an 802.11 wireless network. Note this metric is deprecated; see Network.Wifi.TimeToJoin.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.AuthMode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.BitRate
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Network metric reporting the download speed test results run at setup time. Recorded at least once per day.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeOnline
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network metric sampling the time spent using WiFi to transport data. These data are mostly useful when summed and compared to TimeOnline for other network technologies (e.g. WiFi vs Cellular).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeResumeToReady
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time from the resume event to the time when an 802.11 wireless network has configured its Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToConfig
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to configure Layer 3 state on an 802.11 wireless network (typically acquire a DHCP lease).

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToJoin
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to join (associate plus authenticate) an 802.11 wireless network.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToOnline
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is online after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: Network.Wifi.TimeToPortal
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS network performance metric sampling the time to determine that an 802.11 wireless network is in a captive portal after configuring Layer 3 state.

histogram.name: NetworkTimeTracker.UpdateTimeFetchAttempted
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 because it does not provide additional information beyond NetworkTimeTracker.UpdateTimeFetchFailed and NetworkTimeTracker.UpdateTimeFetchValid.
histogram.summary: NetworkTimeTracker makes periodic queries to obtain a secure timestamp over the network. This histogram increments whenever such a query is attempted.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ActionAndroid
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2017. Replaced by NewTabPage.ActionAndroid2.
histogram.summary: Actions taken by users from the new tab page on Android. These actions may navigate away from the NTP (e.g. searching in the omnibox or opening a bookmark), but can also happen without navigating away from the NTP (e.g. opening a bookmark in a new tab).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.AnimatedLogoDownloadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time it takes to download the animated logo. Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.BackgroundService.Albums.RequestLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2019 with the removal of the associated service integration.
histogram.summary: The time it took until a request from the New Tab Page for Google Photos albums was served.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.BackgroundService.Photos.RequestLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2019 with the removal of the associated service integration.
histogram.summary: The time it took until a request from the New Tab Page for Google Photos (in a specific album) was served.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.BookmarkActionAndroid
histogram.obsolete: Removed on M33 with the change to native NTP.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Actions taken by users on partner bookmarks (editing / renaming) on the NTP on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.ArticleFaviconFetchResult
histogram.obsolete: Not used anymore. Removed in April 2020.
histogram.summary: Android: Result of fetching a favicon for an article suggestion on the New Tab Page.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.ArticleFaviconFetchTime
histogram.obsolete: Not used anymore. Removed in April 2020.
histogram.summary: Android: Time it takes to fetch a favicon for an article suggestion on the New Tab Page.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.MessageReceived
histogram.obsolete: Removed in October 2017 (M64) and replaced by NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.ReceivedMessageAction, when adding support for push-to-refresh messages.
histogram.summary: Android: Number of received messages and whether they contain pushed news. A message contains pushed news if the payload key exists in the message. The payload content is not checked at all (e.g. it may be empty). Recorded when a message is received.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.ReceivedMessageAction
histogram.summary: Android: Action of a received message. An action can be either push-by-value or push-to-refresh. A message with a missing or invalid action is recorded as well. Recorded when a message is received.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.SubscriptionRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Android: The result of a subscription request for breaking news at the content suggestions server. Recorded when a request finishes. Analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.UnsubscriptionRequestStatus.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.TimeSinceLastTokenValidation
histogram.summary: Android: Time between a token validation and the last successful token retrieval from InstanceID. Recorded when InstanceID answers our token request for a validation either with a token or an error. If the token was never received before the validation, the metric is not recorded.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.TokenRetrievalResult
histogram.summary: Android: The result of our inquiry to InstanceID to receive the current token. Recorded when InstanceID replies to our inquiry for a token (including for a validation).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.UnsubscriptionRequestStatus
histogram.summary: Android: The result of an unsubscription request for breaking news at the content suggestions server. Recorded when a request finishes. Analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.SubscriptionRequestStatus.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.BreakingNews.WasTokenValidBeforeValidation
histogram.summary: Android: Whether a token validation detected an invalid token. This is recorded only for validations where no error occured and the token was actually retrieved.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.CountOnNtpOpened
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2017. This metric was replaced by CountOnNtpOpenedIfVisible. Initially the metric was not recorded properly if any category was not visible. This was fixed in https://codereview.chromium.org/2874213002/, however, not visible categories still were polluting the metric (they were recorded as showing 0 suggestions).
histogram.summary: Android: The number of suggestion cards that were available at the time an NTP was opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.CountOnNtpOpenedIfVisible.Articles.Prefetched.Offline
histogram.obsolete: Removed in October 2017 (M63) and replaced by CountOnNtpOpenedIfVisible.Articles.Prefetched.Offline2, because underreported. UI checked whether a URL is prefetched asynchronously. As a result, there was a race condition and this metric could be reported before all URLs are checked.
histogram.summary: Android: The number of prefetched suggestion cards that were available in Articles category if it was visible at the time an NTP was opened and the user was offline. Analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.CountOnNtpOpenedIfVisible.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.MenuOpenedScore
histogram.summary: Android: The relevance score of a suggestion card on the NTP whose long-press menu was opened, analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedScore.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.OpenedScore
histogram.summary: Android: The score of a suggestion card on the NTP that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The recorded score is from the moment the suggestion was fetched, it could have changed since.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Shown.Articles.Prefetched.Offline
histogram.obsolete: Removed in October 2017 (M63) and replaced by Shown.Articles.Prefetched.Offline2, because underreported. UI checked whether a URL is prefetched asynchronously. As a result, there was a race condition and for suggestions immediately visible on the suggestions surface this metric could be reported before their URLs are actually checked.
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a prefetched suggestion card that was shown on the NTP when offline. Analogous to NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.Shown. That is a card is considered shown when at least 2/3 of its height is visible on the screen. For each card, at most one impression is recorded per NTP instance. We track the position the card had in the list when it was first seen by the user. This tracked position can be different from the position observed by the user, e.g. when the user dismissed some suggestions from the list or requested more that got inserted in the middle of the feed.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.ShownScore
histogram.summary: Android: The score of a suggestion card that was shown on the NTP. A card is considered shown when at least 2/3 of its height is visible on the screen. For each card, at most one impression is recorded per NTP instance.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeSinceLastBackgroundFetch
histogram.summary: Android: The time since the last successful background fetch of remote content suggestions. Recorded when the user looks at content suggestions on the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilFirstSoftTrigger
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of July 2017, in favor of NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilFirstShownTrigger and NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.TimeUntilFirstStartupTrigger.
histogram.summary: Android: The time since the last fetch, recorded upon the first soft fetch trigger. The first soft trigger does not necessarily cause a fetch (if it comes before the end of the respective scheduling interval). This metric is recorded at most once after each fetch (and additionaly at most once after each startup of Chrome before the next fetch). This is used to understand how changing scheduling intervals will impact traffic of background fetches.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.UIUpdateResult
histogram.summary: Android: The result of updating the list of content suggestions in the UI.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.UIUpdateResult2
histogram.obsolete: Not used anymore. Removed in April 2020.
histogram.summary: Android: The result of updating the list of content suggestions in one UI section.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ContentSuggestions.UIUpdateSuccessNumberOfSuggestionsSeen
histogram.obsolete: Not used anymore. Removed in April 2020.
histogram.summary: Android: The number of content suggestions that have been seen by the user in the UI section before the section was successfully updated. The seen suggestions were not removed in the update so that we do not change visible parts of the UI. This histogram is only recorded when the UIUpdateResult2 is "Success (some suggestions replaced)".

histogram.name: NewTabPage.CustomizationAvailability.Backgrounds
histogram.summary: The availability of New Tab Page background customization features on Desktop, based on feature flags or other configuration settings; logged per NTP load.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.CustomizationAvailability.Shortcuts
histogram.summary: The availability of New Tab Page shortcut customization features on Desktop, based on feature flags or other configuration settings; logged per NTP load.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.DefaultPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default pane when the NTP is first opened.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ExploreOffline.Action
histogram.summary: Android: Records user actions on the explore offline card on the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Feed.ImageFetchResult
histogram.summary: Android: Represents success/failure of Feed image loading. Recorded upon each individual image retrieved from the feed_image_cache.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Feed.ImageLoadFromCacheTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes for Feed to load an image from the cache.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Feed.ImageLoadFromNetworkTime
histogram.summary: Android: The time it takes for Feed to load an image from the network.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.HoverTimeClicked
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds, users have the cursor over a most visited thumbnail before clicking.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.HoverTimeNotClicked
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds, users have the cursor over a most visited thumbnail before moving it away from the thumbnail without clicking.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.IconsColor
histogram.summary: The number of most visited tiles on the new tab page that are displayed using a fallback color (as opposed to having an icon, or simply being gray). Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.IconsGray
histogram.summary: The number of most visited tiles on the new tab page that are displayed as gray (as opposed to having an icon, or a fallback color). Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.IconsReal
histogram.summary: The number of most visited tiles on the new tab page that are displayed with the site's icon (as opposed using a fallback color or just gray). Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Interests.ImageDownloadSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-05 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Android: Whether an attempt to download the image for an interest was successful.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Interests.InterestsFetchSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-05 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Android: Whether an attempt to fetch the interests for a user was successful.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Interests.NumInterests
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-05 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Android: The number of interests fetched for a user to display on the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Layout
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-04 with full launch of NTP condensed layout.
histogram.summary: Android: A histogram detailing how the NewTabPageLayout is laid out on the device (eg, whether it fits fully above the fold or not). This is logged once per NewTabPageLayout creation (so once per NTP).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LoadType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-06 because it was no longer being monitored.
histogram.summary: Android: the type of load for the NTP, such as cold or warm start. It's a warm start if the native library is already loaded and initialized at the time the activity is created. This might happen if for example a service was already running.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.LogoShownTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-08 because it was only recorded for cached logos. Replaced by LogoShownTime2.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between opening an NTP and the logo appearing. Only recorded when there is a logo, and only recorded once per NTP. Android only.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MobilePromo
histogram.obsolete: Removed on M33 with the change to native NTP.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Android: Tallies counts for how the user interacted with the NTP promo page.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Action taken by the user on the Most Visited NTP pane. If the user switches panes during this use of the NTP, this action is sometimes not recorded. Ask mpearson@ for details.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedScheme
histogram.summary: The schemes of URLs of most visited thumbnails that the user clicked on.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.MostVisitedTilePlacementExperiment
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.summary: Records anomalous events for the Most Visited Tile Placement experiment, where it is unable to operate as expected. These are recorded during New Tab Page load time, once for every NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NonVisibleScreenshots
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of screenshots that were cached for the non-visible but ranked suggestions on the Suggested NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NonVisibleSuggestedSiteRank
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Given that the user has typed a URL, and given that that specific URL was ranked but not visible on the Suggested pane of the NTP, this is the rank that the Suggested pane had for that URL.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalTileFallbacks
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we relied on external tiles as a fallback because a local screenshot was not available to be used as a thumbnail. External tiles are those for which the visuals are handled by the page itself, not by the iframe. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window, or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalTiles
histogram.summary: The number of external tiles that are displayed on the NTP. External tiles are those for which the visuals are handled by the page itself, not by the iframe. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTileFallbacks
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we displayed a gray tile with the domain name as a fallback because a local screenshot was not available to be used as a thumbnail. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTiles
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which no thumbnail was specified, but a domain was so we displayed a gray tile with the domain name in it. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfMouseOvers
histogram.summary: The total number of times the user hovered the mouse over Most Visited tile or title elements before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailAttempts
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we attempted to use a local screenshot as a thumbnail. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailErrors
histogram.summary: The number of thumbnails for which a local screenshot was not available so we were not able to display them on the Most Visited section of the NTP. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailTiles
histogram.summary: The number of tiles for which we attempted to use a local screenshot as a thumbnail. Recorded before reloading the suggestions, navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.OfflineUrlsLoadTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent waiting for the offline page model to return which New Tab Page URLs are available offline.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.OtherSessionsMenu
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for usage of the menu on the NTP that allows the user to access tabs from other devices.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.PreviousSelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane that had been previously selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Promo.Bubble
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for NTP bubble promo activity.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Promo.Notification
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for NTP notification promo activity.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Promos.RequestLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-03 as it doesn't correctly capture all request states.
histogram.summary: The time it took until a request from the New Tab page for the middle slot promo script was served. Recorded only on the local NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.RecentTabsPage.TimeVisibleAndroid
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time that the "Recent Tabs" page is visible and Chrome is in the foreground on Android. The metric is recorded whenever the "Recent Tabs" page moves out of the foreground. The metric is recorded when the "Recent Tabs" page is closed, when the user switches from the "Recent Tabs" page to a different tab and when Chrome is backgrounded.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchAvailableLoadTime.ColdStart
histogram.summary: The time until the search box became available on the NTP in a cold start. It's a cold start if the native library is not already loaded and initialized at the time the activity is created. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchAvailableLoadTime.WarmStart
histogram.summary: The time until the search box became available on the NTP in a warm start. It's a warm start if the native library is already loaded and initialized at the time the activity is created. This might happen if for example a service was already running. Only measured on Android.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchSuggestions.RequestLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-03 as it doesn't correctly capture all request states.
histogram.summary: The time it took until a request from the New Tab page for the search suggestions script was served. Recorded only on the local NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchSuggestions.RequestStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-03 as it grouped together requests that returned no suggestions with those that failed completely, which is misleading.
histogram.summary: Whether a request was made for search suggestions on NTP load; and if a request was not made, the reason why.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SearchURLs.Total
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SessionRestore
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for user clicks of the Recently Closed items. The value is the recency of the entry being restored (0 is most recent).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SingleSessionPageSwitches
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram to track how many times a user switched pages in a single NTP session.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClicked
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the snippets card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedAge
histogram.summary: Android: The age of the snippets card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The age is measured from the moment the content has been published. In each "_x_y" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \gt;=x and \lt;=y are tracked. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedScore
histogram.summary: Android: The score of the snippets card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The recorded score is from the moment the snippet was fetched, it could have changed since. In each "_x" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \lt;=x are tracked. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedScoreNew
histogram.summary: Android: The score of the snippets card on the NTP, that is clicked through to the host website of the content. The recorded score is from the moment the snippet was fetched, it could have changed since. In each "_x" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \lt;=x are tracked. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list. In contrast to CardClickedScore, this histogram has a proper maximal value of 100 000.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardExpanded
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the snippets card on the NTP, that is expanded to reveal more content.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardHidden
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the snippets card on the NTP, for which the expanded content was minimized/hidden.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardLongPressed
histogram.summary: Android: The position of a snippet card when it is long pressed, analagous to NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClicked.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardLongPressedAge
histogram.summary: Android: The time difference between when a snippet card is long pressed and when its content was published. Analagous to NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedAge.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardLongPressedScoreNew
histogram.summary: Android: The relevance score of an interest card that is long pressed, analagous to NewTabPage.Snippets.CardClickedScoreNew.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardShown
histogram.summary: Android: The position of the snippets card that is shown on the NTP. Each snippet (its position) is recorded whenever at least 2/3 of its height becomes visible by scrolling through the NTP. Each snippet is recorded at most once for a given instance of NTP and a given data set of snippets that is shown. We track the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list. Previously (in the code before 2016/05/27), this histogram was recorded each time a snippet became visible (e.g. by scrolling up and down) at least by 1px; the first snippet was thus recorded even without scrolling down.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardShownAge
histogram.summary: Android: The age of the snippets card that is shown on the NTP. Each snippet (its age) is recorded whenever at least 2/3 of its height becomes visible by scrolling through the NTP. Each snippet is recorded at most once for a given instance of NTP and a given data set of snippets that is shown. The age is measured from the moment the content has been published. In each "_x_y" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \gt;=x and \lt;=y are tracked. By this, we mean the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardShownScore
histogram.summary: Android: The score of the snippets card that is shown on the NTP. Each snippet (its score) is recorded whenever at least 2/3 of its height becomes visible by scrolling through the NTP. Each snippet is recorded at most once for a given instance of NTP and a given data set of snippets that is shown. The recorded score is from the moment the snippet was fetched, it could have changed since. In each "_x" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \lt;=x are tracked. By this, we mean the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.CardShownScoreNew
histogram.summary: Android: The score of the snippets card that is shown on the NTP. Each snippet (its score) is recorded whenever at least 2/3 of its height becomes visible by scrolling through the NTP. Each snippet is recorded at most once for a given instance of NTP and a given data set of snippets that is shown. The recorded score is from the moment the snippet was fetched, it could have changed since. In each "_x" suffix of the histogram, only snippets on positions \lt;=x are tracked. By this, we mean the position the snippet had in the list when NTP was loaded. This tracked position is thus different from the position observed by the user whenever before scrolling down to the given snippet, the user discards some snippets in the top of the list. In contrast to CardShownScore, this histogram has a proper maximal value of 100 000.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.Interactions
histogram.summary: Android: A histogram giving an overall summary of important events like impressions, scroll events, clicks etc.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.NumArticlesOnScrolledBelowTheFoldOnce
histogram.summary: Android: The number of snippet articles available to the user in the UI, logged when the user scrolls below the fold (at max once per NTP load).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.OpenMethod
histogram.summary: Android: A histogram detailing how the articles linked from snippets are opened (eg, plain click, open in new tab, open in incognito).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.Snippets.VisitDuration
histogram.summary: Android: Time spent reading the page linked by an opened (clicked) snippet card. Exit conditions include the tab not being in the foreground or starting a new navigation.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSite
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Histogram for user clicks of the suggested site thumbnails. The value is equal to the index of the thumbnail.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Action taken by the user on the Suggested Sites NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time to load the Suggested Sites NTP pane, in milliseconds.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestedSitesViewTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent on the Suggested Sites NTP pane, in seconds.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.SuggestionsType
histogram.summary: Indicate, for each impression of the New Tab Page, whether the suggestions were obtained from the client or server. Recorded before changing focus away from the NTP, be it by navigating to a URL, switching tabs, changing the active window or closing the tab/shutting down Chrome.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ThumbnailErrorRate
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2014. Replaced by NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailAttempts and NewTabPage.NumberOfThumbnailErrors.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The percentage of errors per attempts to load image thumbnails on the New Tab Page. When an error occurs, a grey tile is shown instead of a thumbnail image. We measure the rate instead of the number of errors because multiple attempts are made to load images at different times during the NTP's lifetime. Each NTP session's error rate is logged after the user navigates to a new URL from that NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.ThumbnailFallbackRate
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2014. Replaced by NewTabPage.NumberOfGrayTileFallbacks and NewTabPage.NumberOfExternalFallbacks.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The percentage of times most visited tiles use the fallback thumbnail. Only requests that actually specify a fallback thumbnail are considered here. We measure the rate instead of the number of errors because multiple attempts are made to load thumbnails at different times during the NTP's lifetime. Each NTP session's error rate is logged after the user navigates to a new URL from that NTP.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TileFaviconFetchStatus.Server
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 because the histogram was unused and close to expiration.
histogram.summary: Mobile only. The result of fetching a favicon for a tile on the New Tab Page. This is recorded for each gray MostVisited tile on the New Tab Page once per impression of the tile.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TileFaviconFetchSuccess.Popular
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 because the histogram was unused and close to expiration.
histogram.summary: Mobile only. The result of fetching a favicon for a tile on the New Tab Page. This is recorded for each gray PopularSites tile on the New Tab Page once per updating the set of tiles (notably upon each NTP impression).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TileFaviconFetchSuccess.Server
histogram.summary: Mobile only. The result of fetching a favicon for a tile on the New Tab Page. This is recorded for each gray MostVisited tile on the New Tab Page once per lifetime of Chrome (there as an in-memory cache of failed requests).

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TilesReceivedTime
histogram.summary: Histogram of the time, in milliseconds since navigation start, it took for the NTP most visited iframe to receive the data for all of its tiles. This does not include actually loading the DOM elements for the tiles, in particular the thumbnail images; see NewTabPage.LoadTime for that.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.TimeToFirstDraw
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2019, replaced by NewTabPage.TimeToFirstDraw2 when a bug in how this was calculated was fixed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a new tab page is created until the first pre-draw call on the main UI containing the search provider logo (if available), fake search box, most visited tiles, etc. More specifically, this is the time between NewTabPage's constructor and the first pre-draw pass on NewTabPageLayout.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.VisibleScreenshots
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of screenshots that were cached for the visible suggestions on the Suggested NTP pane.

histogram.name: NewTabPage.VisibleSuggestedSiteRank
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-02 (and not recorded for some time before that).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Given that the user has typed a URL, and given that that specific URL was visible on the Suggested pane of the NTP, this is the rank that the Suggested pane had for that URL.

histogram.name: Notifications.AuthorDataSizeKB
histogram.summary: The size, in kilobytes, of the author-provided data associated with a Web Notification. Recorded when a persistent Web Notification is being shown by the developer.

histogram.name: Notifications.DifferentRequestingEmbeddingOrigins
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2015. No longer tracked since M42.
histogram.summary: Records if the requesting and embedding origins are different when requesting permission to display Web Notifications.

histogram.name: Notifications.Display
histogram.obsolete: Removed October 2017 (fullscreen notifications feature enabled by default).
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a notification was shown for the various types of sources. The suffix distinguishes between the window state of the app or webpage that sent the notification. This will be used to determine whether a legacy mode is required when we allow apps or webpages to display notifications over fullscreen content in the future.

histogram.name: Notifications.ExtensionNotificationActionCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2020 as the metrics are not needed anymore, and documentation has been amended as a result of this collection.
histogram.summary: The number of action buttons the developer provided for a notification created using the extensions notification API. Logged when creating the notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.ExtensionNotificationIdLength
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2019 because this was measuring risk for a feature that has now been implemented and shipped.
histogram.summary: The length, in characters, of the id given to an extension notification. These can be automatically generated, in which case they will be either 36 bytes (GUID) or 16 bytes (random data) in length, or provided by the developer. Measured when the notification is being displayed through the chrome.notifications.create() extension API.

histogram.name: Notifications.ExtensionNotificationType
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2020 as the metrics are not needed anymore as platforms have moved to native notifications, for which these metrics were used.
histogram.summary: The type of a notification created using the extensions notification API. Logged when creating the notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.HeaderClick
histogram.obsolete: Removed Nov 2019 because the histogram data was not being used.
histogram.summary: Whether a click on a notification header caused it to collapse, expand or had no effect at all. Logged when clicking on the notification header.

histogram.name: Notifications.Icon.FileSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed Nov 2016 in favor of Notifications.LoadFileSize.*
histogram.summary: The number of bytes loaded for a Web Notification icon.

histogram.name: Notifications.Icon.LoadFailTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed Nov 2016 in favor of Notifications.LoadFailTime.*
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to fail loading an icon for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.Icon.LoadFinishTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed Nov 2016 in favor of Notifications.LoadFinishTime.*
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to finish successfully loading an icon for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.Icon.ScaleDownTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed Nov 2016 in favor of Notifications.LoadScaleDownTime.*
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to scale down an icon for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.LoadFailTime
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to fail loading an icon/image for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.LoadFileSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes loaded for a Web Notification icon/image.

histogram.name: Notifications.LoadFinishTime
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to finish successfully loading an icon/image for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.LoadScaleDownTime
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds it took to scale down an icon/image for a Web Notification.

histogram.name: Notifications.NotificationHelper.NotificationActivatorStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2018. Replaced by NotificationActivatorPrimaryStatus and NotificationActivatorSecondaryStatus.
histogram.summary: The execute status of NotificationActivator::Activate. Logged whenever a notification_helper process is launched by Windows.

histogram.name: Notifications.PersistentNotificationDataDeleted
histogram.summary: Recorded when the data associated with a persistent Web Notification gets deleted. The value will be true if data deletion succeeded, and false if there was an error.

histogram.name: Notifications.Windows.ImageRetainerDestructionTime
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 10/2018 as we no long record this metric.
histogram.summary: Amount of time taken to destroy a NotificationImageRetainer object when the image directory is valid.

histogram.name: Notifications.Windows.ImageRetainerInitializationTime
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 10/2018 as we no long record this metric.
histogram.summary: Amount of time taken to initialize the image retainer directory.

histogram.name: Notifications.Windows.OnDismissedStatus
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 06/2020 as we no long record this metric.
histogram.summary: The status of OnDismissed requests in NotificationPlatformBridgeWin (Windows only). Logged whenever a dismiss event is handled.

histogram.name: Notifications.Windows.SetReadyCallbackStatus
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Notifications.Windows.SetReadyCallbackStatus2 which is not skewed.
histogram.summary: The status of SetReadyCallback requests in NotificationPlatformBridgeWin (Windows only). Logged once at startup.

histogram.name: Notifications.Windows.StartMenuShortStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2018. Replaced with Notifications.Windows.StartMenuShortcutStatus where typo is fixed.
histogram.summary: Used to indicate the status of start menu shortcut (Windows only). Logged whenever a notification display attempt is made.

histogram.name: Notifications.Windows.ToastActivatorCLSIDMismatchReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2018 as this is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Used to indicate the reason why toast activator CLSID in shortcut is different from the one retrieved from the installer (Windows only). Logged whenever this mismatch is detected during a notification display attempt.

histogram.name: Notifications.Windows.UserManagerShowupStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2018 as this is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Used to indicate the code path where the user profile manager shows up during startup (Windows only). Logged whenever a notification event is being handled.

histogram.name: NQE.Accuracy.DownstreamThroughputKbps.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated downstream throughput (in kilobits per second) and the observed downstream throughput (in kilobits per second). Downstream throughput estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the downstream throughput observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.Accuracy.EffectiveConnectionType.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated effective connection type and the observed effective connection type. Effective connection type is estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the effective connection type observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.Accuracy.HttpRTT.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated HTTP RTT and the observed HTTP RTT. HTTP RTT estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the HTTP RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.Accuracy.TransportRTT.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated transport RTT and the observed transport RTT. Transport RTT estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the transport RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.BDPComputationKbps.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: The value of the downstream throughput used to compute the bandwidth delay product. The 80th percentile throughput observation is used to calculate the bandwidth delay product. This gets recorded everytime the BDP is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.BDPComputationTransportRTT.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: The value of the TransportRTT used to compute the bandwidth delay product. The 20th percentile TransportRTT observation is used to calculate the bandwidth delay product. This gets recorded everytime the BDP is computed.

histogram.name: NQE.BDPKbits.OnECTComputation
histogram.summary: An estimate of the bandwidth delay product which is computed on main-frame requests.
