It is calculated using the 80th percentile throughput and 20th percentile TransportRTT values whenever |ComputeEffectiveConnectionType| is called and the throughput and TransportRTT estimates are available.

histogram.name: NQE.CellularSignalStrength.AtECTComputation
histogram.summary: Cellular signal strength level reported by the device at the time of ECT computation. Recorded only on cellular networks, and only when the value is available. The value ranges between 0 and 4 (both inclusive).

histogram.name: NQE.CellularSignalStrength.LevelDifference
histogram.summary: Difference between the minimum and the maximum received signal strength since the last connection change event. Recorded only on cellular connections on Android platform when the cellular signal strength was available. Recorded right before a connection change event.

histogram.name: NQE.CellularSignalStrengthAvailable
histogram.summary: Whether the signal strength for the cellular network was available or not. Recorded right before a connection change event. Recorded only on cellular connections on Android platform.

histogram.name: NQE.CellularSignalStrengthDifference
histogram.summary: Difference between the minimum and the maximum received signal strength since the last connection change event. Recorded only on cellular connections on Android platform when the cellular signal strength was available. Recorded right before a connection change event.

histogram.name: NQE.CongestionAnalyzer.CountInflightRequestsForPeakQueueingDelay
histogram.summary: Records the count of in-flight requests causing the peak queueing delay within the current ongoing measurement period. These samples are bucketized into 10 peak queueing delay levels. This is emitted at the end of the current measurement period.

histogram.name: NQE.CongestionAnalyzer.PeakQueueingDelayMappingScore
histogram.summary: Records the score that evaluates the mapping between the count of in-flight requests to the peak observed queueing delay. The score is the percentage of total samples that follow the rule 'the more in-flight requests, the higher peak queueing delay' when a new peak queueing delay mapping sample is acquired. This is emitted at the end of the current measurement period and only when there are at least 10 cached mapping samples.

histogram.name: NQE.ContentObserver.NetworkQualityMeaningfullyChanged
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when the network quality change notification is received by content and before the network quality change is notified to the renderers. Records true if the notified network quality change is meaningfully different from the last network quality notified to the renderers.

histogram.name: NQE.Correlation.ResourceLoadTime.0Kb_128Kb
histogram.summary: Records estimated network quality (estimated RTT, estimated downlink bandwidth), resource load size, and the resource load time in a single UMA sample. This metric is recorded randomly when a resource load finishes. Each sample in this sparse histogram consists of multiple metrics (each occupying few bits in the sample). The data in the histogram would be analyzed using custom scripts. A sample is recorded only when the resource size is between 0 Kilobits (inclusive) and 128 Kilobits (exclusive).

histogram.name: NQE.DifferenceRTTActualAndEstimated
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in June 2016 by NQE.Accuracy.HttpRTT.* metrics.
histogram.summary: Difference between the actual RTT observation and the estimated RTT. This metric is recorded on every request when the actual observation is higher than the estimated value.

histogram.name: NQE.DifferenceRTTEstimatedAndActual
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in June 2016 by NQE.Accuracy.HttpRTT.* metrics.
histogram.summary: Difference between the estimated RTT and the actual RTT observation. This metric is recorded on every request when the estimated value is higher than the actual observation.

histogram.name: NQE.EstimateAvailable.MainFrame
histogram.summary: This histogram records whether the estimate of the network quality metric was available or not. Recorded at every main frame request.

histogram.name: NQE.ExternalEstimateProvider.DownlinkBandwidth
histogram.summary: Records the estimate of the downlink bandwidth (in Kbps) provided by the external estimate provided. Recorded every time the external estimate provider provides a valid downlink bandwidth estimate to the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.ExternalEstimateProvider.RTT
histogram.summary: Records the estimate of the RTT provided by the external estimate provided. Recorded every time the external estimate provider provides a valid RTT estimate to the network quality estimator.

histogram.name: NQE.ExternalEstimateProvider.RTT.Accuracy.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the HTTP RTT estimated by the external estimate provider and the observed HTTP RTT. The HTTP RTT estimated by the external estimate provider at the time of navigation start is compared with the HTTP RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation.

histogram.name: NQE.ExternalEstimateProviderStatus
histogram.summary: Records the interaction (availability and query count) of Network Quality Estimator with external estimates provider. Logged on network change events, everytime external estimate provider is queried for an updated estimate, and when it proactively notifies that an updated estimate is available.

histogram.name: NQE.FastestRTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the fastest round-trip-time, before a connectivity change is detected.
This metric is recorded when a connectivity change is detected. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NQE.Kbps.ObservationSource
histogram.summary: Number of Kbps observations indexed by the source of the observation. Recorded by the network quality estimator every time a new observation is made or synthesized.

histogram.name: NQE.Kbps.RawObservation
histogram.summary: Downstream throughput observation received or synthesized by network quality estimator. Observations from different sources are recorded in separate histograms.

histogram.name: NQE.MainFrame.EffectiveConnectionType
histogram.summary:
Effective connection type estimated by network quality estimator. Suffixed with the connection type reported by the operating system.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.MainFrame.Kbps
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the downstream peak throughput at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.MainFrame.RTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the URLRequest layer at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.MainFrame.TransportRTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the transport layer at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.PeakKbps
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of downstream peak throughput, before a connectivity change is detected.
This metric is recorded when a connectivity change is detected. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NQE.PeerToPeerConnectionsDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration of the time period for which there was at least one peer to peer active connection. Recorded when the count of peer to peer connections drop from a non-zero value to a zero value.

histogram.name: NQE.RatioEstimatedToActualRTT
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in June 2016 by NQE.Accuracy.HttpRTT.* metrics.
histogram.summary: Ratio of the estimated RTT to the actual RTT observation multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: NQE.RenderThreadNotified
histogram.summary: Count of the number of times renderers were notified of the changes in the network quality estimator. This metric makes sense to compare in frequency relative to other events like the number of page loads or the number of renderers seen. It is expected that we will see at least 1 notification per renderer (on average), and less than 100.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the URLRequest layer at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded immediately after a connectivity change is detected. The metric name is suffixed with the connection type before the connectivity change was detected. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.HangingRequest
histogram.summary: HTTP RTT observation received by the network quality estimator. Recorded when the request is detected as hanging.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.NotAHangingRequest.EndToEndRTT
histogram.summary: HTTP RTT observation received by the network quality estimator. Recorded at the beginning of a request if the request is detected as not hanging because the observed HTTP RTT was comparable to the end to end RTT estimate.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.NotAHangingRequest.HttpRTT
histogram.summary: HTTP RTT observation received by the network quality estimator. Recorded when the request is detected as not hanging because it was comparable to the HTTP RTT estimate.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.NotAHangingRequest.MinHttpBound
histogram.summary: HTTP RTT observation received by the network quality estimator. Recorded when the request is detected as not hanging because the RTT value was lower than the minimum threshold RTT needed to be categorized as a hanging request.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.NotAHangingRequest.TransportRTT
histogram.summary: HTTP RTT observation received by the network quality estimator. Recorded when the request is detected as not hanging because it was comparable to the transport RTT estimate.

histogram.name: NQE.RTT.RawObservation
histogram.summary: RTT observation received or synthesized by network quality estimator. Observations from different sources are recorded in separate histograms.

histogram.name: NQE.RTTObservations
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in May 2016 by NQE.MainFrame.RTT.* metrics.
histogram.summary: RTT observations at the URLRequest layer made by network quality estimator, recorded on every request.

histogram.name: NQE.ThroughputAnalyzer.HangingRequests.Erased
histogram.summary: Count of the requests that were marked as hanging by the heuristic algorithm in the throughput analyzer in the network quality estimator. A sample is recorded everytime the heuristic algorithm is run.

histogram.name: NQE.ThroughputAnalyzer.HangingRequests.NotErased
histogram.summary: Count of the requests that were not marked as hanging by the heuristic algorithm in the throughput analyzer in the network quality estimator. A sample is recorded everytime the heuristic algorithm is run.

histogram.name: NQE.ThroughputObservation.Hanging
histogram.summary: Throughput observation made by network quality estimator, and eventually discarded because the window (over which the througput was computed) was detected as hanging.

histogram.name: NQE.ThroughputObservation.NotHanging
histogram.summary: Throughput observation made by network quality estimator, and used when the window (over which the througput was computed) was detected as not hanging.

histogram.name: NQE.TransportRTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the transport layer at different percentiles.
This metric is recorded immediately after a connectivity change is detected. The metric name is suffixed with the connection type before the connectivity change was detected. This will miss data from users whose connection type never changes and will be biased to users whose connection type changes frequently.

histogram.name: NQE.UnweightedAverage.Accuracy.HttpRTT.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated HTTP RTT and the observed HTTP RTT. HTTP RTT estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the HTTP RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation. Both the estimated and the observed RTT are computed using average algorithm that assigns equal weight to all observations.

histogram.name: NQE.UnweightedAverage.MainFrame.RTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the URLRequest layer computed using average algorithm that assigns equal weight to all observations.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.WeightedAverage.Accuracy.HttpRTT.EstimatedObservedDiff
histogram.summary: Records the difference between the estimated HTTP RTT and the observed HTTP RTT. HTTP RTT estimated by the network quality estimator at the time of navigation start is compared with the HTTP RTT observed during the specified time interval following the start of the navigation. Both the estimated and the observed RTT are computed using weighted average algorithm.

histogram.name: NQE.WeightedAverage.MainFrame.RTT
histogram.summary:
Rough estimate of the computed round trip time at the URLRequest layer computed using weighted average algorithm.
This metric is recorded on main-frame requests.

histogram.name: NQE.WifiSignalStrength.AtECTComputation
histogram.summary: Wifi signal strength level reported by the device at the time of ECT computation. Recorded only on Wifi networks, and only when the value is available. The value ranges between 0 and 4 (both inclusive).

histogram.name: NQE.WifiSignalStrength.LevelDifference
histogram.summary: Difference between the minimum and the maximum received signal strength since the last connection change event. Recorded only on Wifi connections on Android platform when the Wifi signal strength was available. Recorded right before a connection change event.

histogram.name: ntp.searchurls.total
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: NtpHandler.AttachShownPageType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2011. No longer tracked, replaced with NewTabPage.DefaultPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The default pane when the NTP is first opened.

histogram.name: NtpHandler.SelectedShownPageType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2011. No longer tracked, replaced with NewTabPage.SelectedPageType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The pane selected when the user switches panes in the NTP.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.AccountRevoked.IsEmailId
histogram.summary: This histogram records whether the account ID is actually an email if we detect an account that has an account ID but not email.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.AccountRevoked.MigrationState
histogram.summary: This histogram records the account ID migration status from email to GAIA ID if we detect an account that has an account ID but not email.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.GetOAuth2AccessTokenFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuth2 access token retrieval call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.GetOAuth2AccessTokenRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuth2 access token retrieval call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.ListAccountsFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final ListAccounts call failure during Chrome OS login. This data is now included in Signin.ListAccountsFailure.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.ListAccountsRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed ListAccounts call during Chrome OS login. This data is now included in Signin.ListAccountsRetry.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginGaiaCredFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuthLogin (with SID+LSID) call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginGaiaCredRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuthLogin (with SID+LSID) call during Chrome OS login.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginUberTokenFailure
histogram.summary: Failure reason of final OAuthLogin (with uber token) call during Chrome OS login. This data is now (M44+) included in Signin.UberTokenFailure.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.OAuthLoginUberTokenRetry
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed OAuthLogin (with uber token) call during Chrome OS login. This data is now (M44+) included in Signin.UberTokenRetry.

histogram.name: OAuth2Login.SeedState
histogram.summary: Only applicable on M47 on Android. Measure the frequency of a suppressed error state when the account is not seeded.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.AggregatedRequestResult
histogram.summary: Result of servicing requests that may contain offline page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ArchiveManager.ArchiveDirsCreationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-10, and replaced by OfflinePages.ArchiveManager.ArchiveDirsCreationResult2 with suffixes for temporary and persistent pages.
histogram.summary: This is recorded every time the archive directory is being created. It doesn't include the case which the archive directory exists.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.BackgroundLoadingFailedCode
histogram.summary: The error codes that caused a page load failure.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.CctApiDisableStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary:
Reason for the Chrome Custom Tabs API prerender call to be ignored.
There are several causes for the Chrome Custom Tabs API calls to be ignored, this tracks the potential causes so we can see how often the prerenderer doesn't prerender due to these being switched off. Since this is checked elsewhere (CCTAPI), this only catches the user switching off the third party cookies or navigation prediction after the CCT API has checked.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ResourceCompletion.Css
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: True if all requested CSS was loaded when a background page loaded.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ResourceCompletion.Image
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: True if all requested images were loaded when a background page loaded.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.ResourceCompletion.Xhr
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: True if all requested XHRs were completed when a background page loaded.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Background.UnsupportedScheme.ConnectionType
histogram.summary:
Connection type when prerenderer reports Unsupported Scheme error.
To give insight about Unsupported Scheme errors that may be due to lost network connection (as data URL used for rendering an error page will manifest as an Unsupported Scheme error by the prerenderer).

histogram.name: OfflinePages.BatchDelete.Count
histogram.summary: Number of offline pages that are deleted in a batch.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.BatchDelete.TotalPageSize
histogram.summary: Total size, in kilobytes, of all offline pages that are deleted in a batch.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.CanSaveRecentPage
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 6/2019. No longer considered useful.
histogram.summary: Reports whether a web page complies with all requirements for it to be allowed to be saved as an offline page. This is reported only on Android, after a successful main frame navigation is finished.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearAllStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of wiping out the offline page data.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearAllStatus2
histogram.obsolete: Removed a long time ago, marked as expired for M83.
histogram.summary: Status code of wiping out the offline page data.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearStorageBatchSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Jan 2018, replaced by OfflinePages.ClearTemporaryPages.BatchSize.
histogram.summary: Number of pages deleted in a batch during one clear-storage request.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearStoragePreRunUsage
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Oct 2017 and replaced by OfflinePages.ClearStoragePreRunUsage2 as it was reporting data in bytes instead of the expected MiB.
histogram.summary: The total storage size used by all offline pages from a specific client namespace.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ClearStorageResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Jan 2018, replaced by OfflinePages.ClearTemporaryPages.Result.
histogram.summary: Result of asking storage manager to clear storage.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.DeleteOrphanedArchivesResult
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to delete archive files without metadata was successful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.DeletePagesMissingArchiveFileResult
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to delete pages without archives was successful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.ExpirePagesMissingArchiveFileResult
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to expire pages without archives was successful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.OrphanedArchivesCount
histogram.summary: Number of archives without metadata entry when checking consistency.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Consistency.PagesMissingArchiveFileCount
histogram.summary: Number of offline pages without archive file when checking consistency.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ConsistencyCheck.Persistent.PagesMissingArchiveFileCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2018, since saving public offline pages to external download directory needs a different consistency check strategy.
histogram.summary: Number of persistent offline pages without archive file when checking consistency. It will only be reported if the number is larger than 0.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ConsistencyCheck.Persistent.PagesMissingDbEntryCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2018, since saving public offline pages to external download directory needs a different consistency check strategy.
histogram.summary: Number of archives without database entry when checking persistent page consistency. It will only be reported if the number is larger than 0.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.AccessCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 12/2017. Replaced by OfflinePages.AccessCount.
histogram.summary: Number of accesses to the offline page since its creation. This is reported when the offline page was deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.FreeSpaceMB
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2/2018. No longer used, duplicate of OfflinePages.SavePage.FreeSpaceMB.
histogram.summary:
The amount of free space available, in megabytes, on the user's device after the page is deleted.
Note that before M52 this operation was started before delete operation.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.FreeSpacePercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of free space available on the user's device when the page is being deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.LastOpenToCreated
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2018. Replaced by OfflinePages.PageAccessInterval.
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was created and was opened last time. This is reported when the page was deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.PageSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2/2018. No longer used, duplicate of OfflinePages.PageSize.
histogram.summary: Size of the offline page, in kilobytes, that was deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.TimeSinceLastOpen
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2018. Replaced by OfflinePages.PageAccessInterval.
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was last opened and was deleted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DeletePage.TotalPageSizeAsPercentageOfFreeSpace
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 03/2018. Replaced by similar metric OfflinePages.StorageInfo.InternalUsagePercentage and OfflinePages.StorageInfo.ExternalUsagePercentage.
histogram.summary:
The percentage of space taken by offline pages from the free space that could be available, if the feature was not present. I.e. considering situation where the user has: Free Space, Offline content, other apps and data. This is a percentage of: Offline content / (Offline content + Free Space).
The value will be recorded after user deletes a single or multiple offline pages. In case pages are removed in bulk, this value will be reported once. This value is only reported with deleting, as we are trying to infer if lack of free space might have caused the user to delete.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DownloadDeletedPageDuplicateCount
histogram.summary: The number of downloaded pages with the same URL that exist at the time that we delete a downloaded page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DownloadSavedPageDuplicateCount
histogram.summary: The number of downloaded pages with the same URL that exist at the time that we save a downloaded page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.DownloadSavedPageTimeSinceDuplicateSaved
histogram.summary: If at save time there is another downloaded page with the same URL, this tracks this amount of time between creation of the most recent existing page and the current page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Edit.BookmarkUrlChangedForOfflinePage
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Whether a user-edited bookmark URL had a saved offline page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ExpirePage.BatchSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016. Offline pages no longer use two-step expiration.
histogram.summary: Number of pages that are expired in a batch.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ExpirePage.PageLifetime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016. Offline pages no longer use two-step expiration.
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was created and was expired.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ExpirePage.StoreUpdateResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016. Offline pages no longer use two-step expiration.
histogram.summary: Result of updating expired page in store.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ExpirePage.TimeSinceLastAccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016. Offline pages no longer use two-step expiration.
histogram.summary: Length of time between when an offline page was last opened and was expired.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Filter.OnlineWhenEntering
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Whether user is connected when entering the filter with offline only content.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Filter.OnlineWhenLeaving
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Whether user is connected when leaving the filter with offline only content.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.FirstOpenSinceCreated
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between creation of the offline page and the first time it was opened.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.IncognitoSave
histogram.summary: Whether the page that was being saved offline was in incognito mode.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.LaunchLocation
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Logs a UI location from which an offline page is launched.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.LoadStatus
histogram.summary: Status code of loading from the offline pages metadata store.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.LoadSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt to load the offline pages metadata store was successful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Model.ArchiveDirCreationTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time to create the offline pages archive directory.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Model.ConstructionToLoadedEventTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time to create the offline pages archive directory and load the offline page model.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Model.FinalLoadSuccessful
histogram.summary: Whether the metadata database was successfully loaded, after possibly several retries.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Model.InitAttemptsSpent
histogram.summary: The count of attempts spent to open the metadata database. In the best case, it's 1. There is a small upper limit. This is recorded only at success. Failures are counted by OfflinePages.Model.FinalLoadSuccessful.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.OfflinePageCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2016. This was the dup of OfflinePages.SavedPageCount.
histogram.summary: Number of offline pages the user has. Android only.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.OnlineOnOpen
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2016. Offline pages no longer depend on bookmarks UI.
histogram.summary: Whether the user was online when a saved page with offline copy was opened.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.OpenSinceLastOpen
histogram.summary: Length of time between two consecutive opens.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Prefetching.ActionRetryAttempts
histogram.summary: Number of attempts to perform a specific retriable pipeline action for each finished prefetch item.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Prefetching.DownloadedArchiveSizeVsExpected
histogram.summary: Reports differences between the expected size of a prefetch archive -- as reported by the service -- and the actual downloaded file size.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Prefetching.FetchThumbnail.Complete
histogram.summary: Records the final status of attempts to fetch thumbnails for prefetched offline pages.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Prefetching.FetchThumbnail.Complete2
histogram.summary: Records the final status of attempts to fetch thumbnails for prefetched offline pages. The 1st attempt takes place right after the prefetch item was sent to the cloud service as part of a request for the creation of its offline snapshot. The 2nd attempt occurs right after the offline snapshot was successfully downloaded by the client.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Prefetching.FetchThumbnail.Start
histogram.summary: Reports each time a thumbnail fetch is attempted.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PrefetchStore.TimeFromCloseToOpen
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks the time between store closing and reopening again within a session. The store is meant to close itself after a period of inactivity. We are trying to assess how much time the store is unloaded from memory vs. time it is loaded and not used. This event will be reported when the store is opened after being closed within the same lifetime of Chrome.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PublishArchive.CreateDirectoryError
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: When publishing an archive, we create the download directory if it doesn't already exist. If we get an error, we record it here.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PublishArchive.MoveFileError
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: When publishing an offline page, the move file step can fail. This returns the reason for failure as a linux errno.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PublishArchive.MoveFileFailureReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: When a move file fails for publishing, what caused the failure.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.PublishPageResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 04/2020 in favor of becoming a special case of OfflinePages.SavePageResult2.
histogram.summary: Failure attempting to move a file while publishing downloaded page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RedirectResult
histogram.summary: Result of automatic redirect to offline version of the page or back. Emitted exactly once when offline-to-online or online-to-offline redirect is determined to be needed and conveys the outcome of redirect.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RedirectToOfflineCount
histogram.summary: Number of times an offline copy was loaded instead when the user is trying to load the online version of a saved page and there is no network connection.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RedirectToOnlineCount
histogram.summary: Number of times an online version was loaded instead when the user is trying to load the offline copy of a saved page and there is network connection. connection.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RequestJob.IntentDataChangedAfterValidation
histogram.summary: Records whether the content read from intent URI (file:// or content://) changed after the initial validation that was done to route the request when the intent was received. This is recorded at the time that Offline Page Request Handler tried to read the data, in preparation to show an offline page to a user.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RequestJob.OpenFileErrorCode
histogram.summary: Positive net error code for opening the underlying file to serve the offline page, including net::OK.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RequestJob.RangeHeader
histogram.summary: Track whether the range header is provided when an offline page is served.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RequestJob.ReadFileErrorCode
histogram.summary: Positive net error code for the failure to read the underlying file to serve the offline page. net::OK is not included.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.RequestJob.SeekFileErrorCode
histogram.summary: Positive net error code for the failure to seek the underlying file to serve the offline page. net::OK is not included.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavedPageCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2/2018. Replaced by OfflinePages.SavedPageCountUponQuery.
histogram.summary: Number of saved pages restored from the offline pages metadata store when it is logged.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePage.FreeSpaceMB
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 03/2018. Replaced by similar metric OfflinePages.StorageInfo.InternalFreeSpaceMB.
histogram.summary:
The amount of free space available, in megabytes, on the user's device after the page is saved.
Note that before M52 this operation was started before save operation.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePage.FreeSpacePercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of free space available on the user's device when the page is being saved.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePageCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 04/2020. The same information can be obtained from OfflinePages.SavePageResult2.* (from each namespace suffix).
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times an offline page is saved. Events are reported per offline pages namespace.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SavePageResult
histogram.summary: Result of saving an offline copy for a page.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.ShowOfflinePageOnBadNetwork
histogram.summary: Whether an offline page is shown, instead of error page, when the network is disconnected or poor condition.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SQLStorage.CreateDirectoryResult
histogram.summary: If the directory to store the SQLite database file does not exist, it is created. This is recorded every time the database is opened, even if the directory already exists, in which case it's reported as FILE_OK.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.SQLStorage.TimeFromCloseToOpen
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks the time between store closing and reopening again. The store is meant to close itself after a period of inactivity. We are trying to assess how much time the store is unloaded from memory vs. time it is loaded and not used. This event will be reported when the store is opened after being closed within the same lifetime of Chrome.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.TotalPageSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 03/2018. Replaced by similar metric OfflinePages.StorageInfo.TotalArchiveSize.
histogram.summary:
Total size of all the offline pages saved by the user.
This value is recorded whenever the number of pages change, meaning after a page is added or removed. If pages are removed in bulk, this value will be reported only once.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.TotalPageSizePercentage
histogram.summary:
Total size of all the offline pages saved by the user as a percentage of total storage size.
This value is recorded whenever the number of pages change, meaning after a page is added or removed.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Wakeup.BatteryPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: Percentage of battery remaining when the offline page background loading task wakes up to check for work.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Wakeup.ConnectedToPower
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: Whether the device is plugged in when the offline page background load task wakes up to check or work.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Wakeup.DelayTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time delay from a dinosaur page to connection being available.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.Wakeup.NetworkAvailable
histogram.summary: Which network is available (if any) when the offling page background loading task wakes up to check for work.

histogram.name: OfflinePages.WebsiteSettings.ConnectedWhenOpenOnlineButtonClicked
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the browser was connected when Open online button was clicked on Page Info popup, which causes a reload of an offline page to online version.

histogram.name: OfflinePolicy.SuccessfulResourceLoadPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When a page is loaded in offline mode, the percentage of resources on that page that were successfully loaded.

histogram.name: OffscreenCanvas.TextMetrics.MeasureText
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/08, this metrics doesn't reflect the measurement speed because it is dependent on the length of text.
histogram.summary: Time spent in microseconds to perform calls to measure TextMetrics for OffscreenCanvas. It's measured each time TextMetrics is called.

histogram.name: Omnibox.AggressiveHistoryURLProviderFieldTrialBeacon
histogram.obsolete: Aggressive HistoryURL provider field trial deleted in spring 2012.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A number that indicates what omnibox ranking behavior the user is seeing as part of the OmniboxAggressiveHistoryURLProvider field trial (OmniboxAggressiveHistoryURLProvider).

histogram.name: Omnibox.AnswerInSuggestShown
histogram.summary:
Records number of times an Answer is presented as one of the Omnibox Suggestions at the time the user exited the omnibox. Exiting the omnibox includes navigating (to entered text or any suggestion), pressing the system back key, clearing omnibox, blanking screen / locking the phone (whether intentionally or due to inactivity), or closing the Chrome app. This metric is logged every time the omnibox is exited, including when no answer is present in the list of suggestions.
Nota bene: in some circumstances this histogram is double counting on purpose. Scenarios cover repetitive actions that expose same answer suggestion, ie. leave-enter-leave application, or leave-enter-clear where no new suggestion fetches are done.
This histogram assumes that no more than 1 AiS suggestion is shown at a time, which was enforced by the backend at the time the histogram was created. Additional histogram/s may be required to properly track how frequently answers are shown in general - and in what quantity.
This histogram is related to Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.AnswerInSuggest.

histogram.name: Omnibox.CharTypedToRepaintLatency.Composited
histogram.obsolete: This became the new implementation of Omnibox.CharTypedToRepaintLatency as of 08/2017.
histogram.summary: A refinement of the Omnibox.CharTypedToRepaintLatency metric that attempts to more accurately track the latency by measuring until the point when the compositor has actually put pixels on the screen. In particular, this will capture the time used to also paint the Omnibox result views as a result of the character insertion, which is not covered by Omnibox.CharTypedToRepaintLatency. If there are multiple keystrokes before a paint, logs the time since the earliest one.

histogram.name: Omnibox.EditUrlSuggestionAction
histogram.summary: The action performed on the edit-URL omnibox suggestion that contains the "what you typed"/current URL. If visible, this is the first suggestion.

histogram.name: Omnibox.EnteredKeywordMode
histogram.summary: The number of times users enter keyword hint mode "Search ___ for:" and how.

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTime
histogram.summary: The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion).

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTimeAnyPopupState
histogram.summary: The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion). This is recorded regardless of whether the omnibox dropdown (a.k.a. popup) is open.

histogram.name: Omnibox.FocusToOpenTimeAnyPopupState2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Omnibox.FocusToOpenTimeAnyPopupState3 in January, 2017, which only differs in the bucketing and range.
histogram.summary:
The length of time between when a user focused on the omnibox and opened an omnibox match (which could be what they typed or a suggestion). This is recorded regardless of whether the omnibox dropdown (a.k.a. popup) is open. It is not recorded if a match is opened without triggering a focus event, e.g., when a user drags a URL to the omnibox to navigate.
To know how common this last condition is, compare the total count of this histogram to the total number of omnibox events.
Android started logging this in M76.

histogram.name: Omnibox.HardwareKeyboardModeEnabled
histogram.summary: iOS: Records whether a hardware keyboard is used to input text. This is recorded each time a UIKeyboardWillChangeFrameNotification is sent while editing the omnibox text.

histogram.name: Omnibox.HasLegalDefaultMatchWithoutCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether there was at least one legal default match without an |inline_autocompletion|. Recorded every time AutocompleteResult::SortAndCull() is called, which could happen multiple times on each keystroke.

histogram.name: Omnibox.HistoryQuickHistoryIDSetFromWords
histogram.summary: Times URLIndexPrivateData::HistoryIDSetFromWords(), which is called by the omnibox's HistoryQuick provider. URLIndexPrivateData::HistoryIDSetFromWords() can be called multiple times per keystroke due to, for example, the cursor being in the middle of the input string or SearchProvider's calls to Classify().

histogram.name: Omnibox.LocalHistoryZeroSuggest.MaxMatchesCount
histogram.obsolete: Made obsolete in July 2020 for the M86 Milestone.
histogram.summary: The maximum number of matches returned by the provider. Triggered when zero-prefix suggestions are enabled and requested as a result of user focus into the Omnibox or the Realbox on the NTP.

histogram.name: Omnibox.LocalHistoryZeroSuggest.SearchTermsSeenCount
histogram.obsolete: Made obsolete in July 2020 for the M86 Milestone.
histogram.summary: The number of search terms examined until the maximum possible matches are fulfilled. Used to determine the upper bound of search terms to query from the keyword search terms database. Triggered when zero-prefix suggestions are enabled and requested as a result of user focus into the Omnibox or the Realbox on the NTP.

histogram.name: Omnibox.MatchStability.AsyncMatchChange
histogram.summary:
This histogram was buggy and the data should be disregarded.
The original intent was to count asynchronous match updates for each position. The implementation had a bug, and it overcounted.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PhysicalWebProvider.SuggestionUsedWithoutOmniboxFocus
histogram.summary: Records a boolean value indicating whether the Physical Web provider was invoked by focusing the omnibox during the current omnibox session. This is unexpected; it's probably a bug somwhere. Recorded when the user selects an omnibox suggestion. Does not record when the Physical Web omnibox provider is disabled.

histogram.name: Omnibox.PhysicalWebProviderMatches
histogram.summary: The number of matches returned by PhysicalWebProvider. Emitted when the omnibox is first focused, unless the user is in incognito mode. Capped at 10.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ProgressBarBreakPointUpdateCount
histogram.summary: The number of progress bar break point updates from page load started to page load finished.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ProgressBarUpdateCount
histogram.summary: The number of progress bar frame updates from page load started to page load finished. If there is no animation, this matches Omnibox.ProgressBarBreakPointUpdateCount. Note that there can be additional updates after page load finished, animating to 100%, but this histogram doesn't include them.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ProviderTime
histogram.summary: The length of time taken by the named provider"s synchronous pass.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryBookmarksTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time the HistoryContentProvider takes to perform a bookmark search.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryGeolocationAcquisitionTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to acquire the location sent in the X-Geo header for an Omnibox query.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryGeolocationHorizontalAccuracy
histogram.summary: The estimated horizontal accuracy of the location sent in the X-Geo header for an Omnibox query.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryIosLocationAuthorizationStatus
histogram.summary: For iOS, whether the application is authorized to use location services when the user enters a search query into the Omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.QueryTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes for the omnibox to become responsive to user input after the user has typed N characters. This measures the time it takes to start all the asynchronous autocomplete providers (but not wait for them to finish).

histogram.name: Omnibox.RichEntity.DecorationType
histogram.summary:
Records, for each entity suggestion (people, music, ...) whether it was decorated with image / color / icon at the time the user exited the omnibox. Exiting the omnibox includes navigation (url or query), pressing back key, locking the phone, clearing the omnibox, closing Chrome, or just screen blacking out due to prolonged inactivity.
This metric is currently only recorded on Android, though it could be added to the other platforms.

histogram.name: Omnibox.RichEntityShown
histogram.summary:
Records number of presented Rich Entity suggestions at the time the user exited the omnibox. Exiting the omnibox includes navigating (to entered text or any suggestion), pressing the system back key, clearing omnibox, blanking screen / locking the phone (whether intentionally or due to inactivity), or closing the Chrome app. This metric is logged every time the omnibox is exited, including when no entities are present in the list of suggestions.
Nota bene: in some circumstances this histogram is double counting on purpose. Scenarios cover repetitive actions that expose same entity suggestions, ie. leave-enter-leave application, or leave-enter-clear where no new suggestion fetches are done.
This histogram is related to Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.RichEntity.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SaveStateForTabSwitch.UserInputInProgress
histogram.summary: When a user switches tabs, whether the omnibox had an edit in progress.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchEngine
histogram.obsolete: Made obsolete around Chrome 32. Use Omnibox.SearchEngineType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of search engine that was used for search in omnibox. See src/chrome/browser/search_engines/template_url_prepopulate_data.cc for more info.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchProvider.AddHistoryResultsTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes to add all the raw history results to the list of matches.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchProvider.ConvertResultsTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes to convert all the results to matches and add them to a map, to keep the most relevant match for each result.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SearchProvider.GetMostRecentKeywordTermsDefaultProviderTime
histogram.summary: Time it takes for the omnibox to search the previous query history database for queries that start with the omnibox text.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.IconOrFaviconType
histogram.summary:
Counts how often omnibox suggestions are used, and in the case a regular search / url (not an Answer, Entity or any other specialized) suggestion was selected - records how the suggestion was decorated.
This histogram is related to Omnibox.IconOrFaviconShown.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58, replaced with Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount.AtFocus and Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount.AtMatchCreation.
histogram.summary:
The number of nearby Physical Web URLs when the user focused the omnibox. Recorded when the user accepts an omnibox suggestion, regardless of whether the suggestion came from PhysicalWebProvider. Capped at 50.
In M57, the values recorded by this histogram were determined to be bugged. It's believed that it was recording uninitialized values due to a corner case on Android that allows an omnibox suggestion to be selected without first focusing the omnibox. In addition to the new histograms, Omnibox.PhysicalWebProvider.SuggestionUsedWithoutOmniboxFocus was added to detect this case. https://crbug.com/691059

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount.AtFocus
histogram.summary:
The number of nearby Physical Web URLs when Physical Web Provider was last focused (i.e., the start of the current session). Recorded when the user accepts an omnibox suggestion, regardless of whether the suggestion came from PhysicalWebProvider. Capped at 50.
Does not record if the omnibox was not focused during the current session. Omnibox.PhysicalWebProvider.SuggestionUsedWithoutOmniboxFocus records true when we hit this case.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.NearbyURLCount.AtMatchCreation
histogram.summary: The number of nearby Physical Web URLs when Physical Web Provider last constructed matches. Recorded when the user accepts an omnibox suggestion, regardless of whether the suggestion came from PhysicalWebProvider. Capped at 50.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.RichEntity
histogram.summary:
Whether a Rich Entity omnibox suggestion was selected when the user used the omnibox to go somewhere.
This histogram is related to Omnibox.RichEntityShown.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.Experimental.ForegroundToFirstMeaningfulPaint.Prerender
histogram.obsolete: Prerender was retired from the code long ago; this histogram was finally removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the page first appearing in the foreground to its first meaningful paint. Only recorded on navigations that use a prerender that is to a search query suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.ForegroundToFirstContentfulPaint.Prerender
histogram.obsolete: Prerender was retired from the code long ago; this histogram was finally removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the page first appearing in the foreground to its first contentful paint. Only recorded on navigations that use a prerender that is to a search query suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.Search.NavigationToFirstForeground.Prerender
histogram.obsolete: Prerender was retired from the code long ago; this histogram was finally removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: Measures the time from a page being navigated to in prerender to it first showing up in foreground. Only recorded on navigations that used a prerender that was to a search query suggestion selected from the omnibox. This is only recorded on pages that experience a first contentful paint.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.Experimental.ForegroundToFirstMeaningfulPaint.Prerender
histogram.obsolete: Prerender was retired from the code long ago; this histogram was finally removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the page first appearing in the foreground to its first meaningful paint. Only recorded on navigations that use a prerender that is to a URL suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.ForegroundToFirstContentfulPaint.Prerender
histogram.obsolete: Prerender was retired from the code long ago; this histogram was finally removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: Measures the time from the page first appearing in the foreground to its first contentful paint. Only recorded on navigations that use a prerender that is to a URL suggestion selected from the omnibox.

histogram.name: Omnibox.SuggestionUsed.URL.NavigationToFirstForeground.Prerender
histogram.obsolete: Prerender was retired from the code long ago; this histogram was finally removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: Measures the time from a page being navigated to in prerender to it first showing up in foreground. Only recorded on navigations that used a prerender that was to a URL suggestion selected from the omnibox. This is only recorded on pages that experience a first contentful paint.

histogram.name: Omnibox.TimeUntilFirst
histogram.summary: The amount of time that passes in ms between the user focusing the omnibox and performing some action on Android. This is only recorded the first time the user performs this action per omnibox focus event. Other Omnibox.TimeUntilFirst.* events are not recorded past the first event.

histogram.name: Omnibox.URLNavigationTimeToRedirectToHTTPS
histogram.summary:
The amount of time, in milliseconds, between the start of a typed URL navigation in the omnibox (the user typing a URL to completion, or selecting a URL from the inline autocomplete or dropdown) and the start of a redirect upgrading the URL to HTTPS. This is only recorded when the upgraded URL is the same except for the scheme and the addition/removal of a "www." prefix.
To calculate the percentage of HTTP URL navigations that have been upgraded in this way, divide the count of this histogram by the count for HTTP in Omnibox.URLNavigationScheme.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.Eligible.OnFocus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2019 because histogram was not recorded in every circumstance. Superseded by Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.Eligible.OnFocusV2.
histogram.summary:
Whether the user has settings configured so that the current page URL can be sent to the suggest server to request contextual suggestions. For example, this is only supported for users who have Google as their default search engine (unmodified version of Google), have search suggest enabled, are signed-in and syncing without a custom passphrase, and don't have an incognito window open. There are other criteria too. Recorded on focus in the omnibox if there is default search provider and we've constructed a suggest URL.
Some additional guidelines: if an incognito window is open, all focus events will go into the "generally ineligible" bucket. Likewise, if the current page is a search results page, we don't allow contextual suggestions either so focus events on those pages go in the "generally ineligible" bucket. The difference between "eligible" and "generally eligible but not this time" depends only the properties of the current URL.
Recorded regardless of whether contextual or non-contextual zero suggest is currently enabled on the user's platform. However, if zero suggest (in all forms) is entirely disabled, the user will be perpetually ineligible.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.Eligible.RemoteNoUrl.OnNTP.OnFocus
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code as of M87 / September 2020. This is no longer useful.
histogram.summary:
Whether the user is eligible to receive personalized zero suggestions on the NTP. This histogram is updated only when the user focuses the omnibox on the NTP and is emitted only once even if multiple criteria make a user ineligible. Consult the source code to learn more about the precedence of these values.
This metric is recorded for all contexts (including users non-syncing, in incognito mode, or using different search engines) and targets specifically eligibility in the current situation.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.Eligible.RemoteNoUrl.OnNTP.OnProfileOpen
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code as of M87 / September 2020. This is no longer useful.
histogram.summary:
Whether the user is eligible to receive personalized zero suggestions on the NTP. This histogram is updated every time Chrome registers a profile change.
This metric is recorded for all contexts (including users non-syncing, in incognito mode, or using different search engines) and targets overall profile eligibility to receive zero-prefix query suggestions on a New Tab Page.

histogram.name: Omnibox.ZeroSuggest.MostVisitedResultsCounterfactual
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of M85. Added back in 2013 (https://crrev.com/23600051), this is no longer useful.
histogram.summary: The number of most visited suggestions returned when ZeroSuggest would have triggered. The suggestions appear when the user has focused but not modified the omnibox.

histogram.name: OmniboxViewViews.SendTabToSelf
histogram.summary: Whether the user has clicked the item when it is shown" Logged when the share option is shown in the omnibox context menu"

histogram.name: OOBE.NetworkErrorShown.Supervised
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of M85. Supervised screen has gone so this metric became obsolete.
histogram.summary: Number of times error screen has appeared during supervised user creation.

histogram.name: OOBE.RecommendApps.Fetcher.ResponseSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 08/27/2020. No longer needed to track size of a response.
histogram.summary: The size of the recommend-apps JSON response.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintCache.FetchedHint.TimeToExpiration
histogram.summary: The remaining time a fetched hint that was loaded for use has before it expires and is removed from the hint cache store.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HasHint.AtCommit
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records when the optimization guide hint cache has a hint entry for a URL's host at commit time.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HasHint.BeforeCommit
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records when the optimization guide hint cache has a hint entry for a URL's host before commit time (e.g., at original navigation time or redirected navigation time).

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HostMatch.AtCommit
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records when the optimization guide hint cache has a loaded hint entry matching a URL's host at commit time. This is recorded regardless of whether an associated preview type is allowed for the navigation or not. If no associated preview type is allowed, the hint will not be loaded from a backing store, so this will only capture matches for in-memory hints.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintCache.PageMatch.AtCommit
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records when the optimization guide hint cache has a loaded page hint for a URL at commit time. This is recorded regardless of whether an associated preview type is allowed for the navigation or not. If no associated preview type is allowed, the hint will not be loaded from a backing store, so this will only capture matches for in-memory hints.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintCacheStore.OnLoadHint.FetchedHintExpired
histogram.summary: Records that a fetched hint loaded from the store has expired. If expired, the hint is not provided.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.Hints.NavigationHostCoverage.AtCommit
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records once per navigation if the host that was navigated to was included in a hints fetch request in the last 7 days, even if no hints were returned, or had a hint served via the Optimization Hints component at commit.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.Hints.NavigationHostCoverage.BeforeCommit
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records once per navigation if the host that was navigated to was included in a hints fetch request in the last 7 days, even if no hints were returned, or had a hint served via the Optimization Hints component before commit.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintsFetcher.NavigationHostCoveredByFetch
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records when hints fetching is enabled whether the HTTPS host being navigated to was included in a hints fetch request and any hints returned have not since expired. Captured at navigation start so it will not include hints fetched based on the current navigation.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintsFetcher.NavigationHostCoveredByFetch.AtCommit
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records whether the host being navigated to was included in a hints fetch request and any hints returned have not since expired. Captured after a navigation is committed in order to determine if the fetch attempt made at navigation start succeeded or not.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintsFetcher.NavigationHostCoveredByFetch.BeforeCommit
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 04/2020 since this histogram no longer makes sense with the current request flow.
histogram.summary: Records whether the host being navigated to was included in a hints fetch request and any hints returned have not since expired. Captured at navigation start so will not include any newly fetched hints for this navigation.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintsFetcher.WasHostCoveredByFetch
histogram.summary: Records whether the host being navigated to was included in a hints fetch and any hints returned have not since expired.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.HintsLoadedPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage (0-100) of hints loaded over all attempted page loads between component updates. Recorded when the OptimizationGuideService receives a component with a new version.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.PredictionModelStore.OnLoadCollided
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 01/2020 since it rarely ever happens that there is a load collision.
histogram.summary: For each load of a prediction model from the OptimizationGuideStore, reports whether the load collided with an update being made to the store.

histogram.name: OptimizationGuide.PredictionModelVersion
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 05/2020 to in favor of recording the version on update and on load.
histogram.summary: Records the version of the prediction model being updated and stored in the prediction model store and made available for use. Recorded only if the model is valid and successfully loaded into memory for use.

histogram.name: OriginChip.Pressed
histogram.obsolete: Removed with CL 731423002. OriginChip has been removed.
histogram.summary: The number of clicks on the origin chip.

histogram.name: OriginTrials.FeatureEnabled
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of Chrome 54. Sort of replaced by OriginTrials.ValidationResult.
histogram.summary: Counts the results of origin trial checks to enable experimental features. The result for each feature check is counted at most once per execution context (e.g. page, worker).

histogram.name: OriginTrials.FeatureEnabled.MessageGenerated
histogram.summary: Counts how often an error message is generated for each origin trial check to enable an experimental feature.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.EncryptionKeyLookupError
histogram.summary: Error code returned by SecKeychainFindGenericPassword when the encryption key is retrieved.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.EncryptionKeyOverwritingPreventions
histogram.summary: The number of times that Chrome prevented overwriting the encryption key in a row. This metric is logged once on startup.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.FindPasswordAgain
histogram.summary: Result of the second call to SecKeychainFindGenericPassword when the encryption key was not found but was expected to be there.

histogram.name: OSCrypt.GetEncryptionKeyAction
histogram.summary: Action taken when retrieving the encryption key from the Keychain. This metric is logged once on startup.

histogram.name: OSX.BluetoothAvailability
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of Chrome 73. This has been replaced by Bluetooth.Availability.
histogram.summary: The availability and capabilities of the Bluetooth driver on OSX devices. This metric is logged on startup.

histogram.name: OSX.CatSixtyFour
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of Chrome 43. See OmahaProxy for more relevant statistics.
histogram.summary: The cat's flavor and how many bits there are in it.

histogram.name: OSX.FastUserSwitch
histogram.summary: Records the Fast User Switching events that occur.

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.Enter
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 40. See OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.Style, OSX.Fullscreen.Enter.WindowLocation and OSX.Settings.ScreensHaveSeparateSpaces.
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen for a browser window. The value's bits reflect different parameters. Bit 0: Fullscreen entry mechanism (AppKit vs Immersive). Bit 1: Whether the window was on the primary screen (Primary vs. Secondary). Bit 2: Whether displays have separate spaces options is enabled (Seperate vs Shared). Bit 3: Whether there are multiple screens.

histogram.name: OSX.Fullscreen.ToolbarStyle
histogram.summary: This event is recorded each time a user triggers fullscreen and when the fullscreen toolbar is updated with a new style.

histogram.name: OSX.InstallationFilesystem
histogram.summary: Records the filesystem type that the app lives on.

histogram.name: OSX.KeychainReauthorizeIfNeeded
histogram.summary: The number of previous times that the keychain reauthorization did not complete, when run during the main browser launch.

histogram.name: OSX.KeychainReauthorizeIfNeededAtUpdate
histogram.summary: The number of previous times that the keychain reauthorization did not complete, when run at update time.

histogram.name: OSX.KeychainReauthorizeIfNeededAtUpdateSuccess
histogram.summary: How many times the keychain reauthorization ran before finally succeeding, when run at update time.

histogram.name: OSX.KeychainReauthorizeIfNeededSuccess
histogram.summary: How many times the keychain reauthorization ran before finally succeeding, when run during the main browser launch.

histogram.name: OSX.OtherInstances
histogram.summary: Records how many other instances of this binary are running at startup.

histogram.name: OSX.OtherInstancesCheckResult
histogram.summary: The result of the update process's check for other instances of Chrome.

histogram.name: OSX.RendererHost.SurfaceWaitTime
histogram.summary: This event records the amount of time that the browser process main thread blocks, waiting for a frame with the right dimensions to arrive from the gpu process.

histogram.name: OSX.SharedMemory.Mechanism
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 51 since Mach has become the default mechanism.
histogram.summary: A histogram entry is emitted each time a base::SharedMemory object is constructed. The value of the entry indicates the mechanism used to back the shared memory region.

histogram.name: OSX.StagingDirectoryLocation
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2019 in favor of StagingDirectoryLocation2.
histogram.summary: Records first staging directory location that works.

histogram.name: OSX.StagingDirectoryLocation2
histogram.summary: Records, during Chrome startup, the first staging directory location that works. This is for the change to the updating system.

histogram.name: OSX.StartupUpdateState
histogram.summary: Records, during Chrome startup, the state of any staged updates.

histogram.name: OutOfProcessHeapProfiling.ProfiledProcess.Type
histogram.summary: One metric is emitted every 24-hours after Chrome is launched for every process that is being profiled. The timer is reset if Chrome exits.

histogram.name: OutOfProcessHeapProfiling.ProfilingMode
histogram.summary: One metric is emitted every 24-hours after Chrome is launched for every Chrome instance that is using out of process heap profiling. The timer is reset if Chrome exits.

histogram.name: OutOfProcessHeapProfiling.RecordTrace.Success
histogram.summary: The metric is emitted each time Chrome attempts to record a memory-infra trace to upload an out-of-process heap-profiling memory dump.

histogram.name: OutOfProcessHeapProfiling.UploadTrace.Size
histogram.summary: The metric is emitted each time Chrome uploads a trace. It reflects the uncompressed size of the trace.

histogram.name: OutOfProcessHeapProfiling.UploadTrace.Success
histogram.summary: The metric is emitted each time Chrome uploads a trace. It reflects whether the upload was successful.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Cancelled
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 59 in favour of Overscroll.Cancelled3.
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures that were aborted before they were completed.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Completed
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 44 in favour of Overscroll.Cancelled and Overscroll.Navigated2.
histogram.summary:
Completed overscroll gestures.
An overscroll gesture starts when user scrolls past the edge of the web page and continues scrolling in the same direction. An overscroll gesture is completed when user stops scrolling (e.g. by lifting the fingers from the touchscreen or touchpad).

histogram.name: Overscroll.Navigated
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 44 to switch to NavigationDirection enum.
histogram.summary: Navigations that were triggered due to completed overscroll gesture. Note that not all completed overscroll gestures trigger a navigation.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Navigated2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 59 in favour of Overscroll.Navigated3.
histogram.summary: Navigations that were triggered due to completed overscroll gesture. Note that not all completed overscroll gestures trigger a navigation.

histogram.name: Overscroll.Started
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 44 to switch to NavigationDirection enum.
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures initiated by the user. Note that not all overcroll gestures started are completed (e.g. the overscroll gesture is aborted if user clicks or presses a key during the gesture).

histogram.name: Overscroll.Started2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 59 in favour of Overscroll.Started3.
histogram.summary: Overscroll gestures initiated by the user. Note that not all overscroll gestures started are completed (e.g. the overscroll gesture is aborted if user clicks or presses a key during the gesture).

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchNoiseFilter.FarApartTapDistance
histogram.summary: The squared distance between taps which occur in quick succession. Only reported when the taps are far apart and touch noise filtering is enabled.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchNoiseFilter.HorizontallyAlignedDistance
histogram.summary: The horizontal distance from a "touch press" to the closest other touch. Only reported if there are two or more fingers onscreen and touch noise filtering is enabled.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchNoiseFilter.TimeSinceLastNoiseOccurrence
histogram.summary: The amount of time between noisy touches. The amount of time since Chrome startup is recorded for the first noisy touch after startup.

histogram.name: Ozone.TouchNoiseFilter.TouchesAtSinglePositionDuration
histogram.summary: The time between taps which occur in quick succession at the same screen location. Only reported when touch noise filtering is enabled.

histogram.name: PageImportanceSignals.HadFormInteraction.OnCommitLoad
histogram.summary: Number of pages that had any HTML form interaction before next page load.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Background
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted due to being backgrounded.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.ClientRedirect
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a client side redirect (Javascript navigation).

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Close
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by the user closing the tab or browser.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.ForwardBackNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a forward or back navigation.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.NewNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a new navigation.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Other
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted. The abort cause is unknown.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Reload
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a reload.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.Stop
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming equivalent.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by the user pressing stop.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AbortTiming.UnknownNavigation
histogram.obsolete: We now have sufficient infrastructure to always characterize aborts that resulted in new navigations.
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a navigation with unknown transition type.

histogram.name: PageLoad.AdPaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary:
Records the time from frame navigation start to FirstContentfulPaint of each ad frame that receives a FirstContentfulPaint. The time could be quite large, as some ads don't paint until they're scrolled into view. But the metric is still useful in aggregate.
Recorded for all ad frames with non-zero bytes or cpu usage that receive a FirstContentfulPaint. Recorded when the ad frame or page is destroyed.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.AdFrames.Aggregate.Network
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of the resources loaded for all of the ad frames on the page that loaded over the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.AdFrames.Aggregate.PercentNetwork
histogram.summary:
The percentage of bytes loaded for all ad frames that were loaded over the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.AdFrames.Aggregate.Total
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of the resources loaded for all of the ad frames on the page.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.AdFrames.PerFrame.Network
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of the resources loaded for an ad frame from the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.AdFrames.PerFrame.PercentNetwork
histogram.summary:
The percentage of bytes loaded for a single ad frame that were loaded over the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.AdFrames.PerFrame.Total
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of the resources loaded for an ad frame.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.FullPage.Network
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources that loaded over the network.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.FullPage.Network.PercentAds
histogram.summary:
The percentage of bytes loaded for the page (from the network) that came from resource loads in ad frames (from the network).
