Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.FullPage.Total
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.FullPage.Total.PercentAds
histogram.summary:
The percentage of bytes loaded for the page that came from resource loads in ad frames.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Bytes.NonAdFrames.Aggregate.Total
histogram.summary:
The size (in KB) of all of the page's resources except for those loaded in ad frames.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Bytes are measured as over-the-wire (e.g., compressed) response body KBs and do not include header bytes. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.All.Navigations.AdFrameRenavigatedToAd
histogram.obsolete: Removed In July 2018, metric was buggy for subresource filter ads.
histogram.summary:
When a frame that is (or previously was) an ad frame renavigates, record whether it renavigated to an ad frame or a non-ad frame.
An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children. Its children (which may also be ads) are not counted when they renavigate.
This metric is recorded as the event happens. Note that this is unlike most other Clients.Ads metrics, which are recorded when the page load is complete.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.All.Navigations.NonAdFrameRenavigatedToAd
histogram.summary:
When a frame that has never been part of an ad frame renavigates, record whether it renavigated to an ad frame or a non-ad frame.
This metric is recorded as the event happens. Note that this is unlike most other Clients.Ads metrics, which are recorded when the page load is complete.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.All.ParentExistsForSubFrame
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a parent frame is found for a subframe that finishes navigating.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.All.ResourceTypeWhenNoFrameFound
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2018. At time of deprecation: Subframe 80%, Script 6.5%, Images 10%, and XHR was 3%.
histogram.summary: Records the content::ResourceType when a resource finishes loading but the ads metrics aren't aware of a committed frame for the resource.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.FrameCounts.AdFrames.PerFrame.Visibility
histogram.summary: Whether or not the ad frame had a display: none style set, meaning it was not visible to the user. Only recorded for ad frames with non-zero total bytes. Recorded when the page is destroyed or navigated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.FrameCounts.MainFrameParent.AdFrames
histogram.summary:
The number of frames (with parent frame of main frame) that are on the page identified as Google Ad Frames.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. Child frames of an ad frame are not included in the count.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.FrameCounts.MainFrameParent.PercentAdFrames
histogram.summary:
The percentage of frames (with parent frame of main frame) on the page that are identified as Google Ad Frames.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame. An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.FrameCounts.MainFrameParent.TotalFrames
histogram.summary:
The number of frames (with parent frame of main frame) on the page.
Only recorded if the page has at least one identified ad frame.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Navigations.AdFrameRenavigatedToAd
histogram.summary:
When a frame that is (or previously was) an ad frame renavigates, record whether it renavigated to an ad frame or a non-ad frame.
An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children. Its children (which may also be ads) are not counted when they renavigate.
This metric is recorded as the event happens. Note that this is unlike most other Clients.Ads metrics, which are recorded when the page load is complete.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.Navigations.NonAdFrameRenavigatedToAd
histogram.summary:
When a frame that has never been part of an ad frame renavigates, record whether it renavigated to an ad frame or a non-ad frame.
This metric is recorded as the event happens. Note that this is unlike most other Clients.Ads metrics, which are recorded when the page load is complete.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.ParentExistsForSubFrame
histogram.summary: Records whether or not a parent frame is found for a subframe that finishes navigating.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Google.ResourceTypeWhenNoFrameFound
histogram.summary: Records the content::ResourceType when a resource finishes loading but the ads metrics aren't aware of a committed frame for the resource.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Resources.Bytes.Ads
histogram.summary: Total number of network bytes that went towards loading ad resources for a single page over it's entire lifetime. This includes resources that did not finish or were canceled. Only recorded for pages with non-zero ad bytes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Resources.Bytes.TopLevelAds
histogram.summary: Total number of network bytes that were used to load top-level ad resources on the page. This includes resources that did not finish or were canceled. Only recorded for pages with non-zero ad bytes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Resources.Bytes.Total
histogram.summary: Total number of network bytes that were used to load resources on the page. This includes resources that did not finish loading or were canceled. Only recorded for pages with non-zero ad bytes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.Ads.Resources.Bytes.Unfinished
histogram.summary: Total number of network bytes that were used to load resources that did not finish loading on the page (e.g. ongoing video). This includes resource loads that were canceled or resource loads that were ongoing when the page was destroyed. Only recorded for pages with non-zero ad bytes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.AMP.Experimental.LayoutStability.JankScore.Subframe
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of layout jank (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred during the session, in the AMP subframe. Recorded for same-document navigations.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.AMP.Experimental.LayoutStability.JankScore.Subframe.FullNavigation
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of layout jank (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred during the session, in the AMP subframe. Recorded for non-same-document navigations.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.AMP.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay3.Subframe
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2019 in favor of FirstInputDelay4.
histogram.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation, in an AMP subframe document. Recorded on first page interaction. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. Excludes scrolls. Only same-document navigations are included.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.AMP.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay3.Subframe.FullNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2019 in favor of FirstInputDelay4.
histogram.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation, in an AMP subframe document. Recorded on first page interaction. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. Excludes scrolls. Only non-same-document navigations are included.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.AMP.PaintTiming.InputToLargestContentPaint.Subframe
histogram.summary:
The time from user input to largest "contentful" paint in an AMP subframe document. Only same-document navigations are included.
Excludes any content painted after user input. The value is recorded at the end of each page load unless there is an abort or user input before text or image paint. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for details.
Will be zero or near-zero in cases where the AMP subframe document was prerendered.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.AMP.PaintTiming.InputToLargestContentPaint.Subframe.FullNavigation
histogram.summary:
The time from user input to largest "contentful" paint in an AMP subframe document. Only non-same-document navigations are included.
Excludes any content painted after user input. The value is recorded at the end of each page load unless there is an abort or user input before text or image paint. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for details.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.AMP.SameDocumentView
histogram.summary: Count of same document page views for AMP pages.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.CompressionRatio
histogram.summary: 100 times the ratio of network bytes received to network bytes the user would have seen without data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded as a percent if the data reduction proxy saved the user data. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.CompressionRatio2
histogram.summary: 100 times the ratio of network bytes received to network bytes the user would have seen without data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded as a percent if the data reduction proxy saved the user data. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Inflation
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the data reduction proxy inflated for the user in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Inflation2
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the data reduction proxy inflated for the user in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.InflationPercent
histogram.summary: The inflation in network kilobytes (not including headers) the user saw due to using data reduction proxy in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded as a percent when the user saw inflated data. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.InflationPercent2
histogram.summary: The inflation in network kilobytes (not including headers) the user saw due to using data reduction proxy in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded as a percent when the user saw inflated data. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.NonProxied
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes that were not fetched through the data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.NonProxied2
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes that were not fetched through the data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Original
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the user would have seen without using data reduction proxy in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Original2
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the user would have seen without using data reduction proxy in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.PercentProxied
histogram.summary: The percent of network kilobytes (not including headers) in a page load that went through data reduction proxy when the main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.PercentProxied2
histogram.summary: The percent of network kilobytes (not including headers) in a page load that went through data reduction proxy when the main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Proxied
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes that were fetched through the data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Proxied2
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes that were fetched through the data reduction proxy (not including headers) in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Savings
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the data reduction proxy saved the user in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.Bytes.Network.Savings2
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that the data reduction proxy saved the user in a page load that had its main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.CompletedResources.Network.PercentProxied
histogram.summary: The percent of completed resources loaded from network in a page load that use data reduction proxy when the main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DataReductionProxy.Experimental.CompletedResources.Network2
histogram.summary: Records info about the completed resources loaded from network in a page load that use data reduction proxy when the main resource was loaded through data reduction proxy. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app. The number of proxies, non-proxied, percent of proxied are recorded as suffixes.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DelayNavigation.Delay.Actual
histogram.summary: The actual delay added to page loads by DelayNavigationThrottle, for page loads that started in the foreground and reached first paint in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DelayNavigation.Delay.Delta
histogram.summary: The absolute delta between the specified and actual delays added to main frame navigations by DelayNavigationThrottle, for page loads that started in the foreground and reached first paint in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.DelayNavigation.Delay.Specified
histogram.summary: The specified delay added to main frame navigations by DelayNavigationThrottle, for page loads that started in the foreground and reached first paint in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.FontPreload.LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2020 as the behavior is launched
histogram.summary: This metrics measures PageLoad.LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore when the first rendering cycle has been delayed in favor of font preloading

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.FontPreload.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestImagePaint
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2020 as the behavior is launched
histogram.summary: This metrics measures PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestImagePaint when the first rendering cycle has been delayed in favor of font preloading

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.FontPreload.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestTextPaint
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2020 as the behavior is launched
histogram.summary: This metrics measures PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestTextPaint when the first rendering cycle has been delayed in favor of font preloading

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.GoogleCaptcha.Events
histogram.summary: Events related to Google CAPTCHA pages being seen by users.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.LoFi.Experimental.Bytes.Network.LoFi
histogram.summary: The number of network kilobytes (not including headers) that LoFi resources used in a page load that had at least one LoFi resource. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.LoFi.Experimental.CompletedResources.Network.LoFi
histogram.summary: The number of network LoFi resources in a page load that had at least one LoFi resource. Recorded per page load when the user navigates away, hides the tab, or backgrounds the app.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.MultiTabLoading.NumTabsWithInflightLoad
histogram.summary: Records the number of tabs with inflight loading activities. Recorded when a new page load starts.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ServiceWorker.PageTransition
histogram.summary: The core transition type for main frame page loads controlled by a service worker.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.SubresourceFilter.ActivationDecision
histogram.summary: Records the policy decision to activate subresource filtering for a page load. 'Activated' indicates that subresource filtering was activated. All other reasons indicate that subresource filtering was not activated. Page loads where subresource filtering was activated ('Activated') and at least one subresource matched the subresource filter are counted in PageLoad.Clients.SubresourceFilter.Count.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.SubresourceFilter.Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed May 2018 (M68) in favor of SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.MatchedRules (e.g. by looking at 0 and non-zero buckets).
histogram.summary: Records 'true' for page loads where the subresource filter matched a subresource loaded by the page. Includes dryrun matches. To compute the percentage of total page loads affected by subresource filtering, divide by the sum of counts for (PageLoad.ParseTiming.NavigationToParseStart + PageLoad.ParseTiming.NavigationToParseStart.Background).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ThirdParty.Frames.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time from navigation start to the first contentful paint of third-party frames on pages. Note that this can be significantly delayed due to lazy loading.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ThirdParty.Frames.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint2
histogram.summary: The time from navigation start to the first contentful paint of third-party (third party in respect to eTLD+1) frames on pages. Note that this can be significantly delayed due to lazy loading.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ThirdParty.Origins.CookieRead
histogram.summary: The number of third party origins on a page that read cookies either via resource request headers or document.cookie.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ThirdParty.Origins.CookieWrite
histogram.summary: The number of third party origins on a page that changed cookies either via resource response headers or document.cookie.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ThirdParty.Origins.LocalStorageAccess
histogram.summary: The number of third party origins on a page that access local storage via window.localStorage.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ThirdParty.Origins.Read
histogram.summary: The number of third party origins on a page that read cookies either via resource request headers or document.cookie.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ThirdParty.Origins.SessionStorageAccess
histogram.summary: The number of third party origins on a page that access session storage via window.sessionStorage.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Clients.ThirdParty.Origins.Write
histogram.summary: The number of third party origins on a page that changed cookies either via resource response headers or document.cookie.

histogram.name: PageLoad.CSSTiming.Parse.BeforeFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time spent parsing author style sheets before the first contentful paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.CSSTiming.ParseAndUpdate.BeforeFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The sum of CSSTiming.Update and CSSTiming.Parse variants for this page load.

histogram.name: PageLoad.CSSTiming.Update.BeforeFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time spent in Document::updateStyle before the first contentful paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.DocumentTiming.NavigationToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first layout is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.EventCounts
histogram.summary: Captures counts of various page load events. These are enumerated in the enum page_load_metrics::PageLoadEvent, and include events like 'page load aborted before first layout'

histogram.name: PageLoad.Events.Committed
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToCommit and PageLoad.AbortTiming.
histogram.summary: Captures counts of load events post-commit, on relevant page loads (i.e. http/https, not same-page, not an error page). These events include aborts before first layout and successful first layouts. Note that the event 'Committed load started' when segmented by background/foreground specifies whether the eventually committed load started in the background or foreground, not whether we backgrounded before the actual commit event. This is because we don't have all the data to filter relevant page loads on provisional loads.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Events.InternalError
histogram.summary: Counts of various internal error conditions in the page_load_metrics system.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Events.Provisional
histogram.obsolete: Removed Feb 2016 in favor of PageLoad.AbortTiming and PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFailedProvisionalLoad. Note that the corresponding background enumerations are no longer being tracked in the timing histograms.
histogram.summary: Captures counts of provisional load events. These include aborted, failed, and successful (committed) provisional loads.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.AbortTiming.ClientRedirect
histogram.summary: This metric is still experimental and not yet ready to be relied upon. Measures the time from navigation start to the time the page load was aborted by a client side redirect (Javascript navigation).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Bytes.Cache
histogram.summary: The number of prefiltered (e.g., compressed) response body KiloBytes loaded from the cache via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated. Only recorded for complete resources.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Bytes.Total
histogram.summary: The number of prefiltered (e.g., compressed) response body KiloBytes loaded via the browser process for a page load. Does not include any header or overhead bytes. Recorded when the page load is terminated. Only recorded for complete resources.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Cache.RequestPercent.ParseStop
histogram.summary: The percent of resources loaded from cache for the given page load. Recorded at the end of HTML parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Cache.TotalRequests.ParseStop
histogram.summary: The number of resources a given page finished loading from cache at parse stop.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.CompletedResources.Cache
histogram.summary: The number of completed resources loaded from the cache via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.CompletedResources.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of completed resources loaded via the browser process for a page load. Recorded when the page load is terminated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.LayoutStability.JankScore
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of layout jank (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred on the page (including all subframes) during the session.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.LayoutStability.JankScore.MainFrame
histogram.summary: Measures the amount of layout jank (bit.ly/lsm-explainer) that has occurred in the main frame during the session.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.NavigationToInteractive
histogram.summary: Measures Time to Interactive, a metric based on main thread and network heuristics to approximate the point in time when the page feels interactive to the user. See https://goo.gl/TFw6xz for detailed explanation. This histogram uses First Meaningful Paint as the lower bound for quiescent windows.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PageTiming.FirstPaintToFirstBackground
histogram.summary: Measures the total time the page load was active after first paint, up until being backgrounded, prior to the page load terminating. Recorded only for page loads that started in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PageTiming.FirstPaintToPageEnd
histogram.summary: Measures the total time the page load was active after first paint, for page loads that spend the entire time in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PageTiming.NavigationToFirstBackground
histogram.summary: Measures the total time the page load was active, up until being backgrounded, for page loads that started in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PageTiming.NavigationToPageEnd
histogram.summary: Measures the total time the page load was active, for page loads that spend the entire time in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintSignalStatus
histogram.summary: Whether the user had any interaction on the page (except mouse move) after first paint, and whether the user left the page before network stable or not.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintSignalStatus2
histogram.summary: Whether the user had any interaction on the page (except mouse move) after first paint, and whether the user left the page before network stable or not. Not logged if page load was aborted before first paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintToNetworkStable
histogram.summary:
Measures the time between when the first meaningful paint (http://bit.ly/ttfmp-doc) was computed to have happened, and when we actually logged the metric.
This metric is useful in helping us tweak when FirstMeaningfulPaintDetector should stop observing layout operations.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.ForegroundToFirstMeaningfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from a background tab being switched to the foreground to the time the first meaningful paint is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.LargestContentPaint.AllFrames.ContentType
histogram.summary: Measures whether the largest content paint, whose timestamp is measured by PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaintAllFrames, comes from text or image. This value is recorded whenever PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaintAllFrames is recorded.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.LargestContentPaint.ContentType
histogram.summary: Measures whether the largest content paint, whose timestamp is measured by PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaint, comes from text or image. This value is recorded whenever PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaint is recorded.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the largest content (text or image) is first painted, for main frame documents. Excludes any content painted after user input. The value is recorded at the end of each page load unless there is an abort or user input before text or image paint. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for details.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestContentPaint.AllFrames
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the largest content (text or image) is first painted, for main frame documents. Excludes any content painted after user input. The value is recorded at the end of each page load unless there is an abort or user input before text or image paint. Compared with NavigationToLargestContentPaint, this is the aggregate results from all frames, while NavigationToLargestContentPaint is only for main frame. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for details.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestImagePaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the largest image is first painted after fully loaded, for main frame documents. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for details.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLargestTextPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the largest text is first painted, for main frame documents. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for details.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLastImagePaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the last image is first painted after fully loaded, for main frame documents. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for details.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToLastTextPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the last text is first painted, for main frame documents. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. The value is recorded at the end of each page load. See http://bit.ly/fcp_plus_plus for details.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.ParseDuration.CachedPercent.0-50
histogram.summary: The parse duration of the page load where 0-50% of all subresources (loaded during parsing) were served from the HTTP cache (including 304s).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.ParseDuration.CachedPercent.51-100
histogram.summary: The parse duration of the page load where 51-100% of all subresources (loaded during parsing) were served from the HTTP cache (including 304s).

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Renderer.FirstMeaningfulPaintDetector.FirstMeaningfulPaintOrdering
histogram.summary: Whether the two variants of First Meaningful Paint reported different values, and if so, which one was reported first.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.Renderer.FirstMeaningfulPaintDetector.HadNetworkQuiet
histogram.summary: Recorded when the page load reached network 0-quiet (no active network connection for 0.5 seconds), or network 2-quiet (no more than 2 active network connections for 2 seconds). PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintSignalStatus2 histogram gives the fraction of page loads that had network 2-quiet, so it can be used as a baseline.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.TimeToInteractiveStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether the Time To Interactive metric was reported for the page load, or why it wasn't if not. See https://goo.gl/TFw6xz for definition of Time to Interactive.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Experimental.TotalRequests.ParseStop
histogram.summary: The number of resources a given page finished loading at parse stop.

histogram.name: PageLoad.FrameCounts.AdFrames.PerFrame.CrossOrigin
histogram.summary:
For each identified ad frame, whether the origin of the ad matches the origin of the main frame.
An ad frame consists of the identified ad frame and all of its children (which may also be ads, but are counted as part of the ancestor ad frame). Frames of zero bytes (e.g., never had a document or their document was doc.written and no sub-resources were loaded) are not counted.

histogram.name: PageLoad.FrameCounts.AdFrames.PerFrame.SizeIntervention
histogram.summary: Whether or not the ad frame would have triggered the Adframe size intervention. This is determined by checking if a frame does not have a user gesture when its size exceeds 1050 kilobytes. Only recorded for ad frames with non-zero total bytes. Recorded for each frame when the page is destroyed or navigated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.FrameCounts.AdFrames.PerFrame.SizeIntervention.MediaStatus
histogram.summary: Whether or not the ad frame that would have triggered the Adframe size intervention had media playing at any point in its lifetime. An adframe will trigger the intervention if it does not have a user gesture when its size exceeds 1050 kilobytes. Recorded for each offending frame when the page is destroyed or navigated.

histogram.name: PageLoad.FrameCounts.AdFrames.PerFrame.SmallestDimension
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020. Available in UKM via AdFrameLoad.Visibility.FrameHeight and AdFrameLoad.Visibility.FrameWidth.
histogram.summary: The smallest dimension of a root ad frame in pixels. Only recorded for ad frames with non-zero total bytes. Recorded when the page is destroyed or navigated. Display none iframes will not always update their size because they lack a content view. This uses the last size of frame before it was set to display: none.

histogram.name: PageLoad.FrameCounts.AdFrames.PerFrame.SqrtNumberOfPixels
histogram.summary: The square root of the area of a root adframe in pixels. Only recorded for ad frames with non-zero total bytes. Recorded when the page is destroyed or navigated. Display none iframes will not always update their size because they lack a content view. This uses the last size of frame before it was set to display: none.

histogram.name: PageLoad.FrameCounts.AnyParentFrame.AdFrames
histogram.summary:
The number of frames on the page that have loaded more than 0 bytes of content.
For pages with zero ad frames, the other PageLoad.Clients.Ads metrics are not recorded unless otherwise specified.
Child frames of an ad frame are not included in the count.

histogram.name: PageLoad.HeavyAds.ComputedType
histogram.summary: Records heavy ad type for each ad frame, as determined by the first threshold hit (see FrameData::HeavyadStatus). This is recorded regardless of feature flag or other conditions that prevent the heavy ad intervention from occuring. Recored for all ad frames with non-zero bytes. Recorded when the ad frame destroyed or when the page is destroyed.

histogram.name: PageLoad.HeavyAds.InterventionType
histogram.summary: Records the type of heavy ad unloaded by the heavy ad intervention. Heavy ad type is determined by the first threshold hit. This is not recorded for ad frames that are considered heavy but did not fufill other criteria for the intervention. This includes the feature being enabled and being below the per-origin intervention cap.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed on January 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay2 which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
histogram.summary:
Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.
Do not modify this metric in any way without contacting speed-metrics-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay.SkipFilteringComparison
histogram.obsolete: Removed January 2020 as the SkipTouchFilter experiment is completed.
histogram.summary:
This metric will be used to compare first inputs during the SkipTouchEventFilter experiment.
Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. Recorded on first page interaction. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay2
histogram.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
histogram.summary:
Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. Recorded on first page interaction. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. Excludes scrolls.
Do not modify this metric in any way without contacting speed-metrics-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay3
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay4 which includes input events which were filtered previously.
histogram.summary:
Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. Recorded on first page interaction. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. Excludes scrolls.
Do not modify this metric in any way without contacting speed-metrics-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp
histogram.obsolete: Removed on January 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp2 which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
histogram.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp.SkipFilteringComparison
histogram.obsolete: Removed January 2020 as the SkipTouchFilter experiment is completed.
histogram.summary:
This metric will be used to compare first inputs during the SkipTouchEventFilter experiment.
The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. Recorded on first page interaction. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp2
histogram.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
histogram.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. Recorded on first page interaction. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp3
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp4 which includes input events which were filtered previously.
histogram.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. Recorded on first page interaction. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.InputDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed on January 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.InputDelay2 which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
histogram.summary:
The duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for a meaningful input. In ms.
Do not modify this metric in any way without contacting speed-metrics-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.InputDelay2
histogram.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.InputDelay3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
histogram.summary:
The duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for a meaningful input. Excludes scrolls.
Do not modify this metric in any way without contacting speed-metrics-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.InputTimestamp
histogram.obsolete: Removed on January 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.InputTimestamp2 which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
histogram.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of a meaningful input. In ms.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.InputTimestamp2
histogram.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.InputTimestamp3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
histogram.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of a meaningful input. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed on January 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay2 which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
histogram.summary: Measures longest Input Delay, the longest duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input per navigation. In ms.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay2
histogram.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
histogram.summary: Measures longest Input Delay, the longest duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input per navigation. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputDelay3
histogram.obsolete: Removed in October 2019 in favor of LongestInputDelay4, which updates naming to be consistent with LongestInput UKM.
histogram.summary: Measures longest Input Delay, the longest duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the meaningful input per navigation. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp
histogram.obsolete: Removed on January 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp2 which correctly excludes some scrolling cases that were previously not excluded from this metric.
histogram.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the meaningful input with longest queuing delay per navigation. In ms.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp2
histogram.obsolete: Removed on February 2019 in favor of PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp3 which brings the metric more in line with the EventTiming API.
histogram.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the meaningful input with longest queuing delay per navigation. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.InteractiveTiming.LongestInputTimestamp3
histogram.obsolete: Removed in October 2019 in favor of LongestInputTimestamp4, which updates naming to be consistend with LongestInput UKMs.
histogram.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the meaningful input with longest queuing delay per navigation. Excludes scrolls.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.ClientRedirectDelayAfterPaint
histogram.summary: The delay between first paint and a client-side redirection. This metric is only intended to help in choosing a heuristic delay to distinguish between client-side redirects and other client initiated navigations, and will be deprecated in M54. Please contact bmcquade@chromium.org before using this metric.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.CommitToComplete.NoTimingIPCs
histogram.summary: The delay between commit and completion, for page loads that did not receive any timing IPCs. This metric is only intended to help understand the cases where committed page loads don't receive timing IPCs. Please contact bmcquade@chromium.org before using this metric.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.InteractiveToInteractiveDetection
histogram.summary: Measures time delta between Time to Interactive and when we can detect TTI. TTI cannot be detected in real time - we have to wait sufficiently long to determine main thread and network quiescence. See https://goo.gl/TFw6xz for detailed explanation of Time to Interactive. This histogram uses First Meaningful Paint as the lower bound for quiescent windows.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.PaintTiming.HadUserInputBeforeFirstMeaningfulPaint
histogram.summary: Whether the user had any interaction on the page before FirstMeaningfulPaint. Recorded when the page load reaches network idle.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.Renderer.FirstMeaningfulPaintDetector.FirstMeaningfulPaintOrdering
histogram.summary: Whether the two variants of First Meaningful Paint reported different values, and if so, which one was reported first.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.Renderer.FirstMeaningfulPaintDetector.HadNetworkQuiet
histogram.summary: Recorded when the page load reached network 0-quiet (no active network connection for 0.5 seconds), or network 2-quiet (no more than 2 active network connections for 2 seconds). PageLoad.Experimental.PaintTiming.FirstMeaningfulPaintSignalStatus2 histogram gives the fraction of page loads that had network 2-quiet, so it can be used as a baseline.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Internal.Renderer.PaintTiming.SwapTimeDelta
histogram.obsolete: deprecated May 2018: The swap-timestamp comes from a different process, and comparing that with the paint-time (which is from the local process) does not produce a reliable metric.
histogram.summary: Records the delta between the renderer timestamp and swap timestamp for first paint, first contentful paint, first meaningful paint, first text paint, and first image paint. The renderer timestamp is recorded on the Paint path, while the swap timestamp is the result of a CC SwapPromise (queued on the Paint path) either being successfully fulfilled, or broken in cases where the swap did not occur. As we switch to using the swap timestamps in place of their renderer counterparts, this metric allows us to see the discrepancies between the two timestamps.

histogram.name: PageLoad.LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore.AfterBackForwardCache
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2020 due to misspelling. Use PageLoad.LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore.AfterBackForwardCacheRestore instead.
histogram.summary: Measures the cumulative layout shift score (bit.ly/3fQz29y) that has occurred on the page (including all subframes) after the page is restored from the back-forward cache. Recorded when the user navigates away or closes the page after the page was restored from back-forward cache.

histogram.name: PageLoad.LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore.MainFrame.AfterBackForwardCache
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2020 due to misspelling. Use PageLoad.LayoutInstability.CumulativeShiftScore.MainFrame.AfterBackForwardCacheRestore instead.
histogram.summary: Measures the cumulative layout shift score (bit.ly/3fQz29y) that has occurred in the main frame after the page is restored from the back-forward cache. Recorded when the user navigates away or closes the page after the page was restored from back-forward cache.

histogram.name: PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstTextPaint
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued Nov 2018 because data is no longer being used.
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first non-blank text is painted, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing.NavigationToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing.NavigationToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first layout is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing.NavigationToLoadEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the load event is fired, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.DOMLoadingToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when DOM loading occurs (the time that HTML parsing begins) to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents. This is equivalent to the time that the HTML document resource was being parsed.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.DOMLoadingToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when DOM loading occurs (the time that HTML parsing begins) to first "contentful" paint.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ForegroundToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from a background tab being switched to the foreground to the time the first paint is performed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToCommit
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the navigation committed, for main frame documents.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.DocumentTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFailedProvisionalLoad
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the provisional load failed. Only measures provisional loads that failed in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstBackground
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the user first backgrounds the tab. Only measures navigations that started in the foreground.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: The time from navigation start to first "contentful" paint. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstForeground
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the user first foregrounds an initially backgrounded tab. Only measures navigations that started in the background.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstImagePaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first image is painted, for main frame documents. For images that render progressively, this is recorded as soon as any image pixels have been drawn. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first layout is performed, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.DocumentTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first paint is performed, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToFirstTextPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first non-blank text is painted, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.NavigationToLoadEventFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the load event is fired, for main frame documents. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.DocumentTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoad
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts, for main frame documents that started parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoad.ParseComplete
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts, for main frame documents that finished parsing. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.ParseTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoadFromDocumentWrite
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that started parsing.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoadFromDocumentWrite.ParseComplete
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that finished parsing. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.ParseTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the time that the HTML parser was active, for main frame documents that finished parsing. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.ParseTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageLoad.Timing2.ParseStartToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when the HTML parser started, to when the page first paints content. This metric is being phased out in favor of the PageLoad.PaintTiming equivalent and will be deprecated in M54.

histogram.name: PageSerialization.MhtmlGeneration.PopupOverlaySkipped
histogram.summary: Recorded when the popup overlays are removed from MHTML serialization.

histogram.name: PaintHolding.CommitTrigger
histogram.summary: Records the reason that a commit was triggered, to enable research into which event (non-same-origin, FCP, timeout, etc) led to the first commit.

histogram.name: PaintHolding.InputTiming
histogram.summary: Records whether or not input arrived before the first commit.

histogram.name: Parser.AppendBytesDelay
histogram.summary: The delay from when bytes are received on the main thread to when the BackgroundHTMLParser starts tokenizing them. Always a shorter time than the time emitted to Parser.PreloadTokenizeDelay.

histogram.name: Parser.ChunkEnqueueTime
histogram.summary: The time it takes to enqueue a ParsedChunk onto the shared parser queue.

histogram.name: Parser.DiscardedTokenCount
histogram.summary: The number of speculative tokens discarded by the parser when a rewind is needed.

histogram.name: Parser.PeakPendingChunkCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of pending Chunks in the ParsedChunkQueue after the parser is detached.

histogram.name: Parser.PeakPendingTokenCount
histogram.summary: The maximum number of pending tokens in the ParsedChunkQueue after the parser is detached.

histogram.name: Parser.PreloadTokenizeDelay
histogram.summary: The delay from when bytes are received on the main thread to when they are tokenized and preloads are sent back to the main parser. Always a greater time than the time emitted to Parser.AppendBytesDelay.

histogram.name: PartitionAlloc.CommittedSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2019. Use Memory.Renderer.* and Memory.Experimental.Renderer2.* instead.
histogram.summary: The committed memory size in PartitionAlloc. The value is reported when we see the highest memory usage we've ever seen in the renderer process.

histogram.name: PartnerBookmark.Count
histogram.summary: The number of partner bookmark entries. Note that zero would be under-represented because reading is throttled if the last result is zero. Logged when using the bookmark, not skipped (PartnerBookmark.Skipped == False), and at most once per cold start. Note that the distribution is weighted by bookmark usage.

histogram.name: PartnerBookmark.Null
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of Apr 2018
histogram.summary: Whether there's no partner bookmark provider. By default, the system image contains a dummy partner bookmarks provider that provides zero entries. Logged when using the bookmark, not skipped (PartnerBookmark.Skipped == False), and at most once per cold start.

histogram.name: PartnerBookmark.Skipped
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of Apr 2018
histogram.summary: Whether reading of partner bookmark is skipped. Logged when using the bookmark, and at most once per cold start.

histogram.name: PartnerBookmark.TimeSinceLastEmptyRead
histogram.summary: When trying to load the partner bookmarks, if no partner bookmark is read last time, record the time elapsed since then. It is recorded no matter whether loading would be skipped.

histogram.name: PartnerBookmark.TimeSinceLastEmptyRead2
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of Apr 2018
histogram.summary: When trying to load the partner bookmarks, if no partner bookmark is read last time, record the time elapsed since then. It is recorded no matter whether loading would be skipped.

histogram.name: PartnerBookmarksFaviconThrottle.NumEntries
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-07. See crbug.com/975263 for wrap-up analysis.
histogram.summary: Number of elements read from the partner bookmarks favicon cache, recorded once per cold start when reading partner bookmarks. Only recorded on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.PresaveConflict
histogram.summary: Records whether there is a username conflict with existing credentials when the user clicks 'Generate Password'.

histogram.name: PasswordGeneration.UserEvent
histogram.summary: Records user-triggered events related to a generated password. Each event is logged at most once per lifetime of the generated password.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AboutBlankPasswordSubmission
histogram.summary: Records attempts to submit a password on a form in an about:blank frame, indicating whether this attempt is for a main frame or subframe. Recorded once per form submission.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialog
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 56. See the histograms for one and more accounts.
histogram.summary: The dismissal reason of the account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogAccounts
histogram.summary: The number of accounts displayed in the account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogEmptyAvatars
histogram.summary: The count of the placeholder avatars shown in the account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountChooserDialogUsability
histogram.summary: Whether the account chooser includes an empty username or any duplicates

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountsPerSite
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M79 in favor of PasswordManager.AccountsPerSiteHiRes.
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored per site in the password manager (one event per site)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AccountsReusingPassword
histogram.summary:
Records, for each account, the number of other accounts (across all sites and usernames) that reuse the same password. Only non-blacklisted, HTML-form-based accounts are considered.
For each account, samples will only be recorded into the histograms that have the first suffix corresponding to whether that account was saved on a secure website or not. The second suffix is used to further categorize the other accounts that reuse the same password based on how they relate to the account in question, and whether they are secure. The number of other accounts in each category will be reported into histogram with the respective second suffixes.
Metrics are collected once per browser start-up. In case of multiple profiles, the counts are for the profile for which a WebContents is first created.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTaken
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Chrome 32. See PasswordManagerActionsTakenWithPsl
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTakenOnNonSecureForm
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password on a non-secure page, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTakenV3
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ActionsTakenWithPsl
histogram.summary: Stats documenting how we handle every form containing a password, bucketed by the actions taken.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationDummyData.RequestResultCount
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of May 2015.
histogram.summary: The number of facets affiliated with a dummy Web facet, according to the affiliation information retrieved from the cache. Recorded for each dummy Web facet, once shortly after start-up, and then periodically every hour; but only if getting affiliations succeeded for the Web facet.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AffiliationDummyData.RequestSuccess
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of May 2015.
histogram.summary: Whether or not affiliations of a dummy Web facet could be successfully retrieved from the cache. Recorded for each dummy Web facet, once shortly after start-up, and then periodically every hour.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AllowToCollectURLBubble.UIDismissalReason
histogram.obsolete: The bubble isn't shown anymore. Become obsolete in Feb. 2015.
histogram.summary: Why was "Allow to collect URL?" bubble closed?

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Android.ExportPasswordsProgressBarUsage
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of June 2019.
histogram.summary: Records what happened to the progress bar during exporting passwords when its dismissal was requested.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Android.PasswordSearchTriggered
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of June 2019.
histogram.summary: Records whether a user triggered the search function while visiting the password preferences page on Android.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.AutocompletePopupSuppressedByGeneration
histogram.summary: If the password manager UI was suppressed because generation UI was already being displayed for the same field.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BlacklistedDuplicates
histogram.obsolete: Corresponding clean-up logic got introduced in M70 and has run its course.
histogram.summary: The number of duplicates forms from the password store. Recorded once for the profile on startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BlacklistedSites
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M76 in favor of PasswordManager.BlacklistedSitesHiRes.
histogram.summary: The total number of sites that the user has blacklisted in the password manager's profile-scoped store. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per run of Chrome.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BlacklistedSites.NeedNormalization
histogram.obsolete: Corresponding clean-up logic got introduced in M76 and has run its course.
histogram.summary: Records once on startup whether the blacklisted sites in the password store need to be normalized.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BlacklistedSites.NeedRemoveBlacklistDuplicates
histogram.obsolete: Corresponding clean-up logic got introduced in M70 and has run its course.
histogram.summary: Records once on startup whether the blacklisted sites in the password store need to be cleared of duplications.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BlacklistedSites.NeedToBeCleaned
histogram.summary: Records once on startup whether the blacklisted sites in the password store need to be updated to remove username/password. Can be removed around Chrome M69 (https://crbug.com/817754).

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BlacklistedSites.PreventedAddingDuplicates
histogram.summary: Boolean indicating whether adding a blacklist entry was prevented due to an already existing entry. Recorded after every blacklist site submission.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BubbleSuppression.AccountsWithSuppressedBubble
histogram.summary: The number of accounts that do not trigger password save prompts anymore. The count is recorded once per browser start-up. (In case of multiple profiles, the counts are for the profile that first has a WebContents created.)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.BubbleSuppression.DomainsWithSuppressedBubble
histogram.summary: The number of domains for which at least one account exists that does not trigger password save prompts anymore. The count is recorded once per browser start-up. (In case of multiple profiles, the counts are for the profile that first has a WebContents created.)

histogram.name: PasswordManager.DeleteCorruptedPasswordsResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of removing passwords that cannot be decrypted when retrieving passwords from LoginDatabase. Called for Mac users for each profile.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.FormWithoutUsernameFieldIsPasswordChangeForm
histogram.summary: When parsing a password form, and no username field is detected, whether this was a password change form.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.OfferedToSave
histogram.summary: When offering to save a password, whether the username is empty.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.ParsedUsernameField
histogram.summary: When parsing a password form, whether a username field is detected.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.PasswordFieldCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 09/2018. The investigation this metric was supporting has been concluded in 2016.
histogram.summary: The number of password fields for password forms that do not have a username field. This is recorded every time such a password form is successfully parsed. Note that the parsing is attempted when the form is encountered (i.e when the document is loaded) and also when it is submitted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.TextAndPasswordFieldCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 09/2018. The investigation this metric was supporting has been concluded in 2016.
histogram.summary: The total number of text and password fields for password forms that do not have a username field. This is recorded every time such a password form is successfully parsed. Note that the parsing is attempted when the form is encountered (i.e when the document is loaded) and also when it is submitted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.EmptyUsernames.WithoutCorrespondingNonempty
histogram.summary: Number of password forms with empty username in the Login Database for which there is not another password form from the same realm with a nonempty username. In other words, number of password forms with empty username which we do not suspect to be reauthentication forms.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ExportedPasswordsPerUserInCSV
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2019/07. Password exporting has been rolled out.
histogram.summary: The number of passwords exported in CSV format per user.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ExportPasswordsToCSVResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2019/07. Password exporting has been rolled out.
histogram.summary: The success or error type of exporting passwords into CSV.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.GetMediated
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 05/2017. This metric has been replaced by PasswordManager.MediationOptional.
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with unmediated=false. That is the result of account chooser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.GetUnmediated
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 05/2017. This metric has been replaced by PasswordManager.MediationSilent.
histogram.summary: Tracks result of navigator.credentials.get() with unmediated=true. That is the result of auto sign-in.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.HttpCredentialsWithConflictingHttpsCredential
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of M72. Superseded by PasswordManager.HttpCredentials.
histogram.summary: Number of HTTP credentials, with HSTS enabled as given in the histogram suffix, for which a conflicting (i.e.same host and username, but different password) HTTPS credential exists. Recorded once for the profile on startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.HttpCredentialsWithEquivalentHttpsCredential
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of M72. Superseded by PasswordManager.HttpCredentials.
histogram.summary: Number of HTTP credentials, with HSTS enabled as given in the histogram suffix, for which an equivalent (i.e. same host, username and password) HTTPS credential exists. Recorded once for the profile on startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.HttpCredentialsWithoutMatchingHttpsCredential
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of M72. Superseded by PasswordManager.HttpCredentials.
histogram.summary: Number of HTTP credential, with HSTS enabled as given in the histogram suffix, for which no HTTPS credential for the same username exists. Recorded once for the profile on startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.IE7LookupResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2018. This metric was deleted at https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1131495.
histogram.summary: The result of importing passwords stored in IE7 into Chrome's password store.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.InfoBarResponse
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 03/2016. This metric has been replaced by PasswordManager.UIDismissalReason.
histogram.summary: The distribution of responses to the "Do you want Chrome to remember this password"? info bar prompt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.InvalidtHttpsCredentialsNeedToBeCleared
histogram.obsolete: Corresponding clean-up logic got introduced in M71 and has run its course.
histogram.summary: Records once on startup whether forms with wrong signon_realm created by HTTP to HTTPS migration need to be removed. See https://crbug.com/881731 for more details.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KeychainMigration.NumChromeOwnedInaccessiblePasswords
histogram.summary: After migration from the Mac Keychain fails, records the number of passwords in the Keychain owned by Chrome but not accessible by it.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KeychainMigration.NumFailedPasswords
histogram.summary: After migration from the Mac Keychain fails, records the number of passwords in the Chrome Password Manager database for which the corresponding values in the Keychain are not accessible by Chrome.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KeychainMigration.NumPasswordsOnFailure
histogram.summary: After migration from the Mac Keychain fails, records the number of passwords in the Chrome Password Manager database to be migrated. As there is no partial migration, it's the total number of passwords in the DB.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KeychainMigration.Status
histogram.summary: The status of passwords migration from the Keychain. It's recorded shortly after startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.KWalletDeserializationStatus
histogram.summary: The success or failure of deserializing PasswordForms in KWallet. Failure either indicates corrupted data or the presense of bugs in the deserialization code.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LinuxBackendMigration.Adoption
histogram.summary: Whether the password store has been migrated to an encrypted login database. This is recorded on startup, before any migration attempts.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LinuxBackendMigration.AttemptResult
histogram.summary: Whether the password store has been migrated to an encrypted login database. This is recorded at the end of a migration attempt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LinuxBackendMigration.TimeIntoEncrypted
histogram.summary: The time it took to read credentials from the native backend and write them into the encrypted login database. This is logged once per migration (normally once per client), at the end of copying into the database. The migration is triggered on the first operation to the password store.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LinuxBackendMigration.TimeIntoNative
histogram.summary: The time it took to read credentials from the unencrypted login database and insert them into the native backend. This is logged once per migration (normally once per client), at the end of copying into the backend. The migration is triggered on the first operation to the password store.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LinuxBackendStatistics
histogram.summary: Information about usage of password storage backends on Linux. It also includes whether a command line flag for a specific backend is given.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.LoginDatabaseFailedVersion
histogram.summary: The version of LoginDatabase if the migration to a new one failed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.MultiAccountPasswordUpdateAction
histogram.summary: A user action when a password update bubble with multiple accounts is shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumFormsExtractedIOS
histogram.summary: Records the number of password forms extracted by PasswordFormHelper at the moment of submission. This metric is needed to check the assumption that received and parsed message contains only one form at a a time.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsDeletedByBulkDelete
histogram.summary: Number of passwords deleted when the user chooses to clear passwords via the clear browsing data UI.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsDeletedDuringRollback
histogram.summary: Number of passwords deleted when browsing data is cleared during rollback.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.NumPasswordsDeletedWhenBlacklisting
histogram.summary: When the user chooses to never remember passwords for a form, we remove all previously saved credentials for that form. This is the count of those credentials.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Onboarding.ResultOfSavingFlow
histogram.summary: Result of the combined saving flow consisting of the potentially shown onboarding dialog and the save infobar. Recorded when the user is prompted to save their password.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Onboarding.ResultOfSavingFlowAfterOnboarding
histogram.summary: Result of the combined saving flow consisting of the shown onboarding dialog and the save infobar. Recorded when the user is propmpted to save their password only if the onboarding was actually shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Onboarding.State
histogram.summary: The current state of showing the password manager onboarding to the user. Recorded on startup.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.Onboarding.UIDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Reason of dismissal of the password manager onboarding dialog. Recorded when the user is propmpted to save their password and the dialog is shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordReuse.MainFrameMatchCsdWhitelist
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of May 17 2017. Replaced by PasswordProtection.RequestOutcome.ProtectedPasswordEntry.
histogram.summary:
A password reuse is an event when the user typed a string that is equal to a saved password on another domain, and this saved password is called reused password.
This metric shows whether a password reuse happens on a page whose main frame url matches CSD whitelist.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PasswordUpdatedWithManualFallback
histogram.summary: Measures whether users update passwords with automatic prompt or manual fallback.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PresavedUpdateUIDismissalReason
histogram.summary: Why was the update password UI closed when a generated password caused a conflict?

histogram.name: PasswordManager.PslDomainMatchTriggering
histogram.summary: Breakdown on trigger rate of providing a password form autofill entry based on matching stored information using the public suffix list (PSL) for possible matches. In addition, this metric also counts cases where a existing federated entry was successfully matched via PSL. For example, this includes cases where an existing federated credential for https://example.com was used for https://subdomain.example.com.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.QueryingSuppressedAccountsFinished
histogram.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether the PasswordStore responded quickly enough so that PasswordManager.SuppressedAccount histogram samples could be computed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.RemovedCorruptedPasswords
histogram.summary: Collects positive number of inaccessible passwords that were successfully deleted when retrieving them from the database. Recorded for Mac users.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptDisappearedQuickly
