histogram.summary: Indicates whether the save password prompt disappeared in less than one second. This most likely indicates that the prompt was dismissed automatically, e.g. due to a page navigation, before the user was able to respond to the infobar.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptDisplayed
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the save password prompt was displayed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SavePasswordPromptResponse
histogram.summary: Breakdown of which response the user selected from the save password prompt.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SendPasswordFormToBrowserProcess
histogram.summary: Measures sending/not sending password forms to the browser process by PasswordAutofillAgent::SendPasswordForms.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SettingsReconciliation.InitialAndFinalValues
histogram.summary: Tracks the pair of initial values and pair of final values for the legacy preference for controlling the Chrome Password Manager and the new preference for controlling Smart Lock on Android. A single sample is recorded after sync has merged last snapshot and finished initialization for sync users, and on profile initialization for non-sync users.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SettingsReconciliation.InitialValues
histogram.summary: Tracks the pair of initial values for both for the legacy preference for controlling the Chrome Password Manager and new preference for controlling Smart Lock on Android. Sample is recorded on every profile initialization before reconciliation logic is taken place, e.g. when user logs in to browser, on a startup of a browser.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShouldBlockPasswordForSameOriginButDifferentScheme
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of M78. PasswordManager.ProvisionalSaveFailure contains strictly more information.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded every time Chrome detects a password form submission. The credential might be proposed to be saved, or it might be blocked. It is blocked if the previously detected password form submission was successful, and the current submission is from a URL with the same origin, but a different and insecure scheme. That is, if the previously provisionally saved credential is for https://example.com, a new credential for http://example.com would be blocked. More details can be found in the doc associated with http://crbug.com/571580.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShouldShowAutoSignInFirstRunExperience
histogram.summary: Records if the user still has to click through the first run experience to benefit from auto sign-in behavior. Recorded on every start-up.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShouldShowPromptComparison
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2018 because the decision this should have helped with is now moot. See https://crbug.com/871509#c3.
histogram.summary: Records results of the new and the old algorithm for detecting whether to show a password prompt to the user. Recorded on each password form successful submission.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShowAllSavedPasswordsAcceptedContext
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Show all saved passwords" fallback is accepted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShowAllSavedPasswordsShownContext
histogram.summary: Recorded when the "Show all saved passwords" fallback is shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.ShowedFormNotSecureWarningOnCurrentNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2018 because the feature never launched.
histogram.summary: Recorded (at most once per main-frame navigation) when a password form shows a warning that the form is not secure.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromo
histogram.summary: User action on the Chrome Sync promo that appears in the password bubble. The promo offers to sign in to Chrome.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromoCountTilClick
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 12/16/16. New statistic is PasswordManager.SignInPromoCountTil*.
histogram.summary: The number of times the Sign In promo in the password bubble was shown before user clicked on it.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromoCountTilNoThanks
histogram.summary: The number of times the Sign In promo in the password bubble was shown before user clicked on "No thanks".

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromoCountTilSignIn
histogram.summary: The number of times the Sign In promo in the password bubble was shown before user clicked on "Sign in".

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SignInPromoDismissalCount
histogram.summary: The number of times the Sign In promo in the password bubble was implcitly dismissed. Recorded each time the promo is implicitly dismissed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StorePasswordImportedFromCSVResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 14 September 2017, due to being no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Whether password manager stored passwords imported from CSV file successfully.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StorePerformance.AddLogin
histogram.summary: The time (ms) it takes for the synchronous part of the AddLogin on the PasswordStore to complete.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StorePerformance.GetLogin
histogram.summary: The time (ms) it takes for the synchronous part of the GetLogin on the PasswordStore to complete.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StorePerformance.GetLogins
histogram.summary: The time (ms) it takes for the synchronous part of the GetLogins on the PasswordStore to complete.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StorePerformance.RemoveLogin
histogram.summary: The time (ms) it takes for the synchronous part of the RemoveLogin on the PasswordStore to complete.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StorePerformance.UpdateLogin
histogram.summary: The time (ms) it takes for the synchronous part of the UpdateLogin on the PasswordStore to complete.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.StoreReadyWhenWiping
histogram.obsolete: Removed since August 28, 2018, due to removing the corresponding feature.
histogram.summary: When the user logs in with their sync credential, PasswordManager checks if there are any outdated copies of it in the password store, in order to purge them. This histogram records whether password store data are ready during this check.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SubmitNavigatesToDifferentDomain
histogram.summary: Indicates whether submitting a password login form changes the registry controlled domain of the main frame.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SuggestionClicked
histogram.summary: The type of password suggestion on iOS displayed in the keyboard accessory. Recorded for each tap on the suggestion.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SuggestionShown
histogram.summary: The type of password suggestions on iOS displayed in the keyboard accessory. Recorded each time the password suggestion is shown.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SuppressedAccount
histogram.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled because they were for an origin that was similar to, but not exactly (or PSL) matching the origin of the observed form (see the suffix description for the possible classes of such near-matches). If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.SyncCredentialFiltered
histogram.obsolete: Password manager no longer supports this behavior and the code that could generate values in this histogram is gone as of M74.
histogram.summary: This histogram is reported for those forms on accounts.google.com, on which Chrome is forced by Finch/flags during autofilling to remove sync credentials from password store results. It reports true if sync credentials were indeed removed from the store results, and false if there were no sync credentials in the results to begin with.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TimeReadingExportedPasswords
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2019/07. Password exporting has been rolled out.
histogram.summary: The time it takes to fetch and serialise the passwords for export.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TimesGeneratedPasswordUsed
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/11/14. New statistic is PasswordManager.TimesPasswordUsed.AutoGenerated.
histogram.summary: The number of times each generated password has been used to log in. Recorded by iterating over stored passwords once per run. This information is persisted and synced.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.TotalAccounts
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M76 in favor of PasswordManager.TotalAccountsHiRes.ByType.
histogram.summary: The number of accounts stored in the password manager (across all sites), split by whether created by the user or generated by Chrome, and further by whether the user used sync with custom passphrase or not.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UpdatePasswordSubmissionEvent
histogram.summary: The password submission event happened when the user changes their password on a website, say foo.com or types new password on a sign-in form for saved credential (which might mean that the password was changed in a different browser). The later case called password overriding. This histogram measures whether the user has any passwords saved in the Chrome password manager for foo.com or the password was overriden on sign-in form, and what action the user performed on the offered bubble. It's recorded when the bubble is closed.

histogram.name: PasswordManager.UserStoredPasswordWithInvalidSSLCert
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2016 because this information is no longer stored in PasswordForm. See also http://crbug.com/413020.
histogram.summary: Whether saved password for HTTPS site had a valid SSL cert when the password was saved.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.CacheVerdictDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed since caching is not the root cause of time out issue.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for PasswordProtectionService to cache a verdict.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.ChromeSettingsAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed since 03/2020 due to no usage.
histogram.summary: Records how a user interacts with the chrome://settings page that displays the password protection warning. Logged when the page is shown and when the user chooses to change their password on the page.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.DomFeatureParsing
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78. The DOM features always parsed successfully, so this histogram wasn't useful.
histogram.summary: Records whether the DOM features were parsed successfully when returned from the renderer. This is logged on every PhishGuard ping.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.GetCachedVerdictDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed since caching is not the root cause of time out issue.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for PasswordProtectionService to get a cached verdict.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.InterstitialActionByUserNavigation
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-01 due to lack of usage. https://crbug.com/915894
histogram.summary: When user manually navigates to chrome://reset-password page, records how this user interacts with this page. Logged when the interstitial is shown and when the user chooses to change their password.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.NumberOfCachedVerdictBeforeShutdown
histogram.obsolete: Removed since 07/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: Number of password protection verdicts stored in content settings of a profile before this profile is destructed.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.NumberOfVerdictsMigratedDuringInitialization
histogram.summary: We start changing the way of caching password protection verdicts in M69. This histogram counts the number of verdicts migrated to the new way during initialization of PasswordProtectionService. It helps determine when we can remove migration code.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.PasswordReuseEventVerdict
histogram.summary: Verdict types returned by Safe Browsing server for password reuse events.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.ReferrerChainSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed September 18 2018. This wasn't being used, and can be recreated on the backend if needed.
histogram.summary: The referrer chain size of a password protection request. This is recorded when Chrome receives a verdict for this request.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.UnfamiliarLoginPageVerdict
histogram.summary: Verdict types returned by Safe Browsing server for unfamiliar login pages.

histogram.name: PasswordProtection.UserClickedThroughSafeBrowsingInterstitial
histogram.obsolete: Removed since 07/2018 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: Whether the user has clicked through the Safe Browsing interstitial before the password protection ping is triggered on the same page. Logged right before password protection ping is sent.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.NotUsed.WithShowEffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when CanMakePayment was not called by the merchant.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.Usage
histogram.summary: Whether the merchant used the CanMakePayment method during a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.Used.EffectOnShow
histogram.summary: The effect of the CanMakePayment return value on whether Show was called.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.Used.FalseWithShowEffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when CanMakePayment was called by the merchant and returned false.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CanMakePayment.Used.TrueWithShowEffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when CanMakePayment was called by the merchant and returned true.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.Completed
histogram.summary: When the merchant has processed the user's Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.Initiated
histogram.summary: When a Payment Request gets initiated by the user.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.PayClicked
histogram.summary: When the user clicks the "pay" button in the Payment Request UI.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.ReceivedInstrumentDetails
histogram.summary: When the browser retrieves the instrument details from the payment app to complete a purchase.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.Shown
histogram.summary: When the Payment Request UI gets shown after initialization.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.CheckoutFunnel.SkippedShow
histogram.summary: When the Payment Request UI gets skipped to go directly to the payment app.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.NumberOfSelectionAdds
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020. Made decision in issue 1128111 to remove unused payment sheet histograms.
histogram.summary: The number of times the user added an entry during a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.NumberOfSelectionChanges
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020. Made decision in issue 1128111 to remove unused payment sheet histograms.
histogram.summary: The number of times the user changed an entry during a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.NumberOfSelectionEdits
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020. Made decision in issue 1128111 to remove unused payment sheet histograms.
histogram.summary: The number of times the user edited an entry during a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.RequestedInformation
histogram.summary: Tracks what user information is required by merchants to complete a Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.SelectedPaymentMethod
histogram.summary: Tracks what payment method was used to complete a transaction in Payment Request.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.UserDidNotHaveCompleteSuggestionsForEverything.EffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when the user did not have a complete suggestion offered for each requested information.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.UserDidNotHaveInitialFormOfPayment.EffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when the user did not have a a form of payment on file when the Payment Request was shown.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.UserDidNotHaveSuggestionsForEverything.EffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when the user did not have suggestions offered for each requested information.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.UserHadCompleteSuggestionsForEverything.EffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when the user had at least one complete suggestion offered for each requested information.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.UserHadInitialFormOfPayment.EffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when the user had a form of payment on file when the Payment Request was shown.

histogram.name: PaymentRequest.UserHadSuggestionsForEverything.EffectOnCompletion
histogram.summary: Whether the flow was completed when the user had suggestions offered for each requested information.

histogram.name: PDF.AnnotationType
histogram.summary: Tracks documents opened in the PDF viewer that displayed one or more pages with the given annotation type.

histogram.name: PDF.DocumentFeature
histogram.summary: Tracks which features are used by documents opened in the PDF viewer, logged when the document finishes loading.

histogram.name: PDF.FileSizeInKB
histogram.summary: The size of PDF documents opened in the PDF viewer.

histogram.name: PDF.IsFontSubstituted
histogram.summary: Measures if PDFs opened in the PDF viewer require fonts to be substituted. This is logged whenever a document is opened in the PDF viewer.

histogram.name: PDF.IsLinearized
histogram.summary: Measures if PDFs opened in the PDF viewer are Linearized PDFs. This is logged whenever a document is opened in the PDF viewer.

histogram.name: Pepper.BrokerAction
histogram.summary: Counts various actions related to the Pepper Broker interface.

histogram.name: Pepper.SecureOrigin.MediaStreamRequest
histogram.summary: Whether a Pepper media stream request (mic/cam access) comes from a plugin in a secure or an insecure origin.

histogram.name: Performance.MeasureParameter.EndMark
histogram.summary: The count of possible incoming values to the endMark parameter in performance.measure(). The purpose is to investigate how much the change of API of User Timing L3 will impact the real world use cases. This histogram was deprecated in 05/2018 and re-reenabled in 11/2018. The re-enabled histogram adds the counting of undefined, null, number and unprovided, to the original navigation-timing names, object and string. This value is recorded at each call to performance.measure().

histogram.name: Performance.MeasureParameter.StartMark
histogram.summary: The count of possible incoming values to the startMark parameter in performance.measure(). The purpose is to investigate how much the change of API of User Timing L3 will impact the real world use cases. This histogram was deprecated in 05/2018 and re-reenabled in 11/2018. The re-enabled histogram adds the counting of undefined, null, number and unprovided, to the original navigation-timing names, object and string. This value is recorded at each call to performance.measure().

histogram.name: PerformanceManager.AgentsByTime
histogram.summary: Tracks the total number of agents hosted by the browser by time. An entry in bucket N corresponds to N agents being hosted across all live renderer process for 1 second. Recorded on state changes and every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: PerformanceManager.AgentsPerRendererByTime
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of agents hosted per renderer by time. An entry in bucket N corresponds to N agents being hosted by a renderer process for 1 second. Recorded on state changes and every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: PerformanceManager.AgentsUniqueByTime
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of unique agents hosted by the browser by time. An entry in bucket N corresponds to N unique agents being hosted across all live renderer process for 1 second. Unique means that the agent count would remain the same if they were in one process (i.e. they have different protocol+site). Recorded on state changes and every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: PerformanceManager.BrowsingInstancePluralityVisibilityState.ByPageTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-01-06 as this was only added for a brief exploration.
histogram.summary: Tracks the plurality and visibility state of all BrowsingInstances over time. An entry in each bucket corresponds to a page in a BrowsingInstance being in that state for one second. This is effectively "page seconds" of time spent in each state. Recorded on state changes and every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: PerformanceManager.BrowsingInstancePluralityVisibilityState.ByTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-01-06 as this was only added for a brief exploration.
histogram.summary: Tracks the plurality and visibility state of all BrowsingInstances over time. An entry in each bucket corresponds to a BrowsingInstance being in that state for one second. Recorded on state changes and every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: PerformanceManager.FrameSiteInstanceProcessRelationship.ByProcess
histogram.summary: Tracks the types of frames that are being hosted by a process over its entire lifetime. An entry in the "AllFramesHaveDistinctSiteInstances" means that the process only ever hosted frames with distinct site instances over its entire lifetime. Recorded on state changes and every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: PerformanceManager.FrameSiteInstanceProcessRelationship.ByTime
histogram.summary: Tracks the types of frames that are being hosted by a process, aggregated over time. Each entry in each bucket corresponds to a process being in that state for one second. Recorded on state changes and every 5 minutes.

histogram.name: PerformanceMonitor.SystemMonitor.DiskIdleTime
histogram.summary: Average percentage of time during which the disk has been idle, logged at regular intervals. If the system has multiple disks then this is the average value for all of them. Windows only.

histogram.name: PerformanceMonitor.SystemMonitor.FreePhysMemory
histogram.summary: The amount of free physical memory available, logged at regular intervals. Windows only.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action.InsecureOrigin
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-06-19 as most permissions are no longer exposed to insecure origins to begin with, and even those few that are recorded no useful data any longer.
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc on an insecure origin. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Action.SecureOrigin
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-06-19 as most permissions are no longer exposed to insecure origins to begin with, and even those few that are recorded no useful data any longer.
histogram.summary: Tracks whether a permission was granted, rejected, etc on a secure origin. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.SafeBrowsingResponse
histogram.obsolete: Permission blacklisting was removed in M67.
histogram.summary: Tracks the response (if received) from Safe Browsing when the API blacklist is queried for an (origin, permission) pair. The response could be that the origin was blacklisted, not blacklisted, or Safe Browsing timed out before a response was received.

histogram.name: Permissions.AutoBlocker.SafeBrowsingResponseTime
histogram.obsolete: Permission blacklisting was removed in M67.
histogram.summary: Records the elapsed time between the client sending a request to Safe Browsing and receiving a result, or the maximum wait time is exceeded and Safe Browsing is deemed to have timed out.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.Persisted
histogram.obsolete: Persist toggle experiments ran from M56 to M59.
histogram.summary: For each granted permission prompt displayed with a persistence toggle (remember my decision), records whether the persistence toggle was enabled (persist) or not enabled (don't persist).

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.PriorDismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt accept, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.PriorIgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt accept, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.Persisted
histogram.obsolete: Persist toggle experiments ran from M56 to M59.
histogram.summary: For each denied permission prompt displayed with a persistence toggle (remember my decision), records whether the persistence toggle was enabled (persist) or not enabled (don't persist).

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.PriorDismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt deny, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Denied.PriorIgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt deny, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the accept. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.DismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismissal, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data, inclusive of the current dismissal. Every event in a bucket larger than 1 in this histogram will also have an event in each smaller bucket. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Dismissed.PriorDismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismiss, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the dismiss. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Dismissed.PriorIgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt dismiss, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the dismiss. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.IgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data, inclusive of the current ignore. Every event in a bucket larger than 1 in this histogram will also have an event in each smaller bucket. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Ignored.PriorDismissCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt dismissal events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the ignore. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.Ignored.PriorIgnoreCount
histogram.summary: This metric, recorded at the time of a permission prompt ignore, records the total number of prompt ignore events for this origin since the last time the user cleared their history or site data and prior to the ignore. The suffix of the histogram indicates which particular permission.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.MergedBubbleAccepted
histogram.obsolete: Redundant since M61 (bug 728483) as we now only merge Mic+Camera. The same counts are available in Permissions.Prompt.Accepted.
histogram.summary: Tracks acceptance of permission bubble request types that have been merged into coalesced bubbles.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.MergedBubbleDenied
histogram.obsolete: Redundant since M61 (bug 728483) as we now only merge Mic+Camera. The same counts are available in Permissions.Prompt.Denied.
histogram.summary: Tracks denial of permission bubble request types that have been merged into coalesced bubbles.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.MergedBubbleTypes
histogram.obsolete: Redundant since M61 (bug 728483) as we now only merge Mic+Camera. The same counts are available in Permissions.Prompt.Shown.
histogram.summary: Tracks the permission bubble request types that are being merged into coalesced bubbles.

histogram.name: Permissions.Prompt.RequestsPerPrompt
histogram.obsolete: Redundant since M61 (bug 728483) as we now only merge Mic+Camera. The same counts are available in Permissions.Prompt.Shown.
histogram.summary: How many permission requests each permissions prompt shown to the user contains.

histogram.name: Permissions.Requested.CrossOrigin
histogram.summary:
The embedder's permission setting at the time of a cross-origin iframe permission request for a given permission type. See the corresponding histogram suffixes.
A request is when a website makes a permission request and the user has the permission set to prompt (i.e. not blocked or allowed).
Note this is probably not the metric you want - it does not correspond to the total number of times websites request a permission. Also, because specific permissions have code that can automatically block or grant permissions based on things like incognito, installed extensions etc., this does also not correspond to the number of times users are prompted to allow permissions.
See https://crbug.com/638076 for more details.

histogram.name: Permissions.Requested.SameOrigin
histogram.summary:
The permission type (geolocation, and such) of a same-origin permission request.
A request is when a website makes a permission request and the user has the permission set to prompt (i.e. not blocked or allowed).
Note this is probably not the metric you want - it does not correspond to the total number of times websites request a permission. Also, because specific permissions have code that can automatically block or grant permissions based on things like incognito, installed extensions etc., this does also not correspond to the number of times users are prompted to allow permissions.
See https://crbug.com/638076 for more details.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ActivityReferral
histogram.summary: Referer used by user to reach the main Physical Web Activity.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.InitialState.IosChrome
histogram.summary: Initial state of the Physical Web in Chrome for iOS.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ReferralDelay.OptInNotification
histogram.summary: Time between the most recent opt in notification update and when the user arrives at the ListUrlsActivity.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ReferralDelay.StandardNotification
histogram.summary: Time between the most recent standard notification update and when the user arrives at the ListUrlsActivity.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ResolveTime.Background
histogram.summary: Round trip time to the metadata server for a Physical Web URL resolution which the client requests during a background scan.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ResolveTime.Foreground
histogram.summary: Round trip time to the metadata server for a Physical Web URL resolution which the client requests during a foreground scan, that is not explicitly requested via a refresh.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.ResolveTime.Refresh
histogram.summary: Round trip time to the metadata server for a Physical Web URL resolution which the client requests during a foreground scan, that is explicitly requested via a refresh.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.RoundTripTimeMilliseconds
histogram.summary: Round trip time to the metadata server for Physical web.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.Bluetooth
histogram.summary: Whether bluetooth is on, off, or unknown.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.DataConnectionActive
histogram.summary: Whether the data connection is active.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.LocationPermission
histogram.summary: Whether location permission has been accepted.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.LocationServices
histogram.summary: Whether location services are enabled.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.State.Preference
histogram.summary: Whether the preference is on, off, or if the user is in an onboarding state when Chrome first starts up.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.TotalUrls.OnInitialDisplay
histogram.summary: The number of URLs displayed to a user when a list of nearby URLs is first displayed.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.TotalUrls.OnRefresh
histogram.summary: The number of URLs displayed to a user when a list of nearby URLs is displayed after refreshing.

histogram.name: PhysicalWeb.WebUI.ListViewUrlPosition
histogram.summary: Count of how many times the user selected a nearby URL at the specified index in the Physical Web WebUI list view (zero-based). Capped at 50.

histogram.name: Platform.Cast.MeminfoMemAvailable
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 in favor of Platform.Cast.MeminfoMemAvailable2 with a larger range.
histogram.summary: /proc/meminfo's 'MemAvailable' in Mbytes. Collected on Cast devices with kernel version 3.14 and above and capped at 500.

histogram.name: Platform.Cast.MeminfoMemFreeDerived
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 in favor of Platform.Cast.MeminfoMemFreeDerived2 with a larger range.
histogram.summary: free + buffers + cache memory in Mbytes on Cast devices, capped at 500.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Cache_Avg
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Cache_Max
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Downloads_Avg
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.Downloads_Max
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's Cache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.GCache_Avg
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Average size of user's GCache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.GCache_Max
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Maximum size of user's GCache directory. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.DiskUsage.LeastUsedAccountDays
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Days since the least frequently used account signed in. Logged once a day, if disk usage is high.

histogram.name: Platform.KernelWarningHashes
histogram.obsolete: Removed 8/2019 due to lack of usage.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The 32-bit hash of a kernel warning. This is the hash of the "file:line" string corresponding to the location of the warning, for instance: "/mnt/host/source/src/third_party/kernel/files/drivers /gpu/drm/i915/intel_dp.c:351" (ignore spurious spaces). The hash is produced by this code: while (*string) hash = (hash << 5) + hash + *string++; Separately each warning is also collected (with its hash) via the crash reporter, but only its first occurrence in each boot session.

histogram.name: Platform.MountEncrypted.EncryptedFsType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 6/2020 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: Type of encrypted mount used for the encrypted stateful file system on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Platform.ServiceFailureHashes
histogram.obsolete: Removed 8/2019 due to lack of usage.
histogram.summary: The 32-bit hash of the name of the service that failed. The name of the service is hashed using the same algorithm as used for the hashes in Platform.KernelWarningHashes. The first instance of each service failure is also collected separately via the crash reporter.

histogram.name: Platform.TPMForcedReboot
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 as there is no data and no mention of it in the codebase.
histogram.summary: Each sample is the number of consecutive reboots performed while attempting to clear a TPM (Trusted Platform Module) error.

histogram.name: Platform.Tps65090Retries
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Retries needed to enable a FET on tps65090 (AKA tpschrome). Tps65090 is a power management unit (PMU) used on many ARM Chromebooks. Until version ES7 was rolled into production we would sometimes run into a problem where FET1 (the FET used to switch on and off the backlight) wouldn't turn on properly. This problem was especially prevalent when the voltage was high (like when the device was plugged into the wall). Retrying by turning the FET off and on again is nearly always effective, so the kernel will retry up to 5 times (currently) and will also log the fact that it needed to retry. On newest kernels (kernel 3.8 and up) a kernel warning will be logged with WARN_ON if the FET still failed to turn on after 5 tries. Refer to the kernel warning reports to find that information. For more details about this bug refer to http://crbug.com/338657 and http://crosbug.com/p/16009. Note that we log retries on all 7 FETs even though we've only ever seen failures of FET1.

histogram.name: Platform.U2F.LegacyCommand

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaint
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "first paint." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaint_Negative
histogram.summary: Magnitude and difference between begin and first paint, when first_paint precedes begin. This is a temporary metric used to better understand the root cause of http://crbug.com/125273.

histogram.name: PLT.BeginToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.obsolete: The first paint after load is not useful for most documents. Consider using PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint instead.
histogram.summary: Time from "big" to "first paint after load." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish doc." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish doc" == main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFirstPaint
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: PLT.CommitToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.obsolete: The first paint after load is not useful for most documents. Consider using PageLoad.PaintTiming.ParseStartToFirstContentfulPaint instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint after load." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "finish doc" to "finish." "Finish doc"== main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.FinishToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.obsolete: The first paint after load is not useful for most documents. Consider using PageLoad.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "finish " to "first paint after load." "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.iOS.BrowserInitiatedPageLoadTimeWithLowBattery
histogram.summary: Page load time for Browser-initiated navigations when battery level is below a certain threshold (20%). Recorded when CRWWebRequestController::didFinishWithURL completes successfully. iOS specific.

histogram.name: PLT.iOS.RendererInitiatedPageLoadTimeWithLowBattery
histogram.summary: Page load time for Renderer-initiated navigations when battery level is below a certain threshold (20%). Recorded when CRWWebRequestController::didFinishWithURL completes successfully. iOS specific.

histogram.name: PLT.LoadType
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Probability distribution for enumerated varieties of page loads.

histogram.name: PLT.MissingStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Diagnose error conditions in PLT reporting. A start time should always be present.

histogram.name: PLT.NavStartToLoadEnd
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the Navigation Timing metrics navigationStart and loadEventEnd. Definitions: http://www.w3.org/TR/navigation-timing/

histogram.name: PLT.NavStartToLoadStart
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the Navigation Timing metrics navigationStart and loadEventStart. Definitions: http://www.w3.org/TR/navigation-timing/

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Connect
histogram.summary: Time from connectStart to connectEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeConnect
histogram.summary: Time from domanLookupEnd to connectStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeDomainLookup
histogram.summary: Time from fetchStart to domainLookupStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeDomLoading
histogram.summary: Time from responseStart to domLoading based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeFetch
histogram.summary: Time from navigationStart to fetchStart based on Navigation Timing when no redirect.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeFetchRedirect
histogram.summary: Time from navigationStart to fetchStart excluding time spent on redirects based on Navigation Timing. Only page loads with redirects are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeLoadEvent
histogram.summary: Time from domContentLoadedEventEnd to loadEventStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DelayBeforeRequest
histogram.summary: Time from connectEnd to requestStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomainLookup
histogram.summary: Time from domainLookupStart to domainLookupEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomContentLoaded
histogram.summary: Time from domContentLoadedEventStart to domContentLoadedEventEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomInteractive
histogram.summary: Time from domInteractive to domContentLoadEventStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_DomLoading
histogram.summary: Time from domLoading to domInteractive based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_LoadEvent
histogram.summary: Time from loadEventStart to loadEventEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Redirect
histogram.summary: Time from redirectStart to redirectEnd based on Navigation Timing when redirects exist.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Request
histogram.summary: Time from requestStart to responseStart based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.NT_Response
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/19/2016. Replaced by PageLoad.ParseTiming.ParseDuration.
histogram.summary: Time from responseStart to responseEnd based on Navigation Timing.

histogram.name: PLT.PageUsed_PrerenderLoad
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Distribution of discarded and displayed prerendered pages.

histogram.name: PLT.PerceivedLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererPLT.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a page. For non-prerendered pages, this is just BeginToFinish. For displayed prerendered pages, this is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: PLT.PerceivedLoadTime_PrerenderLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLTMatched.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a prerendered page that is displayed. This is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: PLT.Prerender_TimeUntilDisplay
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererTimeUntilDisplay.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between when the prerendering of a page starts and when the page is displayed. Prerendered pages discarded without being displayed are excluded from this count.

histogram.name: PLT.PrerenderIdleTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/02/2011, replaced by Prerender.RendererIdleTime.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This is the time from when a prerendered page finishes loading to when it is displayed. When a page is displayed before it finishes loading, no value is recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: PLT.PT.NavigationStartToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first document layout is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.PT.ResponseStartToFirstLayout
histogram.summary: Measures the time from navigation timing's response start to the time the first document layout is performed.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToCommit
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToCommit. Commit: responseStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToCommit_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToCommit. Commit: responseStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinish_SpdyProxy. Finish: loadEventEnd. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinishDoc. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_BeginToFinishDoc_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.BeginToFinishDoc_SpdyProxy. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Begin: requestStart or navigationStart if user-initiated request. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinish. Commit: responseStart. Finish: loadEventEnd.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinish. Commit: responseStart. Finish: loadEventEnd. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinishDoc. Commit: responseStart. FinishDoc: loadEventStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_CommitToFinishDoc_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.CommitToFinishDoc. Commit: responseStart. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_FinishDocToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.FinishDocToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. FinishDoc: loadEventStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_FinishDocToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.FinishDocToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. FinishDoc: loadEventStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToCommit
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the time until the renderer got first byte of document. Commit: time when renderer got first byte of document. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToDomContentLoaded
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the time until the beginning of the DOMContentLoaded event. DOMContentLoaded: domContentLoadedEventStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinish
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToFinish. Finish: loadEventEnd. Request: navigationStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToFinishDoc
histogram.summary: This time is based on the NavigationTiming spec and measures the page load time until the beginning of the load event. Finish: loadEventStart. Request: navigationStart.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_RequestToStart_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.RequestToStart. Start: requestStart. Request: navigationStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToCommit_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToCommit. Start: requestStart. Commit: responseStart. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.PT_StartToFinish_DataReductionProxy
histogram.summary: This time is based on the PerformanceTiming spec and is a more accurate version of PLT.StartToFinish. Start: requestStart. Finish: loadEventEnd. Only page loads through the data reduction proxy are considered.

histogram.name: PLT.RequestToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "finish." "Request" == time when user requested document. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToCommit
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "commit." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "finish." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.NoProxy.http
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using http and no proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.NoProxy.https
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using https and no proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.Proxy.http
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using http over a proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.StartToFinish.Proxy.https
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: StartToFinish times when using https over a proxy.

histogram.name: PLT.UserTiming_Mark
histogram.summary: This time is based on the User Timing spec and measures the time from Navigation Timing navigationStart until the point where the page called performance.mark().

histogram.name: PLT.UserTiming_MeasureDuration
histogram.summary: This time is based on the User Timing spec and reports the time between two arbitrary points defined by the page being loaded and directly matches the measurement exposed by performance.measure().

histogram.name: Plugin.AvailabilityStatus.WidevineCdm
histogram.summary: The availability status of Widevine CDM. In normal cases, this is reported per render process if EME API is used. This is not reported if EME API is not used. This could be reported multiple times per render process until PLUGIN_AVAILABLE is reported (which should be a rare case).

histogram.name: Plugin.EnabledStatusMigrationDone
histogram.summary: Tracks whether plugins that were disabled were migrated.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.ClickSize.AspectRatio
histogram.summary: Aspect ratio of Flash plugins users click at least once. The aspect ratio is multiplied by 100 and stored as a rounded integer.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.ClickSize.Height
histogram.summary: Height of Flash plugins users click at least once.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.ClickSize.Width
histogram.summary: Width of Flash plugins users click at least once.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.Engagement
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2017 in Issue 781644 as we no longer use Site Engagement Index as a signal for Flash display.
histogram.summary: The engagement score of origins which have passed through a site engagement check to permit or block Flash. Recorded every time the Flash plugin is requested with the PreferHtmlOverPlugins feature active.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.TinyContentSize
histogram.summary: Collects the sizes of all loaded Flash plugin instances. This is for determining the prevalence of tiny flash plugin instances.

histogram.name: Plugin.Flash.YouTubeRewrite
histogram.summary: Records the YouTube Flash embed rewrite status when attempted.

histogram.name: Plugin.NpapiRemovalInfobar.Removed.PluginGroup
histogram.summary: The plugin group of an NPAPI plugin that is no longer supported. Recorded when the NPAPI removal infobar is shown for a plugin which is no longer supported.

histogram.name: Plugin.NpapiRemovalInfobar.RemovedSoon.PluginGroup
histogram.summary: The plugin group of an NPAPI plugin that will be unsupported soon. Recorded when the NPAPI removal infobar is shown after an NPAPI plugin first loads to warn the user that NPAPI support for this plugin will be removed soon.

histogram.name: Plugin.NPAPIStatus
histogram.summary: Records whether NPAPI plugins are supported by the platform, and if so, whether they are enabled or disabled. Recorded once at browser startup.

histogram.name: Plugin.PowerSaver.PeripheralHeuristic
histogram.summary: Records each decision of the Plugin Power Saver peripheral content heuristic. This UMA is counted once per peripheral query, and may count a single plugin instance multiple times as it is resized.

histogram.name: Plugin.PowerSaver.PeripheralHeuristicInitialDecision
histogram.summary: Records the initial decision of the Plugin Power Saver peripheral content heuristic for each plugin instance. This is recorded once per plugin instance.

histogram.name: Plugin.PowerSaver.PosterParamPresence
histogram.summary: Record how many plugin object tags use poster param. This is recorded once per plugin instance, and is currently restricted to Flash plugin instances.

histogram.name: Plugin.RequestObjectResult
histogram.summary: Result of HTMLPluginElement::requestObject in Blink.

histogram.name: Plugin.SyncMessageTime
histogram.summary: Roundtrip times for synchronous IPC calls from the renderer to NPAPI plugin processes.

histogram.name: PluginFinder.BuiltInPluginList.ErrorCode
histogram.summary: Error codes when parsing the built-in plugin list. Logged when the PluginFinder singleton is created.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargePercentPerHour
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 in favor of power benchmarks that have less variability than data from users' machines.
histogram.summary: The percentage of battery capacity used per hour relative to a full battery. Reported once when the power adaptor is plugged back in after the system is on battery power for more than 30 minutes. If at any point the system is suspended or all Chrome renderers are closed the measurement is not recorded. Anytime the user unplugs the power adaptor, a new measurement will begin being recorded. Collection of this histogram only starts after 30 minutes of uptime at which point the clock starts (assuming the user is on battery power at that point). The system will need to remain unplugged for at least another 30 minutes in order for any measurement to be recorded. Values are normalized to a percent per hour scale. This measurement is tied tightly to hardware model/OS and is not comparable across different hardware configurations.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate_15
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 in favor of power benchmarks that have less variability than data from users' machines.
histogram.summary: The percent of depleted battery capacity relative to a full battery over the first 15 minutes after battery power collection information starts. Collection of this histogram only starts after 30 minutes of uptime at which point the clock starts (assuming the user is on battery power at that point). The system will need to remain unplugged for at least another 15 minutes in order for any measurement to be recorded. Values are normalized to a percent per hour scale. This measurement is tied tightly to hardware model/OS and is not comparable across different hardware configurations.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate_30
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 in favor of power benchmarks that have less variability than data from users' machines.
histogram.summary: The percent of depleted battery capacity relative to a full battery over the first 30 minutes after battery power collection information starts. Collection of this histogram only starts after 30 minutes of uptime at which point the clock starts (assuming the user is on battery power at that point). The system will need to remain unplugged for at least another 30 minutes in order for any measurement to be recorded. Values are normalized to a percent per hour scale. This measurement is tied tightly to hardware model/OS and is not comparable across different hardware configurations.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryDischargeRate_5
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 in favor of power benchmarks that have less variability than data from users' machines.
histogram.summary: The percent of depleted battery capacity relative to a full battery over the first 5 minutes after battery power collection information starts. Collection of this histogram only starts after 30 minutes of uptime at which point the clock starts (assuming the user is on battery power at that point). The system will need to remain unplugged for at least another 5 minutes in order for any measurement to be recorded. Values are normalized to a percent per hour scale. This measurement is tied tightly to hardware model/OS and is not comparable across different hardware configurations.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryRemainingCharge
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 03/2012, no longer being generated by powerd.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining battery charge as percent of the maximum battery charge sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BatteryTimeToEmpty
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 03/2012, no longer being generated by powerd.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS remaining time to empty battery in minutes sampled when the device runs on battery.

histogram.name: Power.BrightnessAdjustOnAC
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2013. See Accel_BrightnessDown_F6 and Accel_BrightnessUp_F7 user actions instead.
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has adjusted brightness up and down while running on battery power.

histogram.name: Power.BrightnessAdjustOnBattery
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 5/2013. See Accel_BrightnessDown_F6 and Accel_BrightnessUp_F7 user actions instead.
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has adjusted brightness up and down while running on AC power.

histogram.name: Power.ChargerType
histogram.summary: External power supply type such as MAINS_CHARGER, USB_CHARGER, UNCONFIRMED_SPRING_CHARGER, SAFE_SPRING_CHARGER. A sample is reported each time a charger is connected to the device.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourIosOnActive
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator listens to on_application_active events. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourOthers
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, for other sync invalidator methods. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourP2P
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator uses peer-to-peer notifications. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.MilliConsumptionPerHourServer
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The average power consumption, measured in milli-units per hour, when sync invalidator uses server-based non-blocking invalidator. Values for this metric are per session, i.e. from battery level at application entering foreground to returning to background, and normalized to an hourly average consumption. This is an iOS only measurement. Due to how iOS reports battery levels, it is likely to see many readings of 0.

histogram.name: Power.RetrySuspendCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed Feb 2014 by Power.SuspendAttemptsBeforeCancel and Power.SuspendAttemptsBeforeSuccess.
histogram.summary: The number of times Chrome OS retried suspend due to previous failure.

histogram.name: Power.SuspendStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed Jan 2014 by Power.SuspendAttempt and Power.SuspendResult.
histogram.summary: Chrome OS suspend status.

histogram.name: Power.ThermalAbortedFanTurnOn
histogram.summary: The percentage of aborted fan attempts out of total fan attempts per session, where an abort is due to hysteresis. This value is computed from boot and sent when powerd starts and then every 15 minutes afterwards.

histogram.name: Power.ThermalMultipleFanTurnOn
histogram.summary: The percentage of fan trip point passes that are more than one trip point. This value is computed from boot and sent when powerd starts and then every 15 minutes afterwards.

histogram.name: Precache.BatteryPercentage.Start
histogram.summary: The battery level in percentage when the precache task was started.

histogram.name: Precache.BatteryPercentageDiff.End
histogram.summary: Measures the difference between the battery level percentage when the precache task is started and ended. This value indicates the possible battery usage due to the precache task. Logged when the precache task ends, which could be due to successful completion, time-out, error conditions, max download limit exceeded, etc.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheSize.AllEntries
histogram.summary: The size in kilobytes occupied by all the entries existing in the cache at the time of the last precache.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch
histogram.summary: Like HttpCache.Pattern but only for requests not made during precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch.FromPrecache
histogram.summary: Like Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch but only for requests which having a matching URL in the precache. Measures the amount of precache misses due to expiration or eviction. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch.NonTopHosts
histogram.summary: Like Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch, but only for requests with a referer not in the user's top visited hosts. See History.TopHostsVisitsByRank for details on the top hosts computation.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch.TopHosts
histogram.summary: Like Precache.CacheStatus.NonPrefetch, but only for requests with a referer in the user's top visited hosts. See History.TopHostsVisitsByRank for details on the top hosts computation.

histogram.name: Precache.CacheStatus.Prefetch
histogram.summary: Like HttpCache.Pattern but only for requests made during precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.DownloadedNonPrecache
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were downloaded over the network for HTTP/HTTPS fetches that were not motivated by precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.DownloadedPrecacheMotivated
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were downloaded because of precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.Events
histogram.summary: Enumerates the various failure reasons and events of interest for precaching. The events are persisted when the native library is not loaded, and recorded when the library loads next time.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.FailureReasons
histogram.summary: A bit vector of reasons why the precache fetch failed to start. Bit values are documented in the FailureReason Java enum.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.MinWeight
histogram.summary: The minimum resource weight that is fetched in a given precache run. Reported if the precache completed successfully or was canceled due to the byte cap, but not if it was cancelled due to an ill-formed manifest or exceeding the time limit. Reported only if global_ranking is true.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.PercentCompleted
histogram.summary: The percent of manifests for which all resources have been downloaded. Logged per prefetch run.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes received from all prefetch requests, including config, manifests, and resources. Logged per prefetch run.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes.Daily
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes in 24 hours received over the network from all prefetch requests, including config, manifests, and resources. Logged during the next precache run after the 24 hours has elapsed.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes.Network
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes received over the network from all prefetch requests, including config, manifests, and resources. Logged per prefetch run.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes.NetworkWasted
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes received over the network for a wasted resource precache fetch. Logged when a partially downloaded resource precache fetch gets cancelled due to per-resource size limit or max precache size limit.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.ResponseBytes.Total
histogram.summary: The total number of response bytes contained in all prefetch requests, including config, manifests, and resources. Logged per prefetch run.

histogram.name: Precache.Fetch.TimeToComplete
histogram.summary: The time, in milliseconds, to complete a prefetch run. Only applies to non-cancelled runs (those for which PercentCompleted is 100).

histogram.name: Precache.Freshness.Prefetch
histogram.summary: The freshness lifetimes of the resources that were precached from the moment they were fetched or revalidated as described in RFC 2616 13.2.4. Logged per precache request.

histogram.name: Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch
histogram.summary: The latency for requests that were not made during precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch.NonTopHosts
histogram.summary: Like Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch, but limited to requests with a referer not in the user's top visited hosts. See History.TopHostsVisitsByRank for details on the top hosts computation.

histogram.name: Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch.TopHosts
histogram.summary: Like Precache.Latency.NonPrefetch, but limited to requests with a referer in the user's top visited hosts. See History.TopHostsVisitsByRank for details on the top hosts computation.

histogram.name: Precache.Latency.Prefetch
histogram.summary: The latency for requests that were made during precaching. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.PeriodicTaskInterval
histogram.summary: The time between successive precache periodic GCM task invocations. When precache task is started, the time interval from previous task invocation is logged.

histogram.name: Precache.Saved
histogram.summary: The number of bytes during user browsing that were served from the cache, but would have been downloaded over a network if precaching was disabled. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Precache.Saved.Freshness
histogram.summary: The freshness lifetimes (RFC 2616 13.2.4) of the resources that were precached and later used (and thus served from the cache). This is computed at serving time and thus possibly different from the precached value if the cache entry was revalidated. Logged per-request but only once per URL and precaching cycle (as Precache.Saved).

histogram.name: Precache.TimeSinceLastPrecache
histogram.summary: The time between the the beginning of the last precache session and each of the URL fetches made by the user ever since. Logged per-request.

histogram.name: Prefetch.Redirect
histogram.summary: Recorded when a prefetch request is made, and when a prefetch request is redirected. Specifically, PrefetchURLLoader::PrefetchURLLoader records "Prefetch request made", and PrefetchURLLoader::FollowRedirect records one of the two redirection values. This is to collect data on how often prefetch requests experience redirects. Note that when the PrefetchRedirectError flag is enabled, no events are recorded. We do not want to interact with this histogram when we're experimenting with the redirect mode for prefetch requests.

histogram.name: PrefService.CreateProfilePrefsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during CreateProfilePrefs.

histogram.name: PrefService.NetworkPredictionEnabled
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2019. No longer needed.
histogram.summary: Count events where Network Prediction was enabled or disabled.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.Counts
histogram.summary: The number of preloads generated by the preload scanner.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.Counts.Miss
histogram.summary: The number of unused preloads generated by the preload scanner. Note that some link rel preloads are not referenced until after this point, so they will be falsely marked as preload misses. These will show up in the Raw bucket.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.Counts2
histogram.summary: The number of preloads generated by the preload scanner.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.Counts2.Miss
histogram.summary: The number of unused preloads generated by the preload scanner. Note that some link rel preloads are not referenced until after this point, so they will be falsely marked as preload misses.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.ExecutionTime.Failure
histogram.summary: Time spent executing a script tag in the blink preload scanner, for the purpose of preloading scripts that will be fetched via a call to document.write. The execution failed to generate a preload request.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.ExecutionTime.Success
histogram.summary: Time spent executing a script tag in the blink preload scanner, for the purpose of preloading scripts that will be fetched via a call to document.write. The execution successfully resulted in a preload request.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.GatedEvaluation
histogram.summary: The reason a particular inline script was blocked from evaluation.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.InitializationTime
histogram.summary: Time spent initializing a new V8 context for the purpose of evaluating it and preloading document.written strings.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.DocumentWrite.ScriptLength
histogram.summary: The length of the inline script that is being considered for document write evaluation.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.ExternalCSS.PreloadCount
histogram.summary: The number of preloads generated by scanning an external preloaded CSS resource. As of 4/25/2016 this only includes @import declarations.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.ExternalCSS.ScanTime
histogram.summary:
Microseconds it took to scan the first chunk of external CSS for preloads.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.ReferenceTime
histogram.summary: The time between preload discovery and when the resource is actually referenced. This is implemented by marking when a preload is discovered by the scanner, and when it has its first ResourceClient added to it. Note that for link rel preloads, this tracks the time from scanner discory to DOM discovery of the link declaration, not the actual resource.

histogram.name: PreloadScanner.TTFB
histogram.summary: The time between preload discovery and when the first bytes of the response data arrive.

histogram.name: Prerender.AbandonTimeUntilUsed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-09 as prerenders can no longer be 'used' (=='swapped-in').
histogram.summary: Time from when a prerendered page is abandoned to when it is first used due to user navigation. If the page is swapped before begin abandoned, a zero is recorded.

histogram.name: Prerender.CookieSendType
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what types of cookies were sent for a prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.CookieStatus
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what cookie actions a prerender caused.

histogram.name: Prerender.Event
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to prerendering have occurred.

histogram.name: Prerender.Events
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Hover Event counts for prerendering.

histogram.name: Prerender.FinalStatusMatchComplete
histogram.summary: Final status for prerender pages - either success, or why it was canceled. This is for the MatchComplete set of pages (including some pages that were not actually prerendered), to match the control group.
