histogram.name: Prerender.FractionPixelsFinalAtSwapin
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For prerenders that are swapped in, the percentage of pixels that is already final at swap-in time compared to when the spinner stops.

histogram.name: Prerender.HoverStats_TimeUntilClicked
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Duration that a user hovers a link before clicking on it.
This is recorded for all pages loaded in a session.

histogram.name: Prerender.HoverStats_TimeUntilDiscarded
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Duration that the mouse pointer hovers on a link before the mouse pointer moves off of it.
This is recorded for all pages loaded in a session.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorEvent
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to the local predictor have occurred

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorLoggedInLookupTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform the LoggedIn Lookup for the local predictor. This operation checks whether a user is likely logged into a page that we would like to prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorPrefetchMatchPLT
histogram.summary: The PrerenderLocalPredictor uses local browsing history and the prerender service to predict pages likely visited soon. Some of these URLs are prefetched. When such prefetched likely next pages are visited, this histogram records the PLT for such pages. In particular, this also happens if prefetch is actually disabled, allowing (by pivoting on whether or not prefetch is enabled) to compare the effect of prefetch on PLT.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorServiceLookupTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform the Service Lookup for the local predictor. This operation queries a Google service to obtain pages to prerender, as well as whether prerender candidate pages are likely safe for prerendering.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorTimeUntilUsed
histogram.summary: Time from when a prerendered page is started to when it is first used due to user navigation. If the page is never used, it is not included in this histogram. This only refers to prerenders based on the local predictor.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalPredictorURLLookupTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform the URL Lookup for the local predictor. This operation retrieves from the user's local browsing history the URLs corresponding to URLIDs.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalVisitCoreTransition
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The transition type for each new visit as recorded in the local visits database.

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalVisitDatabaseSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the local visits database (number of entries).

histogram.name: Prerender.LocalVisitEvents
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to local visits have occurred

histogram.name: Prerender.ModPagespeedHeader
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Previous version of the Prerender.PagespeedHeader.* histograms.

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytes.TotalForProfile
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead). Reported on event of a PrerenderContents deletion. Includes prerender bytes. Bytes are only counted when prerendering is enabled and not in a control group. The sum of the distribution for a single user represents all of that user's network transfers for resource for that time period while prerendering was enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytes.Used
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead) for a prerender that was used (or would have been used).

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytes.Wasted
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead) for a prerender that was not used.

histogram.name: Prerender.NetworkBytesUsed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-09 as prerenders can no longer be 'used' (=='swapped-in').
histogram.summary: Number of bytes transferred on the network for URLRequests (not including HTTP/TLS/TCP/IP overhead) for a prerender that was used (or would have been used).

histogram.name: Prerender.NoStatePrefetchAge
histogram.summary: Time between the prefetch and the actual load of the page.

histogram.name: Prerender.OmniboxNavigationsCouldPrerender
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-04, as NoStatePrefetch is launched everywhere.
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates whether the Omnibox navigation being committed could have been prerendered by the Omnibox Prerender system. This provides an upper bound for Prerender.OmniboxNavigationsUsedPrerenderCount and allows the potential for Omnibox Prerendering coverage to be understood. If Omnibox Prerendering is disabled, this histogram will register a 'false' entry. The total count is the equivalent of the deprecated NetworkActionPredictor.NavigationCount histogram.

histogram.name: Prerender.OmniboxNavigationsUsedPrerenderCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-09 as prerenders can no longer be 'used' (=='swapped-in').
histogram.summary: The number of navigations that use a prerender initiated from the Omnibox. The count is incremented when the Prerendered tab is swapped in if the Prerender was initiated by the Omnibox, which obviously requires Prerendering from the Omnibox to be enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.OmniboxPrerenderCount
histogram.summary: The number of prerenders initiated from the Omnibox. This is incremented when the NetworkActionPredictor suggests Prerendering as an optimal strategy given the text the user has entered and the Autocomplete suggestion currently selected. It is only incremented if Prerendering from the Omnibox is enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PagespeedHeader.ServerCounts
histogram.summary: The number of responses received bucketed into the range [0,4]: bucket 0 is the total number of responses received; bucket 1 is the number of responses received with an X-Mod-Pagespeed header [indicating a mod_pagespeed server]; bucket 2 is the number of responses received with an X-Page-Speed header and a header value in the X-Mod-Pagespeed format (a.b.c.d-e) [indicating an ngx_pagespeed server]; bucket 3 is the number of responses received with an X-Page-Speed header and a header value in the PageSpeed Service format (a_b_c) [indicating a PSS server]; and bucket 4 is the number of responses received with an X-Page-Speed header and a header value in neither of the preceding formats [indicating some other server; IISpeed is the only known one at this stage].

histogram.name: Prerender.PagespeedHeader.VersionCounts
histogram.summary: The number of responses received that either have an X-Mod-Pagespeed header or have an X-Page-Speed header with a value in the X-Mod-Pagespeed format (a.b.c.d-e), bucketed into the range [1,99]: bucket 1 is for header values that aren't in the a.b.c.d-e format, the remaining buckets are an encoding of the value: 2 + 2 * (max(c, 10) - 10) + (d > 1 ? 1 : 0). The rationale is that 'c' is incremented with each new release and 'd' is initially 0 but is incremented for each patch to a release.

histogram.name: Prerender.PageviewEvents
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Types of pages rendered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PageVisitedStatus
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the user has ever visited (in the past) a URL for which a prerender is launched.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_Control
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is for all page loads for users who do not have prerendering enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_PrerenderMatchControl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is only for pages that would have been prerendered if the user had prerender enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_PrerenderMatchTreatment
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is for all prerendered page loads for users who have prerender enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_Treatment
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is for all page loads for users who have prerendering enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_WindowControl
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This particular histogram is for all page loads within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is seen for users who do not have prerendering enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPageLoadTime_WindowTreatment
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load pre navigation.
This particular histogram is for all page loads within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is seen for users who have prerendering enabled.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLT
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all pages loaded in a session.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMiss
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for the first page load completing immediately after a prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissAnyOnly
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where only Any triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissBoth
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where both triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissNonOverlapping
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for the first page load completing immediately after a prerender, but which has also started after the prerender has been initiated.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTFirstAfterMissNonOverlappingOnly
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
"FirstAfterMiss" means the first pageload after a prerender miss. There are two types: Any, and Non-overlapping. The latter only applies to page loads initiated after the prerender. This variable records cases where only Non-overlapping triggered.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTMatched
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded only for prerendered pages, or for pages which would have been prerendered in the control case.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTMatchedComplete
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded only for prerendered pages, or for pages which would have been prerendered in the control case.
In MatchedComplete, the prerender group also contains cancelled prerenders, so as to produce a perfect match of page views attributed this group in the prerender group with those attributed to this group in the control group.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTWindowed
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all page loads which happen within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is observed.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedPLTWindowNotMatched
histogram.summary:
Time from when a user navigates to a page to when it loads. Since the pages may start loading before the user navigates to it, this does not include any portion of load prior to navigation.
This is recorded for all page loads which happen within 30 seconds after a prefetch tag is observed and which do not correspond to a prerender tag.

histogram.name: Prerender.PerceivedTTFCPRecorded
histogram.summary: Whether the perceived Time to First Contentful Paint (TTFCP) was recorded successfully for a prerendered page. Since a prerendered page will start loading before a user navigates to it, the perceived TTFCP does not include an time prior to the user navigation. If true, there is an associated PrefetchTTFCP that records the TTFCP from the swapped-in navigation start. If false, no PrefetchTTFCP was recorded.

histogram.name: Prerender.PercentLoadDoneAtSwapin
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-09 as prerenders can no longer be 'used' (=='swapped-in').
histogram.summary: For prerenders that are swapped in, the percentage of the time from load start until the onload event fires that has elapsed at the time of the swapin.

histogram.name: Prerender.PeriodicCleanupDeleteContentsTime
histogram.summary: How long the cleanup portion of PrerenderManager::PeriodicCleanup takes, to measure jank.

histogram.name: Prerender.PeriodicCleanupResourceCheckTime
histogram.summary: How long the resource check portion of PrerenderManager::PeriodicCleanup takes, to measure jank.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrefetchAge
histogram.summary: Time between a prefetch or effective prefetch and the actual load of the page. For NoState prefetch, this is the time of the actual prefetch. For prerendering, it is the time that prerender began. For control groups in NoState prefetch experiments, it is the time that prefetch would have occurred.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrefetchTTFCP
histogram.summary: Time to first contentful paint (TTFCP) for navigations related to prefetch (including prerender, no-state prefetch, and associated experiments). This measures user-visible TTFCP. For no-state prefetch this is standard navigation-to-FCP; for prerender this is the time from navigation start when the prerender is swapped in to FCP.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrerenderCountOf3Max
histogram.summary: After launching a prerender, how many simultanious prerenders are recorded as running, out of a maximum of three.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrerenderNotSwappedInPLT
histogram.summary: For prerenders that finish loading before they are ever swapped in, their page load time until the onload event fires.

histogram.name: Prerender.PrerenderStartToReleaseContentsTime
histogram.summary: This is the time from when a prerendered page begins to load to when it is swapped in as the main page load. Recorded when the swap occurs, only on iOS.

histogram.name: Prerender.RelTypesLinkAdded
histogram.summary: For each prerender link added to a document, records the rel types present on the link element.

histogram.name: Prerender.RelTypesLinkStarted
histogram.summary: For each prerender in a document which starts prerendering, records the rel types present on the link element.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererIdleTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This is the time from when a prerendered page finishes loading to when it is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. When a page is displayed before it finishes loading, no value is recorded in this histogram.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLT
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a page, as measured by the renderer process. For non-prerendered pages, this is just BeginToFinish. For displayed prerendered pages, this is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererPerceivedPLTMatched
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Perceived load time of a prerendered page that is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. This is the time from when the prerendered page is moved into a TabContents until finish. "Finish" == after onload() and all resources are loaded. Note that this is 0 if the loading finishes before the page is moved into a TabContents.

histogram.name: Prerender.RendererTimeUntilDisplay
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between when the prerendering of a page starts and when the page is displayed, as measured by the renderer process. Prerendered pages discarded without being displayed are excluded from this count.

histogram.name: Prerender.SchemeCancelReason
histogram.summary: The detailed reason why a prerender is canceled with FINAL_STATUS_UNSUPPORTED_SCHEME

histogram.name: Prerender.Sessions
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Enumeration of how prerender was used per session.

histogram.name: Prerender.SessionStorageNamespaceMergeTime
histogram.summary: Time to perform the session storage namespace merge.

histogram.name: Prerender.SimulatedLocalBrowsingBaselinePLT
histogram.summary: For simulated local browsing prerendering, the baseline PLT of pages without any prerendering for pages that would be prerendered.

histogram.name: Prerender.SimulatedLocalBrowsingPLT
histogram.summary: For simulated local browsing prerendering, the estimated PLT of pages with prerendering enabled for pages that would be prerendered.

histogram.name: Prerender.TabContentsDeleterSuppressedDialog
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates how often we suppress a dialog from a tab when swapping it with a prerender.

histogram.name: Prerender.TabHelperEvent
histogram.summary: Enumeration of what events related to the TabHelper class have occurred.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeBetweenPrerenderRequests
histogram.summary: Time between subsequent prerender requests.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeSinceLastRecentVisit
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between the most recent visit to a URL and when an attempted prerender of the same URL is cancelled with FINAL_STATUS_RECENTLY_VISITED.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeToClick
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration that a user hovers a link before clicking on it.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeUntilUsed
histogram.obsolete: deprecated Nov 16 2012. See Prerender.TimeUntilUsed2, which has a larger range.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time from when a prerendered page is started to when it is first used due to user navigation. If the page is never used, it is not included in this histogram.

histogram.name: Prerender.TimeUntilUsed2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-09 as prerenders can no longer be 'used' (=='swapped-in').
histogram.summary: Time from when a prerendered page is started to when it is first used due to user navigation. If the page is never used, it is not included in this histogram.

histogram.name: Previews.ContextMenuAction.LoFi
histogram.summary:
User interactions with the Lo-Fi context menu options. These include:
Displays and clicks on the "Load image" and "Load images" context menu options. Count of pages where the user has clicked "Load image" at least once.

histogram.name: Previews.HintCacheLevelDBStore.LoadMetadataResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of loading the metadata while initializing the HintCacheLevelDBStore.

histogram.name: Previews.HintCacheLevelDBStore.Status
histogram.summary: Records each status change within the HintCacheLevelDBStore.

histogram.name: Previews.HintCacheStore.OnLoadHint.FetchedHintExpired
histogram.summary: Records that a fetched hint loaded from the store has expired. If expired, the hint is not provided.

histogram.name: Previews.HintsFetcher.GetHintsRequest.HostCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of hosts selected for sending a OnePlatform client hint request. This will be captured when any OnePlatform client hint request is initiated.

histogram.name: Previews.HintsFetcher.GetHintsRequest.NetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Net error codes for HintsFetch requests to the Optimization Guide Service on success and failure.

histogram.name: Previews.HintsFetcher.GetHintsRequest.Status
histogram.summary: For each HintsFetch request to the Optimization Guide Service, log the HTTP response code on success and failure.

histogram.name: Previews.HintsFetcher.TopHostProvider.BlacklistSize.OnInitialize
histogram.summary: Records the number of hosts placed on the HintsFetcherTopHostBlacklist when it is initialized.

histogram.name: Previews.HintsFetcher.TopHostProvider.BlacklistSize.OnRequest
histogram.summary: Records the number of hosts on the HintsFetcherTopHostBlacklist when top hosts are requested.

histogram.name: Previews.InfoBarAction
histogram.summary:
User interactions with the previews "Saved data" infobar. These include:
Displays of the infobar and clicks on the "Load original" link. Whether the infobar was dismissed by navigation or the user clicking on "X" close button.

histogram.name: Previews.InfoBarTimestamp
histogram.summary: Whether the timestamp for a stale preview was shown on the infobar. If the timestamp was not shown, states the reason why.

histogram.name: Previews.Offline.CommittedErrorPage
histogram.obsolete: Offline Previews functionality removed in M86.
histogram.summary: Whether or not an offline preview that was committed showed an error page. This metric is recorded every time an offline preview is committed.

histogram.name: Previews.Offline.FalsePositivePrevention.Allowed
histogram.obsolete: Offline Previews functionality removed in M86.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the navigated URL was allowed to trigger an offline preview. This is done by checking an in-memory cache of all available offline previews which is designed to prevent false positive triggering. This metric is recorded on every preview eligible navigation when the OfflinePreviewsFalsePositivePrevention feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Previews.Offline.FalsePositivePrevention.PrefSize
histogram.obsolete: Offline Previews functionality removed in M86.
histogram.summary: The number of entries in the false positive prevention pref. This is recorded every time we update the pref from a DB query, at most once per session.

histogram.name: Previews.OmniboxLiteStringShown
histogram.summary:
Whether the verbose status string was shown on a Preview page. This is recorded on every transition from a non-preview page to a preview page. An entry of false means that the Previews Icon appeared without the "Lite" string only because there was not enough room to show the string.
Note that it is possible for the Lite string to not be shown on the page after true is recorded if the user rotates their device or enters multi-window mode while viewing the page, or the converse.

histogram.name: Previews.OptimizationFilterStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of OptimizationGuide.OptimizationFilterStatus as of 07/2019.
histogram.summary: Status of processing OptimizationFilter configurations for server-provided blacklists. Recorded when the PreviewsOptimizationGuide receives a notification to process hints.

histogram.name: Previews.OptimizationGuide.HintCache.FetchedHint.TimeToExpiration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of OptimizationGuide.HintCache.FetchedHint.TimeToExpiration as of 08/2019.
histogram.summary: The remaining time a fetched hint that was loaded for use has before it expires and is removed from the hint cache store.

histogram.name: Previews.OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HasHint.AtCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HasHint.AtCommit as of 08/2019.
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type when the optimization guide hint cache has a hint entry for a URL's host at commit time.

histogram.name: Previews.OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HasHint.BeforeCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HasHint.BeforeCommit as of 08/2019.
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type when the optimization guide hint cache has a hint entry for a URL's host before commit time (e.g., at original navigation time or redirected navigation time).

histogram.name: Previews.OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HintType.Loaded
histogram.summary: Records the store entry type of a hint when it is loaded from the hint cache store.

histogram.name: Previews.OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HostMatch.AtCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of OptimizationGuide.HintCache.HostMatch.AtCommit as of 08/2019.
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type when the optimization guide hint cache has a loaded hint entry matching a URL's host at commit time. This is recorded regardless of whether an associated preview type is allowed for the navigation or not. If no associated preview type is allowed, the hint will not be loaded from a backing store, so this will only capture matches for in-memory hints.

histogram.name: Previews.OptimizationGuide.HintCache.PageMatch.AtCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of OptimizationGuide.HintCache.PageMatch.AtCommit as of 08/2019.
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type when the optimization guide hint cache has a loaded page hint for a URL at commit time. This is recorded regardless of whether an associated preview type is allowed for the navigation or not. If no associated preview type is allowed, the hint will not be loaded from a backing store, so this will only capture matches for in-memory hints.

histogram.name: Previews.OptOut.DBRowCount
histogram.summary: The number of rows in the Previews opt out SQLite table at profile startup.

histogram.name: Previews.OptOut.SQLiteLoadError
histogram.summary: The SQLite error code that the previews opt out store saw when trying to open the SQLite database. This is logged when an unexpected error occurs when trying to open the database file.

histogram.name: Previews.ProcessHintsResult
histogram.summary: Whether processing the previews hints succeeded and if any previews hints were found. Recorded when the PreviewsOptimizationGuide receives a notification to process hints.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.BlacklistReasons
histogram.summary: The reason that a navigation is blacklisted from loading a server lite page preview by a dynamic blacklist. Recorded only after the observed navigation has passed static eligibility checks.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.HostBlacklistedOnBypass
histogram.summary: Whether or not the server directed Chrome to blacklist the requested host on a bypass response.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.HttpOnlyFallbackPenalty
histogram.summary: The time spent on a navigation request that loaded a fallback signal from the lite page previews server. This does not include any penalty incurred because of network errors.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.IneligibleReasons
histogram.summary: The reasons that a navigation is not eligible to be shown a server lite page preview by static eligibility checks. Each check is evaluated on every observed navigation when the feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.NotReportedNavigationRestartPenalty
histogram.obsolete: Removed November 2018 when PLM support was reverted.
histogram.summary: Every time a navigation is restarted on account of this preview we attempt to report the cumulative total penalty to page load metrics. This histogram tracks penalties that were not successfully reported. The penalty is the amount of time between the navigation start of the original (i.e.: user-initiated) navigation and the current navigation when this histogram is reported. This histogram is reported at the start of every navigation for every navigation seen by the Lite Page Redirect Navigation Throttle.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.Penalty
histogram.summary:
The lost time spent attempting a server lite page via canceling and restarting navigations. This value is the difference between the final navigation's start time and the start time of the original navigation. This metric is recorded everytime the Previews NavigationThrottle acts on a response, whether that is from the previews server or a network error.
This histogram is only recorded in M73 for the non-URLLoader implementation of this feature. For M72, refer to Previews.ServerLitePage.HttpOnlyFallbackPenalty which records this penalty for failure statuses only.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.PreconnectedToPreviewServer
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever lite page preview predictor preconnects to a URL. True is recorded when the URL that is preconnected is for the lite pages previews server, False is when the origin is preconnected.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.PredictorToggled
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the lite page preview predictor state is changed. True is recorded when preresolving or preconnecting starts and False is recorded when it stops.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.PreresolvedToPreviewServer
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever lite page preview preresolver preresolves a URL. True is recorded when the URL that is preresolved is for the lite pages previews server, False is when the origin is preresolved.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.ReportedNavigationRestartPenalty
histogram.obsolete: Removed November 2018 when PLM support was reverted.
histogram.summary: Every time a navigation is restarted on account of this preview we attempt to report the cumulative total penalty to page load metrics. This histogram tracks penalties that were successfully reported. The penalty is the amount of time between the navigation start of the original (i.e.: user-initiated) navigation and the current navigation when this histogram is reported. This histogram is reported at the start of every navigation for every navigation seen by the Lite Page Redirect Navigation Throttle.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.ServerNetError
histogram.summary: The net error from connecting to the previews server. Recorded every time a connection to the server is finished.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.ServerNetError.AfterCommit
histogram.summary: The net error from connecting to the previews server after commit. Recorded every time a connection to the server is finished after commit.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.ServerNetError.BeforeCommit
histogram.summary: The net error from connecting to the previews server before commit. Recorded every time a connection to the server is finished before commit.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.ServerResponse
histogram.summary: The type of response given by the previews server when a server lite page preview was triggered.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.ToggledPreresolve
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever the lite page preview preresolver state is changed. True is recorded when preresolving starts and False is recorded when it stops.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.Triggered
histogram.summary: Whether or not the server lite page preview is triggered. Recorded on every observed navigation when the feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Previews.ServerLitePage.URLLoader.Attempted
histogram.summary: Whether or not the server lite page preview was attempted during a navigation. Recorded when the lite page URLLoader feature is enabled, during any leg of the navigation (redirects trigger recording the histogram).

histogram.name: Previews.StalePreviewTimestampShown
histogram.obsolete: Stale timestamp functionality removed in M86.
histogram.summary: Whether the timestamp for a stale preview was shown on the UI. If the timestamp was not shown, states the reason why.

histogram.name: Previews.Triggered.EffectiveConnectionType
histogram.summary: Records the effective connection type of a navigation that triggers a preview. This is captured for slow page preview types - that is, ones that support variable thresholds depending on matching a page pattern in the optimization guide hints.

histogram.name: PrinterService.PrinterServiceEvent
histogram.summary: Count of events in PrinterService on Chrome OS related to USB printers.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.EmptyNetworkAutomaticSetupEventSource
histogram.summary: Records the source from which a network printer was configured in Chrome OS if it was setup automatically with unpopulated make and model fields. Used to determine the source pathway from which printers without any make and model information are able to be setup automatically with a PPD.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.EmptyUsbAutomaticSetupEventSource
histogram.summary: Records the source from which a USB printer was configured in Chrome OS if it was setup automatically with unpopulated make and model fields. Used to determine the source pathway from which printers without any make and model information are able to be setup automatically with a PPD.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.InvalidPpdResolved
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 because it is not longer needed (Issue 1046125).
histogram.summary: Records when a synced printer's invalid PPD reference has been resolved by stripping off the autoconf flag. Recorded during initial sync across PrintersSyncBridge.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.PpdSource
histogram.obsolete: Most users do not provide their own PPDs.
histogram.summary: Records the source of PostScript Printer Description files used during printer setup. Entries are recorded for every attempted configuration. Only recorded on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.PrintJobDatabaseEntries
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: The number of entries in the print job database. Recorded when the database is initialized.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.PrintJobDatabaseEntrySize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: The size in bytes of the entry in the print job database. Recorded every time when new print job is written to the database.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.PrintJobDatabaseLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to fetch compeleted print jobs from the database.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.PrintJobDatabasePrintJobSaved
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether we were successful performing saving print job database operation.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.PrintJobDatabasePrintJobsDeleted
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether we were successful performing deleting print jobs database operation.

histogram.name: Printing.CUPS.PwgRasterDocumentResolutionSupported
histogram.summary: Records whether a printer supports the pwg-raster-document-resolution-supported attribute.

histogram.name: Printing.FrameIsActiveOnCreateLoaderFactory
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 2020-06. kUseFrameAssociatedLoaderFactory has shipped in M83 and Printing.FrameIsActiveOnCreateLoaderFactory is true in 100% of cases on all platforms.
histogram.summary: Records whether the associated frame is active when PrepareFrameAndViewForPrint::CreateURLLoaderFactory is called. If it is always active we want to replace the CreateFailingURLLoaderFactory call with a DCHECK.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.FontType
histogram.summary: Count of font file formats embeeded in print preview PDFs. These numbers are biased by what the platforms supports in terms of detection.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.GcpPromo
histogram.summary: Actions performed by the user when the Google Cloud Print add-printers promotion is shown to the user.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.InitiatedByScript
histogram.summary: Logged when a document calls the window.print() API. The boolean value indicates whether it is invoked by the main frame. It will be false for documents in subframes.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.OutOfProcessSubframe
histogram.summary: Logged when a document calls the window.print() API in any frame. The boolean value will be true when the API call is invoked by a document which is in a process different than the top level document. It will be false in all other cases.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.Initial
histogram.summary: The page count of the initial print preview, a.k.a. the total number of pages in documents to be printed.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.OpenInMacPreview
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to PDF and opened in Preview.app on Mac.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToCloudPrint
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to a cloud printer.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToCloudPrintWebDialog
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to a cloud printer using web dialog.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToGoogleDrive
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to Google Drive.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToPDF
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to PDF.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintToPrinter
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to a printer.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintWithExtension
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to an extension printer (using printerProvider API).

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.PrintWithPrivet
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed to a privet printer.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PageCount.SystemDialog
histogram.summary: The final page count (after page selection) of documents printed using system dialog.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PdfAction
histogram.summary: Actions taken on the PDF viewer inside Print Preview's preview area.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.PreviewEvent
histogram.summary: Print preview events.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.SiteIsolation.CrossSiteFrameCount
histogram.summary: The number of cross-site frames contained in a document being printed, as defined by comparing scheme and eTLD+1.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.SiteIsolation.CrossSiteVisibleFrameCount
histogram.summary: The number of cross-site visible frames contained in a document being printed.

histogram.name: PrintPreview.SiteIsolation.RemoteFrameCount
histogram.summary: The number of out-of-process frames contained in a document being printed.

histogram.name: Privacy.ConsentAuditor.UserEventServiceReady
histogram.summary: Logs whether the UserEventServiceReady is ready when recording a consent. This should always be true as the service is created at startup.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.FlagOverrodeRemoteSessionCheck
histogram.obsolete: The check seems to be needed for as long as Windows 7 is supported. Removed 2020-05.
histogram.summary: Measure how often the automatic recognition for terminal services environment would have incorrectly decided that the job object should be applied, when it shouldn't have been as dictated by the flag --allow-no-sanbox-job. This histogram will guide the final removal of the flag, which will be possible when the number of false values becomes insignificant.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.PolicyGlobalSize
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by PolicyGlobalSizeOnSuccess as failure cases were uninteresting. Removed 2020-04.
histogram.summary: Size of policy global memory used when policy was committed on Windows for all outcomes. 0 indicates that no rules were used.

histogram.name: Process.Sandbox.PolicyGlobalSizeOnSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Policy size reduced, metric no longer required. Removed 2020-06.
histogram.summary: Size of policy global memory used when policy was committed after successful process start on Windows. 0 indicates that no rules were used.

histogram.name: ProductTour.IOSScreens
histogram.summary: The time spent in product tour screens for ios.

histogram.name: Profile.AuthResult
histogram.obsolete: Not accessed in months. All results say "authentication was unnecessary". Removed 2020-03.
histogram.summary: Counts of authorization results when trying to open a locked profile from the User Manager.

histogram.name: Profile.AvatarLoadStatus
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of M87.
histogram.summary: Load status of an avatar for decorating the Windows taskbar

histogram.name: Profile.CreateAndInitializeProfile
histogram.summary: Length of time to setup profile.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateBrowserContextServicesTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the CreateBrowserContextServices call within OnPrefsLoaded.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateProfileHelperTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ProfileManager::CreateProfileHelper. This is called when a profile is created synchronously (usually at startup).

histogram.name: Profile.CreateTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Back-end time elapsed while creating a new profile. The max is 30 seconds, when an external timeout was applied.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateTimeCanceled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed before the user decided to cancel creation of a new profile. Since only managed-user profile creation can be canceled, this time comes from managed-user registration. The max is 30 seconds, when an external timeout was applied.

histogram.name: Profile.CreateTimeCanceledNoTimeout
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from when the handler received the message that a user clicked 'Create' until the user decided to cancel creation of a new profile. Since only managed-user profile creation can be canceled, this time comes from managed-user registration.

histogram.name: Profile.DesktopMenu
histogram.summary: Track user interactions that can be performed in the user menu and user manager. The origin of the action, whether the an interaction in the content area or some other source, is noted in the histogram suffix.

histogram.name: Profile.GetProfile
histogram.summary: Length of time to retrieve profile.

histogram.name: Profile.GetProfileInfoPath.OutsideUserDir
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. There are no recordings of this event since M83.
histogram.summary: Whether Profile::GetProfileInfoPath is called with a profile that does not have the user data directory as a parent directory. This is expected to never happen, but there are a few events recorded on stable as of M80. This metric should be removed once http://crbug.com/981374 is fixed.

histogram.name: Profile.InitProfileUserPrefs.OutsideUserDir
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020. There are no recordings of this event since M83.
histogram.summary: Whether Profile::InitProfileUserPrefs is called with a profile that does not have the user data directory as a parent directory. This is expected to never happen, but there are a few events recorded on stable as of M80. This metric should be removed once http://crbug.com/981374 is fixed.

histogram.name: Profile.LaunchBrowser
histogram.summary: Number of times users launch a browser window from either a primary or secondary profile (i.e., each time a browser window is opened we log which type of profile it belongs to).

histogram.name: Profile.LockedProfilesDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2019. We do not lock profiles anymore.
histogram.summary: How long locked profiles have been locked for. This is logged each time any profile is loaded. Note that this does not track the total time the profile was locked, but rather the span from when the profile was locked to when the measurement takes place.

histogram.name: Profile.NewAvatarMenu.NotYou
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-10-16. No longer tracked. Feature removed.
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions with the 'Not You?' bubble that users can navigate to from the Upgrade bubble after upgrade to the New Avatar Menu.

histogram.name: Profile.NewAvatarMenu.Signin
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-10-19. No longer tracked. Feature removed.
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions with the signin bubble that appears in the New Avatar Menu upon signin. This bubble appears after the user signs in using the Inline Signin flow.

histogram.name: Profile.NewAvatarMenu.Upgrade
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-10-16. No longer tracked. Feature removed.
histogram.summary: Tracks user interactions with the bubble that appears for users in the new avatar menu after upgrade.

histogram.name: Profile.NotifyProfileCreatedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the Notify() of NOTIFICATION_PROFILE_CREATED during ProfileImpl::DoFinalInit().

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfProfilesAfterAddOrDelete
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2013-04-09. No longer tracked. See Profile.NumberOfProfiles.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of profiles on a user's machine whenever a profile is added or deleted.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfProfilesOnStartup
histogram.obsolete: Removed; replaced by Profile.NumberOfProfiles on 2013-04-09. Data are suspect, especially after 2012-02-24: see https://crbug.com/189213.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of profiles on a user's machine when Chrome starts up.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfSignedInProfilesOnStartup
histogram.summary: Counts the number of profiles that are signed in to Chrome when Chrome starts up.

histogram.name: Profile.NumberOfSwitches
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times profiles were switched in a browser session. This value is incremented when a profile is switched to and the result is logged during shutdown.

histogram.name: Profile.OnLocaleReadyTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ProfileImpl::OnLocaleReady. This happens once after profile was loaded.

histogram.name: Profile.OnPrefsLoadedTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ProfileImpl::OnPrefsLoaded.

histogram.name: Profile.Opening
histogram.obsolete: Removed because it did not present the information clearly.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The frequency of ways that the profiles are opened.

histogram.name: Profile.OpenMethod
histogram.summary: The frequency with which the user opens the different profile menus or switches profiles. For the open statistics, this does not mean the user necessarily opened a profile after clicking. The switch statistics indicate how often and how the user switches profiles. They are provided together for comparison of how often the user actually switches after opening the avatar bubble menu.

histogram.name: Profile.ProfileImplDoFinalInit
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the ProfileImpl::DoFinalInit().

histogram.name: Profile.RemoveUserWarningStatsTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2020 since the histogram indicators were stable.
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during profile statistics calculation.

histogram.name: Profile.SupervisedProfileCreateError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The error code generated in the final step (registration step) of creating a new supervised profile.

histogram.name: Profile.SupervisedProfileImportError
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The error code generated in the final step (registration step) of importing a supervised profile.

histogram.name: Profile.SupervisedProfileTotalCreateTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from when the handler received the message that a user clicked 'Create' to create a new supervised user profile until the registration ends either successfully or with a failure (both recorded in Profile.SupervisedProfileCreateResult).

histogram.name: Profile.SupervisedProfileTotalImportTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed from when the handler received the message that a user clicked 'Import supervised user' until the registration ends either successfully or with a failure (both recorded in Profile.SupervisedProfileImportResult).

histogram.name: Profile.Sync
histogram.obsolete: Removed because it did not present the information clearly.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Activity of the user with regards to sync.

histogram.name: Profile.SyncSignIn
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 as this histogram is not of sufficient value anymore. It only records events made through the advanced settings dialog which are very rare and not representative for most analysis purposes.
histogram.summary: Number of times the user signed into sync from original or secondary profile.

histogram.name: Profile.ThumbnailsSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of the thumbnails database.

histogram.name: Profile.TimeToOpenUserManager
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Replaced by Profile.TimeToOpenUserManagerUpTo1min with the max time increased from 10 seconds to 1 minute.
histogram.summary: Time required to open the UserManager, from when it started to show until when its javascript started executing.

histogram.name: Profile.UpdateTaskbarDecoration.Win.Result
histogram.summary: Record the result of updating taskbar decoration on Windows.

histogram.name: Profile.UpgradeEnrollment
histogram.summary: The process which leads a user to enroll in New Profile Management. Also tracks if the user chooses to opt out, and tutorials which guide the user into New Profile Management.

histogram.name: ProfileReset.SendFeedback
histogram.summary: Signifies if the user selected "Send feedback" checkbox in the Reset Profile dialog.

histogram.name: Protector.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Errors that Protector detects about default search provider in Web Data. Reported once when Web Data is loaded.

histogram.name: Protector.Preferences
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Errors that Protector detects about protected settings in Preferences. Reported once when profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Protector.SearchProvider
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When the default search provider setting is changed outside of Chrome, which is detected by the Protector, this histogram reports the new setting.

histogram.name: Protector.StartupSettings
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: When the startup settings are changed outside of Chrome, which is detected by the Protector, this histogram reports the new setting.

histogram.name: ProxyOverriddenBubble.ExtensionCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 9/2016. Never added to histograms.xml and value is always 1.
histogram.summary: The number of extensions overriding the proxy, triggering the proxy override extension warning bubble.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.BlinkGCKB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of the BlinkGC allocator after a background renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.DiscardableKB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of the discardable memory after a background renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.MallocMB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of the malloc after a background renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.PartitionAllocKB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of PartitionAlloc after a background renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.TotalAllocatedMB
histogram.summary: The sum of the memory usages of PartitionAlloc, malloc, discardable memory, mainThreadIsolate() and BlinkGC allocator after a backgrounded renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.Memory.V8MainThreadIsolateMB
histogram.summary: The memory usage of mainThreadIsolate() after a backgrounded renderer is purged and suspended. Note: this metric is for A/B testing.

histogram.name: PurgeAndSuspend.PendingTaskCount
histogram.summary: This records how many tasks are still in task queues when a backgrounded renderer is suspended.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.QueuedMessagesCount
histogram.summary: When a message arrives for a lazy subscription and Chrome isn't in the foreground, it is persisted on disk until next time Chrome is in the foreground. This is recorded before adding the message the persisted queue to estimate how large does the queue grow.

histogram.name: PushMessaging.TimeToCheckIfSubscriptionLazy
histogram.summary: When a message arrives to a subscription while Chrome is in the background, the subscription is checked first for being lazy, and accordingly the message is forwarded or persisted on disk. Since this check may require disk access, this histogram measures the time spent in checking if the subscription is lazy.

histogram.name: Quota.DaysSinceLastAccess
histogram.summary: The number of days since an origin's data was last accessed. Logged upon access when the time since last access is at least 24 hours.

histogram.name: Quota.ErrorsOnEvictingOriginPerHour
histogram.summary: Number of errors on evicting origin by QuotaTemporaryStorageEvictor in an hour.

histogram.name: Quota.ErrorsOnGettingUsageAndQuotaPerHour
histogram.summary: Number of errors on getting usage and quota by QuotaTemporaryStorageEvictor in an hour.

histogram.name: Quota.EvictedOriginTimeSinceAccess
histogram.summary: The time since the evicted origin was last accessed. Logged when the origin is evicted.

histogram.name: Quota.FreeDiskSpaceForProfile
histogram.summary: Amount of free disk space for profile directory.

histogram.name: Quota.InitialTemporaryGlobalStorageQuota
histogram.summary: Initial quota for global temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.LRUOriginTypes
histogram.summary: Types of origins that are initially selected for eviction via LRU. Some of these types are exempt from eviction.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfPersistentStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of origins using persistent storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfProtectedPersistentStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of protected origins using persistent storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfProtectedTemporaryStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of protected origins using temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfTemporaryStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of origins using temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfUnlimitedPersistentStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of unlimited origins using persistent storage.

histogram.name: Quota.NumberOfUnlimitedTemporaryStorageOrigins
histogram.summary: Number of unlimited origins using temporary storage.

histogram.name: Quota.PercentUsedForTemporaryStorage
histogram.summary: Percentage of the storage device that is being use for temporary storage. Logged at irregular intervals (during eviction).

histogram.name: Quota.TimeBetweenRepeatedOriginEvictions
histogram.summary: Time since an origin was last chosen to be evicted from the storage, recorded each time the origin is evicted (except for the first eviction).

histogram.name: Quota.TimeToGetSettings
histogram.summary: Time spent querying the embedder for the settings values. Logged at irregular intervals as the values are refreshed.

histogram.name: Quota.TimeToInitializeGlobalQuota
histogram.summary: Time spent initializing the global quota. Logged when the storage partition's quota manager is initialized.

histogram.name: Quota.UsageOverageOfTemporaryGlobalStorage
histogram.summary: Overage of the temporary global storage usage at beginning of an eviction round.

histogram.name: rappor.last_daily_sample
histogram.summary: Rappor.DailyEvent.IntervalType reported under the wrong name.

histogram.name: RecurrenceRanker.ConfigurationError
histogram.summary: Reports different kinds of misconfigurations of a RecurrenceRanker.

histogram.name: RecurrenceRanker.LogFileOpenType
histogram.summary: Records number of file opens for each file open type events.

histogram.name: RecurrenceRanker.SerializationError
histogram.summary: Reports various saving/loading errors for a RecurrenceRanker or RecurrencePredictor.

histogram.name: RecurrenceRanker.UsageError
histogram.obsolete: The cases this reported can no longer occur.
histogram.summary: Reports when a RecurrenceRanker is used in a way not supported by its underlying RecurrencePredictor.

histogram.name: Referrer.HeaderLength
histogram.obsolete: We successfully shipped a 4k restriction in M77, and no longer require the data on `referer` header length.
histogram.summary: The size of each outgoing request's 'Referer' header field's value, in bytes.

histogram.name: Render.Workers.MaxWorkerCountInRendererProcess
histogram.obsolete: Removed Dec 2016. This metric did not report the number of shared workers correctly, since it used the RenderProcessHostImpl ref counts, which in the shared worker case is more like a boolean flag (zero or one or maybe two) than the number of shared workers. So its results can be thought of as roughly the number of service workers only.
histogram.summary: Maximum number of workers (SharedWorker or ServiceWorker) that are simultaneously hosted in a single renderer process. Recorded when the renderer process host is being destructed.

histogram.name: Renderer.AcceleratedFixedRootBackground
histogram.obsolete: Removed May 2018. There are no longer accelerated fixed root backgrounds.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Keeps track of the number of main frame scrolls with an accelerated fixed root background, the number of main frame scrolls with an unaccelerated fixed root background, and the total number of main frame scrolls.

histogram.name: Renderer.DrawDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Scheduling.Renderer.DrawDuration. This metric did not differentiate between processes.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the compositor to draw a frame.

histogram.name: Renderer.DrawDurationOverestimate
histogram.summary: The amount by which the compositor's draw duration was overestimated in a particular frame (0 if the duration was perfectly predicted or underestimated).

histogram.name: Renderer.DrawDurationUnderestimate
histogram.summary: The amount by which the compositor's draw duration was underestimated in a particular frame (0 if the duration was perfectly predicted or overestimated).

histogram.name: Renderer.GpuLatency
histogram.summary: The delay between the compositor submitting a command to the GPU and that command executing on the GPU. This delay is measured once per frame.

histogram.name: Renderer.GpuLatencyOverestimate
histogram.summary: The amount by which GPU latency was overestimated in a particular frame (0 if the latency was perfectly predicted or underestimated).

histogram.name: Renderer.GpuLatencyUnderestimate
histogram.summary: The amount by which GPU latency was underestimated in a particular frame (0 if the latency was perfectly predicted or overestimated).

histogram.name: Renderer.LayoutMs
histogram.summary: Duration of the FrameView::performLayout trace event, which occurs at most once per frame.

histogram.name: Renderer.LineLayoutMs
histogram.summary: Amount of time spent doing line layout during FrameView::performLayout.

histogram.name: Renderer.PixelIncreaseFromTransitions
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: A lower-bound on the percentage increase in memory that would result from promoting all layers that have a webkit-transition on opacity or transform.

histogram.name: Renderer.unloadEventsDurationMS
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This measures how long all unload event handlers required to run whenever an unload event is processed.

histogram.name: Renderer.WKWebViewCallbackAfterDestroy
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2019 as it is no longer hit or recorded.
histogram.summary: [iOS] Counts the number of times a WKNavigationDelegate callback was called after the CRWWebController was closed. This is unexpected and could be the cause of many crashes. If this histogram is ever logged, it means that Chrome needs to gracefully handle the case when WKNavigationDelegate callbacks are called for a destroyed web controller. Only logged on iOS.

histogram.name: Renderer2.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a document finished loading to when all it's resources are also loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFinish
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFinish_L
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToFirstLayout
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to its first layout.

histogram.name: Renderer2.RequestToStart
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page was requested by a user to when it starts loading.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page started loading to when it is fully loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFinishDoc
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page starts loading to when the main document is finished loading.

histogram.name: Renderer2.StartToFirstLayout
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The time from when a page starts loading to its first layout.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Abandoned
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Distribution of actual finished pages, vs abandoned pages, where we needed to declare a finish time prematurely since the page was being closed (exited).

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelContentPaintDurationMS
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect non-root layers.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelContentPaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect non-root layers.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelDoDeferredUpdateDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time between frames when GPU acceleration is active.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelRootPaintDurationMS
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect the root layer.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AccelRootPaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when GPU acceleration is active, for paints that affect the root layer.

histogram.name: Renderer4.AnimationCallbackDelayTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from when the animation callback was posted to when it ran.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "commit." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFinishDoc
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFirstPaint
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "begin" to "first paint." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.BeginToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "big" to "first paint after load." "Begin"== "request" if user requested, and "start" otherwise. "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Browser.PartialRasterPercentageSaved
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of M80. Partial raster has shipped for a long period of time / is not being tuned.
histogram.summary: Percentage of pixels which would have been rastered, but were skipped due to the partial raster optimization. Logged for each raster task run in a Browser process. The histogram is suffixed by the RasterBufferProvider which is in use.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Browser.RasterTaskSchedulingDelay
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 11/2019. Replaced by Renderer4.Browser.RasterTaskSchedulingDelayNoAtRasterDecodes since the semantics changed: we used to count raster tasks that depended on at-raster image decodes, but this is no longer the case.
histogram.summary: The wall time elapsed between creating a raster task in the client and being ready to issue raster work to the driver in the GPU process. This includes time decoding and uploading images.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFinishDoc
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "finish doc." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "Finish doc" == main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFirstPaint
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint"== time when first paint operation was performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CommitToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "commit" to "first paint after load." "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CompositorScrollHitTestResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 12/2017. Renderer4.MainThreadGestureScrollReason and Renderer4.MainThreadWheelScrollReason could track more detailed reasons of main thread scrolling.
histogram.summary: It's possible for compositor hit testing to determine conclusively that compositor thread scrolling can or cannot be done. It's also possible that the hit testing result is inconclusive. We would like to see the I-don't- know result as little as possible. This histogram tracks the ratios.

histogram.name: Renderer4.CompositorThreadImplDrawDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2018, M69. Renderer4.CompositorThreadImplDrawDelay is no longer needed due to issue 851784.
histogram.summary: Time between frames, as measured on the compositor thread. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountCulled
histogram.summary: Number of pixels that culling prevented being drawn to the screen, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountOpaque
histogram.summary: Number of pixels drawn to the screen and known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.drawPixelCountTranslucent
histogram.summary: Number of pixels drawn to the screen and not known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.FinishDocToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "finish doc" to "finish." "Finish doc"== main document loaded, before onload(). "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.FinishToFirstPaintAfterLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "finish " to "first paint after load." "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded. "First paint after load"== time after onload() when first paint operation is performed.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GestureScrollingThreadStatus
histogram.summary: For every touch scroll, we record whether the scroll occurred on the main thread, on the compositor thread, or on the compositor thread but blocked on the main thread. The last case will happen when there is a blocking event listener.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuImageUploadState.FirstRefWasted
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 06/2017. No longer generated.
histogram.summary: Indication whether the first ref of a GPU image upload was wasted (not used in raster). Images are uploaded prior to raster; this indicates whether the upload was used during the first ref.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuImageUploadState.Used
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 06/2017. No longer generated.
histogram.summary: Indication whether the GPU image upload was used in raster. Images are uploaded prior to raster; this indicates whether the upload was used during raster.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuRasterizationSlowPathsWithNonAAPaint
histogram.summary: If gpu rasterization is enabled, whether this page contains both slow-paths (making it suitable for MSAA) and non-AA paints (making it not-suitable for MSAA). This indicates a case where we would like to use MSAA, but may have to avoid it for correctness reasons.

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuRasterizationSuitableContent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019. Gpu rasterization is no longer dynamically triggerd by content.
histogram.summary: If gpu rasterization is enabled, whether the page contents contain no more than 5 slow paths, and is suitable for non-MSAA gpu rasterization (checked once after the page is painted for the first time).

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuRasterizationTriggered
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2019. Gpu rasterization is no longer dynamically triggerd by content.
histogram.summary: If gpu rasterization is enabled, whether it was triggered (checked once after the page is painted for the first time).

histogram.name: Renderer4.GpuRasterizationUsed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2019. Due to changes in the code, this is synonymous with Renderer4.GpuRasterizationEnabled.
histogram.summary: If gpu rasterization is enabled, whether it was actually used for the page (checked once after the page is painted for the first time).

histogram.name: Renderer4.IdealContentsScale
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2018. The ideal content scale closely matches the default device scale factor.
histogram.summary: The contents scale at which picture layer impl should be rasterized in order to appear crisp. This is also known as ideal contents scale. This value is recorded any time the ideal contents scale changes. Some examples of this are pinch-zoom and JavaScript transform changes.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ImageDecodeMipLevel
histogram.summary: The mip level at which images are decoded for rasterization in the renderer. This value is recorded each time an image is decoded in the compositor and records the mip level used for the decode. Note that the mip levels recorded lie between [1, 32], with the value of 1 indicating the use of the original image.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ImagePixelsPercentSRGB
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2020, expired and no longer useful.
histogram.summary: For each cc::Layer that has more than zero discardable images, this metric records the percent of image pixels that were from images that were originally specified in an sRGB color space.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ImagesPercentSRGB
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2020, expired and no longer useful.
histogram.summary: For each cc::Layer that has more than zero discardable images, this metric records the percent of images that were originally specified in an sRGB color space.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LanguageDetection
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2018, M69. Renderer4.LanguageDetection is no longer needed due to issue 851784.
histogram.summary: Time to determine the page language. This is done after the page has been loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LCDText.PercentageOfAALayers
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2015. No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The ratio of LCDText CC Layers / candidate LCDText layers. Recorded in LayerTreeHost, after LayerTreeHostCommon::CalculateDrawProperties() has computed the properties we need. Only recorded for the first 50 frames of every page.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LCDText.PercentageOfCandidateLayers
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2015. No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The ratio of CC Layers which are candidates for LCDText AA / total picture or content Layers. Recorded in LayerTreeHost, after LayerTreeHostCommon::CalculateDrawProperties() has computed the properties we need. Only recorded for the first 50 frames of every page.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LoadType
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Probability distribution for enumerated varieties of page loads.

histogram.name: Renderer4.LockExistingCachedImage
histogram.obsolete: Removes as of 6/2020. We now get enough cache hit information from Renderer4.SoftwareImageDecodeState* and don't need to divide it into tile bins.
histogram.summary: For each attempted lock of a cached image, records whether it was successful.
