histogram.name: Renderer4.MomentumScrollOrderingJankPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of input events which are janks (not processed in the expected frame) during each momentum scroll gesture due to unstable ordering of begin frame with regards to input delivery. Computed by tracking the number of times we coalesce an extra input event close to the point at which we process it. Added to track the impact of https://crbug.com/952930. Logged once after a scroll with momentum events completes.

histogram.name: Renderer4.pixelCountPainted
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Number of pixels painted by WebKit into main memory, recorded as 10 times the percentage of the viewport that these pixels cover. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.RasterSourceClearType
histogram.obsolete: Not used after M77. No longer tuning this code.
histogram.summary: The type of clear which was needed for each cc::RasterSource rasterized.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ReadyToDrawTileDrawStatus
histogram.summary: For each tile that was ready to draw at some point, logs whether the tile was actually used in a draw. This is logged at tile destruction time.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Renderer.PartialRasterPercentageSaved
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of M80. Partial raster has shipped for a long period of time / is not being tuned.
histogram.summary: Percentage of pixels which would have been rastered, but were skipped due to the partial raster optimization. Logged for each raster task run in a Renderer process. The histogram is suffixed by the RasterBufferProvider which is in use.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Renderer.RasterTaskSchedulingDelay
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of 11/2019. Replaced by Renderer4.Renderer.RasterTaskSchedulingDelayNoAtRasterDecodes since the semantics changed: we used to count raster tasks that depended on at-raster image decodes, but this is no longer the case.
histogram.summary: The wall time elapsed between creating a raster task in the client and being ready to issue raster work to the driver in the GPU process. This includes time decoding and uploading images.

histogram.name: Renderer4.RequestToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "finish." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.RequestToStart
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "request" to "start." "Request"== time when user requested document. "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ReservedMemory
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85 as no longer being needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the contiguous memory block reserved in the renderer so that large allocations are more likely to succeed. The reservation is currently made in BlinkInitializer.

histogram.name: Renderer4.ResourcePoolMemoryUsage
histogram.summary: Size of the in-use portion of the ResourcePool. Recorded each time resources are reclaimed after tile work completes.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Snapshot
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time to capture a renderer snapshot.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwareCompositorThreadImplDrawDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2018, M69. Renderer4.SoftwareCompositorThreadImplDrawDelay is no longer needed due to issue 851784.
histogram.summary: Time between frames when the software renderer is being used, as measured on the compositor thread. This is collected once per frame while it is being drawn to the screen in the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwareDoDeferredUpdateDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time between frames when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwarePaintDurationMS
histogram.obsolete: Removed in issue 755432 as no longer being needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent by WebKit painting the page, in milliseconds, when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.SoftwarePaintMegapixPerSecond
histogram.obsolete: Removed in issue 755432 as no longer being needed.
histogram.summary: WebKit paint throughput, measured in megapixels per second, when the page is not GPU accelerated.

histogram.name: Renderer4.StartToCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "commit." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Commit"== time when renderer got first byte of document.

histogram.name: Renderer4.StartToFinish
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time from "start" to "finish." "Start"== time when renderer requested load of document, after any unload of last document. "Finish"==after onload() and all resources are loaded.

histogram.name: Renderer4.TextureGpuUploadTimeUS
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: The number of microseconds it took to upload a tile's full texture as measured on the GPU process.

histogram.name: Renderer4.Thumbnail
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Time to capture a renderer thumbnail.

histogram.name: Renderer4.tileCountCulled_Upload
histogram.obsolete: Removed at an unknown time. No longer used in code.
histogram.summary: Number of tiles that culling prevented being uploaded to texture memory. This is an approximation and is recorded as a 100 times the percentage of the number of tiles, of default size, needed to cover the viewport. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountCulled
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2012, replaced with Renderer4.tileCountCulled_Upload.
histogram.summary: Number of pixels that culling prevented being uploaded to texture memory, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountOpaque
histogram.summary: Number of pixels uploaded to texture memory and known to be opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.uploadPixelCountTranslucent
histogram.summary: Number of pixels uploaded to texture memory and not known opaque, normalized to the viewport size. This is collected once per commit from WebKit to the compositor.

histogram.name: Renderer4.WheelScrollingThreadStatus
histogram.summary: For every wheel tick, we record whether the scroll occurred on the main thread, on the compositor thread, or on the compositor thread but blocked on the main thread. The last case will happen when there is a blocking event listener.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.BackgroundedRendererTransition
histogram.summary: Tracks the transitions of the renderer scheduler when it is backgrounded. Once it is backgrounded, it can be stopped after a timeout, stopped due to critical resources, resumed or foregrounded.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.BackgroundRendererMainThreadLoad
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load when renderer is backgrounded, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per minute per renderer amortized.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.BackgroundRendererMainThreadLoad2
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load when renderer is backgrounded, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per minute per renderer amortized.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeByFrameStatus
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeByFrameStatus2 as of Feb 2018. Buckets were changed.
histogram.summary: Expected queueing time split by tasks according to their frame status, in microseconds. The sum of the split values will be equal to the total, reported on RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration2. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeByFrameStatus2
histogram.summary: Expected queueing time split by tasks according to their frame status, in microseconds. The sum of the split values will be equal to the total, reported on RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration3. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeByFrameType
histogram.summary: Expected queueing time split by tasks according to their frame type. The sum of the split values should be equal to the total, reported on RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeByTaskQueue
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeByTaskQueue2 as of Feb 2018. Buckets were changed.
histogram.summary: Expected queueing time split by tasks according to the type of their task queue, in microseconds. The sum of the split values should be equal to the total, reported on RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration2. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeByTaskQueue2
histogram.summary: Expected queueing time split by tasks according to the type of their task queue, in microseconds. The sum of the split values should be equal to the total, reported on RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration3. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeByTaskQueueType
histogram.summary: Expected queueing time split by tasks according to the type of their task queue. The sum of the split values should be equal to the total, reported on RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedQueueingTimeWhenQueueingTime
histogram.summary:
Expected queueing time for events which were queued on the main thread longer or shorter than a threshold, given by the QueueingTimeThreshold suffix.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration
histogram.summary: The estimated queueing duration which would be observed for additional high priority tasks posted to the RendererScheduler. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration3 as of Feb 2018. Buckets were changed.
histogram.summary: The estimated queueing duration which would be observed for additional high priority tasks posted to the RendererScheduler, in microseconds. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration3
histogram.summary:
The estimated queueing duration which would be observed for additional high priority tasks posted to the RendererScheduler, in microseconds. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.
Do not modify this metric in any way without contacting speed-metrics-dev@chromium.org.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDurationWithoutMainFrame
histogram.summary:
The estimated queueing duration which would be observed for additional high priority tasks posted to the RendererScheduler, in microseconds, for renderer processes that do not host any main frame. Recorded for each 1000 ms window.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ForegroundRendererMainThreadLoad
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load when renderer is foregrounded, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per minute per renderer amortized.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.ForegroundRendererMainThreadLoad2
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load when renderer is foregrounded, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per minute per renderer amortized.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.MaxQueueingTime
histogram.summary:
The single maximum estimated queueing duration (or max queueing time) between when user starts navigation and user navigates away. Navigate-away is defined as a fast shutdown or a natural ending of renderer, or the new navigation start which replacing the old navigation.
The queueing time is estimated on a sliding window basis. The width of the sliding window is 1 second, the sliding step being 50ms. The max queueing time keeps track of the largest queueing time on each slide.
This metric resets itself at navigation start, updates the max of queueing time with the sliding window moving, reports the max queueing times to the histogram at the next navigation start of the same or different renderer process.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.NumberOfTasksPerQueueType
histogram.summary: The number of completed renderer tasks split per task queue type. Used to monitor usage of each type of task queue. Reported each time when task is completed.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.NumberOfTasksPerQueueType2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskCountPerQueueType as of July 2017.
histogram.summary:
The number of completed renderer tasks split per task queue type. Used to monitor usage of each type of task queue. Reported each time when task is completed.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.QueueingDurationWhenExpectedQueueingTime
histogram.summary:
Time between sending an event to the renderer main thread and when the renderer begins to process that event, for events which were dispatched when the expected queueing time was past some threshold.
Team: input-dev@chromium.org.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.RendererMainThreadLoad3
histogram.obsolete: This metric still used 1-minute reporting chunks. Replaced with RendererMainThreadLoad4 as of July 2017.
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load (percentage of time spent in tasks), reported in one minute chunks.
See http://bit.ly/chromium-renderer-main-thread-load-metric for details.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per second per renderer amortized.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.RendererMainThreadLoad4
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererMainThreadLoad5 as of August 2017.
histogram.summary:
Renderer main thread load (percentage of time spent in tasks), reported in one second chunks.
See http://bit.ly/chromium-renderer-main-thread-load-metric for details.
This metric is emitted when the renderer main thread task is completed or renderer is backgrounded or foregrounded, at most once per second per renderer amortized.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskCPUDurationPerTaskType.DedicatedWorker
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskCPUDurationPerTaskType2.DedicatedWorker as of June 2018 due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary:
Total duration of dedicated worker tasks (thread time) split by per thread type. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskCPUDurationPerThreadType
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskCPUDurationPerThreadType2 as of June 2018 due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary:
Total cpu time of renderer tasks split by per thread type. Wall time is tracked by RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerThreadType histogram. This histogram is used to compare CPU usage of tasks from different threads.
Only 1% of randomly sampled tasks have cpu time measured and report duration for this histogram.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerFrameOriginType
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerFrameOriginType2 as of June 2018 due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary:
Total cpu time of renderer tasks split by per frame origin type (main frame vs same-origin frame vs cross-origin frame).
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerFrameType
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerFrameType2 due to the introduction of new types of frames as of 11/2017.
histogram.summary:
Total duration of renderer per-frame tasks split per frame type. Used to monitor workload coming from different frames. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
This metric is susceptible to problematic outliers and should be analyzed with custom scripts accounting for that rather than from a dashboard.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerFrameType2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerFrameType3 as of June 2018 due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary:
Total duration of renderer per-frame tasks split per frame type. Used to monitor workload coming from different frames. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
This metric is susceptible to problematic outliers and should be analyzed with custom scripts accounting for that rather than from a dashboard.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerQueueType
histogram.summary:
Total duration of renderer tasks split per task queue type. Used to monitor usage of each type of task queues. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
This metric is susceptible to problematic outliers and should be analyzed with custom scripts accounting for that rather than from a dashboard.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerQueueType2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerQueueType3 as of June 2018 due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary:
Total duration of renderer tasks split per task queue type. Used to monitor usage of each type of task queues. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
This metric is susceptible to problematic outliers and should be analyzed with custom scripts accounting for that rather than from a dashboard.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerTaskType
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerTaskType2 as of June 2018 due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary:
Total duration of renderer per-frame tasks split per task type. Used to monitor usage of each task type. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
This metric is susceptible to problematic outliers and should be analyzed with custom scripts accounting for that rather than from a dashboard.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerTaskType.DedicatedWorker
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerTaskType2.DedicatedWorker as of June 2018 due to due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary:
Total duration of dedicated worker tasks (wall time) split by per thread type. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerThreadType
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerThreadType2 as of June 2018 due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary:
Total duration of renderer tasks split by per thread type. Used to compare CPU usage of tasks from different threads. Reported each time when task is completed and current accumulated duration is longer than 1ms.
Note that this metric discards tasks longer than 30 seconds because they are considered to be a result of measurement glitch.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerUseCase
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskDurationPerUseCase2 as of June 2018 due to overflows (crbug.com/809668). Some metrics are incremented with large amounts that they sometimes overflow and roll negative before they get uploaded.
histogram.summary: Total duration (measured in ms) of renderer main thread tasks split by scheduler use case. Use case is a scheduler's educated guess of the current state of the world. See renderer/use_case.h and RendererSchedulerImpl::UpdatePolicy for more details.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskQueueManager.DelayedTaskLateness
histogram.summary: The delta between when a delayed task was scheduled to run and when the RendererScheduler actually ran it. Note: to reduce overhead only 10% of tasks are sampled.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskQueueManager.ImmediateTaskQueueingDuration
histogram.summary: The queueing duration for non-delayed tasks posted to the RendererScheduler. This metric is only recorded if TrackingInfo::time_posted is set (i.e. not on android). Note: to reduce overhead only 10% of tasks are sampled.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TaskTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with RendererScheduler.TaskTime2 as of May 2017.
histogram.summary: The duration of every task queued in the _renderer_ scheduler to see the distribution of the task duration.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TimeRunningOtherAgentsWhileTaskReady
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2020. Summary of collected data: https://crbug.com/1019856#c6.
histogram.summary: Time spent running tasks from other agents between when an agent task becomes ready and when it starts running. A non-delayed task is ready when it is posted. A delayed task is ready when its delay expires. Recorded for 1 out of 1000 tasks.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.TimeRunningOtherFramesWhileTaskReady
histogram.summary: Time spent running tasks from other frames between when a frame task becomes ready and when it starts running. A non-delayed task is ready when it is posted. A delayed task is ready when its delay expires. Recorded for 1 out of 1000 tasks.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.UserModel.GestureDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of gestures (scrolls and pinches).

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.UserModel.GesturePredictedCorrectly
histogram.summary: Whether a user gesture was predicted correctly.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.UserModel.GestureStartTimeSinceModelReset
histogram.summary: Time between when the UserModel was last reset (which happens on navigation) and a gesture starting.

histogram.name: RendererScheduler.UserModel.TimeBetweenGestures
histogram.summary: Time between subsequent gestures (scrolls and pinches).

histogram.name: RenderFrameHostImpl.ReceivedPostMessageFromNonDescendant
histogram.summary: Record whether a local root frame ever received post messages from another cross origin frame that's not a descendent. This is useful to evaluate if a frame is safe to be reloaded automatically. Recorded when a frame crashed while invisible, and then becomes visible to the user; this is the point a crashed frame would be reloaded. Note this is not logged for the main frame, which only has descendant frames.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidChangeScrollOffset
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidChangeScrollOffset.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidClearWindowObject
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidClearWindowObject.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidCommitProvisionalLoad
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidCommitProvisionalLoad.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidCreateScriptContext
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidCreateScriptContext.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidFailProvisionalLoad
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidFailProvisionalLoad.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidFinishDocumentLoad
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidFinishDocumentLoad.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidFinishLoad
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidFinishLoad.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidMeaningfulLayout
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidMeaningfulLayout.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.DidStartProvisionalLoad
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.DidStartProvisionalLoad.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.FocusedNodeChanged
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.FocusedNodeChanged.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.OnMessageReceived
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.OnMessageReceived.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.ScriptedPrint
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.ScriptedPrint.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.WillCommitProvisionalLoad
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.WillCommitProvisionalLoad.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.WillSendSubmitEvent
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.WillSendSubmitEvent.

histogram.name: RenderFrameObservers.WillSubmitForm
histogram.summary: Cumulative time spent by all RenderFrameObservers in RenderFrameImpl.WillSubmitForm.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.OpenLinkAsUser
histogram.summary: State of the profile that is activated via the "Open Link as User" menu. Logged when one of the "Open Link as User" context menu options is selected.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.OpenLinkAsUserProfilesState
histogram.summary: Whether or not other profiles are active when the "Open Link as User" context menu is shown. Logged when the context menu is created.

histogram.name: RenderViewContextMenu.OpenLinkAsUserShown
histogram.summary: Count of the profiles shown for the "Open Link as User" context menu. Logged when the context menu is created.

histogram.name: Reporting.HeaderEndpointGroupOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to process a single endpoint group in a Report-To header once the header itself has been parsed.

histogram.name: Reporting.HeaderEndpointOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to process a single endpoint in a Report-To header once the header itself has been parsed.

histogram.name: Reporting.HeaderOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to process a Report-To header. Once it is parsed, Reporting.HeaderEndpointOutcome records the outcome of the endpoints within it.

histogram.name: Reporting.ReportDeliveredAttempts
histogram.summary: When Reporting successfully delivers a report, the number of unsuccessful delivery attempts that preceded the successful one.

histogram.name: Reporting.ReportDeliveredLatency
histogram.summary: The delivery latency of reports successfully delivered by Reporting. Starts when the report is queued and finishes when the delivery attempt returns successfully.

histogram.name: Reporting.ReportOutcome
histogram.summary: The outcome of Reporting trying to deliver a report, recorded when the report is finally erased from memory.

histogram.name: ReportingAndNEL.DBSizeInKB
histogram.summary: Size on disk of the Reporting and NEL database. This is recorded when the database is initialized, which typically happens upon the first network request after startup.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.DismissalState
histogram.summary: The state of the requestAutocomplete() dialog when it was dismissed.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.InitialUserState
histogram.summary: The initial state of a user that's interacting with a freshly shown requestAutocomplete() dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.PopupInDialog
histogram.summary: User interactions with the Autofill popup shown while filling an requestAutocomplete() dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.Security
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of security warnings and errors in the RequestAutocomplete dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration.Cancel
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up canceling out of the dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiDuration.Submit
histogram.summary: Measures the duration for which an requestAutocomplete() dialog was shown, in cases where the user ended up accepting the dialog.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiEvents
histogram.summary: Measures how users are interacting with the requestAutocomplete() dialog UI.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.UiLatencyToShow
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of time it takes for the requestAutocomplete() UI to be actionable by the user after it is shown.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.WalletErrors
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of errors in communicating with the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: RequestAutocomplete.WalletRequiredActions
histogram.summary: Measures the frequency of required user actions returned by the Google Online Wallet server.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.IPCPerMinute.Frame
histogram.summary: The number of IPCs from frame to GRC. Recorded every 1 minute.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.IPCPerMinute.Page
histogram.summary: The number of IPCs from page to GRC. Recorded every 1 minute.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.IPCPerMinute.Process
histogram.summary: The number of IPCs from process to GRC. Recorded every 1 minute.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.LocalDB.DatabaseInit
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Local Site Characteristics database.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.LocalDB.DatabaseInitAfterDelete
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Local Site Characteristics database after deleting it after a failed repair attempt.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.LocalDB.DatabaseInitAfterRepair
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Local Site Characteristics database after a repair attempt.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.LocalDB.DatabaseRepair
histogram.summary: The result of trying to repair the Local Site Characteristics database after a failed open.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.LocalDB.ObservationTimeBeforeFirstUse
histogram.summary: The cumulative observation time before a feature tracked in the Local Site Characteristics database gets used.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.LocalDB.OnDiskSize
histogram.summary: The size of the Local Site Characteristics database on disk. Recorded at startup when the database gets opened.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.LocalDB.ReadHasCompletedBeforeQuery
histogram.summary: Boolean indicating if the read operation from the Local Site Characteristics database has completed when we query for the characteristics of a site.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.Measurement.Duration
histogram.summary: The amount of wall-clock time a measurement cycle occupied.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.Measurement.Memory.ExtraProcesses
histogram.summary: The number of unexpected processes encountered during memory measurement. This is expected to be non-zero as new processes can be created after a measurement cycle is initiated, plus non-renderer processes are counted here at the moment.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.Measurement.Memory.LateNotification
histogram.summary: A boolean that measures how often a performance measurement notification arrives at a WebContents that has been re-navigated.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.Measurement.Memory.Outcome
histogram.summary: An enumeration indicating the outcome of each memory measurement attempt.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.Measurement.Memory.UnmeasuredProcesses
histogram.summary: The number of processes that didn't get a memory measurement. This can happen if processes die as or after measurement is initiated.

histogram.name: ResourceCoordinator.Measurement.TotalProcesses
histogram.summary: The number of processes that were measured for CPU at least.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.CountBlockedSubresourcePatterns
histogram.summary: The count of resource loading blocking patterns received by the renderer. Recorded every time resource loading hints mojom message is received. Recorded at most once per triggered navigation.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.PageHints.ProcessedCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2019 as it was never a useful metric.
histogram.summary: The count of page hints received by the browser from the component updater. Recorded every time a page hint is received by the browser from the optimization guide service.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.PageHints.TotalReceived
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2019 as it was never a useful metric.
histogram.summary: The total count of page hints received by the browser from the component updater. Only the page hints that have at least one resource loading hint are counted. One sample is recorded every time optimization guide service processes the optimization hints provided by the component updater. The count of hints loaded to memory may be lower than this.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.ResourceHints.TotalReceived
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2019 as it was never a useful metric.
histogram.summary: The total count of resource loading hints across all page hints received by the browser from the component updater. One sample is recorded every time optimization guide service processes the optimization hints provided by the component updater. The count of hints loaded to memory may be lower than this.

histogram.name: ResourceLoadingHints.ResourcePatternsAvailableAtCommit
histogram.summary: Records if the resource patterns were available at the time of page commit if the committed previews type was RESOURCE_LOADING_HINTS.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.CachePattern
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Like HttpCache.Pattern but only for requests made during speculative prefetch. Logged per successful request.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.DatabaseReadiness
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: This metric measures the host coverage of the predictor database: On each navigation, it records what percentage of the top X history entries are found in the predictor DB. Caveats: (1) This metric is only recorded once the user has accumulated enough browsing history, implemented as a minimum threshold of total page visits by the user. (2) This metric is sampled, so it's actually only recorded for 1 out of every K navigations.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.DbStringTooLong
histogram.summary: A boolean that used to indicate a corner case when certain resources are not written to the Predictor database becuase their URLs are too long. We monitor this number to ensure that we do not discard too many resources.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HavePredictionsForUrl
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates if the speculative resource prefetch predictor has predictions for a Navigation. This is updated on each navigations and helps us determine the coverage of the predictor.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HavePrefetchResults
histogram.summary: A boolean that used to indicate a corner case when we may not have prefetch results even though prefetching is enabled and predictions are present, because another navigation in the same tab canceled the prefetching of the previous load.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HistoryVisitCountForUrl
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: The visit count of a URL in the history database, measured when the onload fires for the URL. Helpful in figuring out what visit count should be used to start learning about a URL.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchCount
histogram.summary:
Assuming a fixed number (25 or 50) of URLs could be prefetched max, how many would be available for prefetch (after we apply our heuristics for picking subresources to prefetch for a navigation).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchFromCache
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the cache restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the network restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchFromNetworkPercentOfTotalFromNetwork
histogram.summary:
Similar to ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork but as a percent of the total number of resources the page actually fetched from the network. This depcits the major gains that we can get.
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PredictedPrefetchMisses
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page not used by the page, restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the host of the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchCancelled
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of prefetches cancelled as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFailed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of prefetches failed as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromCacheNotUsed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching but were not requested by the page, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromCacheUsedFromCache
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching and also came from the cache when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromCacheUsedFromNetwork
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching but came from the network when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromNetworkNotUsed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from network while prefetching but were not requested by the page, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromNetworkUsedFromCache
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from network while prefetching but came from the cache when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchFromNetworkUsedFromNetwork
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching and also came from the network when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Host.PrefetchNotStarted
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of resources that were prefetchable but were not prefetched as a percentage of prefetchable resources.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HostTableHostCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed January 2017. This is effectively the same as ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HostTableRowCount2 after refactoring of the predictor database.
histogram.summary: The count of number of unique hosts in the HostTable, i.e. the number of hosts that the database has prediction data for. This data is useful for determining the recall/precision as a function of the number of hosts that need to be tracked by the database. Measured at startup.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HostTableRowCount
histogram.summary: The count of number of rows in the HostTable. This is effecively the number of (host, resource URL) pairs in the database. This is measured at startup and used to get an estimate of the data size.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.HostTableRowCount2
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: The number of rows in the HostTable. This is effectively the number of hosts in the database. This is measured at startup and used to get an estimate of the data size.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.LearningCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has resources in the local database for a given navigation, the count of predicted urls.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.LearningPrecision
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has resources in the local database for a given navigation, the precision of the predictions, in percentage. This is computed as 100 \times \frac{correct predictions}{predictions}.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.LearningRecall
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has resources in the local database for a given navigation, the recall of the predictions, in percentage. This is computed as 100 \times \frac{correct predictions}{all prefetchable subresources}.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.MainFrameRequestStats
histogram.summary: Records stats about main frame navigations. Records the total number of requests/responses/redirects for main frame urls along with the numbers for how often the predictor can process such events. This is useful to figure out what percentange of requests are handled by the predictor and also for sanity checking the other stats.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.NavigationEvent
histogram.summary: Records stats about various interesting events such as - request start, response start, redirect, onload, etc during the load of a main frame. Essential for understanding the complete life of a navigation request start to the onload fire and the events that occur in between.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.NavigationStatus
histogram.summary: The status of various navigations from the view point of the 'onload' event. Since we measure the prediction accuracy and learn navigation subresources on the onload event, it is useful to know how many of the navigations are abandoned before 'onload' fires.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.NetworkType
histogram.summary: Records the number of pages on each type of network after a page is loaded.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PLT
histogram.summary:
Page load time. It starts from when the main frame URL request is sent out to when the main frame document load is completed.
This is recorded for both prefetched and non-prefetched pages.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: Assuming a fixed number of URLs could be prefetched max, how many would be available for prefetch (after we apply our heuristics for picking subresources to prefetch for a navigation).

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchFromCache
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the cache restricted to some max predictions.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the network restricted to some max predictions.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchFromNetworkPercentOfTotalFromNetwork
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: Similar to ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Predicted.PrefetchFromNetwork but as a percent of the total number of resources the page actually fetched from the network. This depcits the major gains that we can get.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PredictedPrefetchMisses
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2013. Replaced with specific ones for Url and Host.
histogram.summary: When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page not used by the page, restricted to some max predictions.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchedCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: The count of successfully prefetched subresources for a single page. Recorded after all subresource prefetches have reached a terminal success/failure state.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchedSizeKB
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: The total amount of data consumed by predictor for a single page. Only successfully finished requests taken into account. Recorded after all subresource prefetches have reached a terminal success/failure state.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchHitsCount.Cached
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Number of resources that were prefetched and requested by a page load, for cached requests. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchHitsCount.NotCached
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Number of resources that were prefetched and requested by a page load, for non cached requests. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchHitsSizeKB
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Amount of useful data fetched from the network for a prefetch request. This is the total size of the resources accounted for in ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchHitsCount.NotCached. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchingDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M72. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Amount of time available for prefetching. Specifically, this is a time interval between corresponding StartPrefetching() and StopPrefetching() calls. This is recorded for both prefetched and non-prefetched pages.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchMissesCount.Cached
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Number of resources that were prefetched but not requested by a page load, for cached requests. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchMissesCount.NotCached
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Number of resources that were prefetched but not requested by a page load, for non cached requests, that is waste. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchMissesSizeKB
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Amount of wasted data fetched from the network for a prefetch request. This is the total size of the resources accounted for in ResourcePrefetchPredictor.PrefetchMissesCount.NotCached. Logged after the prefetcher completes.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.RedirectStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: When the prefetch predictor has resources in the local database for a given navigation, records stats about whether redirect was predicted correctly or incorrectly.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.ReportingEvent
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M72. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Records stats about various interesting events such as - when partial or all of history is cleared. It will include events which do not necessarily happen during a navigation (which are reported in ResourcePrefetchPredictor.NavigationEvent).

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.RequestStats
histogram.summary: Records stats about requests, redirects, and responses observed by the LoadingPredictorObserver. These stats are useful as a baseline for other stats.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.ResourceStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 with the removal of the recording code.
histogram.summary: The distribution of the reasons for which subresources are ignored during prefetching. This helps us prioritze reasons we should further investigate to increase coverage. This is reported as a bit map and every status will be a bitwise or of the underlying reasons.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchCount
histogram.summary:
Assuming a fixed number of URLs could be prefetched max (25 or 50), how many would be available for prefetch (after we apply our heuristics for picking subresources to prefetch for a navigation).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchFromCache
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the cache restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page and served from the network restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchFromNetworkPercentOfTotalFromNetwork
histogram.summary:
Similar to ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchFromNetwork but as a percent of the total number of resources the page actually fetched from the network. This depcits the major gains that we can get.
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PredictedPrefetchMisses
histogram.summary:
When we have predictions for a navigation, we measure the accuracy of the predictions against the actual resources downloaded. This histogram gives the distribution of the predictions that were fetched by the page not used by the page, restricted to some max predictions (25 or 50).
This stat is recorded when the predictor uses the main frame url as the key for prediction.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchCancelled
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of prefetches cancelled as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFailed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of prefetches failed as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromCacheNotUsed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching but were not requested by the page, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromCacheUsedFromCache
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching and also came from the cache when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromCacheUsedFromNetwork
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching but came from the network when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromNetworkNotUsed
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from network while prefetching but were not requested by the page, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromNetworkUsedFromCache
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from network while prefetching but came from the cache when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchFromNetworkUsedFromNetwork
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on the main frame URL, the percentage of successful prefetches that came from cache while prefetching and also came from the network when the page requested it, as a percentage of the total number of resources that the predictor tried to prefetch.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.Url.PrefetchNotStarted
histogram.summary: For prefetching based on host of main frame URL, the percentage of resources that were prefetchable but were not prefetched as a percentage of prefetchable resources.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableMainFrameUrlCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed September 2016. This is effectively the same as ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableRowCount2 after refactoring of the predictor database.
histogram.summary: The count of number of unique main frame urls in the UrlTable, i.e. the number of webpages that the database has prediction data for. This data is useful for determining the recall/precision as a function of the number of webpages that need to be tracked by the database. Measured at startup.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableMainFrameUrlsDeletedNotInHistory
histogram.summary: The count of number of unique main frame urls that are deleted from the URL table at startup because they are no longer in history. Essential to figure out how much data we are loosing out.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableMainFrameUrlsDeletedNotInHistoryPercent
histogram.summary: Same as ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableMainFrameUrlsDeletedNotInHistory but recording percentage of URLs in the table rather than absolute numbers.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableRowCount
histogram.summary: The count of number of rows in the UrlTable. This is effecively the number of (main frame URL, resource URL) pairs in the database. This is measured at startup and used to get an estimate of the data size.

histogram.name: ResourcePrefetchPredictor.UrlTableRowCount2
histogram.obsolete: Removed at M66. No longer recorded.
histogram.summary: The number of rows in the UrlTable. This is effectively the number of main frame URLs in the database. This is measured at startup and used to get an estimate of the data size.

histogram.name: ResourceReporter.BrowserProcess.CpuUsage
histogram.summary: The CPU usage range reported for the browser process when the Chrome OS device memory pressure (which is the percentage of total memory used by the system) is critical. This is emitted only when memory pressure changes from a low pressure to a higher pressure.

histogram.name: ResourceReporter.BrowserProcess.MemoryUsage
histogram.summary: The system memory usage range reported for the browser process when the Chrome OS device memory pressure (which is the percentage of total memory used by the system) is critical. This is emitted only when memory pressure changes from a low pressure to a higher pressure.

histogram.name: ResourceReporter.GpuProcess.CpuUsage
histogram.summary: The CPU usage range reported for the GPU process when the Chrome OS device memory pressure (which is the percentage of total memory used by the system) is critical. This is emitted only when memory pressure changes from a low pressure to a higher pressure.

histogram.name: ResourceReporter.GpuProcess.MemoryUsage
histogram.summary: The system's RAM memory usage range reported for the GPU process when the Chrome OS device memory pressure (which is the percentage of total memory used by the system) is critical. This is emitted only when memory pressure changes from a low pressure to a higher pressure.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.ClientLoadedTime.Active
histogram.summary:
The amount of time between when the ResourceScheduler is informed of a Client's creation or starts loading and when that Client finishes loading in a Client which has been user-observable the entire time.
Note: Will not include time for the main resource if PlzNavigate is in use.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.ClientLoadedTime.Background
histogram.summary:
The amount of time between when the ResourceScheduler is informed of a Client's creation or starts loading and when that Client finishes loading in a Client which has been background the entire time.
Note: Will not include time for the main resource if PlzNavigate is in use.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.ClientLoadedTime.Other
histogram.summary:
The amount of time between when the ResourceScheduler is informed of a Client's creation or starts loading and when that Client finishes loading in a Client which has switched between Active and Background.
Note: Will not include time for the main resource if PlzNavigate is in use.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.ClientLoadedTime.Other.SwitchedToActive
histogram.summary:
The amount of time between the last time that a Client becomes user-observable and when that Client finishes loading in a Client that was user-observable when the load completed.
Note: Will not include time for the main resource if PlzNavigate is in use.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeDeferred.Active
histogram.summary: The amount of time the ResourceScheduler is throttling a request after WillStartRequest is called for a request in a client that was user-observable at creation and start time.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeDeferred.Background
histogram.summary: The amount of time the ResourceScheduler is throttling a request after WillStartRequest is called for a request in a client that was background at creation and start time.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeDeferred.Other
histogram.summary: The amount of time the ResourceScheduler is throttling a request after WillStartRequest is called on a request without a Client or a request in a Client which is in a different state since the request was made. Note that this won't capture requests which have switched state an even number of times. Switching from Active to Background back to Active will be recorded in the Active version of this histogram.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeThrottled.Active
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when the request was created and when the ResourceScheduler stops throttling the request in a client that was user-observable at creation and start time.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeThrottled.Background
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when the request was created and when the ResourceScheduler stops throttling the request in a client that was background at creation and start time.

histogram.name: ResourceScheduler.RequestTimeThrottled.Other
histogram.summary: The amount of time between when the request was created and when the ResourceScheduler stops throttling a request without a client or a request in a Client which is in a different state since the request was made. Note that this won't capture requests which have switched state an even number of times. Switching from Active to Background back to Active will be recorded in the Active version of this histogram.

histogram.name: RTCQuicStream.ReadIntoAmountBytes
histogram.summary: The amount of data that gets read out via each call to the RTCQuicStream readInto() API. The RTCQuicStream can record multiple ReadIntoAmountBytes in its lifetime.

histogram.name: RTCQuicStream.ReadIntoResult
histogram.summary: How data is read out with a finish (FIN) bit for each call to the RTCQuicStream readInto API. The RTCQuicStream can record multiple ReadIntoResults in its lifetime.

histogram.name: RTCQuicStream.WriteAmountBytes
histogram.summary: The amount of data that gets written via each call to the RTCQuicStream write() API. The RTCQuicStream can record multiple WriteAmountBytes in its lifetime.

histogram.name: RTCQuicStream.WriteUsage
histogram.summary: How data is written with a finish (FIN) bit for each call to the RTCQuicStream write() API. The RTCQuicStream can record multiple WriteUsages in its lifetime.

histogram.name: SadTab.Created
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Track number of times we built a sad tab page for a renderer crash or kill. The user may not have seen the page if it was not the frontmost tab.

histogram.name: SadTab.Displayed
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Track number of times the user actually saw a sad tab page for a renderer crash or kill.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ContentsSize.Height
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Was used to get a general sense of this value when planning visual features in PhishGuard pings.
histogram.summary: Records the height of content area when the user opens a new browser window or when the user finishes resizing a browser window.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ContentsSize.Width
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Was used to get a general sense of this value when planning visual features in PhishGuard pings.
histogram.summary: Records the width of content area when the user opens a new browser window or when the user finishes resizing a browser window.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.EnabledSettingChanged
histogram.summary: Records the user action that enables/disables safe browsing feature in the Settings page on Android.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.DynamicUpdateTypeCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M80 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary:
Number of file types (aka file extensions) present in the FileTypePolicies proto loaded.
This is for the file types loaded from the component-update system. This includes both those loaded from disk shortly after startup, and those received over the network when the component version changes

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FileTypeUpdate.ResourceBundleTypeCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M80 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary:
Number of file types (aka file extensions) present in the FileTypePolicies proto loaded.
This is for the file types loaded from the resource bundle packaged with Chrome, which is always loaded at startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FontSize.Default
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Was used to get a general sense of this value when planning visual features in PhishGuard pings.
histogram.summary: Records the default font size on user startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FontSize.DefaultFixed
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Was used to get a general sense of this value when planning visual features in PhishGuard pings.
histogram.summary: Records the default fixed font size on user startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FontSize.Minimum
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Was used to get a general sense of this value when planning visual features in PhishGuard pings.
histogram.summary: Records the minimum font size on user startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.FontSize.MinimumLogical
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Was used to get a general sense of this value when planning visual features in PhishGuard pings.
histogram.summary: Records the minimum logical font size on user startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GetV4HashHttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing Pver4 service. Logged after a GetHash or request finishes to capture the response code or error code for that call.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GetV4HashNetwork
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Safe Browsing servers for a V4 GetHash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.GetV4HashResult
histogram.summary: Track return status from V4 GetHash attempts. The buckets of this histogram overlap, so the counts cannot be used as percentages.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ModuleBaseRelocation
histogram.summary: A windows only historgram. Records when an unknown base relocation type is encountered while reading the reloc table of a loaded module.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NavigationObserver.IPAddressCleanUpCount
histogram.summary: Count of how many ResolvedIPAddresses get removed in each periodic clean up. This is a rough estimation of the number of IPs associated with main frame and sub-frame navigations every two minutes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.NotificationImageReporter.NetError
histogram.summary: The net error code for failed reports sent by NotificationImageReporter, or net::OK if successful.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ParseV4HashResult
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of a status 200 GetV4Hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ParseV4UpdateResult
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of a status 200 GetV4Update request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Scout
histogram.obsolete: Removed in or before M86. See SafeBrowsing.Pref.Extended
histogram.summary: Tracks the Extended Reporting preference transition. Suffixes track which opt-in text users are viewing and the values of each Extended Reporting preference. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Scout.Decision
histogram.obsolete: This is unused due to it being part of SBER1. Deprecated 06/01/2020.
histogram.summary: Tracks user decisions about the Extended Reporting opt-in on security interstitials by comparing the initial and final states of the preference. Suffixes specify the type of change that was made. Recorded when a user closes a security interstitial or navigates away.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Scout.SetPref
histogram.obsolete: Removed in or before M86. See SafeBrowsing.Pref.Extended.*
histogram.summary: Tracks the Extended Reporting preference being changed. Suffixes track which Extended Reporting preference was changed, and the specific UI that the change was made on. Recorded when a user changes the preference on any UI.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.Pref.Scout.Transition
histogram.summary: Tracks reasons for the Extended Reporting preference transition, such as a user entering an experiment group or seeing a security interstitial for the first time. Recorded for all non-Incognito profiles on profile startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ThreatReport.DomIsAmbiguous
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78 due to lack of use and utility. See crbug.com/975258
histogram.summary: A threat report contains a DOM hierarchy that is ambiguous. This indicates that the parent/child relationship among the elements in the DOM may not be accurate.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.ThreatReport.MaxNodesExceededInFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78 due to lack of use and utility. See crbug.com/975258
histogram.summary: Whether the threat report generated for a subframe of a page hit the maximum number of nodes. When this is true, the data from that frame will be truncated.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.Allowed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2020 since this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: File types that were allowed to be downloaded without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.AllowedByWhitelist
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2020 since this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: File types that were allowed to be downloaded without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing due to the requestor URL being on the Safe Browsing whitelist. Each sample recorded on this histogram is also recorded in SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.Allowed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.AllowedDueToDisabledService
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2020 since this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: File types that were allowed to be downloaded without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing due to the SafeBrowsing service being disabled. Each sample recorded on this histogram is also recorded in SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.Allowed.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.AlternateExtensionCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2020 since this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Count of alternate extensions that were supplied when attempting to download a file without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.UnverifiedDownloads.Blocked
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2020 since this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: File types that were blocked from downloaded without verifying their content nor their source URLs with Safe Browsing.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4AddUnlumpedHashes.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/25/2018 since it was not being used actively or monitored.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to copy the SafeBrowsing list update as a string, into a map which contains the hash prefixes that are looked up when a client queries for the reputation of a resource (URL, full hash, etc.).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4AddUnlumpedHashesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to copy the SafeBrowsing list update as a string, into a map which contains the hash prefixes that are looked up when a client queries for the reputation of a resource (URL, full hash, etc.).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ApplyUpdateResult
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying the update fetched from the PVer4 service for a particular store.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ApplyUpdateResultWhenReadingFromDisk
histogram.summary: Track the result of applying an update read from disk after parsing it successfully as a protobuf.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DecodeAdditionsResult
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of additions of 4-byte hash prefixes. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded additions.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DecodeAdditionsTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded additions to the blacklist into raw format.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DecodeRemovalsResult
histogram.summary: Track the result of decoding the Rice-encoded list of indexes of hash prefixes to remove since the last update. This is logged once per store, per update containing Rice-encoded removals.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4DecodeRemovalsTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded removals from the blacklist into raw format.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4FullHashCacheResult
histogram.summary: Track cache hits for V4 full hashes.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHashCheckResult
histogram.summary: Track get hash response hits for V4 full hash requests.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetHashNetwork.Time
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a full hash request.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetPrefixMatches.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of the TimeUs variant
histogram.summary: The time that it took to check a URL against our in-memory database. It is dominated by the time to perform checks for CheckBrowseUrl.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4GetPrefixMatches.TimeUs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2019 due to lack of use (Histogram Eraser).
histogram.summary:
The time that it took to check a URL against our in-memory database. It is dominated by the time to perform checks for CheckBrowseUrl. Note that this metric is recorded even for users with low resolution clocks.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4MergeUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to merge the existing state of the list with the update. The update may have been received from the server, or it may have just been read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.ApplyUpdate.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to process a SafeBrowsing list full update. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashes.Time for each prefix-sized list, and V4ProcessFullUpdate.MergeUpdate.Time. Additionally, if the update is Rice-encoded, it includes V4ProcessFullUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Time for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded additions to the blacklist into raw format when applying a full update to a store.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdate.MergeUpdate.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/25/2018 since it was not being used actively or monitored.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to merge the existing state of the list with a full update received from the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessFullUpdateTime
