histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to process a SafeBrowsing list full update. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashesTime for each prefix-sized list, and V4MergeUpdateTime. Additionally, if the update is Rice-encoded, it includes V4DecodeAdditionsTime for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.ApplyUpdate.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to process a SafeBrowsing list partial update. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashes.Time for each prefix-sized list, and SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.MergeUpdate.Time. Additionally, if the update is Rice-encoded, it includes V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeRemovals.Time, and V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Time for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeAdditions.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded additions to the blacklist into raw format when applying a partial update to a store.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.DecodeRemovals.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded removals from the blacklist into raw format when applying a partial update to a store.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdate.MergeUpdate.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/25/2018 since it was not being used actively or monitored.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to merge the existing state of the list with a partial update received from the server.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ProcessPartialUpdateTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to process a SafeBrowsing list partial update. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashesTime for each prefix-sized list, and V4MergeUpdateTime. Additionally, if the update is Rice-encoded, it includes V4DecodeRemovalsTime, and V4DecodeAdditionsTime for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.ApplyUpdate.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to read, parse, and process a SafeBrowsing list stored on disk. This happens at Chromium start-up. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashes.Time for each prefix-sized list, and SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.MergeUpdate.Time. Additionally, if the file is Rice-encoded, it includes V4ReadFromDisk.DecodeAdditions.Time for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.DecodeAdditions.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to decode the Rice-encoded additions to the blacklist into raw format when reading a store file from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDisk.MergeUpdate.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/25/2018 since it was not being used actively or monitored.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to perform in-memory copy of the map of raw hash prefixes read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4ReadFromDiskTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes to read, parse, and process a SafeBrowsing list stored on disk. This happens at Chromium start-up. It includes V4AddUnlumpedHashesTime for each prefix-sized list, and V4MergeUpdateTime. Additionally, if the file is Rice-encoded, it includes V4DecodeAdditionsTime for each prefix-sized list that's Rice-encoded.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Store.IsStoreAvailable.ValidStore
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 since the histogram was very stable: crbug.com/984286.
histogram.summary: Records how often IsStoreAvailable fails due to an invalid store identifier. This is logged each time a store is checked (a few times for each download, and once when a potentially dangerous subresource is loaded).

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreReadResult
histogram.summary: Track the parsing results of reading the SafeBrowsing V4 store file from disk. Recorded every time a store is read from disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreVersionRead
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78 since there's only ever been just 1 version number.
histogram.summary: Version of V4Store read from a store file. This would be useful in tracking the usage and rollout of new V4Store versions.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4StoreWriteResult
histogram.summary: Track the results of writing the SafeBrowsing V4 store file to disk. Recorded every time a store is written to disk.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4UnusedStoreFileExists
histogram.summary: Track the presence of store files that were previously created but have been deprecated since so need to be removed from disk. Logged once per startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4UnusedStoreFileExists.V3
histogram.summary: Track the presence of Safe Browsing list files used for PVer3, which has been deprecated. Logged once per startup.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4Update.TimedOut
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78 due to lack of use and timed out rate being less than 0.03%
histogram.summary: True if a PVer4 update request timed out.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4UpdateHttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: Response or error codes when fetching updates from the SafeBrowsing PVer4 service.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4UpdateResponseSizeKB
histogram.summary: The size of the response sent by the SafeBrowsing PVer4 service, in KB.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.V4UpdateResult
histogram.summary: Track return status from V4 update attempts. The buckets of this histogram overlap, so the counts cannot be used as percentages.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.WebSocket.Elapsed
histogram.summary: Time spent on SafeBrowsing lookup. Since this includes any time spent on the interstitial page the average may not be useful.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.WebSocket.Result
histogram.summary: Results of a SafeBrowsing lookup for a WebSocket handshake. All lookups are counted. Note: the "ABANDONED" bucket contains both connections that were abandoned before the check completed and those that were cancelled when the user navigated away from the SafeBrowsing interstitial.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsing.WebView.UserConsentVsUrlCheckRace
histogram.obsolete: Removed in December 2019 because logic was simplified to remove this race.
histogram.summary: WebView can simultaneously check for user opt-in and Safe-Browsing-check the first URL, with both asynchronous checks racing to finish. This records the outcome of that race: (1) which asynchronous method finished first; (2) if user consent finished first, what was the outcome; and (3) did we show malicious content to the user. This is recorded only once, for the first Safe Browsing check.

histogram.name: SafeBrowsingBinaryUploadRequest.TimeToGetToken
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 as SafeBrowsingBinaryUploadRequest.TimeToGetFCMToken provides the same information with a better range of durations.
histogram.summary: This record how long it took for the request to get the FCM token. It is logged every time a deep scanning request successfully gets a token.

histogram.name: SB.BloomFilter
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The first stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our in-memory bloom filter.

histogram.name: SB.BuildBloom
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.name: SB.Database
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The second stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our SQLite database.

histogram.name: SB.DBCheck
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The second stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our SQLite database. This time includes the filter check time.

histogram.name: SB.Delay
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This measures the time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB.FilterCheck
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The first stage check that measures the time that Chrome took to check if a URL is present in our in-memory hash table.

histogram.name: SB.Network
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The third and final stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to get a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a particular URL.

histogram.name: SB.NetworkCheck
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The third and final stage check that mesures the time that Chrome took to get a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a particular URL. This time includes the filter and database check time.

histogram.name: SB.PauseSafe
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: This measures the time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL.

histogram.name: SB.Update
histogram.obsolete: Has not been generated for years (7/8/14).
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: TBD.

histogram.summary: Track failures when updating the safe-browsing database.

histogram.summary: The size of the SafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes.

histogram.name: SB2.DatabaseOpen

histogram.name: SB2.Delay
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M65. Replaced by SB2.NoUserActionResourceLoadingDelay
histogram.summary: The time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL. This is the sum of .Mainframe and .Subresource breakout metrics.

histogram.name: SB2.Delay.MainFrame
histogram.summary: The time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL. Logged for main frame resources only.

histogram.name: SB2.Delay.Subresource
histogram.summary: The time that SafeBrowsing actually delayed the browsing experience. It records the difference between the time when Chrome would have started reading the response for a URL and when the SafeBrowsing system completed its check of that URL. Logged for non-main frame resources only.

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadBinhashAddsDeleted

histogram.name: SB2.DownloadHashCheckDuration

histogram.name: SB2.FilterMissing

histogram.name: SB2.FormatEvent
histogram.obsolete: Removed after the launch of PVer4 in M57.
histogram.summary: Collection of boolean events for SafeBrowsingFileStore instances. Includes corruptions detected, old versions detected, and various failures detected.

histogram.name: SB2.GetChunkResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.obsolete: Removed after the launch of PVer4 in M57.
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from the SafeBrowsing service. Logged after a GetChunk request finishes to capture the response code or error code for that call. Split out from SB2.GetHashErrorResponseOrErrorCode in M49.

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash200
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_200.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned data (valid requests).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHash204
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of SB2.GetHashResult STATUS_204.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests that returned empty data (false positives).

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed after the launch of PVer4 in M57.
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash attempts (STATUS_200, STATUS_204, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, BACKOFF_ERROR), whether parsing a 200 result failed (PARSE_ERROR), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus all *_ERROR cases. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision). (PARSE_ERROR, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, and BACKOFF_ERROR were added in M36.)

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashResultDownload
histogram.obsolete: Removed after the launch of PVer4 in M57.
histogram.summary: Track return status from GetHash attempts (STATUS_200, STATUS_204, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, BACKOFF_ERROR), whether parsing a 200 result failed (PARSE_ERROR), and dispensation of returned values (EMPTY, HIT, MISS). EMPTY means the response had no full hashes, and should contain all of the 204 responses plus all *_ERROR cases. HIT means that one of the full hashes matched. MISS means that none of the hashes matched (there was a prefix collision). (PARSE_ERROR, NETWORK_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, and BACKOFF_ERROR were added in M36.)

histogram.name: SB2.GetHashServerMiss
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of SB2.GetHashResult FULL_HASH_* and SB2.BloomFilterFalsePositives. It is unclear if this histogram ever reported useful data.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of GetHash requests returning full hashes that didn't match the URL that initiated the request.

histogram.name: SB2.HandleCorrupt
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The count of the number of times a database was found corrupt and reset.

histogram.name: SB2.InterstitialAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed, replaced by: interstitial.malware.* and interstitial.phishing.*.
histogram.summary: Track number of times Safe Browsing interstitials have been shown, and how many times they have been clicked through or not.

histogram.name: SB2.InterstitialActionDetails
histogram.obsolete: Removed, replaced by: interstitial.malware.* and interstitial.phishing.*.
histogram.summary: Tracks the click-through rate for specific cases of the interstitial.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeClosed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user navigating away by for example, closing the tab, clicking the browser back button or typing another URL in the address bar.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeDiagnostic
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on diagnostic page link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeExpandedSeeMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user expanding the "see more info" section of the page. (Only applies to field trial version 2 of the interstitial.)

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeLearnMore
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the learn more about malware link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimePrivacyPolicy
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the privacy policy link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeProceed
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the proceed link.

histogram.name: SB2.MalwareInterstitialTimeTakeMeBack
histogram.summary: The time between when we show the SafeBrowsing malware interstitial and the user clicking on the big green back button.

histogram.name: SB2.Network
histogram.summary: The time that it took to receive a response from the Google SafeBrowsing servers for a GetHash request.

histogram.name: SB2.NoUserActionResourceLoadingDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 since it is fairly flat and not really useful.
histogram.summary: The total delay, in milliseconds, caused by SafeBrowsing for a resource load, if the SafeBrowsing interstitial page is not shown and therefore no user action is involved. At most one value is reported for each resource load. If SafeBrowsing causes delays at different stages of a load, the sum of all the delays will be reported.

histogram.name: SB2.OldDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: Size of v1 database deleted from client profile.

histogram.name: SB2.OutShardShifts
histogram.obsolete: Removed after the launch of PVer4 in M57.
histogram.summary: Indicates how sharded safe-browsing on-disk stores are. Values like 0 to 4 are reasonable.

histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The size of the PrefixSet storage in bits, divided by the number of prefixes represented. Should almost always be 16.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredExcess
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How many extra results GetPrefixes returns.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetRestoredShortfall
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How many fewer results GetPrefixes returns.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetSizeKilobytes
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The size of one of the PrefixSet files in kilobytes. Logged after a database update has occurred and the PrefixSet has been flushed to disk (once a few minutes after startup, and every thirty minutes or so thereafter).

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDelta
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How far unsorted deltas are from expected value.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedDifference
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. Distance of unsorted elements from expected location.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedPercent
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. How far into the results unsorted elements were found. Interesting values would be 0%, 50%, or 100%.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetUnsortedSize
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: For debugging PrefixSet. Size of unsorted sets. To see if there is a problem with a particular size of dataset.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetVersionRead
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: Version read from one of the PrefixSet files.

histogram.name: SB2.PrefixSetWrite
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: Time to store one of the PrefixSet files.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.CanUseLocalBlacklists
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84. This feature is not launched.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether the local Safe Browsing blacklists can be used on this Android device. Logged once on first URL check request.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.CheckDispatchTime
histogram.summary:
Wall time in microseconds for calling Java_SafeBrowsingApiBridge_startUriLookup. Logged at every Safe Browsing check on Android.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.ChecksPending
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M64 (Nov 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: Number of outstanding calls for URLs getting classified through RemoteSafeBrowsingDatabaseManager. The size of the queue is logged before initiating each request.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.InternalErrorStatusCode
histogram.obsolete: No longer generated. Replaced by SB2.RemoteCall.InternalErrorStatusCode2
histogram.summary: The status code provided by GmsCore if it is unable to respond to a URL check request due to incorrect initialization, not being ready, etc. Logged on each URL check that hits the internal error condition. The total number of these should add up to the INTERNAL_ERROR reports under SB2.RemoteCall.Result.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.LocalAllowlistLookupTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed M81. The latency looks good, not needed anymore.
histogram.summary: Indicates the time for synchronous local allowlist lookup on Java side. This metrics provides the evidence of whether asynchronous implementation is needed for local allowlist.

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.LocalBlacklistsAgeInMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84. This feature is not launched.
histogram.summary: Indicates the time since the local blacklists were successfully updated last. Logged each time the verdict of local blacklists lookup is stale or possibly unsafe, if the local blacklists feature is enabled (i.e. SB2.RemoteCall.CanUseLocalBlacklists == ENABLED)

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.LocalBlacklistsLookupResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84. This feature is not launched.
histogram.summary: Indicates the result of local Safe Browsing blacklist lookup on Android. Logged for each URL lookup, if the local blacklists feature is enabled (i.e. SB2.RemoteCall.CanUseLocalBlacklists == ENABLED)

histogram.name: SB2.RemoteCall.LocalBlacklistsUpdateSucceeded
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84. This feature is not launched.
histogram.summary: Indicates the result of local blacklists' update. Logged each time an update of local blacklists is attempted, if the local blacklists feature is enabled (i.e. SB2.RemoteCall.CanUseLocalBlacklists == ENABLED)

histogram.name: SB2.ReportingIsEnabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether the user has Safe Browsing extended reporting enabled at the time a Safe Browsing warning was dismissed. This tracks the fraction of all SB interstitials that had reporting enabled.

histogram.name: SB2.ResourceTypes
histogram.summary: Resource types of resources that were inspected by Safe Browsing in the SafeBrowsingResourceThrottle.

histogram.name: SB2.SetExtendedReportingEnabled
histogram.summary: Tracks changes to the Safe Browsing extended reporting opt-in which is shown in the Safe Browsing interstitial.

histogram.name: SB2.SetReportingEnabled
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Tracks changes to the Safe Browsing extended reporting opt-in which is shown in the Safe Browsing interstitial.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreePrefixSetWrite
histogram.summary: Time to store the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file. Note: this histogram was intended to be stored as SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetWrite but was actually reported as SB2.SideEffectFreePrefixSetWrite from its inception to its deprecation...

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistDatabaseKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the Side Effect Free Whitelist SaafeBrowsing database file on disk in kilobytes, after an update has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file in kilobytes, after an udpate has occurred.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistPrefixSetLoad
histogram.summary: Time to load the Side Effect Free Whitelist PrefixSet file.

histogram.name: SB2.SideEffectFreeWhitelistStatus
histogram.summary: The instantiation status of the SideEffectFreeWhitelist.

histogram.name: SB2.StoreVersionRead
histogram.obsolete: Removed after the launch of PVer4 in M57.
histogram.summary: Version read from the store file.

histogram.name: SB2.SubPrefixes
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The number of sub prefixes stored in the database after the last update.

histogram.name: SB2.Update
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The time from the receipt of the update request to the receipt of the final update chunk.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateRequestSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The payload size of update requests to the server.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: Result from trying to update the SafeBrowsing data.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The size of all the chunk URLs in an update response.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateSizeBackground
histogram.obsolete: Was used for an experiment in late 2014.
histogram.summary: The size of all the chunk URLs in an update response when Chrome is in the background.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateSizeForeground
histogram.obsolete: Was used for an experiment in late 2014.
histogram.summary: The size of all the chunk URLs in an update response when Chrome is in the foreground.

histogram.name: SB2.UpdateUrls
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M58 (Aug 2017). No longer generated.
histogram.summary: The number of chunk URLs in an update response.

histogram.name: SB2.VolunteerPrefixesRemoved
histogram.obsolete: The operation this is tracking has been deleted as of 09/2014.
histogram.summary: Older versions of the safe-browsing code incorrectly added additional SBPrefix items when receiving full hashes. This caused errors when calculating when to send gethash requests to the server. An additional pass over the data has been added to remove the excess prefixes. This histogram tracks progress of that code for purposes of informing a decision on when to remove the additional pass. See http://crbug.com/361248 .

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ArchivedArchiveExtensions
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of archive file types that were found while examining a downloaded ZIP file. Each archive file type in a single ZIP file is recorded at most once. The relative incidence rate of each filetype in this histogram should indicate the probability of finding that file type in a ZIP file given that that ZIP file contains an archive file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ArchiveDownloadExtensions
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 08/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records a histogram of how often users download a file with a possibly dangerous file extension (e.g., exe, class) within an archive.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileArchivedBinariesCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: The original number of archived_binaries found in a DMG-like file when it's scanned, if at least one is found. The actual number sent in the download request may be capped below this value.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileFailureByType
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: Counts of DMG-like file types that failed to be successfully analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileHasExecutable
histogram.summary: For each DMG file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the DMG contained an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileHasExecutableByType
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: Counts of DMG-like file types which were analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service that contained an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileHasNoExecutableByType
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: Counts of DMG-like file types which were analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service that did NOT contain an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgFileSuccess
histogram.summary: For each DMG file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records true if the analysis was successful, or false if there was an error analyzing the file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DmgTooBigToUnpack
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: Records whether a given DMG download was too big to unpack, as specified by configuration option set in SafeBrowsing download service. This metric is logged each time the user downloads a DMG file on Mac.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadFileHasDetachedSignatures
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/19, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: A Mac-only metric that records whether a given download contains a detached code signature file. This metric is logged before Chrome sends SafeBrowsing download pings.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadFileWithoutDiskImageExtensionHasKolySignature
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: Records whether download files without an Apple disk image file extension have a 'koly' signature. This can be used to identify distribution of disk image files to Mac users without simply relying on file extension. This metric is logged before Chrome sends SafeBrowsing download pings.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestTimeoutDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78, since the metrics were not being actively used and there was no near-term plan to begin using them.
histogram.summary: Records the portion of the SafeBrowsing download service check starting with the point CheckClientDownloadRequest::StartTimeout() is called. It is recorded regardless if a ping was sent or not. It is not recorded for requests that were cancelled.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.DownloadRequestTimeoutStats
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78, since the metrics were not being actively used and there was no near-term plan to begin using them.
histogram.summary: For SafeBrowsing binary download checks which reached the CheckClientDownloadRequest::StartTimeout() call, records the final result (once the check finishes or is cancelled).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractDmgFeaturesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract info from a downloaded DMG file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractImageHeadersTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77. Extracting image headers was usually fast so this histogram was not providing useful data.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract image headers from a downloaded binary.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractRarFeaturesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract info from a downloaded rar file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractSignatureFeaturesTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78, since the metrics were not being actively used and there was no near-term plan to begin using them.
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract signature info from a downloaded binary. This includes both unsigned and signed binaries.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ExtractZipFeaturesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the SafeBrowsing download service to extract info from a downloaded zip file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.PPAPIDownloadRequest.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: Time taken to complete a PPAPIDownloadRequest.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.PPAPIDownloadRequest.RequestOutcome
histogram.summary: Outcome of running CheckPPAPIDownloadRequest. Most failure modes cause an UNKNOWN result to be returned to the caller. If the attempt succeeds, the result returned to the caller is based on the SafeBrowsing resopnse. The final result returned is counted in SBClientDownload.PPAPIDownloadRequest.Result.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.PPAPIDownloadRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Result returned to the caller of CheckPPAPIDownloadRequest.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.RarFileArchivedBinariesCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09-2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The original number of archived_binaries found in a rar-like file when it's scanned, if at least one is found. The actual number sent in the download request may be capped below this value.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.RarFileHasArchiveButNoExecutable
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each rar file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records true if the rar did not contain any executables but did contain another archive file, false otherwise.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.RarFileHasExecutable
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each rar file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the rar contained an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.RarFileSuccess
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each rar file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the unpacking was 100% successful.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.RarHeadersEncrypted
histogram.obsolete: Marked obsolete 07-2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Records whether the RAR headers are encrypted, preventing any meaningful content analysis. This is in contrast to encryption of the content of the archive, which still exposes file name information. This histogram is recorded every time a RAR archive is downloaded.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.RarOpenSuccess
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each rar file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the file could be opened. This should be close to 100% success because the library doesn't actually open the file; it is handed an open file handle and the Open() function call sets that as the file handle to use.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.RarValidArchive
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each rar file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the unrar library considers this file a valid RAR archive. It includes checking the following, and more: magic number is present, valid RAR version format can be parsed, headers are valid, etc.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedBinaryDownload
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78, since the metrics were not being actively used and there was no near-term plan to begin using them.
histogram.summary: Records the number of signed vs. unsigned executables that are downloaded.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.SignedOrWhitelistedDownload
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Chrome 50. Replaced by SBClientDownload.CheckWhitelistResult.*.
histogram.summary: Counter which is incremented whenever an executable is downloaded which is either signed or whose URL matches the download whitelist.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.UnsupportedScheme
histogram.obsolete: Removed M76, since there had been no such downloads for over a year.
histogram.summary: Records how often different file extensions are downloaded with schemes that aren't supported by Safe Browsing (e.g. ftp, gopher, content, cid, etc).

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipArchiveUncompressedSizeOverflow
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M79 due to lack of use, and no future plans for use.
histogram.summary: Records whether the total uncompressed size of a ZIP overflowed our total. This is logged once per ZIP file scanned.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipCompressionRatio
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M79 due to lack of use, and no future plans for use.
histogram.summary: Records the compression ratio for each scanned ZIP archive. This is logged once per ZIP file scanned, unless SBClientDownload.ZipArchiveUncompressedSizeOverflow is true.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipEntrySize
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M79 due to lack of use, and no future plans for use.
histogram.summary: Records the uncompressed size of each entry in a scanned ZIP file. This histogram is logged once per entry in the ZIP.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileArchivedBinariesCount
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The original number of archived_binaries found in a zip-like file when it's scanned, if at least one is found. The actual number sent in the download request may be capped below this value.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileContainsAppDirectory
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 12/2018 during a refactoring. The data was not being actively used.
histogram.summary: A Mac-only metric that records whether a downloaded zip file contains an .app directory, signifying the presence of installable software.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileFailureByType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/19, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: Counts of ZIP-like file types that failed to be successfully analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileHasArchiveButNoExecutable
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each zip file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records true if the zip did not contain any executables but did contain another zip file, false otherwise.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileHasExecutable
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was marked obsolete in 05/2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: For each zip file analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service, records if the zip contained an executable file.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileLocalFileHeadersSkipped
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/19. This approach to measuring platform-dependent extraction does not work, so the data was not useful.
histogram.summary: The number of Local File Headers (identified by their magic number) present in the file, that were not extracted during ZIP inspection. A non-zero entry implies some potential files were not extracted. That could be intended, or it could indicate ZIPs with platform-dependent extraction. This metric is sampled with small probability during each ZIP download.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipFileSuccessByType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/19, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: Counts of ZIP-like file types were successfully analyzed by the SafeBrowsing download service.

histogram.name: SBClientDownload.ZipTooBigToUnpack
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the metric was not being actively used and there were no near-term plans to begin using it.
histogram.summary: Records whether a given ZIP download was too big to unpack, as specified by configuration option set in SafeBrowsing download service. This metric is logged each time the user downloads a ZIP file.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.ClassificationStart
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07-2020 since the SBClientMalware feature was removed.
histogram.summary: The number of pages that we could have possibly classified (essentially the number of top page navigations by users with SBClientMalware enabled). The name is slightly misleading as it is recorded before "Preclassification" happens.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.PreClassificationCheckFail
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07-2020 since the SBClientMalware feature was removed.
histogram.summary: Records the number of malware classifications that were skipped because a pre-classification check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.ResourceUrlMatchedBadIp
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07-2020 since the SBClientMalware feature was removed.
histogram.summary: True if at least one resource url matched the malware IP list. Recorded when client side malware feature extraction is done.

histogram.name: SBClientMalware.UnexpectedPageId
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2014. That part of the code got deleted.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times the page ID that completed the page load does not match the browse info page ID. We expect that number to be zero.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.CheckNoPendingClassificationFailed
histogram.summary: The number of times client-side phishing classifier expected to have no pending classifications running but that check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ClientDeterminesPhishing
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The counts for phishing verdicts given by client side model.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.GrabPhishingThumbnail
histogram.summary: Time spent generating the thumbnail.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InitPrivateNetworksFailed
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Chrome 37, which now uses //net's internal matching.
histogram.summary: The number of times that the phishing detection service could not be initialized due to an error parsing the private IP networks. This would indicate a bug.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.InvalidWhitelistExpression
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2011. Whitelist entries are no longer part of ClientPhishingResponse.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of whitelist_expression entries in a ClientPhishingResponse that could not be canonicalized.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.PreClassificationCheckFail
histogram.obsolete: This was replaced by SBClientPhishing.PreClassificationCheckResult in 08-2020, since that histogram is easier to reason about.
histogram.summary: Records the number of phishing classifications that were skipped because a pre-classification check failed.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.ServerDeterminesPhishing
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The counts for phishing verdicts given by server side model.

histogram.name: SBClientPhishing.SkipClassificationReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The counts for various reasons why a phishing classification is skipped.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Activations
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the information was not being used.
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback has been started, broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.ActiveFeedbacks
histogram.obsolete: Marked obsolete 07-2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: When a new download feedback request is added, records the number of download requests currently active and/or pending.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Eligible
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85, since the histogram is not being used.
histogram.summary: Count of times eligible download notifications are shown. Broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.EmptyFilePathFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the information was not being used.
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback cannot be sent due to empty file path.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.FileErrors
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M86, since the information was not being used.
histogram.summary: The net error or response code that caused the TwoPhaseUploader to fail while uploading the file. This is logged whenever the TwoPhaseUploader fails while uploading the file.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.MetadataErrors
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M86, since the information was not being used.
histogram.summary: The net error or response code that caused the TwoPhaseUploader to fail while uploading metadata. This is logged whenever the TwoPhaseUploader fails while uploading metadata.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.Shown
histogram.obsolete: Starting with M32, replaced by SBDownloadFeedback.Eligible.
histogram.summary: Count of times download feedback button has been shown, broken down by danger type.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeEligibleKB
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the information was not being used.
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that were of the correct danger type, regardless if they meet the max file size check or if they are actually uploaded or not.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeFailure
histogram.obsolete: Marked obsolete 07-2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that failed to be uploaded to the feedback service.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.SizeSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Marked obsolete 07-2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Size of downloads that were successfully uploaded to the feedback service.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.UploadRequestedByServer
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77, since the information was not being used.
histogram.summary:
For each non-SAFE file, records whether the server requested that that file be uploaded.
Logged before checking the file size, so it may be dropped there.

histogram.name: SBDownloadFeedback.UploadResult
histogram.obsolete: Marked obsolete 07-2020 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: Final result of attempt to upload binary to download feedback service.

histogram.name: SBIRS.BLAHashTime
histogram.obsolete: Blacklist Load analysis was removed in M63.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to compute the hash of a blacklisted module.

histogram.name: SBIRS.BLASignatureTime
histogram.obsolete: Blacklist Load analysis was removed in M63.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to validate the signature of a blacklisted module.

histogram.name: SBIRS.IncidentCount
histogram.summary: The number of incidents collated into a single safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PruneRatio
histogram.summary: The percentage of incidents pruned from a safe browsing incident report on account of having been previously reported.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PSSDataStoreSize
histogram.summary: The size, in bytes, of a profile's platform state store. This histogram is logged on each write, which always replaces any previous contents.

histogram.name: SBIRS.PSSLoadResult
histogram.summary: The result of loading data from the platform state store.

histogram.name: SBIRS.ReportUploadTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to upload a safe browsing incident report.

histogram.name: SBIRS.StateStoreInit
histogram.summary: The result of initializing the state store and comparing the preferences to the platform-specific state store.

histogram.name: SBIRS.SuspiciousModuleDetectionTime
histogram.obsolete: Suspicious Module detection was removed in M63.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to check loaded modules against the module whitelist.

histogram.name: SBIRS.SuspiciousModuleReportCount
histogram.obsolete: Suspicious Module detection reporting removed in M63.
histogram.summary: The number of suspicious modules found.

histogram.name: SBIRS.SuspiciousModuleReportingTime
histogram.obsolete: Suspicious Module detection reporting removed in M63.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to create incidents for suspicious modules.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.Abort
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis was aborted. This histogram is suffixed with the abort reason.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.Detected
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which an off-domain inclusion was detected by the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.EmptyMainFrameURL
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the main frame URL was unexpectedly empty in the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.InHistory
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis concluded in no inclusion whitelist hit but a browsing history hit.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.InvalidMainFrameURL
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2015 (was never reported, confirming experiment that handling it is irrelevant).
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the main frame URL was unexpectedly invalid (and not empty) in the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.RequestAnalyzed
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request analyzed by the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.Suspicious
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which an off-domain inclusion was detected by the OffDomainInclusionDetector and considered suspicious.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion.Whitelisted
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis concluded in an inclusion whitelist hit.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.Abort
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis was aborted. This histogram is suffixed with the abort reason.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.InHistory
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis concluded in no inclusion whitelist hit but a browsing history hit.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.RequestAnalyzed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request analyzed by the OffDomainInclusionDetector.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.Suspicious
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which an off-domain inclusion was detected by the OffDomainInclusionDetector and considered suspicious.

histogram.name: SBOffDomainInclusion2.Whitelisted
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-05 as the OffDomainInclusionDetector was removed.
histogram.summary: Logs the resource type of each resource request for which the off-domain inclusion analysis concluded in an inclusion whitelist hit.

histogram.name: Scheduler.CancelableTaskTracker.TaskCanceled
histogram.obsolete: 2020-02-25: Replaced by Scheduler.CancelableTaskTracker.TaskState, which allows correlation of live/canceled with same/off-sequence states.
histogram.summary: True if a task posted to CancelableTaskTracker was canceled before it got the chance to run. Recorded for every task posted via CancelableTaskTracker, immediately before it would be run.

histogram.name: Scheduler.CancelableTaskTracker.TaskDuration
histogram.obsolete: 2020-02-25: Replaced by Scheduler.CancelableTaskTracker.TaskDuration2_* which correllate duration with liveness, off-sequence and task priority states.
histogram.summary: Time taken for a task posted to a CancelableTaskTracker to run. Durations are not recorded for canceled tasks.

histogram.name: Scheduling.ActivateDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by ActivateDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the compositor to simply activate the pending tree. Does not include any PrepareTiles or raster time.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameIntervalCritical
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameIntervalCritical2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary:
This is the time delta between back-to-back BeginMainFrames completions on the compositor side when the on_critical_path flag is set, regardless of whether they abort (have no updates) or commit (have updates).
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running continuously; sepcifically when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after a) an abort or b) activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameIntervalNotCritical
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameIntervalNotCritical2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary:
This is the time delta between back-to-back BeginMainFrames completions on the compositor side when the on_critical_path flag is not set, regardless of whether they abort (have no updates) or commit (have updates).
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running continuously; sepcifically when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after a) an abort or b) activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameQueueDurationCritical
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameQueueDurationCritical2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the main side to start the BeginMainFrame in response to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame when the on_critical_path flag is set.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameQueueDurationCritical2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SendBeginMainFrameToCommit.BeginMainSentToStarted of CompositorLatency metrics as of 02/2020.
histogram.summary:
How long it takes for the main side to start the BeginMainFrame in response to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame when the on_critical_path flag is set.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameQueueDurationNotCritical
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameQueueDurationNotCritical2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the main side to start the BeginMainFrame in response to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame when the on_critical_path flag is not set.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: The time from when the main side actually starts the BeginMainFrame to when the commit completes on the impl side.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SendBeginMainFrameToCommit of CompositorLatency metrics as of 02/2020.
histogram.summary:
The time from when the main side actually starts the BeginMainFrame to when the commit completes on the impl side.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.BeginMainFrameToCommitDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameQueueDurationCritical, BeginMainFrameQueueDurationNotCritical, and BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the blink main thread to respond to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.ActivateDuration2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 08/2018, M69. Since there is no impl thread on Browser side, there is no activation state for Browser.
histogram.summary:
How long it takes for the compositor to simply activate the pending tree. Does not include any PrepareTiles or raster time.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.BeginMainFrameIntervalCritical2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2018, M69, due to too much noise in the collected data.
histogram.summary:
This is the time delta between back-to-back BeginMainFrames completions on the compositor side when the on_critical_path flag is set, regardless of whether they abort (have no updates) or commit (have updates).
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running continuously; sepcifically when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after a) an abort or b) activation.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_HIGH_RESOLUTION_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.BeginMainFrameIntervalNotCritical2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2018, M69. All begin frames are in critical path for browser, no data is reported.
histogram.summary:
This is the time delta between back-to-back BeginMainFrames completions on the compositor side when the on_critical_path flag is not set, regardless of whether they abort (have no updates) or commit (have updates).
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running continuously; sepcifically when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after a) an abort or b) activation.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.BeginMainFrameQueueDurationNotCritical2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2018, M69. All begin frames are in critical path for browser, no data is reported.
histogram.summary:
How long it takes for the main side to start the BeginMainFrame in response to the compositor's SendBeginMainFrame when the on_critical_path flag is not set.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.BeginMainFrameStartToCommit
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration. This was recorded as a result of a typo in the code that didn't include "Duration".
histogram.summary: The time from when the main side actually starts the BeginMainFrame to when the commit completes on the impl side.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.BeginMainFrameStartToCommit2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by BeginMainFrameStartToCommitDuration2. This was recorded as a result of a typo in the code that didn't include "Duration".
histogram.summary: The time from when the main side actually starts the BeginMainFrame to when the commit completes on the impl side.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.CommitInterval2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2018, M69, due to too much noise in the collected data.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the *draw* times of back-to-back BeginMainFrames that result in a commit.
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running and committing continuously, where continuously means when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after activation.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_HIGH_RESOLUTION_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.DrawInterval2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 06/2018, M69, due to too much noise in the collected data.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the draw times of back-to-back BeginImplFrames, regardless of whether or not they result in a swap.
The interval is only recorded when every BeginImplFrame wants to draw.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_HIGH_RESOLUTION_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.DrawIntervalWithCompositedAnimations2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2018, M69, due to too much noise in the data.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the draw times of back-to-back BeginImplFrames, regardless of whether or not they result in a swap, when there is at least one composited animation.
The interval is only recorded when every BeginImplFrame wants to draw.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.DrawIntervalWithMainThreadAnimations2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2018, M69, due to too much noise in the data.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the draw times of back-to-back BeginImplFrames of new active trees only, regardless of whether or not they result in a swap, when there is at least one main thread animation.
The interval is only recorded when every BeginImplFrame wants to draw.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.MainAndImplFrameTimeDelta2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 08/2018, M69, since there is no impl thread in Browser side, this metric does not record any meaningful data.
histogram.summary:
Recorded every time the compositor draws with a new active tree. A value of 0 indicates the main-side started and finished within the same frame interval as the impl-side. Positive values correspond to how old any main-side updates are compared to the impl-side updates. If there are no mid-frame updates, this metric is a good proxy for how well the main and impl threads are synchronized.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.PendingTreeDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2018, M69. Since there is no pending tree in Browser, no data is ever reported.
histogram.summary:
Time between creating a pending tree and activating that tree. This differs from Scheduling.ActivateDuration in that it includes time taken to raster the pending tree, not just the time to activate it.
The interval is recorded each time a pending tree is activated.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.PendingTreeRasterDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2018, M69. Since there is no pending tree in Browser, no data is ever reported.
histogram.summary:
Time between starting raster work on the pending tree and when it is ready to activate. Unlike PendingTreeDuration which - includes the time to commit to this tree, the raster duration and the time for which the pending tree waits before it can be activated - this only measures the time taken to rasterize tiles required for activation.
The interval is recorded each time we are notifed that a pending tree is ready for activation.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.ReadyToActivateToActivationDuration2.Impl
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2018, M69. No data reported because there is no pending tree on impl thread for browser side.
histogram.summary:
How long does the pending tree wait after it is ready to be activated and before it is activated.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution. Impl side invalidation initiated pending tree

histogram.name: Scheduling.Browser.ReadyToActivateToActivationDuration2.Main
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by EndCommitToActivation of CompositorLatency metrics as of 08/2020.
histogram.summary:
How long does the pending tree wait after it is ready to be activated and before it is activated.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution. Commit initiated pending tree.

histogram.name: Scheduling.CommitInterval
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by CommitInterval2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the *draw* times of back-to-back BeginMainFrames that result in a commit.
The interval is only recorded when the BeginMainFrames are running and committing continuously, where continuously means when another BeginMainFrame is requested by the next BeginImplFrame after activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.CommitToReadyToActivateDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by CommitToReadyToActivateDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes for the compositor to rasterize pending tree content after a commit before it is ready for activation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.DrawDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by DrawDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes the compositor to draw a frame.

histogram.name: Scheduling.DrawInterval
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by DrawInterval2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the draw times of back-to-back BeginImplFrames, regardless of whether or not they result in a swap.
The interval is only recorded when every BeginImplFrame wants to draw.

histogram.name: Scheduling.DrawIntervalWithMainThreadCompositableAnimations2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2018 because the experiment described in Issue 754471 is completed.
histogram.summary:
The time delta between the draw times of back-to-back BeginImplFrames of new active trees only, regardless of whether or not they result in a swap, when there is at least one main thread animation that could be composited but not, due to running experiment.
The interval is only recorded when every BeginImplFrame wants to draw.

histogram.name: Scheduling.ImageInvalidationUpdateDuration
histogram.summary: Duration for updating animated images and invalidating layers for images invalidated on the sync tree in the compositor. This interval is recorded each time the sync tree is updated after a commit or an impl-side invalidation.

histogram.name: Scheduling.MainAndImplFrameTimeDelta
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by MainAndImplFrameTimeDelta2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: Recorded every time the compositor draws with a new active tree. A value of 0 indicates the main-side started and finished within the same frame interval as the impl-side. Positive values correspond to how old any main-side updates are compared to the impl-side updates. If there are no mid-frame updates, this metric is a good proxy for how well the main and impl threads are synchronized.

histogram.name: Scheduling.PrepareTilesDuration
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by PrepareTIlesDuration2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes the compositor to PreapreTiles, which determines what rasterization work to do.

histogram.name: Scheduling.SwapAckWasFast
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 07/2018, M69. The swap ack is always received within 8 seconds.
histogram.summary: True if the swap ack was received within approximately 8 seconds of the swap. Although 8 seconds isn't exactly fast, it is a threshold that represents a hang or the appearance of a hang.

histogram.name: Scheduling.SwapToAckLatency
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SwapToAckLatency2, due to inefficient bucketing scheme.
histogram.summary: How long it takes the swap ack to return after a swap.

histogram.name: Sdch3.AdvertisedWithSecureScheme
histogram.obsolete: Experiment complete, histogram gathering code removed.
histogram.summary: Whether an SDCH dictionary was advertised over a secure scheme or not. This histogram is logged inside SdchManager at advertisement time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Advertisement_Count
histogram.summary: The number of dictionaries advertised in an HTTP GET transaction that supports SDCH. Note that only non-zero advertisements are logged.

histogram.name: Sdch3.BlacklistReason
histogram.summary: The reason why a blacklist blocking a request from advertising SDCH was implemented. There is one entry in this histogram per inhibited request.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Dictionary size loaded
histogram.summary: Each sample is the byte count for a dictionary that is loaded by Chrome. A dictionary is loaded shortly after the first Google query performed in each session, and allows future SDCH transactions to be encoded/decoded using that dictionary.

histogram.name: Sdch3.DictionaryFate
histogram.summary: The fate, both on input and output, of dictionary requests. There is intended to be two entries in this histogram for each Get-Dictionary seen (except failed requests are not currently tracked).

histogram.name: Sdch3.DictionaryUseCount
histogram.summary: The number of times a dictionary has been successfully used for decoding, recorded at the time it is evicted from the manager.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment2_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment2_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment3_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from the first byte of a request was received, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment3_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from the first byte of a request was received, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Decode
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of an SDCH encoded transmission made after the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback
histogram.summary: Duration in time from when a request was made, until all bytes were received. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st holdback (non-SDCH encoded) packet and receipt of the last packet. Only groups that are part of the holdback (i.e., could have been sdch encoded) are sampled.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_2nd_To_3rd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Experiment_Holdback_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time. During the running of an SDCH latency experiment, these packets were part of a holdback, which precluded SDCH despite the fact that the link had proven it was capable of handling SDCH compression.

histogram.name: Sdch3.FilterUseBeforeDisabling
histogram.summary: If SDCH decoding was disabled client side, this records how many URLs were processed by the SDCH filter before disabling this feature. The most common number is 1, which happens when there is one home-page tab that contains SDCH encoded data, for which there is no dictionary loaded into the Chrome process (yet), since Chrome was just restarted. Large values in this histogram are indicative of flaky decompression, that works for a while, and then is disabled. Values of 2 or 3 may appear if a user has more than one home page with a query, and restarts there browser.

histogram.name: Sdch3.FirstUseInterval
histogram.summary: The amount of time between creation/load of an SDCH dictionary and its first use.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the last packet, for processing by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_2nd_To_3rd_c
