histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th SDCH encoded packet and receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_a
histogram.summary: (discontinued 7/29/2009, and replaced by Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_b) The number of bytes processed (received over the net or from cache) by the SDCH filter chain.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_Processed_b
histogram.summary: The number of bytes processed (received over the net or from cache) by the SDCH filter chain.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Bytes_VcdiffOut_a
histogram.summary: The number of bytes emitted after decoding by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Latency_F_a
histogram.summary: The duration between putting the first byte of a request (such as a GET) on the wire, until the last by of compressed SDCH encoded content is received (with durations over 10 minutes discarded). During a planned latency experiment, some clients will receive encoded SDCH data, and other will received mere gzip'ed data (that passes through the SDCH filter unchanged).

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Packets_b
histogram.summary: An approximation to the total number of SDCH encoded packets received for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Decode_Ratio_a
histogram.summary: The ratio of the number of bytes read from the network (or cache) and fed to the filter chain (usually the gunzip filter) vs. the number of bytes emitted by the SDCH filter to be rendered. This is commonly described as the SDCH compression ratio.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_1st_To_2nd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 2nd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_1st_To_Last_a
histogram.summary: The duration between receipt of the 1st **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the last packet, for processing by the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_2nd_To_3rd_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 2nd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 3rd packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_3rd_To_4th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 3rd **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 4th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_4th_To_5th_c
histogram.summary: Sampling only transmissions with 5 or more packets, the duration between receipt of the 4th **NON**-SDCH encoded packet to receipt of the 5th packet, for processing by the SDCH filter. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_Latency_F_a
histogram.summary: The duration between putting the first byte of a request (such as a GET) on the wire, until the last by gzip compressed content is received and passed-through unchanged by the SDCH filter (with durations over 10 minutes discarded). During a planned latency experiment, some clients will receive encoded SDCH data, and other will received mere gzip'ed data (that passes through the SDCH filter unchanged).

histogram.name: Sdch3.Network_Pass-through_Packets_b
histogram.summary: The total number of **NON**-SDCH encoded packets received for processing by the SDCH filter in one URL fetch. Packet count boundaries are calculated each time a read from the filter is called, assuming 1430 bytes of data per packet since the last boundary calculation. This *tends* to properly count small packets, but can err if small packets come at roughly the same time.

histogram.name: Sdch3.NetworkBytesSavedByCompression
histogram.summary: The absolute difference in bytes between the amount of data entering the SDCH filter and the amount of data exiting the SDCH filter.

histogram.name: Sdch3.NetworkBytesSpent
histogram.summary: Absolute sizes, in bytes, of SDCH dictionaries fetched over the network. These are logged in SdchOwner when dictionary fetches complete.

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialBytesIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to the start of the filter chain (usually to the gunzip filter).

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialVcdiffIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to VCDIFF decoder (usually after gunzipping).

histogram.name: Sdch3.PartialVcdiffOut
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode INCOMPLETE_SDCH_CONTENT reports that the VCDIFF decoder still has internally buffered data that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were output by the VCDIFF decoder (and sent toward the renderer).

histogram.name: Sdch3.PersistenceFailureReason
histogram.summary: Tracks failures that occur when reading in or writing out persisted dictionary information.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ProblemCodes_3
histogram.summary: Each sample is the report of a distinct problem code.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ProblemCodes_4
histogram.summary: Each sample is the report of a distinct problem code.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ProblemCodes_5
histogram.summary: Each sample is the report of a distinct problem code.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ResponseCorruptionDetection.Cached
histogram.summary: Attempted SDCH decoding can fail at the Read() filter processing stage. In some of those cases, the request is corrupted enough that it must be either retried or failed completely. This histogram records the details of why the request was considered corrupted, for results returned from the cache.

histogram.name: Sdch3.ResponseCorruptionDetection.Uncached
histogram.summary: Attempted SDCH decoding can fail at the Read() filter processing stage. In some of those cases, the request is corrupted enough that it must be either retried or failed completely. This histogram records the details of why the request was considered corrupted for results returned from the network.

histogram.name: Sdch3.TimeWeightedMemoryUse
histogram.summary: Measures the time-weighted memory use of SDCH dictionaries, in bytes. The numerator is bytes of dictionary times seconds that dictionary was in memory, and the denominator is seconds that the Chrome process lives.

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedBufferSize
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were in that buffer.

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedBytesIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to the start of the filter chain (usually to the gunzip filter).

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedVcdiffIn
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were received over the net (or from the cache) and fed to VCDIFF decoder (usually after gunzipping).

histogram.name: Sdch3.UnflushedVcdiffOut
histogram.summary: If/when a ProblemCode UNFLUSHED_CONTENT reports that the SDCH filter is still buffering output of the VCDIFF decoder that has never been read, this histogram reports the number of bytes that were output by the VCDIFF decoder (and sent toward the renderer).

histogram.name: Sdch3.UsageInterval
histogram.summary: The amount of time from the last time an SDCH dictionary was used. For the first use of a dictionary, the maximum time is used.

histogram.name: Sdch3.UsageInterval2
histogram.summary: The amount of time from the last time an SDCH dictionary was used. Not recorded on first dictionary use. First use is recorded as Sdch3.FirstUseInterval.

histogram.name: Search.AddSearchProvider
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Search.AddSearchProvider2, which is also now obsolete.
histogram.summary: Measures how much the user modifies their search engines, whether through window.external.AddSearchProvider or chrome://settings.

histogram.name: Search.AddSearchProvider2
histogram.summary: Measures usage of window.external.AddSearchProvider and user interaction with the resulting confirmation dialog (if any). Only works on Views platforms (Win, Linux, CrOS).

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchAllCapsResultsSeen
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2017 because it's no longer ever used.
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen during a contextual search where the selected text consisted of all capital letters. Only logged when contextual search is triggered due to a tap. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchBlacklistSeen
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued on 5/2017 due to experiment being completed.
histogram.summary: The details (blacklist reason and whether the results were seen) of every search term issued by a tap gesture. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationNonPrefetched
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued on 2/2017 Due to data being buggy and not useful.
histogram.summary: The time from opening the panel until the SERP is fully loaded. Applies only to non-prefetched requests. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchDurationPrefetched
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued on 2/2017 Due to data being buggy and not useful.
histogram.summary: The time from opening the panel until the SERP is fully loaded. Applies only to prefetched requests. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchIconSpriteAnimated
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen, whether the search provider icon sprite was animated when the panel first appeared, and the triggering gesture. If animation is disabled due to a field trial, we still log "animated" if the animation would have run otherwise.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPeekPromoCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed because the feature no longer exists.
histogram.summary: The number of times the Peek Promo was seen. This histogram will be emitted when the Panel closes. The panel is always visible when the Peek Promo is shown, so this histogram will always be emitted after a Promo is shown (except in the case of a crash). This histogram does not care whether the Panel was opened.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPeekPromoCountUntilOpened
histogram.obsolete: Removed because the feature no longer exists.
histogram.summary: The number of times the Peek Promo was seen until the Panel was opened. This histogram will be emitted when the Panel closes, if the Panel was opened with the Peek Promo visible. If the Panel is not opened, nothing will be emitted.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPeekPromoOutcome
histogram.obsolete: Removed because the feature no longer exists.
histogram.summary: The outcome of the Contextual Search Peek Promo for those who have seen the promo and for those who would have seen the promo if it was enabled, so we can compare the effect of the promo on users opening the Panel. This histogram will be emitted when the Panel closes, if the conditions to display the Peek Promo are met, regardless of whether the Peek Promo was actually visible (the Promo is controlled by Finch) and regardless of whether the Panel was opened.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchPrefetchSummary
histogram.obsolete: Discontinued on 2/2017 Due to data not being useful.
histogram.summary: A summary histogram for prefetch timings, indicating fully preloaded, etc. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchRecentScrollNotSeen
histogram.summary: The duration since a recent scroll when the results were not seen. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchRecentScrollSeen
histogram.summary: The duration since a recent scroll when the results were seen. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchResultsSeenSelectionWasUrl
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2017 because it's no longer ever used.
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen (Contextual Search panel was opened) when the selection was part of a URL, broken down by original triggering gesture. Includes both users that have enabled Contextual Search and users that are undecided (have neither enabled or disabled the feature). Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchSecondTapSeen
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017 because the data is no longer valuable.
histogram.summary: Whether results were seen for a Tap during suppression when Tap Suppression is enabled. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchSerpLoadedOnClose
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2017 because the data is no longer valuable.
histogram.summary: Whether the SERP was fully loaded when an opened panel was closed.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchShouldTranslate
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M75 because the data is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Emitted when a translate one-box should be forced, to indicate if it actually was forced or simply would have been forced if not disabled by a flag in the variations_service.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchStartedWithCapitalResultsSeen
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2017 because the data is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Whether search results were seen during a contextual search where the selected text started with a capital letter but was not all capital letters. Only logged when contextual search is triggered due to a tap. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.ContextualSearchTapSuppressionSeen
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017 because the data is no longer valuable.
histogram.summary: Whether results were seen for a Tap before suppression when Tap Suppression is enabled. Recorded when the UX is hidden. Implemented for Android.

histogram.name: Search.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.obsolete: Made obsolete around Chrome 32. Use Search.DefaultSearchProviderType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the default search engine that is loaded after Chrome startup. See src/chrome/browser/search_engines/prepopulate_engines.json for more info.

histogram.name: Search.DesktopSearch.RedirectionInfobarCloseAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2016 because desktop searches are no longer opened in the default browser.
histogram.summary: The action performed by the user to close the infobar explaining that a desktop search has been redirected to the default search engine.

histogram.name: Search.DesktopSearch.URLAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2016 because desktop searches are no longer opened in the default browser.
histogram.summary: The action performed when a desktop search URL is passed to the browser through the command line.

histogram.name: Search.GsaProcessMemoryPss
histogram.summary: On Android, when Chrome connects to a bound service exposed by GSA, the memory footprint of the GSA process in KB, as measured by PSS. Reported at most once per Chrome startup.

histogram.name: Search.MigratedPrefToDictionaryValue
histogram.obsolete: Removed after migrator is deleted in 12/2016.
histogram.summary: The number of times that a user-selected DSE was migrated from separate String/List/..Value preferences to the new single DictionaryValue used in M36.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.NavigationStartedAfterUserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-12 after HTTPBad was rolled out for all HTTP pages. This metric was recorded only after sensitive input events, which were removed.
histogram.summary: Records the time from when a page was put into a warning state because of a sensitive input on an HTTP page until a navigation starts. Recorded at most once per main-frame navigation. The Finch trial 'mark-non-secure-as' controls whether the user sees an omnibox warning for this state, or just a console warning.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2016-11-10 because this is replaced by two separate metrics: Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput.CreditCard and Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput.Password.
histogram.summary: Whether a "Not Secure" warning was shown in the omnibox because a security-sensitive form field was rendered in a non-secure context. Logged at most once per main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput.CreditCard
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-12 after HTTPBad was rolled out for all HTTP pages, and discrete credit card / password tracking was removed.
histogram.summary: Whether a "Not Secure" warning was shown in the omnibox because a credit card form field was rendered in a non-secure context. Logged at most once per main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.UserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput.Password
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-12 after HTTPBad was rolled out for all HTTP pages, and discrete credit card / password tracking was removed.
histogram.summary: Whether a "Not Secure" warning was shown in the omnibox because a password form field was rendered in a non-secure context. Logged at most once per main-frame navigation.

histogram.name: Security.HTTPBad.WebContentsDestroyedAfterUserWarnedAboutSensitiveInput
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-12 after HTTPBad was rolled out for all HTTP pages. This metric was recorded only after sensitive input events, which were removed.
histogram.summary: Records the time delta between when a page was put into a warning state because of a sensitive input on an HTTP page and when the WebContents was destroyed. Recorded at most once per main-frame navigation, and it is not recorded if the user starts a navigation before the WebContents is destroyed. The Finch trial 'mark-non-secure-as' controls whether the user sees an omnibox warning for this state, or just a console warning.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Valid
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-01-31, split into ValidEV and ValidNonEV.
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions that take place on a valid HTTPS URL with no security issues (e.g. no mixed content).

histogram.name: Security.TimeOnPage
histogram.obsolete: Removed March 2019 in favor of Security.TimeOnPage2.
histogram.summary: Records the time spent on the page (the time that the page was in the foreground from the start of the navigation to the page visit completing due to a new navigation or the tab being closed). This aggregates all foreground time over the entire visit (multiple times in the foreground are added together). For pages that were never backgrounded, this histogram (accidentally) collects 0 instead of the actual foreground time.

histogram.name: Security.TreatInsecureOriginAsSecure
histogram.obsolete: Removed April 2020 as it is no longer used.
histogram.summary: Records the number of origins which will be treated as secure based on their presence in the '--unsafely-treat-insecure-origin-as-secure' command-line flag.

histogram.name: SendTabToSelf.DeviceCount
histogram.summary: Record how many valid devices are shown when user trigger to see the device list.

histogram.name: SendTabToSelf.Notification
histogram.summary:
The use of desktop notification for SendTabToSelf.
These notifications are tied to a sync type so there is a distinction between user initiated actions (Opened, Dismissed) and actions that are initiated by changes to the sync model (Shown, DismissedRemotely).

histogram.name: SendTabToSelf.Sync.AddEntryStatus
histogram.summary: The result of the add entry method when a tab is shared via SendTabToSelf

histogram.name: SendTabToSelf.Sync.ApplySyncChangesStatus
histogram.summary: The result of the ApplySyncChanges method when a tab is shared via SendTabToSelf

histogram.name: SendTabToSelf.Sync.ModelLoadedInTime
histogram.summary: Whether or not the SendTabToSelf model was loaded in time to perform the necessary update.

histogram.name: SendTabToSelf.Sync.NotifyLocalDevice
histogram.summary: The number of entry that are sent to the SendTabToSelf NotificationHandler.

histogram.name: Sensors.Windows.ISensor.Activation.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 after the WinRT backend experiment concluded.
histogram.summary: The HRESULTs returned from activating a sensor in the ISensor API, used in the implementation of W3C sensors on Windows. This includes both errors and successes (S_OK).

histogram.name: Sensors.Windows.ISensor.Start.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 after the WinRT backend experiment concluded.
histogram.summary: The HRESULTs returned from starting a sensor in the ISensor API, used in the implementation of W3C sensors on Windows. This includes both errors and successes (S_OK).

histogram.name: Sensors.Windows.ISensor.Stop.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 after the WinRT backend experiment concluded.
histogram.summary: The HRESULTs returned from stopping a sensor in the ISensor API, used in the implementation of W3C sensors on Windows. This includes both errors and successes (S_OK).

histogram.name: Sensors.Windows.WinRT.Activation.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 after the WinRT backend experiment concluded.
histogram.summary: The HRESULTs returned from activating a sensor in the Windows.Devices.Sensors WinRT API, used in the implementation of W3C sensors on Windows. This includes both errors and successes (S_OK).

histogram.name: Sensors.Windows.WinRT.Start.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 after the WinRT backend experiment concluded.
histogram.summary: The HRESULTs returned from starting a sensor in the Windows.Devices.Sensors WinRT API, used in the implementation of W3C sensors on Windows. This includes both errors and successes (S_OK).

histogram.name: Sensors.Windows.WinRT.Stop.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 after the WinRT backend experiment concluded.
histogram.summary: The HRESULTs returned from stopping a sensor in the Windows.Devices.Sensors WinRT API, used in the implementation of W3C sensors on Windows. This includes both errors and successes (S_OK).

histogram.name: SequencedWorkerPool.ShutdownDelayTime
histogram.summary: How long it takes to wait for tasks that block shutdown to complete.

histogram.name: SequencedWorkerPool.TaskCount
histogram.obsolete: Histogram wasn't even reported anymore when ownership was taken in 11/2015.
histogram.summary: How many pending tasks there are on each request for work from a worker thread.

histogram.name: SequencedWorkerPool.UnrunnableTaskCount
histogram.obsolete: Histogram wasn't even reported anymore when ownership was taken in 11/2015.
histogram.summary: How many tasks we skip over to find the next runnable task.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary:
The time taken for the browser to find and possibly start an active worker to dispatch a FetchEvent for a main frame resource request. BEWARE: This metric includes the time taken for redirects. It starts when the URLRequest is created, and ends when the worker is ready. For context, a FetchEvent can only be dispatched to an ACTIVATED worker that is running (it has been successfully started). The measurements starts when the browser process receives the request. The browser then finds the worker appropriate for this request (if there is none, this metric is not recorded). If that worker is already started, the browser process can send the request to it, so the measurement ends quickly. Otherwise the browser process has to start the worker and the measurement ends when the worker is successfully started (we do not include in the time it takes for the worker to become ACTIVATED). The metric is not recorded in the following situations: 1) The worker was in state INSTALLED or ACTIVATING, and the browser had to wait for it to become ACTIVATED. This is to avoid including the time to execute the activate event handlers in the worker's script. 2) The worker was started for the fetch AND DevTools was attached during startup. This is intended to avoid including the time for debugging. 3) The request is for New Tab Page. This is because it tends to dominate the stats and makes the results largely skewed.
It will be removed after NetS13nSW ships. https://crbug.com/715640

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Type
histogram.summary: The type of preparation needed for the browser to find and possibly start an active worker to dispatch a FetchEvent for a main frame resource request. See details at ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The suffixed histograms for .Time record the time required for each type.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ActivateEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onactivate. Includes the time for waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.BackgroundFetchedEvent.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2018, and renamed to BackgroundFetchSuccessEvent. See ServiceWorker.BackgroundFetchSuccessEvent.Time instead.
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a BackgroundFetchedEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ContextRequestHandlerStatus
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary:
The result of ServiceWorkerContextRequestHandler handling a request for a service worker script. The histogram is suffixed to distinguish new vs installed workers and main vs imported scripts.
Note that since M64, this no longer includes most script loads because those are handled by ServiceWorkerInstalledScriptsManager, which doesn't record this histogram.
It will be removed after NetS13nSW ships. https://crbug.com/715640

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCacheMigrator.MigrationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed because the migrator was removed as of 12/2015.
histogram.summary: Records result of ServiceWorkerDiskCacheMigrator::Start that migrates resources in BlockFile backend to Simple backend.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCacheMigrator.MigrationTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed because the migrator was removed as of 12/2015.
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerDiskCache migration from BlockFile to Simple.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.DiskCacheMigrator.NumberOfMigratedResources
histogram.obsolete: Removed because the migrator was removed as of 12/2015.
histogram.summary: The counts of resources migrated by ServiceWorkerDiskCacheMigrator. This includes the main script and imported scripts.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.EventDispatchingDelay
histogram.summary:
The time taken between sending an event IPC from the browser process to a Service Worker and executing the event handler in the Service Worker.
For subresource fetch events (_FETCH_SUB_RESOURCE suffix) When NetS13nSW (https://crbug.com/715640) is enabled, this is the time between sending a DispatchFetchEvent message from the main thread and executing the event handler in the Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.EventHandledRatioType.Fetch
histogram.summary: Records the proportion of (non foreign) fetch events that are handled compared to the number of events that are fired for a ServiceWorker. Recorded each time the ServiceWorker is stopped when at least one event was fired.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.EventHandledRatioType.ForeignFetch
histogram.summary: Records the proportion of foreign fetch events that are handled compared to the number of events that are fired for a ServiceWorker. Recorded each time the ServiceWorker is stopped when at least one event was fired.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2015-07-13; please use ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.HasResponse.Time or ServiceWorker.FetchEvent.Fallback.Time.
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onfetch. Includes the time for the respondWith() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onfetch. Includes the time for the respondWith() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.FetchRespondWithDataPipeCreation.Time
histogram.summary: Measures how long the service worker thread is blocked creating a mojo::DataPipe during FetchEvent.respondWith() processing.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetch.OriginCount
histogram.summary: The number of origins a particular service worker with foreign fetch registrations will intercept fetches from. A value of zero indicates that the foreign fetch service worker intercepts requests from any origin. Recorded at the end of a successful install event, if the service worker registered for foreign fetch. A service worker that registers for foreign fetch must always intercept fetches from at least one origin or intercept fetches from all origins.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetch.ScopeCount
histogram.summary: The number of foreign fetch scopes a particular service worker registered for. Recorded at the end of every successful install event. A value of zero indicates that the service worker did not register for foreign fetch.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetchEvent.Fallback.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a ForeignFetchEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a fallback-to-network reply. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle, if any.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetchEvent.HasResponse.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a ForeignFetchEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a response. Includes the time for the respondWith() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ForeignFetchEvent.WaitUntil.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching a ForeignFetchEvent to a Service Worker and finishing the ForeignFetch. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle. If there is no waitUntil promise, this will be almost the same with HasResponse.Time or Fallback.Time.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.InstallEvent.Status
histogram.summary: The result of dispatching the install event to the worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.InstallEvent.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken between dispatching an InstallEvent to a Service Worker and receiving a message that it finished handling the event. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.InstallEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.oninstall. Includes the time for the waitUntil() promise to settle.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.LoadTiming.MainFrame.MainResource.ForwardServiceWorkerToWorkerReady
histogram.summary:
The time taken from (a) a resource loading request is routed to service worker path, to (b) a service worker is ready to handle the request.
Recorded for each navigation request (including redirects) where there is a fetch event handler and the fetch event was successfully dispatched to the service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.LoadTiming.MainFrame.MainResource.ResponseReceivedToCompleted
histogram.summary:
The time taken from (a) response headers from service worker are received, to (b) reading response body is completed. Recorded when a fetch event handler handled the request.
Recorded for each navigation request (including redirects) where there is a fetch event handler and the fetch event was successfully dispatched to the service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.LoadTiming.Subresource.ResponseReceivedToCompleted
histogram.summary:
The time taken from (a) response headers from service worker are received, to (b) reading response body is completed. Only recorded when a fetch event handler handled the request.
Recorded for each subresource request where there is a fetch event handler and the fetch event was successfully dispatched to the service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MainFramePageLoad.CoreTransition
histogram.summary: The transition type for main frame page loads controlled by a service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MainFramePageLoad.RedirectChainLength
histogram.summary: Total length of the server redirects during main frame page loads controlled by a service worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MainResourceRequestDestination
histogram.summary:
Describes whether a main resource request (i.e., a request for a main frame, subframe, or shared worker) was routed to service worker or network and why. The purpose is to debug why ServicifiedServiceWorker has a lower count of ServiceWorker.MainResource.FetchEvent.Status than the control: https://crbug.com/866335.
Recorded for every main resource request that is seen by ServiceWorkerControlleeRequestHandler (usually means all http(s) requests). If redirects occur, it is recorded for each redirect.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MessageEvent.Time
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onmessage.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.MessageEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onmessage.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationHintPrecision
histogram.obsolete: This experiment was turned down, see https://crbug.com/616502.
histogram.summary: The precision of the speculative launch of Service Workers for navigation hints. Recorded when the worker is stopped. If there was no main/sub frame fetch event fired on the worker, this value is false. This means that the speculative launch wasn't helpful.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.ConcurrentTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2017 in favor of ServiceWorker.NavPreload.ConcurrentTime, see https://crbug.com/728035.
histogram.summary: The duration of time when both (1) a service worker is being found and possibly started up, (2) the navigation preload request is in-flight. The measurement ends once either the worker is prepared, or the navigation preload response is received (OnReceiveResponse() is called). This is a rough estimate of the performance win of using navigation preload, ignoring concurrency overhead. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.FinishedBeforeStartWorker
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2017 in favor of ServiceWorker.NavPreload.FinishedFirst, see https://crbug.com/728035.
histogram.summary: Whether the navigation preload response arrived before the activated and running service worker was prepared. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.HeaderSize
histogram.summary: The size of Service-Worker-Navigation-Preload header when the navigation preload request is to be sent. The default value of the header is "true", so the default size is 4.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.NavPreloadAfterSWStart
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2017. No replacement exists. See https://crbug.com/728035.
histogram.summary:
This is recorded in the case where the activated and running service worker was prepared before the navigation preload response arrived. It is the remaining time it took to receive the response after the worker was prepared.
This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event (for the case mentioned above), with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.ResponseTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2017 in favor of ServiceWorker.NavPreload.ResponseTime. See https://crbug.com/728035.
histogram.summary: The time taken for the navigation preload response to start, i.e., when OnReceiveResponse() is called. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is successfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavigationPreload.SWStartAfterNavPreload
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2017 in favor of ServiceWorker.NavPreload.WorkerWaitTime. See https://crbug.com/728035.
histogram.summary:
This is recorded in the case where the navigation preload response arrived before the activated and running service worker was prepared. It is the remaining time it took to prepare the worker after the response arrived.
This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event (for the case mentioned above), with the same restrictions as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is additionally recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavPreload.ConcurrentTime
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary:
The duration of time when both (1) a service worker is being found and possibly started up, (2) the navigation preload request is in-flight. The measurement ends once either the worker is prepared, or the navigation preload response is received (OnReceiveResponse() is called). This is a rough estimate of the performance win of using navigation preload, ignoring concurrency overhead. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions enumerated 1) through 3) for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is only recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.
It will be removed after NetS13nSW ships. https://crbug.com/715640

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavPreload.FinishedFirst
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary:
Whether the navigation preload response arrived before the activated and running service worker was prepared. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions numbered 1) through 3) for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is only recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.
It will be removed after NetS13nSW ships. https://crbug.com/715640

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavPreload.ResponseTime
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary:
The time taken for the navigation preload response to start, i.e., when OnReceiveResponse() is called. This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is successfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event, with the same restrictions numbered 1) through 3) for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is only recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.
It will be removed after NetS13nSW ships. https://crbug.com/715640

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavPreload.WorkerPreparationType
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary:
The type of preparation needed for the browser to find and possibly start an active worker to dispatch a FetchEvent for a main frame resource request, when navigation preload also occurred.
This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event (for the case mentioned above), with the same restrictions numbered 1) through 3) as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is only recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.
This is similar to ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Type_NavigationPreloadEnabled. The difference is ServiceWorker.NavPreload.WorkerPreparationType gets logged if the navigation preload successfully occurred, at the same time as the other ServiceWorker.NavPreload.* metrics so is more safely comparable to them. We could deprecate the Type_NavigationPreloadEnabled histogram if it turns out there is no significant difference.
It will be removed after NetS13nSW ships. https://crbug.com/715640

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NavPreload.WorkerWaitTime
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary:
This is recorded in the case where the navigation preload response arrived before the activated and running service worker was prepared. It is the remaining time it took to prepare the worker after the response arrived.
This histogram is recorded when a navigation preload response is succesfully forwarded to the service worker's fetch event (for the case mentioned above), with the same restrictions numbered 1) through 3) as for ServiceWorker.ActivatedWorkerPreparationForMainFrame.Time. The sample is only recorded to the appropriate suffixed histograms.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.NotificationClickEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onnotificationclick.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.PushEventExecutionTime
histogram.summary: Execution time of ServiceWorkerGlobalScope.onpush.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.RegistrationCount
histogram.obsolete: No longer needed as found the cause of stability issue to be number of registrations rather than size of registrations. Removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: Number of service worker registrations to be added in ServiceWorkerRegistry::DidGetAllRegistrations().

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.RegistrationInfo.ScopeLength
histogram.obsolete: No longer needed as found the cause of stability issue to be number of registrations rather than size of registrations. Removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: The length of the scope url in the ServiceWorkerRegistrationInfo is measured for each service worker registration to give a better idea of the data structure as a whole. This metric is collected in ServiceWorkerRegistration::GetInfo().

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.RequestTimeouts.Count
histogram.summary: The number of Service Worker request timeouts, by request type.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.ScriptLoadSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2018 (M69). This was recorded as 100% success since service worker script streaming launched in M64, since load failures didn't reach this UMA. When there is an error reading the script from storage, it's typically recorded as a start worker failure under SERVICE_WORKER_ERROR_DISK_CACHE.
histogram.summary: Whether loading the service worker script succeeded. Only recorded for installed service workers. Recorded by the browser process when reported back by the renderer during worker startup.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartHintPrecision
histogram.summary: The precision of the speculative launch of Service Workers for navigation hints. Recorded when the worker is stopped. True if a fetch event for a main/sub frame navigation was fired on the worker before it stopped; otherwise, false. False means the speculative launch wasn't helpful.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartNewWorker.Status
histogram.summary: The result of trying to start a Service Worker that has not yet installed. See also ServiceWorker.StartWorker.Status for installed workers.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StartWorker.InstalledScriptsSender.FinishedReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code in July 2019 since ServiceWorkerScriptStreaming successfully launched.
histogram.summary: The result of sending installed scripts over ServiceWorkerInstalledScriptsSender. This is recorded after every start worker attempt that sent the scripts through ServiceWorkerInstalledScriptsSender.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.StopWorker.Status
histogram.obsolete: Removed from code in Oct 2015, replaced with ServiceWorker.WorkerStopped.
histogram.summary: The result of trying to stop a Service Worker. Recorded only for installed Service Workers that succesfully stopped or were detected as stalling. If a worker stalled and later stopped, it will be recorded as both STALLED and STALLED_THEN_STOPPED.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.Storage.DiskCacheMigrationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed because the migrator was removed as of 12/2015.
histogram.summary: Records the final result of diskcache migration in ServiceWorkerStorage. ServiceWorker.DiskCacheMigrator.MigrationResult records more detailed status of migration operations.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.SubresourceNotifyStartLoadingResponseBodyDelay
histogram.summary: The time between when the ServiceWorkerSubresourceLoader receives a Response and when it notifies the loader's client that the body has started loading. This is different from SubresourceStartBlobReadingDelay in that notifying the client about the Response may take place some time later than when the blob body reading begins. This will be triggered for every successful subresource load handled by a ServiceWorker with servification enabled.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.SubresourceStartBlobReadingDelay
histogram.summary: The time between when the ServiceWorkerSubresourceLoader receives a Response with a blob body and when the main blob data starts to get read. This will be triggered for every successful subresource load handled by a ServiceWorker with ServiceWorker servification enabled.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.TerminateThread.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken in the renderer process between the main thread asking the worker thread to terminate and getting ACK that it terminated.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.TimeBetweenEvents
histogram.summary: Called at the beginning of each ServiceWorkerVersion::Dispatch*Event function: the time elapsed since idle. Generally this is the time between one event ending and one event starting, if the worker remained running in the interim.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.UnhandledEventRatio
histogram.summary: Records the ratio of unhandled events to all events that are dispatched to each ServiceWorker. Recorded when each ServiceWorkerVersion is destructed.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.UpdateCheck.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-07 because we could confirm byte-for-byte update checking for imported scripts works.
histogram.summary: Records the result of byte-for-byte update checking. If it's not OK, it means that script comparison doesn't work well. Recorded only when ServiceWorkerImportedScriptUpdateCheck is enabled.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.UpdateCheck.UpdateFound
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-07 because we could confirm byte-for-byte update checking for imported scripts works.
histogram.summary: Records the result of byte-for-byte update checking. Recorded only when ServiceWorkerImportedScriptUpdateCheck is enabled and ServiceWorker.UpdateCheck.Result is OK.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.FallbackedRequestMode
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary: Records the the mode of request that was fallbacked to the network by the Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.MainResource.Result
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary: Records the result of a main resource request forwarded to a Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.MainResource.StatusZeroError
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary: Records the error provided when the renderer returns a response with status code zero to a main resource request forwarded to a Service Worker (i.e., ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.MainResource.Result was REQUEST_JOB_ERROR_RESPONSE_STATUS_ZERO).

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.Subresource.Result
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary: Records the result of a subresource request forwarded to a Service Worker.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.Subresource.StatusZeroError
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded since NetS13nSW shipped on Dec 2018.
histogram.summary: Records the error provided when the renderer returns a response with status code zero to a subresource request forwarded to a Service Worker (i.e., ServiceWorker.URLRequestJob.Subresource.Result was REQUEST_JOB_ERROR_RESPONSE_STATUS_ZERO).

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.VersionInfo.ClientCount
histogram.obsolete: No longer needed as found the cause of stability issue to be number of registrations rather than size of registrations. Removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: Number of clients associated with each service worker version, for better estimation of the size of ServiceWorkerRegistrationInfo. This metric is collected in ServiceWorkerVersion::GetInfo(), and clients for all versions (active, waiting, and installing) are counted for now.

histogram.name: ServiceWorker.VersionInfo.ScriptURLLength
histogram.obsolete: No longer needed as found the cause of stability issue to be number of registrations rather than size of registrations. Removed in July 2020.
histogram.summary: The length of the script url in ServiceWorkerVersionInfo is measured for each service worker version to give a better idea of the memory size of ServiceWorkerRegistrationInfo as a whole. This metric is collected in ServiceWorkerVersion::GetInfo().

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Cache.AddResponseType
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was removed in M77.
histogram.summary: Records the response type to be added in the Cache by Cache.add()/addAll().

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.DiskCacheCreateEntryResult
histogram.summary: The network result code produced by disk_cache::Backend::CreateEntry() when cache_storage is attempting to put a new request/response pair on disk.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.IndexSizeDifference
histogram.obsolete: No longer used. Removed in April 2020.
histogram.summary: The absolute difference between the ServiceWorker Cache size saved to the CacheStorage index and the actual cache size when opened.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.PeakParallelSharedOps
histogram.obsolete: Replaced in M78 with ServiceWorkerCache.PeakParallelSharedOps2 that uses a smaller histogram range with the same number of buckets in order to improve bucket granularity.
histogram.summary: The peak number of shared operations that ran simultaneously during a single "batch" of operations. A batch is defined as the time from when an idle scheduler begins running a shared operation until the count of running shared operations drops back to zero.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.PeakParallelSharedOps2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85 since the parallel operation trial launched already. Also, this histogram did not provide very useful information.
histogram.summary: The peak number of shared operations that ran simultaneously during a single "batch" of operations. A batch is defined as the time from when an idle scheduler begins running a shared operation until the count of running shared operations drops back to zero.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Response.HasDeprecatedURL
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was removed in M77 when we began deleting entries with the deprecated url field.
histogram.summary: True if a response read from the CacheStorage has a url field. This field was deprecated in M57.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.IsOperationSlow
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was removed in M85 in favor of the OperationDuration2 histograms that provide full timing information for operations.
histogram.summary: An operation is slow (true) if it takes at least 10 seconds to run. If an operation never completes, it will still be recorded as slow.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.OperationDuration
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was deprecated in M72 in favor of ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.OperationDuration2.
histogram.summary: The time in ms from when an operation is started until it completes.

histogram.name: ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.QueueDuration
histogram.obsolete: This histogram was deprecated in M72 in favor of ServiceWorkerCache.Scheduler.QueueDuration2.
histogram.summary: The time in ms from when an operation was queued until its task is posted.

histogram.name: Servicification.Startup
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-02 in favour of Servicification.Startup2. The data was incompelete since it was only recorded the first time when the ServiceManager was launched.
histogram.summary: Histogram of how Chrome is launched, either in ServiceManager only mode or as full browser, as well as either cold start or warm start. See go/servicification_startup_metrics for more details.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.Actions
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-05. Not actively used in current projects.
histogram.summary: The actions that have occurred in a session restore timeline. These are to be interpreted as raw event counts. Tabs are almost certainly deferred due to the existence memory pressure, but this may not always be the case.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.AllTabsLoaded
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-05. Not actively used in current projects.
histogram.summary: The time from SessionRestore start until all tabs have finished loading.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.command_size
histogram.summary: The size of the commands written to disk. See CommandStorageBackend for details.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.FirstTabPainted
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-10 in favor of SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint and ultimately SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint3.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstLoaded
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-05. Not actively used in current projects.
histogram.summary: The time from SessionRestore start until a visible tab has finished loading.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-03-13 in favor of SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint2 and ultimately SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint3.
histogram.summary: Deprecated 2015-03-13 in favor of SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint2 and ultimately SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint3.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint2
histogram.summary: The time from SessionRestore start until a visible tab's first paint. This metric only records paints that have occurred after a tab has loaded.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ForegroundTabFirstPaint3
histogram.summary: The time from SessionRestore start until a visible tab's first paint.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.FrameUniqueNameFromRequestedNameSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-05-02. This data was used to confirm that the unique name generation change succeeded in reducing memory usage, and is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The size of a unique name derived from the browsing context name. Emitted when generating a unique name for a new subframe or when a subframe's browsing context name is changed before the first real load is committed. Only applies to subframes as main frames always have an empty unique name.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.FrameUniqueNameLength
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-08 due to unique name generation change. Please use SessionRestore.FrameUniqueNameFromRequestedNameSize and SessionRestore.FrameUniqueNameWithFramePathSize instead.
histogram.summary: Records the length of unique names for web frames that are saved as part of session restore data. It is logged each time the unique name changes, which typically happens when a web frame is first created or its name is changed by mutating window.name.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.FrameUniqueNameOriginalRequestedNameSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-05-02. This data was used to confirm that the unique name generation change succeeded in reducing memory usage, and is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The size of the browsing context name (based on the iframe name attribute or window.name) when generating the unique name. Emitted when generating a unique name for a new subframe or when a subframe's browsing context name is changed before the first real load is committed. Only applies to subframes as main frames always have an empty unique name.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.FrameUniqueNameWithFramePathSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-05-02. This data was used to confirm that the unique name generation change succeeded in reducing memory usage, and is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The size of a unique name when falling back to the frame path algorithm. The fallback path is used when the browsing context name is empty or non-unique. Emitted when generating a unique name for a new subframe or when a subframe's browsing context name is changed before the first real load is committed. Only applies to subframes as main frames always have an empty unique name.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.FrameUniqueNameWithFramePathSizePerComponent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-05-02. This data was used to confirm that the unique name generation change succeeded in reducing memory usage, and is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The size of a unique name when falling back to the frame path algorithm, divided by the depth of the frame. Used to normalize sizes for deeper nodes in a frame tree. Emitted when generating a unique name for a new subframe or when a subframe's browsing context name is changed before the first real load is committed. Only applies to subframes as main frames always have an empty unique name.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.last_session_file_size
histogram.summary: The size, in k, of the last session file on disk.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.NavEntryCommittedLongPeriod
histogram.summary: Like NavEntryCommittedPeriod, but specifically to provide a clearer breakdown of samples in the 10 minutes - 8 hours range.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.NavEntryCommittedPeriod
histogram.summary: Milliseconds between subsequent Save() operations due to a nav entry being committed (new tab created + nav initiated).

histogram.name: SessionRestore.NavigationListPrunedLongPeriod
histogram.summary: Like NavListPrunedPeriod, but specifically to provide a clearer breakdown of samples in the 10 minutes - 8 hours range.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.NavigationListPrunedPeriod
histogram.summary: Milliseconds between subsequent Save() operations due to the navigation list being pruned (typically a change in back/forward stacks).

histogram.name: SessionRestore.ParallelTabLoads
histogram.summary: The number of tabs that were loaded simultaneously when restoring a session.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.read_session_file_time
histogram.summary: Amount of time to read and assemble the commands from the last session.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.RestoredSubframeURL
histogram.summary: How often history navigations in subframes restore a different URL than the frame's default src URL. This indicates how much users rely on subframe session history items.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.RestoredTab.SiteEngagementScore
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-05. Not actively used in current projects.
histogram.summary: The site engagement score associated with a tab restored by session restore, recorded at the moment the tab is restored.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.RestoreSubframeFramePathLength
histogram.obsolete: Removed in July 2019 / M77, since new approach landed in r493153 (M62).
histogram.summary: Records the length of unique names that include frame paths, for subframes that are restoring a different URL than the frame's default src URL during a history navigation. Large values here would indicate a possible challenge for the plan to truncate frame unique names (to save memory).

histogram.name: SessionRestore.SaveLongPeriod
histogram.summary: Like SavePeriod, but specifically to provide a clearer breakdown of samples in the 10 minutes - 8 hours range.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.SavePeriod
histogram.summary:
Amount of time between subsequent SessionService Save() operations (aka updates to session data).
Periods longer than 10 minutes are grouped together; see SaveLongPeriod for resolution.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.SubFrameUniqueNameChangedBeforeFirstCommit
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-05 as data is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: How often a subframe is assigned a new name between the initial empty document and the first navigation.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabActions
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-05. Not actively used in current projects.
histogram.summary: A breakdown of key events that occur to individual tabs as they are processed by an ongoing session restore.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabClosedLongPeriod
histogram.summary: TabClosedPeriod, but specifically to provide a clearer breakdown of samples in the 10 minutes - 8 hours range.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabClosedPeriod
histogram.summary: Milliseconds between subsequent Save() operations due to a tab being closed.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-05. Not actively used in current projects.
histogram.summary: The number of tabs involved in a single session restore event.

histogram.name: SessionRestore.TabLoadTimeout
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-05. Not actively used in current projects.
histogram.summary: The boolean indicates whether the tab load was initiated because a previous tab load completed (including the tab was closed) or whether the tab load was initiated because a timer fired to start the next load (true) during session restore.

histogram.name: SessionStorageDatabase.Commit
histogram.obsolete: Removed during the SessionStorage onion soup refactoring.
histogram.summary: The result of a commit to the sessionStorage database.

histogram.name: Settings.DefaultSearchProvider
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Chrome 30. Use Search.DefaultSearchProviderType instead.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the default search engine domain that is specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.EnforcementGroupDeterminedFromTrial
histogram.obsolete: Removed from the codebase in M85. This trial has long been obsolete.
histogram.summary: Whether the SettingsEnforcement group was successfully determined from the field trial or if it had to revert to the hardcoded default.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageDomain
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Chrome 30. Replaced by Settings.HomePageEngineType.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The id of the home page domain that is specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the home page user preference is set to the default NTP value when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage.PulledFromSync
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The value of the home-page-is-new-tab-page pref when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.HomePageIsNewTabPage.PushedToSync
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The value of the home-page-is-new-tab-page pref when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.InitializedFromMasterPrefs
histogram.summary: Logged on first run when generating the Preferences file from master_preferences. True if serializing the generated Preferences file to disk was successful, false otherwise. Note: this event does not occur if there is no master_preferences file on first run.

histogram.name: Settings.JsonDataSizeKilobytes
histogram.summary: The size of the JSON settings content about to be written to disk in kilobytes. Suffixed with the name of the JSON file being written to disk.

histogram.name: Settings.JsonDataWriteCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 due to lack of use.
histogram.summary: The number of writes of a JSON file that occur in every 5 minute period of running Chrome. Suffixed with the name of the corresponding JSON file.

histogram.name: Settings.LegacyMachineIdGenerationSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether generation of the RLZ deterministic machine-specific device id was successful when creating the ProfilePrefStore.

histogram.name: Settings.LoadCompletedTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Non MD version of Settings has been deprecated.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad event and the render frame DocumentOnLoadCompleted event for the settings page.

histogram.name: Settings.LoadDocumentTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019. Non MD version of Settings has been deprecated.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the render frame host StartProvisionalLoad and DidFinishDocumentLoad events for the settings page.

histogram.name: Settings.MachineIdGenerationSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Chrome 63, as we verified that machine id generation was not flaky.
histogram.summary: Whether generation of the deterministic machine-specific device id was successful when initializing the PrefHashStore.

histogram.name: Settings.MigratedHashesFromLocalState
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Chrome 54, as we stopped legacy migration of preferences.
histogram.summary: Whether, while loading a profile, any preference hashes were migrated from Local State to either Preferences or Protected Preferences.

histogram.name: Settings.PinnedTabs
histogram.summary: The number of pinned tabs opened when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.RegisterProfilePrefsTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during RegisterProfilePrefs.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The enabled state of the Home button pref when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.ShowHomeButton.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The enabled state of the Home button pref when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageDomains
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Chrome 30. Replaced by Settings.StartupPageEngineTypes.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The ids of startup page domains that are specified in user preferences when a profile is loaded.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings.PulledFromSync
histogram.summary: The startup page setting when pulled down from sync to update an out-of-sync local pref store.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadSettings.PushedToSync
histogram.summary: The startup page setting when pushed up to sync from a change made locally.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupPageLoadURLs
histogram.summary: The number of URLs to be loaded on startup when a profile is loaded, if the startup page setting is set to load URLs.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupURLsMigration
histogram.summary: The startup URLs pref migration steps.

histogram.name: Settings.StartupURLsResetTime
histogram.summary: The time elapsed in milliseconds in between startup URLs pref migration. A value of 0 indicates that the last migration time was in the future due to e.g. an incorrect system time.

histogram.name: Settings.SyncSetup.DisplayedSwaaState
histogram.summary: Tracks the sWAA value we show to the user in chrome://settings/syncSetup for sync users. This tracks as well the different states for which sWAA can be off. This is recorded everytime the sWAA state is calculated/refreshed. Only Desktop.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferenceMigrated
histogram.summary: Logs the tracked preference id when it is migrated to the new MAC algorithm. This should only happen once per pref per profile.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersion
histogram.summary: The version of a PrefHashStore, reported once for each alternate PrefHashStore (not associated to the default profile) from a delayed task on startup.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersionUpdatedFrom
histogram.summary: The previous version of an alternate PrefHashStore (not associated to the default profile) that was updated from a delayed task on startup. This should match Settings.TrackedPreferencesAlternateStoreVersion fairly closely for all versions but VERSION_LATEST which should never be reported here.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedPreferencesInitializedForUnloadedProfile
histogram.summary: Preference tracking was initialized for an unloaded profile. This should happen at most once per profile.

histogram.name: Settings.TrackedSplitPreferenceChanged
histogram.summary: The number of items that had changed in a dictionary pref when Settings.TrackedPreferenceChanged is reported for that pref.

histogram.name: Settings.ZoomLevelPreferencesMigrated
histogram.summary: Tracks migration to per-partition zoom-level preferences during profile initialization.

histogram.name: SettingsAppMonitor.InitializationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019. All signs indicate that it is exceptionally rare for initialization to fail.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether or not the Windows Settings app monitor was initialized.

histogram.name: SettingsPage.PrivacyElementInteractions
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2020. Replaced with Settings.PrivacyElementInteractions to stick to naming conventions.
histogram.summary: Which privacy related settings elements a user interacted with. Recorded every time a user interacts with an element of interest.

histogram.name: SettingsPage.SettingsPageInteractions
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2020. Recording too much duplicate data with route navigation histogram (WebUI.Settings.PathVisited).
histogram.summary: Which settings a user interacted with. Recorded every time a user interacts with a setting.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.DelayBeforePromptParam
histogram.summary: The feature parameter determining the amount of time to wait after startup before attempting to show the settings reset prompt. Logged once after startup.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.NumberOfExtensionsDisabled
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that were disabled after the user accepted the settings reset prompt.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.NumberOfExtensionsToDisable
histogram.summary: The number of extensions that will be disabled if the user accepts the settings reset prompt. Logged once after startup.

histogram.name: SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilDeclined
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M59 in April 2017 and replaced by SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilCanceled and SettingsResetPrompt.TimeUntilDismissed.
histogram.summary: The time between the settings reset prompt dialog being shown and the user declining the prompt.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.ApplyArchivePatchTime
histogram.summary: The elapesed time to apply a patch to a previous version's chrome.7z archive to generate a new chrome.7z archive. This histogram only applies to diff updates.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.CumulativeDiskUsage
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M82, then replaced by Setup.Install.CumulativeDiskUsage2 on 06/2020.
histogram.summary: The cumulative disk usage in MB during install or uninstall attempt, recorded right after the install/uninstall attempt on windows only.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.DeleteAppHost
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when the legacy "app_host.exe" binary is deleted from the filesystem.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.HasArchivePatch
histogram.summary: True if the chrome.packed.7z archive contains a patch (in which case a diff update is taking place) or false if it contains a full archive (in which case a new install or a full update is taking place).

histogram.name: Setup.Install.LzmaUnPackNTSTATUS
histogram.summary: Record the NTSTATUS code of unpacking the contents of a 7z file.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.LzmaUnPackResult
histogram.summary: Record the return value of unpacking the contents of a 7z file.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.MultiChromeFrameRemoved
histogram.summary: Hit following a successful install or update when data from a legacy multi-install Chrome Frame is deleted from the registry.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeAbort
histogram.summary: Number of calls to DeleteOldVerions() made by a --delete-old-versions process that didn't delete all files that belong to old versions of Chrome. A --delete-old-versions process exits when another process tries to acquire the SetupSingleton or after too many unsuccessful attempts to delete all old files. A --delete-old-versions process that successfully acquires the SetupSingleton records to either the Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeAbort histogram or the Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeSuccess histogram.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeSuccess
histogram.summary: Number of calls to DeleteOldVersions() made by a --delete-old-versions process that successfully deleted all files that belong to old versions of Chrome. A --delete-old-versions process that successfully acquires the SetupSingleton records to either the Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeAbort histogram or the Setup.Install.NumDeleteOldVersionsAttemptsBeforeSuccess histogram.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.SingletonAcquisitionResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2019 because it is not used.
histogram.summary: The result of trying to acquire a setup singleton. On Windows, a setup.exe process must hold the setup singleton of a Chrome installation when it makes changes to it.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.StrandedChromeIsUsed
histogram.summary: The disposition of a stranded Chrome install discovered while updating multi-install Chrome Binaries. This metric is only logged in an edge case. The buckets indicate whether or not the "stranded" Chrome install has been used in the last 28 days. If so, it respresents a Chrome that has not been updating due to a logic flaw in the installer and will be repaired in the current update. If not, it likely represents Chrome Binaries that were previously used by Chrome Frame that has since been uninstalled and that will be uninstalled in a future update.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.UncompressArchivePatchTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to uncompress a chrome.7z patch. This histogram only applies to diff updates.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.UncompressFullArchiveTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to uncompress a full chrome.7z archive. This histogram only applies to new installs and to full updates.

histogram.name: Setup.Install.UnpackFullArchiveTime
histogram.summary: The elapsed time to unpack the uncompressed chrome.7z archive. This histogram applies to all installs and updates.

histogram.name: SharedMemory.CreateError
histogram.obsolete: Not accessed in months. Primary error was CREATE_FILE_MAPPING_FAILURE by far. Removed 2020-03.
histogram.summary: A histogram entry is emitted each time a shared memory object is constructed (for example, base::ReadOnlySharedMemoryRegion or the deprecated base::SharedMemory). The value of the entry indicates the type of error encountered during construction.

histogram.name: SharedMemory.CreateMacError
histogram.obsolete: Not accessed in months and no data reported for it at all. Removed 2020-03.
