histogram.summary: Emitted each time a shared memory region could not be created due to a failed Mac system call. The value of the entry indicates the return value of the failed call.

histogram.name: SharedMemory.CreateWinError
histogram.obsolete: Not accessed in months. Primary error was #1455 by far. Removed 2020-03.
histogram.summary: A histogram entry is emitted each time a shared memory object could not be created due to a failed Windows system call (for example, base::ReadOnlySharedMemoryRegion or the deprecated base::SharedMemory). The value of the entry indicates the result of the GetLastError() API call.

histogram.name: SharedMemory.TimeSpentMakingAnonymousMemory
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-06 because the Finch experiment SharedMemoryCreateStrategy has finished running.
histogram.summary: The time spent making a new region of shared, anonymous memory. This metric is not emitted if the shared memory region is read only.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.RendererSurviveForWorkerTime
histogram.summary: A survival time of RenderProcessHostImpl for the In-renderer Shared Worker from when FastShutdownIfPossible() is called.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToDeleted
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a SharedWorkerHost. This roughly corresponds to the lifetime of SharedWorker.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToScriptLoaded
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of SharedWorkerHost until when WorkerScriptLoaded is called.

histogram.name: SharedWorker.TimeToScriptLoadFailed
histogram.summary: The time from the creation of SharedWorkerHost until when WorkerScriptLoadFailed is called.

histogram.name: Sharing.ClickToCallContextMenuPhoneNumberParsingDelay
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84 after gathering enough data as a baseline.
histogram.summary:
Time taken to find a phone number in highlighted text for context menu. Desktop only.
Note: This metric drops reports on clients with low-resolution clocks, which means these reports will be biased against a portion of the population on Windows. See Windows.HasHighResolutionTimeTicks for the affected sample.

histogram.name: Sharing.ClickToCallDialIntent
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M81 in favor of Sharing.ClickToCallDialerPresent
histogram.summary: Logged when a user taps a Click to Call notification and a dial intent is fired to open the dialer. Distinguishes between empty string (no phone number) and not empty. Android only.

histogram.name: Sharing.ClickToCallHelpTextClicked
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M81 as there was not a lot of usage of the help link.
histogram.summary: Logged whenever a user clicks on the help text in a Click to Call dialog. The value is used to distinguish which dialog type was shown. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Sharing.ClickToCallPhoneCall
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 after collecting enough data. See https://crbug.com/1053140.
histogram.summary: The time from opening the dialer until a phone call is initiated. This is logged when we detect an outgoing phone call after opening the dialer as part of the Click to Call feature. Android only.

histogram.name: Sharing.ClickToCallPhoneNumberDigits
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 as the experiment has been stopped.
histogram.summary: The number of digits in a phone number. Logged when right clicking on a selected phone number or tel link, showing the Click to Call dialog and when selecting a device. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Sharing.ClickToCallPhoneNumberLength
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 as the experiment has been stopped.
histogram.summary: The number of characters in a phone number including digits and non-digits. Logged when right clicking on a selected phone number or tel link, showing the Click to Call dialog and when selecting a device. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Sharing.ClickToCallPhoneNumberRegexVariantResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 as the experiment has been stopped.
histogram.summary: The result of comparing a phone number regex variant against the simple version. Logged after right clicking on a selection and when selecting a device from the context menu. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Sharing.ClickToCallReceiveDeviceState
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M82 after collecting enough data. See https://crbug.com/1053140.
histogram.summary: The device state when receiving a Click to Call message. Indicates if the screen is on or off and if Chrome is running in foreground. Recorded when handling a Click to Call message. Android only.

histogram.name: Sharing.DownloadQRCode.Failed.Time
histogram.summary: Records how long it took to the failed attempt to save the QR code image.

histogram.name: Sharing.DownloadQRCode.Succeeded.Time
histogram.summary: Records how long it took to successfully save the QR code image.

histogram.name: Sharing.SendAckMessageSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether an ack message was sent successfully by the Sharing service. Logged in the callback for sending the message to FCM. All platforms.

histogram.name: Sharing.SendMessageSuccess
histogram.summary: Whether a SharingMessage was sent successfully by the Sharing service. Success requires receiving an ack message before the timeout. Logged after the send message callback is run. Not logged for sending ack messages. All platforms.

histogram.name: Sharing.VapidKeyCreationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-06 as the result is always successful.
histogram.summary: Result of Sharing VAPID key generation during registration. Logged after Sharing VAPID key generation is attempted.

histogram.name: Sharing.WebRtc.AddIceCandidate
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09 as the WebRTC experiment is shut down.
histogram.summary: Result of parsing received ice candidate. Logged when trying to add received ice candidate.

histogram.name: Sharing.WebRtc.ConnectionErrorReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09 as the WebRTC experiment is shut down.
histogram.summary: Error reason for closing a WebRTC connection. Logged when a p2p WebRTC connection is closed.

histogram.name: Sharing.WebRtc.ConnectionType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09 as the WebRTC experiment is shut down.
histogram.summary: Type of routing used to establish a connection with a remote device. Logged when a p2p connection is established using WebRTC by SharingService.

histogram.name: Sharing.WebRtc.OnMessageReceivedResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09 as the WebRTC experiment is shut down.
histogram.summary: Result of receiving and handling a message via WebRTC. Logged after receiving a message from remote device via WebRTC.

histogram.name: Sharing.WebRtc.SendMessageResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09 as the WebRTC experiment is shut down.
histogram.summary: Result of sending a SharingMessage by SharingService via WebRTC. Logged after sending the message.

histogram.name: Sharing.WebRtc.Timeout
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09 as the WebRTC experiment is shut down.
histogram.summary: State of the WebRTC connection when it timed out. Logged when the connection has been inactive for 30 seconds.

histogram.name: Sharing.WebRtc.TimingEvents
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-09 as the WebRTC experiment is shut down.
histogram.summary: Sharing WebRTC timing events logged during an active WebRTC connection.

histogram.name: ShortcutsProvider.QueryIndexTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/11/2020 as it has been unused for a while with no expectation to be used in the future.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for the ShortcutsProvider to perform a query after the user has typed N characters.

histogram.name: Shutdown.browser_exit.time
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Shutdown.browser_exit.time2 to get more resolution into the tail of the distribution (10/2016).
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the browser exit menu command.

histogram.name: Shutdown.end_session.time
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Shutdown.end_session.time2 to get more resolution into the tail of the distribution (10/2016).
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by an end session (user logs off, shuts down or reboots without explicitly exiting).

histogram.name: Shutdown.window_close.time
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Shutdown.window_close.time2 to get more resolution into the tail of the distribution (10/2016).
histogram.summary: Time for shutdown initiated by the last browser window being closed.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.LoadResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of loading a resource from Signed HTTP Exchange. Emitted each time a response is handled as Signed Exchange.

histogram.name: SignedExchange.Prefetch.LoadResult
histogram.summary: Records if the prefetched Signed Exchange was properly formatted and passed verification steps. Reported for each completed SignedExchange prefetch.

histogram.name: Signin.AccountTracker.DeprecatedServiceFlagDeleted
histogram.obsolete: Instrumentation code has been removed as the conversion has been completed.
histogram.summary:
This histogram records the removal of the ServiceState property from the identities known to the AccountTracker. It records whether the deprecated flag was found in the loaded data and had to be deleted.
This histogram will be used to check whether the migration has completed for all active installs on a given platform or not (and whether the code can be removed).
This is recorded on each profile load.

histogram.name: Signin.AddAccount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-07 as it was never used by the sign-in team.
histogram.summary: Track when chrome successfully adds an account. Failures are not tracked.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidSigninPromoAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed this histogram since we have had newly designed histograms Signin.SigninStartedAccessPoint, Signin.SigninCompletedAccessPoint, and Signin.SigninReason.
histogram.summary: Track how a user interfacts with the android signin promo.

histogram.name: Signin.AndroidTimeBetweenUpdateAccountList
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-03 as it is not needed by the signin team.
histogram.summary: Duration of time between UpdateAccountList calls. Recorded when OAuth2TokenServiceDelegateAndroid::UpdateAccountList completes.

histogram.name: Signin.ChromePrimaryAccountStateOnWebSignout
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. No longer useful after Dice is launched.
histogram.summary: Logs the state of the Chrome account when the user signs out on the web. This assumes that a logout of the web is always a complete logout of all the web accounts (e.g. single session signout is not supported).

histogram.name: Signin.DiceEnabledForProfile
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Signin.DiceMigrationStatus. Does not have any meaningful information.
histogram.summary: Whether Dice is enabled for the current profile, recorded at startup.

histogram.name: Signin.DiceMigrationNotReady.Reason
histogram.obsolete: Removed M80. Dice migration is complete.
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason of why DICE migration is not ready. It is computed by Dice reconcilor delegate on every reconciliation cycle.

histogram.name: Signin.DiceMigrationStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2020, as it was equivalent to Signin.SigninAllowed.
histogram.summary: The Dice migration status, recorded at startup for each profile.

histogram.name: Signin.DuringFirstRun
histogram.obsolete: Removed M77 in favor of Signin.SigninCompletedAccessPoint
histogram.summary: Track if the profile sign in took place during First Run or not. Logged at signin time. True means signin took place during First Run, False means anytime after.

histogram.name: Signin.ElapsedTimeFromInstallToSignin
histogram.summary: Track how many minutes of local system time elapsed from when Chrome was installed to when Signin occured for this profile.

histogram.name: Signin.MultiloginFinished
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M76. Use Signin.OAuthMultiloginResponseStatus instead.
histogram.summary: Reconds finished calls to Gaia Multilogin endpoint, both successful or not, and return the GoogleAuthError state NONE is a success, other values are failures.

histogram.name: Signin.MultiloginRetry
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M76, because multilogin switched to a new error type.
histogram.summary: Retry reason of failed Multilogin call during Chrome reconcile.

histogram.name: Signin.OAuth2TokenGetFailure
histogram.summary: Reason fetching an OAuth2 Token failed. Available on all OSes.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.AddedToChrome
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-09 because chrome no longer tries to reconcile from the cookie jar to the browser.
histogram.summary: How many accounts were added to the browser's token service because they were in the cookie jar.

histogram.name: Signin.Reconciler.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the execution time of the account reconciler.

histogram.name: Signin.RefreshTokenAnnotationRequest
histogram.obsolete: Removed this histogram along with the code that was logging it.
histogram.summary: Track when chrome successfully sends RefreshTokenAnnotationRequest.

histogram.name: Signin.RequestHeaderOperation.Dice
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-07, replaced with a log message.
histogram.summary: Tracks when Chrome adds or removes the Desktop Identity Consistency HTTP header to Gaia.

histogram.name: Signin.RequestHeaderOperation.Mirror
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-07, replaced with a log message.
histogram.summary: Tracks when Chrome adds or removes the the X-Chrome-Connected HTTP header to Gaia.

histogram.name: Signin.SignedInDurationBeforeSignout
histogram.obsolete: Removed in 7/2019 as the information it provides is no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Track how many minutes of real time (not browser active time) elapsed between profile signin and signout.

histogram.name: Signin.SigninSource
histogram.obsolete: Removed this histogram since we have had newly designed histograms Signin.SigninStartedAccessPoint, Signin.SigninCompletedAccessPoint, and Signin.SigninReason.
histogram.summary: Logs the original source that displayed the signin or reauth Gaia page, before the page is displayed.

histogram.name: Signin.SwitchSyncAccount.Source
histogram.summary: Tracks the usage of different flows that switch sync accounts. Logged after accounts have been switched.

histogram.name: Signin.TokenServiceDiceCompatible
histogram.obsolete: Removed M80. Obsolete after Dice migration completed.
histogram.summary: Tracks the state of kTokenServiceDiceCompatible preference. This is recorded at every startup, if the account consistency method is in Dice migration and is not ready yet to migrate to Dice.

histogram.name: Signin.TokenStateTransition
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. Obsolete after Dice is launched.
histogram.summary: Tracks the changes of refresh token states for all accounts. Tokens can have three states: Regular (retrieved from Gaia), Invalid (created by Chrome and known to be invalid) or None (no token). Recorded when a token is loaded or changed.

histogram.name: Signin.XDevicePromo.BrowsingSessionDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete because the XDevicePromo never shipped.
histogram.summary: How long a browsing session was measured to be. Logged when a Browser window becomes active if the previous activation was longer than the minimum configured in the "CrossDevicePromo" experiment. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.XDevicePromo.BrowsingSessionDurationComputed
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete because the XDevicePromo never shipped.
histogram.summary: How often browsers are considered activated, which in turn triggers the CrossDevicePromo. Logged every time a Browser window becomes active. We need this to estimate QPS for RPC calls. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.XDevicePromo.Eligibility
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete because the XDevicePromo never shipped.
histogram.summary: The reasons for which a profile is or is not eligible for the Desktop Cross Device Sign In Promo. Logged every time a new Browsing session is detected as part of a Browser window becoming active. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Signin.XDevicePromo.Initialized
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete because the XDevicePromo never shipped.
histogram.summary: Tracks if profiles initialized the XDevicePromo, and if not, why. Logged at Profile startup and (if not initialized then) when a new browsing session is detected during Browser window activation. Desktop only.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.DiskOpenStream2NonTinyLatency
histogram.summary: The time to open the stream 2 file successfully on disk cache entry open with known key, when the size of payload is greater than 32 bytes.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.DiskOpenStream2TinyLatency
histogram.summary: The time to open the stream 2 file successfully on disk cache entry open with known key, when the size of payload is 32 bytes or less.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryCreatedAndStream2Omitted
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-02. Not creating stream 2 on CreateEntry entries is indeed a good idea, since stream 2 writes are done on things opened with OpenEntry. (Which also means this metric wasn't good at evaluating the prevalence of stream 2 in general).
histogram.summary: Whether, upon creation of a new cache entry, the file for stream 2 was omitted since that stream was empty.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryCreationResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-08. Look at SyncOpenResult and SyncCreateResult.
histogram.summary: For entry creation operations that were sent to the disk, the result of creation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryOpenedAndStream2Removed
histogram.summary: Whether, upon opening of an existing cache entry, stream 2 was empty and the file for that stream was therefore removed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryOperationsPending
histogram.summary: At the time that operations are run, the number of pending operations on a particular entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.EntryTrailerSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2020-05 due to excessive quantities of data.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes read at the end of the entry file in order to process the EOF footer and the stream 0 data.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.CacheSizeOnStart
histogram.summary: The size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.MaxCacheSizeOnStart
histogram.summary: The maximum allowed size of the cache at the beginning of an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeOfEvicted
histogram.summary: The number of bytes to be erased in an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.Eviction.SizeWhenDone
histogram.summary: The size of the cache after running an eviction.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitHard
histogram.summary: The maximum limit of how many file descriptors a process can open. Emitted each time the browser is launched, if the limit could be retrieved. (This is the highest value we could raise the current limit to if we liked.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitSoft
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-07-03. Consider Memory.Browser.OpenFDsSoftLimit for similar information.
histogram.summary: The current limit of how many file descriptors a process can open. Emitted each time the browser is launched, if the limit could be retrieved. (We can raise this to the maximum limit if we like, without root access.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.FileDescriptorLimitStatus
histogram.summary: The result of trying to get the file descriptor limit. Emitted each time the browser is launched.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.GlobalOpenEntryCount
histogram.summary: The number of open entries across all caches backed by the Simple Cache. An entry is opened whenever a caller asks to open it to read or write cache data, and remains open until the last caller asks to close it. Logged whenever an entry is opened or closed.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeChange
histogram.summary: How the header size has changed in a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time a write operation occurs on the header stream. (This includes the initial write, rewrites, and other writes that we couldn't classify.)

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeDecreaseAbsolute
histogram.summary: The absolute size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeDecreasePercentage
histogram.summary: The relative size decrease of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a smaller size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeIncreaseAbsolute
histogram.summary: The absolute size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.HeaderSizeIncreasePercentage
histogram.summary: The relative size increase of the header stream of a Simple Cache entry, emitted every time the headers are rewritten with a larger size.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexCorrupt
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85, but code was missing at that point already.
histogram.summary: For each index load, whether the index file was corrupt.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexEntriesLoaded
histogram.summary: Number of entries loaded from the index file on start.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexEntriesRestored
histogram.summary: Number of entries restored from disk when there was no index or the index was corrupted.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexInitializationWaiters
histogram.summary: At the time of index initialization, the number of enqueued jobs awaiting index initialization.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexLoadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85, but didn't actually work before that.
histogram.summary: Time (as measured on the worker pool) spent loading the index file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexStale
histogram.summary: For each index load, whether the index file was stale.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteInterval.Background
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the background.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteInterval.Foreground
histogram.summary: The interval between index saves, for apps in the foreground.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Background
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the background, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.IndexWriteToDiskTime.Foreground
histogram.summary: The amount of time spend writing the index file to disk, for apps in the foreground, measured starting at the beginning of the write on the callback thread, and calculated using the completion time on the worker pool.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.KeyMatchedOnOpen
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-05 as the match checking was moved back into the entry itself, so this result is now reported in the SimpleCache.x.SyncOpenResult histograms.
histogram.summary: For each call to OpenEntry, whether the key on disk matched the request key.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.LastClusterLossPercent
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the percentage of disk space used by the cluster loss, the unused disk space in the last 4096 byte cluster of the file.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.LastClusterSize
histogram.summary: For each file in the Simple Cache, the number of bytes in the last 4096 byte cluster when the entry is saved to disk.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.NumOpsBlockedByPendingDoom
histogram.summary: Number of operations that were queued behind a particular doom operation (with a mass doom counting as a single operation).

histogram.name: SimpleCache.QueueLatency.CreateEntry
histogram.summary: Delay between when the I/O portion of CreateEntry is enqueued and when its execution begins.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.QueueLatency.OpenEntry
histogram.summary: Delay between when the I/O portion of OpenEntry is enqueued and when its execution begins.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.QueueLatency.OpenOrCreateEntry
histogram.summary: Delay between when the I/O portion of OpenOrCreateEntry is enqueued and when its execution begins.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.QueueLatency.PendingDoom
histogram.summary: Delay between when an operation is deferred due to a pending doom for its key, and when it can resume execution.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.ReadIsParallelizable
histogram.summary: For each Read operation, whether it could have been issued in parallel of a previous Read operation.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.ReadResult
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::ReadData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.ReadStream1FromPrefetched
histogram.summary: Whether a read from stream 1 (conventionally used for payload body) was satisfied from prefetched data. Reported only on the first read operation on the stream (including if there are multiple readers, or even some writers).

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCheckEOFHasCrc
histogram.summary: For each EOFRecord found with a valid magic number, indicates if the record also contains a CRC.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncCreateResult
histogram.summary: The result, at the synchronous layer, reported when attempting to create a new cache entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncKeySHA256Result
histogram.summary: The result of the the key SHA256 check done when opening stream 0 for each entry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenDidPrefetch
histogram.obsolete: Replaced Dec, 2018 by SimpleCache.SyncOpenPrefetchMode. The new histogram is an enumeration that can distinguish between full file prefetching from trailer prefetching.
histogram.summary: Whether an attempt was made to prefetch the entire file when executing disk_cache::Backend::OpenEntry.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.SyncOpenEntryAge
histogram.summary: The age of the entry (time since last modified), when opened at the synchronous layer.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.WriteDependencyType
histogram.summary: Shows whether a write operation depends on the previous operation in queue particularly in the aspect of its possibility to run in parallel.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.WriteResult
histogram.obsolete: Replaced 2013/09/03 by WriteResult2, which adds "fast empty return", which previously showed up as "success".
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::WriteData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SimpleCache.WriteResult2
histogram.obsolete: Removed pre-M85. SyncWriteResult may be of interest.
histogram.summary: The outcome of Entry::WriteData in the simple cache.

histogram.name: SingleThreadedCompositorLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 9/2019: metric is not monitored for the UI compositor.
histogram.summary:
Tracks the duration of stages in the pipeline while processing a single frame on the single thread compositor, where the Main frame did not miss its deadline.
A Main frame that missed its deadline is a frame such that SubmitCompositorFrame happened before a commit and activation happened. E.g. BeginImplFrame1 -> BeginMainFrame1 -> SubmitCompositorFrame -> BeginImplFrame2 -> Commit1 -> Activate1 -> SubmitCompositorFrame

histogram.name: SingleThreadedCompositorLatency.MissedFrame
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 9/2019: metric is not monitored for the UI compositor.
histogram.summary:
Tracks the duration of stages in the pipeline while processing a single frame on the single thread compositor, where the Main frame missed its deadline.
A Main frame that missed its deadline is a frame such that SubmitCompositorFrame happened before a commit and activation happened. E.g. BeginImplFrame1 -> BeginMainFrame1 -> SubmitCompositorFrame -> BeginImplFrame2 -> Commit1 -> Activate1 -> SubmitCompositorFrame

histogram.name: SingleThreadedCompositorLatency.MissedFrameLatencyIncrease
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 9/2019. Did not provide enough information about latency.
histogram.summary:
The latency increase of an abnormally long activation stage on the single thread compositor pipeline when the frame is missed.
These latency increases are determined by comparing the stage duration to the times from past non-missed frames. These times are also reported to "SingleThreadedCompositorLatency.MissedFrame.<StageName>"

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementPercentageForHTTPS
histogram.summary: The percentage of total site engagement accumulated by this profile for HTTPS URLs as a proportion of all engagement for HTTPS and HTTP URLs. Recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore.HTTP
histogram.summary: Distribution of the engagement scores accumulated by a user, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Limited specifically to HTTP URLs.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore.HTTPS
histogram.summary: Distribution of the engagement scores accumulated by a user, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter. Limited specifically to HTTPS URLs.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore.IsZero
histogram.summary: The distribution of zero versus non-zero engagement scores accumulated by the user, recorded at the same time as SiteEngagementService.EngagementScore.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.PercentOriginsWithMaxEngagement
histogram.summary: The percentage of all origins recorded by the site engagement service which have reached the absolute site engagement point cap, recorded at startup per non-incognito profile, and then upon the first engagement-increasing event every hour thereafter.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.ScoreDecayedFrom
histogram.summary: The site engagement score of an origin prior to applying decay. Recorded at the first engagement event after decay, independently per decay event.

histogram.name: SiteEngagementService.ScoreDecayedTo
histogram.summary: The site engagement score of an origin once decay has occured. Recorded at the first engagement event after decay, independently per decay event.

histogram.name: SiteIsolatedCodeCache.Behaviour
histogram.obsolete: Split this histogram into SiteIsolatedCodeCache.JS.Behaviour and SiteIsolatedCodeCache.WASM.Behaviour to collect statistics for JS and WASM code caches in separate histograms.
histogram.summary: The behaviour of site isolated javascript code cache recorded for each cache transaction. It records if the request was serviced and if serviced how it was serviced for ex: hit, miss, update.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.AllResponses
histogram.obsolete: Removed in March 2018; in M67+, browser-process CORB policy is enabled.
histogram.summary: The count of all network responses received by a renderer. Each response is corresponding to one URL requested by a renderer. Incremented when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CurrentRendererProcessCount
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in March 2020; see Memory.RenderProcessHost.Count.* instead.
histogram.summary: The count of all renderer processes, including WebUI and extensions. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.Flags.IsolateOrigins
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in March 2020. For about:flags usage, see Launch.FlagsAtStartup.
histogram.summary: True if the --isolate-origins mode was enabled from the command line, about:flags, or enterprise policy. Recorded on browser startup and then once every 24 hours.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.Flags.SitePerProcess
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in March 2020. For about:flags usage, see Launch.FlagsAtStartup.
histogram.summary: True if the --site-per-process mode was enabled from the command line, about:flags, or enterprise policy. Recorded on browser startup and then once every 24 hours.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountEstimate
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77 - the histogram is no longer useful since site-per-process has already shipped on desktop in M67 (see https://crbug.com/810843).
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77 - the histogram is no longer useful since site-per-process has already shipped on desktop in M67 (see https://crbug.com/810843).
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of unique sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77 - the histogram is no longer useful since site-per-process has already shipped on desktop in M67 (see https://crbug.com/810843).
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated all sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateAllSitesTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77 - the histogram is no longer useful since site-per-process has already shipped on desktop in M67 (see https://crbug.com/810843).
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated all sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateExtensionsProcessCountEstimate
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77 - the histogram is no longer useful since isolate-extensions has already shipped in M56 (see https://crbug.com/545200).
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only Chrome extensions, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateExtensionsProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77 - the histogram is no longer useful since isolate-extensions has already shipped in M56 (see https://crbug.com/545200).
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only Chrome extensions, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateExtensionsProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77 - the histogram is no longer useful since isolate-extensions has already shipped in M56 (see https://crbug.com/545200).
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated only Chrome extensions and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateExtensionsTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77 - the histogram is no longer useful since isolate-extensions has already shipped in M56 (see https://crbug.com/545200).
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated only Chrome extensions, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountEstimate
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77.
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77.
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of isolated sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77.
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateHttpsSitesTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77.
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated only HTTPS (not HTTP) sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateNothingProcessCountEstimate
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77.
histogram.summary: The upper bound of the estimated renderer process count if we isolated no sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateNothingProcessCountLowerBound
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77.
histogram.summary: The lower bound of the predicted renderer process count if we isolated no sites, subject to the process limit. Happens to be the number of isolated sites. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateNothingProcessCountNoLimit
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77.
histogram.summary: The predicted renderer process count if we isolated no sites and if there were no process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateNothingTotalProcessCountEstimate
histogram.obsolete: Logging code has been removed in M77.
histogram.summary: The predicted total process count if we isolated no sites, subject to the process limit. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolateOrigins.Size
histogram.summary: The number of currently enabled isolated origins. This includes origins specified via the --isolate-origins command-line flag as well as those configured via enterprise policy. Recorded on browser startup.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.LowMemoryMode.Transition
histogram.summary: The number of times a render process transitions its main thread isolate into or out of memory savings mode. This is recorded per-renderer-process upon the creation of the first main frame or the destruction of the last main frame.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.PendingSitelessNavigationDisallowsProcessReuse
histogram.summary: Whether or not the RenderProcessHost is disqualified from process reuse because it has a pending navigation to a URL for which SiteInstance does not assign a site URL, such as chrome-native://newtab. This is intended to measure how often this scenario results in spinning up extra processes. Measured once per IsSuitableHost() invocation.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Allowed.ContentScript
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2019 / M77. Some old data have been saved in a Google-internal doc at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hgPpFD5GpxgWsTQvrA0eLunrG0mwb_uJgWWJmG_kVN4
histogram.summary:
The total count of responses that were would be blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process, but were only allowed because the request was initiated by a content script of an extension. Recorded with a resource type (0-17) when the response is allowed.
Note that this histogram is not reimplemented in the NetworkService version of Cross-Origin Read Blocking feature. This should be okay since we hope to gather enough data before NetworkService ships.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.AllowedByCorbButNotCors.ContentScript
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2020 / M87. (It was not needed anymore, since CORS-for-content-scripts has successfully shipped in M85.)
histogram.summary:
Logs an upper bound of how many new content script requests might be blocked if we start making them subject to CORS. We haven't yet started passing Origin headers on these requests, so this will report true/risky even if in the future the server might respond with a valid Access-Control-Allow-Origin header when presented with an expected Origin request header.
Logged when 1) CORB processes a http response (so excluding requests from allowlisted content script and requests from extension background pages where CORB is disabled) and 2) the request was associated with a non-http isolated world origin (so not logging anything when the CorbAllowlistAlsoAppliesToOorCors and OOR-CORS features are enabled since the former feature forces ignoring the isolated world origin when OOR-CORS is enabled) and 3) CORB allows the response (based on non-CORB-content-type header OR sniffing decided that this is not a CORB type).
Logs "risky" if the request would be blocked by CORS if made from a web page (cross-origin, mode=cors, and no valid ACAO response header). Logs "safe" otherwise.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Blocked
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2019 / M77. Some old data have been saved in a Google-internal doc at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hgPpFD5GpxgWsTQvrA0eLunrG0mwb_uJgWWJmG_kVN4
histogram.summary: The total count of responses that were blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process. Recorded with a resource type (0-17) when the response is blocked; up to 1024 bytes of the response are considered. This is also recorded with a suffix indicating the MIME type category.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Blocked.ContentLength.ValueIfAvailable
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2019 / M77. Some old data has been saved in a Google-internal doc at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hgPpFD5GpxgWsTQvrA0eLunrG0mwb_uJgWWJmG_kVN4
histogram.summary: For each responses blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process, logs network::ResourceResponseInfo::content_length of the response (but only if the content length value was available - if the value was not -1).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Blocked.ContentLength.WasAvailable
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2019 / M77. Some old data has been saved in a Google-internal doc at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hgPpFD5GpxgWsTQvrA0eLunrG0mwb_uJgWWJmG_kVN4
histogram.summary: For each responses blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process, logs whether network::ResourceResponseInfo::content_length was available (i.e. value was 0 or greated) or not available (i.e. value was equal to -1) if the value was available (i.e. the value was not -1).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.BlockedForParserBreaker
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2019 / M77. Some old data have been saved in a Google-internal doc at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hgPpFD5GpxgWsTQvrA0eLunrG0mwb_uJgWWJmG_kVN4
histogram.summary: The total count of responses that were blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process, due to the presence of a Javascript parser-breaker pattern (like "for(;;);", or ")]}'", or a non-empty JSON dictionary like "{\"a\":". Recorder with a resource type (0-17) when the response is blocked; up to 1024 bytes of the response are considered.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.BytesReadForSniffing
histogram.obsolete: Removed in June 2019 / M77. Some old data has been saved in a Google-internal doc at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1hgPpFD5GpxgWsTQvrA0eLunrG0mwb_uJgWWJmG_kVN4
histogram.summary: The number of bytes of the network response buffered for sniffing purposes, when attempting to sniff the response to determine if it should be blocked as a cross-site document. Recorded after sniffing is attempted.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.DataLength
histogram.obsolete: Removed in March 2018; in M67+, browser-process CORB policy is enabled.
histogram.summary: The number of bytes in the first network packet for a response with headers that imply potential illegal cross-site access. Recorded when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked
histogram.obsolete: Removed in March 2018; in M67+, browser-process CORB policy is enabled.
histogram.summary: The count of blocked cross-site document responses due to having HTML content type header and contents sniffed as HTML. Sampled with value of 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked.NonRenderableStatusCode
histogram.obsolete: Removed in March 2018; in M67+, browser-process CORB policy is enabled.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a nonrenderable HTTP status code among blocked cross-site document responses due to their HTML contents. Sampled with value 1 when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.) among blocked cross-site document responses due to their HTML contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-14) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.HTML.Blocked.RenderableStatusCode2
histogram.obsolete: Removed in March 2018; in M67+, browser-process CORB policy is enabled.
histogram.summary: The count of responses with a renderable HTTP status code sub-categorized by their requesting context type (e.g., image, script, etc.) among blocked cross-site document responses due to their HTML contents. Sampled with a resource type (0-17) when the first network packet of a response of this type is received.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.MimeType

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.NetworkService.InitiatorLockCompatibility
histogram.summary:
Logs whether CORB blocking might have been caused by treating |request_initiator| as opaque when |request_initiator_origin_lock| is incompatible (as may be the case for HTML Imports).
Logged when CORB allows or blocks a response, only when NetworkService is enabled.

histogram.name: SmartLock.Performance.AuthenticationToReceiveUnlockableRemoteStatus.Duration.Unlock
histogram.summary: The duration of time between when Smart Lock successfully establishes a secure channel connection to the host device, and receives an "authenticated" remote status from it (i.e., the Smart Lock icon becomes green).

histogram.name: SmartLock.Performance.StartScanToReceiveUnlockableRemoteStatus.Duration.Unlock
histogram.summary:
The duration of time between when Smart Lock begins to try to find the host device, and receives an "authenticated" remote status from it, which allows the device to be unlocked (i.e., the Smart Lock icon becomes green).
See MultiDevice.SecureChannel.BLE.Performance.StartScanToAuthenticationDuration.Background and SmartLock.AuthenticationToReceiveUnlockableRemoteStatus.Unlock.Duration for breakdowns of this metric.
See SmartLock.GetRemoteStatus.Unlock for the success rate of fetching the remote status from the host.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.DownloadHttpResponseCode
histogram.summary: The HTTP response code for the Chrome Cleanup Tool download request.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.HasCompleted
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 because of lack of use.
histogram.summary: The state of software reporter cleaner tool runs. A value of "Not Completed" can mean either the tool crashed, or the tool was still running when Chrome checked.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.NumberOfDownloadAttempts
histogram.summary: The number of attempts to download the Chrome Cleanup tool until it either succeeds or fails.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.RebootPromptShown
histogram.summary: Indicates how the user was prompted to reboot the machine to complete a run of the Chrome Cleanup Tool.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Cleaner.Version
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: The build version of the software reporter cleaner tool.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.ExperimentErrors
histogram.obsolete: Deprecate in M82 as the histogram is renamed to SoftwareReporter.ConfigurationErrors.
histogram.summary: Whether a configuration error prevented the experimental Software Reporter from running.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.PromptDialog.TimeUntilDone
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: The time between the Chrome Cleaner dialog being shown and the dialog being closed.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.PromptShown
histogram.summary: Whether the user has been prompted to run the Chrome Cleanup Tool.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.PromptUsage
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 2017-11-01. Replaced with SoftwareReporter.PromptDialogResponse.
histogram.summary: Usage of the Software Removal Tool (SRT) Prompt.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.ReporterSequenceResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: Indicates the result of a reporter sequence once it ends.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.RunningTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took to run the software reporter tool as reported by the tool itself via the registry. Logged just after the software reporter tool has finished.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.RunningTimeRegistryError
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: Error encountered when reading the software reporter tool's start and end times from the registry.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.Step
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: The registration and execution steps for the software reporter.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.UploadFailureCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: The total count of SRT log upload failures experienced by this machine for all time. This value is reported at startup by Chrome and is capped at 64.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.UploadLongestFailureRun
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: The longest run of upload failures logged by SRT runs. This value is reported at startup by Chrome and is capped at 64.

histogram.name: SoftwareReporter.UploadSuccessCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07-2020 due to lack of use
histogram.summary: The total count of successful SRT log uploads experienced by this machine for all time. This value is reported at startup by Chrome and is capped at 64.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.HunspellUnsupportedLanguageCount
histogram.summary: Counts how many languages are currently added to Chrome by the user but are not eligible for spellchecking because we have no Hunspell dictionaries for them. This is recorded once during spellcheck initialization, and then once each time the user changes their Chrome languages.

histogram.name: Spellcheck.Windows.MissingLanguagePacksCount
histogram.summary: Counts how many Hunspell spellcheck locales are currently enabled by the user but are not supported by the Windows OS spellchecker because there are no language packs installed for them. Locales that are not supported by Hunspell are not counted. This is recorded once during spellcheck initialization, and then once each time the user changes which spellcheck languages are enabled.

histogram.name: Sqlite.CommitTime

histogram.name: sri.resource_integrity_mismatch_event
histogram.summary: When resources are checked for mismatching integrity and whether the mismatch forces a refetch.

histogram.name: SSL.CertificateErrorHelpCenterVisited
histogram.summary: When the "Learn more" link on an SSL interstitial is clicked, this histogram records if the navigation succeded, if it failed with an interstitial, or if it failed with a different error.

histogram.name: SSL.ExpectCTReportFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2016. Replaced with SSL.ExpectCTReportFailure2.
histogram.summary: Sites can opt in to Expect CT, a reporting feature that sends a report whenever a TLS connection does not have valid Certificate Transparency information associated with it. This records the error code when Chrome fails to send an Expect CT report.

histogram.name: SSL.MarkHttpAsStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed December 2017 (M65). This information in this histogram can be found in LoginCustomFlags (for users who have set a flag) or by filtering to users with the MarkHttpAs feature enabled (for seeing the field trial breakdown).
histogram.summary: Reports whether the user has selected to mark HTTP origins with an experimental UI treatment (such as showing a warning on HTTP pages that collect sensitive information). This histogram is recorded whenever the security level (the overall security state of a page, roughly corresponding to the lock icon) is computed for an HTTP page.

histogram.name: SSL.MarkNonSecureAsStatus
histogram.summary: Reports whether the user has selected to mark non-secure origins as Neutral (the status quo), Dubious, or Non-Secure.

histogram.name: Stability.Android.PendingMinidumpsOnStartup
histogram.summary: The number of un-uploaded minidumps present in the Android Crash Reports directory. Each minidump file (should) correspond to a crash. This is recorded on startup, just prior to initiating uploading for these minidumps. This is intended as a temporary metric, to be removed around M60: http://crbug.com/699785

histogram.name: Stability.Android.PendingMinidumpsOnStartup.SansLogcat
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M60. Roughly 50% of Chrome startups that had *any* pending minidumps had at least one pending minidump without any logcat output. About 5% had multiple minidumps without any logcat output.
histogram.summary: The number of un-uploaded minidumps present in the Android Crash Reports directory that do not yet have logcat output attached. Each minidump file (should) correspond to a crash. This is recorded on startup, just prior to initiating uploading for all pending minidumps. This is intended as a temporary metric, to be removed around M60: http://crbug.com/699785

histogram.name: Stability.Android.ProcessedMinidumps
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2019 as we no longer record it in favour of the two variants below.
histogram.summary: Records the number of minidumps processed by Crashpad, split by process type. This metric is similar to one that could be computed server-side based on received crash uploads; but the client-side metric also includes any minidumps that were not successfully uploaded.

histogram.name: Stability.CrashedProcessAge.Extension
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2020 (data for go/site-isolation-stability has been collected long time ago; nobody on chrome-stability@ spoke in defense of this histogram).
histogram.summary: The age of a crashed extension process. Not logged on iOS. Logged together with CrashExitCodes.Extension.

histogram.name: Stability.CrashedProcessAge.Renderer
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2020 (data for go/site-isolation-stability has been collected long time ago; nobody on chrome-stability@ spoke in defense of this histogram).
histogram.summary: The age of a crashed extension process. Not logged on iOS. Logged together with CrashExitCodes.Renderer.

histogram.name: Stability.iOS.UTE.CreatedSyntheticCrashReportConfig
histogram.obsolete: Removed 09/2019 after having collected enough data.
histogram.summary: Recorded when Chrome for iOS attempts to create a config for synthetic crash report. Used to debug the feature, which suppose to upload synthetic crash report using Breakpad.

histogram.name: StackSamplingProfiler.DeserializeAllPendingProfilesTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2019 after having collected enough data to analyze jank.
histogram.summary: Amount of time taken to deserialize all pending call stack profiles.

histogram.name: StackSamplingProfiler.ProfileDeserializationTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Amount of time taken to deserialize a call stack profile string.

histogram.name: StackSamplingProfiler.ProfileSerializationTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Amount of time taken to serialize a call stack profile.

histogram.name: Stars.BookmarksBar_Active_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when the bookmarks bar view is activated.

histogram.name: Stars.Clipper_Folio_Selected_Depth_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the depth of a folio when it is selected in the clipper.

histogram.name: Stars.Clipper_Folio_Selected_Visible_Folio_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the number of folios visible when a folio is selected in the clipper.

histogram.name: Stars.Clipper_Open_Folio_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of folios when the clipper is opened.

histogram.name: Stars.Folio_Active_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when the folio view is activated.

histogram.name: Stars.Goog_Related
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with Google related urls (points to internal Google resources). Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Goog_Related_20_Percent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with Google related urls within first 20 (points to internal Google resources). Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Images_Percent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with images. Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Images_Percent_First20
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips with images within first 20. Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Launch_Bookmark_BookmarksBar_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when a bookmark is launched from the bookmarks bar view.

histogram.name: Stars.Launch_Bookmark_Folio_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when a bookmark is launched from the folio view.

histogram.name: Stars.Launch_Bookmark_Search_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when a bookmark is launched from the search view.

histogram.name: Stars.Launch_Bookmark_SmartGroup_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when a bookmark is launched from the smart group view.

histogram.name: Stars.Launch_Bookmark_Timeline_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when a bookmark is launched from the timeline view.

histogram.name: Stars.LaunchLocation
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs every time a bookmark is launched from an assortment of different UI surfaces with Stars, the new bookmarks UI.

histogram.name: Stars.No_Images_Snippets
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips without images or snippets. Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.No_Img_No_Snippet_20_Percent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Percentage of clips without images or snippets within first 20. Logs every time user goes to chrome://bookmarks.

histogram.name: Stars.Number_Of_Nodes
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs number of bookmark nodes every time stars extension is loaded.

histogram.name: Stars.Profile_Active_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when the profile view is activated.

histogram.name: Stars.PromoActions
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Count the actions performed by the user on the stars promo panel currently only on android and ios.

histogram.name: Stars.SalientImageFound
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: A boolean that indicates if a salient image was found for a displayed bookmark. It is recorded every single time a bookmark is displayed. That way, this histogram shows the proportion of bookmarks the user sees with an image. This is used only with Stars, the new bookmarks UI.

histogram.name: Stars.Search_Active_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when the search view is activated.

histogram.name: Stars.SmartGroup_Active_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when the smart group view is activated.

histogram.name: Stars.Timeline_Active_Clip_Count
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the approx number of clips when the timeline view is activated.

histogram.name: Stars.Version
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as we no longer record this metric.
histogram.summary: Logs the extension version the user is using.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.Experimental.Cold.TimeToFirstContentfulPaint
histogram.obsolete: This metric was deprecated in M68 in favour of "Startup.Android.Cold.TimeToFirstContentfulPaint.Tabbed". It has moved out of experimental and records a smaller range of numbers (medium times instead of long times). The ".Tabbed" suffix is added since the histogram is being tracked for WebApkActivity using the ".WebApk" suffix.
histogram.summary: Android: The time from the activity creation point to the first contentful paint of the first loaded page. It's not recorded when the first loaded page is non http(s) page like a chrome error page, a new tab page, a blank page. It's also not recorded if the application wasn't in the foreground since the start till the end of event.

histogram.name: Startup.Android.Experimental.Cold.TimeToFirstNavigationCommit
histogram.obsolete: This metric was deprecated in M68 in favour of "Startup.Android.Cold.TimeToFirstNavigationCommit.Tabbed". It has moved out of experimental and records a smaller range of numbers (medium times instead of long times). The ".Tabbed" suffix is added since the histogram is being tracked for WebApkActivity using the ".WebApk" suffix.
histogram.summary: Android: The time from the activity creation point to the moment the first navigation is committed, i.e. when renderer gets the first byte of the document. It's not recorded when the first loaded page is non http(s) page like a chrome error page, a new tab page, a blank page. It's also not recorded if the application wasn't in the foreground since the start till the end of event.

histogram.name: Startup.AppListFirstPaintColdStart
histogram.summary: Time for a newly created browser process to perform the first paint of the app launcher, when started with the --show-app-list flag and with no currently running Chrome processes.

histogram.name: Startup.AppListFirstPaintWarmStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to perform the first paint of the app launcher. Measured from the time a second Chrome process started, which sent its --show-app-list command line argument to the already-running process and will soon exit.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserLaunchURLCount
histogram.summary: Measured when Chrome is invoked, this counts the number of URLs passed via command line. Note that this handles the case of a URL passed to Chrome starting up, or when a running Chrome is given the message to open a new URL.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMainToRendererMain
histogram.summary: Time from the ChromeMain() entry in the browser process to the first RendererMain() entry.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStart.To.MainNavigationStart
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2/2018, as MessageLoopStart is after MainNavigationStart with browser-side navigation.
histogram.summary: Time between Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTime and Startup.FirstWebContents.MainNavigationStart. Recorded explicitly to allow easy breakdown of Startup.FirstWebContents.MainNavigationStart when diagnosing issues.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartHardFaultCount.FirstRun
histogram.summary: The number of hard faults incurred in the browser process from startup to start of the main thread's message loop on first run. This is only reported on Windows 7 and greater.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartHardFaultCount.Success
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2015. No longer tracked because values collected on stable show that the function pretty much never fails.
histogram.summary: If OS support was detected (Windows 7 and greater) indicates whether it was possible to determine the number of hard faults that have occurred in the process from startup to start of the main thread's message loop. This can fail because the underlying call is inherently racy.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry.FirstRun
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop on first run. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry.FirstRun2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry.FirstRun2
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop on first run.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-01 in favor of Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry3 which does not involve a conversion from Time to TimeTicks.
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserMessageLoopStartTimeFromMainEntry3
histogram.summary: Time from main entry to the start of the main thread's message loop.

histogram.name: Startup.BrowserOpenTabs
histogram.summary: Time taken to open the initial tab or to restore tabs from previous session.

histogram.name: Startup.ChromeCast.TimeToDisplayVideo
histogram.obsolete: Removed 7/2015. To be replaced with Cast events.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from the ChromeCast application launch to the first video frame displayed.

histogram.name: Startup.Experimental.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad.ManyBuckets
histogram.summary: An experimental metric only collected on the dev and canary channels. Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first main frame load of the first web contents. Uses significantly more buckets, with reduced ranges.

histogram.name: Startup.Experimental.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad.StandardBuckets
histogram.summary: An experimental metric only collected on the dev and canary channels. Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first main frame load of the first web contents. Uses standard bucket ranges.

histogram.name: Startup.Experimental.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint.ManyBuckets
histogram.summary: An experimental metric only collected on the dev and canary channels. Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first non-empty paint of the first web contents. Uses significantly more buckets, with reduced ranges.

histogram.name: Startup.Experimental.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint.StandardBuckets
histogram.summary: An experimental metric only collected on the dev and canary channels. Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first non-empty paint of the first web contents. Uses standard bucket ranges.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime
histogram.summary: [Android only] The time from the earliest entry point in the browser process to the moment the first navigation is committed, i.e. when renderer gets the first byte of the document.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime2
histogram.summary: [Android only] The time from the first foreground entry point in the app to the moment the first navigation is committed, i.e. when renderer gets the first byte of the document.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstCommitNavigationTime3
histogram.summary: [Android only] The time from the first foreground entry point in the app to the moment the first navigation is committed, i.e. when renderer gets the first byte of the document.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad
histogram.summary: [Desktop] DEPRECATED (but kept as a known basis until M48 is phased out). Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first main frame load of the first web contents. Deprecated in favor of Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad2 which now avoids counting ill-cases (ref. FirstWebContentsProfiler::FinishReason).

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad2
histogram.obsolete: Removed with M77. Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 is a better indicator of startup time as perceived by users.
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first main frame load of the first web contents. Only comprised of cases where the initial foreground tab gets to complete its rendering task unimpeded (an improvement over Startup.FirstWebContents.MainFrameLoad).

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint
histogram.summary: [Desktop] DEPRECATED (but kept as a known basis until M48 is phased out). Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first non- empty paint of the first web contents. Deprecated in favor of Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2 which now avoids counting ill-cases (ref. FirstWebContentsProfiler::FinishReason).

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced with Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint3 on 06/2020, which uses application start time instead of process creation time to reduce noise.
histogram.summary:
[Desktop] Measure the elapsed time from process launch to the first non- empty paint of the first web contents. Only comprised of cases where the initial foreground tab gets to complete its rendering task unimpeded (an improvement over Startup.FirstWebContents.NonEmptyPaint).
This histogram is of special interest to the chrome-analysis-team@. Do not change its semantics or retire it without talking to them first.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UINotResponsive
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the execution time for a single task to execute on UI if it was not possible to execute UI tasks under 1/60s within certain limits, after WebContents was painted at least once. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UINotResponsive_10sec
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time for a single task to execute on UI if it was not possible to execute it under 1/60s within certain limits, 10 second after first WebContents was painted at least once. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UINotResponsive_1sec
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time for a single task to execute on UI if it was not possible to execute it under 1/60s within certain limits, 1 second after first WebContents was painted at least once. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UIResponsive
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time it takes for a task to execute on UI under 1/60s after first WebContents was painted at least once. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UIResponsive_10sec
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time it takes for a task to execute on UI under 1/60s, 10 second after the first WebContents was painted. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.FirstWebContents.UIResponsive_1sec
histogram.summary: [Desktop] Measures the elapsed time it takes for a task to execute on UI under 1/60s, 1 second after the first WebContents was painted. This is recorded at most once per Chrome launch. Used as a measure of responsiveness on startup.

histogram.name: Startup.Fling.TimeToDisplayVideo
histogram.obsolete: Removed 7/2015. To be replaced with Cast events.
histogram.summary: The elapsed time from the Fling application launch to the first video frame displayed.

histogram.name: Startup.IsResume
histogram.summary: Whether a startup is a resume (vs a cold start).

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ExeMainToDllMain
histogram.summary: Time from the main() function in chrome.exe to chrome.dll's main(). This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.LoadTime.ExeMainToDllMain2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ExeMainToDllMain2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2020. Replaced with Startup.LoadTime.ApplicationStartToChromeMain which applies to most platforms.
histogram.summary: Time from the main() function in chrome.exe to chrome.dll's main().

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToDllMain
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to chrome.dll's main(). This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToDllMain2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToDllMain2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2020. Replaced with Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToApplicationStart which applies to most platforms.
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to chrome.dll's main().

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToExeMain
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to executing the main() function in chrome.exe. This stat is only recorded after 7 minutes of OS uptime to try to mitigate the variance resulting from Chrome being autostarted. Replaced with Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToExeMain2 which is recorded all the time.

histogram.name: Startup.LoadTime.ProcessCreateToExeMain2
histogram.summary: Time from the process creation to executing the main() function in chrome.exe.

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplStep1Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the first untracked section of ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl.

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplStep2Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the second untracked section of ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl. Not written for Android.

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplStep3Time
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during the third untracked section of ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl. Not written for Android.

histogram.name: Startup.PreMainMessageLoopRunImplTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during ChromeBrowserMainParts::PreMainMessageLoopRunImpl.

histogram.name: Startup.SameVersionStartupCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 8/2019. See startup_metric_utils.cc for a summary of old data.
histogram.summary: The number of startups the current version has been through. Reported once per Chrome session, on startup. Any user that reports X for this version will also have previously reported [1,X-1] for this version through the previous X-1 Chrome sessions.

histogram.name: Startup.ShowAppListColdStart
histogram.summary: Time for a newly created browser process to reach the code that starts showing the app launcher, when started with the --show-app-list flag and with no currently running Chrome processes.

histogram.name: Startup.ShowAppListWarmStart
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to reach the code that starts showing the app launcher. Measured from the time a second Chrome process started, which sent its --show-app-list command line argument to the already-running process and will soon exit.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupBookmarksLoad
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load bookmarks from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupExtensionServiceInitAfterImport
histogram.summary: Time it takes to finish initialization of the extension service including loading built-in extensions. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupFinalProfileInit
histogram.summary: Time the final stages of profile initialization taking including initialization of profile keyed services. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupNSSInit
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load the NSS libraries and initialize it. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupPreferenceLoading
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load preferences from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupProfileIODataInit
histogram.summary: Time it takes to initialize the ProfileIOData object - this includes initialization of the cookie store. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSafeBrowsingGetDatabase
histogram.summary: Time it takes to load the safe browsing database from disk. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSafeBrowsingServiceInitialize
histogram.summary: Time it takes to initialize the safe browsing service. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.

histogram.name: Startup.SlowStartupSessionServiceCreateTabsAndWindows
histogram.summary: Time it takes for session restore to finish initiating creation of restored tabs and windows. This measurement is only sent for startups that take >10 seconds after an uptime of 7 minutes.
