histogram.name: Startup.StartupBrowserCreator_ProcessCmdLineImplTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time that elapsed during StartupBrowserCreator::ProcessCmdLineImpl.

histogram.name: Startup.SystemUptime
histogram.obsolete: Remove 01/2020. Data is no longer used.
histogram.summary: The time elapsed between system boot and Chrome browser process launch. This is recorded just before the main message loop starts.

histogram.name: Startup.TimeOfDayGMT
histogram.summary:
The time of day in GMT that the startup was performed. This is logged in HHMM format, with the minutes rounded down to the nearest 10 minute interval.
This can be used to make traffic estimates for requests made from startup.

histogram.name: Startup.TimeSinceLastStartup
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2019. See startup_metric_utils.cc for a summary of old data.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed since the last startup that went up to the main message loop start. This is recorded just before the main message loop starts.

histogram.name: Startup.WarmStartTimeFromRemoteProcessStart
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020. The data is no longer used.
histogram.summary: Time for a running browser process to start processing the command line passed in by a second Chrome process, which just sent its command line arguments to the already-running process and will soon exit. Measured from the time the second Chrome process started.

histogram.name: StartupTimeBomb.Alarm
histogram.summary: Time duration measured from the time the startup timebomb was started and when it went off.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.CreateDirectoryResult
histogram.obsolete: No longer relevant. There are almost never any failures.
histogram.summary: Recorded when we create the blob storage directory for the blob storage system. When we need to write blob data to files, we create this directory if it doesn't exist. We write blob data to files when either we have a new blob that's larger than our memory limit, or we're approaching our in-memory limit for blob storage.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.ExceededMemory
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 3/2016. Use Storage.Blob.Broken to see the fraction of blobs that are broken, and Storage.Blob.BrokenReason for the number of broken blobs that are broken because of memory constraints.
histogram.summary: True if a created blob exceeded the internal in-memory storage memory limit for blobs.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.ItemCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 12/18. Metric wasn't used for anything and wasn't useful.
histogram.summary: The number of blob items in a blob, recorded at blob construction. (Blobs are immutable, so this won't change afterwards).

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.MaxDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Records the calculated max disk space the blob storage system can use. Recorded on storage partition initialization.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.StorageSizeAfterAppend
histogram.obsolete: Not an accurate way to measure the normal max blob usage.
histogram.summary: Records the total in-memory storage size of blobs before a blob item is appended. Can be subtracted by Storage.Blob.StorageSizeBeforeAppend to find the true distribution of blob storage sizes.

histogram.name: Storage.Blob.StorageSizeBeforeAppend
histogram.obsolete: Not an accurate way to measure the normal max blob usage.
histogram.summary: Records the total in-memory storage size of blobs before a blob item is appended. Can be subtracted from Storage.Blob.StorageSizeAfterAppend to find the true distribution of blob storage sizes.

histogram.name: Storage.BlobItemSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 12/18. Metric wasn't used for anything and wasn't useful.
histogram.summary: The size in KB of items (or parts of items) appended to blobs.

histogram.name: Storage.BlobItemSize.BlobSlice
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 12/18. Metric wasn't used for anything and wasn't useful.
histogram.summary: The size in KB of items (or parts of items) appended to blobs that come from the slicing of other blobs. This happens when using Blob.slice, where we are using a part of an item in the original blob (not the whole item).

histogram.name: Storage.BlobItemSize.FileSystem.Unknown
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 12/18. Metric was always false.
histogram.summary: True if the file size of a filesystem object on blob append is unknown (which means the full file), or false if a specific file length was populated. Recorded in BlobStorageContext when we are adding a filesystem item to a blob.

histogram.name: Storage.BytesRead
histogram.summary: The number of bytes read. Recorded on each read.

histogram.name: Storage.BytesWritten
histogram.summary: The number of bytes written. Recorded on each write.

histogram.name: Storage.IndexedDB.WriteBlobFileViaCopy
histogram.summary: Records if a blob attempted to be written to IndexedDB used the base::CopyFile optimization. Recorded for every blob attempted to be written to IndexedDB.

histogram.name: Style.AuthorStyleSheet.ParseTime
histogram.summary:
Microseconds spent in StyleSheetContents::ParseAuthorStyleSheet.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Style.LazyUsage.Percent
histogram.summary: Tracks % of lazy rules that ended up needing to be parsed. A sheet logs counts into this histogram as it is parsed (i.e. as properties are parsed lazily). Once a certain percent of rules have been parsed, we log a count immediately. Note that this implies that a stylesheet which uses all of its rules will log counts in every bucket.

histogram.name: Style.TotalLazyRules
histogram.summary: Tracks the total number of rules that have parsing lazily deferred in an author style sheet.

histogram.name: Style.TotalLazyRules.FullUsage
histogram.summary: Tracks the total number of rules that have parsing lazily deferred in an author style sheet, for sheets that ended up needing all their rules.

histogram.name: Style.UpdateTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2018, replaced by Style.RecalcTime and Style.RebuildLayoutTreeTime.
histogram.summary:
Microseconds spent in Document::UpdateStyle.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.Actions
histogram.obsolete: Removed June 2018 in favor of SubresourceFilter.Actions2
histogram.summary: Counts of various UI and user action events related to the SubresourceFilter. This will be triggered in response to Content Settings changes, as well as when portions of the UI are shown or interacted with. Main frame navigations are also tracked for ease of comparison and analysis.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.AdDelay.Delay
histogram.summary: Logs the delay the ad delay throttle added to a request. Logged for every subresource request that was delayed.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.AdDelay.Delay.Expected
histogram.summary: Logs the expected delay the ad delay throttle added to a request. This is the delay imposed assuming no task queuing delay. Logged for every subresource request that was delayed.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.AdDelay.Delay.Queuing
histogram.summary: Logs the task queuing delay the ad delay throttle added to a request. This is the actual delay minus the expected delay. Logged for every subresource request that was delayed.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.AdDelay.IsolatedInfo
histogram.summary: For a given ad request, logs information related to whether it is isolated from the top-level context. Logged per ad subresource request.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.AdDelay.SecureInfo
histogram.summary: For a given request, logs information related to whether it is marked as an ad, and whether it is secure (e.g. https). Logged per subresource request.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.ActivationComputingDelay
histogram.summary:
Records the total time the activation state navigation throttle within a document is delayed while calculating activation. Recorded at resume time.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.ActivationComputingDelay.MainFrame
histogram.summary: Records the total time the activation state navigation throttle within a main frame document is delayed while calculating activation. Recorded at resume time.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Disallowed
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M77, then deprecated in July 2019.
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have been disallowed. This only differs from `MatchedRules` when filtering is performed in dry-run mode.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Evaluated
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M77, then deprecated in July 2019.
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have been evaluated. This only differs from 'Total' when the document is subject to a deactivating rule with DOCUMENT activation type.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.MatchedRules
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M78, then deprecated in July 2019.
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have matched filtering rules. This only differs from `Disallowed` when filtering is performed in dry-run mode.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.NumSubresourceLoads.Total
histogram.obsolete: Expired in M77, then deprecated in July 2019.
histogram.summary: Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total number of subresource loads that have gone through the subresource filtering pipeline.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.SubframeFilteringDelay.Disallowed
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2019. Replaced by SubframeFilteringDelay.Disallowed2.
histogram.summary: Records the total time a subframe navigation was delayed while calculating whether it should be disallowed or not. Logged for all navigations that were disallowed or would be disallowed.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.SubresourceEvaluation.TotalCPUDuration
histogram.summary:
Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total thread CPU time spent on processing subresource requests in allowLoad.
Note: this histogram is emitted for all clients, both ones which have high-resolution timer available and those which don't.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.DocumentLoad.SubresourceEvaluation.TotalWallDuration
histogram.summary:
Whenever a document load is finished in a main frame or subframe with subresource filtering activated, records the total real time spent on processing subresource requests in allowLoad, including the time spent on waiting or being descheduled.
Note: this histogram is emitted for all clients, both ones which have high-resolution timer available and those which don't.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.IndexRuleset.Verify.WallDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of the Verify2 metric
histogram.summary: The total time it took to verify the indexed ruleset in the browser process. Logged every time verification occurs, which usually occurs when the first page with activation is navigated to.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.Activation.RedirectPosition
histogram.summary: For pages that trigger Safe Browsing activations (not including dry runs), records the position in the redirect chain for the page the activation was triggered by. If SubresourceFilterConsiderRedirects is disabled, then always returns "Only navigation".

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.BlockedPopups
histogram.obsolete: Metric is broken and will be replaced by ContentSettings.Popups.StringBlocked.NumBlocked. This only logged values for sites which are also activated for subresource filtering, when most sites will probably only be marked for popup blocking.
histogram.summary: Records the number of popups blocked per page load due to subresource filter logic. Recorded when a new main frame navigation commits. Note that this histogram is recorded for all pages which are activated by the subresource filter, including ones which do not trigger the stronger popup blocker.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.FinalURLMatch
histogram.summary: Records, for each main frame navigation, whether the last URL in the redirect chain matched the Safe Browsing blacklist specified by the histogram suffix.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.ForcedActivation.DisallowedLoad
histogram.summary: Logged when the first resource is disallowed from a page with forced activation. For example, if the devtools ad blocking option is set.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.RedirectChainLength
histogram.summary: Total number of server redirects during the navigation. This histogram is recorded in several for every list where subresource fiter is active.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.RedirectChainMatchPattern
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete as of April 2017, since the don't have correct data to record anymore.
histogram.summary: For each main frame navigation, records a pattern that indicates which URLs in the redirect chain matched Safe Browsing blacklists, and which did not. For example, for the redirect chain A-B-C-D metric tracks: 1. If initial URL (A) was on a Safe Browsing blacklist. 2. If any if middle urls (B, C) were on a Safe Browsing blacklist. 3. If committed URL (B) was on a Safe Browsing blacklist. This histogram is recorded in several flavours: with prefix SubresourceFilterOnly in case the redirect chain contains url from the Safe Browsing SubresourceFilter list and without the prefix for all other redirect chains.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.PageLoad.SafeBrowsingDelay.NoRedirectSpeculation
histogram.obsolete: Removed in May 2018 (M69). We have enough data to show that the redirect speculations we do are necessary, especially for Android.
histogram.summary: The navigation delay that would have been imposed by the subresource filter on a given navigation due to Safe Browsing checks if redirect speculation was removed. Removing this feature would cause more delay if a navigation has redirects.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.Prompt.NumReloads
histogram.obsolete: Removed in favor of the whitelisted bucket in SubresourceFilter.Actions2
histogram.summary: Number of times the user has requested a reload for the page by clicking on the reload button.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.Prompt.NumVisibility
histogram.summary: Number of times Safebrowsing Subresource Filter decided to toggle visibility of the prompt.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.SafeBrowsing.CheckDispatchTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed in May 2018 in favor of the more general SB2.RemoteCall.CheckDispatchTime.
histogram.summary:
The microseconds it took to dispatch the Safe Browsing check. This includes IPC descheduling delays to communicate with SafetyNet on Android, and synchronous db checks on desktop.
Note: this histogram is emitted for all clients, both ones which have high-resolution timer available and those which don't.

histogram.name: SubresourceFilter.SafeBrowsing.CheckTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed in May 2019 in favor of the TotalCheckTime variant.
histogram.summary: The time an individual Safe Browsing URL check took before finishing. Logged when a check is complete or cancelled due to a timeout.

histogram.name: SupervisedUserContentProvider.ChromeNotStartedRequestTime
histogram.summary: Time to get the response to requesting whether a URL should be accessible to the supervised user, when Chrome was not previously running.

histogram.name: SupervisedUserContentProvider.ChromeStartedRequestTime
histogram.summary: Time to get the response to requesting whether a URL should be accessible to the supervised user, when Chrome was already running.

histogram.name: SupervisedUserContentProvider.RequestTimedOut
histogram.summary: True if a request to find out whether a URL should be accessible to a supervised user timed out.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.Extensions
histogram.summary: Records the progress of supervised users as they try to install Chrome extensions. New extension approval granted count increments when the custodian initially grants approval to install the extension. New version approval granted count increments when the supervised user approves a newer version of an existing extension. Removed count increments when the supervised user removes an extension.

histogram.name: SupervisedUsers.ExtensionsAllowlist
histogram.summary: Records the progress of supervised users as they try to install Chrome extensions during the COVID-19 crisis, before the parent approval dialog is ready. kAllowlistMiss count increments whenever we query for an extension id in the allowlist and it is not found. kAllowlistHit count increments whenever the extension id is found in the allowlist.

histogram.name: Sync.AppAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during app association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.AppRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of apps run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.AppSettingsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of app settings association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AppsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of app association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AppStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of app association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.AssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during association of this data type.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.DownloadChecksumResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-04, Sync attachments were never launched.
histogram.summary: Whether attachment checksums match on download or not.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.DownloadResponseCode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-04, Sync attachments were never launched.
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from downloading sync attachments.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.DownloadTotalTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-04, Sync attachments were never launched.
histogram.summary: The total time a download takes including request and server overhead.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.StoreInitResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-04, Sync attachments were never launched.
histogram.summary: The result of initializing the sync attachment store.

histogram.name: Sync.Attachments.UploadResponseCode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018-04, Sync attachments were never launched.
histogram.summary: Response or error codes from uploading sync attachments.

histogram.name: Sync.AttemptNigoriMigration
histogram.summary: Enumeration of results from attempting to migrate Sync's nigori node and its encryption keys to support keystore.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthInvalidationRejectedTokenAgeLong
histogram.summary: Age of all auth tokens rejected by the invalidation server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthInvalidationRejectedTokenAgeShort
histogram.summary: Age of auth tokens younger than one hour that were rejected by the invalidation server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthorizationTimeInNetwork
histogram.summary: Time taken during initial authorization.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthServerRejectedTokenAgeLong
histogram.summary: Age of all auth tokens rejected by the sync server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AuthServerRejectedTokenAgeShort
histogram.obsolete: No longer relevant since transition to OAuth.
histogram.summary: Age of auth tokens younger than one hour that were rejected by the sync server. Measured from the time they were created.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfile.AddOrUpdateOrigin
histogram.summary: Reported for autofill profile sync once per every locally committed entity creation/update. It breaks down the origin of such a local change.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfile.DeleteOrigin
histogram.summary: Reported for autofill profile sync once per every locally committed entity deletion. It breaks down the origin of such a local deletion.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfileAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during autofill profile association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfileRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of autofill profiles run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfilesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of autofill profile association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillProfileStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of autofill profile association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of autofill (autocomplete) run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.AutofillStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of autofill association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.AutoNigoriOverwrites
histogram.summary: Number of times this client has overwritten the nigori node to update the encryption keys without a user action (during this instantiation of Chrome).

histogram.name: Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreState
histogram.summary: Compares sync's has_setup_completed pref against the set of types actually restored from the sync DB. Mismatches should be rare.

histogram.name: Sync.BadRequestCountOnSignInNeedsUpdateInfoBar
histogram.summary: Number of bad requests since application startup, when the Sync error infobar asking the user to update their account details is displayed.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkGUIDSource
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 12/2019. Replaced by Sync.BookmarkGUIDSource2 which fixes a bug affecting bucket 2 (field left empty) which counted permanent nodes.
histogram.summary: Records the source of GUIDs for remote bookmark updates, recorded when processing a remote bookmark update.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of bookmark run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksDuplicationsAtAssociation
histogram.summary: Estimated number of bookmark duplications after bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksModelReadyToSyncTime
histogram.summary: Time used to parse the Bookmarks persisted sync metadata after being read from the Bookmarks JSON file. It includes the time spent in initializing Bookmark Sync data structures as well as the time spent to check the correctness of the data. It's reported on every startup for already syncing users. It's not reported for non-syncing users or users going through the first sync experience.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksModelSyncStateAtNewDuplication
histogram.summary: Tracks state of local bookmark model version relative to the sync version when a new bookmark duplication occurs during bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksNewDuplicationsAtAssociation
histogram.summary: Estimated number of new bookmark duplications after bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarksStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of bookmark association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.BookmarkStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of bookmark association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.CanDecryptNigoriKeybagWithBase64DecodedKeys
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2019. Was used for investigation of not completed Nigori migration to keystore and recorded 0 suspicious samples.
histogram.summary: Records whether Nigori keybag can be decrypted with base64 decoded keystore keys, when Nigori is not migrated to keystore and cryptographer is not ready.

histogram.name: Sync.ClearServerDataEvents
histogram.summary: Records events encountered during sync's ClearServerData flow.

histogram.name: Sync.CommitLatency
histogram.summary: Records the time between the local model being changed until the commit response is completed and propagated to the model thread. Note: This is only recorded with a data type suffix. The base version is never recorded.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of configuration failures of this data type.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime.ABORTED
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration is aborted.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime.OK
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration succeeds.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime.PARTIAL_SUCCESS
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where only some data types succeed.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime.UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration encounters an unrecoverable error.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.ABORTED
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Sync.ConfigureTime_Initial.ABORTED and Sync.ConfigureTime_Subsequent.ABORTED in M75.
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration is aborted.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.OK
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Sync.ConfigureTime_Initial.OK and Sync.ConfigureTime_Subsequent.OK in M75.
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration succeeds.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.PARTIAL_SUCCESS
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where only some data types succeed.

histogram.name: Sync.ConfigureTime_Long.UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR
histogram.summary: Time spent configuring data types in the case where configuration encounters an unrecoverable error.

histogram.name: Sync.ConflictFixCircularity
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times we fix a circularity sync conflict. This is not expected to be hit anymore.

histogram.name: Sync.ConflictFixRemovedDirectoriesWithContent
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times we fix a removed directory with content sync conflict. This is not expected to be hit anymore

histogram.name: Sync.CredentialsLost
histogram.summary: Whether or not we detected missing credentials during startup. This may be related to crbug.com/121755.

histogram.name: Sync.CustomPassphrase
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether a custom passphrase was entered during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users entered a custom passphrase.

histogram.name: Sync.CustomSync
histogram.summary: Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users explicitly chose to sync this data type via the "Advanced Sync Preferences" dialog.

histogram.name: Sync.DatatypePrefRecovery
histogram.summary: Number of clients that have fixed themselves up from a datatype preference loss. Clients are not expected to have this happen more than once. This value can be compared to Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreSuccess to determine what percentage of users are still recovering.

histogram.name: Sync.DataTypeRunFailures
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. Replaced by Sync.DataTypeRunFailures2 which correctly splits run and start failures.
histogram.summary: Histogram of the run failures for the different sync datatypes. These are failures that occur after startup while the datatype is syncing. Note: Due to an enumeration reordering, pre-M23 labels are inaccurate (see sync/base/model_type.h).

histogram.name: Sync.DataTypeStartFailures
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. Replaced by Sync.DataTypeStartFailures2 which correctly splits run and start failures.
histogram.summary: Histogram of the startup failures for the different sync datatypes. These are failures due to missing top level sync nodes or model association Note: Due to an enumeration reordering, pre-M23 labels are inaccurate (see sync/base/model_type.h).

histogram.name: Sync.DeleteRoamingUserDataDirectory
histogram.summary: Reports the result of an attempt to delete a Windows user's roaming User Data directory. This directory was erroneously created for signed-in users who were not using the local sync server. See https://crbug.com/980487 for details.

histogram.name: Sync.DeviceCount
histogram.summary: The largest number of active syncing devices known to any profile. May be 0 when there are no signed in/syncing profiles open.

histogram.name: Sync.DeviceIdMismatchDetails
histogram.summary: When signin_scoped_device_id from pref doesn't match the one in DeviceInfoSpecfics this histogram tells if sync or pref copy was empty. This will indicate how often such mismatch happens and what was the state before.

histogram.name: Sync.DictionaryStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of dictionary association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryCatastrophicError
histogram.summary: Whether the Sync Directory encountered a catastrophic error.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedMac
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on mac.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedNotWinMac
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on a non-windows non-mac platform.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenFailedWin
histogram.summary: Number of failures trying to open the sync database on windows.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryOpenResult
histogram.summary: Tracks success of failure of sync directory initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.DirectoryVsPrefsConsistency
histogram.summary: Whether the sync cache GUID and birthday are stored consistently across the sync directory and prefs.

histogram.name: Sync.DownloadedPasswordsCountWhenInitialMergeFails
histogram.summary: Counts the number of password updates downloaded in case of error during the MergeSyncData(). This is introduced to detect if there is corrleation between number of password updates and failure during merge. Recorded only for USS implementation.

histogram.name: Sync.DuplicateClientTagHashInApplyPendingUpdates
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09 - we collected sufficient data, see crbug.com/995534.
histogram.summary: Whether ModelTypeWorker received any duplicate client tag hashes within a full GetUpdates cycle (which, in the case of pagination, might consist of multiple individual GetUpdates responses).

histogram.name: Sync.DuplicateClientTagHashInGetUpdatesResponse
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09 - we collected sufficient data, see crbug.com/995531.
histogram.summary: Whether ModelTypeWorker received any duplicate client tag hashes within a single GetUpdates response (which, in the case of pagination, might be only part of a full GetUpdates cycle).

histogram.name: Sync.DuplicateClientTagHashWithDifferentServerIdsInApplyPendingUpdates
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09 - we collected sufficient data, see crbug.com/995528.
histogram.summary: Whether ModelTypeWorker received any duplicate client tag hashes within a full GetUpdates cycle that happen to have different server ids (which, in the case of pagination, might consist of multiple individual GetUpdates responses).

histogram.name: Sync.DuplicateServerIdInApplyPendingUpdates
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09 - we collected sufficient data, see crbug.com/995529.
histogram.summary: Whether ModelTypeWorker received any duplicate server ids within a full GetUpdates cycle (which, in the case of pagination, might consist of multiple individual GetUpdates responses).

histogram.name: Sync.EncryptAllData
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether the "Encrypt all synced data" radio button was selected during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users chose to encrypt their sync data.

histogram.name: Sync.EncryptEverythingWhenCryptographerNotReady
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2020, Sync.PassphraseType2 can give the same data in a better way.
histogram.summary: Records EncryptEverything state when Nigori is not migrated to keystore and cryptographer is not ready.

histogram.name: Sync.Entities.PositioningScheme
histogram.summary: The positioning scheme used within sync entities. It is reported for data types migrated to USS only. While it is reported for all data types, the positioning information are expected to be set for bookmarks only. "MISSING" is reported only for non deleted bookmarks.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during extension association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of extension run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionSettingsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension settings association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ExtensionStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of extension association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ExtraSyncDataCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 07/2018. No longer tracked (because it is directory-specific and related to now obsolete metrics Sync.ModelTypeCount).
histogram.summary: Counts the total number of extra copies of sync data in memory. This count is emitted once, after loading Sync Directory. The count will indicate how many Directory entities fail to share client and server specifics.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconAvailability
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by a Sync.SyncedHistoryFaviconAvailability in M77. Note: Last data entries will be inconsistent since we keep recording this histogram while behavior has not been changed for every SyncFaviconRequestOrigin histogram suffix. In particular, Sync.FaviconAvailability.RECENTLY_CLOSED_TABS on Android has always been recorded for remote only entries.
histogram.summary: Records the availability status (local, sync or non-available) for each favicon displayed by an interface. Recorded when the recent tabs menu is opened or when a request is done to chrome://favicon by page url, which happens for example for the chrome://history and chrome://history/syncedTabs interfaces.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconCacheLookupSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether a sync favicon cache lookup succeeded or not.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconCount
histogram.summary: Number of synced favicons at initialization time.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconImagesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of favicon images association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconsAvailableAtMerge
histogram.summary: Number of client that have filled their sync favicon cache and must evict old favicons vs those whose cache is not full.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconTrackingStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of favicon tracking association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.FaviconVisitPeriod
histogram.summary: Time between updates to a synced favicon's visit time.

histogram.name: Sync.FirstBackendInitializeSuccess
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2011. Was counted incorrectly. Replaced by Sync.BackendInitializeFirstTimeSuccess.
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate during initial sync setup.

histogram.name: Sync.FirstSyncDelayByBackup
histogram.obsolete: Backup logic has been removed since 02/2016.
histogram.summary: First sync delay casued by backing up user data.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqApps
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for apps. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for apps.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqAutofill
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for autofill entries. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for autofill entries.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqAutofillProfiles
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for autofill profiles. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for autofill profiles.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqBookmarks
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for bookmarks. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for boomarks.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqDictionary
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for dictionary. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for dictionary.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqExtensions
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for extensions. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for extensions.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqFaviconImages
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for favicon images. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for favicon images.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqFaviconTracking
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for favicon tracking. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for favicon tracking.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqNigori
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for nigori. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for nigori.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqPasswords
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for passwords. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for passwords.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqPreferences
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for preferences. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for preferences.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSearchEngines
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for search engines. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for search engines.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSessions
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for sessions. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for sessions.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqSyncedNotifications
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for synced notifications. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for synced notifications.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqThemes
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for themes. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for themes.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqTypedUrls
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for typed urls. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for typed urls.

histogram.name: Sync.FreqWifiCredentials
histogram.summary: Time between nudges for WiFi credentials. Used as estimate of datatype commit frequency. Logged when a sync cycle is performed for WiFi credentials.

histogram.name: Sync.GlobalIdConflict
histogram.summary: Two navigations with different unique_ids shared a global_id/timestmap. This means that user events will be ambiguously referencing navigations.

histogram.name: Sync.HasAccessTokenWhenNigoriOnlyConfigurationFailed
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2020. Instrumented in a wrong way and replaced by Sync.NigoriConfigurationWithInvalidatedCredentials.
histogram.summary: Recorded when Nigori-only configuration failed. Indicates whether there was a valid access token when failure happened.

histogram.name: Sync.HasAccessTokenWhenNigoriOnlyConfigurationFailedWith5SecBackoff
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2020. Instrumented in a wrong way and replaced by Sync.NigoriConfigurationWithInvalidatedCredentials.
histogram.summary: Recorded when Nigori-only configuration failed with 5 seconds backoff. Indicates whether there was a valid access token when failure happened.

histogram.name: Sync.InvalidationSessionsAndroid
histogram.summary: Count of the number of session sync invalidations. The goal of the metric is to track how the number of session sync invalidations changes over time.

histogram.name: Sync.IsNigoriMigratedAfterMigration
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2020 because directory implementation of Nigori is no longer used and enough data for corresponding investigation was recorded.
histogram.summary: Indicates whether Nigori node state is migrated after the migration attempt.

histogram.name: Sync.Local.FileSize
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2019 in favor of Sync.Local.FileSizeKB.
histogram.summary: Tracks the size of the local sync backend database file.

histogram.name: Sync.LocalDataFailedToLoad
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. Was only ever recorded for passwords.
histogram.summary: Counts cases when a sync type failed to load the local data during startup.

histogram.name: Sync.LocalModelOutOfSync
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-09. Was only ever recorded for bookmarks.
histogram.summary: Counts instances of out of sync local models detected during startup.

histogram.name: Sync.LostNavigationCount
histogram.summary: Counts instances of navigations that are recorded locally but not synced. Recorded once per active tab for every inferred sync cycle. Sync cycles are inferred by examining the is_synced and is_syncing flags of sync directories when recording local changes to tabs or windows. Sync cycles that occur without changes to tabs or windows won't cause this metric to be logged.

histogram.name: Sync.MemoryPressureWarningBeforeCleanShutdown
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a user's sync service received a MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_CRITICAL warning before the sync service shut down cleanly. The sync service emits this number the next time the user's sync service is started, which will likely happen the next time the user's profile is opened after a Chrome restart. This count is emitted once per user/profile. Things like browser crashes that implicitly bring down all users' sync services will cause unclean shutdown tags to appear on all open profiles, meaning that there will be multiple emissions to this histogram as those profiles are re-opened.

histogram.name: Sync.MemoryPressureWarningBeforeUncleanShutdown
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a user's sync service received a MEMORY_PRESSURE_LEVEL_CRITICAL warning before the sync service shut down uncleanly. The sync service emits this number the next time the user's sync service is started, which will likely happen the next time the user's profile is opened after a Chrome restart. This count is emitted once per user/profile. Things like browser crashes that implicitly bring down all users' sync services will cause unclean shutdown tags to appear on all open profiles, meaning that there will be multiple emissions to this histogram as those profiles are re-opened.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2018. Replaced by Sync.ModelTypeCount2 which does record data consistently for both directory data types and USS data types.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of entries for each model type in sync DB at startup.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeCount2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2018. Replaced by Sync.ModelTypeCount3 which fixes a bug in recording the counts for USS data types
histogram.summary: Counts the number of entries for each model type. For directory types, the count is based on the directory contents, for USS types, the count is based on metadata entries for the type. Recorded after sync configuration. This metric is used for monitoring general health of sync client-side code.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeCount3
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2018. Replaced by Sync.ModelTypeCount4 which fixes a off-by-one bug that the root node get also recorded for directory data types.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of entries for each model type. For directory types, the count is based on the directory contents, for USS types, the count is based on metadata entries for the type. Recorded after sync configuration. This metric is used for monitoring general health of sync client-side code.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeEntityChange
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 10/2018. Replaced by Sync.ModelTypeEntityChange3 which splits initial remote updates from incremental remote updates.
histogram.summary: Recorded once for every sync entity change (whenever it is commited to the server or updated from the server). This metric is used for monitoring general health of sync client-side code. Note: This is only recorded with a data type suffix. The base version is never recorded.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeEntityChange2
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2018. Replaced by Sync.ModelTypeEntityChange3 which fixes a bug affecting a subset of datatypes (directory codepath).
histogram.summary: Recorded once for every sync entity change (whenever it is commited to the server or updated from the server). This metric is used for monitoring general health of sync client-side code. Note: This is only recorded with a data type suffix. The base version is never recorded.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeRedundantPut
histogram.summary: Records the model type when a local change is made and sync optimized it away because nothing actually changed.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeStoreCommitCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of write batches committed to leveldb (ModelTypeStoreBackend) per datatype.

histogram.name: Sync.ModelTypeStoreInitResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M78 after sufficient data was gathered.
histogram.summary: Records the result of ModelTypeStoreBackend initialization. Used to analyze frequency and causes of backend initialization failures.

histogram.name: Sync.NigoriConfigurationWithInvalidatedCredentials
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84 after corresponding investigation was completed.
histogram.summary: Recorded when Nigori-only configuration pending while user credentials were invalidated.

histogram.name: Sync.NigoriMigrationAttemptedBeforeNotMigrated
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2020 because directory implementation of Nigori is no longer used and enough data for corresponding investigation was recorded.
histogram.summary: Records whether Nigori was attempted to migrate before recording migration failure.

histogram.name: Sync.NigoriMigrationReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84 because directory implementation of Nigori is no longer used and enough data for corresponding investigation was recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the condition, which triggered Nigori migration to keystore.

histogram.name: Sync.NigoriMigrationState
histogram.summary: Breakdown of sync's nigori node keystore migration state.

histogram.name: Sync.NigoriMigrationTrigger
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2020 because directory implementation of Nigori is no longer used and enough data for corresponding investigation was recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the method, which triggered Nigori migration to keystore.

histogram.name: Sync.NonGroupedInvalidation
histogram.obsolete: Was used during the launch to compare new and old implemetations.
histogram.summary: The number of invalidations received per sync data type for cases when only single invalidation was emited by the invalidation component. In some cases the invalidation component emits many invalidations grouped together, this histogram doesn't track those cases.

histogram.name: Sync.NonGroupedInvalidationKnownVersion
histogram.obsolete: Was used during the launch to compare new and old implementations.
histogram.summary: The sync datatype of the recieved invalidation. Recorded only for the invalidations with known version and recieved not in a group.

histogram.name: Sync.NonRedundantInvalidationPerModelType
histogram.obsolete: Deprecated in 10/2019. Was used during the launch of the new implementation.
histogram.summary:
WARNING: The recordings here are incorrect (crbug.com/1158476).
The sync datatype of the received invalidation with fresh version.

histogram.name: Sync.NonReflectionUpdateFreshnessPossiblySkewed
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 05/2019 because it recorded freshness only up to 1hr and most samples were thus out of bounds. Replaced by Sync.NonReflectionUpdateFreshnessPossiblySkewed2 which records freshness up to 7 days.
histogram.summary: Freshness of the sync data per received sync entity update, excluding reflections. The time represents the clock difference from the model being modified (usually on another device) until the change is processing by this instance of the browser. Beware of potential clock skew due to two clients being involved.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitBookmarksDuration
histogram.summary: The client side execution time to check for revisits with bookmarks data.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitBookmarksMatchAge
histogram.summary: Age of bookmark that matches a navigation event, where matching means the urls match. If multiple bookmarks match, the most recently created is used.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitBookmarksMatchTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type to a page that matched a bookmark.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitBookmarksMissTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type to a page that didn't match a bookmark.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitNavigationMatchAge
histogram.summary: Difference in time between finding the match and the creation of the most recent foreign modification of the parent tab. The parent tab's modification will not always be indicative of when the matching navigation occurred.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitNavigationMatchOffset
histogram.summary: The number of navigations forward or backwards the matching noncurrent navigation is from the current navigation in its tab. Negative values represent backwards and positive values represent forwards. Zero should not occur since it would cease to be noncurrent.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitNavigationMatchTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that matched a synced navigation.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitNavigationMissTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that didn't match a synced navigation.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitSessionDuration
histogram.summary: The client side execution time to check for revisits with session data.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTabMatchAge
histogram.summary: Difference in time between finding the match and the creation of the most recent foreign modification of the given tab.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTabMatchTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that matched a synced tab.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTabMissTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that didn't match a synced tab.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTypedUrlDuration
histogram.summary: The client side execution time to check for revisits with typed URL data.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTypedUrlMatchAge
histogram.summary: Difference in time between finding the match and the last time this URL was typed on a foreign client.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTypedUrlMatchTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that matched a typed URL.

histogram.name: Sync.PageRevisitTypedUrlMissTransition
histogram.summary: Transition type that didn't match a typed URL.

histogram.name: Sync.PartiallySyncedTypes
histogram.summary: Number of partially synced types (those with a progress marker but no initial sync ended bit) that exist at sync startup.

histogram.name: Sync.PassphraseDecryptionSucceeded
histogram.summary: Whether a passphrase decryption attempt succeeded or not.

histogram.name: Sync.PassphraseDialogDismissed
histogram.summary: Enumeration of how a user dismissed the passphrase dialog.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during password association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of passwords run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of password association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.PasswordStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of password association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during preference association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of preferences run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.Preferences.RemotePrefTypeMismatch
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times a client received a remote pref update with a value type different from the registered pref type. The client will ignore those remote updates.

histogram.name: Sync.Preferences.SyncingUnknownPrefs
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M79 because support for lazy pref registration was removed.
histogram.summary: The number of unknown prefs being synced. This number is computed after the sync model has been associated. Preferences which get handled by sync even before being registered are considered "unknown". This might be limited to a whitelist of preferences.

histogram.name: Sync.PreferencesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of preference association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.PreferenceStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of preference association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ReauthorizationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken from startup for the user to reauthorize.

histogram.name: Sync.ReceivedDataTypeGetUpdatesResponseWithToken
histogram.summary: Recorded for each GetUpdates response (and each data type included). Records whether the newly received token is new (as this data type had none before) or whether it is the same as before or whether it has changed.

histogram.name: Sync.RefreshTokenAvailable
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as not useful since it always logged true.
histogram.summary: Whether OAuth2 refresh token was available at the time when SyncServiceImpl was starting backend.

histogram.name: Sync.RequestContentLength.Compressed
histogram.summary: The request content size for a single HTTP/HTTPS call from sync client to server. The content is compressed by gzip.

histogram.name: Sync.RequestContentLength.Original
histogram.summary: The original request content size for a single HTTP/HTTPS call from sync client to server. It is the size before content got compressed.

histogram.name: Sync.RequestGroupSizeForSyncedHistoryFavicons
histogram.summary: Records the number of active requests simultaneously done to the Google favicon server that were associated with a same icon url and could have thus been grouped. Recorded when one of the following is displayed: entries in chrome://history that are known to be present in remote history data; all entries in chrome://history/syncedTabs; tabs from other devices in the 3 dots history menu (desktop); tabs from other devices in the android Recent Tabs UI.

histogram.name: Sync.ResolveConflict
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of conflict resolutions. Recorded every time a conflict is resolved for a data type that has been converted to USS.

histogram.name: Sync.ResolveSimpleConflict
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of simple conflict resolutions.

histogram.name: Sync.ResponseContentLength.Compressed
histogram.summary: The response content size for a single HTTP/HTTPS call from sync server to client. The content is compressed by gzip.

histogram.name: Sync.ResponseContentLength.Original
histogram.summary: The original response content size for a single HTTP/HTTPS call from sync server and client. It is the size after content got uncompressed.

histogram.name: Sync.RestoreBackendInitializeSucess
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2011. Was counted incorrectly. Replaced by Sync.BackendInitializeRestoreSuccess.
histogram.summary: Tracks sync backend initialization success rate in cases where sync was previously initialized.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during search engine association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of search engine run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEnginesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of search engine association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SearchEngineStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of search engine association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ServiceInitialConfigureTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Sync.ConfigureTime_Initial.{OK, ABORTED, UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR} in M75 when solving bug 169053.
histogram.summary: Time spent on first-time configure. May include time spent on retries.

histogram.name: Sync.ServiceSubsequentConfigureTime
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Sync.ConfigureTime_Subsequent.{OK, ABORTED, UNRECOVERABLE_ERROR} in M75 when solving bug 169053.
histogram.summary: Time spent on non-first-time configure. May include time spent on retries.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during session association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.SessionRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of sessions run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsBadForeignHashOnMergeCount
histogram.summary: Number of foreign sessions entries detected with bad client tag hash value during MergeDataAndStartSyncing. These will be immediately deleted. The overwhelming majority of clients should report a value of 0 upon startup.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsRefreshDelay
histogram.summary: Delay from the time chrome://history is loaded until the other devices' sessions data became available.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of session association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SessionStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of session association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.SessionWindows
histogram.summary: The number of windows present within Chrome at the time Sync associates the SESSIONS datatype.

histogram.name: Sync.SesssionsDuplicateSyncId
histogram.summary: https://crbug.com/639009, count of duplicate sync ids (tab node id) when any are encountered. Likely caused from a persistence race between native tab storage and sync db on Android. Should be trending to zero.

histogram.name: Sync.ShouldTriggerMigrationAfterMigration
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M84 because directory implementation of Nigori is no longer used and enough data for corresponding investigation was recorded.
histogram.summary: Indicates that Nigori would be migrated again right after migration if AttemptToMigrateNigoriToKeystore called.

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.BackendDestroyedTime
histogram.summary: Time taken from the start of sync shutdown (in SyncServiceImpl) until the backend (SyncEngine) is fully destroyed.

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.StopRegistrarTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time the UI thread waits (at shutdown) to stop the SyncBackendRegistrar.

histogram.name: Sync.Shutdown.StopSyncThreadTime
histogram.summary: Amount of time the UI thread waits (at shutdown) to stop the sync thread.

histogram.name: Sync.SizeOfFaviconServerRequestGroup
histogram.summary: Records the number of active requests simultaneously done to the Google favicon server that were associated with a same icon url and could have thus been grouped. Recorded when opening the recent tabs menu, chrome://history or chrome://history/syncedTabs with both history sync and the EnableHistoryFaviconsGoogleServerQuery feature enabled.

histogram.name: Sync.Startup.TimeDeferred
histogram.summary: Time spent after SyncServiceImpl *creation* but before SyncEngine initialization.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncAuthError
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times sync clients have encountered an auth error and number of times auth errors are fixed.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncCycleInterval
histogram.summary: The interval between successive sync cycles. Recorded whenever a sync cycle starts, except for the very first one after Chrome startup.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncedNotificationsStartFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M53. Replaced by SyncedNotificationsConfigureFailure. See crbug.com/478226.
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of synced notifications association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncerConflictStuck
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2011. No longer tracked. See crbug.com/107816.
histogram.summary: Number of times the sync conflict resolver gets stuck. This is not expected to be hit anymore.

histogram.name: Sync.SyncEverything
histogram.summary: Boolean histogram for whether the "Sync Everything" option was selected during sync setup. Samples are taken every time sync is (re)configured, and the unique userid count shows how many users chose to sync all available data types.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during theme association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of theme run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.ThemesStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of theme association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.ThemeStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of theme association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during typed url association (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlChangeProcessorErrors
histogram.summary: The percentage of history DB operations initiated by the typed URL change processor that return an error. The cumulative count for the current sync session is logged after every typed URL change.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlMergeAndStartSyncingErrors
histogram.summary: The percentage of history DB operations during merge data that return an error. This is logged at the end of typed URL merge data, which happens once each time sync starts up.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlModelAssociationErrors
histogram.summary: The percentage of history DB operations during model association that return an error. This is logged at the end of typed URL model association, which happens once each time sync starts up.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlRunFailures
histogram.summary: Count of typed url run failures, used to compare failure rates between data types for a particular profile (see other Sync*RunFailures histograms).

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of typed url association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.TypedUrlStartFailures
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of typed url association failures (M18 and earlier were mispelled with this histogram).

histogram.name: Sync.UnrecoverableErrors
histogram.summary: Enumeration of the different reasons for unrecoverable errors and how often they have occurred.

histogram.name: Sync.UserPerceivedAuthorizationTime
histogram.summary: Time the user spends looking at the authorization dialog.

histogram.name: Sync.UserPerceivedBookmarkAssociation
histogram.summary: Time taken during bookmark association.

histogram.name: Sync.USSLoadModelsTime
histogram.summary: Time it took sync to load models for USS datatypes.

histogram.name: Sync.USSMigrationEntityCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of sync entities per model type successfully migrated from directory to USS.

histogram.name: Sync.USSMigrationFailure
histogram.summary: Counts directory to USS migration failures per model type.

histogram.name: Sync.USSMigrationSuccess
histogram.summary: Counts directory to USS migration successes per model type.

histogram.name: Sync.Wallet.EntitiesClearedWhenDisabled
histogram.summary: Counts number of data entities that are removed when sync / Wallet sync gets disabled.

histogram.name: Sync.WalletDataModelTypeProcessorErrors
histogram.summary: Records errors with storage keys in ClientTagBasedModelTypeProcessor during updates and loading of metadata for AUTOFILL_WALLET_DATA data type.

histogram.name: Sync.WalletMetadata.DeletedOldOrphans
histogram.summary: Counts number of old orphan metadata entities that are removed on startup.

histogram.name: Sync.WifiCredentialsAssociationTime
histogram.summary: Time taken during WiFi credentials association.

histogram.name: Sync.WifiCredentialsConfigureFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of WiFi credentials configuration failures.

histogram.name: Sync.WifiCredentialsStartFailure
histogram.summary: Enumeration of types of WiFi credentials association failures.

histogram.name: Sync.WorkerApplyHasEncryptedUpdates
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M67. After more than a year, almost all clients are reporting FALSE.
histogram.summary: Whether there are still encrypted updates that the cryptographer cannot decrypt during ApplyUpdates in the ModelTypeWorker (USS Only). Emitting true is an invalid state that hopefully never happens, as it is a potential data loss scenario.

histogram.name: Sync.YoungestForeignTabAgeOnNTP
histogram.summary: Upon NTP load, the age of the youngest synced foreign tab.

histogram.name: SyncedNotifications.Actions
histogram.summary: The actions taken on synced notifications, recorded every time they happen. This histogram will record every single event that happens separately.

histogram.name: SyncPromo.NTPPromo
histogram.summary: Shows actions taken on the "Not signed in? You're misssing out" link on the top right of chrome://apps. Logged once per visit of chrome://apps as well as on each click of the sync promo.

histogram.name: Syzyasan.DeferredFreeWasEnabled
histogram.summary: Record whether the deferred free mechanism was successfully enabled or not. This is only recorded in syzyasan builds with the feature enabled.

histogram.name: Tab.BackgroundTabShown
histogram.summary: Whether a tab which was opened in the background (e.g. via "Open link in new tab") is foregrounded prior to being closed.

histogram.name: Tab.BackgroundTabsOpenedViaContextMenuCount
histogram.summary: Counts the number of background tabs opened via the context menu per page URL. The count is reset on each navigation of the parent tab. Zero counts are not recorded.

histogram.name: Tab.Close
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from trying to close the tab to actually closing it. Includes time that's spent in JS OnUnload handlers.

histogram.name: Tab.Close.UnloadTime
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds from when JS OnUnload handlers have finished to actually closing tab. Doesn't include time that's spent in JS OnUnload handlers. If there are no UnLoad handlers, should be identical to Tab.Close.

histogram.name: Tab.Deactivation.Bookmarked
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016. No longer useful after finding out that it has no effect on tab reactivation rates.
histogram.summary: A tab was deactivated. Closing tabs are not included. This histogram also records if the tab's URL was bookmarked.

histogram.name: Tab.Deactivation.HadFormInteraction
histogram.summary: A tab was deactivated. Closing tabs are not included. This histogram also records if the tab had any form interaction.

histogram.name: Tab.Deactivation.Pinned
histogram.summary: A tab was deactivated. Closing tabs are not included. This histogram also records if the tab was pinned to the tab strip or not.

histogram.name: Tab.Discarding
histogram.summary: Metric to track counts of actions related to tab discarding. Namely, we get an event for every tab switch, split into two groups, whether it was a discarded tab not. We also get an event whenever a tab gets discarded as well as when a tab that's playing audio gets discarded.

histogram.name: Tab.Discarding.DiscardCount
histogram.summary: Metric to track the number of discards tabs have gone through. Each time a tab is discarded, this histogram is recorded. Therefore, this metric is cumulative, ie. as a tab gets discarded over and over, it gets a hit in each bin (1, 2, 3...).

histogram.name: Tab.EvictedTabWasActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When switching to an evicted tab, this histogram records whether or not the tab had ever been active. For example, the tab was opened via "Open in new tab" but evicted before being viewed for the first time.

histogram.name: Tab.FormActivityCountEvictedHistogram
histogram.summary: A count of form activity (e.g. fields selected, characters typed) in a tab. Recorded only for tabs that are evicted due to memory pressure and then selected again.

histogram.name: Tab.LostTabAgeWhenSwitchedToForeground
histogram.summary: [Android] When a tab that was opened in the background (e.g. via "Open link in new tab") is evicted prior to the first time that it is shown, we record the tab's age at the time that the tab is shown.

histogram.name: Tab.NewTabDOMContentLoaded
histogram.summary: The time for the new tab page to fire the "DOMContentLoaded" event.

histogram.name: Tab.NewTabScriptStart
histogram.summary: The time for the new tab page to start executing JavaScript.

histogram.name: Tab.OpenedPopup.PopupToCrossOriginRedirectTime
histogram.summary: Measures the time from when a tab opens a popup to when it navigates itself cross-origin in the background.

histogram.name: Tab.OpenedPopup.VisibleTimeAfterCrossOriginRedirect
histogram.summary: Measures the total time a tab is visible after it navigates itself cross-origin in the background. Measured at WebContents destruction. The tab must have opened a popup (as classified by the popup blocker) before the navigation.

histogram.name: Tab.Reactivation.Bookmarked
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2016. No longer useful after finding out that it has no effect on tab reactivation rates.
histogram.summary: A tab was reactivated after being hidden. This histogram also records if the tab's URL was bookmarked.

histogram.name: Tab.Reactivation.HadFormInteraction
histogram.summary: A tab was reactivated after being hidden. This histogram also records if the tab had any form interaction.

histogram.name: Tab.Reactivation.Pinned
histogram.summary: A tab was reactivated after being hidden. This histogram also records if the tab was pinned to the tab strip.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenDisplayed
histogram.summary: The status of a tab collected each time the tab is displayed on Android, including user switching to the tab and displays of newly created tabs, such as NTP or tabs opened to handle intents.

histogram.name: Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForegroundDataProxyEnabled
histogram.summary: [Android and iOS] The status of a tab collected each time the user switches to it on mobile with the data reduction proxy enabled. This is populated identically, and in addition to Tab.StatusWhenSwitchedBackToForeground for any given tab switching event if the proxy is enabled.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundLaunchedWithURL
histogram.summary: Each time a tab is brought to the foreground, this histogram indicates if chrome was launched without an URL (i.e., from the launcher), or with an URL (i.e., from another app).

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundMRURank
histogram.summary: Rank in MRU order (0 being first) when the tab was switched to foreground.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundNumTabs
histogram.summary: Count of all tabs when a tab is switched.

histogram.name: Tab.SwitchedToForegroundRevisit
histogram.summary: Each time a tab is brought to the foreground, this histogram indicates if this is the first viewing of the tab since Chrome was put into foreground, or if it was a return to a tab that has already been shown in this session.

histogram.name: Tab.TabUnder.EngagementScore
histogram.summary: Measures the engagement score associated with the URL that is detected as the target of a tab-under navigation.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceActive
histogram.summary: [iOS] When an existing tab becomes active, this histogram records the time since it was made inactive.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceActiveEvicted
histogram.summary: [iOS] When an evicted tab becomes active, this histogram records the time since it was made inactive.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeSinceFormActivityEvictedHistogram
histogram.summary: Time elapsed since there was form activity (e.g. fields selected, characters typed) in a tab. Recorded only for tabs that are evicted due to memory pressure and then selected again.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeToReactivation.Important
histogram.summary: The time elapsed from the moment a tab was deactivated until it was reactivated. Only recorded for tabs that are pinned or had form interaction.

histogram.name: Tab.TimeToReactivation.Normal
histogram.summary: The time elapsed from the moment a tab was deactivated until it was reactivated. Only recorded for tabs that are not pinned nor had form interaction.

histogram.name: Tab.VisibleTimeAfterCrossOriginRedirect
histogram.obsolete: This metric was deprecated in favor of just using Tab.TabUnder.VisibleTime directly. Consider bringing it back if we care about visible time after a suspicious redirect without an associated popup.
histogram.summary: Measures the total time a tab is visible after it navigates itself cross-origin in the background. Measured at WebContents destruction.

histogram.name: TabManager.BackgroundTabOpening.ForegroundTab.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration
histogram.summary: The expected queueing duration of tasks in a foreground tab during a background tab opening session (the duration of time from when the browser starts to open background tabs until the time the browser has finished loading those tabs or otherwise decided to stop loading them). The metric reflects the responsiveness of a tab. A lower value means the tab will respond to inputs faster. This metric is equivalent to RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration. It is emitted once for all tasks in each 1000-ms window. The metric is not recorded when the session overlaps with session restore.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.DiscardedEngagementScore
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. Analysis showed that MRU was as good as engagement score to choose which tabs to discard. The new plan is to build a machine learning model to choose which tabs to discard.
histogram.summary: Site engagement score of a discarded tab. Recorded for each discard if the score is available.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.LocalDatabase.DatabaseInit
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Local Site Characteristics database.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.LocalDatabase.DatabaseInitAfterDelete
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Local Site Characteristics database after deleting it after a failed repair attempt.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.LocalDatabase.DatabaseInitAfterRepair
histogram.summary: The result of opening the Local Site Characteristics database after a repair attempt.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.LocalDatabase.DatabaseRepair
histogram.summary: The result of trying to repair the Local Site Characteristics database after a failed open.

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.LogMemoryTime
histogram.summary: Elapsed time to collect memory usage of each tab triggered by a LogMemory() call().

histogram.name: TabManager.Discarding.ReloadedEngagementScore
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. Analysis showed that MRU was as good as engagement score to choose which tabs to discard. The new plan is to build a machine learning model to choose which tabs to discard.
histogram.summary: Site engagement score of a reloaded tab. Recorded for each reload if the score is available. Note that this will be the same score the tab had when discarded (which could have changed by the time it gets reloaded).

histogram.name: TabManager.Experimental.BackgroundTabOpening.TabSwitchLoadTime
histogram.summary: The tab load time of a tab that is switched to during a background tab opening session (the duration of time from when the browser starts to open background tabs until the time the browser has finished loading those tabs or otherwise decided to stop loading them). Tab load time is defined as the time between when the user switches to a backround tab, and the time when that tab finishes loading in the foreground. If the user switches away before the tab finishes loading, a metric will not be recorded unless the user switches back, in which case the tab load time is measured from that point in time. The metric is only recorded when a tab is switched to from another tab within the same tabstrip. As a result, the initial forground tab is not included in this metric since it was not switched to from another tab. The metric is not recorded when the session overlaps with session restore.

histogram.name: TabManager.Experimental.SessionRestore.TabSwitchLoadTime
histogram.summary: The tab load time of a tab that is switched to during a session restore. Tab load time is defined as the time between when the user switches to a backround tab, and the time when that tab finishes loading in the foreground. If the user switches away before the tab finishes loading, a metric will not be recorded unless the user switches back, in which case the tab load time is measured from that point in time. The metric is only recorded when a tab is switched to from another tab within the same tabstrip.
