As a result, the initial forground tab is not included in this metric since it was not switched to from another tab. The metric is only recorded when session restore is actively loading tabs, which ends when either all tabs have been loaded and their pages rendered, or tab loading needs to be deferred in cases where the system is under memory pressure. The metric is not recorded when the session overlaps with background tab opening session.

histogram.name: TabManager.Heuristics.FromBackgroundedToFirstAlertFired
histogram.summary: Measures the time duration from when the tab is backgrounded to when a JavaScript alert is updated. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.

histogram.name: TabManager.Heuristics.FromBackgroundedToFirstAudioStarts
histogram.summary: Measures the time duration from when the tab is backgrounded to when audio starts to play. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.

histogram.name: TabManager.SessionRestore.CompressedPagesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of pages compressed per second during session restore. Recorded at the end of session restore as an average over the entire period, defined as the period of time when session restore is actively loading tabs, which ends when either all tabs have been loaded and their pages rendered, or tab loading needs to be deferred in cases where the system is under memory pressure. Only recorded on macOS.

histogram.name: TabManager.SessionRestore.DecompressedPagesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of pages decompressed per second during session restore. Recorded at the end of session restore as an average over the entire period, defined as the period of time when session restore is actively loading tabs, which ends when either all tabs have been loaded and their pages rendered, or tab loading needs to be deferred in cases where the system is under memory pressure. Only recorded on macOS.

histogram.name: TabManager.SessionRestore.ForegroundTab.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration
histogram.summary: The expected queueing duration of tasks in a foreground tab during session restore. This metric reflects the responsiveness of a tab. A lower value means the tab will respond to inputs faster. This metric is equal to RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration. It is emitted once for all tasks in each 1000-ms window. The metric is not recorded when the session overlaps with background tab opening session.

histogram.name: TabManager.SessionRestore.SwapInPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of swap-ins per second during session restore. Recorded at the end of session restore as an average over the entire period, defined as the period of time when session restore is actively loading tabs, which ends when either all tabs have been loaded and their pages rendered, or tab loading needs to be deferred in cases where the system is under memory pressure.

histogram.name: TabManager.SessionRestore.SwapOutPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of swap-outs per second during session restore. Recorded at the end of session restore as an average over the entire period, defined as the period of time when session restore is actively loading tabs, which ends when either all tabs have been loaded and their pages rendered, or tab loading needs to be deferred in cases where the system is under memory pressure.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.DiscardCount
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of tabs discarded due to low memory conditions, recorded once per tab discard event. For example, a user who had 3 tabs discarded records a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more tab discard events.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.DiscardInLastMinute
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. Average number of minutes between discard events is available in Tabs.Discard.InitialTime2 and Tabs.Discard.IntervalTime2.
histogram.summary: Whether or not a tab was discarded in the last minute of usage. Total count is number of minutes of device usage. 100 / discard percentage gives the average number of minutes between discard events.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.InitialTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed May 4, 2012. Replaced by Tabs.Discard.InitialTime2 because this stat had too low of a range maximum. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Time in seconds between system startup and when the first tab is discarded due to low memory conditions. Higher is better.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.InitialTime2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. Replaced with Discarding.Urgent.TimeSinceStartup which is recorded when Chrome has to discard tabs or apps urgently (instead of before an individual tab is urgently or proactively discarded).
histogram.summary: Time in seconds between system startup and when the first tab is discarded due to low memory conditions. Higher is better. Range maximum is approximately one day.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.IntervalTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed May 4, 2012. Replaced by Tabs.Discard.IntervalTime2 because this stat had too low of a range maximum. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Time in seconds between tab discard events after the first one, recorded once per discard event. Higher is better.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.IntervalTime2
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. Replaced with Discarding.Urgent.TimeSinceLastUrgent which is recorded before a set of tabs/apps are urgently discarded (instead of before an individual tab is urgently or proactively discarded).
histogram.summary: Time in milliseconds between tab discard events after the first one, recorded once per discard event. Should occur no faster than once every 750 ms. Higher is better.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemAllocatedMB
histogram.summary: System-wide memory allocation at the time a tab was discarded, roughly equivalent to the sum of memory allocated with malloc() in userspace plus graphics driver memory.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemAnonymousMB
histogram.obsolete: Removed December 7, 2012. Replaced by Tabs.Discard.MemAllocatedMB because this stat has insufficient precision in the 2-4 GB range and does not properly account for graphics memory on ARM.
histogram.summary: System-wide anonymous memory allocation at the time a tab was discarded, roughly equivalent to memory allocated with malloc().

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemAvailableMB
histogram.summary: System-wide file-backed memory plus free memory, roughly equivalent to what the kernel uses to trigger low-memory notifications for tab discards. If lower than the kernel's threshold then we are not effectively freeing memory in response to the initial notification and are repeatedly being notified.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemGraphicsMB
histogram.summary: Graphics driver (GEM object) memory at the time of a tab discard.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.MemShmemMB
histogram.summary: System-wide shared memory at the time of a tab discard. Used primarily for shared buffers in the graphics system. Tracked because it's a historical source of leaks on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.ReloadCount
histogram.summary: Cumulative number of times a tab was reloaded because it was discarded and the user clicked on it later, recorded once per reload event. For example, a user who clicks on 3 discarded tabs will record a count in the 1 bin, 2 bin, and 3 bin. Thus each bin N is the number of sessions where users experienced N or more reload events. Compare to Tabs.Discard.DiscardCount.

histogram.name: Tabs.Discard.TabCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2017. Replaced with Discarding.Urgent.NumAliveTabs which records the number of tabs that are not pending load or discarded when an urgent discard request is received (vs. this that records the total number of tabs every time a tab is discarded, no matter the reason).
histogram.summary: The number of tabs open across all browser windows when a tab was discarded due to low memory conditions.

histogram.name: Tabs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenTabClosedAndNextTabCreated
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between closing a tab and opening another, to track very frequent tabs.

histogram.name: Tabs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenTabCreatedAndNextTabCreated
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between opening a tab and opening another, to track very frequent tabs.

histogram.name: Tabs.FineTiming.TimeBetweenTabCreatedAndSameTabClosed
histogram.summary: Fine-grained (in msec) time between opening a tab and closing it, to track very short-lived tabs.

histogram.name: Tabs.FrozenTabPercentage
histogram.summary: The percentage of hidden tabs that are frozen. This metric is recorded every 5 minutes, as a tab heartbeat metric. Desktop only.

histogram.name: Tabs.iOS_PostRedirectPLT
histogram.summary: Page load time (PLT) for iOS that does not include time spent following redirects. On other platforms this is calculated from Navigation Timings but on iOS Navigation Timings are not available so we're recreating a calculation similar to PLT.PT_RequestToFinish but not including time spent following redirects. This metric represents the time between when navigation is initiated (prior to DNS, TCP connect, etc but after following redirects) until loading ends (i.e. JS onload event). On non-iOS Chrome this is (performance.timing.loadEventEnd - performance.timing.redirectEnd). On Chrome for iOS we're calculating the time between the creation of the top-level URLRequest and when webDidFinishWithURL is called.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreApplicability
histogram.summary: Applicability of speculative tab restore, recorded every time a tab is switched. This allows to estimate the fraction of tab restores experienced on mobile that can be mitigated using speculative restore. Options higher in the enum take precedence over the lower ones (i.e. low-memory tablet will be accounted as tablet).

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestorePredictionAccuracy.SideSwipe
histogram.summary: Accuracy of the tab switch predictions made when the user begins the side swipe gesture.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestorePredictionAccuracy.TabSwitcher
histogram.summary: Accuracy of the tab switch predictions made when the user enters the tab switcher.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTargetStatus
histogram.summary: Status of a tab recorded when the tab is targeted with speculative restore.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTimeAhead.SideSwipe
histogram.summary: Time between starting the speculative load and actual tab switch for correct speculative load predictions made when the user begins the side swipe gesture.

histogram.name: Tabs.SpeculativeRestoreTimeAhead.TabSwitcher
histogram.summary: Time between starting the speculative load and actual tab switch for correct speculative load predictions made when the user enters the tab switcher.

histogram.name: Tabs.StateTransfer.Time
histogram.summary: Tabs.StateTransfer.TimeA_B measures the time a tab was in state A before it transferred to state B.

histogram.name: Tabs.Suggestions.Close.NumSuggestionsChanged
histogram.summary:
The user is presented with recommendations on which Tabs they could close. The user has the option to: 1) Remove a Tab from the recommendation 2) Add a Tab which wasn't in the recommendation to the recommendation
This metric records the sum of the number of times the user does 1) or 2) and is a measure of how useful the recommendation is. This metric is recorded after the user accepts a recommendation - potentially with edits by performing 1) or 2).

histogram.name: Tabs.TabSearch.WindowDisplayedDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 09/2020 as the way the metric is emitted has changed. Replaced with Tabs.TabSearch.WindowDisplayedDuration2.
histogram.summary:
Tab Search is a feature that allows users to better search their browsers for their desired tabs. It can be opened and closed. This records the amount of time between when a Tab Search bubble is opened and when it is closed. It does so by recording the difference in time between when the Tab Search's WebView is first set visible and when the WebView's destructor is called.
The Tab Search UI is a bubble anchored to an element within a browser window and is closed if the user switches to a tab, presses the escape key or performs an action to return focus to the hosting window. The Tab Search UI bubble will also close if the hosting browser window is closed or crashes.
Users may leave the bubble open for long periods of time without directly interacting with the UI which could result in a long tail of displayed durations.

histogram.name: Tabs.TimeSinceLastInteraction
histogram.summary: Reports the delta between the last user interaction time with a WebContents and the time browser code wants to verify a recent user interaction with that WebContents. Used to tune the threshhold for timing out a user interaction.

histogram.name: TabsApi.RequestedWindowState
histogram.summary: The requested window creation state from the tabs extensions API when it's used to create a new window or update the state of an existing one.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.BlockShutdownTasksPostedDuringShutdown
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018. Instead of recording a histogram with the number of BLOCK_SHUTDOWN tasks posted during shutdown, we generate a crash when too many BLOCK_SHUTDOWN tasks are posted during shutdown. A crash dump is more actionnable than a histogram.
histogram.summary: Number of BLOCK_SHUTDOWN tasks that were posted to a base::TaskScheduler after its Shutdown() method was called but before it returned.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.DetachDuration
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between when the thread managed by a SchedulerWorker is detached and when the main function of a new thread managed by the same SchedulerWorker is entered (following a wake up). Recorded each time that a thread is recreated for a given SchedulerWorker.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.HeartbeatLatencyMicroseconds
histogram.summary:
Latency of dummy "heartbeat" tasks posted with specific traits (see suffix). The heartbeat recording avoids dependencies between this report and other work in the system. See TaskScheduler.TaskLatencyMicroseconds.* for a metric that is closer to the real workload.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.NumActiveWorkers
histogram.summary: Number of workers running a task in a given SchedulerWorkerPool. Recorded every 59 minutes (sampling rate is not expected to affect the distribution).

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.NumCancelledDelayedTasks
histogram.summary: Lower-bound number of cancelled tasks that remain in the DelayedTaskManager. An exact number is not recorded, as it could potentially be expensive to calculate. Instead, a lazy count is maintained by noting cancelled tasks as new delayed tasks are added. Recorded every time the ServiceThread performs a heartbeat latency report.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.NumTasksBeforeDetach
histogram.summary: Number of tasks executed by a SchedulerWorker before it detached. Recorded when a SchedulerWorker detaches.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.NumTasksBetweenWaits
histogram.summary: Number of tasks executed by a SchedulerWorker between two waits on its WaitableEvent. This should be maximized without affecting perceived browser performance.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.NumTasksRunWhileQueuing
histogram.summary: Number of tasks run by TaskScheduler while task was queuing (from time task was posted until time it was run). Recorded for dummy "heartbeat" tasks posted with specific traits (see suffix). The heartbeat recording avoids dependencies between this report and other work in the system. Recorded every time the ServiceThread performs a heartbeat latency report.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.NumWorkers
histogram.summary: Number of workers that live in a given SchedulerWorkerPool. Recorded every 59 minutes (sampling rate is not expected to affect the distribution).

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.PercentCancelledDelayedTasks
histogram.summary: Lower-bound percentage of tasks in the DelayedTaskManager that have been cancelled. An exact number is not recorded, as it could potentially be expensive to calculate. Instead, a lazy count is maintained by noting cancelled tasks as new delayed tasks are added. Recorded every time the ServiceThread performs a heartbeat latency report.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.TaskLatency
histogram.obsolete: Removed 4/2017. Units changed from milliseconds to microseconds.
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between when a task is posted and when it starts to run. Recorded for each task that runs inside the TaskScheduler. This metric is useful to determine true latency of the average task in the average runtime scenario. Its total count can also be used as a proxy for the number of tasks posted to a given category. On the other hand, a fallout of this metric is that timing every task means each report is dependent on the many things that can cause an individual task to be delayed (e.g. tasks on a single bogged down sequence will be reported with high latency even if not stalling the scheduler itself). See TaskScheduler.HeartbeatLatencyMicroseconds.* for a metric that is independent of such factors.

histogram.name: TaskScheduler.TaskLatencyMicroseconds
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between when a task is posted and when it starts to run. Recorded for each task that runs inside the TaskScheduler.

histogram.name: TerminalSystemAppFrame.WrenchMenu.MenuAction
histogram.summary: Number of times that each menu item is clicked from the terminal system app menu button.

histogram.name: TextToSpeech.Settings.DefaultVoicePicked
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: The user picked a default voice of the specified voice ID, which is hashed from a JSON string of the voice name and extension ID.

histogram.name: TextToSpeech.Settings.PreviewVoiceClicked
histogram.obsolete: Removed 06/2020 as it is no longer needed for analysis.
histogram.summary: When the user requests a preview of a text-to-speech voice, records which voice was previewed.

histogram.name: TextToSpeechEngine.ParseVoice.HasGender
histogram.summary: True if a voice parsed from a ttsEngine extension manifest has a specific gender. This is recorded each time a TTS extension is parsed, which may occur multiple times per extension, in tts_engine_manifest_handler: TtsVoices::Parse.

histogram.name: TextToSpeechEngine.UpdateVoice.HasGender
histogram.summary: True if a voice specified in chrome.ttsEngine.updateVoices by a ttsEngine extension has a specific gender.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.InstalledPrograms.DataSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the in-memory representation of the installed third-party programs on the user's machine.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.InstalledPrograms.GetDataTime
histogram.summary: Records the time it took to gather the list of installed third-party programs and their install location or components.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.ShellExtensionsCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 14 Aug 2018 as reporting to this metric was incorrect since its inception. Replaced by ThirdPartyModules.ShellExtensionsCount2.
histogram.summary: The number of registered shell extensions found on the user's machine. This is emitted shortly after startup when the shell extensions enumeration takes place.

histogram.name: ThirdPartyModules.ShellExtensionsCount2
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 30/08/2018 now that the enumeration removes duplicate entries.
histogram.summary: The number of registered shell extensions found on the user's machine. This is emitted shortly after startup when the shell extensions enumeration takes place.

histogram.name: ThreadPool.NumActiveWorkers
histogram.obsolete: Removed 7/2020. Not used in active investigations.
histogram.summary: Number of workers running a task in a given SchedulerWorkerPool. Recorded every 59 minutes (sampling rate is not expected to affect the distribution).

histogram.name: ThreadPool.NumTasksBetweenWaits
histogram.obsolete: Removed 8/2019. Not used in active investigations.
histogram.summary: Number of tasks executed by a SchedulerWorker between two waits on its WaitableEvent. This should be maximized without affecting perceived browser performance.

histogram.name: ThreadPool.NumTasksInSequenceOnPush
histogram.obsolete: Stopped recording on 21/4/2020 due to a bug.
histogram.summary: Number of tasks in a ThreadPool sequence, recorded every time a task is pushed to a sequence. This is recorded to determine how often the size of a sequence grows above 10000 tasks, and whether it is reasonable to upload a process dump when that happens.

histogram.name: ThreadPool.NumWorkers
histogram.obsolete: Removed 7/2020. Not used in active investigations.
histogram.summary: Number of workers that live in a given SchedulerWorkerPool. Recorded every 59 minutes (sampling rate is not expected to affect the distribution).

histogram.name: Thumbnails.AddedToTopSites
histogram.summary: A page thumbnail (for use on the New Tab page) was added to TopSites.

histogram.name: Thumbnails.CaptureOutcome
histogram.summary: The result of trying to capture a thumbnail of the current page.

histogram.name: TileManager.TilesGPUMemoryUsage
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Compositing.Renderer.GPUMemoryForTilingsInKb which is an existing metric tracking the same value.
histogram.summary: The amount of GPU memory, in kilobytes. Recorded on devices with less than or equal to 512MB of memory and when tile manager had sufficient memory to schedule all visible tiles.

histogram.name: TileManager.TilesGPUMemoryUsage2
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Compositing.Renderer.GPUMemoryForTilingsInKb which is an existing metric tracking the same value.
histogram.summary: The amount of GPU memory used for tiles, in kilobytes. Recorded when the tile manager had sufficient memory to schedule all visible tiles.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ActionsModel.ComponentActionsCount
histogram.obsolete: We no longer have component actions.
histogram.summary: The number of component action icons the Browser Actions Container knows about (visible or in the overflow bucket). Does not count icons that have been permanently hidden by the user. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ActionsModel.OverallActionsCount
histogram.obsolete: After the removal of component actions, this histogram is equivalent to ExtensionToolbarModel.BrowserActionsCount. See that histogram instead.
histogram.summary: The total number of action icons the Browser Actions Container knows about (visible or in the overflow bucket). Does not count icons that have been permanently hidden by the user. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile.

histogram.name: Toolbar.ActionsModel.ToolbarActionsVisible
histogram.summary: The number of visible toolbar icons in the Browser Actions Container (visible as in number of icons not in the overflow bucket). 0 means all icons are in the overflow bucket. MAX_INT means the toolbar is always showing all icons. Measured once per startup per (non-incognito) profile but only for those profiles that have one or more browser actions showing in the toolbar.

histogram.name: Toolbar.AppMenuTimeToAction
histogram.summary: The number of millseconds between when the user opens the app menu and when the app menu is closed. Logged once per app menu run when the menu closes. Not recorded for menu runs that are initiated by a drag-and-drop sequence. Note that the code paths for Views-platforms vs Mac are different, so cross- platform comparison may not always be reasonable.

histogram.name: Toolbar.Menu.NewTabPresentationDuration
histogram.summary: The number of millseconds between the user requesting a new tab, e.g. by tapping the New Tab entry in the main tools menu, and it completing its animation on screen.

histogram.name: TopSites.NumberOfApplyBlacklist
histogram.summary: The number of times TopSitesImpl::ApplyBlockedUrls is called.

histogram.name: TopSites.NumberOfBlacklistedItems
histogram.summary: The number of urls blocked in TopSites. Logged every time TopSitesImpl::ApplyBlockedUrls is called.

histogram.name: TouchAction.EffectiveTouchAction
histogram.summary: Tracks how often each touch action is allowed (AKA the frequency of each effective touch action) at the end of each touch sequence.

histogram.name: TouchAction.EquivalentEffectiveAndWhiteListed
histogram.summary: Tracks how often the effective touch action computed by blink is or is not equivalent to the whitelisted touch action computed by the compositor at the end of each touch sequence.

histogram.name: TouchAction.GestureEventFiltered
histogram.summary: Tracks how often a gesture event is or is not dropped due to the current allowed touch action state not matching the gesture event.

histogram.name: TouchAction.GestureEventFilterResults
histogram.summary: Track whether a gesture event is allowed or filtered or deferred.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Metrics
histogram.summary: Tracks unusual CrOS touchpad operational states (e.g. running into the noisy ground issue). This is sampled at every touchpad event.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Sensitivity.Changed
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2013, replaced by Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Changed.
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting changes by the user.

histogram.name: Touchpad.Sensitivity.Started
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 6/2013, replaced by Touchpad.PointerSensitivity.Started.
histogram.summary: Tracks touchpad sensitivity setting on startup.

histogram.name: Touchscreen.TapDisambiguation
histogram.summary: How the user interacted with the tap disambiguation feature on Android.

histogram.name: TrackedObjects.GetRetiredOrCreateThreadData
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 09/2017. Code measured by this histogram no longer exists.
histogram.summary: Time spent in base::ThreadData::GetRetiredOrCreateThreadData(). This method is called at most once per thread, when its name is set, when it posts a task or when it runs a task (whichever comes first).

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.AmortizationDelay
histogram.summary: The amount of time spent waiting to perform an amortization run. This is logged at the end of each amortization run, before passing any DataUse objects to their respective callbacks.

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.BufferSizeOnFlush
histogram.summary: The number of DataUse objects processed in an amortization run.

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.ConcurrentTabs
histogram.summary: The number of unique tabs seen across all DataUse objects buffered for a single amortization run by the TrafficStatsAmortizer. This is recorded even if TrafficStats byte counts are unavailable, but not recorded if no DataUse objects have been buffered.

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.PostAmortizationRunDataUseBytes
histogram.summary: The total bytes after performing amortization across all DataUse objects buffered for a single amortization run by the TrafficStatsAmortizer. This is recorded even if TrafficStats byte counts are unavailable, but not recorded if no DataUse objects have been buffered.

histogram.name: TrafficStatsAmortizer.PreAmortizationRunDataUseBytes
histogram.summary: The total bytes before performing amortization across all DataUse objects buffered for a single amortization run by the TrafficStatsAmortizer. This is recorded even if TrafficStats byte counts are unavailable, but not recorded if no DataUse objects have been buffered.

histogram.name: Translate.CLD2.LanguageAccuracy
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2017, since cld2 is deprecated.
histogram.summary: Accuracy of the language detected by CLD2. Only recorded if the detection returned a "known" result.

histogram.name: Translate.CLD2.LanguageDetected
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2017, since cld2 is deprecated.
histogram.summary: Language of page detected by CLD2.

histogram.name: Translate.ForceTriggerBackoffStateReached
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 04/2020. No longer used for analysis.
histogram.summary: Whether or not the backoff threshold for triggering Translate on UI-language content is reached when the translation process is initiated.

histogram.name: Translate.InitiationStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 11/2013, and replaced by Translate.InitiationStatus.v2.
histogram.summary: The reason why Chrome decided to perform the next action (e.g., to show infobar, to translate a page without any prompting, and so on) when Chrome Translate is ready to translate a page.

histogram.name: Translate.LanguageDetectionConflict
histogram.summary:
This metric logs CLD3-detected languages for pages that specify a conflicting English language in their markup. In these cases, we must decide on a language source to favor.
Bucket names are of the form "x,y", where x is the common English language code specified in the page markup (or "other" if the English language code is uncommon), and y is the CLD3-detected language.
This histogram only logs detection conflicts. Hence, "matching" buckets (e.g. "en,en", "en-AU,en") will never be populated.

histogram.name: Translate.PageCaptured
histogram.summary: The time spent capturing plain text from the DOM. This is reported by ChromeRenderViewObserver when a page is loaded completely.

histogram.name: Translate.ServerReportedUnsupportedLanguage
histogram.summary: The number of times the detected language is not supported by Translate Element.

histogram.name: Translate.ShowBeforeTranslateInfobar
histogram.summary: The number of times an infobar proposing to translate a page has been shown.

histogram.name: Translate.ShowErrorInfobar
histogram.summary: Chrome Translate shows an error infobar when an error happens on translation and the infobar message depends on what kind of error happens. This metric counts how often each error message is shown.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.TimeInVerifiedOrigin
histogram.obsolete: Retired in M77 in favour of TrustedWebActivity.TimeInVerifiedOrigin.V2 which uses a more appropriate timescale.
histogram.summary: Time spent in a verified origin until navigating to an unverified one or pausing the Trusted Web Activity.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.TimeOutOfVerifiedOrigin
histogram.obsolete: Retired in M77 in favour of TrustedWebActivity.TimeOutOfVerifiedOrigin.V2 which uses a more appropriate timescale.
histogram.summary: Time spent out of verified origins until navigating back to a verified one or pausing the Trusted Web Activity.

histogram.name: TrustedWebActivity.TranslucencyRemovalFailed
histogram.summary: Records the cases when removing a Trusted Web Activity's translucency via a reflective call fails. Only "true" is recorded.

histogram.name: TryScroll.SlowScroll
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2016 in Issue 1741103002, and replaced by Renderer4.CompositorWheelScrollUpdateThread and Renderer4.CompositorTouchScrollUpdateThread.
histogram.summary: Whether a scroll is executed on main thread.

histogram.name: UI.CompositorResizeLock.Duration
histogram.summary: The amount of time the CompositorResizeLock was held in milliseconds. This is a measure of jank as UI will not generate new frames as long as the lock is held.

histogram.name: UI.CompositorResizeLock.TimedOut
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the CompositorResizeLock is being released due to timing out or not.

histogram.name: UI.WindowTreeHost.SurfaceSynchronizationDuration
histogram.summary: The amount of time it took for UI's CompositorFrame to activate due to a surface synchronization event. This a measure of jank as UI will not generate new frames as long synchronization is in progress. This metric is similar to UI.CompositorResizeLock.Duration but measures the new synchronization code path.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.SerializedCount
histogram.summary: Number of serialized UKM entries when storing a UKM log.

histogram.name: UKM.LogUploader.UploadSize
histogram.summary: Reports total upload length in bytes when the UKM service type is used.

histogram.name: UKM.Sources.SerializedCount
histogram.summary: Number of serialized UKM sources when storing a UKM log.

histogram.name: UKM.SyncDisable.Info
histogram.summary: Information about the determination by the UkmConsentStateObserver on why it enabled or disabled UKM.

histogram.name: UKM.SyncDisable.Purge
histogram.summary: Logged in the UpdateSyncState call from the UkmConsentStateObserver. This records if the UKM allowed change will trigger a purge of the local UKM data.

histogram.name: UKM.Upload.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: For each upload to the UKM server, log the response received from the server.

histogram.name: UMA.ClientIdMigrated
histogram.summary: Recorded when the one-time UMA client id reset was performed (and the client id of this user was migrated).

histogram.name: UMA.CollectExternalEventsTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of August 2015. The histogram showed no unexpected slowness, and a profiler is a better tool for identifying any future issues.
histogram.summary: The time to run the external metrics collection task (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UMA.ComputeCurrentSigninStatus
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Jun 2016. The histogram was added for debugging purpose and is not needed anymore.
histogram.summary: Records attempts to compute the current the signin status and error encountered when computing.

histogram.name: UMA.CreatePersistentHistogram.Result
histogram.obsolete: Removed April, 2018 as the information has never shown any problems.
histogram.summary: Records attempts to create histograms in presistent space and any errors encountered when doing so.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpAsyncTaskDuration
histogram.obsolete: No longer useful or monitored, removed 2020-01-06.
histogram.summary: Measures how much time it took to complete all async deferred startup tasks on the background thread. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpCompleteTime
histogram.obsolete: No longer useful or monitored, removed 2020-01-06.
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since application was first in foreground till all deferred tasks are done. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpDuration
histogram.obsolete: No longer useful or monitored, removed 2020-01-06.
histogram.summary: Measures how much time it took to complete deferred startup tasks on the UI thread. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpDurationAsync
histogram.summary: Measures how much time it took to complete async deferred startup tasks on the background thread. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUpMaxTaskDuration
histogram.obsolete: No longer useful or monitored, removed 2020-01-06.
histogram.summary: Measures the maximum amount of time a single deferred startup task took.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUptime
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since start up it took for onDeferredStartup() to be called, which schedules enablePotentialCrashUploading() to be executed on an async task. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.DeferredStartUptime2
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since application was first in foreground till deferred tasks are initialized and queued on the idle handler. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.PostDeferredStartUptime
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since start up it took before ChromeActivity's postDeferredStartupIfNeeded() was called. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.PostDeferredStartUptime2
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since application was first in foreground till ChromeActivity's postDeferredStartupIfNeeded() was called exactly once. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.Uptime
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since start up it took before crash reporting was enabled via enablePotentialCrashUploading() as part of deferred start up. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.Uptime2
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since start up it took before crash reporting was enabled via enablePotentialCrashUploading() as part of deferred start up. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Debug.EnableCrashUpload.Uptime3
histogram.summary: Measures how much time since application was first in foreground till crash reporting was enabled as part of deferred start up. Only logged on Android.

histogram.name: UMA.Discarded Log Events
histogram.summary: The number of events that would be discarded at log transmission time because the event count was already too large. Note that this doesn't measure actual discards - in case the UMAThrottleEvents feature is disabled, the discards won't occur.

histogram.name: UMA.FieldTrialAllocator.Size
histogram.summary: Size, before padding, of objects allocated from persistent memory in the browser process for field trials. Updated on each subprocess launch.

histogram.name: UMA.FieldTrialsEnabledBenchmarking
histogram.summary: Log whether the --enable-benchmarking flag was set, which causes field trials to only use the default group.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.DeletedFiles
histogram.obsolete: Removed April, 2018 as the information it provides is no longer useful.
histogram.summary: The number of old metrics files for which a delete was attempted. This is logged once with each upload operation. Values greater than 1 indicate that the files are not deletable by the browser and must be cleaned up by whatever process is creating them.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.DirectoryFiles
histogram.obsolete: Removed April, 2018 as no problems were ever indicated.
histogram.summary: The number of metrics files in a directory that need to be uploaded. This is logged once with each upload operation.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.EmbeddedProfile.DroppedFileAge
histogram.summary: Records the last-modified age of a file that was dropped for lack of an embedded profile.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.EmbeddedProfile.DroppedHistogramCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/04 with the resolution of https://crbug.com/695880
histogram.summary: Records the number of histograms present in a file that was dropped for lack of an embedded profile.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.EmbeddedProfile.RecordTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/04 as times are small, consistent, and now on a background thread.
histogram.summary: Tracks the time used to record all histograms from a file with an embedded profile.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.EmbeddedProfileResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/04 with the resolution of https://crbug.com/695880
histogram.summary: Records attempts to upload metrics from files with embedded system profiles. Counts are not necessarily mutually exclusive.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.Happening
histogram.obsolete: This metrics was to provide information for crbug/760317 which has been resolved. Removed February, 2018.
histogram.summary: Records various happenings within the FileMetricsProvider for debugging purposes.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialCheckTime.File
histogram.obsolete: Access times are consistently on the order of a few ms. Removed 2019/06.
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent checking and mapping an initial metrics file on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialCheckTime.Total
histogram.obsolete: Removed April, 2018 as the information it provides is no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent checking and mapping initial metrics from all files on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialSnapshotTime.File
histogram.obsolete: Access times are consistently on the order of a few ms. Removed 2019/06.
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent collecting initial stability metrics from a file on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.InitialSnapshotTime.Total
histogram.obsolete: Removed April, 2018 as the information it provides is no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent collecting initial stability metrics from all files on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.SnapshotTime.File
histogram.obsolete: Access times are consistently on the order of a few ms. Removed 2019/06.
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent collecting metrics from a file on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.FileMetricsProvider.SnapshotTime.Total
histogram.obsolete: Removed April, 2018 as the information it provides is no longer useful.
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent collecting metrics from all files on disk.

histogram.name: UMA.GeneratedLowEntropySource
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of August 2015. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: For each attempt to generate the low entropy source, log whether or not the load required generating a new low entropy source.

histogram.name: UMA.Histograms.Activity
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of October 2017. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Type and flags of every histogram created plus other activities. Counts are not mutually-exclusive except for the different types.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.DroppedSampleCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-03-18. Renamed to UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.DroppedHistogramSampleCount and reports also histogram samples dropped due to a limit of the number of cached histograms.
histogram.summary: Number of histogram samples that were not recorded when flushing due to a per-histogram sample count limit in the Java in-memory cache.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.FullHistogramCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-03-18 to reduce the number of histograms emitted by the cache.
histogram.summary: Number of histograms for which not all samples may have been recorded when flushing the Java in-memory cache due to a per-histogram sample count limit.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.HistogramLimitDroppedSampleCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-03-18 to reduce the number of histograms emitted by the cache. UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.DroppedHistogramSampleCount includes histogram samples that were reported in this histogram.
histogram.summary: Number of samples that were not recorded when flushing the Java in-memory cache due to a histogram count limit.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.InputSampleCount
histogram.summary: Number of histogram samples seen by the time the Java in-memory cache was flushed. This is a sum of DroppedSampleCount and FlushedHistogramCount.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.RemainingHistogramLimit
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-03-18 to reduce the number of histograms emitted by the cache.
histogram.summary: The remaining histogram count limit when flushing in the Java in-memory cache.

histogram.name: UMA.JavaCachingRecorder.RemainingSampleLimit
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-03-18 to reduce the number of histograms emitted by the cache.
histogram.summary: The smallest remaining sample count limit in metrics flushed from the Java in-memory cache.

histogram.name: UMA.Large Accumulated Log Not Persisted
histogram.summary: Number of bytes in an excessively large log that was discarded at shutdown instead of being saved to disk to retry during next chrome run.

histogram.name: UMA.Large Rejected Log was Discarded
histogram.summary: Number of bytes in a log was was rejected by server, and then discarded.

histogram.name: UMA.LoadLogsTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of August 2015. The histograms showed no unexpected slowness, and a profiler is a better tool for identifying any future issues.
histogram.summary: The time spent to load (de-serialize) unsent logs from local state, recorded during the MetricsService startup sequence.

histogram.name: UMA.LogLoadComplete called
histogram.summary: Simple counter of the number of times LogLoadComplete was called (bug demonstration, as we're called more often than once per page load :-/ )

histogram.name: UMA.LogUpload.ConnetionType
histogram.obsolete: Used for analyzing UMA log uploads on cellular connection, but necessary after the analysis is finished.
histogram.summary: The network connection type for each successful metrics log upload.

histogram.name: UMA.LogUploader.UploadSize
histogram.summary: Reports total upload length in bytes when the UMA service type is used.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsService.DeletedDirectorySize.Failure
histogram.obsolete: This metrics was to provide information for crbug/760317 which has been resolved. Removed February, 2018.
histogram.summary: Records the size of the metrics directory size, after failing to be deleted. This is a temporary metric that will be removed in M63 or M64.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsService.DeletedDirectorySize.Success
histogram.obsolete: This metrics was to provide information for crbug/760317 which has been resolved. Removed February, 2018.
histogram.summary: Records the size of the metrics directory size, after being successfully deleted. This should always be zero unless there is a bug in the return code. This is a temporary metric that will be removed in M63 or M64.

histogram.name: UMA.MetricsService.RecordCurrentHistograms.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed February, 2018 because persistent metrics are fully launched with no observable change in operation time.
histogram.summary: Records how much wall time was spent merging, taking snapshots, and recording histograms for reporting to UMA.

histogram.name: UMA.Perf.GetData
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2019 in b/110205489 being split into ChromeOS.CWP.CollectPerf and ChromeOS.CWP.UploadPerf.
histogram.summary: A count of successes and various failure modes related to collecting and processing performance data obtained through "perf" on Chrome OS.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentAllocator.Allocs
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2/2017 for Issue 689315 which indicated they weren't being used.
histogram.summary: Size, before padding, of objects allocated from persistent memory. This is updated with every allocation.

histogram.name: UMA.PersistentHistograms.TmpRemovals
histogram.obsolete: Data showed many files being deleted during rollout and then tapering off to near zero. Removed 2019/07.
histogram.summary: Number of old .tmp files of the kind that Windows creates and leaves around when trying to rename a file to another one that already exists. See https://crbug.com/934164

histogram.name: UMA.ProfilesCount.AfterErase
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Jun 2016. The histogram was added for debugging purpose and is not needed anymore.
histogram.summary: Record the number of loaded profiles when a profile is erased from the profiles map kept by profile manager.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoGzipped
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Sep, 2013. Gzipping protobufs is now the default.
histogram.summary: Was the UMA protobuf uploaded earlier compressed or not.

histogram.name: UMA.ProtoGzippedKBSaved
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of August 2015. See UMA.ProtoCompressionRatio instead.
histogram.summary: Kilobytes saved from gzipping the protobufs before uploading them.

histogram.name: UMA.StoreLogsTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of August 2015. The histograms showed no unexpected slowness, and a profiler is a better tool for identifying any future issues.
histogram.summary: The time spent to store unsent logs to local state, which is done periodically and also during start up if there was an initial stability log.

histogram.name: UMA.SubprocessMetricsProvider.SubprocessCount
histogram.summary: The number of subprocesses from which persistent metrics were collected, logged once with every reporting cycle.

histogram.name: UMA.SubprocessMetricsProvider.UntrackedProcesses
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/06 after not reporting anything in years.
histogram.summary: The number of subprocesses, by type, from which persistent metrics are NOT collected because there is no information about this (likely new) process type. Process numbers 1000 or greater are "custom" processes used by embedders.

histogram.name: UMA.SyntheticTrials.Count
histogram.summary: The number of synthetic field trials added to the UMA log when the system profile is recorded. Since this is done prior to capturing the histograms from the current process, this will generally be logged once per UMA log.

histogram.name: UMA.Unacceptable_Log_Discarded
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of May, 2012 (i.e. Chrome 21+). Replaced by the UMA.UploadResponseStatus.XML and UMA.UploadResponseStatus.Protobuf histograms.
histogram.summary:
The server returned a 400 code, and we discarded a log.
This tends to indicate that a syntax error is present in a log, such as would appear when a bogus XML tag is included, or the XML is not balanced and well structured.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadCreation
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of August 2015. This failure case no longer exists.
histogram.summary: For each attempted UMA upload, log whether the upload was successfully constructed. An upload might fail to be constructed, for example, if we try to upload before the system is fully initialized; or if serialization of the data fails.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadResponseStatus.Protobuf
histogram.summary: For each upload to the protocol buffer (v2) UMA server, log whether the upload was successful, or whether there was an error.

histogram.name: UMA.UploadResponseStatus.XML
histogram.summary: For each upload to the XML (v1) UMA server, log whether the upload was successful, or whether there was an error.

histogram.name: UMA.UsedResetVariationsFlag
histogram.summary: Log whether the --reset-variation-state flag was set before the low entropy source was requested.

histogram.name: UMA.XMLNodeDumpTime
histogram.summary: The time spent in converting the XML tree into a character buffer when closing a metrics log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UMA.XMLWriterDestructionTime
histogram.summary: The time spent in freeing the XML writer and tree when closing a metrics log (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.ConsentBump.Action
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018/11, because the consent bump was removed.
histogram.summary: The action the user takes when the unified consent bump is shown.

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.ConsentBump.EligibleAtStartup
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018/11, because the consent bump was removed.
histogram.summary: Boolean indicating whether the user is eligible for seeing the consent bump. This metric is recorded at every startup when Unified Consent is enabled. Note: There can be multiple entries per user.

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.ConsentBump.SuppressReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018/11, because the consent bump was removed.
histogram.summary: The reason the consent bump isn't shown to the user. This is recorded at startup during the migration to Unified Consent.

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.RevokeReason
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2018/11 because it's no longer necessary.
histogram.summary: The reason the unified consent was revoked. This is recorded every time the consent state changes from "unified consent given" to "unified consent not given".

histogram.name: UnifiedConsent.SyncAndGoogleServicesSettings
histogram.obsolete: Renamed as UnifiedConsent.MakeSearchesAndBrowsingBetter.OnStartup in 01/2020 because today the UnifiedConsent service only manages the Make Searches and Browsing better feature.
histogram.summary: State of the user settings for Sync and Google services, recorded at startup. Multiple samples may be recorded at once, except for 'None' which is recorded when no other bucket is used.

histogram.name: Uptime.ProcessesTerminatedToXTerminatedAfterLogout
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2018 in Issue 721891 with removal of X11. Replaced by Uptime.OtherProcessesTerminatedToChromeExecAfterLogout in ChromeOS M69. Equal to 0 since at least ChromeOS M62.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when all user-associated processes (including the X server) have been terminated during the logout process. This statistic is not collected if the logout is part of a restart or shutdown.

histogram.name: Uptime.XTerminatedToChromeExecAfterLogout
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Uptime.OtherProcessesTerminatedToChromeExecAfterLogout in ChromeOS M69. Equivalent to the new name since at least ChromeOS M62.
histogram.summary: Measures the time elapsed on Chrome OS between when the X server has been terminated from a previous logout and when Chrome is started again to show the login screen.

histogram.name: URLBlacklistManager.ConstructorBuildTime
histogram.obsolete: Served its purpose; deprecated 9/2018 in M71 (https://crbug.com/827173).
histogram.summary: The time it took to build and set the URL blacklist on the main thread within URLBlacklistManager's constructor.

histogram.name: UrlFetcher.StringResponseSize
histogram.summary: Size (in kilobytes) of response bodies retrieved as strings from URLFetcher.

histogram.name: UserActivation.AvailabilityCheck.FrameResult
histogram.obsolete: This was added to assess possible impact of UserActivationV2, by comparing pre- and post-launch stats.
histogram.summary: Outcomes (success/failure) of transient user activation availability check attempts for each type of caller frame (null, ancestor, descedant, other).

histogram.name: UserActivation.Consumption.FrameResult
histogram.obsolete: This was added to assess possible impact of UserActivationV2, by comparing pre- and post-launch stats.
histogram.summary: Outcomes (success/failure) of user activation consumption attempts for each type of caller frame (null, ancestor, descedant, other).

histogram.name: UserCert.ContentDisposition
histogram.summary: Distribution of Content-Disposition headers sent with x-x509-user-cert content types.

histogram.name: UserImage.ChangeChoice
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images that users choose in Change Picture dialog (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user changes picture.

histogram.name: UserImage.FirstTimeChoice
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85. The OOBE user image screen is long gone.
histogram.summary: Distribution of the default images chosen on user image screen during out-of-the-box experience (Chrome OS). One sample is taken each time the user confirms the choice by clicking OK button.

histogram.name: UserImage.ProfileDownloadResult
histogram.summary: Profile image download result for UserManager (either on behalf of the Change Picture prefs page, OOBE or scheduled refresh after user login).

histogram.name: UserImage.ScreenIsShownTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85. The OOBE user image screen is long gone.
histogram.summary: Time histogram of the "Choose Picture" OOBE screen display delay.

histogram.name: UserInterfaceStyle.ChangedWhileActive
histogram.obsolete: Removed. Chrome can't listen to changes in the background, these are delayed until the app becomes active again. Use UserInterfaceStyle.CurrentlyUsed instead.
histogram.summary: [iOS] Used on iOS 13+ to report the changes to Light and Dark mode. This is logged when the interface style changes and Chrome is active. Can be caused by the system automatic switch or by the user manually changing the style.

histogram.name: UserSessionManager.UserPodsDisplay
histogram.summary: Whether the user pods were enabled during login, and what could disable them.

histogram.name: V8.ArrayBufferBigAllocations
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2017 in Issue 704922. Replaced by V8.ArrayBufferLargeAllocations.
histogram.summary: Number of bytes requested in an array buffer allocation.

histogram.name: V8.AsmModuleSizeBytes
histogram.summary: Size of asm.js module (in asm.js format).

histogram.name: V8.AsmWasmTranslationMicroSeconds
histogram.summary:
Time to convert asm.js code to WebAssembly.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: V8.AsmWasmTranslationThroughput
histogram.summary: Throughput of translation of asm.js code to WebAssembly in MB/s.

histogram.name: V8.ASTOptimization
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.CodeCreation
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.CodeGeneration
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: Time spent generating native code for functions.

histogram.name: V8.CodegenFractionCrankshaft
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total generated code which was generated using the Crankshaft optimizing compiler, after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.Compile
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 compiler (full codegen).

histogram.name: V8.CompileDeserialize
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileDeserializeMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent deseriailzing code, used by V8 code caching.

histogram.name: V8.CompileEval
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileEvalMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 compiler (full codegen) for eval.

histogram.name: V8.CompileHeuristicsDecision
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileTime.CacheBehaviour.
histogram.summary: V8 script compile function variant which was picked. This contains information such as {if,why} v8 {code,parser} was {produced,consumed,bypassed}.

histogram.name: V8.CompileInlineScriptMicroSeconds
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileTimeMicroSeconds.NoCache.InlineScript.
histogram.summary: Time spent compiling an inline script.

histogram.name: V8.CompileLazy
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileLazyMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent compiling functions lazily on first run.

histogram.name: V8.CompileNoncacheableMicroSeconds
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by the subcategories of V8.CompileTimeMicroSeconds.NoCache
histogram.summary: Time spent compiling a script that cannot be subject to caching.

histogram.name: V8.CompileScript
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileScriptMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary:
Total time spent in compiling a script (incl. parsing/caching).
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: V8.CompileSerialize
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.CompileSerializeMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent serializing code, used by V8 code caching.

histogram.name: V8.DeferredCodeGeneration
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8
histogram.summary: Time spent generating deferred code stubs.

histogram.name: V8.DetachedContextAgeInGC
histogram.summary: Number of garbage collections that a detached global context survives, recorded after each major garbage collection. Values greater than 7 indicate a memory leak.

histogram.name: V8.ExecutableMemoryMax
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8
histogram.summary: The maximum memory used to store V8 compiled code on a given process.

histogram.name: V8.GC.ParallelTaskLatencyMicroSeconds
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Feb 2019. No longer tracked in V8.
histogram.summary:
Latency (post-to-schedule) of each parallel task posted during V8 garbage collection.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: V8.GCContext
histogram.obsolete: Removed in April 2020. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Time spent doing a full GC during an IdleNotification.

histogram.name: V8.GCIdleNotification
histogram.obsolete: Removed in April 2020. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Time spent in IdleNotifications.

histogram.name: V8.GCIdleTimeAllottedInMS
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2017. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Idle time passed to V8 via IdleNotifications.

histogram.name: V8.GCIdleTimeLimit.Overshot
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2017. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Milliseconds the idle time limit was overshot by the IdleNotification.

histogram.name: V8.GCIdleTimeLimit.Undershot
histogram.obsolete: Removed in August 2017. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Milliseconds the idle time limit was undershot by the IdleNotification.

histogram.name: V8.GCLowMemoryNotification
histogram.obsolete: Removed in April 2020. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Time spent in LowMemoryNotifications.

histogram.name: V8.GCYoungGenerationHandling
histogram.obsolete: Removed in April 2020. No longer tracked.
histogram.summary: Type of garbage collection strategy used to collect the young generation.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationCellSpace
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldSpace.
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the cell space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldDataSpace
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldSpace.
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the old data space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldPointerSpace
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.MemoryExternalFragmentationOldSpace.
histogram.summary: External memory fragmentation in the old pointer space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapCommitted
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by Memory.Experimental.Renderer2.V8.
histogram.summary: The committed memory used by V8 in KB averaged over time, logged before each GC.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionCellSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the cell space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionCodeSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the code space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionLoSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the lo space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionMapSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the map space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionNewSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the new space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldDataSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the old data space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldPointerSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the old pointer space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapFractionOldSpace
histogram.summary: Fraction of the total heap used by the old space after each GC in percent.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapSampleCellSpaceCommitted
histogram.summary: The size of committed memory in the cell space after each GC in KB.

histogram.name: V8.MemoryHeapUsed
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by Memory.Experimental.Renderer2.V8.AllocatedObjects.
histogram.summary: The live memory used by V8 in KB averaged over time, logged before each GC.

histogram.name: V8.Parse
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.ParseMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 parser.

histogram.name: V8.ParseLazy
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.ParseLazyMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent parsing functions when they are lazily compiled on first run.

histogram.name: V8.ParseLazyMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent parsing functions when they are lazily compiled on first run.

histogram.name: V8.ParseMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent in V8 parser.

histogram.name: V8.PreParse
histogram.obsolete: This histogram has been replaced by V8.PreParseMicroSeconds.
histogram.summary: Time spent preparsing source code.

histogram.name: V8.PreParseMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time spent preparsing source code.

histogram.name: V8.Rewriting
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: Time spent on rewriting ASTs before compilation.

histogram.name: V8.RSetLO
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.RSetPaged
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.ScriptCache
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: The generation a compiled script was found in the compilation cache.

histogram.name: V8.UsageAnalysis
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: Time spent analysing the usage of variables.

histogram.name: V8.VariableAllocation
histogram.obsolete: This histogram is no longer present in V8.
histogram.summary: TBD

histogram.name: V8.WasmCodeGCTime
histogram.summary: Time to execute a single WebAssembly code GC, measured from when it is triggered until all isolates reported live code and all dead code was freed. Recorded after each WebAssembly code GC if a high-resolution clock is available.

histogram.name: V8.WasmDecodeFunctionMicroSeconds
histogram.summary:
Time to decode a WebAssembly function. Recorded on each validation of a WebAssembly function.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: V8.WasmDecodeModuleMicroSeconds
histogram.summary:
Time to decode a WebAssembly module. Recorded for each WebAssembly module which is decoded for validation, compilation, or deserialization.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: V8.WasmDecodeModulePeakMemoryBytes
histogram.summary: Peak memory used to decode a WebAssembly module. Recorded for each WebAssembly module which is decoded for validation, compilation, or deserialization.

histogram.name: V8.WasmDeserializeModuleStreamingMicroSeconds
histogram.summary: Time to deserialize a WebAssembly module during streaming compilation (via the 'WebAssembly.compileStreaming' API). Recorded on each streaming WebAssembly deserialization from the code cache, but only if a high-resolution clock is available. Note that compilation speed is often limited by the network speed, which is also reflected in thie metric.

histogram.name: V8.WasmExecutionTimeMicroSeconds
histogram.summary:
Time spent executing WebAssembly.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: V8.WasmLazyCompilationMicroSeconds
histogram.summary:
Time for lazy compilation of WebAssembly functions. This is recorded per function for the functions that are lazily compiled.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: V8.WasmLazyCompilationThroughput
histogram.summary: Throughput of compilation of lazily compiled WebAssembly functions in KB/s (size of function in wasm format divided by time to compile it). This is recorded per function for functions that are lazily compiled.

histogram.name: V8.WasmModuleCodeSizeFreed
histogram.summary: The amount of WebAssembly code freed by garbage collection, in MiB. Recorded for each live module after each full GC.

histogram.name: Variations.DisabledNoEntropyProvider
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times we hit the code where a field trial is disabled because no entropy provider was provided.

histogram.name: Variations.DownloadJobFetchTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2020. Replaced by Variations.WebViewDownloadJobFetchTime2, which has a higher maximum bucket.
histogram.summary: The duration of the network request to downloads a new WebView variations seed from the variations server to the central on-device service.

histogram.name: Variations.FailedRequestErrorCode
histogram.summary: The counts of network error codes encountered by VariationsService when an attempt to fetch a variations seed from the server fails.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchNotModifiedLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in a not modified response.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchOtherLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in neither a success nor not modified response.

histogram.name: Variations.FetchSuccessLatency
histogram.summary: The latency of a VariationsService seed fetch that results in a success response.

histogram.name: Variations.GoogleUpdateRegistryLabelsNeedClearing
histogram.summary: If the registry value for Google Update experiment labels contains Variations experiments, and therefore needs to have them cleared. This will be recorderd once per sessions, right before attempting to clear the value.

histogram.name: Variations.HeaderConstructionTime
histogram.summary:
How long it took to create the X-Client-Data header.
Warning: This metric may include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). Such reports will cause this metric to have an abnormal distribution. When considering revising this histogram, see UMA_HISTOGRAM_CUSTOM_MICROSECONDS_TIMES for the solution.

histogram.name: Variations.NetworkAvailability
histogram.summary: Whether or not the network was available when requested by the VariationsService.

histogram.name: Variations.RestartsWithStaleSeed
histogram.summary: Number of consecutive times WebView started up with a stale seed. Only written by WebView, when its loaded seed is fresh after previously being stale. Note that this means it won't be written for WebViews that are never able to get a fresh seed, or ones that consistently have a fresh seed.

histogram.name: Variations.SafeMode.FellBackToSafeMode
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of M66 / Jan 2018. Replaced by Variations.SafeMode.FellBackToSafeMode2.
histogram.summary:
Whether or not the VariationsService /would/ fall back to Safe Mode, due to either too many crashes or too many failures to fetch a new seed, given some initial/unrefined heuristics. Recorded during Chrome startup, when the VariationsService is created.
This metric was only reported before Safe Mode was actually implemented, as a sanity-check for the forthcoming implementation.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateSkew.BuildTimeAheadBy
histogram.summary: Logged on startup when creating field trials from the variations seed if the build time is ahead of or within 24 hours of the kVariationsSeedDate. Used as an experiment to see whether the build time could be used to discard very old seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateSkew.BuildTimeBehindBy
histogram.summary: Logged on startup when creating field trials from the variations seed if the build time is behind the kVariationsSeedDate by a day or more. Used as an experiment to see whether the build time could be used to discard very old seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateSkew.SystemClockAheadBy
histogram.summary: Logged on startup when creating field trials from the variations seed if the system clock is ahead of or within 24 hours of the kVariationsSeedDate. Used as an experiment to see whether the system clock could be used to discard very old seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedDateSkew.SystemClockBehindBy
histogram.summary: Logged on startup when creating field trials from the variations seed if the system clock is behind the kVariationsSeedDate by a day or more. Used as an experiment to see whether the system clock could be used to discard very old seeds.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedEmpty
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M61, and replaced by Variations.SeedLoadResult. This histogram incorrectly conflated failures from loading the seed with failures while attempting to store seeds with delta compression.
histogram.summary: Records whether the variations seed was successfully read from local state on startup. Records a detailed reason on read failure.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedFetchResponseCode
histogram.summary: The counts of HTTP response codes encountered by VariationsService when attempting to fetch a variations seed from the server.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedLoadSuccessTime
histogram.summary: Records the time spent loading the variations seed in WebView, specifically, the time to call VariationsUtils.readSeedFile(). This is logged once per WebView startup, and is only logged if loading was successful.

histogram.name: Variations.SeedLoadWouldBlockTime
histogram.summary: Records how long we would block WebView startup to wait for the variations seed if there were no timeout. This is measured from when we start blocking until when the FutureTask which loads the seed finishes. The FutureTask may finish before we block at all, in which case this will be 0. This is logged once per WebView startup, whether or not loading was successful.

histogram.name: Variations.ServerStudyExpiredUniformity1Percent
histogram.summary: Whether or not the 1-Percent uniformity trial from the Variations server was expired when loaded.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.DeltaSize
histogram.summary: On successful save of a delta-compressed variations seed, records the size of the delta in KiB.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.DeltaSize.ReductionPercent
histogram.summary: On successful save of a delta-compressed variations seed, records the size of the delta as a percentage of the decoded seed size.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.GzipSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of the gzip-compressed variations seed in KiB.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.GzipSize.ReductionPercent
histogram.summary: Records the size of the gzip-compressed variations seed as a percentage of the decoded seed size. Note that variations seed could be first delta-compressed and then gzip-compressed. In this case we record gzip-compressed seed size as a percentage of the delta-compressed seed size.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.HasCountry
histogram.summary: Records whether a country code was present when storing the variations seed.

histogram.name: Variations.StoreSeed.Size
histogram.summary: On successful save of a non-delta-compressed variations seed, records the size of the received seed in KiB.

histogram.name: Variations.UniformityTrialExpired
histogram.summary: A count of the number of times we hit the code where the UMA-Uniformity-Trial-1-Percent field trial is disabled as a result of the expiration check.

histogram.name: Variations.UniformityTrialGroupNotActive
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the UMA-Uniformity-Trial-1-Percent field trial was not active and which factors contributed to it.

histogram.name: Viewport.OverviewZoom
histogram.summary: The screen width as a percentage of viewport width (i.e. zoom at which we can see the whole page). Only recorded on Android and for viewport meta tags with constant width.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.ControllerStateTransitionIsValid
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019/6 because it's equivalent to VirtualKeyboard. ControllerStateTransition.
histogram.summary: Validity of a state transtion. This is equivalent to the positiveness of VirtualKeyboard.ControllerStateTransition.

histogram.name: VirtualKeyboard.KeystrokesBetweenBackspace
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2016 as doesn't have data nor owner.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of keys typed by the virtual keyboard between each backspace. This metric provides a rough approximation of an error rate for the virtual keyboard.

histogram.name: Viz.DisplayCompositor.SurfaceEmbeddingTime
histogram.obsolete: This previously reported a latency metric for Viz on all platforms. This has been replaced by improved tracing and Graphics.Smoothness metrics. Marked obsolete in M87.
histogram.summary: Records the delta from when a viz::LocalSurfaceId was allocated, to the time where it is first embedded by the Viz Service.

histogram.name: VoiceInteraction.OpenDuration
histogram.obsolete: Previously recorded for CrOS, but is no longer used. Marked obsolete in M86.
histogram.summary: Records the time between a voice interaction session start and end.

histogram.name: VR.Component.Assets.DurationUntilReady.OnChromeStart
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2018 in issue 799074. VR.Component.Assets.DurationUntilReady.OnRegisterComponent measures the intended metric more accurately.
histogram.summary: Duration from starting Chrome until VR assets component is ready to use.

histogram.name: VR.Component.Assets.DurationUntilReady.OnEnter
histogram.summary: Duration from entering a VR mode until the VR assets component is ready to use.

histogram.name: VR.Component.Assets.DurationUntilReady.OnRegisterComponent
histogram.summary: Duration from registering VR assets component until it is ready to use.

histogram.name: VR.Component.Assets.Status.OnEnter
histogram.summary: Status of the VR assets component when entering a VR mode.

histogram.name: VR.Component.Assets.VersionAndStatus.OnLoad
histogram.summary: The component version and status of loading the VR assets. The value is encoded as (XXX)(YYY)(SSS) where XXX is the major component version, YYY the minor component version and SSS the status. See //chrome/browser/vr/assets_load_status.h for possible status values.

histogram.name: VR.Component.Assets.VersionAndStatus.OnUpdate
