histogram.summary: The version and update status of the VR assets component. The value is encoded as (XXX)(YYY)(SSS) where XXX is the major version, YYY the minor version and SSS the status. See //chrome/browser/vr/assets_component_update_status.h for possible status values.

histogram.name: VR.EnterVrBrowserWithoutFeatureModule
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a user tries to enter the VR browser without the VR feature module installed. Is success if the user could enter the VR browser nonetheless. Is failure if entering the VR browser was blocked (on smartphone VR) or started in 2D-in-VR mode (on standalones).

histogram.name: VR.NetworkConnectionType.OnEnter
histogram.summary: Network connection type when entering a VR mode.

histogram.name: VR.NetworkConnectionType.OnRegisterComponent
histogram.summary: Network connection type when registering the VR component(s).

histogram.name: VR.Session.VoiceSearch.StartedCount
histogram.summary: Number of times voice search is started in a single VR session. Recorded when a new disjoint session has begun or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VR.Shell.EncounteredSuppressedUI
histogram.summary: We must suppress monocularly rendered ui elements in VR. This records which ui element suppressions are encountered in practice.

histogram.name: VR.Shell.EncounteredUnsupportedMode
histogram.summary: We must exit VR mode when browsing in certain situations. This records which situations are encountered in practice.

histogram.name: VR.VoiceSearch.EndState
histogram.summary: The end state of a voice search request in VR.

histogram.name: VR.VoiceSearch.RecordAudioOsPermissionPromptChoice
histogram.summary: Chrome shows a prompt when the OS's record audio permission is needed for voice search. The prompt gives user two choices: CANCEL or CONTINUE. This records the user's selection.

histogram.name: VRAutopresentedWebVR
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2019, VR DLAs are no longer supported.
histogram.summary: Whether we're auto-presenting the first time we enter WebVR mode.

histogram.name: VRDisplayPresentResult
histogram.obsolete: As of 5/18/2020 this appears to no longer be logged.
histogram.summary: The result of calls to VRDisplay::requestPresent(). Reported twice per requestPresent() call, once to record the call, and once to record the result.

histogram.name: VRRuntimeVersion
histogram.summary: The version of the runtime being used for VR.

histogram.name: VRSessionNavigationCount
histogram.summary: Count of navigations while in a VR session. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: VRSessionTimeFromDLA
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 02/2019, VR DLAs are no longer supported.
histogram.summary: The duration of a single VR session initiated via a deep-linked WebVR app. Logged when a new disjoint session has begun, or when the session has ended in a non-continuable way.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.AcceptLegalDocuments
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's accept legal document API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.AuthenticateInstrument
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's authenticate instrument API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.GetFullWallet
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's get full wallet API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.GetWalletItems
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's get wallet items API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveAddress
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save address API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveInstrument
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save instrument API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveInstrumentAndAddress
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save instument and address API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's save to wallet API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SendStatus
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's send status API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.UnknownApiCall
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's unknown API calls.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.UpdateAddress
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's update address API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.ApiCallDuration.UpdateInstrument
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2013, replaced by Wallet.ApiCallDuration.SaveToWallet.
histogram.summary: Measures the time taken by Google Online Wallet server's update instument API call.

histogram.name: Wallet.MalformedResponse
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each Wallet API failed due to being unable to parse the response.

histogram.name: Wallet.ResponseCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes seen by Wallet client.

histogram.name: Web.CertVerifyAgreement
histogram.obsolete: Removed 08/2016 because CertVerifier is not used for web view cert verification.
histogram.summary: [iOS] Reports certificate verification mismatch between SecTrust API and CertVerifier. SecTrust API is used for making load/no-load decision and CertVerifier is used for getting the reason of verification failure. It is expected that mismatches will happen for those 2 approaches (e.g. SecTrust API considers cert as good, but CertVerifier considers same cert as bad). This metric helps to understand how common mismatches are.

histogram.name: Web.CurrentURLEqualsLastCommittedURL
histogram.summary: [iOS] Reports URL matches between the return value from the WebState's GetLastCommittedURL and GetCurrentURL methods. It is expected the values will be equal to confirm that GetCurrentURL can now be replaced with GetLastCommittedURL. This will be called each time WebStateImpl:: GetCurrentURL(URLVerificationTrustLevel* trust_level) is called, which is an old method of obtaining the url and trust level. The trust level was only relevant with UIWebView, so this method is only called from code which has not yet been updated since UIWebView was removed.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.AvailableSpace.Success
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-09. As of M64, this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the available space that can be used when installing a WebAPK from Google Play succeeds. The space recorded is the available space beyond the system's minimum free space threshold, with a range between -1000 and 1000 MB. Negative values mean that there is less free space available than the system's minimum, by the given amount.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.AvailableSpaceAfterFreeUpAll.Fail
histogram.summary: Records the available space that can be used when installing a WebAPK from Google Play fails after freeing up cache and unimportant storage. The space recorded is the available space beyond the system's minimum free space threshold, with a range between -1000 and 1000 MB. Negative values mean that there is less free space available than the system's minimum, by the given amount.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.AvailableSpaceAfterFreeUpUnimportantStorage.Fail
histogram.summary: Records the available space that can be used when installing a WebAPK from Google Play fails after freeing up unimportant storage. The space recorded is the available space beyond the system's minimum free space threshold, with a range between -1000 and 1000 MB. Negative values mean that there is less free space available than the system's minimum, by the given amount.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.ChromeCacheSize.Fail
histogram.summary: Records the Chrome cache size when installing a WebAPK from Google Play fails, with a range between 0 and 1000, rounded to the nearest 10MB.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.ChromeUnimportantStorage.Fail
histogram.summary: Records the Chrome unimportant storage size when installing a WebAPK from Google Play fails, with a range between 0 and 1000, rounded to the nearest 10MB.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.GooglePlayBindDuration
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time that it takes to bind to the play install service for WebAPK installs.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.GooglePlayInstallState
histogram.summary: On web app and WebAPK installation, records whether a WebAPK could be installed via the Google Play flow. If not, records why the WebAPK could not be installed via the Google Play flow (and a web app was added to the homescreen instead). Warning: This metric is recorded whenever a site is added to the homescreeen as a web app, not just for sites with a WebAPK compatible Web Manifest.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InfoBarShown
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-08. As of M62, this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: WebAPKs are PWAs wrapped in an Android apk, installed from an app banner or the add to homescreen menu item. This stat tracks whether the installation is triggered by an app banner or by the add to homescreen menu.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.InstallSource
histogram.obsolete: No longer recorded as of M65.
histogram.summary: WebAPKs are PWAs wrapped in an Android apk, installed from an app banner or the add to homescreen menu item. If the installation is via an app banner, user could either accept to install or dismiss the infobar; while via the add to homescreen menu, the installation will start automatically. This stat tracks the ways that user accepts to install a WebAPK.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.SpaceStatus
histogram.summary: Whether there is enough space to install a WebAPK. Recorded on each attempt to install a WebAPK.

histogram.name: WebApk.Install.UserAction
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-08. As of M62, this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: WebAPKs are PWAs wrapped in an Android apk, installed from an app banner or the add to homescreen menu item. If the user clicks the add to homescreen menu, and a WebAPK has been installed before, an infobar with an open button will show. The open button will also show on the infobar after a successful installation. This stat tracks whether user clicks the open button on the infobar or dismiss it.

histogram.name: WebApk.LaunchInterval
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time since the user last launched the WebAPK from the homescreen. Not recorded on first launch.

histogram.name: WebApk.LaunchInterval2
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time since the user last launched the WebAPK from the homescreen. Not recorded on first launch.

histogram.name: WebApk.Navigation.ChildTab.InScope
histogram.summary: Recorded each time that a child tab - e.g. a tab opened via window.open() - is navigated. Records whether the navigation is within the scope of the WebAPK's Web Manifest.

histogram.name: WebApk.OpenFromMenu
histogram.summary: When a user visits a PWA for which they have a WebAPK installed, the menu item changes from 'Add to homescreen' to 'Open WebAPK'. This stat tracks whether the opening of the WebAPK is successful when this menu item is clicked.

histogram.name: WebApk.Permission.ChromePermissionDenied
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-11. This UMA logs extra requests. Replaced by ChromePermissionDenied2.
histogram.summary: The number of Android runtime permission requests that are denied for the WebAPK because Chrome does not have access to that permission.

histogram.name: WebApk.Permission.ChromePermissionDenied2
histogram.summary: The number of Android runtime permission requests that are denied for the WebAPK because Chrome does not have access to that permission.

histogram.name: WebApk.Permission.ChromeWithoutPermission
histogram.summary: Records the amount of requests of Android runtime permissions which haven't been granted to Chrome when Chrome is running in WebAPK runtime.

histogram.name: WebApk.Session.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: The length of a WebAPK session (launch/foregrounding to backgrounding) in milliseconds.

histogram.name: WebApk.ShellApkVersion
histogram.summary: Records WebAPK "Shell APK version" when the WebAPK is launched. The "Shell APK version" is documented in shell_apk_version.gni

histogram.name: Webapp.Engagement.EngagementType
histogram.obsolete: Removed 3/2019 because only counts PWAs. Superseded by the WebApp.Engagement histogram with suffixes.
histogram.summary: The type of engagement (navigation, user input, etc.) which led to an accumulation in site engagement within a PWA app window. Should be collected for a subset of SiteEngagementService.EngagementType, which is triggered for all browsing contexts. Recorded at the time of engagement accumulation (e.g., when mouse is clicked).

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.DisplayMode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-11 and replaced by Webapp.Install.DisplayMode2, which correctly records manifest display modes on desktop.
histogram.summary: Records the display mode (as defined in the Web App Manifest spec) at the install time of a WebApp (including WebApks).

histogram.name: Webapp.Install.InstallSource
histogram.summary: Records the mechanism by which a web app installation was triggered, regardless of whether the installation was successful.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallabilityCheckStatus.AddToHomescreenTimeout
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the check that a site is or isn't a Progressive Web App (PWA) completes before the add to homescreen dialog on Android forcibly times out and falls back to generating an icon.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallabilityCheckStatus.MenuItemAddToHomescreen
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the check that a site is or isn't a Progressive Web App (PWA) has completed when the user taps the add to homescreen menu item on Android.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallabilityCheckStatus.MenuOpen
histogram.summary: Records whether or not the check that a site is or isn't a Progressive Web App (PWA) has completed when the user opens the menu on Android.

histogram.name: Webapp.InstallDuration.System
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by Webapp.SystemApps.FreshInstallDuration in 09/2020, issue https://crbug.com/1129275.
histogram.summary: Records the number of seconds taken to install system web apps, from when we dispatch a call to install them, until we get all the installation results. Recorded in milliseconds, from 1 millisecond to 3 minutes.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.BackgroundColor
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 in Issue http://crbug.com/1716136. Information no longer needed or recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the status of the splashscreen's background color (default or custom).

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.Duration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 in Issue http://crbug.com/1716136. Information no longer needed or recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the time during which the splashscreen was visible.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.Hides
histogram.summary: Records the signal that was used to hide the splashscreen.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.Icon.Size
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 in Issue http://crbug.com/1716136. Information no longer needed or recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the size of the icon used to construct the splashscreen in device pixels (ie. real size divided by device pixel density). This is only recording one dimension, the icon being square.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.Icon.Type
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 in Issue http://crbug.com/1716136. Information no longer needed or recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the origin of the icon used to construct the splashscreen.

histogram.name: Webapp.Splashscreen.ThemeColor
histogram.obsolete: Removed 07/2019 in Issue http://crbug.com/1716136. Information no longer needed or recorded.
histogram.summary: Records the status of the splashscreen's theme color (default or custom).

histogram.name: Webapp.SyncInitiatedFallbackInstallResult
histogram.summary: Records installation result code for sync initiated fallback installs in the new USS-based web applications system.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.SampleRate
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SampleRate384kHz in Issue 644683 on 2016/10 due to higher supported sample rates.
histogram.summary: The sample rate (in Hz) requested by createBuffer(). Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioBuffer.SampleRateRatio
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SampleRateRatio384kHz in Issue 644683 on 2016/10 due to higher supported sample rates.
histogram.summary: The ratio of the buffer sample rate from createBuffer() to the context sample rate. This indicates if the buffer needs to be resampled. Recorded for every call to createBuffer(). Probably many (tens or hundreds) per page.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioParam.ValueSetterConflictCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2018 in Issue 764396. Information no longer needed or recorded.
histogram.summary: The number of times the AudioParam value setter was called that also conflicts with an ongoing AudioParam automation. Updated when the realtime AudioContext is closed.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioParam.ValueSetterConflictPercentage
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2018 in Issue 764396. Information no longer needed or recorded.
histogram.summary: The percentage of number of calls to an AudioParam value setter that conflicts with an ongoing AudioParam automation to the total number of calls to the value setter. Updated once when an AudioContext is closed.

histogram.name: WebAudio.AudioParam.ValueSetterCount
histogram.obsolete: Removed 02/2018 in Issue 764396. Information no longer needed or recorded.
histogram.summary: The number of times the AudioParam value setter was called per tab. Updated when the realtime AudioContext is closed.

histogram.name: WebAudio.BiquadFilter.Q.Highpass
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Issue 774526 on 2017/10; statistics aren't needed anymore.
histogram.summary: The Q value (in 0.25 dB steps) used for a highpass BiquadFilter. Recorded each time the value is set for a highpass filter via the .value setter or the automation methods linearRampToValueAtTime, exponentialValueAtTime, and setValueAtTime.

histogram.name: WebAudio.BiquadFilter.Q.Lowpass
histogram.obsolete: Removed in Issue 774526 on 2017/10; statistics aren't needed anymore.
histogram.summary: The Q value (in 0.25 dB steps) used for a lowpass BiquadFilter. Recorded each time the value is set for a lowpass filter via the .value setter or the automation methods linearRampToValueAtTime, exponentialValueAtTime, and setValueAtTime.

histogram.name: WebAudio.OfflineAudioContext.SampleRate
histogram.obsolete: Replaced by SampleRate384kHz in Issue 644683 on 2016/10 due to higher supported sample rates.
histogram.summary: The sample rate (in Hz) specified for the offline audio context. Recorded for every offline context created. Probably only a few per page, but could be potentially much more (thousands).

histogram.name: WebAudio.UserGesture
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2016-09. As of M55, this is no longer recorded.
histogram.summary: Records whether WebAudio had a user gesture requirement and whether it was fulfilled.

histogram.name: WebAuthentication.CableV1Event
histogram.summary: Records events that occur during the lifetime of a caBLE v1 getAssertion operation so that any causes of drop-off can be identified.

histogram.name: WebController.EmptyNavigationManagerCausedByStopLoading
histogram.summary: [iOS] Chrome for iOS crashes because NavigationManager does not have any navigation items and visible navigation item is dereferenced (crbug.com/565457). The assumption is that crash occurs if pending load was stopped for a child window. This metric will prove or disprove that assumption.

histogram.name: WebController.StartProvisionalNavigationExitedWithEmptyNavigationManager
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2017-02. This metric disproved the assumption mentioned in the summary and it is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Chrome for iOS crashes in |didCommitNavigation:| if Navigation Manager is empty. It's unclear how the app can get into this state and one assumption is that didStartProvisionalNavigation: does not add a pending navigation. This metric is logged when didStartProvisionalNavigation: fails to add a pending item.

histogram.name: WebController.WKWebViewHasCertForSecureConnection
histogram.obsolete: It is common for WKWebView to have certificateChain, which does not allow constructing net::X509Certificate. Logging was removed on 2020-01-23.
histogram.summary: Whether or not WKWebView has provided a valid -certificateChain when loaded a page over a secure connection.

histogram.name: WebCore.Animation.CSSProperties
histogram.obsolete: This has been superseded by Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties which does not count multiple times per page load. See https://crbug.com/458925.
histogram.summary: Counts the number of times each CSS property is animated. There is no limit on the number of times each property is counted per page view -- a property that is animated multiple times during a single page view is counted each time it animates.

histogram.name: WebCore.CanvasContextUsage
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2018 with Blink.Canvas.IsComposited, Blink.Canvas.ResourceProviderIsAccelerated, Blink.Canvas.ResourceProviderType and Blink.Canvas.2DLayerBridgeIsDeferred
histogram.summary: The usage of Canvas 2D Context API. Logged when the particular API is used.

histogram.name: WebCore.FeatureObserver
histogram.obsolete: As of M57 this has been superseded by Blink.UseCounter.Features which fixes a number of issues. See https://crbug.com/676837.
histogram.summary: Count of how many page loads use various features. The PageVisits bucket is incremented for each page load, and the other buckets incremented at most once per PageVisit via the WebCore::UseCounter class.

histogram.name: WebCore.FeatureObserver.CSSProperties
histogram.obsolete: As of M57 this has been superseded by Blink.UseCounter.CSSProperties which fixes a number of issues. See https://crbug.com/676837.
histogram.summary: Records usage of CSS properties used on a page, either statically or dynamically, from the time the page is initialised to when it is closed or navigated away from. Each property is counted at most once per page per view.

histogram.name: WebCore.FindInPage.ScopingTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M77 because we're not tracking this anymore.
histogram.summary: Records how much time it takes for find-in-page scoping over the idle task deadline.

histogram.name: WebCore.Framebust
histogram.obsolete: Removed in September 2018 for a version that also tracks if the frame is an ad frame.
histogram.summary: Records instances of child frames navigating the top frame. Includes whether or not the navigation would have been permitted if not for our special case for 'framebusting', the practice of ensuring a given document is never displayed in a frame.

histogram.name: WebCore.Framebust2
histogram.summary: Records instances of child frames navigating the top frame. Includes whether or not the navigation would have been permitted if not for our special case for 'framebusting', the practice of ensuring a given document is never displayed in a frame. It also includes whether the frame that initiated the navigation was an ad frame or not.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.BackingStore.InternalError
histogram.obsolete: As of chrome 26, use {Consistency, Read, Write}Error instead.
histogram.summary: Count of internal IndexedDB errors (data corruption, I/O errors, etc) encountered.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.FrontEndAPICalls
histogram.summary: Count total number of front end API calls of IndexedDB methods.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.FreeDiskSpaceFailure
histogram.obsolete: Removed 1/19. Metric never actually worked, as -1 / 1024 yields 0.
histogram.summary: Count of how many times LevelDBDatabase got an error trying to check free disk space.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.OpenFailureFreeDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Amount of free disk space on the partition/volume/etc where LevelDB failed to open.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.OpenSuccessFreeDiskSpace
histogram.summary: Amount of free disk space on the partition/volume/etc where LevelDB was successfully opened.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.PutTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to write the data IndexedDB to the LevelDB backing store for a put operation.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDB.Transaction.CommitTime
histogram.summary: The time that it takes to commit an IndexedDB transaction to its LevelDB backing store.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.Errno
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: Errno errors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when opening an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.PFE
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBOpenErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when opening an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.Errno
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: Errno errors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when reading an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.PFE
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBReadErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when opening an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.Errno
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: Errno errors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when writing to an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.PFE
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2015-05. As of M43 use WebCore.IndexedDB.LevelDBWriteErrors.BFE.
histogram.summary: PlatformFileErrors encountered by a single LevelDBEnv method when writing to an IndexedDB instance.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.ObjectStore.IndexEntry.KeyType
histogram.obsolete: Removed August 2019. Was added to measure use of features which not all actively developed browser engines supported. No longer relevant.
histogram.summary: The type of key (number, string, etc.) used for an index entry for a record being newly stored or updated in an Indexed DB object store. For array keys, the types of sub-keys are not recorded.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.ObjectStore.Record.KeyType
histogram.obsolete: Removed August 2019. Was added to measure use of features which not all actively developed browser engines supported. No longer relevant.
histogram.summary: The type of key (number, string, etc.) used for a record being newly stored or updated in an Indexed DB object store. For array keys, the types of sub-keys are not recorded.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.OpenTime.Blocked
histogram.summary: The delay between the receipt of the request to open an IndexedDB database and the firing of the blocked event.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.OpenTime.Error
histogram.summary: The delay between the receipt of the request to open an IndexedDB database and the firing of the error event.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.OpenTime.Success
histogram.summary: The delay between the receipt of the request to open an IndexedDB database and the firing of the success event.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.OpenTime.UpgradeNeeded
histogram.summary: The delay between the receipt of the request to open an IndexedDB database and the firing of the upgradeneeded event.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.PutValueSize
histogram.summary: The size of the IndexedDB value used in an IndexedDB object store 'put' operation. Recorded for every 'put' operation.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.Index.KeyPathType
histogram.obsolete: Removed August 2019. Was added to measure use of features which not all actively developed browser engines supported. No longer relevant.
histogram.summary: Records the 'keyPath' type (none, string, or array) during IDBObjectStore's createIndex operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.Index.MultiEntry
histogram.obsolete: Removed August 2019. Was added to measure use of features which not all actively developed browser engines supported. No longer relevant.
histogram.summary: Records the 'multiEntry' flag value during IDBObjectStore's createIndex operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.Index.Unique
histogram.obsolete: Removed August 2019. Was added to measure use of features which not all actively developed browser engines supported. No longer relevant.
histogram.summary: Records the 'unique' flag value during IDBObjectStore's createIndex operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.ObjectStore.AutoIncrement
histogram.obsolete: Removed August 2019. Was added to measure use of features which not all actively developed browser engines supported. No longer relevant.
histogram.summary: Records the 'autoIncrement' flag value during IDBDatabase's createObjectStore operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Schema.ObjectStore.KeyPathType
histogram.obsolete: Removed August 2019. Was added to measure use of features which not all actively developed browser engines supported. No longer relevant.
histogram.summary: Records the 'keyPath' type (none, string, or array) during IDBDatabase's createObjectStore operation. See http://www.w3.org/TR/IndexedDB/

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.TombstoneSweeper.NumTombstones
histogram.summary: Records the number of tombstones encountered by the IndexedDB Tombstone Sweeper. Recorded on the browser side (back end) when the sweeper has completed scanning and it is in 'statistics' mode. See https://goo.gl/coKwA7.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.TombstoneSweeper.StatsTotalTime.Complete
histogram.summary: Records the time it takes for the IndexedDB Tombstone Sweeper to fully scan the indexes. Recorded on the browser side (back end) when the sweeper has completed scanning all indexes (so partial scans are not recorded) and it is in 'statistics' mode. See https://goo.gl/coKwA7.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.TombstoneSweeper.TombstonesSize
histogram.summary: Records the total size of tombstones encountered by the IndexedDB Tombstone Sweeper. Recorded on the browser side (back end) when the sweeper has completed scanning and it is in the 'statistics' mode. See https://goo.gl/coKwA7.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Transaction.ReadOnly.SizeOnCommit
histogram.summary: The total temporary size of an IndexedDB ReadOnly Transaction. Since this is a readonly transaction, the size should only be >0 when the transaction is removing tombstone index keys. Recorded on transaction commit.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Transaction.ReadWrite.SizeOnCommit
histogram.summary: The total temporary size of an IndexedDB ReadWrite Transaction. This is the memory that is temporarily stored before writing to disk. Recorded on transaction commit.

histogram.name: WebCore.IndexedDB.Transaction.VersionChange.SizeOnCommit
histogram.summary: The total temporary size of an IndexedDB VersionChange Transaction. This is the memory that is temporarily stored before writing to disk. Version change transactions happen when creating a database or updating a current database schema. Recorded on transaction commit.

histogram.name: WebCore.PreloadDelayMs
histogram.obsolete: Removed, preloads are issued on the main thread now, so this is less useful.
histogram.summary: The delay between when the preload scanner discovers a resource on the parser thread and when the preload request is issued on the main thread.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.HitCount
histogram.summary: Number of dead resources found in the memory cache over the lifetime of the ResourceFetcher.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.LoadCount
histogram.summary: Number of resources that needed to be loaded by the ResourceFetcher over its lifetime.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.ResourceTypeUponCacheHit
histogram.obsolete: This metric has been not recorded at least since 2016/01. The displayed enum labels might be unreliable because C++ enum values of blink::Resource::Type have been changed over time.
histogram.summary: The type of the resource (e.g. image, script...) upon a cache hit.

histogram.name: WebCore.ResourceFetcher.RevalidateCount
histogram.summary: Number of dead resources that needed to be revalidated by the ResourceFetcher over its lifetime.

histogram.name: WebCore.ScriptedIdleTaskController.IdleCallbackDeadline
histogram.summary: The amount of time allotted to a requestIdleCallback callback, i.e., the difference between the time when it is called and when its deadline expires.

histogram.name: WebCore.ScriptedIdleTaskController.IdleCallbackOverrun
histogram.summary: The amount of time by which a requestIdleCallback callback overran its deadline. Callbacks which don't overrun their deadline will report an overrun of 0.

histogram.name: WebCore.ScriptedIdleTaskController.IdleTaskCallbackType
histogram.summary: The callback type for every idle task that was run.

histogram.name: WebCore.ScriptedIdleTaskController.IdleTaskQueueingTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time an idle task was queued before running. This metric is only recorded for idle tasks that run during idle periods, not for those that run as a result of an expired timeout.

histogram.name: WebCore.ScriptedIdleTaskController.IdleTaskTimeout
histogram.summary: The timeout value specified for each idle task that was run, regardless of whether or not it was run due to its timeout expiring. A value of 0 indicates that no timeout was specified.

histogram.name: WebCore.ScriptedIdleTaskController.IdleTaskTimeoutExceeded
histogram.summary: The timeout value for idle tasks that were run because their timeout expired.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.ParsingBlocking.AlreadyLoaded
histogram.obsolete: Removed as this data was needed for streaming investigations, no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Whether a parsing blocking script was already preloaded from the net or the cache by the time it was needed.

histogram.name: WebCore.Scripts.ParsingBlocking.TimeBetweenLoadedAndCompiled
histogram.obsolete: Removed as this data was needed for streaming investigations, no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time between the events "script is loaded" and "script is compiled" for parsing blocking scripts.

histogram.name: WebCore.SpellChecker.RequestInterval
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M85 as we haven't observed any related performance alerts, and no team is actively monitoring it.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between consecutive spellcheck requests made by Blink, with the exception that requests made simultaneously checking different parts of the same editing host count as only one request.

histogram.name: WebCore.V8DOMWindowShell.createContext.IsolatedWorld
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2013, we no longer have the code that uses this metric.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to create a V8 Context for an isolated world.

histogram.name: WebCore.V8DOMWindowShell.createContext.MainWorld
histogram.obsolete: Removed 05/2013, we no longer have the code that uses this metric.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration of time taken to create a V8 Context for the main world.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.BinaryTypeChangesAfterOpen
histogram.obsolete: Deprecate 2017-06, as we've collected enough data to discuss. (see issue 584616).
histogram.summary: Count the number of changes to WebSocket.binaryType after the connection opened, per connection. Assignments that match the existing binaryType are not counted. This is recorded after WebSocket close, whether explicit or due to error or navigation. It is not recorded if the render process is destroyed before the WebSocket is closed.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.HandshakeResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-06 when we replaced the WebSocket implementation (see issue 226931).
histogram.summary: Count the number of WebSocket handshake for each result. Use this histogram as a baseline for investigating feature usage counters.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.MessageSize.Receive
histogram.summary: The sizes of binary WebSocket messages received, broken down by type. One entry per message. Clamped to 100 MB.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.MessageSize.Send
histogram.summary: The sizes of binary WebSocket messages sent, broken down by type. One entry per message. Clamped to 100 MB.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.PerMessageDeflateContextTakeOverMode
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2014-06 when we replaced the WebSocket implementation (see issue 226931).
histogram.summary: Count the number of WebSockets that accepted permessage-deflate extension for each context take over mode. Used by the old Blink-based WebSocket implementation.

histogram.name: WebCore.WebSocket.ReceiveType
histogram.summary: Count the number of messages for each message type and set binary type.

histogram.name: WebCore.XHR.send.ArrayBufferOrView
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 7/2014. This histogram was used to determine when it would be ok to remove the deprecated XMLHttpRequest.send(ArrayBuffer) overload. The support for ArrayBuffer was un-deprecated in the WHATWG spec for XHR, and subsequently un-deprecated in Blink.
histogram.summary: Count the number of XHR.send() calls for each argument type to see when we can deprecate the ArrayBuffer type support.

histogram.name: WebFont.CORSSuccess
histogram.summary: The success or failure of web fonts CORS-enabled fetching.

histogram.name: WebFont.DecodeSpeed
histogram.summary: Uncompressed font image size divided by the duration of time OTS takes to decode the font image, in kilobytes per second.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCache.EntryAge.Evict
histogram.summary: Recorded upon an eviction of a cache entry for a font in Google Fonts. Records the age of the cache entry.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCache.EntryAge.Hit
histogram.summary: Recorded upon a cache hit for a font in Google Fonts. Records the age of the cache entry.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCache.ReuseCount.Evict
histogram.summary: When a cache entry for a font in Google Fonts is evicted, records the reuse count of the cache entry.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCache.ReuseCount.Hit
histogram.summary: Recorded upon a cache hit for a font in Google Fonts. Records the reuse count of the cache entry.

histogram.name: WebFont.DiskCacheHit
histogram.summary: Whether the font was in the cache or not. "Previously in the cache" means there was an evicted entry for the font in the cache. Recorded upon a disk cache query for a font in Google Fonts.

histogram.name: WebFont.InterventionResult
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2017. Related field trial has finished rolling out.
histogram.summary: For each WebFont load attempt, records whether User Agent Intervention was triggered, and whether the request (would have) timed out or not. The intervention takes adaptive behaviors to handle loading timeouts to improve user experiences on slow networks.

histogram.name: WebFont.InterventionResult.MissedCache
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2017. Related field trial has finished rolling out.
histogram.summary: Like InterventionResult, this records whether User Agent Intervention was triggered, and whether the request (would have) timed out or not. But this version records only when data actually comes from network, not from disk or memory cache, and is not provided in a data URL format.

histogram.name: WebFont.LayoutLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when the webfont was referenced by a calculated style for the first time to the start of the font download.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.0.Under10KB
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.0.Under10KB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of under 10KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.1.10KBTo50KB
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.1.10KBTo50KB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 10KB-50KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.2.50KBTo100KB
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.2.50KBTo100KB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 50KB-100KB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.3.100KBTo1MB
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.3.100KBTo1MB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of 100KB-1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.4.Over1MB
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.4.Over1MB.
histogram.summary: The time it takes for a webfont download to finish, for webfonts of over 1MB.

histogram.name: WebFont.LoadTime.LoadError
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 8/2013, replaced by WebFont.DownloadTime.LoadError.
histogram.summary: The time taken for a webfont download that failed. Includes aborted requests.

histogram.name: WebFont.PackageFormat
histogram.summary: The packaging format of the font file (e.g. SFNT, WOFF ...) upon a webfont load.

histogram.name: WebFont.Resource.StyleRecalcToDownloadLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when the webfont was referenced by a calculated style for the first time to the start of the font download. Recorded at most once for each FontResource object (not recorded if the font is retrieved from the memory cache).

histogram.name: WebFont.Resource.UsageType
histogram.summary: For each webfont, this records (a) if the font was 'styled', i.e. referenced by a calculated style for a RenderText before the font data was used, and (b) if the font was actually used or not, i.e. the renderer requested the font data or not. (A Font can be used without being styled, for example when drawn by a Canvas 2D Context.) This is recorded upon a download request of a webfont, or destruction of a FontResource object. Recorded at most once for each FontResource object in the renderer's memory cahce.

histogram.name: WebFont.StyleRecalcToDownloadLatency
histogram.summary: The time from when the webfont was referenced by a calculated style for the first time to the start of the font download.

histogram.name: WebFont.UsageType
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of 9/2013, replaced by WebFont.Resource.UsageType.
histogram.summary: For each webfont, this records (a) if the font was 'styled', i.e. referenced by a calculated style for a RenderText before the font data was used, and (b) if the font was actually used or not, i.e. the renderer requested the font data or not. (A Font can be used without being styled, for example when drawn by a Canvas 2D Context.) This is recorded upon a download request of a webfont, or destruction of a CSSFontFaceSource object. Recorded at most once for each url() source of @font-face CSS rule.

histogram.name: WebFont.WebFontsInPage
histogram.summary: The number of webfonts used in a page. This is recorded when the first layout is done, and so will not count webfonts dynamically loaded by scripts.

histogram.name: WebHistory.QueryWebAndAppActivity.State
histogram.summary: Records the state of web and app activity everytime a request to query sWAA is completed. The request is triggered when the user opens the history page, sync setup settings page or clear browsing data dialog. Desktop only.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AecDelayBasedQuality
histogram.obsolete: Removed 5/2019 in issue bugs.webrtc.org/10563 due to the reporting component (AEC2) being deprecated.
histogram.summary: Captures if the estimated delay between rendered and captured audio is out of bounds which can cause the Echo Cancellation to fail. This is logged roughly once every 5 seconds. The values are logged in four buckets reflecting how well the Echo Cancellation likely performs based on the estimated delay.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ApplicationMaxConsecutiveBytesDiscard
histogram.summary: The maximum consecutive discarded bytes caused by not enough buffer available in WebRTC's socket implementation. This happens when WebRTC IpcPacketSocket's throttling mechanism kicks in.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AecDelayAdjustmentMsAgnosticValue
histogram.obsolete: Removed 4/2019 in issue bugs.webrtc.org/10563 due to the reporting component (AEC2) being deprecated.
histogram.summary: The AEC in WebRTC will sometimes realign the far- and near-end signal buffers to keep in sync with delay changes in the echo path. This metric logs each such realignment, storing the delay change in ms, when the change is triggered by a shift in the signal based delay estimation (a.k.a delay-agnostic).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AecDelayAdjustmentMsSystemValue
histogram.obsolete: Removed 4/2019 in issue bugs.webrtc.org/10563 due to the reporting component (AEC2) being deprecated.
histogram.summary: The AEC in WebRTC will sometimes realign the far- and near-end signal buffers to keep in sync with delay changes in the echo path. This metric logs each such realignment, storing the delay change in ms, when the change is triggered by a shift in system reported delay.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AecSystemDelayJump
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2019 due to old AEC system (AEC2) being removed.
histogram.summary: The AEC in WebRTC keeps a buffer to mimic the audio buffers in the lower layers. This histogram logs a sudden positive jump in buffer size. Since we detect jumps in the capture thread, only positive values are feasible. Note that the difference in milliseconds is logged and not the actual AEC system delay value. Sampled every time the AEC system delay changes more than 50 milliseconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ComfortNoiseBand0
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M81 as the metric is no longer used for analysis.
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the level of the comfort noise in the WebRTC echo canceller in the lower 4 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ComfortNoiseBand1
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M81 as the metric is no longer used for analysis.
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the level of the comfort noise in the WebRTC echo canceller between 4 and 8 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.SuppressorGainBand0
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M81 as the metric is no longer used for analysis.
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo suppressor gain in the WebRTC echo canceller in the lower 4 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.SuppressorGainBand1
histogram.obsolete: Removed in M81 as the metric is no longer used for analysis.
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo suppressor gain in the WebRTC echo canceller between 4 and 8 kHz. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.NumOfAecSystemDelayJumps
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2019 due to old AEC system (AEC2) being removed.
histogram.summary: Number of triggered WebRTC.Audio.AecSystemDelayJump during a call. This is recorded when a WebRTC based call has ended. AecSystemDelayJump can be triggered when, for example, the capture thread is stalled, which can harm the AEC. NumOfAecSystemDelayJumps shows how often this occurs in general as well as during a call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.NumOfPlatformReportedStreamDelayJumps
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2019 due to old AEC system (AEC2) being removed.
histogram.summary: Number of triggered WebRTC.Audio.PlatformReportedStreamDelayJump during a call. This is recorded when a WebRTC based call has ended. PlatformReportedStreamDelayJump can be triggered when, for example, the capture thread is stalled, which can harm the AEC. NumOfPlatformReportedStreamDelayJumps shows how often this occurs in general as well as during a call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.PlatformReportedStreamDelayJump
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2019 due to old AEC system (AEC2) being removed.
histogram.summary: The difference in stream delay reported to WebRTC by Chrome. Since we detect jumps in the capture thread, only positive values are feasible. Note that the difference in milliseconds is logged and not the actual stream delay value. Sampled every time the stream delay changes more than 50 milliseconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioCaptureTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of WebRTC audio capture session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputFramesPerBuffer
histogram.obsolete: No longer exists in the code as of 2014/2/25.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of WebRTC audio input buffers (in audio frames).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputFramesPerBufferUnexpected
histogram.obsolete: No longer exists in the code as of 2014/2/25.
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Size of WebRTC audio input buffers (atypical values, in audio frames).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputChannelLayout
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Audio output channel layout in WebRTC.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputFramesPerBuffer
histogram.summary: Size of WebRTC audio output buffers (in audio frames).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputFramesPerBufferUnexpected
histogram.summary: Size of WebRTC audio output buffers (atypical values, in audio frames).

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioRenderTime
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Duration in milliseconds of WebRTC audio render session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioRenderTimes
histogram.obsolete: Removed as of Aug 2016, replaced by Media.Audio.Render.GetSourceDataTime.WebRTC.
histogram.summary: Measures the time spent in WebRtcAudioRenderer::SourceCallback. Sampled 10 times per second.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.TimeSendingAudioRtpPacketsInSeconds
histogram.obsolete: Removed 11/2018 due to little use and high implementation complexity.
histogram.summary: The amount of time between sending the first and the last audio RTP packets through the audiostreams of a Call object. This is logged when the Call object is destroyed. This is only logged if audio RTP packets are at some point in time received, and is a way to omit temporary objects that do not send any actual media.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupState.AnswererState
histogram.obsolete: These metrics were useful when Unified Plan was made the default SDP semantics. They will again become useful when Plan B is becoming deprecated. Until then, these are of little value and are temporarily disabled.
histogram.summary: Setting up a call involves a number of steps; this enum describes which "answerer step" the peer connection reached in its most successful attempt. See blink::AnswererState for more information.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupState.CallSetupState
histogram.obsolete: These metrics were useful when Unified Plan was made the default SDP semantics. They will again become useful when Plan B is becoming deprecated. Until then, these are of little value and are temporarily disabled.
histogram.summary: Setting up a call involves a number of steps; this enum describes the status of the most successful attempt. See blink::CallSetupState for more information.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupState.OffererState
histogram.obsolete: These metrics were useful when Unified Plan was made the default SDP semantics. They will again become useful when Plan B is becoming deprecated. Until then, these are of little value and are temporarily disabled.
histogram.summary: Setting up a call involves a number of steps; this enum describes which "answerer step" the peer connection reached in its most successful attempt. See blink::OffererState for more information.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupStateWithGum.AnswererState
histogram.obsolete: These metrics were useful when Unified Plan was made the default SDP semantics. They will again become useful when Plan B is becoming deprecated. Until then, these are of little value and are temporarily disabled.
histogram.summary: Setting up a call involves a number of steps; this enum describes which "answerer step" the peer connection reached in its most successful attempt. See blink::AnswererState for more information. This is the same as "WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupState.AnswererState" except it is only reported for peer connections on pages where getUserMedia() has been called.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupStateWithGum.CallSetupState
histogram.obsolete: These metrics were useful when Unified Plan was made the default SDP semantics. They will again become useful when Plan B is becoming deprecated. Until then, these are of little value and are temporarily disabled.
histogram.summary: Setting up a call involves a number of steps; this enum describes the status of the most successful attempt. See blink::CallSetupState for more information. This is the same as "WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupState.CallSetupState" except it is only reported for peer connections on pages where getUserMedia() has been called.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupStateWithGum.OffererState
histogram.obsolete: These metrics were useful when Unified Plan was made the default SDP semantics. They will again become useful when Plan B is becoming deprecated. Until then, these are of little value and are temporarily disabled.
histogram.summary: Setting up a call involves a number of steps; this enum describes which "answerer step" the peer connection reached in its most successful attempt. See blink::OffererState for more information. This is the same as "WebRTC.PeerConnection.CallSetupState.OffererState" except it is only reported for peer connections on pages where getUserMedia() has been called.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SelectedRtcpMuxPolicy
histogram.obsolete: Removed on Dec 2016. This histogram is used to gauge the risk of making the change for issue 6030. The decision has been made and this is not needed any more.
histogram.summary: Whether the application specified a value for RTCP-mux policy, and if so, which value, "Require" or "Negotiate". Recorded after parsing the configuration when creating the RTCPeerConnection.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UserMediaRequest.Result
histogram.summary: Counters for UserMediaRequests results such as failure reasons.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BadCall.Any
histogram.summary: Fraction of time the call was classified as bad because of any reason.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BadCall.FrameRate
histogram.summary: Fraction of time the call was classified as bad because of low framerate.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BadCall.FrameRateVariance
histogram.summary: Fraction of time the call was classified as bad because of high framerate variance.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BadCall.Qp
histogram.summary: Fraction of time the call was classified as bad because of high qp.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.CompleteFramesReceivedPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of complete frames received per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DiscardedPacketsInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of discarded packets by the jitter buffer due to arriving too late for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DuplicatedPacketsInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of duplicated packets in the jitter buffer for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCountUniqueByOrigin
histogram.summary: Counts number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript, once per origin per renderer process.

histogram.name: WebShare.Unverified
histogram.summary: File types included in navigator.share() requests, where file content and source URLs were not verified with Safe Browsing.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.Action.HttpsUrl
histogram.obsolete: Removed October 2016 in favor of Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Valid, Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Dangerous, and Security.PageInfo.Action.HttpsUrl.Downgraded.
histogram.summary: Tracks WebsiteSettings actions that take place on an HTTPS URL. This completely disregards security status.

histogram.name: WebsiteSettings.PermissionChanged
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2014 in Issue 433776, and replaced by WebsiteSettings.OriginInfo.PermissionChanged.
histogram.summary:
Count of how often a specific content type (permission) is changed using the Page Info UI.
Note: The values of this metric collected for Chrome 49 (early 2016) are innacurate and should not be trusted. crbug.com/589255.

histogram.name: websql.Async.OpenTime.Error
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2018. We're no longer monitoring WebSQL performance.
histogram.summary: The time required to try (and fail) to open a Web SQL database.

histogram.name: websql.Async.OpenTime.Success
histogram.obsolete: Removed 12/2018. We're no longer monitoring WebSQL performance.
histogram.summary: The time required to successfully open a Web SQL database.

histogram.name: WebstoreWidgetApp.Close
histogram.obsolete: There is no remaining code that is emmiting this metric. It was removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Webstore Widget app: the reason why the suggest apps dialog was closed.

histogram.name: WebstoreWidgetApp.Install
histogram.obsolete: There is no remaining code that is emmiting this metric. It was removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Webstore Widget app: whether the Webstore item user selected was successfully installed or not.

histogram.name: WebstoreWidgetApp.Load
histogram.obsolete: There is no remaining code that is emmiting this metric. It was removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Webstore Widget app: whether the initialization of the dialog succeeded or not.

histogram.name: WebstoreWidgetApp.LoadTime
histogram.obsolete: There is no remaining code that is emmiting this metric. It was removed at an unknown time.
histogram.summary: Webstore Widget app: time to load the widget contained in the app. Measured between the moment window appears and the moment all the contents in the app including the Chrome Webstore widget are ready.

histogram.name: WebURLLoader.SyncResourceRequestDuration
histogram.obsolete: Removed 2019-12 after expiration, while adding the similar XHR.Sync.BlockingTime.MainThread and XHR.Sync.BlockingTime.WorkerThread.
histogram.summary: Records the total duration the renderer spent on each sync XHR resource request, including requests that time out.

histogram.name: WebUsb.DetectorInitialization
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete in M72 as initialization of WebUsbDetector no longer blocks the main thread.
histogram.summary: Records the time spent initializing the WebUSB detector module.

histogram.name: WebView.LoadDataWithBaseUrl.HistoryUrl
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/04/2018 as it has been replaced by Android.WebView.LoadDataWithBaseUrl.HistoryUrl.
histogram.summary: Records whether the historyUrl parameter to loadDataWithBaseUrl is empty/ null, the same as the baseUrl parameter, or different from baseUrl.

histogram.name: WindowManager.PanelWindowCountPerLoad
histogram.summary: The number of panel windows open when a load completes. Panels are windows docked to the bottom of the OS desktop, which are visible to the user even while the user is interacting with other applications.

histogram.name: Windows.CreateThreadTime
histogram.obsolete: Removed 01/2020 as it was causing dead lock issues. crbug.com/1043353.
histogram.summary: Time spent inside CreateThread() Windows API call creating a single thread.

histogram.name: Windows.HasOpenXpsSupport
histogram.obsolete: Removed 03/2020 after insight about OpenXPS has lead to more general question of XPS availability (either type).
histogram.summary: If the version of Xpsprint.dll is sufficiently modern to support OpenXPS. Reported once per browser session, on startup.

histogram.name: Windows.InCompatibilityMode
histogram.summary: A boolean used to indicate when the Windows version reported by GetVersionEx() and the Windows version reported by VerQueryValue() on kernel32 do not match. This is queried shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.UCRTVersion
histogram.obsolete: Removed 04/2020. Necessary data was collected and a decision was made. See https://crbug.com/920704 for details.
histogram.summary: The ucrtbase.dll version, converted to a base::win::Version enum. This is queried shortly after startup.

histogram.name: Windows.Win32kRendererLockdown
histogram.obsolete: Removed 10/2016 as this is enabled by default so provides no useful data.
histogram.summary: Count of browser launches where Win32k renderer lockdown is enabled.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.CreateIconFilesCount
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/06/2017 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: The number of jumplist icons requested to create per jumplist update. It is recorded whenever UpdateJumpList() is called.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.CreateIconFilesDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/06/2017 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: Time spent in CreateIconFiles(). This method is called whenever there is a jumplist update and the JumpListIcons folder is empty.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DeleteDirectoryContentDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/06/2016 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: Time spent in DeleteDirectoryContentAndLogRuntime().

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DeleteDirectoryDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2017 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: Time spent in DeleteDirectoryAndLogResults().

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DeleteStatusJumpListIcons
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2017 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric records the detailed delete result of JumpListIcons directory.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DeleteStatusJumpListIconsOld
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2017 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric records the detailed delete result of JumpListIconsOld directory.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DetailedFolderMoveResults
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 12/13/2016 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folder JumpListIcons is moved (can be rename or copy and delete) to JumpListIconsOld. This happens when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. There are several key steps in this folder move operation. Before the move operation, there is another step that JumpListIconsOld folder is deleted. The status of these steps are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these steps is suspected to be related to a known issue.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DetailedFolderResults
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 03/10/2017 as it is replaced by DetailedFolderResultsDeleteUpdated.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folders JumpListIcons and JumpListIconsOld get updated. These two folders are updated when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. These two folders are updated as follows 1) JumpListIconsOld with its content get deleted; 2) if step 1 succeeds, JumpListIcons is moved, 3) if any of the previous steps fails, JumpListIcons is deleted, 4) A new JumpListIcons folder is created. The status of these 4 file operations are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these file operations is suspected to be related to a known issue.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DetailedFolderResultsDeleteUpdated
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 03/20/2017. New metrics named WinJumplist.DeleteStatusJumpListIcons and WinJumplist.DeleteStatusJumpListIconsOld are used instead.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folders JumpListIcons and JumpListIconsOld get updated. These two folders are updated when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. These two folders are updated as follows 1) JumpListIconsOld with its content get deleted; 2) if step 1 succeeds, JumpListIcons is renamed to JumpListIconsOld, 3) if any of the previous steps fails, JumpListIcons is deleted, 4) A new JumpListIcons folder is created if deletion of JumpListIcons' content succeeds (only fail to delete the directory is okay). The status of these 4 file operations are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these file operations is suspected to be related to a known issue.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DirectoryStatusJumpListIcons
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2017 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric records whether the folder JumpListIcons exists; and if it does, whether it is empty or non-empty.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.DirectoryStatusJumpListIconsOld
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/25/2017 as we are no long recording this metric.
histogram.summary: This metric records whether the folder JumpListIconsOld exists; and if it does, whether it is empty or non-empty.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.FolderMoveResults
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 12/08/2016. DetailedFolderMoveResults is used for more detailed analysis.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folder JumpListIcons is moved (can be rename or copy and delete) to JumpListIconsOld. This happens when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. There are 3 possible steps in this folder move operation. Before the move operation, there is another step that JumpListIconsOld folder is deleted. The status of these steps are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these steps is suspected to be related to a known issue listed below. https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=179576

histogram.name: WinJumplist.FolderResults
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 12/13/2016, as we are now recording DetailedFolderResults.
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded when folders JumpListIcons and JumpListIconsOld get updated. These two folders are updated when tabs are closed, mostly visited URLs get updated, etc. These two folders are updated as follows 1) JumpListIconsOld with its content get deleted; 2) JumpListIcons is moved, 3) A new JumpListIcons folder is created. The status of these three file operations are put together and recorded in this metric. The failure of any of these file operations is suspected to be related to a known issue.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.NotificationTimeInterval
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/10/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The time interval between two adjacent update notifications if it's less than 3500 ms.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.NotificationTimeInterval2
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/23/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The time interval between two adjacent update notifications. A zero value indicates the interval is greater than 3500 ms.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.OnFaviconDataAvailableDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 06/22/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent in OnFaviconDataAvailable().

histogram.name: WinJumplist.RatioAddCategoryTime
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/23/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: The ratio of the duration spent adding the most-visited category compared to the duration spent adding the recently-closed category, multiplied by 10.

histogram.name: WinJumplist.StartLoadingFaviconDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 06/22/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent in StartLoadingFavicon().

histogram.name: WinJumplist.UpdateJumpListDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 04/20/2017 as it's no longer accurate due to the code change.
histogram.summary: Time spent in UpdateJumpList(). This method is called whenever there is a jumplist update.

histogram.name: WinJumplistUpdater.AddCustomCategoryDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/26/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent in JumpListUpdater::AddCustomCategory.

histogram.name: WinJumplistUpdater.AddTasksDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/10/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent in JumpListUpdater::AddTasks.

histogram.name: WinJumplistUpdater.BeginUpdateDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/26/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent in JumpListUpdater::BeginUpdate.

histogram.name: WinJumplistUpdater.CommitUpdateDuration
histogram.obsolete: Obsolete 07/26/2017 as it's no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Time spent in JumpListUpdater::CommitUpdate.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.FailedToChangeCores
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: Incremented each time the TimeTicks field trial runs on a machine with multiple cores, but failed to change thread affinity. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.MinResolutionNanoseconds
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The smallest non-zero delta reported by subsequent calls to QueryPerformanceCounter.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.NonStopTsc
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: True if the CPU's timestamp counter ticks at a constant rate regardless of CPU frequency.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.TickedBackwards
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial failed because QueryPerformanceCounter ticked backwards. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.VersionSuccessful
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial succeeded. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: WinTimeTicks.VersionTotal
histogram.owner: Please list the metric's owners. Add more owner tags as needed.
histogram.summary: The number of times the TimeTicks field trial ran for comparison with WinTimeTicks.VersionSuccess. Broken down by Windows version.

histogram.name: Worker.TopLevelScript.OriginType.RequestUrl.DedicatedWorker
histogram.summary: Type of worker top-level script's request URL's origin, relative to parent execution context's origin, recorded on each successful classic dedicated worker creation.

histogram.name: WorkerScheduler.WorkerThreadLoad
histogram.summary: Worker thread load, i.e. percentage of time spent on running tasks. This metric is emitted at most once per kWorkerThreadLoadTrackerReportingInterval sec per worker thread amortized. E.g. if a worker ran a single task for X seconds and then went to idle for Y seconds before it shuts down, and assuming the interval rate was 1 sec, we get X samples for 100% and Y samples for 0%.

histogram.name: WorkerThread.DebuggerTask.Time
histogram.summary: The time taken for running a debugger task on WorkerThread.

histogram.name: WorkerThread.Runtime
histogram.summary: The amount of time a worker thread ran for. Starts recording when a worker scheduler for the thread is created, and stops when the scheduler is shut down.

histogram.name: WorkerThread.Task.Time
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2018-02. The sample count was overflowing. crbug.com/809672.
histogram.summary: The time taken for running a worker task on WorkerThread.

histogram.name: WrenchMenu.OpeningAnimationFrameTimes
histogram.obsolete: Removed on 2020-04. Bucket sizes are not very useful for measuring jank. The only user of AnimationFrameTimeHistogram.
histogram.summary: Frame times of the Android wrench menu opening animation. For example, if the menu opening animation runs exactly at 60fps for a second, then each frame time is 16ms, and a total of 60 values of 16ms are recorded. If the animation is janky, we will see values greater than 16ms in the histogram.

histogram.name: XR.RuntimeAvailable
histogram.summary: Indicates which VR APIs are installed. Recorded shortly after startup.

histogram.name: XR.VRSession.StartAction
histogram.summary: The action that triggered the transition into Chrome in VR, either from 2D or another VR app.

histogram.name: XR.WebXR.ConsentFlow
histogram.summary: Records the actions of a user consent dialog which is displayed on requesting an XR session.

histogram.name: XR.WebXR.ConsentFlowDuration.ConsentFlowAborted
histogram.summary: Time the user takes to abort the consent flow by clicking on the window-close system button of a session request consent dialog.

histogram.name: XR.WebXR.ConsentFlowDuration.ConsentGranted
histogram.summary: Time the user takes to click on the allow-and-enter-VR button on a session request consent dialog.

histogram.name: XR.WebXR.ConsentFlowDuration.ConsentNotGranted
histogram.summary: Time the user takes to click on dont-allow button on a session request consent dialog.

histogram.name: XR.WebXR.PresentationSession
histogram.summary: The action that triggered VR presentation, which is the display of web content on a VR device.

histogram.name: XR.WebXR.RenderPath.Used
histogram.obsolete: Removed July 2019. This was being tracked in case the assumptions about feature availability based on platform version turned out to be incorrect, but it appears that this is working as intended. The webxr-render-path flag that could be used to override this at runtime was previously removed in https://crrev.com/c/1487074.
histogram.summary: Records the WebXR/WebVR render path used for presentation on presentation start. The render path is affected by overrides and device capabilities.
